$90,000 - $120,000 a yearJob SummaryValues1. Growth Mindset - We value lifelong learning. We continue to grow through dedication and hardwork. We prioritize speed and perseverance to achieve the impossible.2. Deep Gratitude - All relationships are looked at as long term relationships. At Blume, we are grateful to be included on others’ journey’s - whether it be customers, partners, investors or our teammates. We show deep gratitude and optimize for trust3. Extreme Ownership - Every team member has deep accountability. All problems are opportunities in disguise.4. No Ego - We focus on our mission and work egolessly. Titles don’t matter. Listen before being heard, don’t take credit - give it. : )Who you are:You have scaled a D2C brand in the past. You are familiar with optimizing the funnel and, you are an expert in analytics and you demonstrate a ton of initiative. You are looking to create a big impact with your role and have a strong voice within a fast paced and growing company. This is a highly entrepreneurial role, working directly alongside Blume’s CEO, as a key member of the team, driving growth through customer acquisition, retention marketing and brand awareness.We are looking for a highly analytical leader with proven track record of driving and accelerating revenue growth to lead new customer acquisition efforts, increase retention and grow brand awareness.You are both strategic and hands on, passionate about testing and have a track record of delivering high ROI results. This leader should have extensive consumer marketing experience, preferably in eCommerce and retail, with a true passion for scaling a brand.You are obsessed with analytics and very strong at financial modelling. You can’t wait to spend your afternoon figuring out how to drive down CAC, increase LTV and dip deep into to data to make impactful decisions.You are both data driven and a creative storyteller - you see the need for creative campaigns with measurable impacts.Responsibilities- Create suite of daily/ weekly/ monthly dashboards to report on marketing activities.- Oversee budgets, account flighting, and day-to-day optimizations of paid social channels, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat, YouTube, Google Adwords, Display (among others)- Analyze site metrics and sales information to identify opportunities to increase sales and site conversion.- Work with Product and Customer Empowerment teams to incorporate customer feedback and returns data into marketing data sets.- Analyzing and reporting Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to the leadership team- Analyze campaign performance and identify opportunities to optimize customer acquisition, referral, loyalty and affiliate programs.- With the founders, oversee marketing budget line items, ROI management and monthly expense reconciliation- Partner with founders on Content Marketing strategy and execution- Be responsible for building email marketing roadmap- Provide a strategic vision for all types of marketing and ensure robust, integrated, and flawless execution of its mission.- You must be open to trying anything, live and breathe data, nix projects that don’t work and be aggressive about doubling & tripling down on tactics that do! - Cohort creation and analysisTo learn more about Blume please visit www.meetblume.com.Email a resume and cover letter to apply. In your cover letter, please highlight why you’re a good fit for this role and any past startup experience.Job Type / CategoryBlume is seeking a data driven marketer that can help take us from a high growth startup with a passionate consumer following to a household name. Blume is hiring a data driven growth marketer to oversee and scale our customer acquisition. Our growth team aims to 5x revenues over the next 12 months.   As you succeed, you will be expected to build and lead Blume’s growth team. When it comes to growth and marketing, we pride ourselves on our grit and relentlessness.Required Education, Skills and QualificationsAreas of experience- Proficient in Microsoft Excel with the ability to analyze data, generate reports and organize large pieces of data. You live and breathe Google Analytics and Excel  - Other analytics or attribution platforms like Omniture, Kissmetrics, Mixpanel, Looker or others- SEO recommendations, landing page optimizations or other website / funnel related optimizations- Expertise with reporting, budgeting and attribution tracking and the latest tracking and measurement technologies.- Deep knowledge of attribution models and media mix marketingManaging ad budgets of over 6 figures in order to manage our external ads teamExperience of the following is helpful but not required:- Media buying for Podcasts, Spotify, Pandora, Pinterest and a range of other social platforms- Media buying on programmatic platforms like DoubleClick, Quantcast, ShareASale or other affiliate networks- Deep knowledge of how to use digital & offline channels and tools to drive new customer acquisition, build a brand, customer base, and community-driven content- Hands-on experience with SEO/SEM, Facebook & Instagram Ads, Google & Youtube Ads, Advertising, Customer Acquisition, Analytics and Reporting, Growth Hacking, Cost Measurement, Google Analytics, SQL+BI/data visualization- 2-3 years of experience in a senior growth role at a startup, top consulting or banking firm (eg. McKinsey, BCG, Bain, private equity or investment banking)Company ProfileWe are the brand girls grow up with - from trustworthy education, to safe & clean self care products, Blume is the first direct to consumer brand focused on puberty and beyond. We’re a small and mighty team making puberty and periods better for thousands of girls across North America. Our team iterates fast, works hard and has aggressive goals.Blume is growing rapidly and looking to hire driven, humble leaders. We have a 7 figure run rate, a passionate customer base (read our reviews) and sustainable month over month growth. Our style is entrepreneurial and dynamic - every member of the team is given a lot of autonomy AND responsibility. Blume is funded by Tier 1 VCs and strategic angel investors.Perks of working at Blume include: your birthday off, full benefits and more.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $90,000.00 to $120,000.00 /yearExperience:Marketing: 4 years (Preferred)

Toronto, ONWhy join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. Reporting to the Senior Director – Analytics, Insights & Innovation, you will lead our data analytics and customer insights program. In this role you will leverage your highly technical education and experience to ensure that we have the business intelligence warehouse, strategic data roadmap and visualization in place to drive success. In collaboration with your team of peers, you will drive outcomes by enabling data and analytics within the retail research, asset management, leasing, marketing and operations teams in addition to both internal and external stakeholders.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectivesLead the design of dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights and opportunitiesDevelop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of our customer and tenant behavior across multiple asset classesLeverage and integrate disparate data sources and technologies working alongside IT and other stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies and improve data quality and accessDevelop a solution / framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who are looking to utilize Tableau and/or data visualizationIdentifying opportunities for continuous improvement and autmation of tasks within our real estate platformDeveloping best-in-class Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methodologies combined with best-in-class Analytics & Insights scalable for a dynamic, innovative deliverables
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingHave a background in quantitative predictive modelling and a Master’s degree in Spatial Analysis and/or Data AnalyticsOver 10 years of experience in an analytical role driving customer insightsProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)Proficient using analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL)Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesHave successfully lead the development of data insights within an organizationMust be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player with an intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining for insights

Toronto, ONWe’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.


To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

This position will support the Senior Director, Digital Strategy and Analytics, by completing activities to develop and drive CIBC’s Digital Commercial Banking strategy. The Consultant, Digital Strategy & Analytics will facilitate, solicit, and assess ideas and recommendations on an ongoing basis from business and delivery partners, through formal and informal methods. You will conduct research to assist with preparation of Executive presentations, strategy papers and strategic roadmaps.

How You’ll Succeed

Proactive Review and Alignment: Assess business impacts and implications to the Digital Strategy Roadmap by conducting research to support the team and stay abreast of competitive and related industry strategies. Assist with identifying opportunities to align digital strategic objectives with client needs and internal stakeholder strategies. Develop a deep understanding of each client segment, their needs & their use of our products/services.
Digital Strategy Roadmap & Execution: Contribute to the Digital Commercial strategy and roadmap with research and preparation of competitive assessments focusing on the Digital needs for all Business client segments. Leverage your knowledge to translate client needs into actionable use cases across various strategic themes. Assist with preparation of presentations and materials ensuring there is alignment to the overall strategic vision and long term roadmap.
Build and maintain relationships across the enterprise: Liaise with peers and partners across Personal and Business Banking, Commercial Banking and Wealth Management, Corporate Banking, Enterprise Payments, Client Connectivity and Innovation and our technology partners to support the initiation of projects/POC’s developing and reviewing strategic scope documents.

Who You Are

You can demonstrate experience in the assessment and development of digital strategies (mobile/online) with a focus on client experience, innovation and revenue generation. Previous experience with digital or commercial banking is preferred.
You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
You have a degree/diploma in business/commerce or equivalent experience
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities and individual development planning
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you Need to Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Digital Analytics and Integration you will be a key member of the team, leading and delivering Google Analytics architecture, design and implementation for Digital Strategy initiatives and Digital Marketing campaigns. You will provide tactical insight, consultation and support to digital programs and initiatives, and drive its implementation and enablement. You will also lead efforts to stay abreast of implementation best practices and proactively drive the implementation of these best practices, in collaboration with various cross functional teams.

How You’ll Succeed

Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute digital analytics strategies and initiatives, and realize efficiencies by leveraging existing integrations as well as providing recommendations and best practices for new integrations.
Team Player – Collaboratively work with cross-functional teams across Digital Analytics, Digital Sales, Digital Strategy and Technology to ensure timely and end to end enablement of digital analytics initiatives across a wide array of enterprise platforms (.COM, Online Banking, Mobile Banking, etc.)
Relationship Building – Forge strong relationships by with business and internal partners and stakeholders and ensure a smooth roll out of various Google Analytics implementation and measurement initiatives.

Who You Are
You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new solutions to overcome all obstacles.
You can demonstrate experience in:
1) Leading and formalizing appropriate KPIs and a measurement strategy for standardization and implementation.
2) Expert knowledge in tag management and JavaScript coding and debugging. Deep experience with designing Digital Analytics solutions for Singe Page Application Frameworks and Mobile App.
3)Automated tagging and validation techniques, and exposure to tools such as ObservePoint.
4) Developing a standardized reporting approach using templates, Google Data Studio, etc. based on standardized metrics and implementation.
5) Integrating data from various backend data sources, such as CRMs, to build a complete omni-channel customer journey and extrapolating insights, trends and anomalies.
 6) Analyzing marketing channel performance with expertise in evaluating channel mix and attribution models.
7) Extensive experience in Google or Adobe Tag Manager, Google Analytics, DMP integrations, personalization integrations, Adobe or Google SDKs, Adobe Marketing Cloud, Google Marketing Platform, and Google Analytics integrations for multiple technology platforms such as AEM based websites, SPA frameworks, native and hybrid mobile apps.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

(6 month contract)


We support and encourage employees to find long term success and explore opportunities that play to their individual strengths and passions. We value lateral moves as much as vertical promotions – we believe all roles should develop your skills, broaden your experience, and help you build a rewarding career at Rogers.

We’ve established a new set of internal hiring rules to help you find long-term success at Rogers. Click here to access Your Career @ Rogers – Ground Rules and become familiar with the new requirements.

The Manager, Forecasting and Analytics will be accountable for driving and evolving analytics, and sharing insights to support the overall Wireless customer lifecycle and acquisition strategy, with the goal of improving business growth and customer satisfaction. This includes defining and implementing necessary data query techniques for program assessment, analyzing and summarizing data, business case input, and providing insights and recommendations on tactics to improve subscriber growth, and customer retention in the existing customer base. The successful candidate will be strategic, command the business acumen to understand how to move the business forward, and have the analytical skills to bring ideas to life.

This is a 6 month contract position

What you will be doing:
Analyze customer-based data, financial data to determine opportunities and gaps for subscriber growth activity, customer retention and acquisition strategies.
Translate business issues into analytical requirements; prepare concise insights and present findings to management and retention team
Present to Senior Leadership Team when required
Assess the current data and reporting environment and recommend design and implement improvements to create more efficient processes
Work with cross functional teams (e.g. Finance, Marketing, Care, and Channels) to assess the impacts of new and existing programs and market changes

What you bring:
Undergraduate degree. Masters degree is considered an asset.
Must have 5+ years of experience in analytic roles demonstrating an ability to derive actionable insights. Knowledge of telecom industry is a plus.
Excellent computer and programming skills with advanced knowledge of SAS and SQL, relational databases, Excel, PowerPoint, PowerQuery, PowerPivot, Thinkcell
Practical experience in manipulating large datasets and working effectively with different data sources
Proficient in statistics and business/financial analysis
Solid organizational skills, with attention to detail and the ability to be flexible and adaptable to a changing environment to provide results
Good work ethic, with the ability to work both independently and with teams
Excellent oral, written and presentation skills

Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: 6 Months
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: None
Posting Category/Function: Reporting and Analytics & Analyst
Requisition ID: 150382

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day

We work as one team, with one vision

What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. job_title: Internship opportunities for students: Business Programs & Operations
job_description:
At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Over the years, Microsoft has experienced great success and we are just at the beginning of an incredible new wave of opportunity. Today, we live in a mobile-first, cloud-first world, and the transformation we are driving across our businesses is designed to enable Microsoft and our customers to thrive in this world. Every organization across the planet will look to internal and external digital tools to help in their own digital transformation. Microsoft is uniquely positioned in an era of massive business and societal transformation. Our entire purpose is to make things that help our customers make things - and make things happen. Join us in our quest to democratize the intelligent cloud and intelligent edge capabilities for the world.
Business Operations Intern
Are you an analytical thinker who has great communication and cross-team collaboration skills and thrives on working with fast paced, rapidly growing, and highly accountable sales, finance and operations teams? If you are, there's no better time to join the Business Programs & Operations discipline at Microsoft! You will be at the business center of excellence for cross-business execution performance, planning, and Subsidiary operations. The team helps scale execution, drives clear business & market insights that result in Microsoft achieving its business objectives.
As a Business Operations Intern for Canadian Enterprise Sales you will lead Sales Operations projects within your respective teams and will support Sales Directors in the management of their business. You will have exciting learning opportunities by helping the Enterprise Operating Unit Sales Operations team in managing sales pipeline and developing innovative BI reporting and insights. You will also be accountable for supporting the creation and execution of strategic sales motion that have the potential to drive revenue within the teams you support.
Responsibilities
Sales Business Management & Support
Working closely with Sales Leaders to provide business management and some operational support for ~$700M businesses, including the development of management dashboards, revenue forecasting and a variety of reporting and analytics
Working closely with Account Executives and Opportunity Managers to provide insight and ideas to enable new rhythms of business growth
Business planning & strategy research for account planning, sales opportunities, etc.

Sales Excellence Operations & Analytics
Sales Excellence Projects varying from developing Manager Dashboards, Power BI Insight Reporting, operationalizing and streamlining process.
Ad hoc requests that support the various Sales Excellence, Customer Facing and Marketing projects.
Qualifications
Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Management, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Information Technologies, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields (pursuing with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship).
Team Player: driving digital transformation with our customers is a team sport. We need teammates who can stay maniacally focused on our customers' satisfaction while operating in a highly-collaborative, matrixed, and global sales organization.
Growth Mindset: your life is truly about learning-it-all. You approach every new piece of information, knowledge, and competency with insatiable curiosity. Ultimately, you're open to the ideas of others, where the success of others does not diminish your own.
Relentlessly Resourceful: you have the drive to overcome any obstacle in your work.
Customer Obsessed: you learn about your customers and their businesses with a beginner's mind and then bring solutions that meet their needs.
Pure Challenge: demonstrated desire and ability to readily take on complex challenges and work towards solutions to seemingly unsolvable problems.
Passion for Technology: you're deeply motivated by the incredible opportunity of how technology can inspire and ignite change and renewal
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Toronto, ONWhy LoyaltyOne?
Are you passionate about leveraging your analytics experience to help more than one hundred of the world’s leading brands improve marketing outcomes and deliver differentiated performance? Are you looking to build an extraordinary career and expand your analytics expertise in one of the most respected analytics companies in Canada? If so, join LoyaltyOne’s analytics practice to become a part of a team comprised of industry leading, business oriented analytics thought leaders. Our team translates data into analytics, insights, strategy and results for our clients. For six consecutive years, LoyaltyOne has been recognized by Hewitt Associates as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada, demonstrating LoyaltyOne's continued commitment to providing a great work experience for its associates and a great service experience for its clients. Don’t miss this opportunity to take your career to a whole new level with LoyaltyOne.
About the Opportunity
The AIR MILES Reward Program Analytics & Insights practice is looking for a well-rounded Analytics & Insights Analyst to join our team in Toronto. We are looking for an analytics practitioner with a blend of proficient technical skills and strong business acumen. The Analyst plays an key role in the application & execution of consumer data and analytics to support the development of customer-centric business strategies and Loyalty Marketing for our clients.
Qualification:
Responsibilities
Subject Matter Expert in Loyalty & Marketing Analytics for the assigned client portfolio
Contribute to all phases of campaign management (ideation, planning, targeting, measurement, recommendation) with a focus in pre-analysis and post-analysis
Work collaboratively with internal and external business partners to understand external client’s business needs and maximize team impact
Work collaboratively with internal business partners to clearly define analysis / campaign scope, objectives, targeting & measurement strategy for client’s loyalty marketing initiatives
Conduct timely customer analysis and campaign measurement to identify opportunities for clients to maximize the use of AIR MILES Reward Program to drive incremental sales
Present analysis results and recommendations in business language in different forums/meetings
Automate and make process and tool improvement suggestions to drive operational efficiency
Balance the demands of multiple concurrent projects while maintaining a high level of diplomacy
Bachelor’s degree, preferrably in any of the following: Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math
Problem solving skills coupled with the “can do” attitude
Hands-on proficient experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau an asset
Knowledge in direct marketing, campaign management, experimental design, customer analytics, CRM, segmentation, modeling
Retail and merchandising industry knowledge a definite advantage
A strategic/analytical thinker who can link assigned tasks to the bigger picture
Strong organzational, time management and communication skills (verbal and written)
About LoyaltyOne

LoyaltyOne is part of the successful Alliance Data family of companies that provide the full range of data-driven loyalty, marketing and credit solutions in more than 80 locations across the globe.

Working with more than 100 leading brands in the retail, financial services, grocery, petroleum retail, travel and hospitality industries to profitably change customer behavior. Through a team of businesses, including one of the leading coalition loyalty programs in the world, the AIR MILES® Reward Program, LoyaltyOne designs, delivers and manages a suite of services focused on consumer data, customer-centric retail strategies, direct-to-consumer marketing, loyalty consulting and more.

LoyaltyOne has broadened its horizons geographically by growing Precima in the European market. With the recent acquisition of BrandLoyalty in the Netherlands, LoyaltyOne has gained the expertise of a global leader in short-term loyalty campaigns, along with a client network that extends throughout Europe and Asia.

About ADS

Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. http://www.alliancedata.com/

Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Toronto, ONResearch Manager, Insights & Analytics - (190491)

Organization Edelman

Practice Area Digital


Edelman has experienced unprecedented growth in recent years – growth that is reflective of the firm’s ongoing evolution from a PR agency into a communications marketing firm. We now offer several specialized areas of expertise, including creative, social, paid media, and research to help clients evolve, promote, and protect their brands in the market. By investing heavily in specialty areas – and by focusing on collaboration, agency position, innovation, and establishing a culture of creativity – Edelman is well-positioned to continue to deliver best-in-class work to our clients in today’s complex media landscape.

Edelman Toronto is currently seeking a Research Manager to join our Insights & Analytics specialty area. Reporting to the Research Director, Insights & Analytics, the role will focus on providing insights and consultative support to our account teams to help drive business results for our clients. The successful candidate will be a proven strategic research professional who will utilize their experience in quantitative (e.g., surveys, polls) and qualitative (e.g., focus groups, in-depth interviews) methodologies to contribute to the growth of our Insights & Analytics specialty.

You will have a solid background in research methods and strong skills across the entire project lifecycle, from scoping and costing stages, through to research design (questionnaire or discussion guide development), project execution, data analysis, and reporting. You will leverage your experience to drive the development of innovative and creative research methods, and to uncover insights that will provide clear direction in terms of communications planning and marketing program related decision-making for our clients. This position requires experience with various statistical methods that are necessary for interpreting data sets, as well as a passion for understanding their impact on human behaviour and the big picture. You also have excellent organizational skills, unwavering attention to detail, strong abilities in PowerPoint and Excel, and are an expert at managing multiple assignments and deadlines simultaneously.
Beyond this, you are a clear communicator, an effective story-teller, and an adaptable collaborator who partners with internal and external stakeholders as well as your team members. You bring a positive attitude to the workplace, and you are eager to learn new things as well as to provide mentorship to junior support members on the team. People love working with you!

Responsibilities


Provide day-to-day account management guidance that will assist clients in meeting their research objectives.
Manage everyday execution of research initiatives, including implementation and oversight of studies, and responding to ad-hoc research requests.
Develop and manage research budgets.
Responsible for the development of quantitative & qualitative analyses which leads to strategic insights and ultimately recommendations against a client's marketing and communications efforts and business objectives.
Manage and coordinate all aspects of the research process from proposal writing and research design, analysis, and interpretation of results through to preparation of reports and delivery of presentations.
Effectively collaborate with external research vendors throughout the research process: data collection, data processing, and results reporting.
Effectively distill data into coherent analysis, insights, and actionable recommendations in straight forward and simple language and communicate research findings in visually engaging PowerPoint presentations.
Act as a lead on Q&A of outgoing reports to ensure deliverables meet standards.
Work with client and account teams to leverage measurement-focused insights.

Support Senior Staff on day-to-day project operations including: project status updates, support on proposal development, project management, resource planning, etc.
Stay informed about client industries including their technologies, products, target markets and competitors.
Have a reputation as a strong "team player" and serve as a role model to more junior team members.
Maintain strong internal/external relationships; support fellow team members.


Qualifications

The Research Manager, Insights & Analytics must have around 3-5 years of relevant experience in market research, ideally from a research firm or a communications agency.
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
Experience with the development of research and measurement frameworks based on clearly defined objectives.
A demonstrated ability to think critically, solve problems, and develop a narrative based on data driven insights.
Strong project management skills, including timeline development and project scoping.
Advanced skills in Excel, and the ability to understand and maintain data integrity.
Strong understanding of structuring and executing research, including audience segmentation and key driver analysis.
Proven ability to analyze, organize, and translate substantial amounts of data and information into clear and concise, story-telling focused presentations and plans.
Strong PowerPoint design skills, including the ability to communicate quantitative data in a visually engaging way.
Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, including strong skills in document and presentation development.
Ability to collaborate, develop, and implement measurement strategies.
Strategic yet creative thinker and self-starter, who is able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Candidates will be required to complete a case-study assignment as a part of the interview process.

Edelman is an independent global communications marketing firm that partners with businesses and organizations—long-established and just-emerging—to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. University degree
5+ years of data analysis experience exploring big data with the express purpose of deriving insightful, marketable output
Specialized expertise in multivariate data analysis, applying valid statistical methods to test hypotheses and discover patterns and predictors
Ability to generate both explanatory as well as predictive models using time-series data
Solid technical proficiency, including experience with relational database environments, and with high powered, industry standard statistical analysis engines such as SAS, R, Python, etc.

Who You’ll Work With

You’ll work as part of the PriceMetrix Advisory Services Team, in our Toronto office.

PriceMetrix, part of McKinsey & Company’s Banking Practice, is the first choice in practice management software for North American wealth manager firms. PriceMetrix uses analytics and industry benchmarking to help financial advisors and their firms better serve their clients and grow their businesses. Our team is small and agile, and you’ll collaborate with very smart, fun and driven colleagues.

What You’ll Do

You will be responsible for turning data into insight and you will support PriceMetrix by extracting data from our databases, analyzing it and turning it into useful solutions and storylines, and developing presentations to internal and external clients.

Additionally, you will be a key resource for client engagement, research, and future product features.

You will work with colleagues in the Advisory Services Team and collaborate with other McKinsey colleagues to develop analysis and insights, and to support reactive business investigations. You will also collaborate with the Product Team to seed ideas, develop requirements for new data and products and new product features inspired by results of analysis.

job_title: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Risk Analytics, Investment Risk
job_description:
Job Description

We are recruiting for an Analyst/Senior Analyst to join the Risk Analytics team in the Investment Risk Department. The candidate is responsible for executing the daily production process and prepare timely and accurate investment risk reports. The candidate will ensure that risk estimates are calculated correctly by ensuring that analytical reviews, reasonability checks, position reconciliations and established processes are completed and followed in accordance with Investment Risk Management Standards and Methodologies. The candidate is expected to work with internal data governance team in response to exceptions management process with respect to his/her primary supporting areas.
The Analyst/Senior Analyst is responsible for developing a deep knowledge of the current risk infrastructure, identifying opportunities for improvements and may involve in the design of solutions to address shortcomings or enhancement in coordination with the Solutions Engeering team within Risk Analytics, the Investment Risk group and IT. Additionally the candidate will participates or leads ad-hoc Investment Risk projects and autonomously liaises with other departments to satisfy dependencies and acquire source data. The candidate will facilitate where appropriate the integration of tactical and manual solutions into production-grade systems by framing and documenting the functionalities for IT.
This position requires someone with high attention to detail, strong sense of ownership and integrity and strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Depending on experience, some basic understanding of risk measurement principles (i.e. risk factors, Value-at-Risk, stress testing, backtesting) is preferred. The position also requires the ability to work diligently with third party risk applications and internally developed applications.
Position Requirements
Prepare, validate and distribute regular CPPIB Investment Portfolio risk reports satisfying both established time-line and accuracy level
Require to accommodate early work shift (8am to 4pm) to support critical daily compliance monitoring requirement
Analyze risk results at both portfolio and aggregated fund at a detailed level to ensure completeness and accuracy of the results. Carry out risk attribution to individual investment strategies and risk factors using established methodologies and applications
Adhere to established standards with regards to escalation protocols of both limits violations and production operational issues
Assist in developing and executing tests to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used to calculate risk measures
Develop and maintain documentation related to Risk Measurement processes and activities
Work with functional teams, in particularly Risk Oversight teams to develop strategy-specific risk reports and to analyze investment department strategies
Provide on-going support function to both management reporting and financial reporting
Work with data service departments and/or IT partner to identify and source necessary position, market and reference data to fulfill risk measurement practices
Develop and foster effective working relationships across the CPP Investment Board and external risk service providers
Other duties as required

Qualifications

0 – 2 years of work experience (Analyst) in financial industry or 2 – 4 years of work experience (Senior Analyst) in financial industry with a focus on Financial/Risk/Management reporting areas
Previous work experience in an operational role would be a strong asset
Undergraduate or advanced degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Math or other relevant discipline with a strong appetite for quantitative and statistical data
Professional designation; CFA, CA, CAIA, FRM or other would be an asset
Strong analytical skills and problem solving abilities
Solid working knowledge in the use of Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Ability to build/automate solutions and lead initiatives using SQL/Database/VBA skills is an asset
Flexibility and adaptability
Able to deliver in a constantly changing and fast paced organization
Able to partner with different areas of the organization and with different employee levels
Ability to deliver in a high performance culture operating under time-sensitive deadlines
Exemplifies our guiding principles of partnership, integrity and high performance
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-PM1
At CPP Investment Board, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Disclaimer:
CPP Investment Board does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investment Board to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investment Board will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Why join us?
At Oxford Properties, you will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers as genuine partners.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Responsible for managing the customer and market research initiatives for our retail assets and other real estate asset classes nationally including NPS, customer and leasing surveys.
Continue to develop the adoption of the analytics platform within the retail portfolio.
Work closely with asset management, leasing, marketing and operations to develop dashboards that generate data-driven insights, opportunities and tools to influence tenant transactions and improve efficiencies.
Provide analytics and insights and innovative methodologies to the retail marketing teams to effectively target existing customers and measure the results
Understand policy & procedure flow as it relates to approvals of projects/ analytics and insights

To succeed in this role, you:

Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.
Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environment
Driven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking
Education – Master’s Degree in Spatial Analysis or similar program preferred
Self-motivated individual who is driven and demonstrates perpetual optimism.
Strong skills in the following: relationship-building, sales, communication, presentation and problem solving
Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologies
Proficient using data analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL) and asset
Proficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)
The ability to work with a variety of diversified cultures, business owners and across different industries.
Computer literacy in MS Office products.

Our story:
OMERS is one of Canada’s leading pension funds. We invest over $85 billion for more than 470,000 plan members and their families. Our investment professionals use a direct-drive, active management strategy to invest in public and private markets from our offices in Toronto, New York, London and Sydney. We are committed to earning superior returns by attracting world-class investors and by building a culture of excellence.

Established in 1960, Oxford Properties Group is the real estate arm of OMERS, one of Canada’s largest pension funds with over $85 billion in assets. Today, Oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with over 2,000 employees and over $45 billion of assets that it manages for OMERS and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Headquartered in Toronto, Oxford has regional offices in Calgary, New York, Boston, Washington, DC, Singapore, Sydney and London, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. For more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

Mississauga, ONThe Manager, WMG Operations & Analytics will support the Director of Integrated Communications Planning with WMG financial reporting, measurement and analysis and business operations.
Key tasks will include:
Supporting the development and implementation of WMG reporting framework, tools and processes
Leading WMG campaign analytics and reporting and providing strategic insights and analytics to help guide merchant and WMG teams to improve vendors marketing and advertising programs.
Supporting WMG financial planning & reporting including developing annual building blocks and revenue targets as well as revenue and expense forecasting and tracking
Leading WMG operations including process development and improvement, program development and business integration
About WMG
The Walmart Media Group (WMG) is a business unit within Walmart Canada that offers brands sophisticated advertising solutions across a network of over 1.8 million online shoppers per day, with the goal of helping customers discover the brands and products available at Walmart that are right for them.
Position Responsibilities
Support the development of strategic measurement frameworks and tools to ensure deep understanding of results across WMG, merchandising, marketing and vendor partners.
Lead the implementation of reporting, analytics tools, training and processes and work closely with internal teams and agency partners to ensure measurement plans are in place to track the effectiveness and efficiency of advertising campaigns and channels
Leverage internal and third-party tools & data to build, analyze, and deliver campaign reports to internal teams and external partners that measure performance and identify opportunities for improvement.
Actively champion the development of new advertising measurement solutions that will enable Walmart to continue to provide a superior and differentiated offering to brand advertisers. Quickly understand multiple data sources and develop methodology for joining data that will add value.
Work closely with Customer Marketing, WMG Sales, agency partners and Walmart Finance to manage the WMG financial plan including annual sales planning and target setting, regular P&L management including forecasting and tracking.
Lead regular cross functional discussions on the WMG P&L ensuring internal & external partners understand current performance including financial wins and opportunities vs plan.
Work closely with internal and agency partners and lead the development and execution of improvements in WMG process and business integration, launching new product offering and executing industry events (ex. Annual vendor conference).

Canada Walmart DivisionCorporate

Minimum Years of Experience Required: 6-8 years
Licensing & Other Qualifications
Strong business acumen with demonstrated proficiency in understanding and managing a P&L
Demonstrated proficiency in analyzing and reporting on advertising performance across multiple traditional and digital media channels
Exceptional problem solving and analysis skills combined with the ability to communicate findings and actionable insights to all levels of an organization, both internally and externally.
Understanding of relational databases, BI tools, and strong understanding of data processing.

Expert working knowledge and experience with website analytics tools such as Omniture, Google Analytics, and Comscore
Deep knowledge of Excel functions and methods for manipulating, aggregating and presenting data in Excel
Experience with presentation tools such as PowerPoint and Tableau
Positive attitude and strongly motivated to employ insights and results to actively move a business forward.
Ability to work independently and learn on the fly.
Able to work successfully under tight deadlines and manage multiple priorities.
Able to shift priorities in a fast-changing environment.
Superb attention to detail.

Toronto, ONJob Description

Business Group Overview
Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) is Visa's consulting division, serving Visa's clients (including card issuers, acquirers and merchants) and solving their strategic problems focused on improving performance and profitability. Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, payments, data analytics, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, VCA drives high impact and tangible financial results.
Position Summary
The Director, VCA will join our strategy consulting practice and play a key role developing and delivering high impact engagements for Visa’s Canadian clients. This person will develop initiatives to promote sustainable and profitable growth, thereby ensuring that Visa is both the preferred brand and a valued, long-term business partner.
Potential projects could include portfolio management diagnostics, assessments of digital product and marketing strategies, development of industry landscape evaluations and best practices, and optimizing client customer experience and supporting processes.
The ideal candidate is a highly analytical individual with previous strategy, consulting and /or payments experience. The role will be based in Toronto, Ontario.
Responsibilities
Proactively engage with Visa leaders in regular strategic & planning discussions; cultivate and manage a pipeline of work with Financial Institutions.
Contribute to selling consulting engagements by identifying potential opportunities with Visa’s client banks/financial institutions.
Develop frameworks, approaches, solutions and recommendations that effectively and efficiently address the most impactful opportunities and challenges.
Build solutions and actionable insights that will help clients to grow their portfolios.
Partner with peers in other functional areas (e.g., sales and solutions, marketing, sales, risk, innovation, products) and across global regional teams to execute projects in ways that leverage the breadth and depth of Visa’s resources.
Produce insights, analyses and recommendations to improve client performance, boost growth, drive understanding of client issues and provide strategic guidance for client priorities across the verticals and segments.
Build new scalable solutions, toolkits, best practice documents and consulting approach that can be applied across VCA practice
Develop client-specific presentations which address executive needs and deliver presentations to clients and internal Visa partners

Qualifications

We are looking for bright and enthusiastic people to bring innovative ideas to our consulting practice:
10-12 years progressive experience across management consulting and/or payments industry
2-3 years of prior strategy consulting experience preferred
Bachelor's degree (MBA preferred)
Excellent communication, story-telling and presentation skills
Self-motivated, highly energized; detail-oriented individuals who will deliver strategic thought leadership, problem diagnostics and high impact solutions to clients support the growth and performance.
Candidates must be able to develop enduring, strategic relationships with internal and external clients and across the Visa organization.
Ability to effectively manipulate and analyze large data sets (industry and Visa) to determine meanings insights and recommendations for clients
Strong team player with a willingness to collaborate across levels and functional experts
Strong multi-tasking skills and ability to adapt
Proficient and ideally a power-user of spreadsheet and presentation tools
An interest in payments, financial institutions or consumer lending a plus
An affinity for payments technology, digital, FinTech
10-25% travel required
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Why join us?
At Oxford Properties, you will be a key member of an engaged, high-reaching team—part of a world-class, winning culture that prioritizes people development and focuses on long-term growth. We take great pride in leading the industry by earning respect through every interaction, every day. We go above and beyond to protect and grow relationships by anticipating needs, being honest and considerate and valuing customers as genuine partners.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Responsible for managing the customer and market research initiatives for our retail assets and other real estate asset classes nationally including NPS, customer and leasing surveys.Continue to develop the adoption of the analytics platform within the retail portfolio.Work closely with asset management, leasing, marketing and operations to develop dashboards that generate data-driven insights, opportunities and tools to influence tenant transactions and improve efficiencies.Provide analytics and insights and innovative methodologies to the retail marketing teams to effectively target existing customers and measure the resultsUnderstand policy & procedure flow as it relates to approvals of projects/ analytics and insights
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingEducation – Master’s Degree in Spatial Analysis or similar program preferredSelf-motivated individual who is driven and demonstrates perpetual optimism.Strong skills in the following: relationship-building, sales, communication, presentation and problem solvingProficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesProficient using data analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL) and assetProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)The ability to work with a variety of diversified cultures, business owners and across different industries.Computer literacy in MS Office products.
Our story:
OMERS is one of Canada’s leading pension funds. We invest over $85 billion for more than 470,000 plan members and their families. Our investment professionals use a direct-drive, active management strategy to invest in public and private markets from our offices in Toronto, New York, London and Sydney. We are committed to earning superior returns by attracting world-class investors and by building a culture of excellence.

Established in 1960, Oxford Properties Group is the real estate arm of OMERS, one of Canada’s largest pension funds with over $85 billion in assets. Today, Oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with over 2,000 employees and over $45 billion of assets that it manages for OMERS and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Headquartered in Toronto, Oxford has regional offices in Calgary, New York, Boston, Washington, DC, Singapore, Sydney and London, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. For more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

job_title: Professor/Program Coordinator, Business Insights and Analytics
job_description:
If you are an educational leader looking for an opportunity to be part of a transformative experience and contribute as we shape the future of our students and communities, here is your opportunity to join our team.
Humber College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning, one of Canada’s leading postsecondary institutions, offers a combination of theoretical learning and hands on experience and meets its vision of transforming postsecondary education through global and polytechnic leadership.
Humber’s Centres of Innovation and Entrepreneurship will integrate applied research into program curricula and provide students with access to interdisciplinary and industry projects. We are seeking faculty who will provide students with an exceptional learning experience as we immerse our students in experiential learning and programs that empower them to think critically, make bold choices and become leaders of change.
Humber offers a variety of credentials including: bachelor’s degree, diplomas, certificates, post-graduate certificates and apprentice programs. Faculty and students excel in business, applied technology, media studies, liberal arts and sciences, social community services, health sciences, hospitality, recreation and lifestyle promotion and creative and performing arts. Learn more about Humber College at www.humber.ca
The incumbent will teach in the Business Insights and Analytics postgrad program and be responsible for the coordination of the day-to-day operation of the program. In addition, the successful candidate will develop curriculum, design/revise specific courses, create an effective and innovative learning environment for our students, assess student progress and achievement; work collaboratively with colleagues, participate in committees and related associations. Teaching may be assigned at both the North and Lakeshore campuses and may include teaching at the Orangeville campus.
The incumbent will also support student advising, student recruitment, graduate placement, assist with the promotion and marketing of programs and develop and maintain strong industry ties.

Qualifications The successful candidate will have a relevant graduate degree (minimum MBA, MA or a relevant PhD) specializing in Business Analytics, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or Machine Learning and Programming, and a minimum of seven years of recent related business experience, plus teaching or training experience. Additional qualifications include: superior and demonstrable written and oral communication skills; initiative and problem solving skills; proven desire and adaptability to work in a diverse, dynamic, multicultural environment with scarce resources; strong leadership capabilities; and a proven commitment to professional development, lifelong learning and non-traditional delivery methods. Knowledge of college systems, policies, procedures, the program context, and the ability to teach in a related discipline, are advantageous.

In addition, the successful candidate will have engaging and effective teaching skills, demonstrated ability to coach and support students, demonstrated experience managing classroom dynamics, strong knowledge and application of current pedagogical principles, a student focused approach and a demonstrated commitment to fostering innovation and positive change. The successful candidate will have a demonstrated commitment to and knowledge of principles of equity and inclusion, be a collaborative team player and be committed to a positive team culture. The successful candidate will possess well developed interpersonal communication skills and have demonstrated ability to contribute positively to curriculum development and delivery.

Notes Duration: This Coordinator component of this position is a three (3) year term.

Qualifications
University degree
5+ years of data analysis experience exploring big data with the express purpose of deriving insightful, marketable output
Specialized expertise in multivariate data analysis, applying valid statistical methods to test hypotheses and discover patterns and predictors
Ability to generate both explanatory as well as predictive models using time-series data
Solid technical proficiency, including experience with relational database environments, and with high powered, industry standard statistical analysis engines such as SAS, R, Python, etc.
Experience with financial data
Experience managing large-scale quantitative research projects
Ability to generate and gather hypotheses, and the willingness to push boundaries on traditional frameworks and beliefs
Ability to solve problems independently and creatively
Comprehensive computer skills including database searching, Power Point, word processing, spreadsheet analysis and online research
Ability to break down analytic output into digestible product ideas, advisory projects and in the form of concise and insightful communications
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing
Ability to manage many projects simultaneously and meet deadlines within a high energy, fast paced and evolving environment
Who You'll Work With
You’ll work as part of the PriceMetrix Advisory Services Team, in our Toronto office.

PriceMetrix, part of McKinsey & Company’s Banking Practice, is the first choice in practice management software for North American wealth manager firms. PriceMetrix uses analytics and industry benchmarking to help financial advisors and their firms better serve their clients and grow their businesses. Our team is small and agile, and you’ll collaborate with very smart, fun and driven colleagues.
What You'll Do
You will be responsible for turning data into insight and you will support PriceMetrix by extracting data from our databases, analyzing it and turning it into useful solutions and storylines, and developing presentations to internal and external clients.

Additionally, you will be a key resource for client engagement, research, and future product features.

You will be developing and curating hypotheses, and developing ideas for structured analysis, in line with market interests, as well as preparing data for, and executing analyses using sound statistical methods and data modeling techniques.

You will work with colleagues in the Advisory Services Team and collaborate with other McKinsey colleagues to develop analysis and insights, and to support reactive business investigations. You will also collaborate with the Product Team to seed ideas, develop requirements for new data and products and new product features inspired by results of analysis.

We expect you to acquire and maintain retail wealth management industry knowledge, keeping abreast of market changes that affect current products and future analysis opportunities.

Toronto, ONPermanentPay per click Specialist

Location: Toronto, Ontario | Department: Marketing Department | Reports to: Digital Marketing Manager

Why Join our Team?
We are building a superb place to work if you love solving problems, enjoy a challenge and have genuine enthusiasm for overcoming obstacles and learning, you’ll love it. Your customer service and technical skills will be tested every day. There are endless opportunities for you to develop and grow and you’ll really make a difference to all sorts of people. We’re a family-run business, who are incredibly ambitious and constantly expanding and I can promise you’ll enjoy every single day.

Job Purpose:
The PPC/ Pay Per Click Specialist is responsible for Creating and Managing a variety of PPC campaigns across a range of Digital Channels such as: Google and Bing.

Job Overview:Three key objectives:

Drive high quality traffic to the website
Generate leads (forms completed or phone calls) from PPC traffic
Capture audience insight

Responsibilities:

Own the strategic planning and everyday management of multiple high budget PPC accounts across Google and Bing
Ongoing testing, optimisation & tracking for lead generation to meet business KPIS
Monitoring bid management of campaigns across all PPC networks to identify trends, opportunities and areas of concern
Producing and presenting reports on PPC activity to internal stakeholders
Design Landing pages depends upon the Target Persona
Monitor Competitor performance by using Google auction insights and SEMRush
Working effectively with the other members of the PPC and digital team to maintain efficient running of all accounts

Professional Skills & Qualifications

Education/Experience:The successful candidate must have:

2+ years’ experience of managing competitive PPC campaigns and able to display experience of managing large budgets
Need to know how to do Long tail keyword research
Need to know how to design Landing pages by Using Unbounce
Experience of CRO with knowledge of creating and implementing multivariate tests
Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Strong knowledge of Google Analytics with a passion for data analysis and data driven decision making
Google Certification is a Plus but not required
Experience with a Tag Manager is a plus
The enthusiasm to keep abreast of industry standards, new technologies and the latest approaches in digital marketing with the ability to communicate this throughout the digital team
Able to develop a long-term strategy with hands-on ability to get things done
Knowledge of multiple biddable media platforms including display advertising, Google and Bing shopping ads, social media and remarketing
Experience of programmatic advertising and Native advertisements

Skills:

Proven B2B PPC experience with lead generation tactics
Thrives in a supportive and friendly working environment and with a desire to share new innovative ideas and skills
Drive to meet and exceed targets and timescales
Self-motivated with a strong work ethic that can work with limited supervision and guidance
Demonstrates a highly committed attitude and works hard towards common goals with others
Worked within a team and help to develop junior members with the sharing of skills

Calgary, ABOverview
POSITION OVERVIEW
We are looking for a skilled communications professional with a track record of producing engaging, creative, and innovative content to join our team as a Communications Specialist. The successful candidate will be an exceptional writer and storyteller who can research, write, package and distribute compelling content appropriate for traditional and digital channels.

Based in our Calgary office and reporting to the Director of Marketing, the Communications Specialist will be equal parts investigative journalist and digital marketer. Working closely with the Marketing, Lead Generation, and Sales teams, this role will help position the organization as an industry leader, attract quality leads, and achieve annual sales targets.

Develop and implement an annual editorial calendar that promotes the brand narrative across multiple channels
Monitor key industry issues and stay current on product development, industry trends, and issues affect FBC Members and their businesses.
Develop content for blogs, whitepapers and other web material, social media posts, video channels, webinars, email campaigns, e-newsletters, online advertisements, presentations, news releases, and other general communications needs using a variety of media and channels.
Develop, communicate and execute content plans and social campaigns
Identify, research, write, package and distribute stories that support lead generation, sales, thought leadership, and Member engagement targets.
Develop and implement an annual editorial calendar that promotes the brand narrative across multiple channels
Manage the corporate website and other digital assets to optimize the in-bound sales funnel.
Develop content for blogs, whitepapers and other web material, social media posts, video channels, webinars, email campaigns, e-newsletters, online advertisements, presentations, news releases, and other general communications needs using a variety of media and channels.
Manage researching, fact-checking, writing, editing and proofing of digital and print materials on deadline.

Work with digital team to optimize content based on analytics and make recommendations to improve performance.

Exceptional writing and story-telling skills with a proven record of producing compelling and shareable content across multiple platforms and content management systems.
