job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
Calgary, ABAbout Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.
#discoverCWB

04/4/2019

Burnaby, BCRequisition ID: 37242
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
DRIVE IS WHAT GIVES YOU THE CAREER ADVANTAGE
This position is for Scotia Dealer Advantage, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Bank of Nova Scotia. We provide dealers and customers alike with the advantages, strength and experience of Scotiabank, coupled with Scotia Dealer Advantage's industry leading Special Finance expertise and service.
Scotia Dealer Advantage is one of Canada’s largest and fastest growing Special Finance companies providing automotive financing programs nationwide. We build partnerships with authorized independent and franchise automobile dealers to help them grow their businesses and serve their special finance customers
Job Purpose:
Champions the Risk department of Scotia Dealer Advantage in Canada ensuring business strategies, plans and initiatives are executed / delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. The Manager, Strategic Analytics contributes to the management of credit risk for non-prime indirect automotive lending. He/she is responsible for designing strategies that optimize key metrics identifying opportunities, while aligning to the Bank's objectives and risk appetite.
Key Accountabilities:
Leads and drives a customer focused culture throughout their team to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Strategic analysis and reporting to increase automated decisions, and optimize risk-adjusted profit by: Overseeing the investigation, quantification, segmentation and other optimization analysis of risk management strategies; determining optimal settings and implications of recommended changes; researching, identifying and utilizing statistically-based methods for assessing, managing and optimizing risk strategies; conducting ongoing analysis and review of current processes/procedures while constantly looking to improve strategy and operational efficiencies; designing new and refine existing metrics, as appropriate, to better track the portfolio performance.
Develop Risk strategies for origination and portfolio management by: designing and developing new procedures and tools to address trends and risk strategies; researching, testing, recommending and implementing the latest analytical techniques to analyze data, where appropriate.
Oversee/conduct comprehensive and timely statistical analysis and execution of ad hoc reporting requests, ensuring accuracy and timely responses for use in Senior Management and Executive decision-making by: reviewing/approving analyses/recommendations and discussing results with the business line where required.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Creates an environment in which his/her team pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Builds a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.
Functional Competencies:
Analytical & problem-solving skills consistent with the ability to identify key issues from a broad range of alternatives, and recommend optimal solutions for various situations.
Strong knowledge designing strategies for new account origination and their respective origination systems (Capstone, TRIAD, probe knowledge beneficial);technical expertise including experience with analytics tools like SQL, Angoss KnowledgeSEEKER, Hive, SAS, R, Python, Tableau, risk technologies and scoring to enable the automation and optimization of strategies, policies and business rules.
Strong influencing skills with excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills in order to build consensus and obtain co-operation across departments & The role requires strong communication skills, both verbal and written, including good presentation skills.
Education/Experience:
University degree (preferably with a major in economics, finance or business). Master degree in statistics, economics, mathematics, management sciences or analytics
5+ years working experience, with a proven track record using SAS/Enterprise Miner to design risk strategies as well as a deep understanding of credit bureau information
Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Burnaby
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.

CWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.

You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.

Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.

The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:
We’re currently recruiting for a Permanent Full-Time Business Analytics Consultant role. You will bring your well-honed skills to the organization by interpreting, implementing and communicating business strategies within B.C.’s fastest growing health authority.
You will provide advanced analytic services in projection modelling, capacity projection, predictive and prescriptive analysis to support the planning, evaluation, risk management, and strategic capacity initiatives for contracted services in Fraser Health. Also you will discover business risks and opportunities through the application of rigorous scientific methodology, statistics, algorithms, and utilization of system/operational engineering principles.
Your responsibilities will include to:
Provide advanced analytics services to support leaders in Fraser Health with viable alternatives for informed, strategic decision-making in contracted services and capacity planning, including system-wide gap analysis, predictive and prescriptive analysis, contract lifecycle management and risk management.
Provide a comprehensive diagnostic and business intelligence engineering support in contracted services by conducting process analysis, modelling and root cause analysis to identify business structural barriers, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement and investment.
Quantify impact of current state, modeling and assessing alternative solutions. Extracts necessary information from available databases, designs and conducts physical sampling where data is unavailable. Applies complex modeling and optimization techniques in the generation of solutions and recommends systems-wide business process improvement strategies. Develops measuring tools to monitor impact of applied solutions.
Provide mentorship, support and professional development to staff who are responsible for systems diagnostics and analysis at assigned functional area. Participate in the evaluation, design, and implementation of the tool set for measuring and monitoring system's performance and achievement of initiative benefits.
Maintain expertise and current knowledge on worldwide research regarding application of data analytic techniques within the healthcare sector by reviewing existing literature, liaising with related professional associations and/or educational institutions and/or participating in research projects.
Provide recommendations to the Manager regarding the assignment of staff and distribution of team resources within the assigned sites and/or assignment of staff at other sites, as needed.
Support the development and enhancement of data management and governance practices.
Participate and attends various meetings regarding business intelligence system efficiency as required; chairs and/or leads the discussion groups, as assigned.
You will bring master's degree in Management Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management or related field, plus five (5) to seven (7) years recent related experience, including two (2) years' experience in a consulting role with demonstrated experience in the application of process improvement techniques on large scale systems, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Valid BC Driver's Licence and access to personal vehicle for business related purposes.

job_title: Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada
job_description:
Mondelez International, Inc. empowers people to snack right in over 160 countries around the world. We’re leading the future of snacking with iconic brands such as Oreo, belVita and LU biscuits; Cadbury Dairy Milk, Milka and Toblerone chocolate; Sour Patch Kids candy and Trident gum. Our 90,000+ colleagues around the world are key to the success of our business. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are.
Join us on our mission to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.
Strategy, Insights & Analytics

Strategy is where you’ll help us develop plans to shape an exciting future for Mondelēz International. Working with our excellent team of strategy professionals, you’ll diagnose key business growth drivers, set strategic direction for the future, prioritize our growth initiatives, and partner with our business teams to implement our growth plans.
Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada
The Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis.
The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.
Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.
Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.

Responsibilities:
Statistical Modelling & Data Mining:
Develop a variety of forecasting models - marketing mix models, inventory management models, consumption and share forecasts.
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.
Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.
Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.
Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.
Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Corporate Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.
Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.
Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.
Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.

Analytic Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, statistical analysis, analytic research, business performance) into one report.
Strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

ContractCreate awesome experiences for our customers.
Join our team
We're a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company's digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.
TELUS Digital's mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com, and the My TELUS app.
Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.
Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!
Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital (https://www.telus.com/digital)
This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position.
Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together
Individuals with web development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of it's flavours) with an interest for analytics may apply for a position within TELUS Digital. The program is designed specifically for those who are passionate about analytics, curious about new technologies and interested in using data to shape the strategy of a large organization. This is a great entry path into the digital analytics and data science team at TELUS.
In this role, you will start with a 1-month training program on our data creation tools where you will learn technical skills, solve real problems designed to grow your business acumen, and collaborate with colleagues, leaders and industry experts. Following the initial training, you will take on more responsibilities and support one of our product teams with implementing analytics tools. Throughout the program, you will have access to a mentor who will guide you through day-to-day challenges as well as the ongoing development of your skills.
In this role, you will gain experience setting up analytics tools for our digital properties in order to collect user interaction data from multiple sources including web, app, voice assistants and wearables. Some of the tools you will learn about include Adobe Marketing Cloud (Dynamic Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager, Campaign), Ensighten, DOMO, Qualtrics and ClickTale.
Reporting into the Manager of Analytics & Insights, this position is accountable for implementation, continued integration and knowledge transfer of the Adobe product suite, specifically Adobe Analytics, across multiple TELUS Digital properties.
This is a full-time, renewable 1-year contract position.
Here's how
Ensuring that data flows smoothly from the website and app into our Adobe Analytics report suite
Support the development of internal processes and documentation governing all aspects of Adobe analytics tagging, implementation, QA and reporting, including continuous improvement of these processes.
Conduct regular audits of digital analytics implementation identifying recommendations to improve data structure and reporting
Work collaboratively with product teams to create valuable data that drives our insights and reporting. Communicate findings and recommendations in a professional, clear, and actionable manner, articulating next steps and recommendations to various audiences including executive level.
Manage quality assurance of all Adobe Analytics implementations and provide recommendations to provide insightful, best-in-class digital channels reports and dashboards, and adherence to service level agreements with lines of business, partners and the overall Digital team.
You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Relevant education in fields such as computer science, engineering or information management
Understanding of database structures, tables & basic SQL statements
Web development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of its flavours)
Ability to work independently and as a contributing member of the team
Passionate about analytics!

About TELUS Digital:
We want to work with people who:
Share our passion for all things digital
Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
View collaboration as essential to your work
Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
Embrace diversity and new ideas
What you can expect from us:
An environment where you're encouraged to share and act on your ideas
Flexible work hours in a central downtown location
A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code
A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks
A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing
Bonus points
Check out labs.telus.com/blog (https://labs.telus.com/blog)to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

TELUS is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.
We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process.

job_title: Records and Knowledge Management Coordinator (approx. 12 months)
job_description:
Temporary, ContractOur Procurement and Program Management division provides professional support and commercial advice to all parts of the organization through the services it provides, including procurement, data analytics, budgeting, and performance management. The Procurement office is a global leader among public sector entities in the procurement of large capital infrastructure projects. The Program Management office ensures consistency and synergy among the capital project cost estimation, budgeting and financial forecasting, quality, process control, continuous improvement, compliance and governance, reporting and analytics functions across the enterprise.
The Records & Knowledge Management Coordinator supports the development, implementation, and maintenance of an effective Document and Records Management (DRM) program. In addition, the Coordinator manages document and records management system and ensure proper retention and disposal of records, and supports the ongoing development and implementation of knowledge management best practices.
We are currently looking for a Records & Knowledge Management Coordinator with a college or post-graduate diploma or experience that would be considered equivalent. Demonstrated knowledge of records management principles, practices, methods and techniques are essential to this role.
To succeed in this role, the Records & Knowledge Management Coordinator should have a minimum of three years experience in a formal file room, archivist, law firm, library or other records-intensive environment. Experience with document and/or content management software or equivalent experience in complex electronic filing systems environments is required. Experience in a law firm environment or a public procuring authority with a role in assembling, issuing and tracking a large number of complex procurement documents is an asset. Experience in drafting user manuals and documenting business processes would be an asset.
This role will require demonstrated ability to communicate complex, non-linear concepts in a systematic, organized and linear manner. Extremely strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast paced environment. Good oral and written communication skills and ability to provide technical training to staff. Demonstrated ability to manage client expectations in application of policies, standards and business processes. Demonstrated interpersonal and relationship building skills to effectively partner with business units, staff, and external service providers. Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to build and maintain positive working relationships and work in a team-based environment. Proficient in the Microsoft Office suite of products is required.
If you meet the above requirements and are a self-starter able to manage multiple priorities and work within the complexity of an evolving organization, this opportunity is for you.
Infrastructure Ontario is an inclusive employer, we encourage applications from all qualified candidates. We will accommodate your needs under the Ontario Human Rights Code. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
By submitting your application you are granting Infrastructure Ontario permission to process your personal data during the recruitment process and for keeping records of the process. Infrastructure Ontario may share your personal data internally to appropriate persons involved in the recruitment process and to third parties where there is an administrative or lawful basis for doing so. Provided that Infrastructure Ontario does not have any lawful reason to continue processing your personal data, you may make a formal request to rectify, erase or restrict (the processing of) your personal data.

Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills

Detail-oriented
Ability to handle multiple priorities against multiple deadlines

$97,190 a yearManages BI and analytics solutions and service delivery for business clients across the TransLink enterprise to enable business strategies and objectives. Leads the team and drives towards DevOps product/service delivery model, including grow the skillsets of the team, empower the employees and drive the change in practice, mindset and culture.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Supports the Director and Senior Manager in forming and executing the strategy and roadmap for enterprise Business intelligence and analytics solutions, in alignment with overall BTS strategy and business plans, using Data Warehousing, Reporting, Data Analytics and other Business Intelligence technologies.

Drives and enhances BI and Analytics service delivery through continuous innovation, Agile/DevOps adoption and product management practice. Provides technical leadership on the enhancement and maturity of BI analytics practices and policies, including data quality management, data governance, data architecture, data warehouse and infrastructure, BI & Analytics end user tools in line with best practice and practical experience of continuous improvement.

Manages one or more BI and Analytics teams to design, develop, deploy, operate and evolve highly reliable, resilient and scalable BI solutions with a focus on data quality and business insight in supporting data driven decision making and enhancing end user experience. Defines and develops BI product development process. Ensures product delivery meets established standards and service level agreement.

Builds partnerships with Business Leaders/Product Owners at various levels to guide strategic decision making and influence how BI applications/solutions can enable new sources of value. Provides customer-centric advice and services in assessing evolving business requirement, shaping and prioritizing BI and analytics needs, developing and delivering solutions.

Fosters collaboration and develops highly responsive working relationship with cross functional IT teams.

Develops and implements necessary controls to identify and mitigate risks where appropriate, alerting the Senior Manager and Director on high risk issues as they emerge, and recommending corrective action.

Manages a team of highly skilled IT professionals including selection, training, coaching, development, performance management and all other people management practices.

Qualifications
Education & Experience:

The requirements for this job are acquired through a bachelor’s degree in Computing science, Computer Systems Engineering or Software Engineering, plus 8 years of recent related experience in leading the design, development and implementation of highly scalable and robust BI and Analytics solutions, including 4 years’ experience on a management level.

Expert knowledge of the principles, concepts, practices and technologies of Agile/DevOps. Certified Scrum Master, Agile Certified Practitioner or similar certification would be an asset.

Expert knowledge in data warehousing, BI systems and processes, quantitative analytical methods, ETL processes and data management practices

Superior business acumen and technical knowledge of software development lifecycle, cloud architecture and distributed systems. Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs.

Advanced interpersonal skills, including relationship building, advising, consulting, influencing, conflict resolution and presentation/facilitation skills.
Advanced communication skills to communicate technical concepts to nontechnical people to enhance understanding and drive decisions that lead to positive outcomes.

Advanced problem solving and decision-making skills to identify and address roadblocks and critical issues that would impact business process transformation and project deliverables.

Advanced ability to lead and advise a large team of diverse technical and business project resources.

Why join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectivesLead the design of dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights and opportunitiesDevelop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of our customer and tenant behavior across multiple asset classesLeverage and integrate disparate data sources and technologies working alongside IT and other stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies and improve data quality and accessDevelop a solution / framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who are looking to utilize Tableau and/or data visualizationIdentifying opportunities for continuous improvement and autmation of tasks within our real estate platformDeveloping best-in-class Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methodologies combined with best-in-class Analytics & Insights scalable for a dynamic, innovative deliverables
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingHave a background in quantitative predictive modelling and a Master’s degree in Spatial Analysis and/or Data AnalyticsOver 10 years of experience in an analytical role driving customer insightsProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)Proficient using analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL)Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesHave successfully lead the development of data insights within an organizationMust be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player with an intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining for insights

ContractHuman Services - Strategic Initiatives

Are you an expert at data mining and pattern analysis? Instead of getting people to click more ads – you could be helping families find affordable housing by identifying demand/supply drivers through data mining and pattern analysis, or optimizing housing stock!

Do you have a passion for machine learning and predictive modelling? Don’t apply those skills to modelling stock option returns for banks when you could help predict what program options might best help real people find stable employment!

Is the challenge of working with unstructured data something you can’t get enough of? Why waste your time building recommendation engines to guess what people might want to buy next when you could help reduce poverty and homelessness by modeling risk factors from voice, text and video data!

The Role...
In this role you will help drive the Region forward to implement advanced analytics across a broad range of programs and services designed to help people live and thrive in a large and growing community. Communities are highly complex systems, with highly complex problems – something that requires creative, innovative and data driven problem solving. You could submit the same resume for your next job as everyone else, or, you could submit this experience and see if it makes you stand out from the crowd.

The Advisor oversees and directs the planning, development, execution, communication and implementation of key Human Services data analysis work related to data management, advanced analysis, governance and integration in a multi-program, multi-sector human services environment.

Responsibilities:
Works within the Business Intelligence and Research team within Human Services to oversee and guide assigned projects involving highly technical and complex quantitative/analytical solutions and algorithms
Develops sophisticated data mining techniques to analyze historical data in order to discover trends, patterns and validate existing processes
Provides expert level direction and guidance on the development and application of computational methods, mathematical and statistical modelling, statistical analysis and data visualization (conventional, web-based and interactive)
Designs data visualization and interactive tools to make large datasets coherent
Directs and guides functional data management in areas such as data access/security, MFIPPA compliance, data structure, data cleansing and data integration
Provides direct coaching and technical support to the Analyst and Specialist roles to build technical competency/skill as related to the work
Establishes data sharing agreements, manages and coordinates access to specialized data sets via other Human Services areas as well as with external partners
Builds and develops relationships with other Regional client groups to ensure solutions align with the Enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) Strategy and help achieve the objectives in the Integrated Planning Framework
Consults with Regional client groups in order to determine, document and prioritize client needs, develop business cases, implement projects and communicate findings
Communicates with management and various stakeholders regarding findings, measurement, reporting and evaluation of options
Qualifications:
Master’s degree with minimum 5 - 8 years’ experience in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Actuarial Science or Data Science related discipline
3 -5 years’ of work experience related to a minimum of three of the following subject areas: predictive modelling, network analysis, spatial analysis, machine learning, fraud detection algorithms, mathematical optimization and/or behaviour modelling
Extensive experience with statistical software packages such as SPSS, STATA, R
Expertise and experience assembling a blend of classical and advanced techniques such as artificial intelligence, pattern recognition, databases, traditional statistics and graphics tools to identify relationships, correlations, trends and patterns found within structured and unstructured data
Advanced skills in structural equation modeling, generating decision trees, cluster analysis, text analytics, and data visualization
Advanced knowledge in 2 or more programming languages is required
Experience with data visualization tools including open source and commercial packages and libraries, as well as the ability to create custom visualizations using combinations of linked tools
Expert knowledge of BI concepts and data mining techniques e.g. associations discovery, sequential pattern discovery, classification, clustering and forecasting
Proficient in use of MS office tools, specifically within Excel and Access
Advanced knowledge and experience with creation of databases and developing queries including SQL is required
Public sector experience in support of diverse programs and services is preferred.
Professional designations including Certified Analytics Professional, Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP), Certified Business Intelligence professional (CBIP) are considered to be an asset

Toronto, ONReporting to the VP Head of Data & Analytics Transformation, you'll be part of the Enterprise Data and AI (EDAI) team who's goal is to harness the power of Data, Analytics & AI to create a competitive advantage and accelerate growth across lines of business and corporate areas for the bank.

Identify opportunities to apply advanced data mining and wrangling techniques, machine learning, graph, optimization, automation and other techniques as warranted

Facility/Property Management

Summary of BGIS

BGIS, A Brookfield Company, is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the Analytics West team, you will be engaged and ready to support the Senior Manager, Strategic Information with data collection, data mining and analysis tasks, and will support data managers and analysts.

The Analytics team’s role is to address complex business problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques. Artificial Intelligence is a rapidly expanding field which is critical in enabling companies to remain competitive, or to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Strategic Information and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models. A sample project may be supporting equipment behaviour overtime through work order analysis and predicting equipment failure. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the field of Data Science/Artificial Intelligence/Analytics post-graduation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Acquire data from internal and external sources
Extract, transform and clean data from internal data systems and from external data sources, including sensor data
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on the data and identify areas for deeper investigation using tools which can handle larger data volumes (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Access etc.)
Data Engineering – adding value to collected data by engineering features
Provide input and recommendations on in-house data management/ data governance
Highlight process improvement areas to enhance team productivity
Develop analyses to understand opportunity areas for further exploration, for example
Create dashboards for disseminate information to business audiences using tools such as PowerBI or Tableau
Partner with the in-house IT team to develop data extraction queries
Support data managers and analysts with analytical tasks
Presenting findings and recommendations internally

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

DEPARTMENT SUMMARY:
The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.

ROLE PURPOSE:
The Manager, AML Strategy & Analytics reports to the Senior Manager, AML Strategy & Analytics and provides technical support for the FIU. The Manager, AML Strategy & Analytics is responsible for leading the AML Strategy & Analytics Team within the Tangerine FIU by developing, modifying, enhancing and maintaining technical solutions to help the FIU meet reporting requirements as well as managing the execution of the reviews for the FIU QA Program. The incumbent will inspire and motivate their team through coaching and development, and be responsible for driving improvements in productivity, decision effectiveness, and the customer experience.

ROLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Oversee the daily operations of the AML Strategy & Analytics team in support of the FIU.
Provide technical support to the FIU team including the business as usual maintenance of the transaction monitoring, name screening and case management systems.
Lead the ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions by following a disciplined change management process.
Lead analytics and reporting to generate accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and system volume.
Manage the FIU Quality Assurance Program
Operate as a liaison with internal and external business partners and represent the AML Strategy & Analytics team in cross functional initiatives.
Maintain a thorough understanding of FIU system capabilities, gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Lead the hiring and performance management of the AML Strategy & Analytics team.
Responsible for understanding and complying with the Regulatory Compliance Framework including the Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing and Sanctions Policy and all AML related policies, procedures and controls within the department.
Other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience
University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3-5 years of related work experience within Financial Services industry, including leadership experience
Minimum 3 years of experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
Experience in consumer banking products / credit / deposit and cards.
Professional Certification
ACAMs certification is considered an asset
Specialized Knowledge
Knowledge of AML/ATF requirements and systems and troubleshooting experience
Technical Skills
Strong analytical skills;
Strong technical solution management experience and skills
Proficiency in Microsoft office (Excel, PowerPoint ,Visio, etc.)
Coding language (VBA, SQL, etc.)
Abilities
Strong capability to work with senior business leaders
Ability to work autonomously under tight timelines
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where processes and procedures are consistently refined
Attributes
Strong verbal written and communication skills
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
WORKING CONDITIONS:
The Manager of AML Strategy & Analytics will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.

DIRECT REPORTS:
Yes.

DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION:
Tangerine will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental disabilities of an otherwise qualified employee or applicant for employment, unless undue hardship to Tangerine would result. Any applicant or employee who requires accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of a job should contact Human Resources or his or her supervisor.

MANAGING RISK:
All members of the Tangerine Team are responsible for managing risk and compliance within their departments. As such, employees should maintain and demonstrate the highest standards of integrity and ethical conduct in accordance with Tangerine policies, guidelines and directions.

Toronto, ONLeadership Development Program - For Recent University Graduates

ABOUT ADP
With over 610,000 clients worldwide, nearly USD 17 billion in annual revenues and a track record of focusing on our customers, ADP is one of the largest Human Capital Management companies in the world. We are transforming the way millions of people approach and view.
We are the leading provider of cloud based HR solutions that unite payroll, talent, benefits, time and attendance and tax. We provide managed or outsourced services to all of our customers and provide leading edge analytics and compliance know how that ensures all of our customers benefit from our deep expertise.
Be You. Be Great.
At ADP we are driven by your success. The future of our company depends on hiring and developing people who can make a difference here. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.

Overview:

ADP is looking for recent graduates to join a new 18-month leadership development program (LDP). This rotational program gives you training and experience across different roles, and professional and personal growth opportunities.
The LDP offers you the opportunity to be trained and mentored in the Technology industry, with an organization that is proud of its longtime commitment to customer service. Working within various teams in different departments across Service Delivery, you will be immersed in strategic meetings, project launches, data analysis, customer interaction and much more. Upon successful completion of the program you will be guided to a role based upon your strengths, interest, aptitude and ADP's need within the Service Delivery organization. Locations include Montreal, Toronto and Halifax.

POSITION SUMMARY

The program consists of an eighteen-month rotational assignment that provides solid experience in some of the following disciplines:
Strategy
Leadership
Business operations
Process improvement
Client account management


How You Will Contribute - The responsibilities will vary depending on the department needs; however, will include the following:

Work independently, and within a collaborative team environment, on various projects
Establish priorities, and use strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to add value to each initiative, project, or team to which you are assigned
Researching, analyzing, preparing reports and presenting findings to senior management
Networking and seeking feedback from leaders throughout the organization

Toronto, ONThe opportunity


As an Experience Management (EM) Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the Canadian Experience Management team by creating reporting and commentary around deployment; entering and ensuring accuracy of data in our resource management system; supporting projects and initiatives in the Advisory practice and capacity management optimization. You will receive regular supervision on a day-to-day basis to set appropriate priorities.

Your key responsibilities

Act as a subject matter resource on Experience Management tools/enablers
Create routine reports using existing templates that show utilization performance, availability forecasts, and variances between actual and forecasted utilization
Create/maintain accurate client-serving profiles in EM systems (i.e. roster updates, new hire records, etc.)
Partner with Talent/HR on headcount reconciliation and with Learning & Development to ensure schedules accurately reflect learning assignments and maintain relevant reporting
Assist with deployment activities by conducting skill and bio/CV searches that focus on matching project need(s) with required skills, development opportunities and project risk
Assist with the creation/maintenance of accurate personnel and client project schedules
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively identify resources that will become available in short term (i.e. next 2-3 weeks)
Partner with deployment EMs to proactively monitor and highlight unassigned resources in order to minimize unassigned time
Demonstrate effective teaming with Canadian EM team by proactively/creatively responding to analytics requests
Participate in ad hoc projects as required (i.e. task forces, reporting, process improvement committees, training manuals etc)
Identify ways to improve Experience Management processes and contribute to EM team initiatives
Participate in the orientation of new hires by providing an overview of the Experience Management function and operating model
Partner with the Talent Team (i.e. HR) on Performance Management initiatives
Actively support Experience Management and EYU enablers including Retain/ARMS; My Competencies; EY Discover; Mercury, etc.
Work with peers across the Americas Advisory EM by contributing to EM priorities; task forces; and/or projects


Skills and attributes for success
The individual in this role must have strong reporting, deployment and collaborative attributes.
To qualify for the role you must have

1-3 years of experience in a professional services firm desirable
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Proficient in other Microsoft applications
Strong analytical skills, with attention to detail
English language skills - very strong written and verbal communication
French language skills a plus
Proven client service focus, with an ability to resolve issues quickly, with a sense of urgency
Strong problem-solving skills
Flexible in adapting to constantly changing priorities
Outstanding teamwork and interpersonal skills
Confident at working independently and a self-starter
Adept at handling multiple tasks with strong organizational skills
What working at EY offers


At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY


As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work and with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Make your mark. Apply today.

Manager, Forecasting & Device Pricing

In this high profile role, the Manager, Forecasting & Device Pricing of will be responsible for the management of Enterprise COA/COR rates, device pricing, and device forecasting.

The successful candidate will have excellent forecasting acumen and work well cross-functionally with Enterprise Wireless Product, Finance, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Consumer Wireless.

What you will be doing:
Manage Device Demand Planning forecasting for all Enterprise Wireless segments (Small Business, Corporately Liable, Individually Liable, Midmarket)
Develop forecasts / forecasting models for (by device type/model, segment) to support RCI device demand planning
Communicate cross-functionally to understand and influence offers/tactics impacting device demand
Develop and maintain reporting required to monitor the performance of device sales & mixes to support device forecast & inventory ordering/management.
Present forecast materials that are accurate, reasonable, and completed in a timely manner to partners such as Device Management, Finance, Marketing & Sales, EBU leadership
Define and develop EBU device pricing strategy consistent with Enterprise objectives and competitive landscape
Maintain and evolve device pricing & offers for Corporately Paid, Custom IDV
Create and evolve device pricing constructs for Midmarket and Small Business segments
Commercialization of new device programs with innovative pricing constructs and incentives
Develop business rationale and associated plans for monthly forecasts and annual budget
Enhance governance and processes
Analyze device consumption behaviour and perform due diligence in reserving devices to manage obsolescence risk
Establish processes / guidelines for pricing approval of Strategic clients
Support complex deals for strategic account opportunities as an expert on hardware economics
Perform ad hoc projects as required

What you bring:
Degree or qualification in Business, Economics and Finance. A professional financial qualification is a strong asset.
Strong analytical, financial modelling skills
Self-starter with the ability to quickly learn and understand concepts, investigate issues, promote efficiency/automation, make decisions, manage processes, and work independently with minimal supervision
Creative thinker with a strong ability to commercialize trends and organizational capabilities into programs
Excellent and proven analytical skills, exceptional problem solving skills with attention to detail
Proven ability to meet tight deadlines, and perform well in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Proven ability to exercise a high degree of business judgment and sound reasoning
Strong communication and interpersonal skills;
Expert proficiency with Excel, Strong proficiency in PowerPoint.
Knowledge of Access, SQL, SAS, or Thinkcell is an asset.
Technical aptitude with regard to wireless products and technologies

Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Marketing & Product Management
Requisition ID: 149967

POSITION OVERVIEW
We are looking for a skilled communications professional with a track record of producing engaging, creative, and innovative content to join our team as a Communications Specialist. The successful candidate will be an exceptional writer and storyteller who can research, write, package and distribute compelling content appropriate for traditional and digital channels.

Based in our Calgary office and reporting to the Director of Marketing, the Communications Specialist will be equal parts investigative journalist and digital marketer. Working closely with the Marketing, Lead Generation, and Sales teams, this role will help position the organization as an industry leader, attract quality leads, and achieve annual sales targets.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop and implement an annual editorial calendar that promotes the brand narrative across multiple channels
Monitor key industry issues and stay current on product development, industry trends, and issues affect FBC Members and their businesses.
Develop content for blogs, whitepapers and other web material, social media posts, video channels, webinars, email campaigns, e-newsletters, online advertisements, presentations, news releases, and other general communications needs using a variety of media and channels.
Develop, communicate and execute content plans and social campaigns
Identify, research, write, package and distribute stories that support lead generation, sales, thought leadership, and Member engagement targets.
Develop and implement an annual editorial calendar that promotes the brand narrative across multiple channels
Manage the corporate website and other digital assets to optimize the in-bound sales funnel.
Develop content for blogs, whitepapers and other web material, social media posts, video channels, webinars, email campaigns, e-newsletters, online advertisements, presentations, news releases, and other general communications needs using a variety of media and channels.
Manage researching, fact-checking, writing, editing and proofing of digital and print materials on deadline.
