Important messages
INVENTORY - When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an INVENTORY for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/gc-jobs/information-candidates/accommodations.html
How can you apply?

You need to provide a résumé; no cover letter necessary.
AND
Answer screening questions online.
The information you provide in the screening questions must be true. Simply saying you have the required qualifications or listing your current duties is not enough. Instead, provide concrete and detailed examples that clearly explain where, when, and how you gained the experience. We can’t make any assumptions about your experience. We’ll only use your résumé as a secondary source of information.

This is an inventory of potential candidates to fill upcoming employment opportunities at the PM-04 level within the Financing, Administration and Management System Unit (FAMS), First Nations and Inuit Health Branch at Indigenous Services Canada, Quebec Region.

The first pull of candidate applications could happen as early as November 2018.

The inventory will be updated every 120 days. You will receive a notice in your applicant account 10 days before the end of your active period to determine whether or not you wish to keep being considered for an additional 120 days.
Duties
Playing a key role in a dynamic team, you will be responsible for the analysis of business needs, the development and implementation of process and tools at national level and participate in several creative and innovative projects.
Work environment
The Financing, Administration, and Management Systems (FAMS) sector is characterized by its program delivery support role, particularly in terms of the administration and financial management of contribution agreements. FAMS also plays a role in reviewing business processes to optimize services to indigenous communities. The sub-sector Management Systems is responsible for process analysis, database management and collaboration tools as well as the implementation of projects that facilitate the collection of health data.
Intent of the process
This process may be used to establish a pool of qualified candidates which may be used to staff positions various tenures such as indeterminate, term and casual positions within the FAMS Unit, First Nations and Inuit Health Branch, Indigenous Services Canada, Quebec Region. Should the selected candidate already be a public servant, the pool could also be used for acting appointments.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or higher studies from a recognized post-secondary institution in a field related to the duties of the position.
Degree equivalency
Experience:

1. Experience in coordinating projects or programs.
2. Experience in formulating recommendations to management.
3. Experience in revising or following up on financial and activity reports for projects or programs.
4. Experience in the coordination of committees or working groups.
5. Experience in computerized management of databases including construction, validation and interpretation of data.
6. Experience in the improvement of operational efficiency (ex: development of performance indicators, development of new business processes, etc).
7. Experience in business intelligence. (ex: process mapping, business needs analysis, operational efficiency, etc).
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Bilingual - Imperative (BBB/BBB)
Information on language requirements
Knowledge:

Knowledge of the technical environment of relational databases and/or information systems.
Competencies:

1. Communication (oral and written)
2. Thinking things through
3. Working effectively with others
4. Focus on Service
5. Aboriginal cultural competency
6. Ability to work effectively with First Nations, Inuit or Metis
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

Experience in the creation, modification and/or management of SharePoint sites or with MS Power BI tools.
Selection may be limited to members of the following Employment Equity groups: Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women
Information on employment equity
ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS

Be a member of an employment equity group.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS

Willingness to work overtime on occasion. (Applicable to some positions)
Willingness to adjust working hours on occasion. (Applicable to some positions)
Conditions of employment
Reliability Status security clearance
OTHER CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Available to travel occasionally within Quebec and/or Canada.
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the targeted groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
All communication throughout the entire staffing process, including email correspondence may be used in the assessment of qualifications.

Based on the hiring division’s needs, additional essential qualifications, asset qualifications, organizational needs, operational requirements and/or conditions of employment may be identified and applied during the assessment and/or selection of candidates.

To manage the volume of applications, we may randomly select candidates from the inventory.

We will communicate with applicants by e-mail. It is your responsibility to verify your e-mails regularly to ensure that you do not miss out on any opportunities. Failure to respond in the prescribed timeframe will result in your application not being referred to the hiring manager. The applicant shall ensure that the e-mail address provided is valid, is functional at all times and accepts messages from unknown users.

You may be assessed using a variety of tools (e.g., online tests, written examinations, interviews, simulations, presentations, reference checks, etc.)

Candidates from outside the public service may be required to pay for travel and relocation costs associated with this selection process.

Proof of citizenship will be requested if you are considered for a position.

Proof of education may be requested if you are considered for a position.

Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca/

All job applications must be submitted ONLY ONLINE through the Public Service Resourcing System. Persons with disabilities who cannot apply online are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order.

Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
Calgary, ABAbout Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Managing the organization design of your product group, owning team budget, reporting processes, hiring, performance coaching and the support processes needed to execute on the Product vision.
Championing your Product group's strategic vision and ability to execute to our users, throughout the company and to our external stakeholders.

Experience building and supporting large cross-functional, global teams
Experience with logistics within a technology driven environment.
Experience working within a global focused environment will an asset.
Deep understanding of the skills required to build a successful technology delivery team, including (but not limited to) UX research methods, data analytics, agile software delivery and release management

job_title: Immigration Support Specialist – Reporting and Analytics
job_description:
The opportunity

As an Immigration Support Specialist – Reporting/Analytics you will be very closely aligned to the US Business Immigration team within EY’s Global Immigration network. This network provides a range of business immigration legal services to multinational clients, whose employees are required to work in locations where they require work authorization from local authorities. EY Law LLP’s immigration team focuses on assisting clients with Canadian and US immigration legal advice and compliance.

Your key responsibilities


The role of Immigration Support Specialist – Reporting/Analytics involves day-to-day support to client teams with all aspects of reporting and data analytics for Canadian, US and Global immigration accounts. The individual in this role will support the development and implementation of standardized analytics across the practice.

The individual in this role must have a very good grasp of technology used for producing reports and statistics, in addition to strong organizational skills. Key responsibilities include:

Creating and maintaining standard reporting functionality
Understanding customer requirements for new report requests, and advising on best practice approaches to report development
Gathering and preparing data from multiple sources to support information analytics
Managing ongoing technology projects within the Immigration practice
Creating and preparing compliance/engagement related reports
Providing ad hoc support to team members when working on projects, document production, etc.
Build and own reporting processes and procedures
Train and educate others (both clients and team) on the methods and value of reporting
General administrative tasks as needed


Skills and attributes for success

Analytical skills to consolidate disparate information and apply to a directed strategy
Excellent organizational skills and project management skills
Verbal communication skills
Proven writing skills, including the ability to present information in a clear and organized manner
High attention to detail

To qualify for the role you must have


Extensive reporting experience including knowledge of process and data usage. Knowledge of standard metrics and key performance indicators.
Experience with visualization tools such as SAP Cloud Analytics, Business Objects, Power BI, Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence
Ideally you will have technical experience in MS SharePoint – SSRS, SQL, and technical knowledge for report production. Advanced Excel skills required such as vba, automation, power pivot, power query, interaction with SQL, programmability.
Ability to build strong working relationships with diverse client base, including senior leadership
Experience with Python will be an asset


Ideally you will also have

An advisory or consulting background
Experience in a legal environment


What we look for

We’re interested in strong team players who support their colleagues in reaching their goals while also considering their own workload and development. If you have the confidence to speak up and influence a team that affects big businesses worldwide, this role is for you.

What working at EY offers


At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY


As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. Recognized as one of Canada's top employers, EY continually strives to be a great place to work and with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Make your mark. Apply today.


EY is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Mississauga, ONPosition Summary
Responsible for managing forecasting and promotional spend for assigned accounts to ensure the division is on track to achieve targets. The candidate will work closely with Product Marketing, Sales and Supply Chain functions to complete PSI simulations, promotion proposals, ROI analysis, product launches, budget requests, and to collect market intelligence to build a competitive analysis to drive business decisions.
Role and Responsibilities
Weekly Checkbook management by Channel to proactively review forecast, budgeting, promotional activities, flyer plans, ROI analysis, run rate analysis, etc to optimize sell-out.
Spending accrual management by channel for optimal sales/promotion planning managed through CORES system. Helping drive profit through high ROI activities. Contribute to Quarterly Business Review with simulated following quarter P/L.
Weekly competitive intelligence gathering at account level. Ex: pricing execution, run rate by model, promotional execution, and competitive intelligence/execution. To feed intelligence back to division for contingency promotion planning and to maintain competitiveness in the channels.
Weekly PSI meetings to ensure accurate demand planning. Forecast review to proactively monitor run rates and spending plans.
Management of regional SPIFF program to drive regional market growth. Ensuring our SPIFFS are at maximum competitiveness and within budget. Gathering market intelligence and sharing within the division to ensure there is a focused strategy with attention on profit driving activities.
Other duties as required.
Skills and Qualifications
Advanced Microsoft office skills. Proficient in excel, access and powerpoint
Fundamental understanding of financial and accounting concepts
Detail Orientated and highly organized
Strong interpersonal skills

As a Project Management Coordinator on the Professional Services team, you will be essential in ensuring that Resolver’s services team can be as effective and successful as possible. You will work as the glue of the services organization by championing data consistency and project accountability across the department.
You’ll identify gaps in key metrics, own the team’s revenue recognition process, improve the quality of project data, act as a project gatekeeper, and systematize process improvement, as well as internal initiatives.
Our ideal candidate has a passion for data analytics, systems and tools, with some understanding of professional services or Software as a Service.
Your Responsibilities
Data Analysis (40%)
Own data collection and identify process improvements to existing systems in the professional services department.
Work with team leads and consulting managers to identify and remediate gaps in key project metrics in our CRM (Salesforce), Intacct and PSA (Mavenlink) systems.
Identify at-risk projects using a data-driven approach from CRM and PSA datasets.
Identify and notify team leads of data quality issues in CRM and PSA systems on a weekly basis.
System Integration (15%)
Own the professional services systems and integrations to other tools (CRM & Accounting)
Work with system owners in Sales and Finance and ensure data consistency and accuracy occurs across all systems.
Work with finance on month-end revenue recognition processes.
Identify and build process improvements across systems.
Resource Management (30%)
Resource and assign projects to ensure optimal team members.
Proactively understand each team member’s skill set, while keeping their career aspirations in mind when resourcing.
Project Gate Keeping (15%)
Review project artifacts, deliverables and sign-offs across projects for completeness.
Your Background
2 years of work experience in software or technology, with a specific focus on industries that have enterprise/corporate buyers.
1 year of Salesforce experience or another related CRM system, ideally experience with implementation related efforts.
Experience with data modelling and data analysis
Post-Secondary degree is required.
About Us: Resolver
We believe in hard work and having fun while we work. We invest in our people, and we think big.
Great benefits: 100% paid by us for health, dental and vision on day one
Wellness/fitness reimbursement: we care about your health
Beverage benefits: coffee/tea/lattes…unlimited! How about beer o’clock?
Vacation: it’s generous…we want you to re-charge your batteries.
External learning budget: we want you to develop and grow
Office fun: our ping-pong, games night, and foodie bake-offs keep it fun!
Parental Leave: best-in-class top-up for new parents!
Resolver Protects What Matters™. Over 1,000 of the world’s largest organizations use our cloud software to protect their employees, customers, supply chain, brand and shareholders.
Interested?!
If you want to work in a highly collaborative environment and are committed to making a difference, we’d like to meet you. Click here to get the process rolling.
We truly appreciate all interest and will happily reply to qualified candidates.

Toronto, ONPermanentWhat is the opportunity?

The GRM Corporate Insurance Risk Team is responsible for providing advice and placement of RBC’s global insurance program and risk management activities.

The Manager’s primary purpose is to support the team in the effective execution of the corporate insurance risk management programs ensuring accuracy of analytics and insights for management decision making vis-à-vis claims experience. You will partner directly with the business to facilitate the implementation of the Corporate Insurance Risk Management coverage across all business platforms in the organization in relation to Property & Casualty claims. Additionally, this role supports the Senior Director with the facilitation of financial lines claims both internally and externally.

What will you do?
Support the strategy, culture and activities that enable the team to operate as an integrated organization. Support a culture of integrity and behaviors that align to RBC’s Code of Conduct and professional standards
Execute and maintain policies, standards, processes and tools for one or more corporate insurance risk management programs
Conduct research into areas of perceived elevated or emerging operational risk. Build detailed risk assessments and investigate risk events to assess for potential systemic weaknesses
Monitor large loss events/incidents as well as key risk indicator trends and provide analysis for a view of systemic issues and trends used for assessment of action plans
Provide subject matter expertise to support management to colleagues and management in understanding corporate insurance risk policies and procedures within a domain or event
Support the team in independent, thematic reviews and/or emerging risk assessments to increase awareness of risk exposure
Contribute to the production of risk dashboards and metrics to support the development of operational risk profiles /exposures. Support analysis and monitoring of claims environment information
Analyze and report on the results from corporate insurance risk program execution deliverables and outcomes

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
4+ years of experience in risk management (1LOD or 2LOD) or related field, knowledge of financial services products, processes, and regulatory environment
Experience working in a corporate risk management within a large mulit-national organization
Strong technical knowledge of property & casualty insurance include financial lines coverages. Previous claims management experience in a 1LOD or 2LOD role
Strong analytical mind-set and ability to leverage data across multiple internal and external sources
Proficient presentation skills and ability to pull together concise and effective presentations and dashboards

Nice-to-have:
College degree. Preferred Undergraduate degree, with a designation associated with risk management

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.

job_title: Human Resources Workforce Analytics - Contract 21 Months
job_description:
TemporaryJoin a financial group that’s as committed to your future as you are. At MUFG, we share a vision for our future, we share our successes, and we strive to bring out the best in each other in everything we do. As the 5th largest bank in the world, our diverse team is connected by a common ambition to create change for the better—from forging more dynamic career paths to driving progress in our communities, to continuously reshaping the standards of global financial services. Positive impact starts here; see the change you can make as we strive to become the world’s most trusted financial group.

MUFG is one of the world’s leading financial groups. With over 360 years of growing the financial health of the world’s greatest businesses, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) has a global network of 150,000 employees, with 1,800 offices and 300 entities in more than 50 countries. Our promise is simple. We serve our communities, foster economic growth and aim to become the preferred trusted financial advisers to our customers. Together, we have the unmatched expertise and global capabilities to meet the diversified needs of all our customers in the Americas and worldwide.

Job Description: Human Resource Workforce Analytics (21 months)

Job Summary

MUFG Canada is seeking a Human Resources Analyst to join its Human Resources team in Toronto. The Human Resources Analyst will support the delivery of HR services to our business groups by partnering with local, regional and global colleagues to identify and develop solutions based on business priorities and organizational analysis. The position requires an analytical, detail oriented, self-starter with an innate ability with HR systems and the curiosity to learn and develop new skills.

Major Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing and interpreting analysis from various human resource programs and initiatives
Provides technical, business, and analytical support in maintaining a high level of business intelligence for the department
Assists in HR Operations and administration including strategic planning, budgeting, record keeping, identification and implementation of initiatives/solutions to enhance efficiency and service and organization wide communications
Analyze and interpret data from HRIS to prepare analysis and strategic reports pertaining to headcount and budget
Manage and compile various analytics, reports, and operational assessments for HR in support of the business
Deliver quantitative analyses and advanced modeling that translates data into actionable insights
Develop and automate data and analytics solutions
Prepare presentation materials for HR Senior Management
Qualifications:
Post-secondary diploma in a related field of study at university or college level
Strong project management skills and be detail-oriented
The ability to work in a dynamic environment where work tasks vary and processes are changing
Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables, charts, formulas
Advance skills in preparing presentations in PowerPoint
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Enthusiastic, self-motivated, effective under pressure and willing to take personal responsibility/accountability
Experience driving metrics using an HRIS database
Notice: The above information on this job description has been described to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by incumbents. Other duties and responsibilities not specifically described may be assigned from time to time, consistent with knowledge, skills and abilities of the incumbent.

Company

Chartered in 1981 and assuming its current identity as MUFG Canada Branch, our Canadian Branch is the premier Asia-based global bank in its market. We serve local and Japanese clients from the Atlantic to the Pacific with financial expertise across a number of key industries such as oil and gas, pipelines, power generation, automotive, transportation, and telecom.

Toronto, ONOverview

Reporting to the Director of Asset Management, the Analyst of Asset Management is responsible for assisting in valuation of assets and the development, implementation, monitoring and maintenance of key performance metrics and analytical models for Centurion Asset Management Inc. | Centurion Property Associates Inc.

Responsibilities

Relationship Development

Develop and foster positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders including Third-Party Appraisers, Consultants, Mortgage Brokers, Lenders and Lawyers.

Fair Value

Work with Third-Party Appraisers and internal departments to conduct the quarterly fair value calculation for each fund. Verify abnormal variances and identify non-recurring incidences to produce a normalized income for the fair value calculation. Prepare the quarterly fair value variance spreadsheet for Management review. Develop calculation models for fair value as needed. Ensure that all deadlines and critical dates are met.

job_description:
Toronto, ONP&G Canada is looking for a full-time Media Analytics Market Operations Manager. This position requires a minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience in media analytics, media measurement, and media optimization.
What sets P&G Canada apart as an employer?

We aim to recruit, reward, and advance the best talent across Canada, and we are proud to promote primarily from within. Your responsibilities will increase over time, and along this path you will receive the training and coaching you need to succeed. That’s why we are recognized as one of the best companies to work for in Canada and globally.

The Position Will Focus On:

Media Measurement and Optimization to Improve Media Investment ROI
Audience Creation: Fueling insights, optimization, and measurement
Media Big Data: Leveraging data sets, data mining, and capability creation to grow brands.
Training and development plan: Learn P&G media end to end processes, terms, and foundational concepts. Includes application management support.

Skillset Required:
You must be a leader, a strategic thinker, and an excellent communicator. You are also someone who sets priorities, follows through on commitments, and understands how to analyze data to help drive decision making.

Specific qualifications include:
Familiarity with media and/or complex systems and tools inclusive of programmatic.
Strong data and analytic skills as evidenced by experience using: Excel (cross-tabbing, complex formula, visualization), JMP, KNIME, Spotfire/Tableau (can build and analyze), SQL, Python, Probability, Statistics, and Big data manipulation for purposes of attribution, predictive modeling, AI, etc.
Proven ability to deliver actionable insights from data.
Ability to manage projects independently and to pivot quickly as brand needs change/marketplace changes/consumer changes.
Can form hypotheses, run experiments, and provide business with data-based rationale to support recommendations that include measurement and optimization.
Service oriented mindset to deliver on needs of customers (brands).
Works well in teams.

This position is well-suited for someone with 3 to 5 years of professional work experience in media analytics, measurement, and optimization.

You will work as the glue of the services organization by championing data consistency and project accountability across the department.
You’ll identify gaps in key metrics, own the team’s revenue recognition process, improve the quality of project data, act as a project gatekeeper, and systematize process improvement, as well as internal initiatives.
Our ideal candidate has a passion for data analytics, systems and tools, with some understanding of professional services or Software as a Service.
Your Responsibilities
Data Analysis (40%)
Own data collection and identify process improvements to existing systems in the professional services department.
Work with team leads and consulting managers to identify and remediate gaps in key project metrics in our CRM (Salesforce), Intacct and PSA (Mavenlink) systems.
Identify at-risk projects using a data-driven approach from CRM and PSA datasets.
Identify and notify team leads of data quality issues in CRM and PSA systems on a weekly basis.
System Integration (15%)
Own the professional services systems and integrations to other tools (CRM & Accounting)
Work with system owners in Sales and Finance and ensure data consistency and accuracy occurs across all systems.
Work with finance on month-end revenue recognition processes.
Identify and build process improvements across systems.
Resource Management (30%)
Resource and assign projects to ensure optimal team members.
Proactively understand each team member’s skill set, while keeping their career aspirations in mind when resourcing.
Project Gate Keeping (15%)
Review project artifacts, deliverables and sign-offs across projects for completeness.
Your Background
2 years of work experience in software or technology, with a specific focus on industries that have enterprise/corporate buyers.
1 year of Salesforce experience or another related CRM system, ideally experience with implementation related efforts.
Experience with data modelling and data analysis
Post-Secondary degree is required.

Toronto, ONContractThe Opportunity:

We’re looking for an experienced Reporting and Analytics Specialist to be responsible for the collection, analysis, and communication of system and user data. Reporting to the VP Product, the ideal candidate will deliver concise, accurate, and timely insights that help us build the platform where healthcare professionals around the world learn from one another.
The scope of this role includes key performance indicator (KPI) reporting for senior leadership and business stakeholders; content consumption insights for Medical and Content teams; funnel conversion and lifetime value reporting for Marketing; user engagement and in-app behavior for Product Management and UX teams; as well as ad hoc analysis. This individual will work with both stakeholders and engineers to ensure that data is available when needed.

Responsibilities include:

Develop reporting strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze KPIs related to: application use, content consumption, function testing, funnel conversion, and lifetime value of a customer

Develop executive dashboards for each department lead to help them understand high-level daily, weekly, and monthly trends related to their area of specialty

Provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Technology, Medical, Content, and Marketing

Work closely with the reporting analyst in Business Development on data requirements, reporting formats, and consistency of metrics across teams

Proactively create path analysis reports to identify potential areas of improvement in the user experience and information architecture

Merge this data with other external data for a complete customer view in order to profile, segment, and optimize the user experience

Establish predictive analytics capabilities to explore data for strategic business advantage

Work with the Marketing department to help track conversion and ROI on digital marketing activities

Regularly conduct tagging audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of reports
Work on multiple, unrelated reporting and analytics requests simultaneously
Experience and skills:

Undergraduate degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years of reporting and analytics experience in digital environments – experience in healthcare environments preferred

Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategy skills
Highly proficient with leading web analytics tools such as Google Analytics as well as other analytics solutions such as Tableau and Looker

Strong SQL skills

Advanced Excel skills
Experience with SEO, SEM, PPC, social media, and mobile analytics
Keen understanding and experience developing multi-channel attribution models and analytics

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact with company leadership, business stakeholders, and technical team
Intellectual curiosity and a strong willingness to learn
Ability to synthesize information into succinct, concise, and logical summaries and reports
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver on multiple tasks to tight deadlines
Ability to take ownership and accountability

Who we are:

Figure 1 is the future of healthcare. Millions of healthcare professionals—as well as prominent institutions including Doctors Without Borders, BMJ, and Mount Sinai Health System—use our digital platform to share cases and help save lives with the largest active network of medical professionals in the world. And that’s just the beginning.

We’ve raised more than $20 million in financing from world-class venture capital firms including Union Square Ventures and Samsung Next. With this support, our team is tackling the trickiest problems in one of the world’s most complicated industries. In the words of Wired, “as Figure 1 grows, it has the potential to become global health’s central nervous system—improving diagnostics, care, and treatment for non-users everywhere.” We’re looking for the people who will make this vision a reality.

While we’re helping the world’s caregivers, we take care of our team with amenities like in-office yoga, lunch and learns, professional development including bi-weekly mentoring, and unlimited vacation.

Figure 1 is a diverse, inclusive, and open-minded workplace. Candidates who identify as a minority are encouraged to apply. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities, and accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or national origin.

Working at Figure 1 comes with:

Competitive salary

Extended healthcare benefits

Unlimited vacation

Paid parental leave

Stock options

In-house yoga, weekly cocktails/mocktails, field trips, and other activities

Opportunities for travel for conferences and professional development

Bi-weekly one-on-ones focused on mentorship

Lunch-and-Learns

The chance to help save lives and make the world a better place. Also, free snacks

Job location:

Downtown Toronto, near the subway

To be considered, please submit a resume and cover letter.

Skills:

Edmonton, ABCWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

You pride yourself on being detail oriented and analytical

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
About Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

$180,000 - $200,000 a yearSetting the strategic vision for your Product group for 6-24 months in the future
Leading multiple teams within your Product group, with a reporting line of Product team members, and overall group size of 30-60 people (product, software engineering, design)
Managing the organization design of your product group, owning team budget, reporting processes, hiring, performance coaching and the support processes needed to execute on the Product vision.
Championing your Product group's strategic vision and ability to execute to our users, throughout the company and to our external stakeholders.
Ten or more years of relevant experience delivering highly successful and innovative products or projects
Experience building and supporting large cross-functional, global teams
Experience with logistics within a technology driven environment.
Experience working within a global focused environment will an asset.
Deep understanding of the skills required to build a successful technology delivery team, including (but not limited to) UX research methods, data analytics, agile software delivery and release management

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. Job number: 2019-29355
Category: Account Management / Brokerage / Insurance
Location: Canada, ON, Toronto
3/18/2019 10:07:52

Why join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. Reporting to the Senior Director – Analytics, Insights & Innovation, you will lead our data analytics and customer insights program. In this role you will leverage your highly technical education and experience to ensure that we have the business intelligence warehouse, strategic data roadmap and visualization in place to drive success. In collaboration with your team of peers, you will drive outcomes by enabling data and analytics within the retail research, asset management, leasing, marketing and operations teams in addition to both internal and external stakeholders.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives
Lead the design of dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights and opportunities
Develop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of our customer and tenant behavior across multiple asset classes
Leverage and integrate disparate data sources and technologies working alongside IT and other stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies and improve data quality and access
Develop a solution / framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who are looking to utilize Tableau and/or data visualization
Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and autmation of tasks within our real estate platform
Developing best-in-class Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methodologies combined with best-in-class Analytics & Insights scalable for a dynamic, innovative deliverables

To succeed in this role, you:

Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.
Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environment
Driven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinking
Have a background in quantitative predictive modelling and a Master’s degree in Spatial Analysis and/or Data Analytics
Over 10 years of experience in an analytical role driving customer insights
Proficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)
Proficient using analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL)
Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologies
Have successfully lead the development of data insights within an organization
Must be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player with an intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining for insights

Our story:
OMERS is one of Canada’s leading pension funds. We invest over $85 billion for more than 470,000 plan members and their families. Our investment professionals use a direct-drive, active management strategy to invest in public and private markets from our offices in Toronto, New York, London and Sydney. We are committed to earning superior returns by attracting world-class investors and by building a culture of excellence.

Established in 1960, Oxford Properties Group is the real estate arm of OMERS, one of Canada’s largest pension funds with over $85 billion in assets. Today, Oxford is a global platform for real estate investment, development and management, with over 2,000 employees and over $45 billion of assets that it manages for OMERS and on behalf of its co-owners and investment partners. Headquartered in Toronto, Oxford has regional offices in Calgary, New York, Boston, Washington, DC, Singapore, Sydney and London, each with a team of talented professionals with deep real estate expertise and local market insight. For more information about us visit www.oxfordproperties.com.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. Diversity and Inclusion at OMERS means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities and perspectives as key elements of our culture. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise if you require accommodation.

ContractABOUT HOME EXPERIENCE
HomeX is building the future of Home Services.
Our unique service and technology platform has been engineered to make next generation experiences for both consumers and service providers come to life.
Reinventing our industry requires creating end-to-end solutions. This is why HomeX is combining a managed service network, a technology platform for providers and full service experiences for consumers. Together, these efforts put us in a unique position to deliver differentiated, fresh, simple and highly personalized solutions making dream experiences come true.
Founded in 2016 by industry veterans and headquartered in Chicago, HomeX (Home Experience LLC) is determined to be a positive force and help the industry evolve from the inside, creating, for the first time, value and magical experiences for customers and service providers nationwide.
Requirements
ABOUT THE JOB
HomeX is seeking multi-faceted, customer-obsessed, analytical Product Management MBA Interns to join the HomeX Product & Design team based out of Toronto, ON.
Key responsibilities include:
Ideate: Partnering with design and business stakeholders to narrow in on the problems and goals that will define HomeX in the market.
Design & Define: Craft concepts and validate through analytical thinking, justifying decisions through intuition and/or teeing up stimuli and hypothesis to validate via research.
Execute: Work with the design and engineering teams to build intuitive and stable products by articulating use cases and user stories, and clearly communicate priorities..
Launch: With business stakeholders, drive go-to-market strategy and new product launches from start to finish.
Analyze: Leverage business case modeling, AB testing, and product and business analytics to deep dive into the performance of your products, with an eye towards continuous improvement on key product and experience metrics.
Product Leadership: While this is an individual contributor role with no direct reports, you are expected to inspire the product & design team to do their best work and provide leadership and mentorship.
Voice of the Customer: Establish a deep understanding of our customer and their needs, evolving your product intuition and the HomeX product the more you learn.
About You
The right candidate for this role is always looking to push the envelope in creating differentiated experiences, while also being dedicated to operational excellence to ensure we can deliver. We’re looking for someone who can help us transform an industry.
A PM Athlete: Be a jack-of-all trades who can inspire and lead cross-functional teams of creatives, engineers, analysts, and data scientists toward a common vision and roadmap.
Empathetic: Be able to put yourself in the customer's’ shoes. Understanding their needs, mindset, and pain points is the foundation of creating a UX and a business that they will be happy to return to again and again.
Team-Oriented: You excel at collaborating across the company, including with Business, Marketing, and Engineering teams as well as your fellow PMs and Designers.
A Believer: You understand that technology can simplify, delight and enhance our lives and hope to build transformative innovation as your career.
A Thought Leader: You bring unique industry experience to push our thinking and strive to be in the know of the latest and greatest tools of the trade.
Startup Mentality: You thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity environment where you balance multiple projects and can prioritize your work both short and long term.
Driven: You are motivated to achieve success both at work and in your personal life.
Forward-Thinking: You are constantly looking for new and better ways to do things. You also follow trends in the market with an interest in what might come next.
Courageous: You think big and aren’t afraid to fail.
Key qualifications:
Ability to complete 10 or 12 week summer internship based out of our Toronto office (no housing stipend available)
Currently enrolled in a Master’s degree program (MBA preferred)
Professional track record with demonstrated value creation for customer/business
Experience leading entrepreneurial efforts, collaborating with cross-functional teams and project management to drive ideas forward.
A passion for the HomeX mission
Preferred qualifications:
Experience in building consumer and/or B2B products
Relevant experience in one of the following: User Experience/Design/Research, AI or industry knowledge of home services
Our Productivity Stack
Proficiency in the following technologies is desired:
Pivotal Tracker
Sketch
InVision
Tableau
Microsoft Excel & Powerpoint
G Suite
Slack
Benefits
Why Work With Us?
How many chances will you get to impact an entire, massive industry by building something from the ground up? Working at HomeX means collaborating with experienced, people-first leaders with a clear vision and a track record of success, and the close-knit camaraderie of a team of highly talented and motivated coworkers. It also means working in a fun and positive working environment - we encourage our employees to balance productivity with the need to recharge the batteries. And of course, you get paid pretty well - we offer competitive compensation packages, including performance-based incentives and full health care benefits for full time employees.
We do not sponsor relocation or housing for summer roles.
HomeX values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. If you request accommodation, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

job_title: Sr. Analyst, Store Operations and Labour Analytics
job_description:
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Role Mandate:

We are looking for a talented and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our Store Operations & Labour Analytics team. You will be working with various stakeholders to understand their operations, data structures, and analytical requirements to enable data driven insights. This role will require you to utilize your analytical skill set to identify opportunities to improve store P&L, service model, productivity and colleague engagement. More so, you will be partnering with and provide support to store colleagues, specialist teams, and regional store operations management teams.
Accountabilities:
 
Summarize vast amounts of in-store and operational data to develop reports and models to solve business problems;
 
Analyze reports to identify opportunities to better manage cost, improve store department schedules and best practices within the labour system;
 
Support the Store Operations Team/Labour Engineers in identifying and resolving business risks;
 
Evaluate new data sources and help define more effective ways to communicate data with our business users;
 
Working with our IT and BI teams to create data processes that are accurate, consistent and efficient to process large amount of data quickly to meet reporting needs;
 
Write SQL to efficiently retrieve information from business data sources to support different kinds of reporting needs;
 
Use SAS to manage large datasets, perform ad hoc analytics, and build predictive models;
 
Stakeholder management: Engage with key stakeholders within store operations to ensure their reporting and analytics needs are fulfilled.
Role Requirements:
 
Post-Secondary education in Mathematics, Business, Computer Science or Statistics;
 
Exceptional analytical skills and proven capability to drive insights from data and analytics;
 
Ability to independently deal with relevant analytical and BI tools (SAS, MicroStrategy, BOXI, Excel, etc);
 
Proficient in SQL - query optimization and syntax knowledge;
 
Ability to self-organize multiple tasks well and to complete them on time with a clear focus on quantitative results;
 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
 
Willingness to work well in a fast-paced team environment;
 
Ability to “think outside the box”.

How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager of Strategic Analytics and Forecasting, the Assistant Manager, Strategic Analytics & Forecasting will be a key contributing member of the Sales Strategy team. The ideal candidate will collaborate with sales, marketing, finance, and supply chain with a focus on data insights and analytics, trends, sales forecasting and program reviews, to collectively achieve Canopy Growth’s sales strategy and vision.

Responsibilities

Support the Manager, Strategic Analytics and Forecasting in all Integrated Business Planning functions including:
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to aggregate and understand forecast inputs for bi-weekly IBP meetings.
Liaise with the sales team and synthesize inputs from our CRM system.
Work with Innovation and Marketing teams to support forecasting of new innovations.
Acting as key support function for the Retail Operations team on cannabis business results and product supply.
Monitor and measure sales activity and market data; providing weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reviews to management.
Maintain and analyze competitive market information through consistent data collection and analysis of various POS data systems.
Responsible for the timely retrieval, processing, forecasting and analysis of business results and sales trends.
Work closely with the Sales, Marketing and Operations teams to provide insights into business performance and areas for improvement.
Provide Provincial Sales Managers with ad hoc, weekly, monthly, and bi-monthly reporting.
Develop and maintain retail data sources for analytical support to the commercial organization.
Provide insights related to shipment /consumption/inventory in the market and implications to the forecast.

Experience and Background

Undergraduate degree in Business, Economics, Statistics/Engineering, or a related discipline.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in an insights/analytics function providing actionable insights to internal or external clients
Proven experience in forecasting consumption, revenue and sizing the market for existing portfolio and innovation launches
Experience dealing with multiple sources of internal/external, structured/unstructured data
Advanced user of MS office suit (excel: Pivot Tables, Macros, VBA) and SQL
Hands-on proficient experience with visualization tools such as Tableau is considered an asset
Knowledge about promotional landscape and promotional optimization techniques.
Knowledge of trade investment optimization techniques.
Experience in Retail/CPG/Alcohol industry is considered an asset

Other Details

This a full-time position based out of Toronto.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

Job Description

As a Solution Architect for Analytics/Business Intelligence you will be responsible to lead the design of solutions for customers in by participating in all phases of the solution life cycle. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual, who can work under dynamic conditions and can foster productive relationships with a diverse customer and partner group. You will focus on:

Proven ability to engage customers at all levels to understand customer challenges and needs to develop technical solutions
Strong delivery experience of complex BI solutions
Depth of understanding in best practices of BI architectures and processes
Proven experience architecting all levels and areas of the solutions
Proven experience of architecting Azure products into a solution platform for Analytics
Experience using Power BI for dashboards and reporting
Hands on development experience (minimum 7 years)
Strong experience in projects requiring integration and customization
Experience or desire to coach, mentor and provide leadership to resources
Prior Project management experience is a definitive asset

Qualifications

Post-secondary degree/diploma in Business, Computer Science or a related discipline;Minimum of 8 years of delivery experience in both internal or consulting rolesA proven track record with Microsoft’s BI stackExperience with Azure Analysis ServicesExperience with Azure tools: Data Lake, Data Factory, Data Warehouse, Blob Storage, USQLExperience with MDXExperience with Azure tools such as: Databricks, PolyBase.Experience with Power BI or PowerAppsAbility to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment and to work with a team;Prepared for domestic and international travel as required
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Position Summary
The Senior Specialist, Data Analytics, will be responsible for collecting, managing and analyzing partner online and direct-to-consumer business related data for the retail excellence division. The main objective is to mine and connect vast datasets related to both SES stores and eCommerce and provide data-driven insights back to the division on a monthly and quarterly basis. The key will be to identify trends in SES stores and eCommerce businesses relative to the market to identify possible opportunities/risks.


This position will work closely with cross divisional stakeholders, as well as Head Quarters.
Role and Responsibilities
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Maintain the retail data warehouse (via Cube file), ensuring consistency across both SES and eCommerce channels
Provide data-driven insights to the division and key stakeholders on key learnings for each of the SES stores and eCommerce businesses on a monthly and quarterly basis. Purpose is to apply these learnings in tandem with the CPFR process to analyze opportunities and risks via the Quarterly Business Review process
Analyze product group/SKU level data in comparison with each division to identify market or channel-specific trends
Responsible for building analytics tools/models as needed by functional teams (example: supply and demand curve for optimal price point/profit) and developing processes and tools to measure performance and accuracy
Drive the monthly target planning process for eCommerce channel by reviewing, validating, and aligning with each division on their account and product level forecast
Manage the monthly upload of eCommerce actual sales data, and have the ability to work back from the system to provide target vs. actual analysis to key stakeholders
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources as they arise, and providing optimal data gathering techniques
Responsible for understanding the eCommerce & SES sales recognition process and support divisions fixing various issues to ensure all sales data is captured in the system
Develop regular analytics and reports based on all available data sets for various internal key stakeholders
Skills and Qualifications
Knowledge/Experience/Competencies/Education/Mandatory Internal Training:
Superior data management, qualitative & quantitative analytical and data visualization capabilities. Expert in data management & visualization tools: (ie. Excel, Access, Power BI, SAS, Tableau, etc.)
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, etc.)
MBA is an asset
Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple projects and set priorities for a team of managers and individual contributors
Expert in with Microsoft Office Suite software
Excellent Data management, analytics and reporting skills
Highly developed communication & relationship skills
Strict attention to details: Excellent written and verbal communication, analytical and strategic thinking skills
Ability to work with all levels of the organization
