job_title: Director, Customer Risk Rating, AML/ATF Models and Analytics
job_description:
Requisition ID: 57851
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose
Contributes to the overall success of the Global Risk Management’s AML/ATF team by ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Accountabilities
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Build and manage a team of AML/ATF documentation and governance professionals. This team will take responsibility for documenting a range of models and handling various model governance issues as part of the Banks AML/AFT efforts.
Accountable for design and maintenance of documentation templates for AML/ATF/Sanction models. Ensure that the model documentation templates satisfy the requirements of regulator guidelines, the Bank’s internal Model Risk Management Policies and AML/ATF Model Risk Management Procedures
Supervise and/or conduct model documentation for individual AML/ATF/Sanction models and ensure the documentation follows the corresponding templates; ensure that individual model documentation compliant to model documentation requirements and internal/ external model development standards.
Work with AML Models and Analytics (AMA) development teams to plan model documentation schedule and manage model documentation projects.
Engage in AMA model development process to ensure that development activities are sufficient to support all key documentation components
Collaborate closely with Model Validation team to ensure communication of issues is sufficient, effective and timely. Understand the validation requirements and validation procedures.
Work with teams in the Bank’s subsidiaries to play an oversight role in the development of model development and documentation framework
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Champions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team.
Education / Experience
Experience in managing a team
Experience with statistical modeling and data science methods in the AML context
Experience programming in statistical languages such as R, SAS. Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server
AML/ATF experience or analytic knowledge
Bachelor’s degree or higher in science, technology, engineering or mathematics
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

IT Service Management Process Analyst
The opportunity
The Process Analyst role performs operational and analysis related activities for IT Service Management function including but not limited to Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management and Systems Availability across the Enterprise Service Delivery and Information Technology departments.
You will support and perform process improvement activities, report generation, maturity improvements, process data analysis, communication, and facilitation of process activities.
Who you'll work with
In a diverse team, you will work closely with Enterprise Service Delivery IT leadership team to define and report on key Service Management process metrics and supporting analysis.
Participate to manage completion of process activities and/or management of process metrics
What you'll do
Creates and maintains ITSM process reporting, optimizes the management of data sources and data accuracy
Automates reporting from data sources where possible
Defines and maintains common Service Management reporting formats, data sources, and definitions
Proactively analyzes process activities and process data to identify reporting improvements, process improvements and key areas of focus for the leadership team. Looking at efficiency, quality, consistency and adherence
Coordinates with Managed Services Providers where ITSM data is produced by the Provider and/or ITSM processes are part of Provider SLAs or Key Measures
Contributes, creates and organizes key process documentation and communication
Facilitates process forums, regular meetings and manages meeting actions
What you'll need
Bachelor’s degree in computer science with a focus on analytics
ITIL certified to a minimum of foundation level.
3 years of direct experience in IT Service Management process support or operational activities
3 years experience developing data intensive reports in Excel. Advanced Excel reporting, programming and data management skills including links to external data sources
Experience with Service Now is preferred
Experience defining, implementing and reporting on relevant IT Metrics & KPI’s
Practical experience with workflow and process design
Project management experience (Preferred)
Superior analytical and problem-solving abilities
Self-starter, with strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills leading to sound judgments/decisions and innovative process improvement recommendations
Effective planning and organizational skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to explain complex, highly technical information to non-technical colleagues using clear, simple language
Ability to effectively influence without authority yielding required results and building strong relationships
What we're offering
Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Comprehensive employer paid benefits coverage, including a Health Spending Account
Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan
Competitive time off
Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company with $2.0 trillion in assets and offices in over 37 countries. How Do We Hire Great People?
We believe in matching the right people for the right role. Description

You are an experienced professional who can bridge the worlds of quantitative analysis and senior account leadership with an integrated approach to media research, insights, analytics and data for existing and new clients.

DESCRIPTION
Weber Shandwick seeks an experienced Director to champion, advance and accelerate the use of data and bespoke advanced analytics in communications both within Weber Shandwick and for our clients. This position will sit in either our Toronto or Montreal offices, but will work hand-in-hand with client teams across Canada and our global network. The ideal candidate for this position will have prior experience selling or marketing scaled custom analytics solutions to sophisticated marketing and corporate communications audiences.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Maintain deep knowledge and points-of-view on cutting-edge technologies, tools, platforms, and partners relevant to integrated media analytics—including overseeing and participating in the rollout of new technologies and partnerships to relevant teamsProvide hands-on consultancy, collaboration and support in designing and delivering analytics workWork closely with firm leaders in identifying opportunities and reducing barriers to advancing the use and sophistication of analytics across officesContribute to business development and growth (both new client and organic growth) through the use of analytics in proposal development, as well as by designing and selling specific analytics solutions to clientsContribute to the development of new analytics tools and techniquesEngage as an active participant in product development work with data science, data engineering and product management organizationBe the voice-of-the-customer as the company seeks to break new analytic ground

Qualifications

CORE REQUIREMENTS
7-9 years of related professional experience within an agency, consulting or corporate settingTalent development experience and skill in coaching and motivating teamsAbility to derive relevant insights from diverse sources of data, both qualitative and quantitative, including published sources, syndicated data, and proprietary data, and then translating those insights into specific media strategies and recommendationsAbility to design research and analyses to test specific hypothesis around optimal communications creative and channel mix
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
Working knowledge of advanced statistics and data modeling techniques, including regression and classification techniques, as well as use of techniques and tools appropriate for analysis of both structured and unstructured data
ABOUT WEBER SHANDWICK
Weber Shandwick is a leading global communications and engagement firm in 78 cities with a network extending to 129 cities around the world. The firm’s diverse team of strategists, analysts, producers, designers, developers and campaign activators has won the most prestigious awards in the world for innovative, creative approaches and impactful work. Weber Shandwick was the only public relations agency included on the Advertising Age Agency A-list in 2014 and 2015 and the only PR firm designated an A-List Agency Standout in 2017 and 2018. Weber Shandwick was honored as PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year in 2015, 2016 and 2017, The Holmes Report’s Global Agency of the Year in 2010, 2012, 2014, 2015 and 2017, and The Holmes Report’s Global Digital Agency of the Year in 2016. The firm deploys deep expertise across sectors and specialty areas, including consumer marketing, corporate reputation, healthcare, technology, public affairs, financial services, employee engagement, social impact, financial communications and crisis management, using proprietary social, digital and analytics methodologies. Weber Shandwick is part of the Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG). For more information, visit http://www.webershandwick.ca

Would you like to work in a fully Agile environment? Your main objective as a Manager of Domain Analytics is to lead a team of technology driven Analysts, ensuring the team’s capabilities translate into delivering first-class solutions for our client portfolio

Who are we at Equifax?

We are a global information solutions company that uses trusted unique data, creative analytics, technology and industry expertise to power organizations and individuals around the world by transforming knowledge into insights that help make more informed business and personal decisions.
We are looking for individuals who can help us disrupt the marketplace. You will do this by delivering leading-edge technology to build and deliver unparalleled customized insights that enrich both the performance of businesses and the

Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our people makes a difference in our business.
lives of consumers.

About the Job

We will give you the opportunity to drive innovation and automation across the enterprise. This will include tool and process integrations across all business units within Equifax globally.
You will be a motivated and energetic leader who can manage our Fraud and Debt Services analytics team. In addition, as a Manager of Domain Analytics you will play a pivotal role in developing new fraud and verification strategy capabilities, collaborating with both internal partners as well as consumer and commercial clients. Your activities will include all relevant components from gathering internal customer requirements and incorporating voice of the customer into the design, to assigning specific projects to appropriate resources, and development of the final solution and insights.

This position will use technical skills, in-depth data and business knowledge, statistical and machine-learning techniques to analyze and interpret data, automate reports, build models and draw conclusions and insights based on Equifax’s internal and external customer needs.

In addition to holding a strong analytical and quantitative background, the successful individual will have a passion for creative thinking and innovative problem solving.
The end goal is to grow Equifax brand as an analytics and insight organization, while successfully solving our customer’s business challenges.

Responsibilities of the Manager, Domain Analytics include:
You will ensure Alignment between both internal and external key partners. Brainstorming, testing and developing new analytics that optimally use new and existing data assets to address and/or exceeds business objectives and requirements. You will use analytics to help our customers to make more informed, insightful and actionable decisions.
Be accountable for the performance and results of the Analytics team.
Manage, develop and give direction to statisticians on the Analytics team supporting consumer and commercial verticals in their mandate to:
Design, develop, deliver and document industry leading Fraud and Debt Services capabilities which drive true value for our customers
Evaluate new data available and support POC initiatives to determine the most optimal use of new data and potential new solutions development
You will design and continuously enhance the data for statistical modelling and analysis based on internal and external client requirements, including the definition and documentation of standard report/extraction criteria/filters for analysis within the department
Automate processes to increase turnaround time on data availability and increase efficiencies in the statistical model building process, including a continuous process improvement process by becoming increasingly entrenched and knowledgeable of the structure and changes to the Canadian data both from internal and an external point of view.
You will be the key point of contact for the IT and Deployment teams regarding analytical tool, environment requirements, and implementation options

Required Skills:
You will need to have minimum 2+ years of team management experience
Expert level knowledge of analytic & modelling techniques and working knowledge of associated development tools
You have demonstrable experience designing and building analytical solutions to solve real world problems, with strong preference of this experience in financial risk area
Minimum of 5+ years of data manipulation experience, specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, experimental design, cluster analysis, building decision trees, and predictive modelling
Solid experience of credit bureau data and its usability and applications, especially in risk & fraud

Proficiency in the following is required:
Data analysis and data mining
You will need to be a Predictive modelling and Statistical analysis authority
SAS (Base SAS, SAS Macro, SAS STAT, EM, EG)
Complex data manipulation using SQL

Preferred Skills:
Master’s degree in Statistics, Math, Operations Research, Computer Science, Econometrics, Actuarial Science or other related quantitative discipline
Database design and data modelling
At least one business intelligence tool (e.g. Business Objects, Cognos, Spotfire)
Experience in the Fraud risk discipline
Experience in Debt Services, Collections or Debt Recovery strategies
Hadoop Tools: SAS, Hive, Python, R, Scala

Education
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Statistics, Math, Operations Research, Computer Science, Econometrics, Actuarial Science or other related quantitative discipline

job_title: Facility Management Data Specialist, Real Property Management
job_description:
$65,328 - $84,928 a yearDefence Construction Canada (DCC) is looking for a facility management data specialist to join its Toronto office. If you have prior experience in facilities management, are knowledgeable about building systems and their operations, maintenance and performance, and have an inclination for technology and data analytics, this position may be for you!
DCC is a federal Crown corporation with its Head Office in Ottawa. Its 1,000-strong workforce delivers infrastructure, environmental and professional services to support its Client-Partners, the Department of National Defence and the Canadian Armed Forces, both at bases and wings across Canada, and on missions abroad.
Reporting to the Team Leader, Real Property Management, the Technical Specialist, Real Property Management, will deliver data-driven real property management solutions with minimal supervision to the Client-Partners. This includes carrying out data analysis, validation, cleansing, collection and reporting.
Primary
Complete complex real property project work (e.g. facility reviews, technical reviews, strategic plans, development plans)
Assist with generating facility management statements of operational requirements, preparing business cases and conducting investigations, as required
Develop, implement and manage real property management programs (preventive and demand maintenance administration) and/or energy programs to ensure buildings and systems remain operational and energy efficient (e.g. identify maintenance and repair requirements, determine damage responsibility, prepare estimates and technical reports)
Audit facilities to determine compliance, condition, maintenance requirements, energy efficiency and Client-Partner satisfaction
Participate in procurement planning
Provide project management support to real property information management systems
Develop and maintain effective relationships within DCC, and with industry, the Client-Partners and/or stakeholders
Ensure quality standards are met, in line with corporate and Client-Partner expectations
Other
Assist in drafting real property policy
Prepare monthly reports (e.g. internal and for the Client-Partners)
Support and/or lead business development activities
Manage risk
Other duties as assigned
General and Specific Knowledge
Best practices, methods, trends and legislation in real property, land use, facility management and maintenance methods
Client-Partner, Public Services and Procurement Canada and Treasury Board Secretariat policies and procedures
Project and risk management principles
Formal Education and/or Certification(s) and Experience
Minimum: college diploma in land use planning, engineering, architecture, facility/property management or related field with four years’ relevant experience, or the equivalent.
Preferred: university degree in one of the above fields and/or additional training in project management; professional certification may be required depending on position (e.g. Certified Engineering Technologist or related designation); eligible for certification as a professional planner if working in planning role (e.g. Registered Professional Planner, Real Property Administrator, Facilities Management Administrator).
Abilities
Use applicable computer software and operating systems
Apply project and risk management techniques
Development and Leadership
Provide functional advice and guidance to employees and the Client-Partners
Working conditions
Typical office environment with occasional travel
Some work may be located on construction sites; incumbent may occasionally be required to wear basic safety equipment

Toronto, ONBrief Description:
The Marketing Analyst will derive insights from data for Wavemaker brands, and will serve as the primary analytics contact for client teams. As such, they will be expected to make recommendations for the activation teams based upon insights retrieved. Additionally, the successful candidate will establish a highly collaborative relationship with the analytics and activation teams, thereby contributing to the success of our clients.
Three Best Things About the Job:
Work in a dynamic team of data and analytics specialists serving high-profile brands
Drive innovative new approaches to automated reporting and data-driven decision making
Key Responsibilities of the Role:
Aids the activation team in measuring the success of media campaigns, comparing a performance to the client’s objectives and constantly seeking ways to improve the accuracy or timeliness of this measurement
Conducts client-specific analyses across all media channels and ensures that Wavemaker has access to the appropriate data. This could include building statistical models on how media affects key business outcomes
Routinely collaborates with the media team to arrive at recommendations supported by data and analytics
Develop and optimize machine learning models to support and strategize controllable factors based on exogenous and endogenous factors
Contributes to the design and measurement of new tactics deemed appropriate in furthering the client’s objectives
Collaborates with internal and external business intelligence groups on the development of various dashboards, pipelines and processes
What You Will Need:
Bachelor’s degree or above in a STEM field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Management (with emphasis on Marketing)
Minimum of two years of experience in a data management or marketing analytics role
Intermediate skills in writing and reading SQL, R and/or Python code
Intermediate skills in business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Datorama or PowerBI (minimum 1-2 years in building dashboards)
Ability to query relational databases such as SQL Server or Azure SQL
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
Experience in working with data from various media channels including digital, search engine marketing, social, and traditional (highly preferred)
Experience in conducting business analysis to collect requirements from non-technical stakeholders, while managing their expectations at the same time
Experience in communicating technical terms to non-technical people, and helping them understand why change is required to achieve a specific goal or to complete a project
Knowledge of media analytics concepts, syndicated media data sources, third party ad serving platforms, and media buying platforms would be beneficial
Qualities:
An independent, self-driven individual with highly responsible nature
A team player with natural curiosity and a desire to do things differently
An understanding of the broader media landscape and its impact on communications campaigns and strategies
Desire to work in a dynamic, client-focused agency environment
Proactivity in seeking solutions to unique and complex problems
Methodical, organized, with high attention to detail
Ability to prioritize multiple projects
An energetic and proactive learner

Kanata, ONRB is the world's leading consumer health and hygiene company. We’re 40,000 entrepreneurs, all inspired by a vision of a world where people are healthier and live better.
At the heart of our rapidly growing consumer health business is a passionate desire to help people feel better. We invest in research and development to find new ways for people to look after themselves, their families, and homes.

What You’ll Do:
The Category Analytics Manager will help create value for RB Health (Canada) through enabling data-driven decision making for strategic and operational planning. You will lead our category understanding and provide insight, analyses and recommendations to position RB Health (Canada) as the category authority and provide business owners with forward-looking and diagnostic insights that optimize our business strategy and drive growth.

What Are Your Responsibilities?
Lead business intelligence reporting across our key markets, Infant Formula, Child Nutrition, Sexual Wellbeing, Health Relief and Personal Care categories.
Ensures integrity of data sources, maintains databases and leads relationship with suppliers of category information.
Produces weekly and monthly reports, and ensures category reporting is reflective of the key segments and product groups that drive market performance.
Uses category expertise to determine how to best understand category performance.
Considers all competitors in the category spaces, and provides an understanding of brand share performances.
Creation of the market data availability through standardized reporting, delivers category expertise and understanding through deep dive analyses into category segments.
Helps to define overall category strategy and stories through working in partnership with Business Analytics team members and Marketing and Sales partners, integrating data sources from internal and external data sources.
Leverage new technologies and platforms to ensure best practice for democratization of data and data visualization.
How Do You Know If You’re A Fit?
BA or BSc Required
Knowledge of the Canadian retail space and retail strategies, instore and online.
Strong knowledge of syndicated data (Nielsen/IQVIA) and POS and proven skill at analyzing and interpreting these data sources.
Strong proficiency in advanced excel knowledge, database management, general knowledge of supply chain and production, marketing and sales.
Demonstrated ability to evaluate and integrate data sources and develop/test/validate hypotheses in order to identify current and forecast emerging trends.
Understanding of organizational dynamics of a global corporation, operating culture and achieving results in a changing work environment.
Strong interpersonal skills to navigate interactions and develop partnerships at all levels of the organization.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously demonstrating strong prioritization skills, balancing uncertainties and trade-offs to achieve desired business results. Attention to detail with emphasis on both speed and accuracy.
Builds a collaborative, positive cross functional team environment and strong working relationships with senior management, marketing, healthcare and retail sales teams, finance and outside agencies.
Successful in demonstrating core behaviors: entrepreneurship, ownership, partnership.
5+ years of experience in Category Management or Retail Analyst experience

Mandate and Overview:


The Business Consultant is accountable for leading and performing work effort and deliverables which has been initiated by the Accountable Head. This individual will have direct oversight on all aspects of the portfolio across the group, and will ensure that associated work efforts and phases are completed as required, including as applicable, reporting, change management, process management, transition to business/operations, problem resolutions, quality management and status management.


Within the context of the portfolio, this individual will be responsible for building and sustaining the day-to-day relationships and communications, including portfolio briefings, with the Accountable Head as well as key partners and stakeholders at various levels of the organization. This individual will also sustain and manage the relationship with the Accountable Head through daily operations by providing research and analysis findings, sound advice, counsel and support. Amongst key responsibilities is ensuring end results across the group are of high performance caliber with a clearly articulated scope, value proposition and where it makes sense, quantifiable benefit. This includes ensuring clear linkage between the organization’s vision/context with the group’s work scope and objectives, enhancing mechanisms to measure benefits, and strengthening controls by improving business operational processes.


While this is an individual contributor role, this individual will have direct leadership and management responsibility for ensuring the operating effectiveness of the group including but not limited to strategic planning, quality assurance, reporting, and execution/delivery of operating plans for the portfolio. Ideally, this individual will have project management and business consulting experience, have been able to successfully work through various challenging and complex scenarios with multiple stakeholders, and will have had working knowledge of Technology related investment/spend planning, initiative portfolio management, financial management, account/vendor management and general business operations management.


More specifically:


Lead the creation and completion of multiple Business Management Review reports for Technology & Operations on various established frequency basis e.g., monthly, quarterly; including ensuring accuracy and quality assurance for executive level viewing.
Support and in some cases lead initiatives related to transformation and/or continuous improvement of existing operational processes, which includes acting in a project planning, resource management and change management capacity; also support the execution of key improvement initiatives using data-driven insights to deliver positive financial and customer-driven outcomes; develop, recommend, and employ productivity aids in all aspects of assignments to accelerate delivery.
Support analysis of various business management operational problems/situations and development of management consulting quality, executive level presentations.
Support and in some cases lead capturing, auditing and reporting of portfolio scope, costs and benefits.
Support the Request for Information (RFI) or Request for Proposal (RFP) with vendors if required; plan and/or conduct third party software analysis including business case development as needed for inclusion in a project solution.
Support risk, performance and general relationship management review and reporting process with key vendor partnerships and conduct analysis to determine the partnership health and improvement opportunities.
Enable business leaders/senior managers to successfully accept solutions to problems and/or changes to current operations/practices/processes by informing stakeholders of their implications such as potential risks and mitigation, with recommendation of actions as appropriate.
Recommends innovative approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency.
Gather, or otherwise contribute to requirements and documentation of these requirements to support enablement of new Technology solutions; ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meets essential quality standards; works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs; maintain requirements to ensure that current state needs are known at any given point in time.
Participate in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products; ensures system specifications meet the business unit expectations/ requirements, and negotiate solutions.
Provide or otherwise contribute to creation of user cases and user expected results to ensure that software is delivered to end users with zero high severity (1 or 2) defects; assist in the preparation of end-user materials.
Liaise with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and recommends solutions to enable the organization to meet its goals.
Analyze data, use statistical and business relevant trend identification techniques and creates documents and plans in service of information, advising or updating stakeholders.
Understands the scope of complexity that exists across business value, technology and interaction models.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen the capability at BMO, such as: sharing expertise to promote development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across technology.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities and individual learning.
Qualifications
Qualifications – core knowledge and skills:

Generally 4-7 years of work experience in business environment and/or Bachelors in business, math and/or process related engineering discipline; also Bachelors/masters in management science, Project Management Professional and/or Accounting designation.
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Possess the ability to create/contribute to tactical and strategic vision.
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills; superior presentation and numbers driven reporting development skills (e.g., MS Powerpoint, Excel and Word).
Ability to learn new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and thinks about new ways of applying.

Qualities sought:

Able to manage complex situations such as urgent ad hoc requests, large volume of stakeholders and/or ambiguous scope; possesses a deep comprehension and problem solving ability of various scale, degree and dimension of complexity.
Able to anticipate and reduce complexity for others.
Must demonstrate management consulting, business management/support of technology/systems, project management/control, budgeting and financial analysis experience or strong capabilities. Technology consulting or development experience would be a valued alternative to business management/support of technology/systems or bonus.
Must demonstrate strong Powerpoint presentation and Excel skills.
Must demonstrate strong written communication skills.
Solid demonstration of stakeholder/relationship management skills.
Highly adaptable to managing ambiguous and unexpected situations.
Demonstrate understanding and ability to balance business priority with risk.
Is analytical yet is able to recommend optimal solutions and solutions; ability to identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data
Demonstrates potential for developing innovative approaches to create solutions to resolve problems and significant issues within the project’s mandate
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Manager, Commercial Data Quality & Analytics - SCI003142
About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.

Sciex offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates' and their families' lives.

Sciex is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join our winning team and Follow us on LinkedIn!
Description
The Manager, Commercial Data Quality & Analytics will work within the Global Commercial Operations and Effectiveness team to lead the charge in transforming data analytics and business intelligence to enable and drive commercial growth and efficiency. The person needs to have a great vision for what’s next, identify major business growth and efficiency improvement opportunities to demonstrate and champion the power of strong data analytics, and bring the business impact as a result of intelligence and insights into real life.

Reporting:
This role reports to Director, Global Commercial Ops and Effectiveness. It is also important that this role builds strong and effective relationship with regional sales leaders and service leaders.

Responsibilities:
Lead a team to solve complex and ambiguous business problems by navigating through data to find the real performance drives and drive data insights to actions, to deliver improved operational, financial, strategic, and customer success outcomes
Transform the commercial analytics team from basic reporting (descriptive of what happened) into insightful data mining (diagnostic – why did it happen) and/or predictive modeling (predictive of what will happen as well as prescriptive of calling to action – what should we do)
Work closely with business leaders to understand the business problems/challenges they need to solve, clarify and formulate assumptions and hypotheses in simple business terms, and breaking down business problems into manageable projects
Lead cross-functional and cross-regional project teams to analyze opportunities, synthesize findings, develop action plans, gain consensus and translate recommendations into results
Participate in the design, planning, prioritization and execution of a broad range of analytics designed to support data-driven decision-making in global Sales & Service organization

#LI-SL1.
Qualifications
5-7 years of working in analytics or commercial planning and reporting field; life sciences industry experience preferred.
At least 1 year of people leadership experience with direct involvement or management of an analytics team and demonstrated success in cross-functional leadership with ability to work execute across matrices
Strong commercial understanding of lead generation to funnel management and experience using data to uncover actionable growth opportunities is preferred
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and be flexible in a fast paced, dynamic team environment
Must be creative and detail-oriented in ambiguous situations with a relentless focus on execution
Experience using Power BI or other advanced analytic software, and Salesforce.com, Service Max or another CRM platform

Additional Requirements:
Creative and intellectually curious demonstrating strong conceptual thinking skills
Strong communicator, both verbal and written, to engage, influence and get buy-in from all levels of internal and external stakeholders and to influence key decisions on product issues
Strong work ethic with ability to manage and prioritize a diverse mix of issues, responsibilities and challenges on a daily basis
Demonstrates key leadership traits including integrity, adaptability, vision, judgment, courage and passion
High degree of awareness and sensitivity to a diverse, global work environment
Travel
If Framingham based, 50% travel expected
If Concord based, 15% travel expected

Toronto, ONAre you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
The Director, Decision Management is accountable for the data strategy and analytics for the Global Operations & Procurement (GO&P) platform. The team objective is to evolve and innovate in analytics to bring new insights and opportunities for GO&P to achieve their strategic priorities, ambitions and goals. In this role you will:
Own accountability for the data architecture, design and reporting functions,
Implement new data tools to drive the strategy of digitizing and democratizing data,
Optimize data analytics innovation and development; by leading and aligning with enterprise technology, data & analytics and finance, and
Ensure data integrity and responsible for the end-to-end reconciliation of data pertaining the GO&P platform as well as linkages to other enterprise data systems & tools.
Own the integration of data & analytics strategy & transformation for GO&P with other enterprise teams
Your Key Responsibilities:
Data Management & Governance
Lead and develop the data management strategy roadmap for GO&P
Accountable for the development of GO&P data architecture and design of reporting capabilities
Actively assess, analyze and recommend new tools to drive and innovate all aspects of data, reporting and analytics for GO&P
Analytics, Insights & Reporting
Develop actionable insights to the business relating to 3rd party spend
Apply Advanced Analytics capabilities throughout the Procurement value chain, e.g predict sourcing opportunities using predictive modelling, text mining, optimization, segmentation and other data mining techniques
Lead the development and implementation of procurements critical metrics and dashboards
Build a fact base to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of operations and procurement operating model
Establish benchmarks and develop KPIs that align to GO&P strategy and objectives and enable ongoing management of the operating model
Work closely with Finance and Risk management team to ensure alignment and integration with financial and risk management reporting as required
Innovation, Collaboration & Execution Excellence
Lead and champion the implementation of analytic tools and initiatives
Discover and use new methodologies, technology, and data lake tools to improve analytics capabilities
Drive innovation and execution excellence in the thinking, approach and delivery, build safe environments for continuous learning and lead with a risk mindset.
Support Global Operations Function
Engage with key global partners to understand the Customer Digital Program business strategy, innovation and digitalization roadmap
Develop key performance indicators to ensure all projects elevate the customer digital experience
Collaborate with cross functional teams to collect, streamline and report on digital transformation performance
Job Requirements:
University degree in quantitative based field (e.g. Statistics, Science, Engineering, Computer Science)
10+ years of progressive business experience in Data, Analytics and Reporting
Strong technology knowledge and deep understanding of data architecture and analysis methodologies
Experienced knowledge on visualization tools available
Solid analytical skills
Competencies:
Familiar with Manulife’s business operations, strategies and financial environment
Shown innovator – authority in identifying and implementing change management and business process transformation; consistently challenges the status quo; takes balanced risks to promote growth of ideas; comfortable in high pressure environments.
Strategic thinker – thinks conceptually beyond day-to-day business realities; crafts a clear vision and goals and adopts a long-term perspective; anticipates emerging issues.
Global thinker – dedicated to improving the Company’s competitive position on an enterprise and global level; understands and is respectful of what works in different parts of the world and what doesn’t.
Team builder – builds strategic partnerships with internal clients and vendors; builds agreement and engagement with key partners.
Skilled communicator – communicates complexity with clarity and ease; articulates a clear view of concepts, ideas, and objectives; able to collaborate with different partners at all levels; represents the company externally with confidence; skilled in both oral and written communication.
Collaborator – shares resources and uses knowledge across the organization; builds and nurtures an extensive network
Be known as a subject matter expert in the data and analytics area

If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

job_title: Director, Data Analytics and Customer Insights (Contract)
job_description:
Toronto, ONContractAs the Director - Data Analytics and Customer Insights (Contract), you will be responsible for overseeing customer analytics, data intelligence, research, and consumer insights for the Customer Success team, and Executive Management. You will lead the effort for identifying, leveraging, and integrating data to be able to identify and create a deeper understanding of key insights both externally with customer behaviors and internally for key functions such as customer care, sales, and marketing.

We are looking for an A-player to help take Horizn to the next level. This is the most exciting time to join the team!

About You

A self-starter, a go-getter with a passion for data analytics
An excellent oral and written communicator with the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are determined in your quest to understand all data; you have experience in advanced analytics, programming and statistical tools
You are a strategic cross-functional thinker that is able to gather buy-in from senior management for analytical and measurement framework approaches
You love translating data into insights by using your strong analytical skills.
Responsibilities

As a Director, Data Analytics and Customer Insights (Contract), a typical day may include:

Design and deploy customer analytics and reporting to strengthen Horizn’s Customer Success offering, by informing customers with an understanding of how the Horizn platform is working for them and providing insights to all stakeholders (within customers and Horizn)
Partner with sales, customer service, and operations teams to develop quantitative models and analyze business hypotheses, informing data driven decisions to optimize and increase Horizn platform effectiveness.
Partner with product and engineering teams to ensure all required data is captured in the Horizn platform and is made available in an easily consumable manner
Provide recommendations to product and leadership teams on how Horizn platform should be enhanced to display analytics and reporting relevant to each customer
Develop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of customer behavior across sales and marketing channels
Develop a strong foundation of predictive, prescriptive recommendations around our products, pricing, customers and operations that will drive organic growth.
Leverage and integrate disparate data sources to aid in customer success
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or higher (Master’s degree preferred) in Information Systems, Computer Science, Analytics, Business, Statistics or Math from a leading institution
5 - 10 years of experience working in an analytical role for a B2B software vendor, ideally driving growth and/or developing customer insights
Familiarity with data analytics and visualization tools (MySQL, Power Pivot, Tableau, Google Analytics, etc.)
Experience with financial institutions and digital innovation/adoption is a plus
We offer competitive compensation. Our commitment to our team includes offering benefit programs that are comprehensive and competitive.

Join our Customer Success team today and help us advance customer insights, advancing our customers digital transformation and adoption using advanced analytics!

job_title: EC-03 - Statistical Officer / EC-04 - Analyst, HR Analytics and Reporting
job_description:
$63,428 - $71,769 a yearDepartment of Justice Canada - Human Resources Branch

Ottawa (Ontario), Montréal Island (Québec)

EC-03, EC-04

EC-03 from $63,428 to $71,769 / EC-04 from $68,468 to $79,234
For further information on the organization, please visit Department of Justice Canada
Closing date: N/A
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Assessment accommodation
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
The first extraction of applications is scheduled for April 1, 2019. The subsequent extractions will take place on an "as and when needed" basis.
*** INSTRUCTIONS TO FOLLOW ***

You must submit a complete application, consisting of screening questions which clearly demonstrate how you meet the screening criteria (education and experience) and a résumé. The screening questions will be used as the primary tool in the screening process and the résumé will only be used to substantiate the information provided.

Please note that the screening questions may also be used to assess written communication.

Please note that point form, “copy and paste" from your résumé and comments such “refer to my attached résumé” will NOT be accepted. Failure to provide this information in the requested format will result in your application being rejected.

FOR EACH EXPERIENCE CRITERION, please provide concrete examples including the following MANDATORY information:

1. Name of the department or organization where the experience was acquired;
2. Title of the position occupied and duration (including dates) for which you exercised the functions;
3. Specific details of tasks, projects, or accomplishments demonstrating how the experience was acquired.
Intent of the process
A pool of partially or fully qualified candidates may be established which may be used to staff similar positions within the Department of Justice Canada with various tenures, language requirements and/or conditions of employment, which may vary according to the position to be staffed.

The positions are currently located in Ottawa, Ontario, but consideration may be given to staffing positions in Montreal, Quebec.
Positions to be filled: Number to be determined
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION
ED1 - Graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.

Note: Candidates must always have a degree. The courses for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. The specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.
Degree equivalency
EXPERIENCE
EX1 - Significant* experience in the production, analysis and interpretation of complex data sets and statistics from various data sources.
EX2 - Recent** and significant* experience using advanced Microsoft Excel functions, such as macros and pivot tables.
EX3 - Recent** experience using advanced Microsoft Access functions.
EX4 - Experience in researching and organizing data and information in response to a variety of data and information requests, and preparing written summaries and recommendations.

“Significant” experience will be assessed in terms of the depth and breadth of activities, the complexity and diversity of the work handled, as well as the level of autonomy demonstrated.
** “Recent” experience refers to experience acquired during the normal performance of such duties for at least one year in the last two (2) years worked.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS

EXPERIENCE
AEX1 - Experience with Visual Basic.
AEX2 - Experience designing queries and writing SQL.
AEX3 - Experience with PeopleSoft, including extracting or manipulating data from various fields and modules.
AEX4 - Experience in using business intelligence software (e.g. SAS, PowerBI, Tableau).
AEX5 - Experience with the Phoenix Pay system, including extracting or manipulating data from various fields and modules.
AEX6 - Experience in analyzing and validating data sets and reporting on results in support of Human Resources Management.
OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS
OR1 - Ability and willingness to work overtime on short notice.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Bilingual Imperative BBB/BBB / English Essential
Information on language requirements
KNOWLEDGE
K1 - Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative analysis, trend analysis and forecasting.
K2 - Knowledge of advanced Excel functions, such as Macros and pivot tables.
K3 - Knowledge of Human Resources management functions.
ABILITIES
A1 - Ability to analyze and summarize data sets and other information and prepare written summaries and/or recommendations.
A2 - Ability to prioritize workload and to meet deadlines
A3 - Ability to communicate effectively.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY
PS1 - Judgment
PS2 - Effective interpersonal relationships
PS3 - Initiative
PS4 - Thoroughness
PS5 - Dependability
Other information
The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
All job applications must be submitted on-line. Persons with disabilities preventing them from applying on-line are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Extractions from this selection process may occur throughout and after the advertisement period.

Results from previous extractions may be deemed valid for future extractions.

Candidates may be required to meet the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.

Other qualifications may be taken into consideration in the selection decision.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

You must provide proof of your education credentials.

Our means of communication with applicants is via e-mail. Please ensure to include a functional e-mail address, which will accept messages from unknown users (some e-mail systems block these types of e-mails). It is the responsibility of the candidate to ensure accurate contact information is provided and updated as required. We encourage candidates to provide a second e-mail address in their application.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Company Description
“We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder
Global supply chain management is what we do, but at the heart of Expeditors you will find professionalism, leadership, and a friendly environment, all of which foster an innovative, customer service-based approach to logistics.

Organic Growth – Expeditors promotes from within. As a shining example, our CEO started as an entry level employee in our San Francisco office 31 years ago.
15,000 trained professionals
250+ locations worldwide
Fortune 500
Globally unified systems

Job Description
Enterprise Data & Analytics is responsible for providing Districts and Customers with exceptional data analytics support for planning, root cause analysis and process improvement activities that accelerate Expeditors’ business. The Data Analyst position is a broad-spectrum analytics role responsible for leveraging all available data and has a wide range of responsibilities including the collection, cleansing, analysis, reporting, interpretation and presentation of data. Data Analysts have the ability to develop end-to-end data solutions.
Key Responsibilities:

Scope, plan, develop and deploy impactful data-driven solutions for our Districts and Customers
Adhere to a defined analytics development procedure and fully document solutions
Participate in project requirements gathering and solution design
Complete projects on-time and provide frequent progress updates to project stakeholders
Prepare, cleanse and augment data in preparation for analysis and usage
Develop meaningful and intuitive reports, summaries and dashboards
Provide support for data and reporting infrastructure such as scheduling and access
Leverage advanced analytics tools and techniques to extracts insights from data
Share solutions and collaborate with other analysts in the network
Manage projects, tasks, time and timelines within our standard project management tools
Provide ongoing training to Districts on available reporting and self-service analytics tools
Cross-train team members on new tools and analytics procedures
Support our District as a subject matter expert on our data, tools and environments
Ensure solutions are built to scale and use enterprise approved technologies
Qualifications
Process Engineering: Meetings with business owners to understand ideas to improve their processes, determine opportunities and solutions for improvement, mapping out the process
Data & Statistical Analysis: Build dashboards using various BI tools as well as conducting data analysis. (all forms of statistical analysis including building dynamic models and dashboards)
Programming: Creating databases (SQL), application development (SQL backend and various
front end technologies), automating processes in internal systems through scripting
Presenting: Derive conclusions and present findings to Management and Executives, demonstrate how you arrived at your conclusion/solution
Learning: Ability to learn new programing languages, techniques, technologies, as well as the logistics industry
Ability to clearly communicate and present to small and large groups

Additional Information
Expeditors offers excellent benefits

Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time
Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision, life insurance, short term disability insurances as well as optional insurance options
RRSP Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Training and Personnel Development Program

Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward. Those who choose to work with us are joining a recognized global leader — a company uniquely positioned to help clients make the most of market opportunities and respond to challenges that affect global healthcare. We’re committed to blending industry expertise and advanced technology to deliver the most accurate perspectives and in-depth analytics on healthcare dynamics.

Role Summary:
The person in this role is responsible for the on-time completion of projects or components of medium to large projects for clients in the pharmaceutical or related industries. Identifies and elevates potential new business opportunities.

Responsibilities:
Participates teams in the design, development and delivery of consulting projects or components of medium to large projects.
Reviews and analyzes client requirements or problems and assists in the development of cost effective solutions that ensure profitability and high client satisfaction.
Provides direction and guidance to Analysts assigned to engagement.
Develops detailed documentation and specifications.
Performs qualitative and/or quantitative analyses to assist in the identification of client issues and the development of client specific solutions.
Designs, structures and delivers client reports and presentations that are appropriate to the characteristics or needs of the audience.
Recommends improvements and alternative solutions to resolve problems.
May identify new business opportunities of follow-on work and new leads at assigned client.
Assists with providing follow-up with client after project deliverable has been completed to ensure client satisfaction.
Proactively develops broader and deeper knowledge of related consulting methodologies and pharmaceutical market through on the job experience and participation in training opportunities.
Begins to develop practice specific subject matter expertise.
Minimum Education, Experience, & Specialized Knowledge Required:
Bachelor’s degree with 3-6 years of related experience in consulting, pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry.
Developing solid project management skills and client influencing and relationship building skills.
Works willingly and effectively with others in and across the organization to accomplish team goals and is effective working in a matrix environment.
Developing ability to manage multiple projects, juggle priorities and deliver on tight deadlines.
Developing excellent presentation, communication and client influencing skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of IMS data or similar data at Patient, Prescriber and Account levels.
Experience with Marketing and/or Market Research studies, Source of Business, Length of Therapy, Patient Journeys, etc.
Experienced with developing consultative relationships with senior level managers and executives at clients in the pharmaceutical/healthcare industry.
Experience in commercial aspects of the Pharmaceutical industry and data
Consulting experience including client-facing roles and project management.
Additional Skills and Knowledge of Interest:
Knowledge of consulting methodologies, tools and techniques related to functional area.
Knowledge of key issues and current developments in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries.
Experience with Media agencies, Consumer data, campaign management, ROI and other related study types.
Therapeutic area knowledge in various medical conditions including but not limited to Oncology, Immunology, Diabetes, Cardiovascular, Vaccines, and rare and orphan diseases
Knowledge of Sales Operations including but not limited to: Sales Force Effectiveness, Sales Analytics, Call Planning, Targeting, Segmentation, Territory Alignment, Sales Sizing & Structure, and Incentive Compensation.
IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve human health outcomes.

Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!
We invite you to join IQVIA™.

job_title: Internship Opportunity- Business Intelligence & Analytics Intern
job_description:
Markham, ONInternshipJob Field:
New Graduate / Student
Job Type:
Internship/Co-op
Length of Assignment:


BGIS is a leading provider of real estate management services, including facilities management, project delivery services, energy and sustainability solutions, building performance management, workplace advisory and management, and real estate services. With a combined team of over 7,000 team members globally, BGIS inspires better business performance across its client's real estate portfolios by developing and implementing real estate and facilities management strategies. Globally, BGIS manages over 300 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

SUMMARY:

As part of the BI & Analytics team, you will be engaged and ready to support the team with data collection, engineering, analysis and data mining tasks, to support cross-departmental analyses.

The Advanced Analytics team’s role is to address complex business and Financial problems using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI is a rapidly expanding field which enables companies to remain competitive, and to differentiate themselves. The intern will have the opportunity to get immersed in various aspects of the Analytics and AI fields through the acquisition and analysis of data and supporting cross-department analyses.

The co-op intern will be reporting to the Associate Director, Analytics, and will work cross-department on advanced analytics and data mining work. The student will be engaged in various stages of the end-to-end delivery of analytical models, with a focus on financial analysis, the energy industry and operational improvement initiatives. Sample projects could include proving cost savings due to retrofits, building energy forecasts, and understanding market opportunities. The role will touch upon big data, creating dashboards and developing insights and recommendations through analysis. This role is an exciting opportunity for students interested in entering the fields of Data Science / Artificial Intelligence, Finance and / or Energy.

Key Responsibilities:

We are looking for a team player who possesses / is interested in developing exceptional analytical skills, is able to learn quickly, and is truly motivated by solving impactful business problems
Acquire data from internal and external sources

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
Calgary, ABAbout Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Date: Mar 13, 2019
Location: Toronto, ON, CA
Requisition ID: 6112

A Career in Beer….

Our purpose at Molson Coors is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world.

We are Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do then we want to hear from you.

The Headlines

The Revenue Operations Analyst provides price strategy, price analysis, assortment strategy and promotional effectiveness expertise while working closely Regional Sales teams and Brand Marketing to bring a fact-based highly analytical approach to the business. The role is also a key point of contact between the business partners (MRK, revenue Management, Finance, Distribution…) and the liquor boards for new SKU registration and listing, pricing and all other matters.

The Responsbilities:
Analysis and Recommendation of Action Plans to grow Net Sales Revenue/Hectoliters, and share based on customer, consumer and competitiveness insights in areas of Price, Promotion and Assortment for Key Accounts, Independents, On-Premise and Western Regions
Development of Recommendations /Business Cases leveraging consumer, customer and competitive learnings to grow Net Sales Revenue and Net Sales Revenue/Hectoliters including GPIs, LTOs, new packs
Performs Price/Promotional post-mortems and ROI analyses making recommendaitons for improvements
Weekly management of changing pricing/promotional conditions incl. government
Execution of Price, Promotion and Mix actions, incl. review and alignment with sales, DP, Finance, Brand and Legal
Extensive knowledge of the liquor control and licensing regulations in each province including buy sell agreements, food primary and liquor primary guidelines. Interprets and understand liquor board’s communications and communicate to key business partners impacts timely.
Build and support relationships with all internal and external customers to support our goal to be the customer preferred supplier
Maintain master data files ensuring high quality data and information.
Submit and track approvals as per policy for Audit and SOX compliance purposes.
Build pricing reconciliations and actionable insights for 3rd Party retail coverage

Work Perks You Need to Know About

Opportunity to work for a global brewing company that is part of the Canada's Top 100 Employers
We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to our employees hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.
We take people development seriously offering growth opportunities through talent and development programs and career planning
Opportunity to take part in industry-leading Beer Education. Our employees become Certified Beer Enthusiasts, and we offer an in-house training program that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings
Access to the things that help to make us an Employer of Choice such as employee events, beer allotment, Employee Assistance Program and innovative open concept head office
Participation in our Total Rewards program which includes; competitive base salary, incentive plans, annual merit review, health, dental and pension benefits
Work within a fast paced ever evolving global company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds, experiences and needs

The Other Qualifications!

University Degree in Finance or Analytics
3+ years CPG or similar industry experience in Category Management, Revenue Management, Commercial Finance, Marketing or Sales
Strong analytical skills, ability to uncover shopper and/or consumer insights to develop revenue generating ideas
Ability to translate pricing and/or promotional strategies into actionable plans
Strong communication, negotiation and/or presentation skills based on a solid understanding of working with sales / marketing
Leadership and strategic thinking
5+ years of experience with demonstrated success preferred in the following:
Analysis, working with insights and developing recommendations
Pricing, Promotional and Mix Analytics & Insights
As part of the recruitment process, the candidates will be required to provide consent to complete a criminal background check.
At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.
