**Description**

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe.

We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

Pearson is constantly looking to add to our AMAZING team! We are actively searching for a detailed and highly organized **Principal Analyst** for our Sales Ops, Reporting and Analytics (R&A) CANADA team. One must not only thoroughly understand data, but can visualize how it all comes together for the business and effectively provide your expertise.

The overall responsibility of this role is to design, develop, implement, test, deploy and maintain business intelligence tools, reports, and dashboards. You will support all standard reporting, ad-hoc reporting, statistical analysis and benchmarking, forecasting, predictive modeling, and influence of operational optimization, transforming business reporting requirements into meaningful visualizations, KPIs and dashboards. You will be responsible for an efficient and effective communication stream within the team with minimum supervision.

**The opportunity will be located at our Toronto, CANADA office.**

**Essential Responsibilities: **

+ Gather requirements for reports and interactive dashboards

+ Develop, and support the development of reports and visualizations that address business needs

+ Perform data analysis to ensure on-going data integrity, quality and operational efficiency

+ Analyzing data with standard statistical methods, interpreting the results, and providing summary of data analyses

+ Adherences to publication approval standards for dashboard release reviews and provide feedback to help with process improvement

+ Disseminate information regarding tools, reports, or metadata enhancements

+ Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards, or other tools

+ Maintain catalog of reports, templates, and other reusable knowledge assets

+ Discusses reporting, or information needs with stakeholders, strategic and business partners, and teams

+ Participate in ongoing decisions concerning data collections, data design, methodology, and data analysis

+ Works together with BI Mgr. that design and build data models and internal ETL-processes

**Qualifications**

**Required Knowledge and Experience: **

+ In-depth experience in data reporting & analytics tools, process, methodologies and best practices

+ Knowledge and wide application of principles, theories, and concepts, and working knowledge of other related fields

+ Expert knowledge of Tableau development required; data management & reading code-huge plus!

+ Solid experience in building reports and dashboards with Tableau Desktop and administering Tableau Server – critical!

+ Strong, successful storytelling with data, data visualization design and visualization best practices

+ Knowledge in designing data models for optimal use for analytics

+ High-level analytical and problem-solving skills

+ Solid time management skills - including ability to work well under a fast-paced high-pressure business environment, plan, set priorities, adapt to change, and meet established timelines

+ Ability to manage team deliverables in close alignment with overall departmental and corporate objectives

+ BA in Business Administration or related discipline, or equivalent combination of education/work experience

Pearson is an international media company with world-leading businesses in education, business information and consumer publishing. Pearson fuels the growing demand for effective education and high-quality information in the global knowledge economy, and share a common goal: to help people get on in their lives through education.

Newmarket, ONTemporary$42.76 - $46.48 an hourThis is an exciting opportunity to join a passionate multidisciplinary team charged to make a difference for York Region.
We specialize in data, analytics and visualization and are committed to advancing York Region as a data-informed organization.
The team is strongly customer-service oriented, empowered and charged to provide high-value insights to local government programs and services. The team works in quick iterations, using a collaborative approach with the techniques and tools best suited for solving challenging problems.
York Region is looking for a GIS Technologist with strengths in data visualization, web cartography, graphic design and written communication. You are a ‘’data storyteller’ that can develop compelling web products that fuse multimedia with data visualizations to attract, engage and excite users to ultimately amplify participation in civic matters at York Region. This position will collaborate to deliver on projects, advance data visualization and cartographic practices, and deliver training and other learning events. The position will contribute to the continual improvements in program planning, service delivery, and business operations.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
You will design and deliver rich products – data visualizations and stories – by thoughtfully creating and assembling compelling visualizations with multimedia carried by a narrative to engage and inspire a diverse user community in York Region. You are curious and persistent – working with the team to seek facts in data. You will author narratives to explain data and design/build visuals that enlighten users to the patterns in data.
You will also be required to produce product suitable to print and advance the integration of rich content on traditional websites and into social media channels.
You will work in independently, in small teams and cross-functional teams depending on the nature of the project. You will lead or contribute to product development projects leveraging existing content, creating new multimedia content, and/or sourcing supportive content that advances program capabilities. You will prototype, develop, document and support web products that can employ diverse sources of data.
You will consult with communications teams and business program areas to inspire the uptake in use of data stories for communication plans. You will develop learning materials and deliver learning events that strengthen organizational capacity on exploiting data.
QUALIFICATIONS
You have an undergraduate degree in University Degree in Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Environmental Science complemented with communications or marketing skills, plus one (1) year of pertinent working experience. You have demonstrated experience with data visualization techniques coupled with mapping (i.e. GIS) and publishing content on the web. You have talent in taking robust data to simple messages. You are keen to develop and share best practices with business units across a wide range of disciplines. Demonstrated experience providing 'analytic translation' - providing a clear and inspiring approach to convey meaning from data coupled with visuals and narrative. Skilled at presenting data simply and building creative output in order to turn complex challenges into easy to understand formats. Demonstrated leadership and facilitation skills with a proven ability to manage multiple projects. Ability to interact with clients, staff, management and senior executives to advance business understanding through data stories. Strong verbal and written communication skills, including report writing, presenting and storytelling. Demonstrated ability and willingness to develop strong relationships and work in a collaborative, integrated manner. Strong knowledge of and experience with a variety of presentation, graphic design applications, and tools.
HOW TO APPLY
Please apply online by March 25, 2019 at 4:30 p.m. We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted via email.

The Senior Analyst, Sales Analytics position is located in Toronto and will be a key contributor to driving decisions on Channel tactics and initiatives to improve overall Channel performance and effectiveness. This is an essential partnership role with Marketing, Commercial Strategy, Finance and Sales channel teams to informing and advising on key business decisions by making extensive and systematic use of data analysis and to execute sales business processes with maximum efficiency and effectiveness.

The successful candidate will use their natural curiosity and creativity to evaluate Channel results and produce insights and market intelligence leading to the development of new sales initiatives and improvements or expiration of existing programs. The Senior Analyst will also work as liaison with other groups/departments within the company in order to execute against objectives.

You are expected to have experience analyzing Channel/Market performance data in preferably telecommunications industry, a strong business sense, adaptive and enjoy new challenges. To be successful, you are an outgoing person that develops and maintains strong relationships inside and outside the immediate team, a self-starter with ‘can-do’ approach who is respectful, resourceful, enthusiastic, and detail-oriented.

Primary responsibilities include:

Insights/Story Telling (25%)
o Quantitative/qualitative analysis (ad-hoc, weekly, monthly, and quarterly), specifically focused on Channel performance, costs & channel/customer behavior and provide recommendations to Channel management
o Perform PIRs through performance deep dives, present findings and showcase the “so what” to determine key learnings
Analytics (25%)
o Develop and maintain statistical models and analytics to support initiatives
o Proactively assess results and work with Channel leadership on business changes to drive success
o Build and foster relationships with channel primes and various sections of channel management team to drive the business forward
Dashboard/Reporting: (20%)
o Communicate and assist with data, feedback, and problem solving to all levels of Channel leadership team
o Construct and maintain executive dashboard for SSLT / ELT tracking sales performance against various KPI’s
Forecasting/Target setting (20%)
o Help in sales forecasting and target setting the wireless product and KPI’s
Channel Strategy (10%)
o Work with channel strategy team to align and implement the distribution strategy

Required Qualifications
Good working knowledge of data analysis, and evaluation (Knowledge of SQL coding skills, Statistical analysis, Advanced Excel, Power BI)Ability to connect the dots and create the story linked by data points , strong problem-solving, and analytical skillsExcellent communication and presentation skills (written & verbal), ability and self-confidence to work with all levels of managementBachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing/Finance/StatisticsExperience preferably in telecommunication / consulting industryAbility to work independently and as a member of various cross-functional teamsPositive attitude, ability to work under the pressure of tight deadlines and multitaskProactive, flexibility, and a willingness to work within a constantly changing environment with enthusiasm

General Accountabilities:

Responsibilities include:

Assist in Supplier Performance duties as required including vendor management and preparation for quarterly and annual meetings. Support and remediate when necessary supplier performance issues with the lines of business, legal and supplier.
Lead by example to minimize supplier risk to the enterprise including reputational, financial and safety.
Participate in the development of Supply Chain policies and procedures including analysis, interaction with stakeholders, recommendation, documentation, and implementation.
Assist in activities related to budgeting and reporting including financial budgets, trends and forecasts, including variance explanations.
Participate in Supply Chain related project type work as initiatives are identified. Depending on the complexity, the individual may be a team member or a leader of the initiative.
Supervise staff on a limited basis including assigning and checking work. Provide advice, guidance and instruction, as required.
Perform other duties as required.

Essential Competencies
Working knowledge of categories such as Corporate Services (such as HR, Outsourcing, Pension, Security, Facilities, Marketing, Cyber Security and Technology).
Ideally a working knowledge of Category Management tools, analytics and strategy.
Requires knowledge of financial concepts, principles and related disciplines including purchasing, internal control, information management technology associated with the development of business support and evaluation policies and techniques relative to Supply Chain.
Requires experience within Supply Chain management and control environment to acquire an understanding of Supply Chain practices and procedures, approval processes, financial and information systems and controls, and the structure and relationship of the organization.
Practical knowledge of commercial practices, procurement policies and procedures
Understanding of contract law, procurement law, and to a lesser extent an understanding of Government directives (procurement)
Strong analytical skills
Strong Networking skills
Ability to navigate and negotiate in a demanding, multifaceted environment engaging varying levels of seniority internally and externally.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Sound business acumen
Ability to work independently and on a team
Knowledge and experience in SAP to navigate Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, Outline Agreements, reporting and invoice resolution
Ideally has experience working with Ariba sourcing and Contract Management tools
Knowledge of various software packages such as Word, Excel, to create, modify and review reports and proposals
Undergraduate degree or equivalent business experience (4-6 years), ideally with some specialization in Supply Chain courses including logistics, vendor performance and contract management.

We didn’t get to be a leader in energy delivery or ranked on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations index on our own. We did it in partnership with outstanding individuals who work together as a team to fuel people’s quality of life. Individuals like you. And now we’re looking for just such an individual to join our team.
To learn more about us, visit www.enbridge.com .
This posting will close at the end of day Monday, March 25, 2019.
Primary Focus
This Supply Chain Management (SCM) position provides overall strategic leadership within the Planning and Governance team. The role is responsible for leading a team of professionals to develop short and long-range departmental plans, steward performance monitoring and provide Management Information Reporting. Significantly contributes to the healthy performance of the SCM function in creating value for Enbridge.
Specific Accountabilities:
Lead the strategic planning process for SCM, including the development of the short term (1-2 years) priorities and strategic medium-to-long term (3 – 5 years) plans.
Liaise with Corporate Planning to align with the Enbridge Inc. strategic planning cycle and requirements for Executive planning sessions and Board of Directors meetings.
Lead the development and deployment of the approach to SCM strategic planning including assessment of the maturity of the organization compared to industry benchmarks, alignment with the SCM Strategy on a page (SOAP) and priorities for growth within each year of the strategic plan
Manage the development of the strategic planning sessions through-out the annual planning cycle and the communication of outcomes.
Manage the central SCM consolidation of SCM strategic priorities and performance results on a quarterly basis including development and stewardship of an executive dashboard to support of the SCM VP&CSCO.
Provide oversight on the SCM Function’s business performance, gaps and corrective actions to ensure SCM continuously meets objectives and delivers results.
Manage the continued development of consolidated reporting of key performance indicators that support the SCM strategy on a page, the annual SCM STIP scorecard, and the quarterly executive dashboard.
Manage the research, analysis, and interpretation of industry bench-marking of KPI’s reporting on comparative results and communicating trends.
Effectively prioritizing work assignments and allocating resources while managing stakeholder expectations, establishing and adjusting priorities based on the department’s objectives and the enterprise’s strategic plan.
Coordinate and develop responses to various ad-hoc requests for deeper analysis and reports required for the Director, Planning and Governance; and the SCM VP & CSCO.
Promote collaborative relationships among the SCM leaders, teams, peers, and Cross functional groups.
Lead a team of Specialists & Analysts including goal setting, performance management and coaching.
Responsible for presenting information to Senior Leadership and Executive Management, as required.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with a minimum of 10 years of progressively responsible experience preferably in Strategic Planning, Supply Chain Management, Business or Finance.
Demonstrated experience in a leadership position managing moderately sized team.
Aptitude and communications skills related to leading and acting independently as a people leader requiring minimal supervision. Self-starter and result-oriented.
Proven interpersonal, communication and leadership skills.
Demonstrated ability to be innovative, initiate, lead and manage change.
SCMP or equivalent supply chain management designation is desirable.
An MBA will be an advantage.

Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.
We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.
To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
We are looking for a talented Manager, Business Analytics E-Commerce to join our Loblaw Digital, Site Merchandising Team, which is responsible for sales, profitability, and online store experience. You will be responsible for informing our category strategies, as well as driving sales & profit through identifying growth opportunity areas across our pickup and delivery business.
The successful candidate will be willing to work in a driven, entrepreneurial, and comfortable working independently within a highly collaborative work environment. This position is based at eCommerce Team’s downtown Toronto offices conveniently located in Liberty Village.
Responsibilities:
Drive the category, pricing and assortment strategy through data driven insights and track and report on progress of new/existing initiatives
Drive Sales & Profit: Support the delivery of the online sales and margin budget, by identifying key growth opportunity categories and developing a strategy to improve Product Margin.
Coordinate efforts internally with our product, tech and marketing teams and externally with our partners such as Instacart to deliver against business KPIs
Ad-hoc Analysis: Manage post mortem reviews, sales reporting, campaign retrospectives and Omniture analytics
Improving efficiencies of the team by automating key tasks & reporting where applicable
Stakeholder Management: Engage with key cross-functional stakeholders within Loblaw Digital, such as marketing, operations, customer service and technology to support key initiatives
Job Qualifications
Quantitative based degree / program (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Accounting, Science, Computer Science, Economics)
Exceptional analytical skills and proven capability. Ability to independently deal with relevant tools (Excel, Access, Omniture, Microstrategy, other internal tools)
Strong commercial focus and business acumen
Ability to self-organize multiple tasks well and to complete them on time with a clear focus on quantitative results
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Willingness to work well in a team
Dealing with ambiguity and high degree of proactive “hands-on” thinking and acting
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.
If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.
Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.
Apply today.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular

job_title: Business Intelligence and Analytics Manager- Essex, New Role
job_description:
Building a career at Libro puts you at the centre of a movement to grow prosperity in southwestern Ontario. You become part of a team that is creating change and making a positive impact – socially, economically and environmentally. Libro has an opening for a passionately accountable Business Intelligence & Analytics Manager, in our Essex Administrative Office, responsible for providing direction and leadership to the Business Intelligence (BI) team in support of business intelligence activities.This Manager is responsible to design and implement a set of theories, methodologies, processes, architectures, and technologies that transform raw data into meaningful and useful information for business purposes. The BI team handles large amounts of data and information to identify and develop new opportunities. Common functions of BI technologies are data sourcing, acquisition, integration, warehousing reporting, online analytical processing, analytics, data mining, process mining, complex event processing, business performance management, benchmarking, predictive analytics and prescriptive analytics. The Manager is responsible for shaping relationships and defining objectives with internal and external stakeholders that help transform Libro into a best-of-breed knowledge management organization. - Could you be Libro? The Epic Human we are looking for will:
Work with stakeholders to define business and systems requirements for new information technologies, particularly in the areas of BI, analytics, and data warehousing.
Work with different business units to align the business and IS
Manage a team of business analysts, database analysts and contract resources
Develop strategies and Governance for effective Data Quality
Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting
Select, configure and implement analytics solutions
Data preparation (sourcing, acquisition, integration)
Reporting, analytics, data exploration
BI center of excellence
Information delivery (portals, mobile)
Oversee all analytics operations to correct discrepancies and ensure quality
Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights

Qualifications Required

A minimum of a post-secondary degree/diploma, with 7-10 years of work experience in the fields of BI, management information and/or data management
Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyze data to develop actionable business information deliverables
Demonstrated experience in ensuring work product is dynamic, scalable, documented and accurate
Experience with BI, data manipulation & data science tools and their application (Tableau, Power BI, SQL, etc.)
Experience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or BI deployed in a complex environment
Extensive experience in multidimensional data modeling, such as star schemas, snowflakes, de-normalized models, handling "slow-changing" dimensions/attributes
Experience with relational – SQL – and multidimensional – MDX – query languages
Experience with business driven / self-service BI
A solid understanding of data security and privacy technologies
Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Project management skills desired
A solid understanding of leading edge technologies and best practices such as Hadoop and Big Data

How we bring Joyful in our work:
Competitive salaries and employee pension plans
Comprehensive benefit package including health, dental, and vision
Generous vacation time
Employee wellness programs
Staff accounts and Staff rates on products and services
Staff appreciation programs and awards
Career development opportunities including tuition assistance
A number of other great perks and rewards; fitness club discounts, technology offers, travel and entertainment deals, just for being part of our great team!

Ready to be Libro?
As a 2016, 2017 & 2018 Platinum Level Aon Best Employer in Canada, Libro demonstrates exceptional performance in employee engagement, leadership, performance culture, and employment brand.If you are passionate about helping your community, interested in being part of a remarkable team, and want to help grow prosperity in southwestern Ontario - we want to hear from you! Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Libro is committed to fostering a safe, healthy and inclusive work environment that inspires respect. Libro welcomes applications from persons with disabilities and accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

job_title: Facility Management Data Specialist, Real Property Management
job_description:
$65,328 - $84,928 a yearPosition Details:

Requisition Number: 3244 Location: ON, Toronto

Who Can Apply?: Internal (DCC Employees) and External (General Public) Language Requirement: English

Salary Range: $65,328 - $84,928 Drivers Licence: Yes

Employment status: Continuing Openings: 1

Term Length: Closing Date: 02/04/19



Description
Summary
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is looking for a facility management data specialist to join its Toronto office. If you have prior experience in facilities management, are knowledgeable about building systems and their operations, maintenance and performance, and have an inclination for technology and data analytics, this position may be for you!
DCC is a federal Crown corporation with its Head Office in Ottawa. Its 1,000-strong workforce delivers infrastructure, environmental and professional services to support its Client-Partners, the Department of National Defence and the Canadian Armed Forces, both at bases and wings across Canada, and on missions abroad.
Reporting to the Team Leader, Real Property Management, the Technical Specialist, Real Property Management, will deliver data-driven real property management solutions with minimal supervision to the Client-Partners. This includes carrying out data analysis, validation, cleansing, collection and reporting.
Primary
Complete complex real property project work (e.g. facility reviews, technical reviews, strategic plans, development plans)
Assist with generating facility management statements of operational requirements, preparing business cases and conducting investigations, as required
Develop, implement and manage real property management programs (preventive and demand maintenance administration) and/or energy programs to ensure buildings and systems remain operational and energy efficient (e.g. identify maintenance and repair requirements, determine damage responsibility, prepare estimates and technical reports)
Audit facilities to determine compliance, condition, maintenance requirements, energy efficiency and Client-Partner satisfaction
Participate in procurement planning
Provide project management support to real property information management systems
Develop and maintain effective relationships within DCC, and with industry, the Client-Partners and/or stakeholders
Ensure quality standards are met, in line with corporate and Client-Partner expectations
Other
Assist in drafting real property policy
Prepare monthly reports (e.g. internal and for the Client-Partners)
Support and/or lead business development activities
Manage risk
Other duties as assigned
General and Specific Knowledge
Best practices, methods, trends and legislation in real property, land use, facility management and maintenance methods
Client-Partner, Public Services and Procurement Canada and Treasury Board Secretariat policies and procedures
Project and risk management principles
Formal Education and/or Certification(s) and Experience
Minimum: college diploma in land use planning, engineering, architecture, facility/property management or related field with four years’ relevant experience, or the equivalent.
Preferred: university degree in one of the above fields and/or additional training in project management; professional certification may be required depending on position (e.g. Certified Engineering Technologist or related designation); eligible for certification as a professional planner if working in planning role (e.g. Registered Professional Planner, Real Property Administrator, Facilities Management Administrator).
Abilities
Use applicable computer software and operating systems
Apply project and risk management techniques
Development and Leadership
Provide functional advice and guidance to employees and the Client-Partners
Working conditions
Typical office environment with occasional travel
Some work may be located on construction sites; incumbent may occasionally be required to wear basic safety equipment

Our Mission: Your Opportunity
All DCC employees can make a difference by supporting Canada's troops and contributing to the defence of the country.

Security Level Eligibility

DCC is responsible for the Personnel Security Clearance process. Typically to be eligible for a "Reliability" clearance, you must have resided in Canada for the last five (5) years and to be eligible for a "Secret" clearance, you must have resided in Canada for the last ten (10) years. The process usually involves reference inquiries, verification of qualifications, criminal records checks, and credit checks (as required) and may require fingerprints.

Security Level: Secret

Position Purpose
Reporting to the Program Manager, OMM Process Optimization & Analytics, is responsible for conducting on-site investigations and recommendations to optimize advanced and conventional wastewater treatment processes including numerical and computerized modelling; conducting on-site diagnostic and treatability analysis including bench scale, pilot and full scale levels; conduct research in partnership with academic institutions on advanced wastewater treatment methodologies; provide recommendations for the planning, design and commissioning of wastewater systems to meet regulatory requirements and ISO standards; conduct on-site and classroom training on new advanced treatment methodologies and technologies.

Successful completion of a University Degree in Civil, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering.
Must be registered as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) with Professional Engineers Ontario.
Minimum five (5) years demonstrated experience (inclusive of E.I.T. experience) in the approvals, design, construction and operating processes of municipal water and wastewater collection, distribution and treatment systems, including project management experience.
Demonstrated knowledge of relevant legislation and regulatory requirements.
Knowledge of municipal water, wastewater treatment, collection and distribution system management and operations techniques, as well as complex hydraulic systems including pumping, piping, valving, etc.
Understanding of budgeting process, strategic planning, program development and implementation techniques.
Knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.
Demonstrated report writing and project management skills to meet program objectives and work to tight deadlines.
Demonstrated leadership skills to coordinate project teams; ability to work effectively, independently and cooperatively within a team environment.
Computer literacy utilizing MS Office software applications.

Various STB Research and Development Centre locations across Canada

SE-RES-01, SE-RES-02, SE-RES-03, SE-RES-04, SE-RES-05

$55,870 to $144,413 (The classification level and salary will be determined by the qualifications of the candidate.)
For further information on the organization, please visit Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
Learn more about our Research and Development Centres
Closing date: N/A
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Information on accommodation for persons with disabilities
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment. We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.
Work environment
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada (AAFC) is strongly committed to diversity and inclusion and is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s best diversity employers based on its exceptional workplace diversity and inclusiveness programs. AAFC welcomes diverse applicants and strives to foster a supportive, respectful, fair and inclusive work environment where everyone's contributions and individual differences are acknowledged and appreciated.

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada drives innovation and ingenuity to build a world-leading agricultural economy for the benefit of all Canadians. The impression we make can be seen from the farmer to the consumer and through all phases of producing, processing and marketing of farm, food and bio-based products.

Research Scientists at AAFC play a key role in providing Canadians with cutting-edge science required to support sector and government priorities including addressing environmental challenges and sustainably enhancing productivity.

As a researcher in the Science and Technology Branch, you will lead a scientific research program working with a diverse team across Canada and collaborating with external partners in academia, other government departments and agencies as well as the private sector to support discovery science and innovation in the sector.
Intent of the process
We are seeking approximately 40 research scientists with a wide variety of expertise and experience to provide the Science and Technology Branch of AAFC with cutting-edge science across the breadth of its activities. Particular emphasis is placed on research to support the efforts of Canada’s agriculture and agri-food sector to respond to the challenges of climate change and to enhance its efforts to better conserve soil and water.

The specific expertise sought will contribute to attaining the following goals:

Goal #1: Increase agro-ecosystem resilience and agriculture’s ability to adapt to climate change through a systems approach (including Living Laboratories)
Some relevant areas of expertise include: agro-meteorology; artificial intelligence; machine learning; atmospheric chemistry; atmospheric modelling; biodiversity; ‘omics’ including genomics, phenomics and metagenomics; farmscaping; geostatistics; landscape ecology; climate modelling; data analytics; bioinformatics; environmental science; mathematical modelling; microbiome engineering; remote sensing and sensor networks; systems biology; watershed hydrological modelling; and other related areas.
Goal #2: Develop clean technologies to improve agriculture’s environmental performance
Some relevant areas of expertise include: bioinformatics; bioresource engineering; biochemistry; enzymology; ecological engineering; carbohydrate chemistry; machine learning; mechatronics; metabolomics; modelling; phytobiomics; remote sensing; software engineering; and other related areas.
Goal #3: Increase soil, plant and animal health and increase productivity by unlocking the microbiome
Some relevant areas of expertise include: animal systems and gut microbiome; bioinformatics; metagenomics; microbiome engineering; phytobiome; soil microbiome; microbial ecology; synthetic biology; and other related areas.
Goal #4: Accelerate the identification of superior traits and practices by revolutionizing germplasm development
Some relevant areas of expertise include: artificial intelligence; machine learning; bioinformatics; genome editing (CRISPR); high throughput phenotyping and phenomics; multi-omics including proteomics, metabolomics, and transcriptomics; next generation sequencing; synthetic biology; and other related areas.
Goal #5: Enhancing risk management and reducing losses for producers through big data and predictive analytics
Some relevant areas of expertise include: agro-meteorology; artificial intelligence; machine learning; atmospheric science; bioinformatics; biosystematics; computer programming; data analytics; earth observation; phenomics; precision agriculture; predictive modelling; process modelling; regional climate change modelling; software engineering; spatial statistics; and other related areas.
Goal #6: Develop agricultural practices to enhance the nutritional value of foods (metabolomics) and to reduce the impact of antimicrobial resistance
Some relevant areas of expertise include: biochemistry; bioinformatics; phenomics; multi-omics including proteomics, transcriptomics, and nutrigenomics; microbiome; and other related areas.
Positions to be filled: 40
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
There is a questionnaire that is part of this application process. Provide as much detail as possible to avoid being screened out. Do not copy and paste from your resume when answering these questions. Your resume will be used for additional support for the answers you provide.

Essential Education:
Graduation with an acceptable doctoral degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in a field of science with a specialization related to the duties of the position, such as, but not limited to:
applied mathematics; agroecology; agronomy; animal or plant science; botany; chemistry; biology or micro-biology; biophysics; climate science; ecology; entomology; environmental science; food science and technology; genetics and genomics; ontology; plant pathology and breeding; animal pathology; post-harvest physiology; social psychology; software engineering; soil science; or other specialization in a field relevant to the duties of the position.

Applications will be accepted from candidates enrolled in their final year, but who have not yet completed a Ph.D. program. Completion of the Ph.D. thesis must occur before the date of appointment.

Recognition of foreign credentials: if you were educated outside of Canada, you must have your certificates and/or diplomas assessed against Canadian education standards. You are encouraged to begin this process as soon as possible. For more information, click this link:
Degree equivalency
Essential Qualifications:
Recognized achievement in the form of authorship and editorship of published or unpublished reports, books, papers, peer-reviewed scientific journals, or other communications resulting from:
a) Research, experimental development, or tasking associated with operational equipment and problems; OR
b) Operational research and scientific analysis; OR
c) Planning, analysis and evaluation of Canadian and foreign programs in research and development; OR
d) Developmental work leading to the issue of patents, copyrights, or the creation of improved varieties, functions, or designs, and/or recognition by the professional community of the research environment

Candidates will be assessed on expertise in one or more of the areas listed in the above section "Intent of the process". Expertise refers to experience and skill in using approaches, tools, and/or technologies within a scientific context.
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
Asset Qualifications:
Experience writing grant applications.Experience working on a multi-disciplinary science team.Experience managing multi-year projects with associated human resource, budgetary, and planning functions.Experience interacting with industry and other stakeholders to garner support and research direction.
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
Depending on the positions to be staffed, it may require the use of English, French or both languages.

AdaptabilityTeamworkWritten Communication

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
Calgary, ABAbout Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Drive to meet and exceed targets and timescales
Self-motivated with a strong work ethic that can work with limited supervision and guidance

Supervisor, Talent Services
City Manager's Office
Human Resources
120 King Street West, 9th Floor

Summary of Duties
Reporting to the Director, Talent and Diversity, the Supervisor, Talent has overall responsibility for the supervision of the Talent Specialist staff. This includes responsibility for oversight and administration of day to day activities of the recruiting function. Ensures the delivery of expert and knowledgeable advice to management and staff with respect to recruitment best practices in accordance with the City’s vision, values, goals and Talent Strategic Plan.
General Duties
Supervises and assigns work duties to the recruitment team including task projects.
Serves as a resource for team inquiries.
Regularly reports on the established performance metrics; works with HR analytics, defines and provides the required analytics to drive system and process improvement.
Set recruitment goals and key performance indicators to ensure transparency and success of the recruitment function.
Make recommendations on practices, policies and programs while striving to continuously improve processes and identify opportunities.
Involved in all city-wide recruitment.
Acts as the primary resource for Return to Work programs relating to workplace accommodation.
Collaborates closely with the Talent Specialist team to design and manage the implementation of talent identification strategies, while ensuring alignment with the Talent Strategic Plan.
Partner with the Human Resources Information Systems team to implement desired technological improvements and upgrades, which affect recruitment and selection activities.
Identify, train and build capacity of internal staff to assist with recruiting events, programs and initiatives.
Works in accordance with the provisions of all applicable legislation including but not limited to Employment Standards Act, Ontario Human Rights Code, Occupational Health and Safety Act and all City of Hamilton corporate and departmental policies and procedures related to human resources.
Support the Director, Talent and Diversity with ongoing initiatives.
Qualifications
Undergraduate Degree in human resources management or other related field or an equivalent combination of education and progressively responsible and relevant experience at a senior level.
Proven human resources experience in recruitment and selection.
Proven leadership and supervisory/management skills with an emphasis on the ability to influence and build collaborative relationships across a broad spectrum of internal and external stakeholders. Demonstrated experience as a supervisor to lead change within a complex environment and manage diverse stakeholders needs and interests.
Strong business acumen and an ability to learn a client’s business needs and anticipate required HR support.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Ability to demonstrate highly effective written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated ability to lead in a team setting.
Demonstrated ability to foster process standardization and continuous improvement.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.

We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. Reporting to the Senior Director – Analytics, Insights & Innovation, you will lead our data analytics and customer insights program. Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

job_title: Head of Data Solutions and Analytics
job_description:
Head of Data Solutions and Analytics-014190
Description
Siemens Canada is building tomorrow’s talent. That’s Ingenuity for life.

For more than 100 years in Canada, Siemens has been offering engaging and sustainable employment opportunities to those shaping our future. It’s our tradition to promote lifelong learning, develop talent and recognize success.

Siemens is proud to be one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers 2018 (eight times total), one of Canada’s Greenest Employers 2018 (six times total) and one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2018 (two times total).

Approximately 4,300 employees across Canada work together to deliver solutions for sustainable energy, intelligent infrastructure, healthcare, and the future of manufacturing. We stand for engineering excellence, innovation, reliability and responsibility.

Enlighted has built the leading Building IoT platform with 200 million square feet of installations. These installations were initially sold on an Energy ROI with a promise of future applications. Enlighted is looking to develop applications to leverage its installed base and create customer value utilizing the available data. The candidate will collaborate with partners and end customers to develop SaaS value propositions and implement and deploy proof of concepts.

The Head of Data Solutions and Analytics will report to the CTO. S/he will lead and build a global team of technical marketing engineers and data scientists . S/he will define Enlighted’s strategy and technology direction for the data analytics and solutions, execute on that strategy, grow and develop the team, and influence and collaborate with stakeholders throughout the company. This leader will be expected to learn about existing building technologies and interfaces (Fire, Life-safety, BMS, Asset Tracking) and be current on a variety of big data technologies, and exercise excellent judgment in whether, when and how to adopt these technologies for Enlighted and our customer needs. S/he should be able to recommend Build, Buy vs Partner options for going to market.

Responsibilities:
Driving Results: Sets dramatic, compelling goals and aggressive schedules for improvement. Pursues long-term goals while delivering positive growth in the short-term. Translates the vision of the organization into actionable, quantitative plans. Conveys a sense of urgency, drives issues to closure, and relentlessly executes.
Strategic and Analytical Thinking: Can take a long-term view of the opportunity beyond the tactical and assess disparate data streams and distill them into meaningful and, ultimately, actionable strategic recommendations. Translates data into focused insights and strategies. Poses questions that provoke different thinking about the business. Quickly sees hidden value and how to unlock it. Navigates confidently in ambiguous situations. Makes rapid course corrections when business conditions change; cuts losing initiatives. Able to “deep dive” into the details of the business while staying focused on the big picture and not suffering from “analysis paralysis.”
Managing Teams and Performance: Translates overarching business goals into specific objectives for each member of the team. Holds people accountable for agreed-to results. Identifies and keeps others focused on the most important metrics that drive the business. Follows through on commitments despite difficulties or complications. Proven ability to hire and manage strong teams, and to provide appropriate leadership, structure, coaching, training and development.
Qualifications
Influencing & Communication Skills: Highly articulate and has excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills. Well-honed influencing skills that will enable him/her to persuade minds, handle conflict and get things done across organizations and external partners. Low ego, confident and comfortable working in a collaborative environment. Takes the time to assess “how things are done here” before making changes. Excellent listening and cognitive skills and the ability to influence and drive dialogue by building “buy-in” across the organization on topics related to the consumer, the market, and business strategy. Able to interact effectively across all functions and leverages relationships to move the agenda forward.
Culture Fit: Entrepreneurial, proactive and productive; “rolls up sleeves” and gets things done. Strategic, insightful, with strong problem-solving skills with a practical “real-world” sense of what is actually do-able. Exceptional internal and external collaboration & partnership skills. A brand ambassador – must be a champion of the brand.
Start challenging yourself today in an environment that embraces diversity and rewards innovation with competitive pay, great benefits, and a global network offering real opportunity for growth and advancement.

While we appreciate all applications we receive, we advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Siemens Canada will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

By submitting personal information to Siemens Canada Limited or its affiliates, service providers and agents, you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes described in our Privacy Code available at www.siemens.ca

At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven leaders. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

1) Owning the strategic development and delivery of community engagement plans
2) Forecasting and analyzing labor demand plans for multiple sites across the node

Successful candidates will be a strategic and analytical thinker who can see around corners and demonstrate a passion for process improvement, candidate experience and onboarding process improvement. You will manage an organization of Team Leads and Coordinators who thrive in an innovative, fast-paced environment. Our node teams support over 15,000 hires annually. We roll up our sleeves, work hard, have fun and make history!

Expected Deliverables

Manage and own cost per hire budgets through oversight of labor acquisition, advertising and other talent acquisition costs within the nodeManage and build strategies to optimize candidate cycle time, conversion rates and applicant funnel metrics to benchmarkBuild and foster community engagement and sourcing strategies and demonstrate through data return on investmentHave development discussions and provide detailed feedback to direct reports on performance and growth plansExceed associate experience service levels and KPI’s measured by hiring activity results and defect reductionPartner with site Finance Managers and Operations Leaders to forecast and plan labor demand

Master’s degree or MBA preferredExceptional analytical skills, comfortable working with large amounts of data and communicating data findings, experience establishing and tracking key performance metrics including return on investment10+ years’ experience in business analytics and reporting or demand forecastingCross-functional project management experienceBasic/Working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques

Toronto, ONJoin Accenture and drive innovation for leading organizations and communities around the world. The way we innovate, co-create, and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture and imagine, invent, and apply the newest methods and technologies now.

People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by collaborating to unlock insights and deliver new solutions that realize value for clients. They progress through required promotion in market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales.

Our Talent & Organization Consulting Practice
An engaged, skilled, and motivated workforce is essential to business growth. Accenture’s Talent and Organization practice offers a comprehensive, analytics-based approach. We collaborate with clients to dramatically improve performance through integrated Future Workforce, Workforce Experience & HR, and Agile Organization services.

Talent & Organization helps clients create, lead, and manage the workforce of the future by:
Driving growth through improving performance of people.
Building and expanding leadership capabilities at scale.
Creating compelling digital employee experiences.
Improving pace, certainty and outcomes through analytics and insights.
Agile Organization
Agile Organization is focused on helping clients successfully plan and manage change in an environment that is global, multi-cultural, cross-generational, and virtual - and changing at an accelerating pace. This is achieved using forward-thinking innovation, iterative co-creation, new technologies, creative collaboration methods, and premier thought leadership.

Accenture Agile Organization achieves value for clients in a variety of ways:
Driving creative problem solving using the latest methods to structure creative interaction.
Insight-Driven Transformation based on analytics and behavioral sciences.
Designing an organization that is resilient and reacts nimbly to change.
Creating a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship.
Using social, mobile, video and the tools that follow to provide easy and affordable two-way communication within the organization.
Innovative learning solutions such as augmented/ virtual reality platforms integrated into wearable devices, delivering the latest learning just in time.
Equipping our client’s leadership to lead in an environment of constant innovation.
Implementing the process, tools and techniques needed to unlock to potential of people.
Aligning business process with evolving technologies, collaboration tools, and working styles.
Your Role
The work will be primarily focused on framing challenges, charting strategy, co-creating with agility, and scaling organizational change initiatives to help define and achieve a client's goals. Learn more about the solutions we are providing to clients in these industry areas at: https://www.accenture.com/ca-en/consulting-index

Good Food, Good Life is the very essence of Nestlé. This philosophy can be traced back to our beginnings. Toronto, ONCalgary or Toronto - Manager, Business Analytics and Pricing
We are currently recruiting for the following role in our Calgary or Toronto office.

The Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing will report to the firm's Pricing Innovation Committee and will work closely with the firm's Finance, Knowledge Management and Marketing and Business Development teams. The person in the role will be dedicated to helping us serve our clients in innovative ways.

This position will support the business of the firm and its relationship with its clients, through the analysis of quantitative and qualitative information and facilitating well-informed pricing decisions, cost estimation and pricing predictability, and assessing the impact of various structures for delivering legal services. The work of the Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing will inform strategic, economic and operational decisions made by firm leadership and its partners with a view to gaining and maintaining strong client relationships, continuing to deliver valuable legal services in respect of complex matters, and enhancing firm profitability.
Essential Functions:
The responsibilities of the Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing lie within the categories of (i) Information Management and Analysis (ii) Costing (iii) Pricing and the development of Alternative Fee Arrangements ("AFA") and (iv) Support in Business Development Proposals and the Sales Process.

The Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing will manage and support the development of the firm's processes for:

Discerning innovative ways to more efficiently serve our clients' needs;
Measuring and assessing the costs and value of delivering various streams of legal services;
Measuring and assessing the profitability of various practice areas; and
Pricing the firm’s services, including through AFAs
Strong collaboration with the firm's Finance, Knowledge Management, and Marketing & Business Development teams will be critical. In particular: making informed pricing decisions requires information that resides in the firm's Finance and Accounting systems; the firm's Knowledge Management team assists with the gathering of information on active mandates and post-mandate analysis, provides legal project management expertise and supports time/cost estimation for specific matters; and the Marketing and Business Development team provides competitive intelligence, supports the identification and structuring of AFAs, and manages the sales process. Increasingly, technology is integral to all of these tasks, and the delivery of legal services. The position will require the Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing to quickly become literate with the firm’s leading technology platforms and their potential impact on how legal services can be delivered.

Qualifications:
The Manager, Business Analytics & Pricing shall possess:

Strong analytical skills and detailed experience in the costing and pricing of professional services;
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work in a cross-disciplinary manner by forming strong internal networks; and
Strong project management skills and experience in measuring and monitoring project task plans.
A professional designation of Chartered Professional Accountant, Chartered Financial Analyst (or equivalent), Engineer or Lawyer is required and a minimum of 5 to 8 years of relevant work experience in a professional services environment (legal, accounting, consulting or engineering).

StarTech.com is looking to add two new Data & Analytics Specialists to its Data Analytics Department.

Reporting to the Manager, Analytics, the Data & Analytics Specialist will contribute in areas such as data compilation, analysis, modelling and reporting. This role is responsible for interpreting and analyzing large data sets, turning information into meaningful insights and ultimately aiding the organization in making informed decisions.

In addition, this role will be support the development, monitoring, testing and implementation of data models, and be accountable for the quality, timeliness, and completeness of their work.

This position offers a competitive salary, bonus potential, and benefit package.

In this role you will:

Evaluate and obtain data from multiple sources (internal and external) and interpret / analyze using statistical techniques to provide ongoing reports as well as identify trends or patterns
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
Leverage your Data Modeling toolkit by summarizing and providing summary statistics on data using Excel, understand the functional nature of various pre-built R scripts and update, clean, organize and format data for input into R scripts
Learn and understand the use of BI software to support higher level reporting, which may include the use of dynamic modeling
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and management to prioritize business information needs for various business segments
Partner with IT and Data Governance teams in order to automate “maintenance” reporting where possible
Work with non-technical functional groups to help determine needs and delivery requirements
Present summary outputs to different levels of the organization when needed via clear, concise and well-constructed PowerPoint presentations
Update and monitor the effectiveness of various Data Analytics initiatives
Choose and apply basic statistical tests/methods to measure marketing effectiveness for discrete activities
What You Can Show Us

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Business, Statistics, Technology or relevant cumulative experience
2+ years working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, working with large data sets
Strong working knowledge of data models, data mining, database development, statistical analysis and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, and using statistical packages (SQL, Excel, R)
Robust analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate
Adept at queries, reporting and presenting findings
Ability to communicate results in a clear and concise manner
What we Offer:

Comprehensive Benefit Plan and RRSP Matching
Competitive Vacation Policy
Fitness Subsidy
Training and Development Program
Paid Charity Day and Regular Company Fun Events
Casual Dress Code – Jeans are allowed!
Free Parking and Subsidized Employee Café

StarTech.com Ltd. is a global manufacturer of hard-to-find parts and accessories that connect and enhance business technology. We make it easy for IT professionals around the globe to identify, find, get and use the parts they need to enable their business solutions.

Founded in 1985 by entrepreneurs Paul Seed and Ken Kalopsis, we’re a privately-owned company with our Corporate Office in London, Ontario, Canada. We continue with double digit year-over-year growth and operate in a number of countries worldwide, spanning North America, Europe and Asia. We will continue to expand our global footprint in the years to come.

StarTech.com is a winner of the prestigious Canada’s Best Managed Companies Platinum Club designation, having retained its designation for eight consecutive years. Most recently we have been named by the London Chamber of Commerce as the winner of the 2019 Corporate Icon Award for our substantial long-term contribution to the economic progress of our community.

A vibrant tech company, we offer an enviable workplace with a track record of growth and recognition. We’re big on service and team spirit without taking ourselves too seriously. By conquering new markets and creating career opportunities, we offer you a place to grow. Plus, our commitment to training and development will keep your skills sharp. We also know you have a life outside work. That’s why we offer benefits that take good care of you and your family and support you to actively participate in your community.

Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the government of Ontario. With headquarters in west Toronto, the TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the Province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with varied skillsets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals, but our employees share a few key traits:
We are passionate about public safety.
We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.
We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.
We are more than employees; we are serving the greater good.
We are committed to life-long learning and development.
We operate with the highest integrity.
TSSA provides our employees with competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and — most importantly — a sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the Province, and it’s our people who make it possible.
We are currently looking for Director Strategic Analytics
Job Purpose
The Director, Strategic Analytics is a newly created role. The Director reports to the Vice President, Safety & Strategy and oversees a team of six. The Director provides experience in leading a technical risk management function with an emphasis on strategic use of data, ideally, as it relates to matters of public safety and health & environment. The Director applies informed judgement and best practices aligned to a modern regulator (moving from a compliance to advisory focus built on agile partnerships with stakeholders and operational effectiveness and efficiencies of business processes). The Director ensures alignment with the senior leadership team and in support of the Strategic Plan (2018-2022).
Key to this role is someone who can design, develop, validate and maintain:
an approach to data structure, collection, governance and reporting for the organization that is aligned and supports TSSA’s modern regulatory framework
an analytics strategy that supports effective and evidence based decision making at TSSA
a risk management framework to support TSSA’s delivery of its safety mandate
a safety reporting strategy that effectively demonstrates to all stakeholders TSSA’s performance against its delivery of its safety mandate

Job Description
Execute analysis of safety and other data (internal and external, as appropriate) that supports harm reduction using risk based decision making in all TSSA’s operations, including the identification and prioritization of opportunities to reduce harm
In collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, as appropriate, design mitigation strategies to address identified harm reduction priorities and support their delivery
Recommend, develop and implement processes and tools that enhance safety information collection and analysis for use by statutory directors in safety issue management.
Direct information analysis and reporting of TSSA’s regulatory and safety performance, including the development and implementation of TSSA’s compliance and safety metrics and regulatory impact framework
Promote the incorporation of TSSA’s Risk Informed Decision Making (RIDM) framework into all of TSSA operations
Drive the strategic use of data and analytics throughout the organization. Use business and regulatory knowledge to strategically use data to improve organizational effectiveness.
Convert complex analytical processes into easily digestible communications is key for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Identify and source alternative sources of data
Lead the validation and quality assurance of TSSA’s RIDM framework and benchmark activities against appropriate national and international organizations (e.g. Governments, regulatory authorities, NGO’s & CSA), including an external peer review process
Prepare and present RIDM methodology and application within TSSA to external contacts such as Advisory Councils, Ministry of Government and Consumer Services and other stakeholders
Lead in the management of PSRM staff through activities such as recruitment, performance, career development and occupational health & safety
Develop and manage budget and team activities
Requirements
The ideal candidate will possess the following knowledge, experience, skills and attributes:
University degree ideally at a master’s level
A minimum of 10 years more progressively responsible and accountable experience with at least 5 years in a senior level position.
Substantial experience in a wide range of public policy functions, ideally pertaining to safety.
Well-developed knowledge of legislative, regulatory and policy making processes.
Well-developed strategic and critical thinking skills.
Ability to work with a senior leadership team as a trusted advisor for strategic decisions.
Ideally knowledge and understanding of the key sectors regulated by TSSA.
Excellent relationship building skills and the ability to work effectively across program and operational units.
Excellent people leadership and management skills, and the ability to build high performance teams within an environment of change and transformation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Contributes to the strategic leadership of the organization overall, and actively champions the incorporation of risk and analytics methodologies and applications
Demonstrates success in working with business leaders, understanding their challenges and then structure/source/analyse data to help them drive better processes and enables them to take concrete action based on analytics and data
Experience presenting results to various levels of leadership, able to influence key decisions that have business unit or enterprise impact
Strong focus on data governance including validating data inputs
Translates results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision making
Collaboration, including ability to drive clarity in a multi-stakeholder environment
Proactively identify trends in data and draw meaningful insights about the risk performance of the portfolio
Identify new sources of data that enhance existing capabilities
Leads teams that utilize advanced analytics to assess future risk, opportunities, and effectiveness
Utilizes and implements industry best practices to quantify risk and aggregate exposures
Oversees the development of complex systems and programs that measure risk
May oversee model validation and model governance efforts
Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make recommendations to answer objectives and drive change
Oversees the production of advanced analytical material for discussions with cross functional teams to understand complex business objectives and influences solution strategies
Effectively communicates analytical results, findings and solutions to senior leaders
Provide proactive analysis that lead to insights that directly improve portfolio and company’s financial performance
Advanced software application proficiency in Microsoft Office and a risk assessment application
Professional verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated capabilities to present, facilitate and influence
Strong project management skills and knowledge
Ability to evaluate impact and anticipate implication of important emerging regulatory requirements and political environment on initiatives and business.
Ability to respond to issues and enquiries in a timely and professional manner.
Ability to be flexible and agile

Should you have any questions regarding this exciting and challenging opportunity, please contact:
Tim Hewat, Partner thewat@amropknightsbridge.com
Location Details
345 Carlingview Drive, Toronto
Equity Statement
At TSSA, we value the diversity in our workplace and we are committed to employment equity. We encourage all qualified persons to apply. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Please be advised that your security of your data cannot be guaranteed while it is being transmitted to TSSA.
