Etobicoke, ONTemporaryCustomer Service Intern – Focus in Market Research and Process Improvement
Toronto, Canada
As a world-class provider of innovative logistics and supply-chain services and solutions, OOCL Logistics has an extensive network of more than 130 offices in over 30 countries. We focus on serving customers with global sourcing and supply-chain management needs and creating value through our innovative end-to-end international logistics programs. We are also a leader in providing sophisticated transportation, warehousing and distribution services in the mainland China, offering professional and efficient 3PL and 4PL solutions. As a global company based in Asia, OOCL Logistics is exceptionally positioned to serve both international and domestic customers in the world's fastest-growing markets.
We have an immediate opening for a Customer Service Intern domiciled in the greater Toronto area. We seek customer focused candidates, that want to learn international business and will enjoy helping customers with their cargo shipments from all over the world. As a Corporate Customer Service Intern you will have the opportunity to drive process transformation by changing the current state into a more effective and efficient future state, aligned to the department goals and objectives by providing innovative solutions to real business challenges. You will conduct marketing research aimed at developing our current account base by understanding market trends and needs.
Job Summary
Work with the Customer Service team to:
Develop marketing materials with a customer angel in mind
Collect input regarding current processes and desired criteria or outputs
Develop, test, debug, and modify solution based on user input
Provide training and documentation to users
Qualifications
Strong customer-centric approach with an interest in marketing strategy in the Supply Chain industry
MS Office with immediate application of Excel skills (Data Analytics, Pivot Tables)
MS SharePoint and Access experience desired, but not required
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or similar area of study
Ability to learn new concepts, apply analytical thinking, multi-task and prioritize projects
Candidate should be a self-starter and have strong interpersonal communication skills
Intern Program Outline:
OOCL Logistics Internship Program is a 10-12 week full-time program (37.5) hours per week starting in early June and ending in mid August. The Internship Program will cover training on project related responsibilities, ownership of department related projects as well as exposure to senior leadership and other departments within the corporate office for OOCL Logistics.
For more information on our company, go to www.oocllogistics.com. Please submit your resume, cover letter and most recent grade transcript for consideration for consideration.

job_title: Analytics High Value Consulting, Senior Manager
job_description:
Toronto, ONJoin Accenture Digital and leave your digital mark on the world, enhancing millions of lives through digital transformation. Where you can create the best customer experiences and be a catalyst for first-to-market digital products and solutions using machine-learning, AI, big data and analytics, cloud, mobility, robotics and the industrial internet of things. Your work will redefine the way entire industries work in every corner of the globe.

You’ll be part of a team with incredible end-to-end digital transformation capabilities that shares your passion for digital technology and takes pride in making a tangible difference. If you want to contribute on an incredible array of the biggest and most complex projects in the digital space, consider a career with Accenture Digital.

Analytics Industry Value Teams are an integral part of Accenture’s Analytics practice, partnering with our largest clients to define and enable insights-led transformation. As a Senior Manager in our practice you will help shape and sell industry specific programs, including definition of the analytics vision & strategies, redefine the operating model & talent strategy, and manage the change journey to deliver sustainable business value. You will act as the architect for our most transformative opportunities, enabling an end-to-end analytics journey by bringing the best of our Accenture Analytics organization. You will also play a key role on the leadership team – building a practice, assets, and thought leadership.

Key Responsibilities of the role include:

1. Support High Value Consulting activities:Work with our Canadian Innovation Hub to plan and define immersion sessions in core analytic and digital capabilities specific to client needsLead complex analytics transformation projects from defining the strategy, operating model, value targeting, proof of value, and change management
2. Sales Origination & Business Development:Educate internal Accenture stakeholders about our Analytics offerings and applicability to their industry/clientsFacilitate the development of “request for proposals” responses and contract developmentLead the development of businesses cases for further project sales as determined by the practice
 3. Practice & Offering Management:Shape assets to accelerate sales and deliveryDrive the analytics innovation agenda, including publishable thought leadershipPlay an active role building a practice including capability development and recruitingIdentify and help bring into the practice talented individuals both internally from Accenture as well as externally

REQUIRED SKILLS:
1.General strategy consulting skills
2.Demonstrated ability to lead complex programs
3.Commercial deal shaping
4.Client Delivery & Relationship Management:
Ability to interact with and influence Director / VP / Executives, C-Suite
Ability to interpret the results of analytical insights and translate results to the client into c-suite business value
Ability to explain complex concepts in non-technical language
Strong story-telling ability

YOUR EXPERIENCE:
Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degreeMinimum of 10 years of consulting experience or relevant industry experience with proven track record of making significant client impact and value creationMinimum of 10 years of experience in designing and utilizing analytic solutions in enterprise-wide organizations.

Relevant experience could include the following:
Marketing analytics
Pricing and Revenue Management / Optimization
Personalization and Loyalty
Selling Strategies and Merchandising
Distribution & Channels
Operational Effectiveness (workforce, crew, fuel, supply chain, etc.)
Compliance, Risk and Fraud prevention
Dispatch Optimization, Logistics, Fleet & Network Optimization, etc.
Other core travel-related analytics
Superior understanding of how to manage client relationship, deliver analytics value, and influence senior clients to define and expand data-driven strategies into new applications and markets
Minimum of 5 years of program mgmt. and business transformation
Meet travel requirements (up to 80%)

SET YOURSELF APART:

Preferred Skills:Masters level degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Marketing, or Operations Analysis, PhD is a plusExceptional presentation skills – ability to convey technology and business value propositionsStrong Data Management Technology backgroundValue based constructs5+ years of experience interacting with clients or executives of all levels to review expected outputs, applicability to business challenges, and model measurementWell connected with cutting-edge analytics techniques and be confident about how to apply them to generate insights and recommendations3+ years of experience guiding the data formulation process and exploratory data analysis5+ years of experience guiding and managing a team of practitioners to execute analytics solutions, preferably both onshore and offshoreProven ability to manage multiple simultaneous work streams and shift / adjust resources to achieve optimal resultsEvidence of thought leadership in defining innovative analytics within multiple complex applications spanning marketing, risk, and cost reductionExcellent communication skills to drive thought-provoking dialogs with senior clients

Professional Skill RequirementsProven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environmentProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentDesire to work in an information systems environmentExcellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsExcellent leadership and management skills

To learn more about Accenture, and how you will be challenged and inspired from Day 1, please visit our website at accenture.ca/careers. https://accntu.re/2Hcjdtn

It is currently our objective to assign our people to work near where they live. However, given the nature of our business and our need to serve our clients our employees must be available to travel when needed.

Accenture does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis covered by local law. Accenture is committed to providing employment opportunities to current or former members of the armed forces.

We are committed to employment equity. We encourage all people, including women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities and persons of aboriginal descent to apply.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven leaders. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

In this role, you will work to forecast and analyze labor demand plans for multiple sites across the node; ensuring candidates move through the recruiting cycle quickly enough to meet the needs of the business. Also, owning and managing the candidate pipeline from the point of application to Day 1. Successful candidates will be a strategic and analytical thinker who can see around corners and demonstrate a passion for process improvement. Leaders are effective and motivating as they will have teams consisting of both people managers and specialists. This role is both a strategic and hands-on leadership role. Our node teams support over 15,000 hires annually. We roll up our sleeves, work hard, have fun and make history!

The Role

Manages the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of Workforce Staffing performance via Key Performance IndicatorsForecast labor demand plans and create scalable staffing strategies to build infrastructure and ensure team resource capabilities meet business demandEvolves and implements strategies based off consistently changing needs of the business by tracking hiring event schedules and forecasted attendance ratesPartners with regional operations and Finance management and workflow teams to optimize labor requirementsInfluences and makes recommendations to key stakeholders and decision makers on building appropriate systems processes, and reports; is sought after for input on key decisions and influence to stakeholdersLeads and drives projects, of increasing scale and complexity, and manages programs through completionFosters strong partnership with engagement leader to analyze labor and market analytics ensuring alignment of demand plan and onboarding strategiesAnalyzes the talent pipeline by shift on the site, business line, and node levels by tracking application and contingent offers to goals based on site labor orders and current pipeline fall-outSets KPI’s benchmarks, metrics, and understands how to prioritize to meet and exceed all business SLAsOwns training, development, team culture and morale for Workforce Staffing Optimization Team
Expected Deliverables

Manage and own cost per hire budgets through oversight of labor acquisition, advertising and other talent acquisition costsManage and build strategies to optimize candidate cycle time, conversion rates and applicant funnel metrics to benchmarkPartner with site Finance Managers and Operations Leaders to forecast and plan labor demandHave development discussions and provide detailed feedback to direct reports on performance and growth plans

Master’s degree or MBA preferredExceptional analytical skills, comfortable working with large amounts of data and communicating data findings, experience establishing and tracking key performance metrics including return on investment10+ years’ experience in business analytics and reporting or demand forecastingCross-functional project management experienceBasic/Working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques

The Analyst , Advanced Analytics is accountable for delivering tactical and strategic knowledge through multivariate statistical analysis.
What you'll do
Manipulation and calculation of large complex data from various sources, convey complicated information concisely, simply with clarity, and deliver actionable insights that enable business partners to fully understand key drivers of business results
Conduct sophisticated multivariate analysis/ predictive modeling at product, portfolio, and customer level, and recommend appropriate actions to ensure profitable and sustainable business growth
Design, develop and evaluate business cases that consider multiple drivers and relay those drivers into accurate forecasts, and presented to varying audiences in order to move business idea forward
Collaborate with the business areas to assess opportunities and measure results of campaigns & initiatives and ensure timely communication of strategic and operational results
Develop and implement statistical models using machine learning techniques that include linear/logistic regression, decision trees and k-means clustering analysis

Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g. computer science, engineering, statistics or other analytically based discipline). Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Management Analytics or other professional designation is highly preferred.
Minimum 3 years proven strong business analytical and modeling experience including statistical and segmentation analysis; data analysis and insight development; financial statement and competitive analysis
Must be proficient with SAS, SQL, Data Warehouses on large datasets; R or Python, knowledge of SAS Enterprise Data Miner, Hadoop & HIVE are asset.
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel & VBA and building complex models for financial, portfolio analysis, and comprehensive business case evaluation.
Strategic critical thinker with proven ability to think conceptually (use numbers to tell a story) and make meaning of complex data to develop insights and communicate results
Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groups.
Experience working with machine learning algorithms including linear/logistic regression, decision trees, k-means clustering analysis

job_title: Diversity, Inclusion, and Equity Programs Associate
job_description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,
At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.
Diversity, Inclusion, and Equity Programs Associate
Capital One is committed to building and fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture, where every voice is heard and matters. We recognize the benefits of diverse and inclusive work environments, and championing diversity and inclusion are central to our mission and values, and are part of our strategic imperatives. We believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, and that only by harnessing the power of our collective wisdom can we truly create the best experiences for our associates and customers.

As a Diversity, Inclusion & Equity Programs Associate, you will work closely with the Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) Lead, the People & Culture Team, the Recruitment Team, HR Consultants, and Business Resource Group leaders to implement Capital One’s diversity and inclusion strategy as well as drive Employment Equity compliance. We’re seeking candidates for this newly created role whose education, perspectives, and experience enable them to support creating a welcoming and respectful environment that embraces diversity as a dimension of excellence, and promotes a culture of inclusion and belonging.
Core Responsibilities:
Diversity & Inclusion Program Management
Support the development of programs and initiatives to attract, develop, retain and engage the best people, creating a highly diverse and talented workforce in all areas of our business.
Assist in developing, updating, and facilitating material to instruct employees and people leaders on how to best include, empower and inspire associates – accommodating and appreciating individual differences and leveraging those differences to benefit the company.
Assist in embedding diversity awareness and inclusive practices into people programs and policies to mitigate bias using data-driven approaches.
Develop key communications staples, including core messaging, talking points, internal articles; create content such as blogs, emails, etc. in leaders’ voice.
Develop and distribute internal communications for a variety of channels, including speeches, presentations, intranet articles and announcements.
Support the initial set-up and ongoing coordination of associate-led Business Resource Groups (BRGs) to ensure sustainability, growth, evolution in maturity and recognition of involvement.
Work closely with D&I Lead and BRG Leads to support ensuring alignment across various D&I stakeholders in Canada and the U.S.
Proactively build and manage relationships with key stakeholders across a range of levels, business functions and geographies.
Employment Equity Compliance
Manage reporting requirements to demonstrate progress against employment equity- or D&I-related measures. Partner with the Internal Communications Team, Learning & Development Team, Recruitment Team, HR Risk Team, Compensation Team, and HR Consultants to analyze data, identify trends, and manage the development, implementation and monitoring Employment Equity reports, programs, and plans.
Analyze and prepare human rights and employment equity reports, presentations, briefing notes on an ongoing or ad hoc basis, as required.
Maintain current knowledge and materials related to laws, rules, regulations, and best practices for advancing employment equity, and monitor legal developments in this area.
Serve as the primary Canadian contact with the U.S. Capital One Workday team; recommend, monitor, and advocate for enhancements that enable the improved collection and housing of necessary data.
Skills Required:
Experience with Employment Equity analyses, reporting, and planning, and in corporate Diversity & Inclusion functions
Demonstrated competence in leveraging HR analytics to provide evidence-based guidance and advice
Advanced knowledge of, and experience using Google and Microsoft products. Proficient in Excel.
Familiarity with human resources principles and practices
Respect for a strict code of confidentiality
Attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
Strong communicator and team player, able to work collaboratively within and across all sites while promoting a diverse work environment and modelling inclusive behaviours
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2 years or work experience in corporate Diversity & Inclusion or HR
At least 2 years experience working with excel, pivot tables, formulas, and data analysis
Preferred Qualification
Bilingualism an asset
Familiarity with Enterprise Workforce Data and Analysis

(COPSSC).

Toronto, ONAt Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Sr. Analyst BI & Analytics

Subscriber reporting and analytics are critical for understanding customer behaviour to drive growth and decision making. At Rogers our reports/analytics are one of the key indicators to measure success at Canada's largest telecommunication company.

We're looking for a Sr. Analyst BI & Analytics to provide outstanding delivery for all Wireless and Cable Subscriber Reporting initiatives.

QualificationsAn individual who is focused on delivering results with integrity.Proven ability to initiate change when opportunities to improve are identified i.e. the successful candidate must be innovative to find opportunities and confident/comfortable to make opinions known and support their recommendation.Demonstrated ability to provide recommendations and solutions rather than reporting problems.Strong time management skills to meet deadlines and the ability to remain organized and focused in a very fast paced environment where multiple and changing priorities are the norm.A motivated team player who has previously demonstrated the ability to proactively initiate plans and begin appropriate courses of action rather than waiting for direction.5 years of analytical and problem solving experience with attention to detail.SAS or SQL experience required, certification preferred.Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment as well as independently with minimal supervision.Information Technology, Business degree or equivalent work experience.

Calgary, ABPermanent$57,603 - $59,904 a yearWe are more than planes and tarmacs. Our purpose travels beyond building and managing world-class facilities and runways, and into the communities we serve. The Calgary Airport Authority is made up of nearly 300 employees who are driven by creating memorable and effortless experiences that reflect the beautiful city and region we serve. Motivated by our vision, we strive to turn the airport experience at YYC into one that air travelers are excited to be a part of.


As a primary driver of our city’s economy and growth, we have an opportunity to help make Calgary a global economic powerhouse. We believe our focus on the future will fuel our city’s next generation of prosperity. And we are ready, willing and able to step up to the challenge. At one of Canada’s busiest airports, our team is working hard to create the best possible experiences for the guests and visitors that arrive, depart and connect through our airport, and we need the help of the best people to help get us there.

OUR RISK & COMPLIANCE TEAM
Our team is passionate about the safety, security and environmental compliance at the Calgary International and Springbank Airports. Currently, we are developing mature programs that build this culture at all levels of our organization and within our airport. On one hand, The Calgary Airport Authority has close to 300 employees where you will be empowered to put your own personal touch on supporting a variety of teams. On the other hand, the airport itself is large enough to expose you to a considerable amount of diverse responsibilities and challenges. Our Risk & Compliance experts are high performers who connect with our people, create opportunities and make substantive change every day.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
As an Administrative Assistant, Risk and Compliance at the Calgary Airport Authority, you will be part of a fast-paced, dynamic team that is responsible for the overall safety, security and compliance of our international airport. Reporting to the Director, Compliance & Safety, you will play an integral role in providing administrative support for the Safety and Security teams. Additional support may be provided to the Environment department as required. Your primary responsibilities will be:
Miscellaneous administrative duties, such as: meeting organization, creating presentations, department filing, expense reports, photocopying, event planning, and budget tracking.General office administration including supply purchasing, travel coordination and VISA reconciliation.Coordinate departmental training, maintain training records and develop communications plans.Participate in departmental committee meetings and assist with any program requirements.Create and update user manuals, maps and documents for training programs.Maintain departmental programs and resources including emergency response rooms and first aid stations.Assist with annual Workplace Safety COR Audit as well as other safety/security reporting.

WHAT YOU BRING
Above average knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Excel and PowerPointProven time management skills and attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple priorities with minimal supervision.Proactive problem solver with the desire and ability to achieve results and meet deadlines all while building and maintaining good working relationships.Desire for continuous learning and process improvement.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work well in both a team and individual environment where priorities can change at a moment’s notice.

WHAT ELSE
Experience in workplace safety, compliance, security, auditing or analytics.Post-secondary education.General knowledge of an airport environment and/or previous work at an airport.Familiarity with In-Design or other desktop publishing program.Experience managing databases and document or record keeping software.
Are you looking for the journey of a lifetime? One that’s focused on creating effortless and memorable experiences for millions of guests and travelers each year.

Reporting to the Director of Data and Analytics Transformation, you'll be part of the Enterprise Data and AI (EDAI) team who's goal is to harness the power of Data, Analytics & AI to create a competitive advantage and accelerate growth across lines of business and corporate areas for the bank.
There will never be a “typical day” at BMO EDAI and that’s why people love it here. We reward high-performance and encourage experience across a range of opportunities to learn, execute on seminal projects and deliver material impact to our stakeholders.

What will you do?
Be the Leader for a portfolio of BMO line of business or corporate areas by collaborating with leadership on their multiyear business growth objectives to formulate a joint vision to enable these objectives using Data, Analytics & AI, architect solutions, prepare multi-year roadmaps, identify near-term pilots to prove value, generate business cases and track ongoing business benefits realized
Facilitate collaborative sessions with partners applying design thinking methods to engage stakeholders and generate key outcomes
Partner with business teams as the front line to triage risks and issues related to Data, Analytics and AI
Develop solutions across key enablers including but not limited to Robotics Process Automation (RPA), Advanced Analytics & Machine Learning, Data Quality/Governance, Digital, and Technology for areas such as pricing analytics, customer analytics, performance management, monetization, and others
Identify opportunities to apply advanced data mining and wrangling techniques, machine learning, graph, optimization, automation and other techniques as warranted
Analyze important success metrics, spend and achieved benefits from projects to ensure the team is delivering improvement to integrate analytics and value metrics into the fabric of business decision-making
Be an expert within specific domains of Data and Analytics and represent us within internal forums and at external events (conferences, meet-ups, etc.)

Qualifications
What do you need to succeed? Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Business)
Minimum of 5 years of knowledge in pricing analytics, customer analytics, performance management, or other areas
Minimum of 5 years of knowledge in big data platforms and applications in one or more of the following: Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, Insurance and Wealth Management,
Minimum of 3 years in a strategy role (Analytics Strategy Consulting, equivalent) in which you developed strategies, roadmaps, operating models, business cases, and have structured new opportunities
Experience designing and building compelling presentation material in Powerpoint and other formats
Experience leading and inspiring teams
Experience working creatively and colla boratively to identify solutions
Excellent structured communication (written and oral), presentation and interpersonal skills: ability to explain analytical solutions, techniques, technology and business value propositions
How to set yourself apart?
Graduate degree in AI, Masters in Business Analytics, or Masters in Business Administration
Exposure to BI and advanced analytics techniques (machine learning, data mining, graph analytics, etc.)
Data visualization skills (e.g. d3.js, Tableau, Spotfire)
Experience with large-scale data architecture, data management or similar complex projects
Design Thinking methods and facilitation

We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
About Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.

Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.

Supply Chain Analyst

Role: Supply Chain Analyst

Location: Toronto, ON

Company: Freshii HQ

Reports To: Manager, Supply Chain

The Supply Chain Analyst will act as a lead interface with partners, vendors, and distributors to provide support to the Freshii stores and to resolve supply issues relating to the supply of goods. This individual will manage internal data and analytics to make key decisions and works with our Franchise and DC community to provide daily supply chain support. The incumbent analyzes and monitors inventory levels and provides forecasts to ensure overall goals in service level, inventory investment, and purchasing compliance are achieved. Projects are technical, with a high degree of complexity across multiple teams, both internal and external, and across multiple platforms. The position utilizes continuous improvement principles to achieve key performance objectives in line with business growth expectation and drive the cost to service efficiencies. Supply Chain is a real-life environment where timely determination and execution of the appropriate response to change is daily work.

Responsibilities:

Own DC-level supply chain metrics and drive best practice to achieve KPIs such as case fill rate, delivery on time, forecast, and inventory obsolescence.

Proactively monitor and identify any gaps between supply and demand and create and execute timely solutions to avoid out of stocks (Medium to long term supply plans).

Reduce waste by managing inventory obsolescence.

Supplier Management, ensuring all forecast and supply flow requirements are executed to defined targets/standards

Work with suppliers on the availability of product, production planning and raw material lead times
Develop, execute and monitor the forecast and supply plan for new product launches, transitions, and promotions.

Liaise and communicate with DCs and partners regarding upcoming product launches, transitions, or product shortages.

Regularly monitor the orders of franchise partners to ensure 100% Supply Chain Compliance is maintained across the system.

Manage the listing of new vendors and items with DC’s

Build and maintain strong relations both with internal and external customers

Provide recommendations for the development and implementation of supply chain network changes and processes, which can enhance efficiencies, KPI’s and service for our partners.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in business or Supply Chain certificate (APICS or equivalent)

Knowledge of CPG (Consumer Packaged Goods), Retail or QSR Industry

2+ years of Supply Chain experience ( Supply Planning and/or Demand Forecasting, etc)

Lean Training preferred but not required


Competencies:

Strong customer orientation

Proven continuous improvement and project management skills

Demonstrated strong analytical skills

Have a good understanding of logistics and warehousing

Self-starter and driven for results

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams.

Attention to detail with a strong ability to multitask

Excellent Communication Skills (verbal and written)

Ability to deal with complexity and ambiguity

Proactive, persuasive, influential and flexible attitude


Technical Skills:

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Access and PowerPoint

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
Calgary, ABAbout Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.

Toronto, ONPosition Overview:
The primary role of the Analyst, Business Insights is to provide information, analysis, and insight to various stakeholders relating to revenue, sales order books, and inventory. The Analyst liaises cross functionally with Sales, Planning and Retail Specialist team members in performance of daily duties. Key activities for this role include development of new analytics, continuous improvement of existing structures, and maintaining the integrity of existing reporting.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop new analysis and capabilities (50% time)
Advanced Analytics
Statistical analysis
Predictive modelling & machine learning
New Tool Implementation
Engage with IT and third parties to implement tools
Identify and integrate capabilities of new tools for reporting, forecasting, and inventory management

Work independently & with IT to automate repetitive tasks
Build models to perform required calculations

Develop dynamic reports that are user-interactive
Define alternative reporting structures
Transition existing standard analysis to new tools and methodology
Maintain ongoing reports and troubleshoot issues (25% time)
Order book analysis
Open order reporting
Actual vs forecast performance
Variance investigation
Inventory analysis

Performance tracking vs budgets and driver analysis

Experience with Anaplan or other data modelling systems is an asset

Director, Analytics Engagement
The opportunity
The Director, Analytics Engagement is responsible for the working with business areas across the organization to create Data & Analytics strategies/solutions to improve the value derived from this capability within their business function. This translates into having a deep understanding of business activities, D&A personas, data requirements, report consumption, analytics needs, data usage patterns, solution patterns and solution effectiveness in order to see opportunities to deliver value.
Who you'll work with
This role leads the intake of Data and Analytics needs across the organization both in a business as usual context and in a project context and engages the necessary resources within the D&A program to provide solutions, assistance and assurance of client/project value.
As a member of the Enterprise Service Delivery (ESD) executive team, the director is additionally responsible for providing thought leadership direction and resources to support the continuous improvement of capabilities and services provided by ESD as a whole.
What you'll do
Develop strategies for various lines of business to derive increased value from Data & Analytics capabilities
Accountable to provide effective solution advice to business users and lead them through solution offerings/options with consideration to other programs and technology partners within ESD/IT.
Enablement of D&A personas (End User, Power User, Quant) across the Enterprise
Develop and manage a pipeline of implementation/improvement opportunities for various business areas and delivery oversight
Identifies Data and Analytics business usage patterns and looks to gain economies of scale for similar business needs and trends across the Enterprise.
Leads the curation of Data Consumption Patterns across the Enterprise to enable better understanding of data usage and key focus areas for solution/capability improvement
Coordinates with other ESD/IT programs as appropriate to deliver solutions where the domain expertise resides in another program.
Oversees the governance model for the Investments Daily Process including strategic direction, process standards, operational measures and continuous improvement. Responsible for ongoing improvements to the daily information process and governance
Leads aggregate intake for D&A program, creates and conscience for Enterprise capabilities and opportunities.
Accountable for client delivery and represents aggregate D&A platforms and solutions in coordination with other programs.
Maintains industry knowledge on business/technology capabilities, data platforms, architectures, solution patterns and data used by similar organizations.
Responsible for leading a team of 3-5 individuals up to and including Senior Manager level.
Responsible for multi-functional leadership of 30-50 individuals that are members of the Data and Analytics program
Responsible for making decisions in the prioritization of capability and operational improvements to the benefit of client.
Resolves appropriate interaction models both directly with clients and with other programs in the delivery of value and capability
Recommends solutions to clients in consultation with other partners.
Identifies potential external vendor solutions for business requirements
Runs staffing and associated budgets
What you'll need
Undergraduate degree required. Masters or professional degree preferred.
Canadian Securities Course. Advance designations may be an asset, such as MBA, CFA, FRM.
Solid understanding of Data and Analytics solutions (platforms and desktop tools) in a Capital Markets context.
Understanding of how to create new value for clients, handle demand and associated delivery processes
Understanding of process improvement frameworks e.g. LEAN
Good understanding of leading solution delivery methods including project management practices and Agile Software development methods
Minimum of 15 years of significant client management experience including at least 5 years in a management/senior leader position.
Excellent client management skills including expectations, requirements, delivery oversight, client reporting and effective communication.
Substantial delivery experience including projects, enhancements and business as usual improvements.
Meaningful experience in data operations, data management, securities database technology and/or analytical applications within an established financial services or investment fund management institution.
Exposure to leading Analytics tools and industry offerings
Investment industry and/or capital markets experience, including multi-strategy/multi-asset exposure
Strong relevant technology skills including relational databases, dimensional models and data transport methods.
Proven capability in talent management, developing and leading senior data management professionals and experts.
Excellent communicator, demonstrating strong interpersonal, teamwork and presentation skills. Must be able to take very complex data and concepts and make them understandable and actionable by both business and technical experts. Excellent verbal and written communication capability demonstrated at technical and business/stakeholder levels.
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills, planning and organizing and organizational change disciplines.
What we're offering
Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Comprehensive employer paid benefits coverage, including a Health Spending Account
Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan
Competitive time off
Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Expedia
As part of the PR and Social Media team, you will contribute to the team's objectives of building positive community engagement through various social media channels and managing the day-to-day posting, responding and overall communication on our social channels. You will assist in content calendar development, content creation and distribution across various social platforms with a keen eye on community engagement to deliver best-in-class content marketing to our audience, and to ensure social KPIs are met alongside stakeholder objectives.
Are you ready to embark on this journey with us ?
What you will do
You will assist in developing social media content strategy and guidelines for storytelling that delights our audiences, with a global lens.
You will actively post and engage with travelers throughout our communities to drive positive engagement and build brand affinity.
Drive results and implement creative ideas within a fluid and fast paced environment while working collaboratively with a high-energy group of individuals who are passionate about the brand.
Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in terms of style, quality, and tone of voice.
You will assist in the development and ongoing optimization of the community management process.
Work closely with other team functions such as Brand, PR, Legal, Customer Marketing, Merchandising, Partnerships, and SEO to manage the creation (ideation, copy writing, proofing, asset creation) and posting of a monthly content calendar.
Monitor social media channels for potential issues and flag to necessary stakeholders.
Administer social media programs by managing day-to-day social media channel presence and response activity including sweepstakes and/or contests.
Project manages social media plans with partners where needed.
Assist in the reporting of all social media marketing efforts across all social media channels to ensure social KPIs are met along with stakeholder objectives.
Proactively flag real-time conversation opportunities that are on brand that are relevant to engage in.
Communicate with sister brands various best practices for ongoing learning and development.
Collaborate with Global Customer Operations to refine our crisis management monitoring and response protocols.
Who you are
You have a bachelor’s degree level, or higher.
3+ years experience in a marketing or communications role.
1+ years experience community managing through various social platforms.
You are up-to-date with latest advances in digital media.
Beginner knowledge of analytics, tracking and social media monitoring tool.
You are self-guided; creative; responsible; energetic; eager to work with other departments and independently; has a desire to see measured results.
You are detail-oriented individual who possesses excellent writing, communications, and interpersonal skills.
You have experience in multi-media content creation with basic design skills preferred but not required.
You have strong project management and organizational skills.
You are comfortable with intense working environments and tight deadlines.
Why join us ?
Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so.
Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

Research Coordinator, Sunnybrook Research Institute
Employment Type: Temporary Full time, one year renewable term
Hours: 37.5 hours/week (1.0 FTE)
Department: Evaluative Clinical Sciences, Sunnybrook Research Institute
Job Summary
Dr. Andrea Gershon, MD MSc, Senior Scientist at Sunnybrook Research Institute and ICES, and Associate Professor at the University of Toronto is seeking a temporary, full-time Research Coordinator. The successful applicant will be part of a health services research team collaborating to study respiratory disease in Canada using large health databases. Primary responsibilities will include developing research plans, completing statistical analyses, maintaining study documentation, and assisting in the preparation of manuscripts and other knowledge translation outputs.
Key Responsibilities
Contribute to the development of research study protocols, including study design and analytic procedures
Undertake bio-statistical analyses of large health databases in accordance with study protocols; update data tables and figures
Critically appraise and synthesize literature, retrieve articles, and maintain citation databases
Contribute to the preparation of abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications and other relevant deliverables
Assist in the preparation of grant applications and submissions to Research Ethics Boards; monitor project timelines and maintain study documentation in accordance with institutional policies and procedures
Co-supervise (with PI) research assistants, trainees and students, and assist in the training and orientation of new staff
Attend and participate in project-related meetings, including research team meetings
Assist with other research-related activities as needed
Qualifications
Master’s degree in epidemiology, public health or a related field
Knowledge generally gained through two years of related experience
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with quantitative statistical analysis, epidemiological methods and data management, preferably using SAS or R
Experience in managing epidemiological and/or health services research projects; familiarity with the use of large health databases for the conduct of observational studies
Strong organizational, time management and priority setting skills
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, with a demonstrated aptitude for report and presentation preparation
Ability to function independently yet collaboratively within a team
Salary: Commensurate with experience
Application Instructions: Please send a cover letter and curriculum vitae in one PDF document to tatiana.son@sunnybrook.ca by April 12, 2019.
We thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates short-listed for interview will be contacted.

job_title: VP, Quantitative Analytics & Data Science - TalentNeuron
job_description:
Quebec City, QCWhat makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage. You’ll deliver must-have research through compelling client interactions, and contribute to our double-digit growth by providing clients the unbiased insight and advice they need to make the right decisions every day. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration, you’ll help clients deliver on their mission-critical priorities, grow your career and increase your industry impact. We value hard workers — and reward you with unlimited opportunity. If you’re looking to explore what’s next in technology and business, Gartner is looking for you.
TalentNeuron is the world’s leading source of global demand, supply, cost data and predictive analytics to help clients make smarter talent planning and recruiting decisions. Our clients include market leaders like Microsoft and Verizon and hundreds of other large and mid sized enterprise companies, and the business is growing quickly. The TalentNeuron data science and operations group is the backbone of the TalentNeuron suite of products and is a key partner to all other parts of the business leveraging our data and insights.
The VP, Team Leader will drive large-scale, multi-TB data quality and quantitative analytics efforts through a diverse team of data science, data product, quality management, platform and operations professionals. This role will create the vision of how we collect, transform and analyze an extremely broad and complex set of data assets to drive impact for our clients.
What you’ll do:
Lead efforts to produce large-scale data sets into actionable data product for end-user clients
Develop, incorporate and promote best-in-class data modeling techniques
Incorporate the highest standards and methods for data quality across raw, processed and modeled data
Work backward from stakeholder needs to develop data products that delight
Think with a platform mindset to build reusable data sources, approaches and models
Responsible for building, leading, motivating, and managing their assigned team
Exhibit the 5 Gartner Leadership pillars, and build a high-performing team which collaborates across Gartner
Lead recruiting, team member development, training, creation and tracking of appropriate team metrics
Partner with Product and Customer Success teams to ensure data enhancements are aligned with product plans and customer requirements
Partner with Technology team to drive scalability and consistency through technical improvements in our data collection and transformation methodologies
What you’ll need:
University graduate (Masters preferred) with a minimum of 8 years’ experience in relevant area (quantitative analytics, research or data science)
Ability to apply structured frameworks to complex problems – helping clients and team members take action
Ability to craft a cohesive strategy across disparate teams with a keen eye on revenue outcomes and process effectiveness
Experience building and managing effective teams with diverse skill sets
Who you are:
High tolerance / evolved ability to lead and manage ambiguous situations
Demonstrated ability to lead diverse, complex data teams to deliver usable, scalable data products
Strong understanding and application of product management disciplines, especially in the data space
Excellent relationship skills
Superior verbal, written, facilitation and presentation skills
Demonstrated collaboration and team leadership skills

Audi Canada

Some call it work. We call it passion.
We could offer you an ordinary career.
Trouble is, we only deal in the extraordinary.

Audi stands for Vorsprung durch Technik. Progressive. Sophisticated. High Performance. Passion. Uncompromising standards.

Just as Vorsprung brings out the best in vehicles, a career with Audi can bring out the drive and dedication of some of the finest people around. The Audi family recognizes the fact that even though we craft some of the finest vehicles on the planet, our work would be in vain without the people we serve, and the people with which we share our passion.
Become a part of the Audi success story full of growth opportunity and personal career development. Join a team of performance driven professionals who value motivation, responsibility, collaboration and exciting work. Audi, with its leading global presence, offers its employees numerous developmental opportunities locally as well as internationally.


We are currently looking for a CRM & Analytics Manager
in our Canadian Headquarters in Ajax, Ontario

As a CRM & Analytics Manager, you will be responsible to develop and execute Audi CRM campaigns with the new Group CRM system, and to analyze and report brand metrics. You are a Marketer with focus on CRM Marketing, Brand Marketing (either agency or client side) and possess excellent communication skills along with analytical thinking.
Reporting to the Manager, Marketing Communications, you will maintain the strategic vision for CRM strategy ensuring loyalty, acquisition and lead campaigns are customer centric, timely and meet predetermined KPIs at Audi Canada.
Primary Responsibilities:
Leverage the new Group CRM system by contributing to the overall growth and development of the Audi brand via maintenance and support of the loyalty, acquisition and lead management strategy in Canada.
Oversee all the programs and campaigns linked to the new seamless customer journey via digital channels.
Work with agency partners to collect, analyze and report all marketing metrics
Audi Magazine: Creating and managing content for the issues (with the steering of the agency)
Ensure all CRM platforms are updated with current Audi product and brand information, include the loyalty program, AudiConnect, myAudi, etc.
Drive overall strategy, tactics and targets for all activation and lead management topics. Manage the Lead Acquisition, Management, Distribution and Reporting process at all customer facing Events, Promotions, and Online.
Oversee the lead management strategy and ensure lead targets are met
Work with media agency, digital/CRM agency to collect and identify implications and actions
Manage CRM marketing budget (invoice processing; ensure tracking documents are updated, etc.).
Qualifications

What we’re asking for:
Bachelor’s degree (Marketing or Business major preferred)
Automotive experience desired (but not mandatory)
A great attitude and proven ability to be an effective business partner, team player, and collaborator
5-7 years of CRM Marketing, Brand Marketing experience, including either agency or client side
Proven success in Retail Marketing and Dealer Support
Partners at all levels of the organization, with ability to negotiate and influence to achieve results
Excellent communication and presentation skills; Fluency in French an asset
Proven track record in CRM system
Flexibility for up to 10% travel within (Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver) US and Germany


What you’ll get in return:
The opportunity to shape and grow an exciting, world-class brand that has huge ambitions in Canada
A flexible, collaborative, dynamic, and fast-paced work environment with an award-winning employer
Many opportunities for personal and professional development
Opportunities to participate in exciting brand and company events that give back to the community
Competitive employer paid benefits, pension and compensation package
And much, much more!

Mississauga, ONThe Peel District School Board (PDSB) is one of the largest school boards in Canada, with more than 150,000 students in over 250 schools. At PDSB, everything we do is designed to help all students achieve to the best of their ability. We have the incredible opportunity to inspire a smile in each student. Our collective, daily efforts make a positive difference in the lives of our students, their families and the world. Guided by our mission, vision and values, we build positive places for learning and working ... together at www.peelschools.org

We are currently accepting applications for a Statistical Data Analyst

Your proven skills in research design and methodology for advanced qualitative and quantitative research and analytics will drive your success in supporting Peel District School Board (PDSB) Curriculum and Instruction initiatives through comprehensive research efforts – from assisting with the design of school and system-wide surveys for various stakeholders, to interpreting data and writing reports.

Job Duties/Responsibilities and Details

Reporting to the Chief Research Officer, Research and Accountability, the successful candidate will design complex data problems and discover evidence-based knowledge through the use of advanced statistical methods, algorithmic, and visualization techniques. The Statistical Data Analyst will require proficiency at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized databases and computing environments and will work independently and as a part of a team of education researchers within Peel District School Board.

Duties will include: design research project analyses and databases; identify relevant and available data;create, select and/or modify evaluation measures; conduct advanced statistical analyses using a variety of procedures and software; perform rigorous quality control checks on work products to ensure data accuracy and integrity; manage and maintain large datasets; retrieve and analyze data from provincial and national surveys to enhance or further the understanding of issues that relate to the Peel District School Board and our stakeholders; monitor and provide timely constructive feedback on project team tasks; retrieve and analyze data from provincial and national surveys to enhance or further the understanding of issues that relate to Peel District School Board and our stakeholders; develop and maintain large-scale database; gather, analyze and interpret data at the school, family of schools, board, community, regional and provincial levels for future planning; develop and prepare and prepare reports and/or manuscripts; conduct reviews of research literature, current educational research and identify implications; assist in designing school and system-wide surveys for various stakeholders; collect and manage qualitative and quantitative data; write a wide range of research reports; assist in presenting results; collaborate with team members; liaise with other school boards and community agencies; assist with partnering with community and regional agencies and partners; and other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Statistics, or related education, social science discipline or equivalent
Minimum of 5 years related experience in a research environment
Demonstrated experience and skills in research design and methodology for advanced qualitative and quantitative research and analytics; high level of proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, multivariate testing, data mining, multilevel modeling, latent variable modeling and various regression models
Knowledge of the Ontario curriculum, teaching models and current resources and documents
Good working knowledge of SPSS, Power Bl, R, Python, GIS software, Access, Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Excellent organizational and time management skills for coordinating multiple ongoing projects
Excellent written and oral communication skills for report writing and presentations with attention to detail
Ability to work under tight timelines is required
Ability to work as a part of a team and independently
Demonstrated commitment to working in a diverse school community and/or work environment
Record of satisfactory on-the-job performance while employed by the Peel District School Board


Commitment to Equity

The Peel District School Board is committed to equity in employment. We are committed to equitable hiring practices that allow us to hire qualified staff who reflect the full diversity of the Region of Peel. We will make any reasonable accommodation, based on any of the human rights protected grounds, to support candidates to participate in the hiring process.
When contacted, candidates will be provided with an overview of the various elements of the selection process, such as test and skill demonstrations. We will provide employment accommodation (i.e. an accessible location, rescheduling of interviews that fall on holy days) if we are advised of an applicant's needs in advance of any part of the selection process.
Criminal Record Check

Successful candidates must provide a satisfactory Criminal Record Check (CRC) prior to commencing employment. Please review the requirements at the CRC link.

Recruitment Process

We appreciate the interest of all applicants, but will only be contacting candidates whose skills, experience and qualifications best meet the requirements of the position. All communication to applicants regarding this job posting, including an invitation to complete skills assessments and/or a job interview if applicable, will be made through email. Candidates are encouraged to regularly check their email as listed on their applytoeducation.com account.

The Data Scientist represents the foundation of a data driven culture that has made Wal-Mart an leader in the retail industry. Individual in this role will use a wealth of ecommerce, physical store and external data available to understand customer behaviour improve operational efficiencies and provide actionable insights to stakeholders so they can make smarter, data-driven decisions.
The successful candidate will have an established background in solving complex problems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and the motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. Our team is small, creative, diligent, highly entrepreneurial and business-focused.

Position Responsibilities
Extract data using data mining techniques to uncover trends and derive insights; analyze forecasting metrics, perform exploratory data analysis with the goal to uncover trends, find root causes of forecast inaccuracies and develop innovative features that can drive additional value
Solve complex data science problems using the breadth of tools available at Walmart – including problem framing, data preparation, model building, model deployment and output consumption in the form of dashboards
Manage stakeholder expectations and design data science solutions which align with our pillars of maximizing revenue, reducing costs and improve customer experience
Perform ad-hoc analysis and present results concisely and persuasively to stakeholders
Highly driven, results-oriented, creative and a problem solver with an ability to prioritize and set direction in a fast moving environment; Possess a curious attitude with collaborative and resourceful working style
Enable others in the organization to utilize your work by sharing your work as well as act as an ambassador for Data Science within Walmart Canada
Canada Walmart DivisioneCommerce
Qualifications
Degree in a STEM discipline (applied mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, machine learning, econometrics etc.)
Familiarity with the consultative process which cater to the internal clients’ advanced analytics needs
Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms
Knowledge of building time-series models by taking into account dynamic variables
Good knowledge of best practices in Statistics and Machine Learning
Strong project management skills
Fluency in Python/R and familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop
Must be able to explain technical concepts and analyses implications (tell a data story) clearly to a wide business audience/possess excellent communication skills, and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
Experience in e-commerce or a related field is an asset
AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

job_title: Account Executive (Mid-Level Sales Manager) - Immediate Need
job_description:
A Career in Our Sales Function:

Sales is an organization within P&G that is responsible for managing the P&G business and our relationships with Canada’s largest retailers. When you join the Sales function at P&G, you hit the ground running. Utilizing proprietary research, industry & brand understanding, and real data, you will create and present your own business plans to your customer, then execute your plan through managing a multi-million dollar budget.

In addition to selling, you become a strategy consultant, working with the largest retailers on the biggest brands in Canada. This work will directly impact shelving assortment, product showcases, and in-store marketing at your retailer. You get the satisfaction of seeing your work come to life in the Canadian market. The result is that you grow both P&G's business and the business of your retailer(s).
Descriptions of roles at the Account Executive level:

Account Executives are responsible for delivering sales and share objectives on specific categories at an assigned customer by delivering excellence in the Sales Fundamentals: Distribution, Shelving, Merchandising, and Pricing at the Customer.
Category Development Account Executives are responsible for delivering shelving & distribution fundamentals on specific categories at assigned customers. This will be accomplished by delivering excellence in analytics, consumer, category and customer understanding, and presenting category growth solutions to our retailers via improvements in distribution & shopper based shelving and consulting on category strategy.

Category Account Executives are the experts regarding a particular category of brands, who continually interfaces between all functional units of the business and all sales personnel to create and execute winning propositions at retail. These roles are viewed as the cornerstone of P&G’s go-to-market strategy, a quintessential experience for a manager focused on moving into Senior Executive Leadership, and represent key building blocks for career development. They provide the successful applicant with analytical, leadership and strategic selling skills applicable in a wide range of future positions.
When you demonstrate the ability to handle more challenging work, you'll be given assignments with larger, more complex accounts or that offer increased responsibility. Any new assignment will be designed to help you improve your skills and prepare you for opportunities to build businesses and lead people.

Skills and Experiences
Bachelors or Master’s degree
Candidates with 2 to 10 years’ experience in key account management, especially in the consumer goods sector, would find these positions to be a good fit
Knowledge and proficiency of how to extract, analyze and make clear business recommendations using Nielsen data
Natural leadership, tenacity and an entrepreneurial spirit
Superior communication skills that will enable you to lead the thinking of decision makers internal and external to P&G

To be reviewed, your resume must be copied & pasted to your online application; we will not review any attachments, including cover letters, transcripts, or PDF resumes. Finish your job application AND assessment as soon as possible as we will be screening resumes on a rolling basis to fill immediate needs.
If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers.im@pg.com to provide your contact information. P&G Talent Supply staff will contact you within 1 week.

About Sanofi Pasteur
Sanofi Pasteur, the vaccines division of Sanofi, is the largest company in the world devoted entirely to human vaccines. Our driving goal is to protect people from infectious diseases by creating safe and effective vaccines. Our company distributes more than 1 billion doses of vaccine each year, making it possible to vaccinate more than 500 million people across the globe. Sanofi Pasteur offers the broadest range of vaccines in the world, providing protection against 20 bacterial and viral diseases.
Sanofi is dedicated to supporting people through their health challenges. We are a global biopharmaceutical company focused on human health. We prevent illness with vaccines, provide innovative treatments to fight pain and ease suffering. We stand by the few who suffer from rare diseases and the millions with long-term chronic conditions. With more than 100,000 people in 100 countries, Sanofi is transforming scientific innovation into healthcare solutions around the globe.

Promote a strong quality mindset with a strong focus on data integrity, validation and data governance

MS or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computational Biology or a similar technical field
Minimum 3 years industry experience
Strong experience in delivering insights through statistical data analysis, data modeling and data visualization
Experience using tools such as R, SAS, SAS JMP, Python, Matlab, Statistica
Experience with developing business requirements, use cases and user stories in a data analytics context
Experience with data warehousing and business intelligence tools and platforms
Exposure to best practices in data management and data governance practices
Ability to deliver projects with complex requirements and a strong customer focus
Ability to influence and communicate with a diverse group of stakeholders from multiple levels of management
Ability to succeed in a team-oriented environment under very dynamic conditions
