Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Under general supervision, the Senior Workforce Management Consultant is a member of the Operational Effectiveness team which supports staff in Operations (both Field Operations and Business Centre Operations) geographically spread over multiple locations. This position is responsible for supporting the Operational Effectiveness team with strategic projects, communications, analysis and assistance with workforce operations. This position is also responsible for providing pro-active analysis related to proper management of Operations staffing levels, capacity utilization, inventory and related metrics. This position does not lead staff.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Stays current and understands the required internal workflow and business strategies of Operations with a focus on both Back and Front Office units which include but are not limited to Policy Service, Billing, Underwriting, Customer Service and other related support group.
Support established Workforce Management (WFM) processes as well as possess the ability to think differently about operational approaches in our workforce management support of new and ongoing strategic initiatives.
Manage a portfolio of workforce projects.
Define best practices and proper use of workforce applications.
Gather data, establish reports, and analyze trends in a timely manner to help improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the local operation.
Effectively present results to various constituencies within the organization to positively influence results.
Work with partners to understand key business drivers and impacts on demand/capacity.
Effectively translate strategic objectives into staffing impacts and equip management with the information required to understand and manage the business.
Fully understand how overall variances in results effect staffing and communicate analysis to develop actionable approaches to meet Service Levels (SVL) objectives and drive change throughout the organization.
Ensure ongoing processes such as PTO management and Shift Bids are supported within established standards and deadlines.
Use current reporting technology, data management applications to access the required data needed to support WFM analytics.
Apply basic statistical approaches to results and develop recommendations that are focused on the key attributes that will drive appropriate actions.
Understand how databases relate to one another and work with and / or lead efforts with various technical groups towards gaining access to data needed to complete WFM analysis efforts.
Effectively participate in large operational initiatives as a WFM subject matter expert.
Work across the Operations team to support Forecasting, scheduling and Intra-day management as it relates to modeling, reporting and overall support of strategic initiatives.
Other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS degree required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
5 years of experience in an Insurance related field preferred. Operational Workforce and Data Management experience with a solid understanding of both call center and back office environments preferred.

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Ability to work with and influence business teams to understand business challenges and identify needed information to make staffing and metric recommendations that meet business needs.
Strong analytical skills, collaboration skills and leadership skills.
Creative thinker with excellent analytical/problem-solving capabilities and a demonstrated ability to analyze complex issues and translate information into actionable tactics.
Proven ability to influence and gain the respect of peers and higher levels of management.
Proven ability to be flexible and easily respond to changing priorities and balance multiple / competing requests while maintaining a positive approach and accountability for assuring proper outcomes.
Above average attention to detail with the ability to properly track and prioritize analytical work, prioritize requests and communicate back status to Operations management and key internal clients.
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills ability to clearly, concisely and convincingly present analyses and recommendations as translating complex WFM concepts into understandable approaches is key to influencing strategic initiatives.
Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment (Daily Frequency) Sitting (Can stand at will) (Daily Frequency) Use of Keyboards, Sporadic 10-Key (Daily Frequency)

Licensing or Certificates
None

Corporate Analytics & Innovation manages the Engineering Governance for the Corporation including Professional Practice and the Engineer-In-Training (EIT) Rotation Program.
As an EIT, you will be assigned to one of the participating business units for up to one year and then re-assigned on a yearly basis. Participating business units include Water Resources, Water Services, Waste & Recycling Services, Transportation Planning, Transportation Infrastructure, and Calgary Transit. Successful candidates will perform a wide variety of engineering work from design through to project management. At the end of the four-year rotation program, or once the Professional Engineer designation has been obtained, trainees are expected to seek placement in a regular permanent position at The City.

Engineering degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering, and registration as an Engineer-In-Training (EIT) by the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of Alberta (APEGA) by the first day of work.
A new or recent graduate with a maximum of 1 year of previous engineering experience.
Well-developed communication skills with a focus on problem solving complex issues in a professional manner.
Strategic and analytical thinker with strong project management and planning skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment while engaging internal and external stakeholders.
Success in this position requires the ability to build strategic working relationship, continuous learning, innovation and strong planning and organizing skills.

$124,000 a yearDirector Product Management
Job Description


GoFor Industries, is an Ottawa based SaaS/PaaS based logistics marketplace serving the construction industry. Our unique hybrid approach to last mile logistics management, mobility and telematics is driving significant growth and we’re looking for a highly motivated and experienced professional to serve as our Director Product Management.
The Director Product Management will work with our technology team to define GoFor Industries’ platform SaaS strategies, specifically around data, reporting, analytics, platform administration, and integration (API) services. The right candidate understands that products need to be market driven and will create a feature validation process working with our external partners to define innovative solutions that will strengthen GoFor Industries position as a market leader.
The Director Product Management will also have responsibility for leading NPI schedule tracking and timely delivery to milestones, project execution, market research, market analysis, market positioning as well as leading product strategy day to day within an executive team setting driving the necessary workflow, providing status to management, identification and management of barriers and risks. The Director of Product Management works to develop the strategic product plan, product requirements, and go to market strategies.

Applicants should have a strong understanding of the enterprise SaaS space, particularly in the areas of cloud native software development, mobile applications & experiences, AI and business intelligence. Applicants must also have demonstrated experience leading products within the Logistics vertical and deep understanding of not only last mile delivery but also LTL and FTL. Applicants should also have excellent communication and management skills with experience in the specific competencies necessary to effectively lead a cross functional NPI process.


10 years product management experience
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing or related field
5 years with last mile, FTL or LTL logistics experience
5 years working in an agile environment
Experience working with internally led off-shore development teams
Must have excellent communications both oral and written, will lead all product related marcom activities.

Edmonton, ABCWB Financial Group is a diversified financial services organization providing specialized service in business and personal banking, trust, and wealth management across Canada. Our approach to business is straightforward: we work hard and with integrity, we practice common-sense thinking, we’re accountable for our actions, and we care about our people. We’re incredibly proud of the work we do every day to help our clients grow their businesses, manage their money and realize their financial potential! Learn more at http://www.cwb.com .
Integrity. Accountability. Respect. Common sense. Caring.
At CWB Financial Group, we want the right data to propel us forward. If you are looking to become part of a highly engaged and talented group of individuals, read on and reach out!
Within our Information Services department, you will be responsible for new development, enhancements, maintenance and support for all data warehouse, datamarts and reporting for the Canadian Western Bank Group. This will involved taking personal responsibility to ensure documentation of all requirements and development details are aligned to audit expectations. Supporting business critical data outputs, you will learn all about the data that feeds business decisions. What data is the most integral? What should be analyzed? How can this information drive important business decisions? Come join our team and find out how you can contribute to a collaborative and inclusive workplace.
CWB Financial Group (CWB) is not your typical bank – we take a deeply personalized approach to our business and in our core values. Taking the time to understand our clients’ goals and aspirations allows us to use a full-picture view in the type of support, guidance and service needed to help them cultivate a successful financial future.
Be what you want to be – with CWB Financial Group.
Here is a glimpse into what your career could look like with us!
You will handle…
Participate in the requirements definition, analysis, planning of data warehouse & analytic solutions.
Design, develop, test, and deliver data warehouse solutions
Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, and Load processes across multiple data sources.
Identify data discrepancies and data quality issues and work to ensure data consistency and integrity
Contribute to the continuous improvement/refinement of processes, tools, quality metrics, methodologies and standards
Create and maintain BI/DW ETL specifications and process documentation
Produces specification documentation that is of excellent quality, which is easily understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material
Performing peer code reviews to ensure adherence to development and maintenance standards.
Monitoring and remediating all issues with the data warehouse/datamarts and reports.
Providing knowledge transfer to the other members of the development team.
Supporting users and performing daily tasks such as job scheduling, monitoring, troubleshooting and remediation.
What you will have accomplished…
Education
Degree or post-secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Professional Experience
Development experience in database and/or reporting environments incorporating Microsoft SQL Server technology.
Working knowledge of Data Warehouse / Datamart design and development is an asset.
Understanding of ETL processes/tools, SAS Data Integration studio considered a benefit.
Working knowledge of TFS or equivalent project management, development management tools.
Personal Competencies
Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Ability to work with moderate supervision.
Work on complex assignments requiring continuous periods of concentration, with periodic interruption.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication (written & verbal) skills, including Technical writing ability.
What you will get from us:
The opportunity to make a difference - our culture thrives on idea-sharing, collaboration and the ability to create impact.
Rewarding, enterprising and engaging atmosphere where you will be able to see your contributions at work.
Understanding balance: We know our people have places to go, people to see and good times to have when they’re not at work and we support that.
An award-winning benefits packages that includes 100% company-funded health coverage (dental, vision and prescriptions), health care spending account, a flexible wellness program and cwbalance day (extra day off with pay!).
Company ownership: Every employee has the opportunity to be an owner with our employee share purchase plan (ESPP).
Our commitment to your success and development: On-going career conversations and personalized professional growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and pay for performance incentives.
Continual learning opportunities and professional development training to grow your talent and realize your aspirations and potential.

Toronto, ONWhy join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. Reporting to the Senior Director – Analytics, Insights & Innovation, you will lead our data analytics and customer insights program. In this role you will leverage your highly technical education and experience to ensure that we have the business intelligence warehouse, strategic data roadmap and visualization in place to drive success. In collaboration with your team of peers, you will drive outcomes by enabling data and analytics within the retail research, asset management, leasing, marketing and operations teams in addition to both internal and external stakeholders.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectivesLead the design of dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights and opportunitiesDevelop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of our customer and tenant behavior across multiple asset classesLeverage and integrate disparate data sources and technologies working alongside IT and other stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies and improve data quality and accessDevelop a solution / framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who are looking to utilize Tableau and/or data visualizationIdentifying opportunities for continuous improvement and autmation of tasks within our real estate platformDeveloping best-in-class Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methodologies combined with best-in-class Analytics & Insights scalable for a dynamic, innovative deliverables
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingHave a background in quantitative predictive modelling and a Master’s degree in Spatial Analysis and/or Data AnalyticsOver 10 years of experience in an analytical role driving customer insightsProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)Proficient using analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL)Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesHave successfully lead the development of data insights within an organizationMust be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player with an intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining for insights

PermanentPay per click Specialist

Location: Toronto, Ontario | Department: Marketing Department | Reports to: Digital Marketing Manager

Why Join our Team?
We are building a superb place to work if you love solving problems, enjoy a challenge and have genuine enthusiasm for overcoming obstacles and learning, you’ll love it. Your customer service and technical skills will be tested every day. There are endless opportunities for you to develop and grow and you’ll really make a difference to all sorts of people. We’re a family-run business, who are incredibly ambitious and constantly expanding and I can promise you’ll enjoy every single day.

Job Purpose:
The PPC/ Pay Per Click Specialist is responsible for Creating and Managing a variety of PPC campaigns across a range of Digital Channels such as: Google and Bing.

Job Overview:Three key objectives:

Drive high quality traffic to the website
Generate leads (forms completed or phone calls) from PPC traffic
Capture audience insight

Responsibilities:

Own the strategic planning and everyday management of multiple high budget PPC accounts across Google and Bing
Ongoing testing, optimisation & tracking for lead generation to meet business KPIS
Monitoring bid management of campaigns across all PPC networks to identify trends, opportunities and areas of concern
Producing and presenting reports on PPC activity to internal stakeholders
Design Landing pages depends upon the Target Persona
Monitor Competitor performance by using Google auction insights and SEMRush
Working effectively with the other members of the PPC and digital team to maintain efficient running of all accounts

Professional Skills & Qualifications

Education/Experience:The successful candidate must have:

2+ years’ experience of managing competitive PPC campaigns and able to display experience of managing large budgets
Need to know how to do Long tail keyword research
Need to know how to design Landing pages by Using Unbounce
Experience of CRO with knowledge of creating and implementing multivariate tests
Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Strong knowledge of Google Analytics with a passion for data analysis and data driven decision making
Google Certification is a Plus but not required
Experience with a Tag Manager is a plus
The enthusiasm to keep abreast of industry standards, new technologies and the latest approaches in digital marketing with the ability to communicate this throughout the digital team
Able to develop a long-term strategy with hands-on ability to get things done
Knowledge of multiple biddable media platforms including display advertising, Google and Bing shopping ads, social media and remarketing
Experience of programmatic advertising and Native advertisements

Skills:

Proven B2B PPC experience with lead generation tactics
Thrives in a supportive and friendly working environment and with a desire to share new innovative ideas and skills
Drive to meet and exceed targets and timescales
Self-motivated with a strong work ethic that can work with limited supervision and guidance
Demonstrates a highly committed attitude and works hard towards common goals with others
Worked within a team and help to develop junior members with the sharing of skills

Global Insights Analytics Lead

Clorox Canada


The position is responsible for driving business results by leveraging broad-based business knowledge while developing a high level of functional expertise. They do this by directing strategies and tactics that enable achievement of sales and profit targets. The incumbent is responsible for bringing expertise on the Canadian retail environment and data sources and proactively identifying key business issues in collaboration with business partners and managing key research priorities/plans/recommendations that drive business results with assistance from their manager. They also enable conversion from insights to action by building strong business and cross-functional relationships. This position also participates in driving functional excellence and building a world-class organization.


Make your mark


At Clorox, we build big brands that make everyday life better, every day. We value our differences, and challenge each other to think and act boldly. We try new things, succeed, fail and keep learning. We work hard, and have busy personal lives. And we're all able to make a positive impact - at Clorox, in our communities, and in the lives of millions of people who invite us into their homes. Make your mark and help us drive Good Growth - growth that is profitable, sustainable and responsible.


Key responsibilities

Drive business results by influencing key decisions through an analytics-based perspective in the areas of Forecast, Sales and Marketing management.
Integrate other consumer/market insights and a solid understanding of the broader business context to make more persuasive recommendations. Over time, proficiently perform and apply advanced analytics techniques, including but not limited to:
Marketing mix modeling
Price & Promotions modeling and simulation
Investment Optimization
Assortment Optimization
Market Structure analysis and interpretation
Business tracking and evaluation
Forecasting
Champion Analytic Insights within the company and build strong cross-functional relationships to become embedded as a critical element of strategic business unit operation.
Implement best practices within Analytic Insights through standardization of methods, tools, and knowledge-sharing to maximize group efficiency and impact.
Contribute to the building of knowledge and technical skill among all Analytic Insights members.
Ensure full utilization and integration of existing research and consumer/market.
Position requirements

3+ years business experience with Masters; 2+ years with PhD or Undergrad with Marketing Analytics
Masters or PhD in Marketing Research, Business Administration, Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, or related applied quantitative field preferred.
Expertise with large volume of data, using Excel (Pivots and V-lookups) and experience using a statistical package (SAS, SPSS, S-Plus, R, Stata, Minitab, or JMP).
Marketing is the growth engine of Clorox. We believe in creating winning ideas that constantly renew consumer value and energize our brands and businesses. We believe consumers are at the center of everything we do, and our Brand Groups drive passion for the consumer and its translation to business results. As an AMM, you will be expected to be visionary leaders, to operate with a general management mindset, to focus on the creative and the original - in order to drive your business and brand with consumers.


More about Clorox
The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with approximately 8,700 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2018 sales of $6.1 billion. Clorox markets some of the most trusted and recognized consumer brand names, including its namesake bleach and cleaning products;

Pine-Sol® cleaners;
Liquid Plumr® clog removers;
Poett® home care products;
Fresh Step® cat litter;
Glad® bags, wraps and containers;
Kingsford® charcoal;
Hidden Valley® dressings and sauces;
Brita® water-filtration products;
Burt's Bees® natural personal care products;
RenewLife® digestive health products; and
Rainbow Light®, Natural Vitality® and Neocell® dietary supplements.


The company also markets brands for professional services, including Clorox Healthcare® and Clorox Commercial Solutions®.

More than 80 percent of the company's sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories.


Clorox Canada was founded in 1972. It is a team of 400 employees with the head office located in Brampton and two additional manufacturing facilities. Our iconic brands are: Clorox, Green Works, PineSol, Kingsford, Hidden Valley, K C Masterpiece, Brita, Glad, Burt's Bees and Renew Life. You can visit our website at: https://cloroxofcanada.ca/


Making a positive impact


Clorox is a signatory of the United Nations Global Compact, a community of global leaders committed to sustainability. The company has been broadly recognized for its corporate responsibility efforts, most notably being named to the Drucker Institute's 2017 Wall Street Journal Management Top 250 list, The Just 100: America's Top Citizens list, CR Magazine's 2018 Best Corporate Citizens list, Barron's 2018 100 Most Sustainable Companies, and the first sector-neutral Bloomberg Gender Equality Index in 2018. In support of its communities, The Clorox Company and its foundations contributed about $20 million in combined cash grants, product donations and cause marketing in fiscal year 2018. For more information, visit TheCloroxCompany.com, including the Good Growth blog, and follow the company on Twitter at @CloroxCo.

Etobicoke, ONThe Senior Talent Management System Analyst will be responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of our digital talent and analytics solutions for the enterprise. This includes supporting and participating in the development of the Moneris talent, learning and analytics technology roadmap that aligns to the strategic people vision at Moneris. The Senior Talent Management System Analyst will ensure timely and effective management and delivery of technology projects, solutions and analytics supporting talent management and learning imperatives as well as advancing analytics to enhance decision-making.
You will be accountable to:
Support the implementation of the HR technology roadmap for talent management systems ensuring all technologies are optimally implemented, configured, and maintained to support business rules/processes. Acts as a super user of the system.
Oversees the integrity and security administration of talent, learning, performance and engagement survey systems in support of end-user day-to-day operations, processing and reporting and as it relates to dependent systems

job_title: Property Claims Product Analytics & Delivery Leader
job_description:
Does a role where you will be responsible for thinking of ways to drive quality of service for today and tomorrow sound exciting? Does driving customer excellence and value, revenue and employee satisfaction sound like your calling? Come join our Property Claims team as a Product Analytics & Delivery Leader and you'll get to do just that.
In this role, you will develop and maintain technical excellence and support business objectives by improving the performance of the property claims business through the disciplined implementation of enhancements.
Our aim is to change how we do insurance and we need your help.
What you'll do:
Build the best Property Claims Analytics team in the industry
Lead the implementation of data enablers and dashboards within Property Claims to enable the business to quickly act on key business drivers
Develop data dictionaries and consistent reporting methodology to reduce complexity and work with front line adjusters to improve data validity and reliability
Establish leading indicators of claims performance for each function and educate and communicate the value and impact of these indicators, internally and externally
Provide guidance, coaching and support to team leaders to ensure they are able to understand the data driving system performance and how to act on it
Complete opportunity assessments and pilot new ways of delivering claims and enhancing the customer experience
Lead the feature team for property and work in collaboration with the Transformation group on implementation and prioritization of technology enhancements
Own telephony strategy and operations for the unit
Assesses ideas for system improvements by ensuring all change is supported by relevant data and take the lead on project management and change initiatives within your team from start to 'business as usual'
Create controls to assess the impact of changes and liaise with Finance to ensure results are impacting the bottom line of the division’s controls
Drive excellence in customer service with a clear focus on the end-to-end ‘insurance’ process from sale through to claim settlement
Lead by example by constantly challenging and questioning the way we do things while assessing and analyzing whether the process flow is meeting and exceeding customer expectations in order to improve the customers’ experience
Be a role model and advocate of systems thinking across Property Claims
Travel periodically between our Markham and Oakville offices
What you'll bring:
You are an experienced people and operational leader with the skills to guide team members at all levels and create a strong team environment
You possess, apply, and disseminate systems thinking principles in practice
You are a skilled communicator who is flexible in style, responsive to situations, and able to challenge and positively influence others, both internally and externally
You have data, analytical and problem-solving skills which allow you to define and design measures to identify problems and initiate solutions. You base decisions on data to find better ways to deliver desired outcomes for customers, colleagues, and Aviva
You have strong awareness and understanding of the business environment in which Aviva operates
You can interpret financial data at all levels, including Profit & Loss Balance Sheets, and use that information to drive action plans
You can demonstrate an ability to work through complexity and ambiguity by finding solutions to tough problems and encouraging possibility thinking
You have excellent relationship building skills in a professional and approachable manner
You are technically savvy
What you'll get:
A salary, vacation, bonus opportunity, and retirement savings.
Exceptional Career Development opportunities.
We’ll support your professional development education.
Annual $300 fitness and wellness incentive and healthcare benefits.
Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. If upon commencement of employment you require a specific accommodation because of a disability, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner so that an appropriate accommodation can be arranged. This process applies throughout your career with Aviva Canada

$82,805 - $93,155 a yearPermanentThe School of Continuing Studies (SCS) is a large and complex revenue-generating education enterprise designed to provide English language instruction and continuing professional education programs to students in the GTA, nationally and internationally. The School serves the diverse needs of international students seeking to obtain language and post-secondary education to excel in Canada. It also serves domestic students seeking to upgrade their professional education, change careers or obtain a Canadian education or credential. It is expected to generate revenue for York University and to generate a funnel of undergraduate as well as graduate students for York University in order to meet the enrolment targets. The School has two main divisions: (a) the English Language Institute (YUELI), and (b) Continuing Professional Education (CPE) programs.

York University English Language Institute (YUELI) offers a range of specialized non-degree courses to meet the needs of specific groups of students (primarily international students), with the teaching of English for Academic Purposes (EAP) as a main focus. YUELI has 3,553 EAP enrollments annually as of 2018.

Reporting to the Director, IE & ELI, the primary responsibility of the Manager, Recruitment is to develop a strong enrolment pipeline within their assigned region (Middle East & North Africa (MENA) & Latin America (LATAM)), by developing and implementing an integrated recruitment strategy comprised of communications, relationship development / maintenance and enrolment management business plans.

The Manager, Recruitment manages the day-to-day implementation and measurement of all strategies designed to meet SCSs established enrolment objectives including managerial oversight of third party agents/representatives; targeted visits and in-market event planning; targeted relationship development; market-specific research and analysis, communications collateral for all channels to increase recruitment and conversion; developing business cases for new relationships designed to meet SCSs enrolment goals.

Working with the Director, the Manager, Recruitment will manage all operational activities for recruitment and enrolment in their assigned region (Middle East & North Africa (MENA) & Latin America (LATAM)). With a keen understanding of the market, this role develops recruiting strategies to maximize market reach and impact. The incumbent will be responsible for generating approximately $1,5M in additional revenue annually with the expectation that this revenue will exceed the costs required to deliver it and that significant marginal revenue will result. At the end of each cycle, assesses results and identifies opportunities for improvement.


Education:
University undergraduate degree in a relevant field (such as a Business Administration, Marketing, Political Science, Finance or Education) or an acceptable equivalent combination of education and five years experience in domestic or international recruitment with specific experience with international recruitment and marketing, development programs, or project management.


Experience:
3 to 5 years of progressively more responsible related strategic experience, including setting goals and objectives, coordination, and planning in a cost recovery or profit-centered department/institution in an international student recruitment role with additional online marketing and/or business development experience. A superior record of generating new business and building/maintaining client relationships in existing and new market sectors. Demonstrated experience in international marketing communications and strategy. Hands-on experience moving programs from inception to completion, and knowledgeable in every phase of work from marketing research to strategy development, to objective setting, to performance management, to budget setting, monitoring and maintenance. Experience in new client identification and relationship development/maintenance in the domestic and, in particular, international arenas. Experience in ESL student recruitment and business development in the international education market.


Skills:
Language capability in their assigned geography. Knowledge of York University and specific program offerings. Exceptional leadership and managerial talent to lead, motivate, engage staff as well and cultivate cross-campus relationships. Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Be proactive and willing to go above and beyond whenever possible. Demonstrate a willingness to be flexible, versatile in a multi-institutional and multi- stakeholder work environment while maintaining effectiveness and efficiency. Outstanding verbal, written communication and presentation skills. Excellent cross-cultural communication skills and exceptional persuasive skills. Superb judgment; exercises tact and diplomacy. Ability to maintain confidentiality. Attention to detail along with social media and web analytics skills. Ability to draft strategic plans and other marketing and recruitment and communications materials. Strong proficiency in the use MS Office and multi-media editing suites. Hands on proficiency working with CRMs. Ability to organize, prioritize, develop a work schedule and meet deadlines; effective at monitoring and evaluating progress towards goals and tracking details, data, information. Anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of a diverse group of internal and external stakeholders, including Faculties, students, parents; schools and a willingness to meet or exceed their expectations within the organizational parameters. Work collaboratively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness; accept and give constructive feedback; be willing to take direction when required. A strong understanding of international student markets and trends and an appreciation of the needs of international students and international key influencers. Proven financial management skills, including the ability to create and monitor project and operating budgets. Experience in developing and maintaining successful community partnerships. Knowledge of and experience within the post-secondary international education sector. A demonstrated commitment to customer service, strong interpersonal skills. Excellent organizational and time management skills and strong ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities. Excellent marketing, negotiation and problem-solving skills, attention to detail Strong analytical skills to compile and analyze information and data for program planning. Ability to work independently with minimum supervision, ability to work successfully in a team setting. Experience with large record management systems like MSAccess, CRM Dynamics, SIS. Valid passport and a willingness to travel extensively domestically or internationally. Experience with extensive travel to and/or living abroad or across Canada preferred.


Recruitment Checks:

This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.

job_title: Vice President, Business Development - Cannabis and NHP
job_description:
Cannabis Compliance Inc is the leading Canadian owned, consulting firm of choice for manufacturers and Licensed Cannabis Producers in North America. As our clients are driven to excellence and exception, we provide complete support from product and facility design through to registration, manufacturing, testing, marketing, distribution, and beyond.

Founded in 2017, we built a strong foundation by guiding North American’s leading consulting firm through Canada’s challenging regulatory climate for cannabis products. We are a specialized consulting firm offering full international compliance services for the cannabis, natural health product, supplement, pharmaceutical, food, cosmetic, medical device, and associated industries worldwide.


Opportunity

We are currently recruiting for a Vice President, Business Development – Cannabis and NHP for our client who is rapidly growing. This person would be responsible for developing strategies that will drive market share growth, champion an exceptional customer experience, and develop a sustainable competitive advantage within the developing cannabis industry in Canada and the NHP market in the US. The Vice President, Business Development – Cannabis and NHP will be responsible for understanding overall client needs and aligning the companies service offerings to their goals and strategies.

This is an entrepreneurial role focusing on new business development and sales with global partners and customers.

The Vice President, Business Development – Cannabis and NHP should possess a high level of drive, energy and executive presence and will continuously improve efficiencies, processes, procedures and personnel in all areas of responsibility to keep pace with growth of company.


Responsibilities
Identify target markets and strategic partnership opportunities that will enable the company to reach its profitable growth objectives in collaboration with the CEO and Director of R&D
Prepare and execute strategies and action plans to grow the companies’ presence in the Canadian cannabis market and position it as a leader and essential business partner across the country
Lead internal activities with cross-functional groups focused on client growth and retention activities and new business development
Grow and manage sales activity pipeline for new business through active sales and prospecting techniques
Develop, lead and engage a high performance, solutions-oriented team of Business Development Representatives/Managers
Recommend and implement sales incentive program in accordance with the companies’ goals
On-going evaluation and development of the sales’ organizational structure
Leverage analytics and market intelligence to develop and implement new ideas, concepts and collaborative approaches to growing market share.
Developing quarterly and annual business development strategies to achieve sales growth targets
Conceiving and curating a sales culture that encourages growth and development of each individual


Skills and Qualifications

A combination of a solid background/education in business and science with an aptitude to quickly understand new science and technologies
An MBA or MA in Business Administration or related fields
10 years of relevant sales and or business development experience in the pharmaceutical, NHP, Cannabis industry or related field.
Excellent project management, planning, organizational and interpersonal skills as well as outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
High energy and self-directed with the ability to rapidly build relationships
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key

Fresh Style. Fresh Careers. Founded in 2006, Joe Fresh is a leading source for modern style and accessible design, offering comprehensive lifestyle collections for men, women and children. Toronto, ONTemporaryThe Senior Analyst, Contract Management will report to the Manager, Contract Management
Summary Statement
The Senior Analyst, Contract Management is accountable to the Supervisor, Contract Management in the Legal Resources and Corporate Governance (LRCG) division of the Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO). The Senior Analyst will focus primarily on natural gas-fired facility contracts, providing support, analytics and recommendations to ensure that contract requirements are fulfilled, while at the same time developing and employing practices that provide the best possible value to the IESO, Ontario’s power system, and Ontario’s ratepayers.
Contract Due Diligence
Ensure that contract requirements are met, and that periodic submissions have been received and reviewed.
Create, maintain and streamline tracking tools to monitor contract submissions/requirements to ensure compliance.
Monitor and provide risk based analysis regarding potential sector developments that may have contractual implications.
Provide updates, reports and presentations to the Supervisor on a regular basis, and senior management as required.
Contract Management and Administration
Advise on methods and recommend changes to IESO Contract Management policies and standard procedures.
Develop standard documents/templates to be used by contract counterparties.
Manage processes that may include meeting with respective contract counterparties, and external agencies/organizations as applicable, in order to resolve issues.
Support the Supervisor with negotiations, facility amendments and contract amendments as required, including the development of negotiation principles and strategies.
Other Responsibilities
Interface and facilitate discussions with internal (Planning, Acquisition and Operations; Corporate Services; Market Renewal; etc.) and external (Ministry of Energy, Northern Development and Mines; Ministry of the Environment, Conservation and Parks; Hydro One; Enbridge Gas; etc.) parties.
Conduct research on topics and issues related to electricity resources and natural gas markets.
Prepare and assist in the development of budgets and schedules.
Assist with projects within LRCG or in other IESO departments.
Demonstrate leadership and mentor, advise, and guide other staff.
Other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned.
Skills and Qualifications
Knowledge of Ontario's energy sector (electricity and natural gas) including IESO Market Rules and the regulatory environment.
Technical knowledge of system resources, including thermal electricity generation (combined cycle gas turbines, simple cycle gas turbines, etc.) and cogeneration configurations; renewable electricity generation (biomass, wind, hydro, solar, etc.); and conservation and demand management.
Understanding of generation contract types used by the IESO, including the rational and importance of various contract provisions, and familiarity with the deemed dispatch mechanism (Exhibit J).
Strong analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills, with drive to improve processes and highlight opportunities.
Project management experience, including scheduling and coordination of IESO staff and external stakeholders.
Counterparty focus with demonstrated ability to work with counterparties in a challenging environment.
Highly motivated individual who can work autonomously and within a group.
Excellent oral, written and presentation skills, including ability to interface with external consultants and contract counterparties.
Must be detail oriented and must be able to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient in MS Office Suite.
What the IESO Offers:
Competitive market wages
Comprehensive benefit programs
Programs and policies to support a balanced lifestyle
A challenging fast-paced team environment
Opportunity to work with some of the brightest people in the industry
Deadline for submitting your application is Month/Day/Year at 11:59 PM EST
While we appreciate your submissions, we regret that we can only contact those candidates selected for interviews.
We thank all candidates for their interest in opportunities with the IESO. Be sure to follow us on LinkedIn .
The IESO is an equal opportunity employer.
Please note the successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a background check.

job_title: Practice Area Director, Data and Analytics
job_description:
Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.

Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to over 6,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 28 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.

Job Title:
Practice Area Director - Data and Analytics

Data and analytics are the single most transformative disrupters of our time. We help our clients achieve their quest to become data-driven organizations by formulating compelling strategies and implementing elegant technologies. Slalom is looking for an entrepreneurial and progressive leader to foster the growth and success of our Data & Analytics practice.

The Practice Area Director will partner with a driven team of Practice Leads to provide thought leadership to our clients, set strategic direction for the practice, drive sales, recruiting, and operational efficiencies. This individual will also be accountable for ensuring the overall quality of execution across a breadth of expertise areas in our Information Management & Analytics practice that include Information Strategy, Data Management, Business Intelligence/Data Visualization, Cloud Data Architecture and Advanced Analytics.

Responsibilities:
Accountability for the Information Management and Analytics Practice, including driving sales, recruiting, account management, consulting, and all operational aspects.
Practice Building – Drive overall growth of practice area through a combination of business development, talent management, oversight of delivery work, and thought leadership.
Business Development – Lead business development activities, leveraging professional contacts for the benefit of the Company.
Team & Individual Development – Maximize team performance through an effective team approach that increases productivity and job satisfaction.
Engagement Management – Manage engagement risk, project economics including planning and budgeting, managing accounts receivable, defining deliverable content, and ensuring buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client.
Culture & Core Values - Enhance the Company’s culture and exemplify our core values on a day-to-day basis.
Develop proposals, presentations, statement of work (SOW) and proactively recommend strategies to grow Business Intelligence and Analytics Practice presence in existing accounts
Deep understanding of data management, business intelligence and/or analytics technology landscape (trends, key platform vendors etc.)
Work with sales teams to manage the solution creation process with clients and provide the leadership throughout the opportunity lifecycle from initial qualification to closure of the deal.
Provide thought leadership & IT transformation recommendations in various technology areas.
Provide delivery guidance for various technology areas within data management, business intelligence and analytics.

Qualifications:

15+ years of experience preferably in consulting with at least 5 years consulting specifically in data management and/or business intelligence solutions
Proven history of leveraging and growing existing client base; organic business development responsibilities; i.e. growing new account/clients from the ground up
Proven history of profitably managing a consulting business/practice
Deep experience with staff management
Strong communication and client facing skills
Must demonstrate strong program management experience covering a broad business base.
A demonstrated track record of successful consulting engagement management experience; including directing other staff members and having a major role in managing and interfacing with senior level client executives.
Ability to establish immediate credibility with clients and within the company; can build consensus and achieve goals through influence versus authority.
Ability to balance the demands of multiple client assignments as well as staff development.
Creative thinking and seeking innovative solutions to complex technical/business problems.

Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

Maru/Matchbox, a Maru Group company, has been pushing the boundaries of the customer market insights space for over a decade. Unifying deep sector expertise with cloud-based customer insights communities, we take a results-focused, consultative approach to helping clients better understand what motivates their customers and influences their markets, so they can act decisively and win.

Maru/Matchbox’s Financial Services practice provides cutting edge research solutions in the arena of product development, customer experience/service optimization, communication enhancement and brand positioning. We deliver research services and ongoing tech-enabled platforms, such as dynamic Insight Communities, that allow our clients to connect with their customers, prospects and internal stakeholders in an interactive and immersive manner. Our team is comprised of quantitative and qualitative research professionals who are passionate about delivering actionable, strategic insights to top financial institutions.

Research Director

We are seeking a Research Director, Financial Services in our Toronto office who will hold an important client-facing position leading innovative research for the top financial institutions in North America. As a member of our rapidly growing practice, you will have direct influence on our future growth and success. You will develop new and manage existing strategic client engagements. You will be involved in all aspects of our business, including proposal writing, research design, project implementation, analysis, and delivery of recommendations.

As an accomplished and respected research and industry consultant, with proven experience in using both quantitative and qualitative methodologies to address critical business objectives, you will have a reputation for client management excellence, creativity, attention to detail and strategic insight in the delivery of research results and consultative recommendations.

Responsibilities:

Lead multiple complex research engagements, serving as key client contact and proactively investigating client needs, communicating study progress, and resolving any issues
Initiate strategic and creative delivery of research design, analysis and reporting
Understand the appropriate use of advanced analytics, sampling and weighting
Conduct client presentations, workshops and data discussions to ensure project success
Expand the use of Maru/Matchbox services with current accounts for ongoing revenue growth
Mentor junior researchers and coach for professional development
Ensure hands-on quality control throughout the entire project process, including effective financial management so that projects/accounts are profitable
Ability to write enticing proposals and programs to win, retain and grow enterprise level clients
Experience with wide range of research methodologies and techniques are an added benefit
Experience:

6+ years related work experience in marketing research with a minimum of 3 years’ experience on the supplier side
BA/BS required
Experience across an array of research types (e.g., product development, service optimization, brand positioning etc.)
Ability to design studies, write questionnaires and plan/create insightful and actionable reports
Experience managing multiple, complex, high value projects simultaneously
Fluency in the basics of analytics, weighting and sampling
Previous experience in consultative Financial Services research roles is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
What’s in it for you?
Working with top clients in the Financial Services sector
Producing high caliber, interesting research that helps our clients to make smarter decisions
Joining a fun, intelligent, open, and accomplished group of researchers
A great company culture focused on collaboration, learning, and growth
Three weeks vacation, comprehensive health benefits, 401K matching, wellness initiatives, tenure awards, an open and collaborative office, and the list goes on…
Ready to join our team?

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you we invite you to apply online now. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We thank you for your interest in Maru/Matchbox and encourage you to constantly check our website for a list of all current opportunities.

Maru/Matchbox is an equal opportunity employer

Toronto, ONThe Mars Agency is a global marketing practice, specializing in marketing to shoppers, consumers and retailers across the ever-expanding omni-commerce environment. Mars uniquely refers to this environment as the A-to-V Commerce SM space, which incorporates everything from Autonomous to Voice commerce. Mars, proud of its independence and growth-for-clients focus, operates internationally across the Americas, Europe and Asia through its network of 13 offices.

We’re seeking a Media Analytics Manager for our Toronto office. The Media Analytics Manager is a functional management role accountable for the media analytics and reporting on advertising performance for a large North American retail client. The selected candidate is expected to oversee a growing new team (and eventually a small team of analysts) who will dive deep into performance data from multiple sources to produce useful, accurate insights and takeaways for clients and help them earn better return on their advertising dollars. This role will be accountable for team management and objectives, including hiring, discipline and career paths for employees under them.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reporting, customer profiling and data manipulation using Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, custom data and reporting platforms and CRM systems as well as in advertising platforms and ad servers
Investigating data sets and creating tables for analysis; performing data mining
Utilizing analytics software (traditional or digital) to generate cross-tabs and digital performance numbers
Supporting the creation of client-ready reports (dashboards) including graphics creation, summarizing findings and recommendations
Producing the highest-caliber Powerpoint decks for clients, containing useful and accurate information and insights
Defining and implementing a framework for capturing, measuring, and reporting sales and marketing KPIs like engagement, website traffic, leads, and conversion rates, ROAS, etc
Formulating approaches to more complex analytics opportunities and new challenges as they arise
Establishing, troubleshooting and improving tagging and analysis related to Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and other relevant platforms
Executing tests; assisting the digital marketing team with A/B and multivariate testing
Benchmarking performance across sales and marketing channels, creative, offers and audiences.
SKILLSETS REQUIRED:
5+ years of experience in digital and/or marketing analytics, with a focus on working with large advertising clients and working heavily with reporting and data from Adobe Analytics (Omniture, Google Analytics and ad serving platforms
Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in math, marketing, statistics or econometrics is required along with 1–3 years of hands-on data experience
Strong math and analytical mindset and a natural curiosity for how marketing and online actions can impact revenue and performance in advertising
Expert-level Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) skills
A ‘Clients First’ approach to everything you do. We work for and on behalf of our clients and always produce the very best results we possibly can
2+ years people-management experience

Nice to Have:
Experience with SASS or SPSS, JavaScript, analytics tagging and custom coding is useful
Experience in shopper marketing a plus, as is experience working with large retail clients
Familiarity with ad serving platforms (DFP, DBM, DCM) and how ad servers work with websites to target users is helpful
French-English bilingual is a big plus

Toronto, ONLead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

The Role:

Actively participate in the design and implementation of the IFRS-9 end-to-end processes with a focus on risk.
Collaborate with key stakeholders in the IFRS-9 project, including Finance, Project Management, Model Validation, Risk Management, Modelling, Business Intelligence and Internal Audit.
Support the development of data infrastructure required for IFRS-9 and Economic Capital production.
Build IFRS-9 and Economic Capital models that meet both internal and regulatory requirements.
Develop code in SAS for ECL and Economic Capital calculations, analysis and reporting.
Contribute to A-IRB development and implementation program in line with emerging regulatory expectations.


Thank-you to all candidates who applied for this position. The mandate has now been filled.

Why join us?
We are looking for a highly motivated leader to join our Analytics, Insights & Innovation team in Toronto as Director – Data Analytics & Insights. Reporting to the Senior Director – Analytics, Insights & Innovation, you will lead our data analytics and customer insights program. In this role you will leverage your highly technical education and experience to ensure that we have the business intelligence warehouse, strategic data roadmap and visualization in place to drive success. In collaboration with your team of peers, you will drive outcomes by enabling data and analytics within the retail research, asset management, leasing, marketing and operations teams in addition to both internal and external stakeholders.
As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:
Turning complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectivesLead the design of dashboards and reports, and create data visualizations to identify trends and drive business insights and opportunitiesDevelop frameworks and conduct robust analysis to deepen understanding of our customer and tenant behavior across multiple asset classesLeverage and integrate disparate data sources and technologies working alongside IT and other stakeholders to drive operational efficiencies and improve data quality and accessDevelop a solution / framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who are looking to utilize Tableau and/or data visualizationIdentifying opportunities for continuous improvement and autmation of tasks within our real estate platformDeveloping best-in-class Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence methodologies combined with best-in-class Analytics & Insights scalable for a dynamic, innovative deliverables
To succeed in this role, you:
Thrive in organizations that constantly evolve and adapt.Embrace collaborative sharing of knowledge within a teamwork environmentDriven to achieving results and continuously striving to deliver the highest performance through creative thinkingHave a background in quantitative predictive modelling and a Master’s degree in Spatial Analysis and/or Data AnalyticsOver 10 years of experience in an analytical role driving customer insightsProficient using data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Google Analytics, API’s)Proficient using analytics and programming languages (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SQL)Proficient in specialized GIS mapping and Market Research methodologiesHave successfully lead the development of data insights within an organizationMust be client facing, and a highly collaborative team player with an intellectual curiosity and passion for digging into data and mining for insights

We are building a superb place to work if you love solving problems, enjoy a challenge and have genuine enthusiasm for overcoming obstacles and learning, you’ll love it. Proven B2B PPC experience with lead generation tactics

job_title: Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management
job_description:
About Solium

Solium is fulfilling a vision of becoming the global leader in equity-based (stock) incentive and share purchase savings plan management. We specialize in the delivery of complete web-based services for the full lifecycle of equity-based incentive and savings plans. Through our technically advanced Solium Shareworks™ platform, Solium is setting the industry's service standard for the administration and execution of all types of equity-based incentives and savings plans.

Why work at Solium

Solium is a fast growing company where every member of our team is important to our success. If you have an unfailing commitment to excellence, alignment to customer interests, and strong problem-solving skills, Solium would welcome your contribution to our enthusiastic team. We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package. We currently have a full-time, permanent opportunity for a:

Manager, Contact Centre and Global Workforce Management

Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Director, Participant Experience Group, you will inspire and lead by providing time, knowledge and experience to guide, coach and motivate Participant Services agents. You are expected to contribute towards continuous excellence within a changing environment through strong, supportive and innovative leadership.

Responsibilities

Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
Team/agent analysis, daily and weekly oversight for the consistent execution of Quality Service Standards and delivery on all key performance indicators: ACW, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, Transfers.
Provide leadership, operational support and be available to all agents for support.
Ensure all direct reports are current and up to date on all training requirements, including all Solium mandatory training.
Workforce management activities include forecasting, scheduling, capacity planning, monitoring queues and volumes, and approving off phone activities.
Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
Strong knowledge of Call Centre IVR. Live listen and call mapping for business operations and opportunities. Coaching in the moment.
Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead. Engagement and supporting all contact centre culture and reward and recognition initiatives. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
Qualifications

2+ years of Supervisory or Leadership experience and the commitment to successfully complete Shareworks certification within the first year of employment.
Degree or diploma preferred but not mandatory.
Previous experience with InContact, NICE, Teleopti or any enterprise grade PBX and Workforce Management Platform.
Previous experience with forecasting, creating staffing schedules, and monitoring real time for schedule adherence
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Proven success with communication and customer service in a variety of service mediums including direct contact via phone, fax and email. Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities.
While we thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Solium, please note that only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.

Imagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Yellowknife, NTContractOur client, a prominent organization in Northern Canada, is seeking a pair of business analysts to work on a 6 month project. In addition to the standard BA responsibilities such as requirements gathering, gap analysis and documentation, they are looking for each BA to have a particular area of significant experience. The first BA needs to have significant experience creating business cases. The second BA needs to have significant policy writing experience.These roles require you to work on-site. All major expenses are covered including accomodation, food and one round-trip airfare. Hourly rates are at a premium over the national average. This role could very well be extended as the client has a good track record in this regard.If you would like more information, please pass along your phone # and the best time to speak. Please also take a few minutes to make sure your resume or LI profile demonstrates your Business Case and/or Policy Writing experience.Thanks!!Job Type: ContractExperience:Business Analyst: 8 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's Degree (Preferred)

Major Responsibilities:


Reporting to the Senior Systems Integrator Clerks, the Business Analyst SII will analyze business operations and application systems in order to bridge the gap of translating business requirements into system specifications to develop custom application solutions.

Assesses information technology and data/systems needs and requirements of business units and identifies and evaluates feasibility of operations, policies, technology, information systems and management practices to improve service delivery
Evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of business systems and determines information systems strategies by means of feasibility and cost/benefit studies.
Assesses impact of technology on service delivery/resources/business and costs/savings, and develops recommendations, including opportunities for maximizing technology and improving efficiency of business practices
Designs system specifications; preparing requirements for ensuring proper system testing, implementation and operation
Prepares system and user documentation and provides consultation, technical support and user training to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented
Documents and analyzes business requirements utilizing various methods such as: interviewing (JAD sessions), data modeling, business process modeling, business object modeling and user interface design
Provides support to the business units on the specific technology application being implemented and utilized in support of the business
Assists in the development, testing, training and configuration of the specific applications and the fine tuning and implementation of upgrades, new releases and enhancements to the applications
Contributes to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
Works closely with various stakeholders and partners to understand priorities and impact.
Develops and delivers presentation and training sessions tailored to specific stakeholder groups
Prepares RFI/P/Qs and other formal project documentation
Manages vendors and external contracts
Travels to off-site locations


Key Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in Information Management, Information Technology, Business / Public Administration or other discipline pertinent to the job function, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience performing system analysis and business analysis and/or managing medium to large scale projects.
Experience in documentation and process design techniques such as cases, data and workflow modelling, swim lane diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, activity diagrams, business rule documentation, functional & non-functional identification and screen mock-ups
Experience and of MS Office Suite including Visio, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and/or other project management software. Experience using Blueprint would be an asset.
Considerable experience coordinating, supporting and facilitating medium to large scale projects including the definition of project purpose and objective, project activities, milestones and deliverables, monitoring and tracking progress, and communication to stakeholders.
Strong understanding of privacy, security and auditing; how these can be reviewed, monitored, and enhanced with regards to systems implementation.
Strong understanding of application deployment approaches, and standard dev-QA-Production cycles.
Knowledge of software development and project management methodologies (RUP, SDLC, Waterfall, Agile, Prince, Zachman).
Knowledge of Municipal Freedom of Information & Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA).
Excellent written and oral communication skills, presentation and interpersonal skills to deal effectively with city staff, city councillors, senior management and the public.
Analytical skills in assessing and reviewing business processes to identify options, best practices and opportunities to improve service delivery through technology change and business process innovations.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills to provide troubleshooting support, prepare technical documentation and reports on problems and to deal effectively with staff at all levels within the organization.
Excellent organizational, conceptual, analytical, problem solving and multi-tasking skills.
Strong leading, listening and interacting skills to work with competing demands, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects, work with cross-functional teams, set clear directions and design terms of references and project plans.
Ability to report to various work sites within the City of Toronto as required.
