Toronto, ON$70,000 - $85,000 a yearCrafting something unique takes more than good ideas: it takes a group of dedicated professionals who aren’t afraid to try something new, make it better, and then make it perfect.

If you’re looking for a job that stretches your creative muscles, and gives you the chance to be better every day, this is the opportunity for you.

At VISO, we’re always searching for ways to innovate. Whether in our groundbreaking custom lighting designs, our company culture, or our business strategies, we know that being better is the only way forward. That spirit has fueled our success for over 25 years, and has driven us to be unique, uncompromising, and exceptional in everything we do.

Now we’re looking to add a new member to our analytics team: someone with expertise, technical ability, and a positive, collaborative attitude.

That’s where you come in

As our new Business Analyst, you’ll be responsible for a range of financial duties: things like reporting, data management, costing and analysis.

A big part of this role involves working with our new ERP software, EPICOR. Here you’ll manage end to end business processes, and identify, define, and analyze business requirements. You’ll also support our software transition by being a resource for EPICOR, and contribute to change and product management.

Succeeding in this role means always looking forward to new opportunities, whether that involves improving our systems for efficiency, finding new applications, or furthering our business goals.

Business analysis is an integral role in our company, and you’ll learn all about our core operations as you gain experience with us. If you can deliver on and exceed the expectations of this role, there will be plenty of chances to grow into more senior positions and responsibilities.

Along with relevant experience, we’re seeking someone who:

Takes initiative – you have the drive and independence to finish projects and tasks on your own, and know how to meet deadlines.
Loves learning – constant improvement is your motto: you are an innovator who’s always looking for a better way.
Excels in group settings – you’re as good with people as you are with analysis, and can use strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with anyone who can lend a hand.
Thinks creatively – you’re strategic and excel in problem solving. You aren’t afraid to try different approaches, and know how to switch tactics when things aren’t working.
Working @ Viso

This will be a full-time, permanent position with hours from 9-5, Monday to Friday. We offer a competitive compensation package, which includes a salary between $70,000 and $85,000 per year, commensurate with your experience. You’ll also get full medical and dental after a trial period, as well as free parking, and potential for bonuses.

We do work culture a little bit differently at VISO. Or office is pet friendly, and we encourage people to be themselves at work. As a group we love collaboration, and maintaining the fun, positive, family-like environment of our workplace is a top priority.

If you want to join a team that’s supportive and always looking to do better, we want to hear from you.

Qualifications
Experience in business analysis, preferably in manufacturing or a related industry
Bachelors degree in business or a related field
Strong business communication skills, and ability/interest in working directly with clients
Proficiency with ERP software, including EPICOR
Demonstrated ability to implement new software/systems related to business analytics
We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications, and look forward to hearing from you.
Please send your resume and cover letter to hr@visoinc.com with the subject title “Business Analyst”.

We look forward to receiving your resume!

aeqbanking is a technology solution provider focused on digital transformations for financial services. We use domain, product, and technical expertise to transform digital banking experiences into rich life experiences. By building seamless and immersive omni-channel solutions, aeqbanking empowers banks and credit unions to deliver tailored and seamless digital experiences to drive business growth, increase efficiency as well as increase customer retention and engagement.

Role Overview:
We are on the lookout for a Business Analyst to join our aeqbanking division at Aequilibrium. In this role you will be responsible for combining an understanding of software development lifecycles, technology platforms, and user interface design principles to help facilitate and support application development and delivery. You will also help ensure that project deliverables meet documented specifications.
This role is to lead the development of, extract, analyze, and validate the business requirements for our interactive planning projects. This includes everything from documentation reviews, stakeholder interviews, group facilitation to gathering exercises to articulate process flows and business requirements. With this information, you will convert requirements into software development specifications for internal and external development teams using a variety of software modeling documentation techniques.
This will be a 6-18 month contract role with potential to convert to a permanent, full-time position. This position is open to candidates based in the Greater Toronto Area.

Responsibilities:
Working with stakeholders and project teams to assess, identify and prioritize requirements
Documenting requirements critical to achieving business objectives
Identifying and establishing project scope based on requirements analysis to define impact, outcome criteria, and measurable actions
Acting as a customer representative to internal development teams to ensure solution satisfies client's needs
Assemble, analyze, and generate high quality functional specifications and user stories for technical teams to develop planned programs
Presenting business recommendations and technical functional specifications to clients in an easy to comprehend manner
Documenting and managing internal and client meetings on an as-needed basis

Required Skills and Experience:
A university degree in Computer Science or related field (minor or combined major in Business an asset)
3+ years working in a professional services environment or within Financial Services in a business systems planning role
Experience working in Agile environments
Strong communication and problem solving skills
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Independent worker able to move projects forward with little guidance
Experienced in organizing and presenting complex information in simple visual models
Strong writing and communication skills, ability to articulate complex technical requirements in an easy to understand, conversational manner with attention to detail
Comfortable in a client-facing role, including conflict resolution and negotiation skills
Understanding of web-related or software development, web technology platforms and their capabilities/limitations an asset
Proven client management experience, specifically in facilitating client interviews, stakeholder workshops and team meetings

Attributes:
Be an agile coach
Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at various levels
Pragmatic, making sensible decisions
Enthusiastic about product and client management
Have the ability to see the big picture while paying attention to the smallest details
Focused, ability to work well under pressure and driven to meet steady deadlines
Able to travel throughout Canada and the United States (up to 25% travel to the U.S. is required for this position)

Toronto, ONPermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

Background & Purpose of the Job
The Business Analyst reports directly to the National Retail Sales Manager. This position is responsible for providing analytical support on Unilever’s retail execution, supporting both Regional Sales Managers & the National Sales Manager. A key focus of the role is building strong, collaborative relationships with the Account, CCD (trade) & Brand teams. The BA works closely with Unilever RSM’s & CD team to plan execution priorities for each respective banner across all categories.
Who You Are & What You’ll Do
Responsible for the communication of the banner priority planning process with account teams, including Banner Priority meeting set up, weekly DocLocker uploads, ARTS touch survey question input, assisting teams with ARTS reporting information/training, and ensuring key BP deadlines are met.
Communicate with Business Analysts and RSMs nationally on account programs
Prepare of relevant retail selling materials for rep use including transformation of CCD information into Pitchbook sell sheets for ARTS Touch.
Co-ordinating monthly meeting (MIAB) items.
Responsible for weekly key updates to retail mgt team on program changes & retail processes
Ensure all necessary materials are uploaded to DocLocker; manage and archive less relevant documents.
Pull POS and upload Pitchbook (store business reviews) every 4 weeks.
Manage 3rd party retail fulfillment including material set up at RDP, co-ordination of items for rep delivery plus liaison with CCD, Shopper Mktg and acct teams
When required, manage modular/POG reset projects, including key milestones and timeline.
Ownership of the product master and commodity codes within the retail technology platform – ensuring that COTC sku’s from Perfect Store are set up in iPads for distribution audits.
Set up acct specific Rapidraft programs with Advantage.
Manage and communicate the period results with the retail team and key stakeholders (cross functional) within the organization; provide recommendations and insights for continuous improvement in this area
Provide weekly supply chain update for RSMs and reps.
What You’ll Need To Succeed
Growth Mindset : This is competitive leadership. Taking the lead in the market place versus following. It's a positive attitude about the company's future — glass half-full —but it's realistic. It's passion for winning. Winning defined as gaining market share. It's placing a fresh emphasis on innovation — challenging the status quo.
Consumer and Customer Focus : This is purpose-driven leadership. It's externally focused — on consumers, on customers. First take care of consumers and customers; financial performance will follow. It's a heightened passion for the consumer: “I firmly believe in improving the lives of consumers.” It's bringing the voice of the consumer and the customer into everything we do. It's seeing our brands through their eyes.
Bias for action: This is action-driven leadership: "This is what I will do." It's speed and sense of urgency in making decisions. But it needs to be thoughtful action, intelligent risk-taking. Also it's not wasting time on bureaucracy — it’s output that counts. And it’s simplifying my agenda, carefully choosing priorities — and not taking on too much.
Accountability and Responsibility : This is performance-driven leadership. "I will deliver against KPIs, holding myself to the highest standards.” I will also hold other people accountable — first by setting clear expectations and then by telling them if they are on the right path. It's staring reality in the eye — doing it with numbers. It's taking responsibility for Unilever's overall performance, not just by delivering my results but by helping other people deliver their results. Finally, it’s personally driving change and using operational discipline to deliver on the promise.
Building Talent and Teams : This is people-driven leadership. It's passion for people. It's having the best people in the right positions, whatever the person's gender or background. It's giving people plenty of room to do their part, and recognizing them for their contributions. It's investing in people's development — giving them feedback and challenging work. It’s also constantly challenging myself to grow and improve. And it's building aligned, cohesive teams that pull together to win.
Education , Key Skills & Other Qualifications
Undergraduate degree required
Strong analytical skills
Critical thinking and strategic thinking abilities
Ability to prioritize and manage workload effectively
Solution-focused attitude
Works well in teams (as there is significant exposure to cross-functional teams)
Candidate should have PC knowledge, primarily in Excel, PowerPoint and Word
1-2 years field sales experience
Previous analytical experience
Sales and or consumer marketing experience is a plus
Experience with Nielsen data (MarketTrack, Homescan, etc) an asset

Vancouver, BCRequisition ID: 13095

Company
The City of Vancouver is striving to become the greenest city in the world, and a city powered entirely by renewable energy before 2050. We are proud to be one of BC's Top Employers, Canada's Best Diversity Employers, and one of Canada's Greenest Employers. With employees that have helped Vancouver consistently rank as one of the world's most livable cities, the City values a diverse workforce which represents the vibrant community we so proudly serve.
Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function
The Business Process Analyst (BPA) provides senior management with objective and comprehensive business and process analysis of the City’s processes, systems, and resourcing. The BPA provides recommendations based on comprehensive analysis performed with a view to continuously improve business operations using Lean Six Sigma principles; and help sponsors, process owners, and end users implement lean initiatives. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, resources, and procedures that may impact operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes in positions or staffing levels.

Key Contacts and Reporting Relationships
This position reports directly to the Manager, Continuous Process Improvement in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management and works closely with directors, managers and staff in Finance, Risk and Supply Chain Management as well as key business representatives across the City. Works with front-line supervisors, departmental subject-matter-experts, external vendors, consultants and other organizations.

Specific Duties/Responsibilities
Leads, consult and participate in business process reviews of City Business Units, including provision of recommendations for opportunities for improvement
Lead Lean Six Sigma projects, including facilitating Kaizen events and Rapid Improvement events, conduct value stream mapping and identifies relevant KPIs,
Develop future state recommendations and build implementation plans for optimizing business processes and value streams
The value streams and processes that the role will be working on will be cross functional in nature and require the candidate to engage a number of business units and departments
Collect and analyze data to complete a current state analysis and optimize solutions
Identify implications and make recommendations for changes in processes and procedures that may impact on operational areas as well as staffing workloads, working conditions, and changes to positions or staffing levels.
Prepares and conducts presentations to, and/or facilitates decision-making for Department Management teams, Division/Branch Heads, Project Steering Committees, and Business Unit Managers.
Teach, mentor and support the project application of Green Belt candidates
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Position Requirements
Education and Experience:
A related bachelor’s degree (i.e. Commerce, Business/Public Administration, Public Policy or Economics).
A minimum of seven years of proven experience in process documentation, business process reviews, and reengineering techniques. Training, experience and knowledge in quality improvement tools, techniques and methodologies such as Lean and/or Six Sigma.
A minimum of five years’ experience at management level within the public sector or a similarly large multi-stakeholder organization. Management experience to effectively lead a business consulting team. Demonstrated experience implementing a business process re-engineering change.
Lean Six Sigma and/or Business Analyst certification (IIBA) certifications preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Detailed knowledge of business practices in effect at other local and more senior governments, and in private industry.
A thorough understanding of organization theory and design.
High degree of analysis using professional thinking.
Superior research and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills and presentation skills, across all levels of the organization.
The ability to think innovatively, solve complex problems and present solutions in clear and compelling terms.
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical staff.
Ability to manage change and assist people with adapting to change.
Ability to analyze and anticipate implications of system changes on work processes and procedures.
Ability to solve complex problems and build relationships.
Ability to build constructive and effective relationships at all level of the organization.
Ability to manage multiple priorities, large workloads and multi-task effectively.
High level of proficiency with MS Office applications.

Calgary Recreation’s Golf and Sport Development (GSD) division provides affordable, quality golf services and city-wide sport opportunities to citizens. Reporting to the Lead of Sport and Business Development, the Business analyst will support division strategy and policy development while also contributing to enhanced service delivery and business performance. Utilizing strong analytical skills with a clear understanding of operations, practices, research and strategies the Business Analyst will work as part of team to identify areas of improvement and implement creative solutions to achieve business goals. The successful candidate will be results oriented possessing highly developed reasoning skills along with a keen sense of financial and social return on investment and an aptitude to identify and execute innovative ideas. Primary duties include:
Responsible for pricing strategies as well as developing, implementing and leading projects that optimize revenue, increase site utilization and broaden the market for GSD services.
Identify opportunities, options and recommendations for the GSD leadership team based on engaging staff and outcomes of detailed data analysis. The incumbent will also provide input supporting strategy and policy development as well as workflow and service delivery improvements.
Evaluate the feasibility of potential opportunities (products and services) by assessing revenue and expense implications, defining operational impacts and articulating social benefits.
Identify, prioritize, plan and monitor GSD data collection and research needs while assuring coordinated approaches and alignment with corporate initiatives. Recommend appropriate frameworks, tools and approaches enabling the division to respond to customer needs and a changing environment.
Responsible for the creating and disseminating strategic insights, reports and presentation materials to assist in decision making and used to effectively communicate information to a broad range of audiences.
Develop and sustain strategic working relationships with internal stakeholders as well as external industry peers such as sport properties and associations.
Qualifications
A degree as well as competency in core aspects and techniques of business analysis, and a minimum of 3 years of relevant and practical experience; OR
A completed 2 year diploma (Business, Business Analysis, Recreation/Sport Management/Golf Course Administration related disciple or equivalent) as well as competency in core aspects and techniques of business analysis and a minimum of 5 years of relevant and practical experience.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Office Suite for data analysis, presentation and documentation.
Access to personal vehicle for occasional business use.
Preference will be given to candidates that are familiar with business intelligence and reporting software used to build reports and dashboards.
Success in this position requires strong problem-solving, market analysis (including identification of trends, benchmarking, and performance measurement); leadership, interpersonal and advanced communication skills.
Pre-employment Requirements
Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.

$50,000 - $60,000 a yearTemporaryDo you have a mind for details and a knack for legalese?

Are you looking for a chance to gain experience and prove that you can succeed?

We’re Walker Environmental, and this is the chance you’ve been looking for. One of our business analysts is going on temporary leave, and we need someone who wants this opportunity to take the baton and run with it.

WALKER ENVIRONMENTAL

Walker Environmental, a division of Walker Industries, is a leading resource recovery and waste management company. The company owns and operates landfills, waste transfer and haulage facilities, biosolids processing plants, composting facilities, food/residual organic processing facilities and landfill gas renewable energy projects throughout Canada. Our product brands, created from the recovery of resources often considered waste, include N-Rich®, All Treat Farms® and Gro-Bark®.

BUSINESS ANALYST

Your primary goal in this role is to review and analyze the legal documents of Walker Environmental, and make recommendations to improve those documents and mitigate legal risks.

The range of documentation is wide, including proposals, multi-year contracts, and agreements with private and public sector counterparts. Our ideal candidate will be able to hit the ground running, managing a high volume of documents and demands. While a legal degree is not required, any legal experience will be advantageous.

You’ll succeed at this role because you are:

Confident – you’re comfortable providing analysis and relaying feedback to upper management.
Meticulous – you have a keen eye for detail. You’re precise and exceptionally thorough.
A strong communicator – you can adjust your style to suit the audience and the medium.
Proactive – you look ahead to anticipate multiple demands and deadlines, and facilitate prompt execution.

You’ll never find this work boring. Walker Environmental brings together a diverse set of businesses and your work will touch all of them. When this contract is fulfilled, you’ll benefit from the wealth of experience gained here.

We’re looking for someone who will show initiative beyond the focus of their day-to-day work. If you can improve our workflow, deepen our reporting, and enhance our risk assessment, there could be opportunities for advancement here.

This is a full-time 12 month contract position with the possibility of extension. We are offering a competitive salary between $50,000 - $60,000 to commensurate with experience.

Qualifications:

Experience working with legal documents
Experience using Microsoft Word and Excel
Valid driver’s license and ability to occasionally travel to other offices within Ontario
Experience working with SharePoint an asset
Degree or courses in law, business, or related field an asset

Working at Walker Industries

Established in 1887, we are proud to be a fifth-generation, family-owned, Canadian company. Our group of companies includes aggregates, paving & construction, emulsions and environmental waste & recycling solutions. We are known for our philanthropy and ‘above and beyond’ service to our customers and communities.

There’s a lot more we’re proud of too.

We’re proud to be growing, serving more customers and providing more jobs across Canada.

We’re proud of our environmental stewardship – turning waste into useful products and energy and working to the highest standards of disposal.

We’re proud to use the best tools and technology in the business – serving our customers well and keeping our employees safe.

And we’re proud of an awesome people-first culture. Working here means being part of a team – not a cog in a machine – and even in regional offices we feel valued, autonomous, and central to the action. Everyone at Walker has a voice.

HOW TO APPLY

Our online application will give you the option to apply to this role as a complete candidate – not just a resume. The application will assess your qualifications, personality traits and workplace preferences, and should take 10 to 15 minutes to complete. You can get a copy of your assessment when you’re done by logging back into the application tool.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us with the “Help” button in the application.

We will review applications as they are received and look forward to hearing from you.

Other
Other duties and special projects as assigned, including systems support and serving as a resource on course development projects

Experience with post-secondary Student Information Systems
Analytical disposition, critical thinking, decision-making ability
Superior verbal and written communication skills, organization and time management
Demonstrated ability to lead, motivate, and building relationships with colleagues at all levels
Demonstrated superior work ethic, initiative, ability to work independently with occasional direction; dependability, discretion, and a responsible attitude

Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!

Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements

Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Toronto, ONTo support our continued growth and provide excellence in customer service and satisfaction, we are looking for a high energy, results focused individual for the following role:

Position: Business Analyst
Location: 2 Lansing Sq, North York, ON
Reports to: Manager, Sales Effectiveness
Reliance™ has been providing affordable, reliable home heating, cooling, hot water, water purification and plumbing products and services to Canadians for more than 50 years. Our customers know they can count on us for fast, friendly, knowledgeable service and advice – and that’s comfortable!


Every day, 2200 Reliance team members focus on delivering a great customer experience, attracting great talent and giving back to the communities where we live and work. In 2018, we donated over $475,000 to United Way and $200,000 in product and services to Habitat for Humanity. This untiring dedication is what will drive profitable growth and help us fulfill our vision: to be the fastest growing and the largest provider of heating and cooling systems, and water heater, plumbing and water purification services in North America.


Reliance is a $750 million business today having doubled in size and team members over the last 5 years. We are proud to be recognized by Waterstone Human Capital Ltd. as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, while our CEO Sean O’Brien was recognized as one of Canada’s most admired CEO’s, and a Glassdoor ‘Best Places to Work’ winner. Reliance is passionate about our team members’ growth and success, and we proudly offer a Technical Training Assistance Program, access to tuition reimbursement and additional paid apprentice leave for eligible team members. Progressing team members’ careers helps us maintain our reputation of having the most knowledgeable technical Team Members in the HVAC industry. Contact us today at R2@reliancecomfort.com to learn more.


Sales Effectiveness Team Overview:

The Sales Effectiveness Team is responsible for the continued development and evolution of the sales process. As part of this team you will look at improving current processes and leveraging business tools to provide value added analysis to assist Sales and Marketing in driving growth and efficiencies.


Primary Mission:

The analyst will be responsible for providing business analysis and insights and subsequent recommendations to senior management, scheduled and adhoc reporting to the business as well as overseeing salespeople commission calculation process.


Key Responsibilities:

Work with manager to explore opportunities to provide data insights and business recommendations
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Filter and “clean” data based on analytical review and data health indicators
Acquire data from various systems within the business to build complete views of our results
Undertake data analytics focused on a view of customer retention, acquisition with the purpose of delivering a best in class customer experience
Locate and design new business process improvement opportunities
Effective communication skills to prepare all data and associated reports and presentations in a clear and concise manner


Skills, Abilities and Experience:
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
3-4 years and of related business experience
Completion of a post-secondary degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or Business
Experienced with Microsoft suite, including: Excel (i.e. Vlookups, Pivot Tables, etc.)
Strong understanding of data management and governance
Experience in commission payment systems an asset


Please note that this position requires a Criminal Background Check and Driver’s Abstract be completed for potential candidates (if applicable). This check must be satisfactory in order for an employment offer to be extended unconditionally .

Reliance Home Comfort is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds including minorities and those with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

TransUnion believes in investing in the best people. Our dynamic and diverse environment values and promotes the growth of associates in their jobs, roles and careers. Our organization supports ambitious individuals who seek career satisfaction and development.

Who We Are
At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things.

Every day TransUnion offers our employees the tools and resources they need to find ways information can be used in diverse ways. Whether it is helping businesses better manage risk, providing better insights so a consumer can qualify for his first mortgage or working with law enforcement to make neighborhoods safer, we are improving the quality of life for individuals, families, communities and local economies around the world.

About the Team
Global Decisioning leverages industry data and analytics, coupled with our technology assets, to deliver decision sets, decision criteria and decisioning solutions that help our business customers achieve more. Flexibility, the desire to contribute and an entrepreneurial spirit are valued here. Other highlights include the business-casual atmosphere where our leaders are interested in removing obstacles to your success, making this a great place to grow in your career. We’ve been instrumental in winning important new business and more challenges are on the way.

What you will do

In this role, you will serve as a project manager and business analyst to deliver decisioning and fraud market initiatives on our client's industry leading decisioning platform.
We are seeking a technically savvy individual with the strong collaborative skills required to manage projects of varying scope and work with customers to elicit and document business and functional requirements.
This is a hands-on and fast-paced role where the incumbent will be a key member of the team working on a specific product, and will be responsible for configuring the customers’ requirements into business ready solutions. You will deliver projects on time and on budget, making modifications to project phases as needed to address changes or problems to original scope. You will drive projects to delivery by performing project administrative tasks such as: creating and maintaining project plans, completing project estimates, identifying and reporting action items and risks, project status reporting, meeting facilitation and preparation of meeting notes. You will facilitate meetings with customers to identify all details of business objectives and requirements. The output from those meetings will result in requirement documentation authored by you. You will lead collaboration to help identify creative solutions to meet customer needs and address problem resolution. You will configure, test and deliver decisioning solution requests (for new solutions as well as changes to existing) to customers in a timely manner ensuring that appropriate standards are followed and customer needs are met. You will work with the team’s development and quality assurance associates to ensure captured requirements are interpreted and delivered correctly. You will serve as a Subject Matter Expert and provide non-incident support to customers, sales and other team members.

What you will bring A minimum of 4 years of applicable business experience in IT / risk industry (credit or financial services background preferred). At least 4 years of project management experience, as a member of a project team with at least 1 year as a project lead. PMP designation is a preferred. A minimum of 4 years elicitation and authoring requirements as well as interaction with external customers. Technical proficiency and skill level to learn and undertake solution configurations. Excellent listening and communication skills coupled with a strong technical aptitude. Demonstrated flexibility in dealing with change and adversity. Practical understanding and experience in Agile methodology.

Accommodation is available, including for applicants with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

FI.SPAN is a SaaS FinTech start-up simplifying and enhancing how banks connect to their business customers. Founded in 2016 by a successful FinTech entrepreneur, Lisa Shields, we are on a mission to fundamentally change the way that companies bank while building Vancouver’s next anchor company.

The Job:

FI.SPAN is looking for a full-time Business Analyst for our Product team to move new features forward from ideation through development to implementation. Our Product team sits in the business and engineering intersection to launch new features that move the customer experience and business forward. You will be joining an experienced team of 20 in our downtown Vancouver location.
If you have a detail-oriented, creative mind and enthusiasm for technology start-ups, we want to hear from you.

The Typical Day:

Work closely with the Project Manager, Product Manager and client, to elicit and analyze requirements to create epics and user stories, using use cases and wireframes to support when needed.

Assist the Project Manager, Product Manager and client, to update and maintain the sprint backlog to prioritize and acknowledge changes.

Participate in sprint planning, estimations and retrospectives.

Be able to produce client facing documentation.

Create customized product demonstrations aimed at prospective customers.

Assist in the preparation of sales proposals.

Be a key stakeholder and team member that plays a critical role in delivering services to our clients.

The Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a business or technology field.

1-2 years Business Analyst experience is preferred.
Passionate about technology.

Familiarity of Accounting & Banking is an asset.

Problem solver and critical thinker.

Familiarity with any high level programming language is an asset.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

The Benefits:

Located in the heart of downtown Vancouver in the MNP Tower, FI.SPAN employees have access to state of the art amenities, weekly team lunches, and daily coffee runs, all along the scenic shores of Coal Harbour. Expect a collaborative, energetic environment with lots of room for proactivity and growth. We believe in getting people to where they need to go. You will work closely with a highly-experienced management team to mentor you and help you achieve your personal career goals.

** Please also apply on FI.SPAN’s website: https://fispan.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=31

job_title: Business Analyst Intern, Strategy & Corporate Development
job_description:
What we’re about


IMAX Corporation is one of the world's leading entertainment technology companies, specializing in immersive motion picture technologies. The worldwide IMAX® theatre network is among the most important and successful theatrical distribution platforms for major event Hollywood films around the globe, with IMAX theatres delivering the world's best cinematic presentations using proprietary IMAX, IMAX® 3D, and IMAX DMR® technology. The IMAX® brand is world famous and stands for the highest-quality, most immersive motion picture entertainment. As the IMAX theatre network grows, so does the visibility of the IMAX brand – a name that is unique in the entertainment business.
IMAX Corporation hires individuals with diverse talents and backgrounds who are creative, entrepreneurial, innovative and passionate. We offer a challenging work environment operating in a global context, a competitive compensation and opportunities for development and growth. By welcoming diversity and respecting the value of work and lifestyle balance, IMAX has earned a reputation as a preferred employer.
Required Skills
What you’ll be doing:


This Analyst will serve as a key member of the Strategy & Corporate Development team, supporting the group VPs in identifying, evaluating and executing high impact strategic growth initiatives. The individual will support cross-functional work streams aimed at aggressively growing IMAX core business while simultaneously working to grow the brand outside of the cinema


Provide project management support for various team initiatives, developing and monitoring cross-functional work plans, project timelines, data/resource requirements, and specific steps/benchmarks.
Create highly polished power point presentations to support internal and external team presentations
Conduct due diligence of externally sourced business opportunities including: business partnerships, technology acquisition and M&A.
Conduct market research, including market sizing, competitive benchmarking, and consumer research
Interface with other groups within IMAX and externally to collect and synthesize data
Perform detailed analyses to help filter, assess, and implement strategic opportunities
Support multiple work streams associated with strategic projects and ensure clear communication with all key stakeholders
Develop business cases in support of the corporate development opportunities being pursued
Develop, use and maintain comprehensive financial models that forecast revenues, operating expenses, capital expenditures and funding scenarios
Perform industry reviews and prepare periodic reports
Manage the day to day operations of the group and any other administrative tasks as required


What we’re looking for:


Bachelor’s degree in, business administration, engineering, finance, economics, or a related area
2+ years’ experience with top-tier management consulting firm, or high impact strategy/corporate development role
Advanced to expert level Excel and PowerPoint skills
Excellent analytical and financial modeling skills
Excels at delivering results in a highly ambiguous environment
Entrepreneurial mindset and pattern recognition capability
Interest in emerging technologies and trends in the entertainment space
Ability to think strategically, to anticipate and identify problems, and develop creative solutions.
Self-motivated, well-organized, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills



Required Experience
For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


IMAX is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

PermanentHelping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?
Business Analyst
Are you interested in being a part of banking history...do you want to be a part of a financial institution that thinks differently and is committed to Albertans greater good?
ATB is just that! We promise to do the right thing for our customers no matter what. We are more than a bank we think beyond the lines of tradition and process to find solutions that impact our community. How do we do this?... By putting our team members first!
We know that for our customers to be happy it starts with the happiness of our people and we are committed to helping our team members learn and grow, and empower them to create their own paths for success. We believe that work should be fun; we inspire our team members to think beyond today and what we can achieve 30 years from now. Let’s create something new together!
The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Director for Business and Risk Management in Treasury and Payments Solutions (TaPS), the Business Analyst will assist the TaPS leadership team through data, processes and communications to best accomplish improvements for the business. This will be done by coordinating various activities and tasks that will facilitate the successful development of business solutions and support TaPS strategic initiatives.
This position is accountable for the regular production and analysis of a growing suite of reports for various audiences in TaPS. The role translates simple information and data requests from team members into meaningful reporting that creates insight in a timely way for these team members. The Business Analyst role will also conduct analysis on current TaPS processes and products and make recommendations on improvements to the TaPS leadership.
Key Accountabilities:
Focus on winning in the market by supporting the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS to deliver the strategic business priorities of enhancing client loyalty, increasing product penetration, and maximizing revenue growth & profitability for ATB.
Support Development & Integration of Business Process Management
Maintain and build industry expertise, leveraging superior networks and insights to deliver world class customer experiences and elevate the TaPS business.
Together with the Director of Business and Risk Management in TaPS, create and manager overall TaPS risk profiles to address all operational, transactional, regulatory and compliance, financial and liquidity, AML and sanction, and cybercrime risks
Job Requirements
What We’re Looking For:
University degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Math, or other quantitative or technical discipline is required
Minimum of 3-5 years of analytical experience
Experience with the development of complex analytical or statistical models
In-depth to expert knowledge of Cash Management, Treasury Management, Payments, Investments, and Financial Systems.
In-depth understanding of the payments product/ service offerings and how they provide customer solutions alone or combined
Strong interpersonal and leadership skills
Highly developed analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills (ability to devise creative, workable solutions within established policies, or provide analysis and recommendations for policy changes)
Ability to network & cultivate productive working relationships at various levels within ATB
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to interact effectively with Business Unit Management, Lines of Business, as well as external vendors
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools and Google Suite including extensive experience with Excel and Sheets
Strong research and project management skills (including planning, prioritization and execution)
Self-directed, self-motivated & committed to continuous learning
Strong time management, prioritization and organizational skills
So what can ATB Financial offer you? Imagine paying less for your everyday banking, mortgages, loans and investments. Throw in an excellent benefits and pension package, opportunities for career advancement, and a financial institution that’s leading the way in change – now you’re talking about a career with a company that allows you to grow. As an award-winning employer-of-choice – we have the best of the best working for Albertans. Sound like a team you want to be a part of?
Advancement. Fun. Rewards… We get it.

Halifax, NS$28.85 - $36.06 an hourNova Scotia Health Authority is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia. We are over 22,000 employees who provide health care and support services in hospitals, health centres and community-based programs throughout Nova Scotia.
Nova Scotia Health Authority provides health services to Nova Scotians and some specialized services to Maritimers and Atlantic Canadians. We operate hospitals, health centres and community-based programs across the province. Our team of health professionals includes employees, doctors, researchers, learners and volunteers that provide the health care or services you may need. This is accomplished across four geographic management zones which are responsible for the operation of acute care health centres and the provision of a variety of inpatient, outpatient services including academic, tertiary, quaternary care and community-based programs and services including continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions.

Responsibilities
The IM/IT Business Analyst/ Systems Analyst reports to an IM/IT PIEM Manager, and is responsible for the evaluation, testing, implementation, maintenance, and support of information management and technology solutions, projects and services across NSHA, IWK and its many external clients. The IM/IT BA/SA collaborates with key clinical and business stakeholders throughout the province as the organization, in partnership with the province’s Internal Services Department and the Department of Health and Wellness, moves towards the rationalization of disparate systems and the OPOR strategy.

Specific Responsibilities Include:
Maintenance and support of patient identity & encounter management software solutions
Information gathering and documentation of business requirements and end user workflow impacts as they relate to IT systems and processes with a focus on Identity Management, Client and Provider Registries, Health Information Management, User Access and Privacy.
Ensures IT systems and processes are implemented and maintained to support the effective and safe delivery of patient information to care providers in a variety of health information applications and registries.
Establish and maintain working relationships between the Clinical and Business stakeholders and IM/IT to determine appropriate IT solutions.
Collaborates as a subject matter expert in encounter and identity management with other team members, vendors and clinical stakeholders
Participate in clinical IM IT projects related to Health Information Management, Identity Management, User Access and Privacy
Complete other duties as assigned in relation to the position description
Qualifications
Degree or diploma in Health Information Management, Health Related discipline, or Information Technology. Consideration may be given to those with equivalent training and relevant experience
1-3 years’ experience in Business/Systems Analysis with Health Information and Registries Applications an asset
Health Information Management certification (CHIMA) or experience working in health information management settings an asset.
Knowledge of the varied information management processes supporting multiple care delivery paths and how they interrelate with other health care disciplines and organizational services an asset.
Certification in IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Project Management (PMP) and/or organizational change management an asset.
Ability to relay or explain issues or difficult scenarios to clinical and business staff
Working knowledge of basic systems principles, theories and concepts within healthcare
Strong knowledge of health care and technology industry best practice relating to Identity and Encounter management and associated software applications
Meditech Magic and ADM software experience considered an asset
Ability to troubleshoot and document issues and problems and implement resolution using clinical best practice knowledge of internal and/or external business issues to improve service
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills
Experience creating summary documentation based on evaluation and analysis
Ability to collaborate with diverse stakeholders to document and solve issues
Experience in transformational or process analysis to support change management principles
Organizational Skills, high level of accuracy and attention to detail
Competencies in other languages an asset, French preferred


PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will not be considered for an interview if applications are incomplete or are missing information. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.
Hours of Work
Regular, full-time position; 75 hours biweekly
Salary Information

Greater Toronto Area, ONJob Summary


Working with the Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) and senior program leadership, the team lead will be responsible for heading activities on projects to deliver technology platform which meet’s the business’ needs. This includes leading requirements gathering, preparing materials for meetings and working sessions, liaising with other project team members and being responsive to client’s needs, all with an eye on details in a fast-paced environment.


Duties and Responsibilities

Responsible for preparing materials needed for client meetings (PowerPoint slides, supporting analysis) and communicating decisions made and action items agreed to post the meeting.
Ensuring the documentation of formal requirements and use cases so that the business needs are properly captured and articulated.
Collaborates with technical delivery team members to maximize and leverage the understanding of business solution functional and technical requirements
Collaborates with application developers, designers, and architects to ensure a shared understanding of the detailed functional and technical requirements.
Ownership of the creation of test plans which ensure that the software solutions developed and tested are fit for purpose, meet business needs and are operationally sustainable.
Oversight of and input into creation of test cases, test scripts and test suites used in test execution
Coordination of testing of applications based on test plans, test cases and test scripts created ensuring delivered solution meets the requirements
Responsible for the timeliness and accuracy of necessary escalations, producing and maintaining applicable project tasks and status reporting within a project team.
Directs and monitors development and cutover activities to ensure the traceability and optimum coverage of requirements by defined test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Actively participates in development of project plans associated with project execution.
Manages the progress of projects by tracking activity, resolving issues, and recommending actions; Provides senior management and project management with regular updates on deliverable timeline and project status.
Responds proactively to both business and project issues and escalates appropriately.
Assists the TDM with team management activities including hiring and training, and keeps the TDM updated on team performance.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

Toronto, ONPermanentWhat is the opportunity?
Business Systems Analyst is responsible for business analysis activities on medium to large size projects. The role demonstrates advanced knowledge and ability, and can apply the competency in new or complex situations and guides other professionals. The role is responsible for execution of all aspects of requirements delivery- planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation, management, and support - for changes to Business Areas and Technology.

What will you do?
Perform requirements stakeholder analysis to identify impacted or influencing groups and stakeholder requirements responsibilities
Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates
Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties
Define the business analysis approach including tasks and deliverables based on the project and delivery methodology
Lead requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out business priorities
Facilitate collaborative sessions with large and diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, analysis, and review
Prepare requirements for review applying various communication techniques and lead requirements walkthrough and sign off sessions
Provide guidance and support to build the capabilities of the junior BAs

What do you need to succeed?
Must have
5+ years related experience
Experience with ITIL best practices and procedures
Working as a Business Analyst with progressively increasing responsibilities in the areas of requirements management on large and complex projects
Cost/Benefit Analysis and alternatives identification
Relevant college, university, or post-graduate degree in Business Analysis

Nice to have
Knowledge or experience with the ServiceNow Platform
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or Project Management Institute –Professional in Business Analysis Certification (PMI – PBA)
ITIL certification or Masters Certificate in Business Analysis

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable.Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.Opportunities to do challenging work.Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

SpringGage is currently looking for an energetic and dedicated individual who is interested in working on challenging projects to join our innovative team as a Business Analyst.

SpringGage deploys a wide range of technology in designing solutions for our customers. Business Analysts must have a love of technology and at least a functional understanding of technologies deployed. These include:

Mobile technologies (iPhone, iPad, Blackberry, Android)

Microsoft Office, including Visio

Work with clients and understand, document in plain English requirements for business processes, work flows and defining Key Performance Indicators
Learn Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN), and translate English requirements into models (BPMN) using Microsoft Visio

SpringGage. is a unique place to work. We offer a competitive salary, positive work environment, and the chance to work with leading edge technology.

Mississauga, ONReq Id: 230714
 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

The Bell IT team uses emerging technologies, Agile and DevOps to design and build innovative solutions that enable Bell’s communications services for businesses and consumers. We’re looking for creative problem-solvers who are curious, collaborative and ready to be on the leading edge of technological transformation.

The Information Technology team develops and maintains Bell’s internal systems and applications while also developing integrated technology solutions for customers across all lines of business.

The team manages Bell’s IT Infrastructure and the service availability of over 700 applications, including mission critical billing and service systems. The IT delivery teams drive the IT Work Program with over 60% of IT capital invested in initiatives that support business unit priorities and Bell’s strategic imperatives.

The Role:
The successful candidate will be accountable to analyze and document system, network and business requirements in accordance with conceptual solutions within the Service Assurance Consumer Trouble Management domain additionally build strong partnerships with clients and vendors, the incumbent will perform comprehensive validation, regression and performance testing to ensure best practices.

Job Duties/Accountabilities
Analyze and document system
Network and business requirements in accordance with conceptual solutions within the Service Assurance Consumer Trouble Management domain
Build strong partnerships with clients and vendors
Validate application designs
Achieve alignment and buy-in from end users
Perform comprehensive validation, regression and performance testing in adherence with the Service Assurance Consumer Trouble Management domain
Ability to perform data mining, statistical and quantitative analysis
Autonomous, strong tolerance to ambiguity, excellent capacity for applied learning
Proven leadership, organization, problem solving skills
Excellent ability to articulate and document technical concepts on many levels- modify approach as required for differing audiences

And/or equivalent work experience

General understanding of programming and markup languages
Enterprise application frameworks (Java EE, ESB, .NET, etc)
Web Services / SOA, N-Tier Architectures
Any OO language (Java- mainly, C/C++ an asset, Javascript, Python, etc)
Any procedural language (C, Perl, Shell, AWK, etc)
Any markup language (HTML + CSS, XML, SGML, etc)
Previous Business analyst experience
Application Testing and Defect Tracking tools
Customer service and network diagnostics tools (DSL test preferred)
Knowledge of systems like ACUT , BCRIS, Tapestry , IPAIRS , Blueprints
Knowledge of Residential and Small Business Service Assurance Process

Kelowna, BCImagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!
Essential Functions:
Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements
Analyze requirements and investigate impacts to customer workflows and operational goals
Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format
Document User Acceptance Test requirements (e.g. test matrix, test scripts)
Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation
Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required
Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

job_title: Business Analyst - MBovis - Hamilton or Christchurch
job_description:
ContractThe opportunity:

We are seeking a Business Analyst for a two year fixed-term role to assist with the eradication of the cattle disease Mycoplasma bovis. You will be working as part of a diverse team seeking to eradicate Mycoplasma bovis from the dairy and beef industries across New Zealand. The role has an operational focus and will assist in developing our operational data and information sets for management.

AsureQuality has been contracted by the Ministry for Primary Industries to implement all operational tasks associated with eradicating the disease. A new business unit has been established and operations are implemented via four regional offices. We are now seeking someone to ensure that service delivery targets are being met across all regions, and that the appropriate resources are in place. Working with the Operations, Technical and Compliance Managers, you will be developing reporting systems for the field operations, sizing up specification changes, providing monthly reports and assisting with resource supply and demand modelling. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team and assist with the analyzing and implementation of systems and processes that will ensure a streamlined operation for the wider business unit.

About you:

Ideally you will have a Tertiary qualification in commerce or senior management, with proven managerial experience. You will be knowledgeable in people management and employee relations also. You will have experience in scenario planning or workload assessment and be proficient in data analysis. Previous experience with Primary Industries and an understanding of the dairy or beef industries would give you a distinct advantage. You will be able to think outside the box, challenge ideas and be able to work independently and also as part of a team.

About us:

AsureQuality provides biosecurity surveillance and response services to help protect New Zealand against exotic pests and disease incursions. We have a long history of working with MPI, successfully managing, developing and delivering capability and responding to incursions.

Join us today!

Imagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.

Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out

Manage conformance process for Partner Integrations with QHR Products or QHR Integrations with external environments as required

Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects

Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

What This Position Is All About:
The Business Systems Analyst engages Business Stakeholders & IT to plan, elicit, analyze, document and validate system requirements that meet business needs. The Business Systems Analyst leverages an analytical approach and their technical skills to understand business problems/requirements, as well as the capabilities of the technology, and proposes a recommended solution for new project or for enhancements to the existing applications.

Who You Are:
You’re able to speak comfortably and with credibility in both business and technical languages.
You have exceptional analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills.
You painlessly overcome obstacles while respecting others’ points of view and positions
You are able to work independently, and can prioritize and meet tight deadlines.
You have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business and technical challenges.

You Also Have:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, Process Engineering or related field.
Previous experience with Retail systems such as Finance and HR.
Previous experience or understanding of Oracle applications and modules.
Previous experience with Oracle Cloud.
An understanding of and possible work experience in development and programming.
Proven record of accomplishments in major enterprise level projects.

As The Business Systems Analyst, You Will:
Collect and document business requirements and act as the liaison between the business and the appropriate technical / development teams during requirement gathering and finalization. Analyze business and user needs; gather business requirements, using a structured process, and document functional requirements.
Work with developers to define system scope and objectives based on both user needs and good understanding of applicable business systems and industry standards.
Develop strong working relationship with the business and establish yourself as their go-to person; independently and through interaction with stakeholders, identify areas of opportunity and propose improvements.
Perform application system analysis, prepare data/process flow diagrams and design screen/report layouts as part of business systems solution/application design.
Creates and maintains applicable documentation pertaining to specific SDLC phases.
Assists in creation of QA and UAT test scenarios and test cases.
Supports QA and Business teams during QA and UAT testing as well as assists in resolution of any applicable defects discovered during QA and UAT.
May perform UAT in proxy for the business when required.

Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance.
