Business Analyst, Customer Experience (CX)

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Success stories, like this don’t happen everyday. From humble beginnings as a courier industry solutions provider in Canada, Fleet Complete quickly grew to be one of the world’s leaders in telematics and connected mobility solutions for a wide variety of industries with fleets, assets and mobile workers.

Today, with 20 years in the industry, Fleet Complete is one of the fastest growing IoT (Internet of Things) companies across the globe, operating in 17 countries with offices in Canada, Netherlands, Denmark, Belgium, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Australia. Fleet Complete continues to win employer, innovation and business awards thanks to our relentless customer centric approach and commitment to company values of Innovation, Quality, Customers, Productivity, People and Community.

Thanks to strong partnerships and sound investments, our trusted Fleet and Mobile workforce platform provides real-time insights, visibility, employee safety and overall operational efficiency. This helps organizations, municipalities and businesses of all sizes to modernize their operations with ease. Fleet Complete is known for hiring, growing and empowering talented people who develop innovative products, build powerful relationships and provide personalized support that is unparalleled in our industry. Join Fleet Complete on our next chapter and we can work together to "help fleets thrive".

MAIN BUSINESS OBJECTIVES:
Reporting to the Global Director, Continuous Experience Improvement (CEI), the Business Analyst, Customer Experience (CX), will provide strong leadership in the elicitation, documentation, and refinement of business processes, workflows and requirements as they relate to mapping out our customer journey for key organizational projects. In this role, you will be responsible for clarifying stakeholder needs and creating newly innovated business processes and workflows that will help the efficiencies within Operations resulting in seamless customer experience. You will collaborate with external and internal stakeholders from multiple disciplines across Fleet Complete worldwide.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Gather and synthesize requirements using various elicitation techniques (workshops, interviews, change management, SWOT and GAP analysis, document analysis)
Provide clear and detailed business requirements or change management documentations
Create and implement change management plans that minimize the workflows within both Product and Operations
Create workflows that result in seamless customer experience journey across all products and services
Work with departments and business leadership to drive faster adoption, greater ultimate utilization and higher proficiency on the changes impacting employees
Identify enhancement opportunities within existing processes; lead change process when required
Participate in projects to deliver insights and recommendations for business requirements to develop high performance products/services that achieve corporate objectives
Work with Training to provide full understanding of new workflows, processes, and solutions
Be a leader in the continuous improvement of customer experience at Fleet Complete
Some travel may be required
Other duties and responsibilities based upon business needs

Hours of Operations: Mon – Fri (9:00 am to 5:00 pm) occasional overtime

QUALIFICATIONS:
All applicants must possess the following:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or equivalent
Certification in Pragmatic Marketing and/or Service Design is an asset
3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Change Management or Business Process equivalent experience in a similar capacity
Proficient with MS Office Suite and Microsoft Dynamics CRM
Strong foundation in the use of various business analysis tools and techniques or change management protocols related to planning, elicitation, analysis, documentation, and communication
Exceptional problem solving and decision making abilities
A team player with exceptional interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional teams
Solid written and oral communication skills and the ability to work effectively with all levels of staff and management, external vendors, and off shore development teams
Flexibility and adaptability in learning and understanding new technologies
Ability to allocate one's time effectively; handle multiple demands and competing priorities; well-organized, detail-oriented and accurate, flexible and willing to take on various tasks as needs change
Highly effective project management, prioritization, multi-tasking, and time management skills to meet deadlines

Ideal candidates also demonstrate the following:

Background or certifications in Lean Six Sigma, Change Management or Procsi is an asset
Fluent both written and spoken in French, Spanish, Dutch, German or Danish is an asset
Experience in the telematics or AVL industry is an asset
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 / Azure is a preference is an asset
Strong knowledge and experience with Power BI is preferred is an asset

Summary

Major Responsibilities and Accountabilities
This BA will be working with our Payment team. Strong understanding of the payment industry and fraud prevention
Define and utilize relevant business analysis techniques and methodologies to perform solution analysis and design, this could include but is not limited to:
Requirements management (requirements traceability, baselining, etc.) Enterprise analysis (benchmark studies, feasibility analysis, SWOT, etc.)
Requirements elicitation (prototyping, reverse engineering, focus groups, interviews, etc.)
Requirements analysis such as analyzing requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities, writing specifications (process modeling, organization modeling, use cases, etc.)
Solution assessment and validation (support of user acceptance testing, defect and issue reporting, etc.)
Development of test cases as appropriate
Development of functional designs or detailed user stories
Drive the definition, optimization, improvement, and approved changes to new and existing business processes and IT solutions via development of business and functional requirements
Identify the current and future-state business processes
Help the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future
Determine operational objectives by studying critical business functions (“CBFs”), gathering information, evaluating output requirements and formats
Provide continuous improvement services to improve existing business processes and inform the Business Solution Delivery leadership team of potential continuous improvement opportunities
Manage process conformance and compliance as appropriate (e.g. PCI)
Recommend controls by identifying problems, writing improved procedures
Support change management activities
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Development of functional designs or detailed user stories
Critical Skills and Competencies Characteristics
QUALIFICATIONS
Client Management : Experienced in effectively interacting and communicating with business teams; can consolidate business requirements and translate them into IT deliverables
Business analysis: familiar with business engineering system concepts and principles as well as complex modeling techniques,able to align business unit sub-processes to enterprise business processes and able to lead functional requirement walk through and quality reviews
Value management: can identify the effectiveness and completeness of business and technology strategies and ensure alignment with IT and other applicable cross-organization strategies
Domain knowledge: deep knowledge of business context and mode of operations

CERTIFICATIONS
Academic : university degree in business or information systems or equivalent experience or combination thereof (required), Graduate degree in Business Administration (MBA)(Asset)
Certifications: Certified business analysis professional (CBAP) (Asset), BABOK (Asset), ITIL foundations (Asset), Project Management Professional (PMP), TOGAF certification (Asset)

EXPERIENCE
Experience in contributing to the success of a range of small-to-medium initiatives with escalating levels of complexity and business criticality
Experience in a business analyst role and / or in other relevant roles within IT
Worked in payment/finance industry
Strong understanding of Fraud Prevention
OVERALL SKILLS – ABILITIES
Excellent understanding of business context and mode of operations
Proven ability to identify, formalize, and problem solve business needs
Exceptional interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation and negotiation
Mature perspective on architecture principles and frameworks
Understands principles of iterative development, and able to document business requirements as Agile user stories
Competencies
Leadership
Achievement & Results Focus
Customer Focus
Communication
Teamwork
Technical Knowledge

Experience in Software Development is required

BSc. In Computer Science or a related field.

Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment, as well as ability to work independently.
Ability to take ownership for assigned tasks and projects, provide development estimates and milestones, and deliver on commitments.
Ability to effectively present ideas and concepts, facilitating stakeholder buy in.
Experience implementing software for agricultural service company is an asset

Organization Overview
For over 70 years Buckland has been working to help companies across the world experience global trade in a better way. Buckland employs a unique approach to global trade that focuses on combining trusted technologies and talented people that know how to use them. As a customer-focused company, Buckland provides customers with a single source of unmatched Customs Brokerage (Canadian, US, Mexican), Trade Managed Solutions, Freight Forwarding, Trade Technologies and Warehousing/Distribution Services. Buckland strives to provide customized services in a memorable way.

Position Summary
The business analyst is the key resource to ensure successful delivery of solutions between application users and application developers. They are the crucial component to determining strategic project deliverables (technology/process/people) and timelines.

What we can offer you
Competitive salary, benefits package and matching retirement plan
A friendly, collaborative work environment
Opportunities for professional development & ongoing learning
A chance to be part of a growing organization

Key Responsibilities:
Partner with the business/user group representatives to understand the business processes
Become a SME to execute the end user’s system entries and responsibilities.
Design and review user stories and acceptance criteria; as well develop test strategies, test plans and test cases
Document the resulting analysis in an appropriate format including process flows, business rules, workflow descriptions and data definitions.
Conduct and lead UAT remediation meetings and documents.
Organize projects/deliverables by applying the SDLC principals and fundamentals.
Deliver an agile approach to system enhancements and deliverables with continuous iterations of improvements to existing applications.
Inclined and enthusiastic approach to all stages or facets in the program.

The ideal candidate will bring:
Educational background and/or 1-5 years in business technology focused roles.
Experience with Business Analysis and Project Management fundamentals and methodologies.
Strong communication skills, able to communicate in both technical and user-friendly language.
University Degree or College Diploma
Familiarity writing formal test plans and test cases.
Fluency in Spanish considered an asset.
Ability to travel between Canada and the USA to other offices

Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. job_title: Category Business Analyst, Kids (12 Month Contract)
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporaryHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast

dates back to

1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

Our Merchandising team is responsible for connecting our quality products and services with our customers. The team uses planning frameworks and tools to provide recommendations that will ensure financial results and provide decisions on key inputs such as point of sales forecasts.

This role will support the Kids department driven by seasonal demands of the business.

What you’ll do

The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians to live life to the fullest every day, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.

You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals. You will inspire the Canadian Tire customer experience with your passion for continually improving processes and product lines, helping us be there for Canadians when they need us.

To excel as a Category Business Analyst, you will be creative and highly organized with a passion for delivering results. You will be responsible for:

Growing your merchandising category by providing support to the Category Business Managers by driving operational excellence accurately and on time

Demonstrating competency in organization, analytics, collaboration and communication

Leading the flawless execution of the line review process and assortment updates

Ensuring timely and accurate product information management

Coordinating samples with vendors in support of various CTR requirements

Acting as a point of contact for our vendors and third-party suppliers on day to day activities and program set-up

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both internal and external clients is required. A solid understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint is an asset.

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of

Canada’s Top Employers

.

To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on

LinkedIn

.

#LI-TK1

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Operating out of Thornhill, Ontario, (Highway 407 & Leslie Street), we hire people with a broad set of skills that connect with the business everyday. The efficient delivery/completion of tasks related to the successful launch of client and TPA implementations and other projects as identified.
Determining inconsistent, inefficient or non-existent business processes and establishing, testing and training the efficient solutions.
A Typical Day Could Include:

Working directly with internal and external development team to ensure solutions meet customers requirements and
Conducting post implementation reviews to determine lessons learned for newly implemented business or TPAs.

3-5 years experience working in a Business Analyst capacity.

Experience gathering, creating, reporting and analyzing project metrics.

Markham, ON
Full Time Permanent

Reporting to the Director, Health and Productivity Solution Technology, the incumbent is responsible to provides business analysis expertise and deliver detailed requirements and specifications related to the proprietary application under the Health and Productivity line of business.

Responsibilities:
Works with internal business users and assigned project resources collecting and analyzing business requirements for project implementations, ongoing maintenance and system enhancements.
Produces detailed requirements and specifications, wireframes and models used by business users and development team.
Produces testing documents and test cases, and performs testing as required.
Supports systems development teams and business areas as required.
Continuously devises ways to improve team operations.
Builds knowledge of industry topics and trends through internal training, external training and self-study, as appropriate.
Performs other tasks and special projects, as required.


Qualifications:
5+ years of experience as a business analyst preferably in a technically-oriented environment and worked on technical assignments and/or projects
Experience in absence or disability management, group insurance, HR/payroll systems is an asset.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience in project management is an asset.
Solid understanding of The Software Development Life Cycle.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience with various analysis and techniques to write detailed specifications and requirements for software development.
Experience with and uses various visual modelling techniques that is appropriate for the type and scope of the assignment.
Understanding concepts in data modelling and relational database design.
Lead and collaborate with business Subject Matter Experts (SME), business resources, Project Managers, other Business Analysts, and developers to ensure that solutions are thoroughly though through and issues and risks are identified and resolved.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments.
Ability to work independently, takes initiative, and exercise good judgement.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and creative-thinking skills.
Exceptional customer focus and strong professional acumen.
Demonstrated knowledge of software development concepts (focus on internet applications and mobile applications).
Basic understanding of negotiation, conflict management and risk management skills.
Reliable, consistent, flexible and adaptable.
Experienced in estimating complexity, time and effort, planning and worked closely with Project Managers to successfully meet requirements and timelines.

The ideal candidate
You’re a patient listener. You understand very technical subjects, but can easily explain them in non-technical language. You’re not necessarily a developer, but you understand application development concepts and can easily engage in a technical discussion. You’re a problem-solver and capable of proposing options to support business decision making. You also have an interest to understand the industry and business processes of the department. You focus on understanding what the user really needs and design solutions that add value, are feasible and can be implemented within budget.

A typical day
You’ll meet with business stakeholders, developers and system architects to gather the information you need to create wireframes, process models and detailed functional specifications. You’ll investigate and research both new business issues and requests for changes to our systems depending on the nature of the request. Throughout the software lifecycle, you will support developers, IT QA specialists and business UAT resources to clarify requirements. Occasionally you’ll do the testing, too. As a change is rolled out, you’ll help your business stakeholders understand how it works and how to use it. At times may be required to work overtime, weekends and evenings to accelerate requirement timelines and support testing during system deployments.

THE ROLE

As a Junior Business Analyst, you create and document technical requirements, including use cases, user stories, process models, and software requirement specifications documents, in addition to writing RFP responses. Your technical background in software development is a must, but don’t worry if you’re not familiar with all of these terms; on this team, passion comes first, drive, second and experience, third.

You’re jazzed at the thought of facilitating workshops to elicit both functional and technical requirements and get satisfaction out of organizing these ideas into clear and concise project specifications. You can’t wait to collaborate with clients and fellow savvy team members to analyze business cases and come up with technical solutions that fit all parties’ needs.

As a Junior Business Analyst, you’re the Nancy Drew of finding new RFP bid opportunities and jump head first into researching the latest trends in tech, then painting the page with your findings. You have a knack for writing and take pride in being the glue that binds the technical team and the business team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Prepare user stories, software requirement documents, RFP responses and other required functional specifications;
Document requirements, create use cases, and process models;
Analyze business problems of our clients and help formulate the technology roadmap to solve their business case;
Conduct meetings and facilitate workshops directly with clients to elicit both functional and technical requirements;
Spot technical constraints to the proposed solutions and communicate them effectively to the client;
Support Project Managers as needed by writing tickets in Jira and documenting processes;
Collaborate with clients and team members to address business, technical, and hardware needs.

QUALIFICATIONS

Need to Haves

A completed or in progress BS/MS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline. Diploma certificates are also okay!
A tech background and/or understanding of/experience in SDLC;
A passion for writing, researching and staying up to date with the newest trends in tech;
A drive to deliver quality, adhere to deadlines and initiate new best practices and processes within our writing team.

We're happy to teach the right candidates the rest!

Nice to Haves

Experience working in an Agile environment
Experience in some area of development, preferably web and/or mobile
Technical writing experience
Legal working status in Canada, please note that we do not have resources to sponsor work permits

If you're a recent grad, please attach your unofficial transcript to your application - show us what you’ve got!

$73,000 - $109,000 a yearEDC is looking to staff several Senior Business Analyst roles
across multiple portfolios within the organization.

EDC Senior Business Analysts liaise between business and solution
delivery teams to develop solutions that support the business. As a key
relationship builder with stakeholders and projects team, the Senior Business
Analysts elicit, analyze, communicate, validate and translate business
requirements into useable formats for the project team, for new functionality
and changes to business processes, data/information, and information systems.

Senior Business Analysts can act with agility and to quickly
understand the business to be able to contribute to solutions that enable the
organization to achieve its goals. The incumbents can assess processes and
information streams; and are proficient in the utilization of appropriate
tools, models and techniques as part of the requirements gathering process. Successful candidates will have experience in
fulfilling their role in both waterfall and agile environments.

Successful candidates will have experience working in large,
complex programs. Candidates will need to demonstrate experience leading other
team members including other Senior Business Analysts on the overall direction
and approach to business analysis. The successful candidates will also need to
demonstrate an ability to work across multiple projects within portfolios and
have evidence of experience in supporting teams moving to an operational model.

Discipline Summary

Acts as a liaison between the development group and business
units for the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of
existing systems.

Evaluates new applications and identifies systems
requirements.

Evaluates new developments and evolving business requirements
and recommends appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current
systems.

Prepares communications and makes presentations on system
enhancements and/or alternatives.

Key Responsibilities

Leads and conducts the requirements gathering process and
translates them into documentation for changes or enhancements to business
processes, data/information, and information systems

Delivers documentation for client validation to support
approval processes and to the technical project members to deliver the solution

Leads the development of technology change management
strategy and approaches

Elicits, analyzes, and validates clients' functional and
non-functional business requirements and translates them into documentation for
changes or enhancements to business processes, data/information, and
information systems

Acts as functional expert on one or more business
areas/applications and provides advice, instructions, and guidance to end-users
and technical support services as an application subject matter expert

Works closely with the project manager, delivery manager,
and/or Product Owner(s)

Qualifications

Screening Criteria

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Management
Information Systems, Business or Accounting

At least 7 years of experience in business system analysis

Education and/or Certification in Business Analysis from a recognized
college, university or organization

Experience and knowledge of information/data management
concepts including: metadata management, data quality, data mapping and
modeling, and data architecture

Demonstrated experience working in large complex programs,
being involved in multiple projects simultaneously, leading other team members,
including other BAs and Senior Business Analysts on the team, and leading
multiple streams of work

Experience and/or certification in Agile, Scrum Master or
Hybrid IT delivery methodology

Assets

Experience in Agile and Scrum delivery frameworks

Strong experience with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)

Formal business analyst training in Adobe Experience Manager
(AEM)

Experience in, but not limited to one or more of the

following industries/areas of specialization:
Marketing

Financial (i.e. insurance, loan origination, loan
administration, banking systems)

Information Services

Experienced with, but not limited to:
TFS and/or VSTS 2013 or higher

Visio

Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certified

Bilingualism in both official languages (English
and French)

$73,000 - $109,000 + performance based incentive

HSBC Bank Canada, a subsidiary of HSBC Holdings plc, is the largest and leading international bank in Canada. HSBC serves customers worldwide through an international network of around 3,800 offices in 66 countries and territories in Europe, Asia, North and Latin America, and the Middle East and North Africa
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Retail Banking and Wealth Management.
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.
About Retail Banking & Wealth Management
Retail Banking and Wealth Management serves millions of customers worldwide, helping them manage their day – to day finances and save for the future. We also connect institutional and retail clients with investment opportunities through our Global Asset Management division. We are committed to building long-term relationships with our customers, offering products and services to help them reach their goals and aspirations. We continue to exponentially grow our market share in Canada year on year.
Key Objectives for Business Analyst:

Business Analysts are at the centre of how Transformation shapes, delivers and embeds change working with the business and our delivery partners. This Business Analyst role is located in the RBWM Business Transformation Team of HSBC Bank Canada.

Principle Accountabilities:
Understand the RBWM strategic priorities and how they connect to the vision and objectives of the project(s) assigned.
Work with business lead and product owner to articulate ideas into business requirements and processes that delivery partners can translate into solution and change intervention designs.
Support product owner define success criteria, business outcome and measurable KPIs that align closely to project objectives and from there manage appropriate scope.
Keep customer centric focus and use end user perspective to validate requirements, solutions and deliverables are aligned to the delivery of business outcome.
Contribute to change activities which can include diverse tasks such as resource planning, budget forecast, timeline planning to stakeholder engagement
Support project manager proactively manage risks and issues, and contribute to effective management strategies.
Collaborate with Change & Implementation team on activities such as audience analysis, training and communication to ensure effective embedding of change and realization of benefits.
Having a working knowledge of BTF and experience in Agile Way of Work will be an asset.
Influencing and Challenging Stakeholders to facilitate acceptance and commitment to change.
Design future state business architecture by translating understanding of business requirements into operating model and design with impact mitigation.
Familiar with change management approach and techniques to manage implementation end-to-end, gaining commitment and ensuring adoption.
Embrace Agile, proficient in fast-paced environment where changing business priorities may result in reprioritisation of requirements, scope and time to market. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement in the way of working.
Understanding products, channels and propositions, be well informed of their features and benefits and how HSBC differentiate from competitors. Suggest improvements to improve customer experience.
Effectively engage with customers/stakeholders/colleagues, understand, respond to and anticipate their changing needs and priorities; demonstrating inclusive behaviour, valuing diversity. Communicating openly and honestly and conveying information in simple and understandable ways to build trusting relationships; Working collaboratively within and across boundaries.
Understand HSBC priorities, keep up to date with external market innovations and use your understanding to identify opportunities .
Problem solving and critical thinking skills to bring structure to complex projects for analysis and resolution.
Remain effective in dynamic working environment and use good judgement in decision making sometimes with limited information.
Qualifications
Knowledge & Experience / Qualifications:
University Degree with 5+ years of relevant working experience, professional accreditation/training is desirable.
Knowledge of financial services industry and its regulatory environment, preferably with experience implementing change in the banking industry. Front line experience will be considered an asset.
Experience gathering requirements and conducting design activity, with a mix of business, operations and technology focused projects
Exposure to business case development and “design-led change” tools, e.g. customer value proposition, business process design
Strong communication skills both verbal and in writing.
Good knowledge of Business Transformation and experience in Agile way of working an asset.
HSBC Proud
In 2018, HSBC Bank Canada was named one of the Best 50 Corporate Citizens by Corporate Knights magazine, in addition to The World’s Best Bank by Euromoney Magazine in its annual Awards for Excellence.
Join HSBC, and benefit from the following:
Career Development: Within your current role, as well as Canadian and international opportunities
Company Reputation: Offering prestige, strength, and longevity
Business Growth: Underpinned by our drive, and the highest banking standards
International Connectivity and impact: Build global relationships and be a part of international initiatives
A diverse workforce: Reflecting our belief that diversity of thought, background and perspective make HSBC a stronger organization
Corporate Sustainability: We build our business for the long term by balancing social, environmental and economic considerations in the decisions we make

Description

Citi’s Trade & Treasury Solutions (TTS) is a leading provider of Cash Management, Treasury and Trade Solutions. With a global network spanning more than 100 countries, TTS has a global platform that is unique in the industry for its reach and flexibility. We provide clients with timely, accurate information and dynamic, web-based tools to effectively manage their financial positions, working capital, payment capabilities and view of their financial supply chain.
We are seeking a senior Business Analyst who will be responsible for build out enterprise and conformed logical models on Citi's Big Data and GIW platform that houses our TTS products.
The ideal candidate should be:
Technically astute, well organized, proactive and be comfortable discussing issues with business and technical users at all levels
He/she requires exceptional communication skills across both technology and the business and will have a high degree of visibility.
The candidate will be dependable and resourceful software professional who can comfortably work in a large development team in a globally distributed, dynamic work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration. The ability to work in high-pressured environment is essential.
Key Responsibilities:
Overall responsibilities include creating conformance models on the Vanguard platform across various TTS products.
Should be able to understand the functional flows, complex calculation logic and data flow across various systems and products within TTS Data & Analytics platform
Review, analyze, and interpret Business Requirements Documents (BRD) and providing feedback on key functionalities and technical feasibility
Develops, writes, and communicates business requirements and functional specifications , data dictionaries to clearly articulate requirements and mapping of data elements to UI elements.
Experience in writing & reviewing functional requirement document specification and data dictionaries to clearly articulate requirements and mapping of data elements to UI elements.
Being the interface between the Product stakeholders and technical team and should be able to bridge any gap related to requirements
Work with stakeholders for requirement scoping, preparation of product backlog and work with Scrum master / project manager for defining sprint backlogs
Lead & work as product owner with Scrum teams for various streams and provide valuable inputs to deliver increment releases for given application / product
Responsible for key process improvements in business analysis space
Create business model and logical data models for cash management products.
Reverse engineer the business model for the Cash management products on existing applications.
Adhere to the requirements processes as well as SDLC to gather, write and maintain FRDs. Conduct FRD walkthroughs for multiple teams (Development, Quality Control, User Acceptance Testing, Training, Market Readiness and Operations) to explain new and enhanced functionality.
Develop prototypes and Business Use Case Scenarios to facilitate the gathering and documentation of requirements
Partner with the business and technical teams and create and maintain the Functional design for the various modules in the platform.
Work with cross functional teams across multiple countries and time zones
Follow the SDLC process established in the organization and create and maintain all relevant requirements artifacts

Qualifications

Required Skills and experience
At least 7+ years overall IT experience within Financial industries with 4+ years’ experience as business analysts or data scientist in large data oriented applications / platform is must
Must have hands-on experience in developing writing, and communicating business requirements and functional specifications for the implementation of business solutions.
Expertise in creating data models, process flows and sequence diagrams are must.
Expertise to create and interpret SQL queries and related software (SQL Developer, Toad).
Experience with Oracle, SQL server, Database concepts, ETL processes, reporting tools .
Experience with Hadoop, HDFS. Impala and any other bid data platforms is a plus.
Knowledge in Project management practices, Software Development Lifecycle, Release, Change and Stakeholder management.
Experience with Agile methodology.
Excellent planning, organization and prioritization skills to meet ever changing demands of delivery stream .
Strong communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation of complex information and data).
Ability to draft Use Cases, Process Flows, and Activity Diagrams.

Requisition ID: 57940
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Overview
In this role you will build and maintain the firm’s Capital Markets RiskWatch (RW) data and feeds for a variety of market risk, credit and counterparty risk and trade floor risk management systems and consumers.
The team is responsible for sourcing financial product data from a 50+ front-office and back-office systems into a centralized data repository, mapping sourced data to risk models and ensuring that pricing/valuations are as expected for downstream risk systems and data consumers.
You are also expected to have a good understanding of risk management and risk pricing models for the majority of the main capital markets products, basic principles of data management, business analysis and a thorough familiarity with SDLC. As part of onboarding new source systems’ data and maintaining current data feeds, the candidate is expected to create/modify risk model and product specifications to ensure correct pricing, perform a variety of data validation and testing to ensure data quality and manage relationships with the source system teams and downstream data consumers.
What we are looking for?
In this role we expect you to;
Use product knowledge and understanding of financial modelling to validate the pricing of a wide range of financial product
Within the context of the project, lead discussions with business partners (market risk, credit counterparty risk, trade floor risk) to better understand the business requirements and to determine potential impacts on the project scope and objectives, and to modify the requirements management plan, if required
Determine the best approach for eliciting, analyzing, validating, and prioritizing requirements to ensure that the necessary information is captured from the relevant stakeholders to address the business needs
Ensure all necessary stakeholders are engaged in communications between the Information Technology (IT) project team and the business to help identify who should be involved in the identification and development of the requirements
Participate in the development of strategic and tactical IT plans to help inform future project work of the direction of the business
Are you the right person for the role?
You Have;
A Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline and 3+ years of business analysis/risk experience OR a bachelor’s degree and 5+ years business analysis/risk experience
A good understanding of risk valuation models for a wide range of financial products
Solid knowledge of a wide range of financial products including swaps, bonds, FX products, commodity products and equity derivative
Knowledge of RiskWatch or of another risk system a plus
Solid business understanding and knowledge of the use of technology and applications in business
Understand and be familiar with the application of techniques associated with data modeling, process modeling, and user-centred design within the context of the organizational standards
Solid communication skills
Advanced writing and documentation skills
Advanced problem-solving and analytical skills
Advanced understanding of Excel
Knowledge of SQL, Python (or any other scripting language) a plus
What’s in it for you?
The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers.
A great opportunity to leave your “stamp” as we are undergoing multiple exciting and forward thinking initiatives.
A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development.
Internal development to support your growth and enhance your skills.
A competitive compensation and benefits package.
An organization committed to making a difference in our communities– for you and our customers.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!

Kelowna, BCImagine yourself as part of one of the most dynamic companies in the healthcare technology industry today! QHR Technologies is a division of Shoppers Drug Mart, a Loblaw Company. QHR is leading the way in Canadian healthcare technology, by providing solutions to assist healthcare professionals enrich their practices and improve the quality of care delivered to all Canadians across the country. We are looking for talented, inspired, and motivated people to join our incredible team and experience a workplace culture that stands above the rest! Competitive salaries and generous perks are just a few of the reasons that QHR has been voted one of BC's Top Employers and Canada’s Top Small & Medium Employers for many years running.
Position Summary:
QHR Technologies Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst to work with internal and external stakeholders on a new consumer facing Health and Wellness initiatives. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Management, Design and Development. You engage with the Product Owner to help develop and understand User Stories and define the Requirements which make each User Story possible. You will ensure that needs are well communicated both verbally and in written documentation so that all parties involved have a solid understanding. You will work with the Solutions Architecture team to help understand and define the non-Functional elements of solutions and assist with UAT to ensure that what is delivered by Design and Development meets the user requirements that were defined up front.
Our products and services reach thousands of healthcare professionals and improve the quality of human health of millions of Canadians through technology, and together with our parent company, Loblaw Companies Limited, we want to make healthcare simpler, safer, more secure, reliable and efficient. Our end users come from many different user bases, including Healthcare Providers, Allied Health Professionals, Pharmacies, Patients, and Retail Consumers.
Help shape our next generation of products and change how Canadians manage their health and wellness!

Interviewing internal and external stakeholders for requirements

Document use cases, functional, non-functional, and transition requirements
Create visuals to convey flows, structure, context and other complex subjects in a more understandable format

Manage User Acceptance Testing of product changes through to production roll out
Review and Contribute to internal and external product documentation

Provide product knowledge, training, support and expertise when required for Design, Development, Sales, Business Development, Implementations and Client Services.
Contribute to software design in collaboration with UX/UI design and architects
Qualifications:
Have 5+ years education or experience in Business Analysis and/or Software Design
Are strong at verbal and written communication
Have experience with Software Development processes (SDLC and Agile)
Have an understanding of systems engineering concepts
Have education or experience with Data Structures (Databases, XML, SQL)
Are positive, creative, and you enjoy a challenge

Hello, it’s a new day, and it’s time to answer the call to elevate your career and make life accessible for all.
Our purpose is to make life accessible
Our compassion and knowledge set us apart. With kindness and expertise, we support individuals by delivering the right mobility, accessibility, personal care, and daily living solutions. We believe that providing people with comprehensive solutions empowers and fulfills us all.
Our role is to care
As we strive to expand our reach and clients we care for, we are adding individuals to our teams who embody kindness, collaboration, and respect. If you want to help our clients experience their most vibrant lives while growing your own career in a nurturing, learning-focused and supportive environment - you will love being part of Motion.
Who we are
Motion is Canada’s leading provider of comprehensive and customized mobility and accessibility solutions for a wide variety of clients from children to elderly adults. Built on professional expertise and personalized service, we are proud to have served our clients for over 30 years. Whether a client is being fitted for equipment for the first time, is in need of an equipment repair or looking to upgrade their solution, our teams across Ontario, Alberta and B.C. are ready to apply their knowledge with the utmost of care and compassion. To learn more about how Motion is working to make life accessible, visit motioncares.ca.
Who we need
Reporting to the Director of Business Improvement, we are adding a Business Analyst to our team. This is a greenfield opportunity to scope out new projects and play a critical role on a new team created in response to a company-wide, cross-country reorganization. This is the chance to introduce and implement a process driven mindset into the organization and establish a culture of continuous improvement. Your work may include:
The simplification and standardization of inventory management and baseline inventory practices.
Development and implementation of an effective inventory control strategy to minimize waste and inventory variances.
Development of nationwide KPI’s for inventory and warehouse management.
Design, creation and implementation of documentation including warehouse SOP’s, processes and policies.
Who you are
You want to join a national organization undergoing an exciting period of transformation. You want to spearhead change initiatives resulting in significant business improvement and customer satisfaction. You are drawn to the bigger cause of Motion and want to be part of making life more accessible.
You are a clear and effective communicator with a passion for continuous improvement. You believe in the power and efficiencies of Lean processes. You are entrepreneurial and creative. You are an inquisitive and high-energy team player who takes a strategic approach to managing and driving change.
What you will do
Lead and implement key strategic projects, focusing on Inventory and warehouse management. You will own and drive improvement projects with the goal of improving quality, reducing costs, increasing productivity and improving cycle time by reducing wasted time, rework, etc.
Inventory & Analysis. Every mobility device we process is custom to our clients, as a result we rely on our warehouse to play an integral role in keeping our operations running smoothly. Work closely with the regions and head office to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively, purchasing the right equipment, maintaining solid inventory data.
Be a role model. You will exemplify excellence in continuous improvement (CI). You will identify opportunity, develop sustainable targets and embed practices within the business. You will work with leadership to create an environment for learning, team goal alignment and accountability removing barriers to these objectives.
Report. You will liaise with finance and other members of the organization in assessing, tracking and reporting the financial benefit of a project. You will provide management with project status updates, feedback, and appropriate reporting on key responsibilities and objectives.
What you bring
The education. You have a Bachelor Degree and possess practical financial and business acumen.
As the Expertise, you also have demonstrated success in:
Inventory reduction best practices.
Project management.
Business optimization and process improvement.
Business transformation.
Continuous improvement process- in quality, sales, distribution and operations.
Cost savings.
The technical skills. You are comfortable using the Microsoft Office Suite of products; data analysis and tools.
The analytical and collaborative approach. You can foster a positive working environment, encouraging adoption and buy-in of continuous improvement initiatives. You have outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, and can relay complex concepts to audiences at any level, gaining trust and nurturing a collaborative team approach. You are comfortable providing feedback and following through to track improvement.
Some travel within Canada may be required (less than 10%).
Progressive experience (2 - 8 years) willing to hire a junior to more seasoned professional provided that individual has some logistics, manufacturing or material handling experience.
Why join?
At Motion, we’ve undergone a recent transformation, and we think that’s exciting. With a strong reputation as experts in our field, we’re turning inwards to foster a culture of belonging, giving and strength. Joining us now is a chance to be part of that momentum; an opportunity to make an impact in people’s lives and help create a company environment you believe in.
Thank you for taking the time to consider joining us. If you want to be part of our team, express your interest here.
Motion is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us.

job_title: Full-time opportunities for students & recent graduates: Data & Applied Sciences
job_description:
CanadaData Scientists at Microsoft help to improve the quality of experiences on our devices and services. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate Data Scientists to apply rigorous scientific methodology and algorithms to data in order to improve Microsoft’s devices, operating systems, and services. As a Data Scientist, you will provide unique insight into business and customer scenarios that cut across organizational boundaries and lead the growth of a data-driven culture within Microsoft.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.

Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Data & Applied Sciences roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered as a student or recent graduate, you should be within 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 12 months.

Data Science
Opportunities for Data Scientists—one of today’s hottest jobs—are rapidly growing in response to the exponential amounts of data being captured and analyzed. Microsoft looks to hire Data Scientists to find insights and to solve meaningful business problems.

The Data Science domain is growing rapidly and we are interested in people with diverse multi-disciplinary backgrounds, engineering and analytical skills, ruthless curiosity, and the motivation to improve product quality with data. If you consistently use data to improve the world around you and have the energy and flexibility to help us build a world class team, come join us to change the world of computing.

Data Science Consultant/Architect
Service delivery professionals, both Consultants and Architects, work to deliver technical solutions directly with the customer, helping them to maximize their investment in Microsoft technology. This requires a willingness to bring order to often ambiguous and complex implementations. Applicants should and be strategic and forward looking, so solutions scale to future business and technical needs.
Responsibilities

Data Science

As a Data Scientist, you will formulate approaches to solve problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources. You will incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data. Successful Data Scientists will interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.

You will engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers. As a Data Scientist, you will also engage in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.

Data Science Consultant/Architect
Building upon solid analytical and IT project experience, these professionals will work with to assist customers in the delivery of high quality engagements around Microsoft's solution areas, technologies, services and products in diverse client environments. Delivery professionals will also help assist customers: in stabilizing developed solutions using Microsoft methodologies in complex customer environments, in the design and development of integrated solutions using the latest Microsoft products, services and technologies and in understanding the relevant application development, infrastructure and operations implications of the developed solution.
Qualifications
A bachelor’s or master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Applied Sciences like Biostatistics, Physics, Chemistry, Computational Neurology and or other quant-focused field (within 12 months of graduation).
Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc.
Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#.
Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS.
Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems.
Some A/B Testing or experimentation (this can be from conducting real life science experiments, hypothesis testing in stats etc.) Not required but ideal.
Some experience or course work applying basic ML to a type of data and or used algorithms to conduct experiments on data. Machine Learning strongly encouraged.
Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain.
Ability to interact with peers and stakeholders to drive product and business impact.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills.

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Mississauga, ONTitle: Study Data Manager
Division: Biometrics
Location: Mississauga

To serve as the core representative for Clinical Data Management (CDM) on the study team and to be accountable for collection, review and management of data and ensure deliverables are met.
Responsibilities:
Leads the Clinical Study Team
Maintains oversight of all activities for one or more studies to ensure productivity and progress
Manages lab reference ranges and processes

Effectively communicates ideas, project goals and status of work and independently presents at department meetings to ensure team is up-to-date

Liaises with Program Data Management (PDM) across one or more CDM study teams in order to implement standards
Occasionally performs program-level activities for molecules where a Program Data Leader (PDL) is not assigned in order to ensure process is monitored
Provides input during protocol review to ensure PDM components are included and comprehensive
Responsible for complex deliverables for the subfunction for one or more studies
Communicates study timelines and deliverables to all CDM study team staff and follows up to ensure timely delivery of assigned tasks
Leads or participates in the local functional/cross-functional implementation of best practices and process improvement initiatives
Provides PDM study specific training to CDM staff, including service providers to ensure valid outcomes
Actively participates in study debrief meetings, shares learnings with CDM staff and participates in subsequent best practice implementation in order to keep employees up-to-date
Problem Solving
Escalates study issues appropriately and addresses corrective action plans
Identifies and develops solutions to complex problems to ensure issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manner
Sets targeted timeframes for deliverables and anticipates potential scenarios that may create timeline delays; able to influence and negotiate a positive outcome
Evaluates probability, impact and priorities of risks and develops and implements mitigation plan
Qualifications:
A minimum of 4 year Science (Biological Science) degree or equivalent in scientific, medical or relevant clinical discipline or a qualified healthcare professional required
CCDM (Certified Clinical Data Manager through the Society for Clinical Data Management (SCDM) preferred
A minimum of 2 – 5 years’ experience
Moderate practical and theoretical expertise within the subfunction
An understanding of the business of his or her subfunction and greater CDM organization
Ability to work under minimal guidance
Functional knowledge in the development of subfunctional processes, training and related documents
Technical proficiency and ability to complete complex assignments within defined parameters
Ability to partner with PTM training community to ensure best training practices are being leveraged in focused training
Ability to identify a range of problems and escalate appropriately
Contribution to the awareness and education of fellow subfunctional colleagues by sharing information and learnings from attendance at conferences and educational enrichment activities
Ability to represent at industry user groups and conferences leveraging net-working opportunities
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit cover letter and resume no later than March 27th, 2019.
This position is not eligible for relocation support.
This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada.

Reporting to the Director, Total Rewards & HR Technology, the Manager, HR Technology & Data Insights is accountable for the development and operationalization of a rolling 3-year HR Technology and Data Insights strategy. They will ensure that systems are optimized, sustainable, scalable, and are relevant given the short and long-term business requirements of the organization. This role will also be accountable for establishing appropriate controls to ensure HR Technology is incompliance with all HR and payroll processes, company policy, legislative requirements while ensuring accurate and efficient administration of programs, reimagining HR strategies to support employee life cycle self-service, and improve the user-friendliness of the community facing HR tools.
They are also be responsible for the conceptualization, design, development and execution of all human resources data, providing insights to develop and deliver people based analytics and dashboard reporting.
You will be accountable to:
Leads HR efforts, in collaboration with HR leaders and I.T. partners, in articulating a rolling 3-year HR Technology and Data Insights strategy aligned with and contributing to HR’s mission and strategic business goals.
Oversees the specification, development and implementation of new or redesigned systems, reports and policies and procedures for internal use. Researches opportunities for continuous improvement for systems optimizations, enhancements, upgrades or exploring new vendors.
Oversees all HR systems ensuring these meet operating parameters including up-time, completeness, connectivity, usability, data integrity, and security.
Determines the effectiveness of HR technology systems by consulting with HR, IT and Business Leaders to refine organizational needs for HR information and activities.
Oversees team members responsible for managing HR system technical support, automating business processes, workflow management, security control, reporting and data insights.
Leads the team in the development of processes, policies and workflows for data management and maintenance, establishing internal controls and developing audit procedures to ensure data integrity. Coordinates changes with IT and Finance for HR application configurations and upgrades, and ensuring connectivity with internal and external interfaces.
Develop communications strategies and training material to create clarity and understanding around HR systems and to promote self-service within HR and in Moneris
Manages the overall HR technical calendar for planning cycles across all relevant HR programs.
In alignment with the HR Technology and Data Insights strategy, determine the appropriate staging of the Data Insights roadmap to meet business requirements. Analyze data and manage employee data flow from multiple HR and Moneris technologies to HRIS system.
In partnership with Information Technology, determine the appropriate “data warehouse” strategy to support the Data Insights roadmap.
Mapped current and future state HR technology needs – including pricing/budgetary requirements
Identified quick wins with current systems and implemented – improve accuracy, productivity, cost savings
Your experience includes:
Successfully completed post-secondary education in a relevant field of study that may include Business and Human Resources
Minimum 7 years progressive experience in HR Information Systems, with a minimum of 2 years of management experience
Experienced creating and maintaining an integrated, highly valued HR infrastructure
Highly experienced in HR technology offerings in ATS, LMS, HRIS, Data Analytics, and Reporting
Proven project management skills and a track record of delivering on and completing objectives on time and within budget
Excellent business writing skills, and you excel at Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Demonstrated collaborative and leadership skills to deliver cross-functional HR Technology projects to successful completion
Demonstrated ability to be a creative, strategic thinker, but deliver significant results that align with and contribute to agreed-to HR and business objectives

The Clinical Data Manager is responsible for the performance of data management tasks from study start-up, inclusive of database design, through database lock for assigned projects within electronic data capture (EDC) systems. S/he is responsible for the creation of CRFs, programming of edit checks, facilitating User Acceptance Testing (UAT), data cleaning, query generation and management, and development of relevant data management documents. The Clinical Data Manager is responsible for overall data quality and documentation, and may lead a small team of support roles from within data management to achieve these goals.

The Clinical Data Manager will work on small to mid-sized projects in various indications.

As a Clinical Data Manager You Will…
Lead studies as the Lead Data Manager or support other lead team members with ongoing project work, as determined by business need and relevant skillset
Liaise between study personnel and the client, as appropriate, regarding clinical and/or technical issues
Develop and/or review case report forms (CRFs) within =EDC system
Author or perform quality control review of data management documents, such as CRF Completion Guidelines (CCGs), Data Management Plans (DMP), and Data Transfer Plans
Develop or quality control review Data Validation Specifications (DVS) documents
Participate in programming edit checks and other system functions within EDC as needed
Facilitate or participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) prior to study go-live
Responsible for data Cleaning activities including data review, query generation and management, and development of study metrics. May find discrepancies, track trends, and identify areas of retraining needed from members of the study team.
Perform reconciliation activities of external data (e.g., Central Labs, IVRS, etc.)
Oversee or participate in database Lock activities, including managing user access and authoring or providing quality control review of lock documentation.
Partner with the other functional groups (e.g., Biostatistics, Statistical Programming, Medical Writing, Project Management, etc.) to ensure data management aspects of the project are properly considered and integrate well with the other activities

Experience + Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a related field & 2 years of experience in clinical data management required OR Master’s degree & 1 years of experience in clinical data management.
1 year of experience in leading small project teams preferred.
Working knowledge of International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) Good Clinical Practice (GCP) guidelines and other applicable regulatory rules and guidelines as well as of medical terminology, clinical trials, and clinical research.
Skilled in use of computer technology, including clinical trial databases and applications (e.g., IBM Clinical Development, Medidata RaveX) and ability to learn new applications.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment.

When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Applications may be selected for consideration based on the date of submission. Selection of applications will continue until all positions are filed; if a sufficient number of candidates are found qualified your application may not be selected for consideration. Candidates who are found qualified will be considered for positions as they become available. If you have already applied on this process and have been assessed, you will not be reassessed.

The inventory will be updated every 60 days. You will receive a notice in your applicant account 14 days before the end of your active period to determine whether or not you wish to keep being considered for an additional 60 days.

PLEASE NOTE: For this selection process, our intention is to communicate with applicants by e-mail for screening/assessment purposes (including issuing screening results, and sending invitations for written tests and interviews). Applicants who apply to this selection process must include in their application a valid e-mail address and make sure this address is functional at all times and accepts messages from unknown users.

Candidates from outside the public service may be required to pay for travel and relocation costs associated with this selection process.

The client organization will accept applications on-line only. All job applications must therefore be submitted through the Public Service Resourcing System. To submit an application on-line, please select the button “Apply Online” below.

Acknowledgment of receipt of applications will not be sent; we will contact candidates when the screening process is completed.

You will be required to show how you demonstrate the essential qualifications (i.e. Education, Experience and/or Occupational Certification) for the initial screening through your resume, cover letter, and/or in answering online screening questions. It is NOT sufficient to only state that the qualifications are met or to provide a listing of current or past responsibilities. Rather you must clearly demonstrate HOW, WHEN, and WHERE the qualification was met through substantiation by examples. Information on your described skills, experience, etc. provided in a cover letter or screening questions should be supported by your resume. Failure to provide the above information in the format required may result in your application being rejected from the process.

Candidates must obtain the required pass mark for each qualification in order to be given further consideration in the selection process.

Candidates will not be solicited for incomplete or possible missing information.

Depending on the requirements of the position(s) being staffed from this process, for current or future vacancies, any or all of the asset qualifications, operational requirements, and organizational needs may be applied at the time of staffing. Candidates may be contacted and assessed against these criteria at any time during this process.

A random or top down selection of candidates may be used in the determination of those to be given further consideration in the assessment process.

The breadth and depth of experience may be considered when making selections from the qualified pool and in determining the "best fit" for the organization.

Candidates may be eliminated at any point during the selection process if they fail to demonstrate any of the essential criteria through their behaviour, for example, through: communication with Human Resources, informal discussion, selection interview, etc.

Written test(s) will be administered.

Interviews will be conducted.

Reference checks will be conducted.

Internal reference contacts are not restricted to the list of names given by the candidate. The Selection Committee reserves the right to contact other references within the federal public service.

Proof of education must be submitted at the interview.

Persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice. Applicants are asked to indicate their preferred official language in their application.

Candidates with foreign credentials must provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Consult the Canadian Information Centre for International Credentials for further information at http://www.cicic.ca/

Persons with disabilities preventing them from applying on-line are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Title: Global Data Standards Manager
Division: Product Development
Location: Mississauga / Welwyn
Duration: Full-Time
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the design, management and maintenance of biomedical (including clinical trial) data standards from protocol development to regulatory submission
Help to identify the needs of key stakeholders and assist in the prioritization of new clinical data standards for inclusion in the Data Standards & Governance (DSG) Roadmap
Lead the development of new biomedical data standards from protocol development to regulatory submission
Support the technical implementation and adoption of biomedical data standards
Active role in the governance of biomedical data standards
Contribute to the curation and integration of data for the creation of data marts:
Provide guidance to key stakeholders relating to transforming previously collected biomedical data to the appropriate data models
Help to maintain content in the Global Data Standards Repository (GDSR)
Develop and deploy metrics that assess the usage and value of the biomedical data standards
Drive adoption of biomedical data standards from external standards development organizations (SDOs) such as CDISC, HL7, ISO:
Actively monitor and assess standards being produced by SDOs
Serve as a member of the SDOs
Actively promote and leverage knowledge sharing with standards experts within Product Development, more broadly across the Roche group and the industry as a whole
Identify and propose improvements to processes related to biomedical data standards design, management, maintenance and implementation
Provide DSG updates in local forums (e.g., PDB All Hands, Lunch and Learn sessions, local functional meetings)
Qualifications:
BS/BA or MS in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or related areas of Clinical Research
Experience in pharmaceutical industry, including standards development or implementation within a Biometrics field
Experience with CDISC ADaM and other industry standards, possibly including CDISC CDASH, SDTM and/or Controlled Terminology
Previous experience as a Study Statistician or Statistical Programmer is a plus
Knowledge of a specific therapeutic area or disease area is a plus
Able to work independently and with other team members cross-functionally to perform impact analyses as part of a change management process, and/or provide support for the implementation of technical projects
Must have advanced process-related analytical skills
Outstanding organizational skills
High attention to detail
Must possess excellent oral & written communication and technical writing skills in English
Strong presentation skills required
In-depth understanding of clinical trial lifecycle processes required, including but not limited to Protocol Design, Clinical Data Management, Statistical Programming, Statistical Analysis and Electronic Submissions (eSUB)
In-depth working knowledge of ADaM
In-depth working knowledge of Statistical Analysis Plan components
Proven experience of defining data analysis concepts
Proven experience of translating statistical analysis requirements into technical specifications
In-depth understanding of data collection design vis-à-vis statistical analysis requirements
Good understanding of SDTM
Good understanding of controlled terminology
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit cover letter and resume no later than February 15th, 2019.
This position is not eligible for relocation support.
This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada.
NOTE: All employment is conditional upon the completing and obtaining a satisfactory background check, including educational, employment, references and criminal records (for which a pardon has not been granted) checks.
