We currently have a temporary full time (1 year) opportunity for a Data Manager – Hematology Disease Site Group in our Clinical Research Programme, Odette Cancer Centre in the Sunnybrook Research Institute.
The Clinical Research Programme at the Odette Cancer Center (OCC) is part of Sunnybrook Research Institute’s (SRI) ongoing commitment to participate in innovative and high quality clinical research. Within OCC Clinical Research, the Medical Director, Manager and Business Analyst, work with 35+ physicians actively participating in clinical research and 33 OCC clinical research staff. Our programme is comprised of 10 disease site groups; Breast, CNS, GI, GU, Gynecology, Head & Neck, Hematology, Lung, Melanoma and Palliative.
Under the direction of the Disease Site Group Leader and Program Supervisor, the goal of this position is to support the Hematology Disease Site Group with the management of trials and patient-specific responsibilities. Primary responsibilities include obtaining and processing biologic specimens and the collection and entry of data into each trials data entry system. Additional responsibilities may include screening, review of the informed consent form with patients, assessment of eligibility, registration/randomization, collection and submission of patient data, monitoring / compliance, maintenance of a system to ensure effective data flow, monitoring of patients, collection of adverse events and communication of patient information to investigators in a timely fashion. The Data Manager (DM) will also liaise with clinical trial, institutional and study sponsor staff to respond to queries and facilitate monitoring and close out visits. Must be able to recognize adverse events (AEs), communicate AEs promptly to investigators and respond appropriately to protocol/patient focused care including reporting to appropriate parties. Overall responsibilities involve aspects of study activation, maintenance and closure.
Qualifications/Skills:
Requires the successful minimum completion of a Community College Diploma/ Certificate
Practical clinical trial experience an asset
Well-developed organizational and time management skills
In-depth knowledge of ICH guidelines and Good Clinical Practice an asset
Proven experience in processing and shipping blood samples an asset
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated accurate and efficient work habits with close attention to detail
Familiarity with medical terminology
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter (in one document) quoting 183960 to:
Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre
To apply, please click "Apply for Position" near the top right corner of this page
Sunnybrook Research Institute is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Research Institute is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

The successful candidate will drive a people and process deployment in the London, Ontario plant. Drive rapid, significant and sustainable improvement

Ensure effective allocation of resources across all areas of the plant to accomplish customer?driven priorities.
Coordinate effectively with sales, marketing, design engineering, and other functional organizations
Partner with the broader management team to ensure the best possible product, and customer satisfaction
Continually benchmark best practices and drive effective implementation

10+ years of progressively responsible manufacturing leadership experience in a fast-paced, complex manufacturing environment.

Demonstrates integrity, flexibility, sound judgment and strong critical thinking skills
Salary: $120,000+

As the Data and Insights Manager for Envision Group, there is an excellent opportunity to drive strategic data and insights in a fun, collaborative and innovative environment. This role offers a fantastic and challenging opportunity to work closely with all levels of our operational teams and executive group with a direct impact on the success of the business.
The Data and Insights Manager will need to possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a clear ability to identify key business trends and issues. It is very important that the analyst has the ability to “think outside the box” in order to drive the desired business outcome. Furthermore, the Data and Insights Manager will need the capability to build relationships at various levels of the organization and within various levels of executive team. The candidate must be a self-starter that is able to work independently to complete specified tasks under tight deadlines within a fast-paced working environment.
This role will report to the Data and Insights Manager.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Planning, Analysis, Budgeting and Forecasting:
Responsible for providing insight & analytical commentary to assist in strategic business decisions
Leverage data and analytics, to make fact based decisions

Working closely with the Envision team; enabling them to meet their commercial objectives by providing them with appropriate tools, materials and presentations
Prepare adhoc analytics in support of functional and strategic projects.
Work closely with product management team to define marketing materials and programs
Identify and action risks and opportunities within the business
Work with the business to identify/validate key business assumptions and incorporate them into planning and forecasting models
Create return on investment models to properly allocate capital investment in the business.
Flexible work hour arrangements in order to meet timelines and key deliverables
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
2+ years of experience in a financial role.
Proficiency in Microsoft office, along with intermediate to advanced excel skill.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a finance or accounting background
CFA or CPA designation or working towards this.
Exceptional communication skills
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent leadership skills with ability to motivate and drive results
Strong interpersonal skills and presentation skills.CH
Self-motivated with ability to work autonomously

Within Chartwells- a division of Compass Group Canada- we are focused on student dining, providing millions of meals for students in kindergarten all the way up to College and University. This is a fast-paced, high volume, exciting and challenging sector that is a huge component of the overall growth strategy for the company.

As the Data and Insights Manager for Envision Group, there is an excellent opportunity to drive strategic data and insights in a fun, collaborative and innovative environment. This role offers a fantastic and challenging opportunity to work closely with all levels of our operational teams and executive group with a direct impact on the success of the business.
The Data and Insights Manager will need to possess strong analytical and critical thinking skills with a clear ability to identify key business trends and issues. It is very important that the analyst has the ability to “think outside the box” in order to drive the desired business outcome. Furthermore, the Data and Insights Manager will need the capability to build relationships at various levels of the organization and within various levels of executive team. The candidate must be a self-starter that is able to work independently to complete specified tasks under tight deadlines within a fast-paced working environment.
This role will report to the Data and Insights Manager.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Planning, Analysis, Budgeting and Forecasting:
Responsible for providing insight & analytical commentary to assist in strategic business decisions
Leverage data and analytics, to make fact based decisions
Spearheading financial planning exercises, including monthly P&L analysis & maintenance, forecasting & strategic execution planning
Working closely with the Envision team; enabling them to meet their commercial objectives by providing them with appropriate tools, materials and presentations
Prepare adhoc analytics in support of functional and strategic projects.
Work closely with product management team to define marketing materials and programs
Identify and action risks and opportunities within the business
Work with the business to identify/validate key business assumptions and incorporate them into planning and forecasting models
Create return on investment models to properly allocate capital investment in the business.
Flexible work hour arrangements in order to meet timelines and key deliverables
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
2+ years of experience in a financial role.
Proficiency in Microsoft office, along with intermediate to advanced excel skill.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a finance or accounting background
CFA or CPA designation or working towards this.
Exceptional communication skills
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent leadership skills with ability to motivate and drive results
Strong interpersonal skills and presentation skills.CH
Self-motivated with ability to work autonomously

job_title: Oral Care Territory Manager - Downtown Toronto/GTA (Immediate Need)
job_description:
A Career in our Professional Oral Care Organization
Procter & Gamble is seeking a highly motivated individual for a Territory Manager within our P&G Professional Oral Care Organization. P&G Oral Care is a leading manufacturer and marketer of Crest and Oral B Products around the Globe.

The Territory Manager role is a multi-faceted field selling position responsible for overall management of a designated territory and dealer management.

The Territory Manager collaborates with their manager in developing/implementing strategies and business plans that deliver sales and volume targets. The Territory Manager is also responsible for targets associated with getting professional customers and key accounts within the assigned territory to recommend Crest and Oral B Products as well as working with our dealer network to identify sales opportunities within the defined territory.

Territory Managers sell to a variety of end-users in the dental industry. The sales process begins with understanding our professional customers' (dentists and hygienists) business, utilizing available information to explain the product benefits, and finally persuading our customer to purchase and recommend Crest and Oral B Products to their customers. Territory Managers are expected to develop expertise in areas such as product knowledge and technical support.

We are looking for an individual who has demonstrated: Territory Management capabilities (Routing/Opportunity identification/ Personal Relationship Development) and Strong Sales Acumen. We are seeking applicants who are problem solvers as well as excellent communicators.

A minimum of a bachelor's degree is required for the position.

The ideal candidate would have professional experience in: Dental or Oral care sales, Healthcare sales, Pharmaceutical sales, Consumer Goods, or a Science background. Other sales backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

To effectively perform the job duties described above, all applicants should have strong computer (Excel/Word/PP) and analytical skills, strong experience with optimizing territory coverage/use of CRM tools, operate with discipline and enjoy social/networking events to:

 Deliver business goals of Oral Care Professionals seen and Office Sales Optimize territory coverage plans
 Strategically use samples to obtain business goals Increase message impact with strategic data collection with disciplined use of CRM tool
 Increase message impact with strong presentation skills Channel development by leading joint business planning with dental distributors and multi practice dental organizations.

Expectations of the role: Weekend and evening attendance at conventions and other dental continuing education events. Travel (approx. 10 – 15%)

The company will cover all business-related expenses and provide: Business use cell phone, vehicle and required business tools.

Successful candidates must have a valid driver's license, be willing to travel on the job and must currently be living in or be willing to relocate themselves to the location listed on this posting.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

To be reviewed, your resume must be copied & pasted to your online application; we will not review any attachments, including cover letters, transcripts, or PDF resumes. Please complete your job application AND assessments as soon as possible as resumes will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers.im@pg.com to provide your contact information. P&G Talent Supply staff will contact you within 2 weeks.

TemporaryLMC|Manna Research is the largest network of fully-owned and integrated clinical research sites in Canada and 3rd largest in North America. We provide Phase I-IV clinical trial services with specialized focuses on endocrine disorders, real world evidence big data research, vaccine research, and primary care studies.
LMC|Manna Research provides Sponsors, CRO's & ARO's access to one of the largest fully owned and operated clinical research site networks within Canada at 19 sites across 4 provinces.
Our mission is to improve the health of Canadians today and tomorrow through clinical research.
Currently, our rapidly expanding team is in need of a Data Management Specialist who can work for us on a 8 month (Maternity-Leave) contract, supporting our Bayview & Vaughan location.
Responsibilities:
Gain familiarity of protocols and case report forms, in order to create source documents to be used during the conduct of the clinical research study
Perform accurate, complete and timely data entry of electronic or paper case report forms (CRF's)
Assist Clinical Research Coordinators in responding to data management queries, monitor findings and follow-up
Check in patients (reception/registration) and check out patients (if applicable)
Respond to telephone inquires and retrieving and returning messages daily from the voice mail system (if applicable)
Handle incoming and outgoing mail, faxes and shipments (if applicable)
Assist the Regulatory Specialist in preparation and timely submission of regulatory documents
Assist Clinical Research Coordinators in the creation, maintenance, update and organization of the Investigator Site File, ensuring compliance to GCP and LMC SOP's
Responsible for the archiving of clinical research documents upon completion of the study and tracking and maintenance of all archived documents
Perform receipt, storage and organization of Investigational products
Prepare research and patient binders and files, as required
Ensure continued QC in the creation and maintenance of source documents, CRF's (electronic or paper) and Investigator Site File
Responsible for assessing overall filing, documentation, reporting and archiving processes on an on-going basis to applicable sites that are supported, identify improvement opportunities and assist in implementing process improvements
Perform other administrative and clerical duties as required by Clinical Research Coordinators, Manager, Research, President, Research Investigators and/or other members of the Research team
Participate in community and company events such as local health fairs, and fundraising events
Attend regularly scheduled research meetings, training with Monitors or Sponsor or other meetings as required by the study
Requirements
University and/or College degree in a relevant field of science is required
At least 2 years experience in an administrative role, preferably in a health care environment
Experience working with multiple teams in a collaborative environment
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
Excellent computer skills (MS Word, Excel and Outlook)
LMC|Manna Research seeks dynamic individuals who embrace learning and innovation opportunities and those who contribute to improving the health of Canadians today and tomorrow through clinical research.

CanadaJoin our growing IT Team! The incumbent will be responsible for leading team(s) of technical specialists/analysts to provide support for all environments within the organization, including all facets of Data Center Operations, focusing on Data Centers, Servers, Backups and Networking components. The Manager will also be required to liaise with Ontario Lottery and Gaming (OLG), third-party vendor management and Disaster Recovery Planning (DRP)/ Business Continuity Planning (BCP). This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with multiple project/program stakeholders, including the Business Units, Project Managers, Solution Architects, Business Systems Analysts, Quality Assurance, IT infrastructure teams and third-party vendors.
Key Responsibilities

Architect, implement, and maintain network hardware and configurations
Deliver stable and responsive application, server, data storage, and backup services and software for the various datacenter environments
Take a lead role in ensuring the security and compliance requirements of networks and protected data
Lead Disaster Recovery initiative from an infrastructure perspective including documenting recovery procedures of all critical components
Collaborate with business leaders to design solutions that meet evolving company objectives
Evaluation of new technology and ongoing vendor management
Contribute significantly to capacity, scalability, and budget planning
Perform maintenance and upgrades during off-hours and provide 24 X 7 on-call network support
Drive the creation of an environment that fosters continuous improvement while following service management processes
Provide timely and expert advice on emerging trends and technologies impacting Network and Server Delivery and Support
Monitor, control and all Data Center, Server, and Network components; ensuring systems, methodologies and procedures are in place and followed
Champion Service and Support in projects and developing a strong understanding of projects impacting your service area and ensuring service impact is minimized and agreed to
Be accountable for the quality of Service and performance; ensuring future demand from growth and projects is understood and factored into capacity plans for all associated systems within the scope of this position
Act as the primary interface for Servers and Networking Services including:
Build and maintain relationships with business owners as well as IT leadership team members
Manage critical incidents – act as a lead member of the incident response team to gather key information from supporting sources on the call, effectively determine appropriate courses of action, and engage & escalate involvement of required resources (from Company, from the customer and/or from supporting vendors), to efficiently close the problem
Perform regular IT maintenance activities related to Data Centers, Servers and Networks.
Provide team feedback and develop action plans to remediate issues, identify processes and skills required for continuous improvements in knowledge
Manage projects and transitions when required
Support new initiatives, such as systems upgrades, refreshes and hardening changes
Ensure that the root causes of major incidents and problems related to the scope of responsibilities are being determined and report the status to Company management as well as the client counterparts
Identify potential areas for service improvement and present to IT Management Team
On-call may be required
What You’ll Require

Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Science or Engineering
Customer Service orientation with a strong bias toward action
5+ years’ experience in managing and leading a team of technical resources in support of networks and Data Centers
10+ years’ experience in a hands-on role supporting server class hardware and networks
Experience in DR runbook and execution in a mission-critical high availability environment
Experience in providing services to agreed SLAs and OLAs
Flexible in working outside of core business hours at short-notice
Good understanding of Microsoft and Linux technology stacks, including awareness of cloud computing architecture
Understanding of technical IT issues to enable discussions with internal and external technical specialists
Experience using Service/Incident Management Tools
Experience working with offshore teams
The ability to obtain a Category 1 registration with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario

job_title: Procurement Manager, Data & External Content, Global Technology
job_description:
Greater Toronto Area, ONDo you extensive Data and External Content or related Technology category expertise?
Are you experienced in delivering cost savings and all phases of strategic sourcing projects from initiation through to contract signature, including acting in a Supplier Relationship Management capacity for strategic supplier relationships post contract award?
Are you a collaborative professional who thrives in a fast-paced, team focused organization
Work you’ll do:


Global CoRe Procurement is seeking a Procurement Manager for the Data and External Content Category in the Technology Procurement Team, that covers online data sources, market data, research tools and subscriptions. We’re looking for a strong negotiator who is adept at advising internal clients to join our Global Procurement practice.


You’ll be responsible for advising internal clients in the Global organization on data sourcing strategies, identifying savings opportunities, delivering sourcing projects in accordance with Deloitte’s Global sourcing methodology, Risk management frameworks and Information security standards; conducting comparative analyses to empower decision making; and leading, or supporting commercial terms negotiations as required within each project.


As part of a global procurement organization, you will be required to collaborate and build effective relationships with suppliers and internal clients across varying geographies and time zones.


You must possess strong commercial and communication skills, and excellent relationship engagement and management capabilities in order to manage client expectations and challenging supplier interactions. You will play a key role in risk mitigation and will be responsible for ensuring the appropriate compliance functions are engaged within the sourcing cycle. You’ll also be responsible for ensuring that related activities are performed efficiently, effectively, and in line with business plans and operating budgets.


What you’ll be part of—our Deloitte Global culture:


At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network.


In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark.


Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?


Who you’ll work with:


The CoRe team makes an impact by providing five fundamental services to Deloitte around the world: knowledge services, creative services, contact center, procurement, and real estate. We develop new and innovative ways to improve how services are delivered across the Deloitte organization, leveraging our global scope and strength to serve our organization across borders.


CoRe Procurement is a service line of Deloitte Global and is an internal service organization with responsibility and oversight for procuring the products and services to support the Deloitte Network of globally distributed offices, service lines and enabling areas


How you’ll grow:


Deloitte Global inspires leaders at every level. We believe in investing in you, helping you embrace leadership opportunities at every step of your career, and helping you identify and hone your unique strengths. We encourage you to grow by providing formal and informal development programs, coaching and mentoring, and on-the-job challenges. job_title: Manager of Counselling & Student Well Being
job_description:
Toronto, ON$87,784 - $117,047 a yearAt George Brown College, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice. As employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.
What responsibilities will you have in this role?
Reporting to the Director, Student Affairs, the Manager of Counselling and Student Well-being provides leadership for counselling services and mental health and well-being programming at George Brown College. Working collaboratively across the college to deliver high quality services and effective supports, the Manager plays a key role in supporting student success by fostering the development of a healthy campus community, where all students have the opportunity and support to thrive.
Provides strategic planning for the department, following divisional and college priorities, creating business plans, and implementing and assessing goals to achieve targets. Through an integrated service model, the Manager works collaborates with academic divisions and other student service areas, fostering positive and productive relationships to lead innovative, proactive, and responsive services to support the mental health and well-being of all students.
Supervises counsellors and is responsible for nurturing a professional and collaborative culture to optimize service performance at all campus locations. This requires the Manager to ensure effective communication, leverage peer support, engage in team planning, and develop partnerships.
Provides leadership in creating departmental policies and procedures, in facilitating departmental communication, and ensuring compliance, while providing daily guidance in decision-making in complex and crisis student situations.
Provides effective clinical supervision to counsellors, and proactively fosters individual and collective professional development to optimize service quality and create a positive and productive work culture.
Manages department operations, including developing the annual budget and monitoring ongoing expenditure and staffing decisions; daily staffing, scheduling, coordination and leadership for staff meetings; clinical data collection, case notes, and report generation; assessment and evaluation of services and programs; and the efficient and effective running of the counselling offices at each campus location.
Provides leadership for the counsellor internship placement program, ensuring quality of clinical supervision (carried out by full-time counsellors), and appropriate placement protocol compliance, and positive, productive student experiences.
Initiates innovative service delivery options by working to widen access to mental health support across the student population, further developing the department’s integration of digital self-service options, peer support programming, and student choice in mental health services.
Creates systems for gathering student input, assessing programs and services, and regularly analyzes service data to make decisions that widen access and increase inclusion.
Contributes to the College’s work on creating a healthy campus community, the Manager plays a key role in mental health education and promotion, and provides leadership in promoting student success by cultivating a healthy campus community.
Stays abreast of research and innovation, resources, and best practices in the field of post-secondary student mental health provincially and nationally, and participates as the college representative in local and regional meetings and partnership initiatives.
What qualifications do you need for this role?
Graduate Degree in Social Work, Counselling or Clinical Psychology with in depth professional development in a wide variety of current counseling modalities and approaches applicable to the post-secondary context.
Registered to practice Psychotherapy in the province of Ontario is required.
Minimum of 10 years’ successful experience as a mental health worker/therapist/counsellor, ideally in a variety of contexts, including community-based and educational settings.
Strong leadership/management skills with successful experience developing and evaluating programming; managing, guiding, and professionally developing staff; advanced expertise at nurturing positive teamwork and a collaborative, positive, and productive workplace. Excellent communication skills.
Experience working with collective agreements, policies, and procedures. Understanding of relevant legislation as it pertains to service delivery.
Training and successful experience in providing clinical supervision to counselors.
In depth understanding of the complex and diverse mental health challenges of post-secondary students; highly competent dealing with complex student cases; excellent skills in conflict resolution and de-escalating conflict; excellence crisis response skills.
Strong research and data analysis skills; effective report writing skills.
Advanced understanding of frameworks for addressing student mental health; able to take a leadership role in mental health promotion, education, student skill development, partnerships with academic areas for early alert, and crisis intervention. In depth understanding of the role of mental health promotion and supports in student retention and success.
Thorough knowledge of current legislation related to college counselling, including privacy legislation, note-taking protocol, and Ontario Human Rights legislation.
In depth understanding of anti-oppressive framework as applied to college counselling; advanced understanding of social justice; strong orientation toward valuing diversity, addressing issues in access, and prioritizing inclusion.
Highly effective interpersonal skills, communication, creative problem-solving, strategic planning, and partnership development competencies.
Strong organizational and operational skills critical to ensuring the efficient and effective running of counselling offices at multiple locations.
Demonstrated leadership in delivering excellent service to others as this is key in supporting the success of our students and our College.
Strong collaboration and teamwork skills.
Effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.
Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.


TO APPLY:
If you are a George Brown College employee, go to https://adfs.georgebrown.ca/adfs/ls/IdpInitiatedSignOn.aspx to apply via our internal site.
If you are an external candidate, go to www.georgebrown.ca and click on the “Employment at George Brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button to the left of the posted job to apply.
NOTES:
Please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.
The College requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents. Credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.
Closing: Open until filled

Manager, Modelling & Geomatics - (MOD000A)
Employee Status: Regular
Office Name: Head Office

Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario and our goal is to create a transportation network that enhances the prosperity, sustainability and quality of life for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area. It leads the planning in the region with its Regional Transportation Plan that guides the work and investments of the organization. It builds light transit, bus rapid transit and Regional Express Rail and operates GO Transit, UP Express and PRESTO.


Our Research and Planning Analytics Office is seeking a Manager, Modelling and Geomatics to lead the development, application, and interpretation of advanced transportation analytics through travel demand modelling and geographic information systems (GIS) to build rigour into Metrolinx policy and plan development, project appraisal, implementation planning, and strategic business decisions.


Key Responsibilities:


Provides senior leadership and technical expertise for organization-wide travel demand modelling analysis, consultations, and advice for use in transportation planning and project appraisal, infrastructure delivery, and strategic business decisions
Defines and develops GIS strategies and frameworks that meet the needs of decision makers and continuously improves spatial data management, tools, and analysis.
Leads the preparation and analysis of travel demand forecasts, including model validation and calibration to required accuracy standards, quality control of outputs, and the documentation of results.
Manages travel demand modelling and spatial analysis projects that deliver advanced transportation analytics and mapping solutions. Determines scope of projects, deliverables and prioritizes competing requests from clients. Deploys processes to ensure the quality, accuracy and integrity of analysis along with the timely delivery of end products to clients.
Oversees research and surveys to integrate best practices and recommend improved modeling, innovative and practical decision support tools, and to build new analytic capabilities and insights regarding travel behaviour, transit ridership and other key transportation trends in the GTHA.
Works across the organization and with key external stakeholders to influence the direction of travel demand modelling in the region, educate others on the outcomes and benefits of travel demand modelling and spatial analysis, and further develop the organization’s capacity in these areas.


Location: 97 Front Street West, Toronto

Qualifications

University degree in planning, engineering or a related discipline-or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent.
Graduate degree with strong emphasis on quantitative research, travel demand modelling and other transportation analytics methods and applications, is an asset.
Minimum 8 years’ experience, including management accountability and experience applying regional transportation models in an agency specializing in planning or transportation.
Knowledge of principles, theories, concepts and practices of transportation modelling/planning for transit evaluation, transit planning, and public policy, urban planning, transport economics.
Knowledge of geospatial sciences and technology, Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and current and emerging GIS tools and techniques in transportation planning environments.
Demonstrated ability to effectively manage and lead staff and project teams.
Strong problem solving, negotiation, and relationship management skill to resolve conflicting priorities and facilitate multi-stakeholder collaboration to mitigate risks
Good experience with managing relationships with contractors and consultants, providing work direction and overseeing contract compliance.
Excellent oral and written communication skills to present technical material in traditional and innovative ways to technical and non-technical audiences.
EMME software modelling framework and other modelling and statistical analysis packages, such as TransCAD, VISUM, STATA, SAS, A-logit, and R is an asset.


To apply for this position, please submit your resume online, no later than March 31, 2019.


Please be advised, Metrolinx uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Search may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.


We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required.


AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

www.metrolinx.com

Flexible work schedules (mobility work, modified work weeks, job sharing, etc.)
Competitive compensation
Ongoing training and professional development opportunities
Comprehensive extended health and dental benefits for you and your family, including 100% employer paid MSP premium coverage
Defined benefit pension program
Health & wellness programs – lunchtime seminars, community health activities (yoga, kayaking, etc.) and a comprehensive Employee & Family Assistance Program

To learn more about us and how you can be a part of a culture that encourages innovation, continuous improvement and a passion for delivering an outstanding customer experience, visit bcpensioncorp.ca


What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Assistant Director, Information and Insight, the Manager, Data Analytics leads the development and management of an analytics platform to support the corporation’s analytics needs. This position will manage a team of data experts and work in cross-functional teams to build out the program, manage operational activities, and ensure deliverables align with strategic direction.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline and two years of recent experience in data analysis and conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Experience identifying business problems and providing advice on enhancements/optimizations based on findings of data analytics projects;
Experience working with and creating large databases and supporting processes;
Two years of recent experience leading and supervising a team of experts.

Nice-to-have
Experience developing performance measurement frameworks.
Experience creating and delivering presentations for the purpose of decision making.
Experience with advanced analytics techniques such as data mining.
Experience programming in Python or R for data analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Spotfire, Tableau, d3.js, Raw, Power BI, etc.

Interested in applying?

To learn more about the Manager, Data Analytics position, please review the job description at the bottom of this page.

Toronto, ONJob Description (EN)

The Manager, Enterprise Data Management will play a critical role within CAPREIT, and will work in partnership with other stakeholders. This position is both technical and business focused with regard to Enterprise Data Management. This position requires strong influencing and problem-solving skills. The role’s primary responsibility is to implement data strategy, governance and best data management practices to ensure data quality and integrity. In addition, responsibilities involve identifying and implementing systems and process improvement initiatives, as well as, coordinating efforts and leading projects to maintain accuracy and improve consistency across all the systems. The position is also required to understand and follow legislative requirements and guidelines set by the organization.

Responsibilities

Leads the development of enterprise data management capabilities with focus on enterprise data qualityManages the day-to-day operation regarding the management of data in SAP and other applicationsCoordinates activities associated with management of master data to achieve corporate goals and the needs of the businessIdentifies and implements process improvements: efforts aimed at improving efficiencies in program development and execution, improving service levels; increasing accuracy, and reducing costs associated with maintenance and creation of master dataResponsible for the documentation of process for data management throughout the organization,Performs data analysis against SAP and other data sources to determine accuracy, completeness and takes corrective actions based on the outcome of the analysis.Identifies, selects, evaluates performance of cross functional teams and operations that are also accountable to data integrity.Collaborates with business partners to assess and mitigate data related operational risks in areas of use, and privacy.Provides training and support to cross functional teams.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, or Accounting is requiredMust have over 5 years of data management experienceMust possess a strong knowledge of ERP system, preferably SAPMust have knowledge of data management toolsStrong problem solving skills, mathematical and data literacyMust have good understanding of legislative requirements relating to dataMust possess a detail oriented and analytical mindsetExcellent communication and computer skillsExcellent leadership, organizational and time management skills

CAPREIT values diversity in the workforce and is an equal opportunity employer, we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

A Little About Us:
Making fans - That’s what we’re all about! Since our humble beginnings in 2011, these two words have driven Big Viking Game s to become the successful company it is today. With over 100 Vikings already on board, and studios in both Toronto, ON and London, ON, we are focused on making our mark by building awesome free-to-play mobile and social games. Big Viking Games has proudly amassed millions of loyal fans across its many popular titles with no signs of slowing down anytime soon. We believe that by investing in our employees and in new technologies, such as HTML5, we can continue our success for years to come. With that in mind, we are on the hunt for exceptional talent to join our growing team, and that’s where you come in!

The Nitty Gritty:
The primary responsibility of a full-time Community Manager is to both support and advocate for the players. You will be the voice of the players as well as the company & will work closely with the rest of the production team to ensure they are aware of what is important to the players and fans.

The Duties:

Providing top-notch support to the players in order to help resolve any support tickets
Create content for blog posts, forum articles, newsletters, and other communication for social media channels
Facilitate the planning of special events for players
Work closely with Customer Support Representatives to ensure all customer requests are being addressed with a high level of customer satisfaction
Work alongside the product, content and marketing teams to facilitate marketing strategies
Managing game communities and answering customer support emails
Working alongside the QA team to help squash player-reported bugs
Gather and analyze data for community issues and events
Supporting marketing campaigns through different forums
Ensuring content on community sites is correct & frequent
Acting as a liaison between the players and product owners

The Must Haves:

Excellent written communication skills both written and verbal, along with the ability to deliver information in an empathetic manner
2+ year providing exceptional community management and support to players.
Strong desire to always give customers premium engagement experience
Experience creating content for blog posts, forum articles, newsletters, and more (writing samples expected)
Experience moderating forum discussion boards strongly preferred
General technical proficiency & internet savvy
Experience in online gaming environment preferred
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, with a mastery in multi-tasking
Strong documentation skills
Critical analysis skills
Previous experience in tech support and/or troubleshooting
Event planning experience is an asset
Post secondary education or relevant work experience
Passion for online games

The Loot:

Competitive salary, Group Retirement Savings Plan matching & participation in the Employee Stock Option Plan
Comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, and vision), including generous time off policies
Stocked kitchen, unlimited snacks and beverages, along with breakfast and daily hot lunches. Vikings can't work on an empty stomach!
Lots of other great perks such as frequent company paid outings, events and get-togethers.

Becoming a Viking:
Does the idea of working for a gaming company doing what you love everyday sound exciting? Great, we’d love to hear from you! Send us your resume and cover letter
Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Please email your request to
accommodation@bigvikinggames.com.

Vancouver, BCBoeing Global Services is hiring an Analytics Manager within its Boeing Vancouver Labs site to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics
Summary:

Boeing Global Services is hiring an Analytics Manager within its Boeing Vancouver Labs site to help design, develop and optimize the future of analytics-driven products for the aviation industry. You will manage an industry-leading data science & data engineering team and be involved in all phases of the advanced analytics innovation, development and delivery lifecycle within the Boeing’s Digital Solution & Analytics business.

As key leader in Global Services Analytics, you will be working with internal business partners and outside customers to identify and define business problems, target appropropriate analytics efforts and drive execution excellence. As a Manager, you will be empowered to form and lead teams, inspire and grow world-class data science talent, and work collaboratively across the Boeing Global Services and the Aviation Industry to advantage our customers. Given the tight integration with digital products teams and business consulting teams, there will also be opportunities to support execution data strategies and digital transformation within Boeing Services and with our Aviation customers.

Since Boeing’s cross-functional teams and Boeing’s customers are located globally, the position will involve some travel, particularly to the USA.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage employees performing data science, data engineering and analytics product development activities.
Develops and drives projects and process improvements, sets operational goals and metrics, and oversees innovation, development & deployment of analytics capabilities embedded into Customer solutions.
Collaborates with business partners, such as product managers, software developments, IT, and data ops teams, to ensure effective integrated working teams aligned to solve business problems.
Work as part of the agile team to integrate capabilities on large scale projects, ensuring coherency across projects, product lines and strategic initiatives
Acquires and allocates resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements.
Help drive requirements and data engineering execution in developing data science working environments and data flows to enable data science performance.
Develops and maintains relationships and partnerships with senior leadership, customers, stakeholders, peers, partners and direct reports to ensure customer needs are being met and team objectives are being accomplished.
Leverages technical experts and leaders to maintain and communicate vision, oversight, and approval of technical approaches, products and processes.
Manages, develops and motivates employees. Supports hiring and team development plans.
Promote the disciples of advanced analytics and help drive the organization to reflect a data-driven culture.


Demonstrated Knowledge and Skills:
You are customer-obsessed and data-driven
You are passionate about product innovation and creating industry level change
You have experience working on data-intensive projects, using modern data platforms and tools and advanced analytics methods and approaches
You are comfortable working with minimal direction and exercising considerable latitude in determining objectives and leading teams
You have strong communication skills, particularly in communicating the technical needs, approaches and benefits of advanced analytics
You are experienced in navigating and engaging internal and external stakeholders in complex, fast-moving organizational environments
You have familiarity with heavy-asset industries – aviation in particular
You have experience operating with remote, globalized teams with cross-functional skills and approaches


Education/Experience:
Previous management experience preferred, working cross-functionally to achieve objectives.
Master’s level degree in analytics-related field (Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, etc) an asset
Front line working experience in analytics, digital product development or data management preferred.

Maru/Matchbox, a Maru Group company, has been pushing the boundaries of the customer market insights space for over a decade. Unifying deep sector expertise with cloud-based customer insights communities, we take a results-focused, consultative approach to helping clients better understand what motivates their customers and influences their markets, so they can act decisively and win.

Research Manager
You are the day-to-day executional lead for projects, studies, and initiatives related to a client engagement (involving Insight Communities (IC) or ad hoc research). You’re the client’s go-to person for all tactical and strategic project-related questions, concerns, or requests, and therefore you are the client manager extraordinaire. You are also the daily link between the client team and the Maru/Matchbox team. You are to ensure that the project work is executed flawlessly, that we are truly partnering with our clients strategically and proactively, and that communication is smooth between Maru/Matchbox and the client and between different Maru/Matchbox team members.

It’s your job to know the client and their industry, listen to them, ask relevant questions to understand what’s needed and why, and identify the best response, including bringing in more senior support as needed. You are also responsible for delivering stunningly clear and relevant insights to help our clients – and us – succeed.

About the Role

Client management
Building and maintaining strong, mutually-beneficial ongoing client relationships
Ensuring smooth and effective day-to-day project management across multiple projects
Maintaining an awareness of client’s business challenges, industry trends & developments, and best practices thinking
Keeping client well-informed by providing regular project updates, IC health reports, etc.
Research and insights

Effective scoping and context-gathering in the planning stages of a new study or project
Ensuring flawless execution of all research, mapping back to initial scope agreement and understanding of clients’ bigger-picture objectives
Develop tab plans based on business objectives
Design initial surveys, and participate in qualitative recruitment screening
Effective analysis and synthesis of data after studies have fielded, with an eye to relating findings to the client’s strategic business objectives
Management of multiple projects simultaneously
About You

This is a great opportunity to partner with some of the best senior level market researchers in the industry! Serving as a consultant to our clients, you will provide strategic insight, ensure objectives are met, nurture relationships and manage key projects from start to finish.

The ideal candidate will have a university degree with 2-3 years of experience on the supplier side of research. Experience in the financial services sector would be a key asset.

You have proven experience in both quantitative and qualitative methodologies including questionnaire design, analysis, and project management. You might not be an expert in advanced analytical techniques (segmentations, conjoint, discrete choice), but you have a few such studies under your belt. You can work your way through data exploration with SPSS to develop hypotheses for further testing. You are known for your attention to detail, the ability to see the story in the numbers, superior communication and client management skills.

You are an out-of-the box thinker and have the ability to influence others, manage pressure and possess a high degree of tenacity. You have strong analytical and writing skills and strict attention to detail. Proficient with Microsoft Office, including skills for the formatting and creative visual display of information.

What’s in it for you?
Working with top clients in the Financial Services sector
Joining a fun, intelligent, open, and accomplished group of researchers
A great company culture focused on collaboration, learning, and growth
Three weeks vacation, flexible benefits, RRSP matching, wellness initiatives, tenure awards, an open and collaborative office, and the list goes on…
Ready to join our team?

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you we invite you to apply online now. Please note that due to the high volume of applications received only short-listed candidates will be contacted. We thank you for your interest in Maru/Matchbox and encourage you to constantly check our website for a list of all current opportunities.

Maru/Matchbox is an equal opportunity employer

$73,402 - $91,752 a yearDURHAM COLLEGE

Requires a

Manager, Academic Quality Assurance

Salary Range - $73,402 - $91,752


Durham College is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from qualified individuals, including members of visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.


The Manager, Academic Quality Assurance is responsible for contributing to the success and quality of college programs through the review of existing local certificate, diploma, advanced diploma, graduate certificate programs, and baccalaureate degree programs. The individual is responsible for leading teams of college administrators and faculty in completing program self-assessments, conducting industry focus groups, organizing and co-ordinating external panel reviews as required, and developing program improvement action plans. In addition, the individual will work with the Office of Research Services, Innovation and Entrepreneurship (ORSIE) to establish data requirements and review data provided.


Additionally, this individual will manage and promote the institutional quality assurance processes including the completion of related audits and the review and revision of academic content of College Guide production. This individual may also support aspects of degree development.


The Manager, Academic Quality Assurance is responsible for the confidential process for 75% of the comprehensive program reviews (CPR) leading teams of faculty and academic administration to conduct program self-assessments for all program credentials offered at the college. This includes the assessment of: the purpose of the program; populations served; enrolment trends; program and course outcomes; and resources to support the program as identified in the Academic Program Review and Renewal Policy and Procedure. In coordination with Manager, Academic Quality and Program Development, manage assigned CPR projects and assist with degree program development upon request.


The successful incumbent will ensure existing programs are compliant with college policies and procedures, the college Strategic Mandate Agreement (SMA), Business Plan, Strategic Plan, Academic Plan, Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities (MTCU) qualifications framework, and institutional and Ministry initiatives; develop, track and disseminate a five-year program review roster in collaboration with the Executive Deans of the academic schools, the VPA, the Associate Dean, Teaching, Learning & Program Quality and participate in the review of the academic programs’ Program Health Matrix reports.


Organizes and co-ordinates external/industry/academic review of programs as required. This includes collaborating with the program review team in the selection and confirmation of participants for the external assessors or focus group participants ensuring that the reviewers are conflict free.


The Manager, Academic Quality Assurance provides leadership and support for the continuous development and implementation of college-wide program quality assurance initiatives. Ensure continuous quality assurance improvement in program lifespan. Develop documentation while leading the preparation and submission of the CQAAP self-study, final report, college response and subsequent 18-month report for CQAAP and future program audits/accreditation. The incumbent will develop and deliver workshops and seminars regarding quality assurance and degree responsibilities further strengthening institutional quality awareness and competency within the academic community.


The Manager, Academic Quality Assurance reviews requests for annual curriculum major change proposals and ensures that the Program Change Policy and Procedure are adhered to. Other responsibilities include the preparation of appropriate Board of Governor reports, MTCU reports, ensure signed attestation letters and communication processes are adhered to as per the Program Suspension and Cancelation Policy and Procedure for all program suspensions or cancellations. Ensure compliance with storage according to records retention management (RIM) policies and procedures. Provide accurate information to various departments within the college regarding new program details, review marketing program information for accuracy and compliance, and support the production of the college guide. Communicate effectively with stakeholders and maintain collaborative working relationships with internal College staff and with government agencies (MTCU).


The successful candidate will have a minimum of a Master’s degree in Education with focus on post-secondary institutions and subject expertise in program and course curriculum design, along with a minimum of five years of practical related work experience. The successful candidate will have knowledge and experience in the instructional development process; research techniques; the college system and college credentials framework; online learning development and applications; and the ability to facilitate focus groups. In addition, the successful candidate will have excellent presentation and facilitation skills; interpersonal skills, particularly working as a member of a team; negotiation and conflict resolution skills; analytical skills; exceptional proof reading editing abilities; and above average use of standard computer software applications.


Durham College provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process. If you require this information in alternate format; require communication supports; an accommodation in applying for a posting and/or you are selected for an interview, please contact our Human Resources (HR) department and an HR Assistant will work with you to meet your needs.


T: 905.721.3073

F: 905.721.3134

E: HumanResources@durhamcollege.ca


In person: Campus Corners building, 2069 Simcoe Street North, Oshawa, Ont.


To apply for this position in confidence, please submit your cover letter and resume to the online portal. Applications will be accepted until 4:00 pm on March 29, 2019. Competition number is AD19-02.

Required Experience

Halifax, NSIrving Shipbuilding Inc., located at 3099 Barrington Street Halifax NS B3K 5M7, is part of the J.D. Irving Group of companies and is in the business of building quality ships and repairing vessels. The company’s primary site is Halifax Shipyard, with three other locations in the Maritime Provinces. Irving Shipbuilding is currently working on a number of significant projects for the Department of National Defense.

The Data Manager will be responsible for development and implementation of an Integrated Data Environment (IDE) to support the Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) activities including budget, cost, schedule and performance monitoring. Data Manager will ensure compliance with all project logistics requirements and coordinate with logistics support program activities as needed. The Data Manager will report to the Business Architect and will be responsible for:

Key Responsibilities:

Support the Business Architect in the development of the IDE to meet the requirements of the ILS activities during all phases of the ship’s life-cycle that meet the relevant standards.
Provide technical input to the IDE solution to meet the requirements of ‘Support the Design’ and “Design the Support’ ILS phases.
Support the development of the IDE to provide an interface between the different stakeholders on the CSC project including Sub-contractors and contracted Vendors that captures all identified resources related to the provision of training, support equipment, and support facilities for all phases of the ship’s life-cycle to include the use of Vendor Furnished Information in support of equipment selection, supportability analysis, design efforts, and sustainment during the ship’s operational phase of the acquisition life-cycle.
Establish and implement business-rules to ensure data-integrity between ILS databases and the IDE.
Create tools and queries which consolidate and report ILS-IDE information.
Integrate the Baseline Comparison System (BCS) with the IDE, to provide single-point update interface and a visual reporting Dashboard.
Support the IDE solution that interacts with the Design toolsets and CSC ILS Supportability Team, including integration of the technical studies critical to ARM, RCM, maintenance and logistic support functions that influences the Design solution.
Engage with the CSC ISI Supportability team to provide an IDE solution that supports Logistic Support Analysis, Level of Repair Analysis, Life-Cycle Costing, Sparing Analysis, Maintenance Task Analysis to create the logistics and maintenance documentation to support end items through their entire life-cycle.
Manage the IDE solution throughout the ship’s lifecycle, providing continual integration of ILS Support data between Design, Production, Support, In-Service and Canada.
Identify and resolve ILS data integration gaps, duplication and conflicts between the different datasets.
Support and update the IDE solution as relevant ILS actives develop due to improvements and technological advances.
Developing plans, processes and procedures as required in support of program requirements
Developing recommendations on support requests and drive continuous improvement strategies to customer problems and queries
Establishing and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders Support a culture of teamwork, enthusiasm and a proactive nature within the CSC Program

Qualification & Experience:

Essential:
University Degree in Engineering Technology, Business or a related field
3+ years of experience as an ILS Specialist in a Defence related program
Minimum of 5 years’ of proficiency with MIL-STD-1388-2B, GEIA-STD-0007 or DEFSTAN 00-600 and other military/commercial specifications related to reliability, maintainability, availability, FMECA, RCM, LCC, LORA, LSA
Familiarity with computer modeling for reliability analysis, logistic support analysis and spares modeling
Experience in a relevant Information, Communication and Technology (ICT) environment where you had a focus on customer support
An understanding of Java, Windows based desktops and web technologies
Excellent communication skills - listening, written and oral
An ability to demonstrate systems analysis skills, critical thinking and problem solving
Ability to plan and prioritize work
Desirable:
Experience in Product Lifecycle Management (Windchill or similar experience is preferred
Strong Technical skills and familiarity with DND/RCN terminology
Knowledge of relevant management and business change techniques such as business process modeling and re-engineering
S1000D or similar Data Exchange Specification
Experience in the following fields:
Engineering and/or Project Management on large and complex defense engineering projects
Coordination with a complex organization Extensive knowledge of a shipyard production environment
Knowledge of relevant management and business change techniques such as business process modeling and re-engineering
S1000D or similar Data Exchange Specification

All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).


What We Offer:

Irving Shipbuilding is proud to offer a competitive salary commensurate with the experience of the Candidate and benefits package including but not limited to medical, dental and vision.

To Apply for this Career Opportunity:


For further details, please contact Aimee Wragg at: wragg.aimee@jdirving.com.


We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

company_name: Amazon FC Slovakia s. r. o
job_description:
SaskatchewanBasic qualifications
You hold (or are about to finish) a university degree, and if you have experience in logistics / retail that would be a plusA strong team player with leadership potentialYou demonstrate problem-solving and analytical capabilities: active engagement in deep dives/projects at school, office package usage on advanced level.You’re a quick thinker, able to act decisively in a fast-paced environment,You’re willing and able to work to flexible schedules and shifts: you always commit the time required to get the job done.You are fluent in English plus the relevant local language

Graduate Distribution/Logistics Centre Area Manager

We’re seeking an enthusiastic graduate for our dynamic Reverse Logistics Centre.
Our centre is at the heart of Amazon’s rapidly growing returns network: they are where we manage customer shipments or returns towards customer satisfaction.
In our centres we develop industry leading work-flows and best practices whilst continuously growing the scale of operations. We hire fresh talent and help them develop into established leaders who can utilize their potential within the Amazon network.

In these facilities we’re building the future of customer service, as we work towards becoming Earth’s most customer-centric company. This is your chance to make history with us.

About the role and responsibilities:

You will be empowered to become a manager for one of the main teams in our centre: customer returns, warehouse deals, receive, stow, pick, pack or ship . Along with your peers, you will ensure that all workflows run smoothly and that customer expectations as well as wellbeing of our employees are met, if not exceeded.

In the reverse logistics team, we will provide training and support so you can lead a team of approximately 80 to 120 associates and 2-5 team leaders. You will drive training and integration of your team, while motivating and inspiring forward progress. You will exercise sound judgement and experience a steep learning curve.

While you achieve this, you will ensure motivation, engagement and performance:
You will need to safeguard your team’s safety, become role model in safe behaviour and enforce safe behaviour in your team. You will lead incident reporting and investigation using standard tools (5 why analysis, fishbone diagram)You will implement, create and enforce quality standards and standard work in your area.You will own training, assessment and motivation of your team membersYou will maintain inventory accuracy by understanding and actively managing workflow.You will take part in lean and primary wastes training and then lead improvement projects through standard methodology (kaizen, A3 format)You will actively share and promote best practices with your colleagues and network.
Base pay for this position is EUR 20,000 per annum, there will be further pay components such as a sign on bonus and the eligibility to participate in a restricted stock unit scheme operated independently by Amazon.com Inc. in USA. Company benefits apply subject to further terms, including annual membership in medical clinic, life insurance, retirement pension, meal voucher card, career development.

We will support domestic relocation of the successful candidates.

We’re looking forward to receiving your application, preferably in English.
