job_title: Manager, Economic Development and Tenant Employment
job_description:
$76,272 - $95,340 a yearTemporaryMake a difference
Is community development your passion? Do you want all persons of Toronto to have the opportunity to thrive? If working in a collaborative environment and feeling like you contribute to the greater good is where you see yourself, you may want to consider working with Toronto Community Housing!
Tenant and Community Services Division supports the Toronto Community Housing vision and mission through nurturing revitalized communities and tenants by providing programs, services and partnerships aimed at the needs of children and youth, working families, under/employed youth, seniors and other vulnerable tenant populations. The Division does this through tenant engagement, accessing services and spaces, integrating healthy communities, providing supports for seniors and vulnerable tenants, economic development programs and corporate sponsorships/partnerships.
Supported by the Program Development Director, the Manager, Economic Development and Tenant Employment (ED&TE) is the sole role responsible for the leading, planning, development, documentation and implementation of initiatives and programs that advance the corporation’s vision of community economic development and workforce and business development for Toronto Community Housing tenants of all ages across the city. The Manager, ED&TE develops and executes a plan that is the catalysis for community development efforts in the areas of business partnerships, poverty reduction through financial literacy, skills development and education, tenant hiring, workforce engagement, youth development, social enterprise and tenant led small business development across the entire TCH portfolio.
What You'll Do
Strategy Preparation and Development
Leads, develops and implements the overall Economic Development and Tenant Employment Strategy to support TCH tenants experiencing multiple barriers to entering the workforce
Responsible for strategic priorities and partnerships cascading down including governmental (municipal, provincial and federal) programs and partnerships. Eg. Announcement of federal funding for employment related programs and developing a subsequent program to work in line with this.
Develops, recommends and administers the annual budget for the unit, and ensures that the unit’s expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations through effective decision-making and monitoring
Develops and facilitates inter-divisional staff collaborations to develop new or enhanced service models 10/ 100%
Develops and supports social enterprise and small business development strategies relying heavily on partnerships and linking tenants to external support.
Develop and implement internship and mentorship programs for tenants, particularly youth.
Advocating for the creation of new organizational roles for tenant focused hiring eg. Interns/ YouthWorx Field worker positions that are implemented citywide.
Launching/ implementing new organization wide programing, including program oversight and customer service. (Eg. YouthWorx)
Identifies policy and program implementation issues and participates in the development of solutions and strategies to address emerging trends and issues
Leading Staff/Managing Resources
Recruits staff, as required, providing management oversight to unionized and non-unionized staff
Manage up to 150 staff over the summer across all 13 OUs.
Human resource planning/ coordination to do mass hiring and staff on boarding for various programs.
Oversee hiring/ on boarding/ of intern program across the organization.
Leads staff team to meet key performance indicators, service standards, unit wide outcomes, business processes and reporting requirements and takes corrective action when needed
Ensures team is compliant with documentation standards and confidentiality is maintained in accordance with applicable legislation, corporate policies and procedures, collective agreement
Coaches and trains staff ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and encourages innovation in others.
Authorizes and controls vacation and overtime requests for unionized and management-exempt level staff;
Supervises hiring of consultants, temporary staff and volunteers
Supervises staff in all aspects of their duties including preparation of reports and correspondence.
Leads, manages and motivates a Community Service Coordinator staff team to ensure effective teamwork, monitor work output, take a proactive approach to problem solving, resolve labour relations issues, ensures high standards of work quality and organizational performance
Manages team resources ensuring effective and efficient use of resources
Develops, recommends and administers the annual budget for the unit, and ensures that the unit’s expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations through effective decision-making and monitoring
Approves expenditures
Enter payroll, manage staff schedules
Responds to/assists with collective agreement grievances, as required
Identify risks and mitigation strategies
Customer Service
As the singular centralized CED management role in the organization, the role is involved in interfacing with external partners at a senior level around tenant hiring and economic development for all TCH communities. The role manages high profile and high visibility programs and staff across the city. It requires specialized communication and customer service skills to ensure successful partnerships and collaborations are established internally and externally to advance the corporations Community Economic Development Strategy. Role is required to communicate with various stakeholders on a daily basis including senior management, external organization leads, tenants and city/ community partners by building rapport, developing interest in partnerships, programs and maintaining productive relationships throughout the program duration. Advanced competence in diffusing conflict and building consensus is required around program development and implementation.
Internal Divisions: High level of customer service/ interpersonal skills as it relates to developing, leading and establishing new programs, initiatives and strategies within and across the organization including establishing organizational buy in and support for new initiatives, eg. Launch/Management of YouthWorx, Internship Program. Identifying emerging hiring needs and developing tenant hiring strategies to address this where possible. Follow up on high numbers of tenant referrals and leads from other divisions. Focus on smooth and timely service delivery of programs to other units to ensure continued support and participation in tenant hiring programs.
City Divisions: Liaise/ Develop and lead tenant hiring strategies and programs with Toronto Employment Social Services, and Social Development and Finance Divisions.
Business Partners/ Vendors: Collaborate with businesses to support tenant hiring through job fairs, targeting outreach for hiring and training opportunities.
Tenant Engagement: Involved with complex conflict resolution and management as it relates to program development, implementation, and evaluation, including addressing community concerns and conflict as it relates to violent incidents/ and other community concerns.
Portfolio engages with a high number of diverse and vulnerable tenants as it relates to economic development supports, including the maintenance and management of a large tenant database. Presenting, communicating with large group of tenants at various portfolio events.
Partnership Engagement and Development
Establishes productive relationships with various levels of government, educational institutions, community agencies, the private sector and funders to establish effective partnerships, develop solutions and coordinate resources to effectively address issues of economic development.
Working with community partners to establish employment/ entrepreneurial programs for TCH tenants.
Develop/ maintain external stakeholder partnerships with businesses to increase employment opportunities for tenants (Eg. UPS Job Fair)
Negotiates external supplemental funding to support new and on-going economic development initiatives for TCH tenants
Leads the coordination of training and workshops to be conducted by external partners with expertise in the areas of job readiness, skills development leading to the increased employability of tenants.
Represents the division on committees and networks which address long term strategies to support economic development opportunities for low income tenants across Toronto
Builds and fosters relationships with key partners in social enterprise, economic development, employment, education and non-profit sectors
Develops relationships and collaborates with key internal and external stakeholders to promote the program and identify opportunities for innovative and high impact interventions
Identifies, approaches, and secures multi-year relationships to support corporate partnerships staff, providing guidance and counsel towards building a unified partnership engagement approach
Works with provincial, municipal and local funders to determine new program needs and objectives and develop responses and programs accordingly.
Represents the organization and is responsible for initiating, developing, maintaining and evaluating agreements for partnerships in line with TCH CED strategic priorities.
Is required to work extensively on partnership development, bringing together external resources to address gaps in service related to economic development and to determine the appropriate resources for communities
Communication
Responsible for developing detailed communication plans for program planning and delivery to ensure successful program implementation.
High frequency of communication with diverse groups to gain cooperation and build multi-stakeholder partnerships. Responsible for overseeing/ approving all communications materials including print, presentations and electronic correspondence of staff. Communicating up to Sr Management and the board of both TCHC and external partners such as Toronto Employment and Social Services is required.
Tenants: Public Speaking and presentations to large groups of tenants, chairing contentious meetings and promoting programming.
Public Speaking/ Speeches at events and programs to groups of up to 200+.
Responsible for providing KPI reports to Stakeholder Relations Department
Agencies / External Stakeholders: is responsible for sharing information about program delivery and implementation to obtain additional resources and supports.
Responsible for developing and delivering presentations to a variety of agencies, staff and tenant groups around their input and collective impact to increasing and improving program delivery in TCHC.
Working with internal divisions to encourage tenant hiring/ employment supports, eg. Working directly with OU managers to encourage YouthWorx team scheduling and support over the summer.
Public Speaking and presentations to large groups of staff from various levels including senior management.
Develops/ presents reports directly to ELT/ Board.
Responsible for writing very detailed business cases and justifications for budget increases based on identified needs.
Leveraging funding/ support from partners regarding CED programs and initiatives.
Developing grant proposals in partnership with community groups to leverage funds/ services for TCH communities.
Project Management
Responsible for strategic priorities and partnerships cascading down including governmental (municipal, provincial and federal) programs and partnerships. Eg. Announcement of federal funding for employment related programs and developing a subsequent program to work in line with this.
Working with community partners to establish employment/ entrepreneurial programs for TCH tenants.
Human resource planning/ coordination to do mass hiring and staff on boarding for various programs.
Budget development, planning, oversight and compliance.
Oversee hiring/ on boarding/ of intern program across the organization.
Oversees the implementation of strategies and ensures an evaluation framework for all enterprise development initiatives and communicates trends to Divisional management
Fosters a relationship with Tenant Services Engagement Teams
Ensures the development and approves content of Economic Development communications material
Oversee and support event/ project planning and execution.
Make programming decisions re: Start/ stop/ expand/ contract for CED city wide programming.
Responsible for program evaluation, data gathering and analysis and corresponding program modification.
Extensive budget management/ knowledge of grant development, administration and partner agency resource sharing approaches
Documentation and Trend Analysis
Monitors and analyses current emerging social, economic, and political trends and issues in economic development, employment funding, community service sector, etc. as a basis
Consults with tenant groups, councils, frontline staff, agencies and partners to identify community issues and priorities
Proactively communicate with tenants and the Division to determine tenant needs and interests for partnerships and help define working for RFPS before submission.
Identifies creative solutions and strategies to address emerging trends and issues for tenants as they relate to education, poverty reduction and community economic development.
Identify community based issues and develop solutions as it relates to community economic development, eg. Addressing youth violence with a summer youth hiring initiative working in high risk/ challenges areas.
Position works at a strategic level to work with external partners to align programs and services with system wide trends and funding. Eg. The City of Toronto Social Procurement Policy.
Strategizing/ developing real time solutions for complex anti-poverty strategies at a senior level within city divisions.
What You'll Need
University undergraduate degree in human/social sciences, public administration, or relevant field
Knowledge of social procurement policy and practices/trends as well as Community Benefit Agreements best practices.
Knowledge/ Experience in program evaluation.
5 years working in a social service or community-based setting
4 or more years’ experience in a leadership position managing staff
3 years working with Community Economic Development/ Employment strategies and program implementation.
Previous experience working in a public sector environment is required
Operational planning, including work plan development and management.
Experience with financial management, including budget development and management.
Human resource management, including experience managing staff in a unionized environment.
Project management and managing numerous projects simultaneously
Experience in partnership development, including working with diverse stakeholders including private sector, nonprofits and vulnerable populations.
Proven high level communication skills, both in written and oral presentations.
What's Next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Please note: This temporary position may be extended or become permanent in order to meet business needs. If this occurs, the position may not be reposted.
INDS

job_title: Full-time opportunities for MBA students & recent graduates: Sales
job_description:
CanadaWe live in a mobile-first, cloud-first world, and the transformation we are driving across our businesses enables our customers to thrive in the digital world. Our sales professionals are the essential link between the potential of what's possible and build trusted advisor relationships with customers and technology vendors.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job. Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available sales roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered as a student or recent graduate, you should be within 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 6 months.

Technology Solution Professional
Technology Solution Professional (TSPs) drive the technical motions within sales driving specific solution area revenue and market share. Based on the tremendous opportunity of digital transformation across every individual and organization, we focus our broad portfolio of assets and go-to-market efforts across four key solution areas: Modern Workplace, Business Applications, Apps & Infrastructure, and Data & AI.

Customer Success Manager
Customer Success Mangers (CSMs) focus on enabling our clients' vision for driving digital transformation within Microsoft solution areas. CSMs are our customer's success advocate as they deploy, use, adopt and consume our technology.
CSMs are core to our long-term strategic success and by driving usage of cloud services and increasing accounts while broadening the surface area of potential with our accounts.

Account Executive
As an Account executive, you are the main connection point between Microsoft and our customers., You provide strategic business leadership partnering with leaders in your customers' organizations to align their business transformation agenda with digital solutions that can help them better engage customers, optimize operations, transform products and shift their business models. Account Executive roles are an incredible opportunity to learn, experience and ultimately drive all aspects of the client relationship, sales pursuit, and customer success lifecycles

Account Technology Strategist
The Account Technology Strategist (ATSs) are our enterprise customer's chief architects. Acting as a chief architect offers a high profile, customer-facing role that is the primary technical face and orchestration point for enterprise customers. Successful ATS' have a strong, proven IT background and demonstrated knowledge with a broad range of Microsoft solutions and technologies.
As an ATS you must relish the opportunity to build and maintain trusted advisor relationships with technical leads at some of America's largest organizations including CIOs, CTOs, Enterprise Architects

Licensing Sales Specialist
As a Licensing Sales Specialist (LSS), you provide licensing solutions to your customers with a focus on Microsoft volume licensing programs. You work closely with multiple sales disciplines including Account Executives, Business Development, Buy and Legal service desks. Outside of Microsoft you will build and maintain relationships across customers' purchasing, business sponsors and technical lead to provide modern and robust licensing solutions.

Sales Operations Program Manager
You will be at the business center of excellence for cross-business execution performance, planning, and Subsidiary operations. The team helps scale execution, drives clear business & market insights that result in Microsoft achieving its business objectives.

Solution Sales Professional
As a Solutions Sales Professional (SSP), you will identify our customers’ pain points and solve them through the latest software and services solutions. You will be our customers’ trusted consultant, thoroughly evaluating the health of their IT platforms and development environments and diagnosing areas for improvement. Your solutions drive measurable value, helping customers run their businesses more cost-effectively and efficiently and giving them a competitive edge in their marketplace—be it business, government, or academics.

Partner Development Manager
As a Partner Development Manager (PDM), you will act as the daily face of our company to our partner channel. The PDM is accountable for driving performance of a managed portfolio of partners, by business priority, with a primary focus on Microsoft cloud services (O365, Azure and Dynamics 365) and complementary products. The goal is to drive partner recruitment, enablement and business growth based on the partners’ strengths and priorities. The PDM represents Microsoft to our partners, communicates our strategy, sells our vision and brings partners along in the digital transformation journey.

Partner Technology Strategist
Your role as a Partner Technical Strategist (PTS) will be to ensure our software partners are successfully delivering great solutions to their customers. You will focus on Azure/Cloud but will also leverage your knowledge of developing for client technologies (Windows, Office, Mobile) to help our partners thrive in a “mobile first, cloud-first world”. The PTS is a technical partner-facing role accountable for the end-to-end technical architecture and solution deployment experience. You will own technical partner engagements by leading Envisioning Sessions, Architecture Design Sessions (ADS), and Proof of Concepts (POC) while also providing project management oversight and technical guidance through solution development, testing and delivery into the market. You will have a crucial role in managing technical relationships with key technical leaders at some of the most innovative companies in the US.
Additional experience: Working knowledge of Cloud technical components helpful including: Development, Systems operations and management, SQL/Database, Virtualization, IP Networking, Storage, IT Security. Experience with one or more of the following development languages a plus: .NET, C#, XAML, Objective-C, or Java. Strong balance of both the business and technical skills required to enable partner profitability, customer adoption and increased revenue growth.
Responsibilities
Technology Solution Professional
As a TSP, you work alongside Business Development and Solutions Architect teams who source, generate and qualify opportunities within the sales lifecycle. TSPs enable, manage, and implement, cutting edge and legacy technologies in large enterprises.

Customer Success Manager
CSMs manage migration of America's largest enterprises to adopt, deploy and execute their business objectives using Microsoft technologies. Successful CSMs uncover the true essence of problems and come up with insightful solutions appreciative of the way a customer views both their business and processes

Account Executive
Day-to-day you'll build and maintain key account relationships while driving a two-side business plan with your customers across Technical and Business agendas, respectively. To drive your customers' digital transformation, you will need to become an expert on their respective industry and talk their language. Your customers will call on you to connect them to the full breadth of Microsoft's assets including supporting sales disciplines, consulting, support, product groups, and executives to advance their digital transformation agenda.

Account Technology Strategist
You will be responsible for developing the account technology vision and strategy to support the overall business objectives for Microsoft and customers. The ATS works closely with the Account Executive, Customer Support, Technical Sales, and Business Development sales disciplines to ensure all new sales are well scoped to achieve sustainable business results.
ATS' champion their customer success across varying Microsoft solutions, technologies, and channel partners often within multiple accounts. The role includes coordinating and guiding both the customer and Microsoft enterprise account teams on all technical domains.

Licensing Sales Specialist
Your role will include negotiating agreement terms and conditions, being the single point of contact for internal and external sales contracts and licensing issues, while supporting developing pricing scenarios and cost/benefit analyses. Successful LSS' deliver customer-centric licensing that ultimately reduce the complexity of doing business with Microsoft while fueling their ability to execute on their digital transformation agenda.

Sales Operations Program Manager
The Sales Operations Program Manager role will responsible for developing highly scaled and efficient operational services, driving standardized sales operations & processes, Building and executing standardized tools and reporting and accelerating the landing of Global Sales transformation efforts

Solution Sales Professional
You will build and maintain relationships with executive business and technical decision makers, be able to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft’s solutions, and develop a firm understanding of Microsoft’s strategies and product offerings relative to our major competitors.
Qualifications
Currently enrolled in an MBA degree program, or completed an MBA degree within the last 6 months.
Strong desire and business acumen for consultative solution selling.
Exceptional negotiation, customer service, and interpersonal skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

$76,500 - $103,500 a yearAbout Us VIDEO ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ohREsVH5ND8&feature=youtu.be )
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Founded in 2013, Pivotal Software, Inc., combines our leading cloud-native platform, tools, and methodology to empower the world's largest organizations to adapt to change and build great software. Our technology unleashes developer productivity, while fulfilling our mission to transform how the world builds software.

Our methodology is about evolving, in both development and innovation, and our culture is empowering. Our 2,000+ employees across offices worldwide subscribe to an ethos of kindness. We make a point to bring empathy to each and every project, and are guided by a purposeful mission—to transform how the world builds software.

We care deeply about recruiting and developing exceptional talent. Pivotal seeks to add new voices and perspectives to our vibrant community because we know it leads to the most innovative solutions and most successful teams. We hire for empathy, collaboration and excellence. Learn more about what Pivotal is doing to cultivate our community - D&I @ Pivotal ( https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7iecwwf7N2weEl4ZHgyTHgtb2NPUE82NDBJU0Z5c3d2UU93/view?usp=sharing ).

You
---

You are someone who enjoys working in a highly collaborative environment. Our project teams can include PMs, designers, engineers, data scientists and other roles - and pairing across these specialties leads to incredible results.

You can't get enough of product and learning. Our clients come from nearly every vertical out there and you'll be able to work hand-in-hand with the decision makers in each. In fact, you will be partnering directly with a client PM and coaching them on modern product development practices.

You enjoy being a leader and an influencer. In this role, you will work with the project team, client executives and the entire spectrum of PMs (project, product, program and any similar roles that a client may have) - to progress the goal of shipping the right product to the client's users.

You bring a balanced, holistic and flexible mindset to product development. We share the overall success of the product with our clients. This means that we don't just help our clients ship features, or define and validate product direction. We do what needs to be done to ensure that both the product and the engagement are successful.

You are comfortable with ambiguity. We work in an iterative and incremental way, balancing many different inputs and constantly making trade-offs. This requires us to be comfortable moving forward with imperfect information.

Us
--------

Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.

Your Day
--------

We're looking for a passionate Product Manager who knows how to help define, de-risk and execute against a product vision. This is a consulting role that demands being able to work collaboratively with clients and colleagues on cross-functional and co-located product teams. The role demands strong product instincts, excellent communication skills, technical fluency, empathy, humility and an appreciation for and understanding of lean startup, agile and user-centered design values, principles and practices.

We practice and teach an approach to product management that is applicable across industries and organizations, so you'll experience all types of teams, industries and products. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you'll typically work hard for 8 hours each day, but then you're off work to relax, recharge and refocus.

Required Skills / Experiences
-----------------------------


3+ years of Product Management experience
Experience with two of the following: lean startup methodologies, agile development methodologies, working directly with clients
Experience shipping successful products, including defining vision, strategy, outcome-driven product roadmaps and creating and managing backlogs
Skilled at defining and prioritizing product features
Strong leadership and communication skills and the ability to teach others
Experience articulating and testing product hypotheses
Demonstrated ability to influence decision making in different contexts
Ability to facilitate collaborative decision-making in a workshop context
Ability to quickly understand a specific client domain and identify the trends and opportunities in that space
Ability to work collaboratively with others and navigate complex decision making
Ability to collaborate well with engineers, designers, and clients

Desired Skills / Experiences
----------------------------


Experience building and deploying software with or inside enterprise scale organizations
Experience working directly with clients and leading projects
Experience shipping both new products as well as improving upon existing ones
Experience leading or supporting user research

Total Rewards Package
---------------------

Pay Range: 76,500 - 103,500 CAD

In addition to salary, our total rewards package also includes equity in the form of RSUs, comprehensive medical and disability benefits, employer match on RRSP, fitness reimbursement programs and more!

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY GPVTL Canada In ("Pivotal") is an equal opportunity employer who recognizes the value of every individual in creating success for our customers, business partners, shareholders, employees and communities. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, developing and promoting employees without discrimination. Pivotal believes equal opportunity and inclusion are essential to motivate, empower and recognize the best in everyone.

ACCESSIBILITY FOR APPLICANTS WITH DISABILITIES Pivotal is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Pivotal will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, please email AskHR@pivotail.io or call 416-907-9470 ensure to provide your name, the best way to contact you, a detailed description of the nature of any accommodation that you may require (including any materials or processes that can be used to ensure your equal participation).

Toronto, ONAt Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Are you excited by the opportunity to partner and collaborate cross-functionally to deliver the best business outcomes and customer experiences? Do you have passion for driving results? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments? If you said yes to all of the above, then this role may be for you.
The Wireless Lifecycle team is looking for an enthusiastic and experienced retention manager to drive Rogers Wireless churn improvements. Reporting to the Director of Wireless Lifecycle, this role will be located in Toronto and is responsible for leading the strategies and programs to retain Rogers Wireless customers.

What you will be doing:
Always be on top of churn results and take immediate action as needed
Liaise with customer-facing channel teams to define, develop, and execute retention programs from end to end (includes opportunity sizing, targeting, segmentation, channel training, and PIRs) to reduce churn in Rogers wireless base
Lead activities to identify, analyze and resolve churn drivers
Constantly and proactively provide new ideas to enhance retention (and revenue) efforts
Create well-thought strategies and business cases to assess opportunities and impacts
Gain alignment on recommendations from stakeholders and senior management
Lead and build collaborative partnerships to deliver projects

What you bring:
Driven by results, with a determination to constantly improve them. You constantly utilize your meticulous analytical skills to satisfy your insatiable curiosity to uncover key insights and opportunities, always wanting to make the results better.
You don’t need to be told to do something. If there is something that needs to be done, you’ve already taken care of it.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
You can gather data from multiple sources, extract the insights, and present the actions/findings succinctly
Proven ability to influence and interact with cross-functional groups and various levels within an organization to ensure mutual goals are achieved
Highly organized, detail-oriented and able to multi-task within tight deadlines
Ability to think outside the box and challenge the status quo with innovative customer-centric and frontline-centric approaches
Strong MS Excel and PowerPoint experience
Bachelors degree in business or equivalent
5+ years of experience in a marketing role
Confident, without ego, someone who has the ability to form strong relationships within a fast-paced industry

Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Marketing & Marketing Communication
Requisition ID: 150311

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment

What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You can also reach out to our team at RogersRecruiting@rci.rogers.com to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Montréal, QCThe eStruxture Regional Data Centre Manager is a critical operational role to manage day to day operations of our Vancouver data centres in addition to support in designing and building out new Vancouver facilities. The role requires an individual with deep experience in data centre sub-systems and someone committed to process and documentation, continual improvement, transparency and customer focus. The role’s ultimate objective is to provide the highest levels of availability and uptime for data centre systems and eStruxture customers in a rapidly changing, high growth environment.
As the role will be part of a very small local Vancouver team, the individual will be asked to fulfill a number of operational/technical sub-roles until demand supports adding more local resources.
Responsibilities
Manage all aspects of eStruxture’s Vancouver data centre electrical, mechanical and life safety systems operations
Day to day management, monitoring and maintenance of critical electrical and mechanical systems such as UPS, RPPs, switchgear, generators, chillers and CRAC units
Assist with new data centre assessments, design and construction projects
Lead data centre fortification and lifecycle projects to improve reliability
Capacity management tracking and reporting
Building Management System operations for monitoring and automation
Detailed as-built documentation up-keep
Preventative maintenance planning including vendor interaction, work-orders, change management, MOP development
Customer installs monitoring/support as needed
Track and manage costs such as supplier maintenance agreements and energy use
Landlord/base building interaction where applicable
Extensive interaction with construction teams on design and build-out/expansion teams
Very heavy process/documentation focused
Strong leader and communicator
Over time, build and manage a small regional team as we scale
Participate and support security audit/compliance programs such as SOC 1/2 and PCI
Good financial acumen; ensure costs are well managed and supplier prices negotiated to be below market levels wherever possible
24×7 role. Evenings, overnights and weekend work required
Reports to SVP, Operations
Experience
Minimum 10 years relevant experience in a similar role
Understanding of data center topologies including Uptime Institute tiering and ASHRAE principles
 Experience in prior data center build-outs and remediation projects
Prior work in a highly proceduralized, regimented mission critical facilities environment
Knowledge of Provincial Building Code & Regulations, Canadian Electrical Code, Provincial Fire Code, and Electrical Safety Authority
Computer literate

Toronto, ONAbout Growth Commerce:


Growth Commerce makes products that solve problems and brings joy to our customers. We are a relentless team of millennials with expertise in eCommerce, marketing, operations, and logistics. We're the team behind many e-commerce brands such as Soxy Socks, Bold Society Shoes, and Hookes Cork Shoes.
We sell 100% directly to our customers through our websites which allows us to take care of the entire customer journey: designing, manufacturing, promoting, and delivering wow-worthy experiences to our customers worldwide.


About the job:
We are looking for an eCommerce Manager Manager to join our small but tenacious team. As an E-Commerce Manager, you will play a critical role in the day-to-day success of our three brands. You will focus on delivering exceptional customer experiences, driving increased transactions, and achieving corporate objectives. You are creative, analytical, and able to identify opportunities for growth and innovation for the brands. The E-Commerce Manager acts as a liaison between the e-commerce website and our customers, ensuring brand expectations are met, resulting in a positive shopping experience. This position reports directly to the founders.
This is a full-time position. We have two offices, one in Downtown Toronto and one in Vaughan.
What you'll be responsible for:
Owning the online asset management process which includes product images, product description and other creative images
Develop and implement innovative ideas to maximize online revenue and visitor engagement activities
Lead the planning process to define eCommerce strategy working closely with the marketing team to ensure the proper acquisitions and redemption strategies are put in place to drive traffic and improve shopping rates.
Analyze web analytics and customer data provided to consistently improve the customer experience
Work with Web & Graphics Designer in updating the look of the site to reflect seasonal campaigns
Create and manage Email Campaign / Flows
Monitor competitors best practices for e-commerce and e-mail
Manage campaign reporting and analysis to ensure sales, traffic and brand KPIs are met


What we'll love about you:
Ability to coach and develop team members to take on more responsibility
Positive attitude—can always see light at the end of the tunnel
Can think on your feet and solve problems both large and small without getting overwhelmed
Constant eye towards efficiency and optimization
A team player who is willing and happy to help
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Belief in our mission and understands the importance of giving back
Inquisitive, loves to learn, embraces failure, and never gives up
Comfortable working in an open office environment while staying focused

What you'll love about us:
We are a team of smart, passionate, diverse, funny, and loving people.
We offer competitive compensation, 100% paid health benefits, snacks, socks and a fun, relaxed office environment.
We take the responsibility to make sure you are excited, happy, and find fulfillment in your work very seriously.
We value fun. This is why we host office lunches, offsite team outings, and a bi-annual company retreat.
We believe in giving back to the community and helping those in need, which is why we volunteer as a team regularly.

Qualifications
2+ years of experience in eCommerce

High level knowledge of Shopify, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, HotJar, and Email capture tools,

Well-versed in marketing language: Conversion Rates, CPA, CTR, impressions, etc.

Very organized and data driven

Excited about proactively coming up with and implementing ideas (big and small) that will help grow our brands and audience

Experience in the fashion / apparel vertical a bonus

See what our customers have to say about product here

Montréal, QCPermanent$100,000 - $120,000 a yearCountry Manager - CanadaPosition involves working to lead operations, develop business and increase profitability for Capture Data ULC in Canada. Capture Data ULC is a supply chain automation and innovation company focused on transportation and logistics, retail, manufacturing, 3PL and healthcare vertical markets.Position Description: Involves a very high level of responsibility and self-motivation.Responsible for managing all operations within a country. Corporate Overview: Citron Hygiene is a leading provider of support services for commercial and industrial facilities. We provide washroom care, pest control, chemical, ware-washing and life safety services and products that help building owners and managers address their facility’s needs. Combining service excellence and innovation we help customers deliver award winning building environments to their employees, customers, and guests. The design and delivery of our services and products reflect our deep understanding of commercial facilities, our focus on creating successful customers, and our respect for the environment.Position Summary: Reporting to the CFO, the role of the Master Data Manager is to be a subject matter expert in master data structure, design, governanace and use across the organization in order to help lead the growth and development of data strategy. The Master Data Manager will work closely with teams across the business to support the creation and ongoing maintenance of high quality item data and ensure master data processes and guidelines are enforced. This role will also be responsible for the maintenance and formal processes for ensuring the integrity of our customer-related data. In addition, this role will help lead data migration of legacy master data from acquired companies.Duties and Responsibilities: Under the supervision of the CFO, the duties and responsibilities of the Master Data Manager include, but are not limited to, the following:Formalize the various processes to maintain Citron’s customer account details within SalesforceWork alongside Citron’s customer success team and other relevant teams to ensure accuracy and timely execution of all requests received for the creation and changes to customer accounts Understand and communicate master data updates (e.g., maintenance, introduction of new fields, modification in attribute definition etc.) that impact downstream systems / teamsProactively and consistently communicate with business areas to notify them of maintenance activities that may impact their areaTo support the maintenance of high-quality data, proactively monitor data accuracy and facilitate required data corrective actions with business ownersMaintain clear communication and positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholdersAd-hoc data cleansing as required (e.g., at the end of a season) to ensure data quality is upheld on an ongoing basisSupport and enforce established data standards and guidelines related to master dataServe as the subject matter expert and central resource to train business owners in master data creation/maintenance and/or the use of supporting tools.Lead the company’s data migration of legacy master data from acquired companies (M&A) into Citron’s systems.Other: Other duties as assigned.Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and business-related work experience totaling 8+ yearsExperience maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management / governance experience and experience within an order-to-cash business processExperience using Salesforce is an assetAbility to manage multiple prioritiesTime management skillsInterpersonal and communication skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environmentUnderstanding impact to other areas of the business from decisions/findings made during testing or process changeAbility to train on the appropriate use of master data systemsStrong analytical and systems thinking skillsjAbility to work independently and proactivelyMust be detail oriented and highly organizedAbility to work based upon specific timelines and dependenciesWorking Conditions: Work normal business hours but may be required to do some work in the evenings or outside normal working hours;Required to meet a number of deadlines which may cause stress.What’s in it for you?Career advancement opportunities within a rapidly growing companyCompetitive compensation package commensurate with experienceAcquire industry insight and skills from some of the industry’s most highly skilled pest management professionalsBenefits including health, dental, vision and life insuranceThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the individual(s) assigned to this position. Kitchener, ONEvents are a fundamental part of D2L’s marketing plans, and you will help develop and shape those event experiences for our clients, prospective clients, and staff alike. We’re looking for a high energy individual who is eager to play a key role in building the D2L events strategy and drive various aspects of event planning and logistics. And most of all, have a passion for events!

How Will I Make an Impact?:

Drive strategy as well as cross-functional planning and coordination and event logistics for Fusion, D2L’s Global User Conference, and associated ancillary events, as well as D2L’s regional Connection events
Coordinate and plan annual internal Sales Kick-Off and support monthly Road-to-Readiness Sales enablement events
Managing events from start to finish according to requirements, target audience and business objectives. This includes such things as:
Preparing and managing budgets, facilitating purchase requests, and ensuring adherence to financials
Work closely to coordinate communications and manage relationships with vendors, executives, event staff, and supporting teams, and attendees, to ensure all events are planned and executed to the D2L standard
Performing Venue, Speaker, and Vendor sourcing and presenting selection proposals for executive decisions
Manage Food and Beverage, Entertainment, Exhibit, Internet, A/V, Electrical requirements, set-up, and support
Facilitate the creation and coordination of communication plans, branding and booth assets, marketing collateral, web pages, registrations, and attendee networking and event experiences
Managing and updating hotel room block listings and facilitating travel and accommodation logistics
Creating and maintaining event programs and agendas
Report post event evaluations and make recommendations for future events
Research, reporting and analysis, and data entry as required
Other areas of responsibility as assigned within the Marketing Events department
What you’ll bring to the role:

Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in event management
Excellent time management, communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills
Team player with leadership skills
High energy level, demonstrated drive to succeed, and a sense of urgency
Knowledge of KPIs and marketing techniques for event management
Advanced Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office skills and ability to pick-up new technologies quickly
Highly service-oriented and self-motivated
Resourceful and adaptable to change
Ability to quickly establish rapport with all levels of personnel within D2L as well as with external vendors, clients, and prospective clients
Occasional travel will be required
Additional Assets:

Experience with venue and vendor contract review and negotiation
Salesforce.com, Hubspot or Marketo system experience would be an asset
Comfort working with Event registration/proposal/speaker management systems (ie. Hubb, CVENT)
Experience in working in a fast-paced environment
 WHY WE'RE AWESOME:

Flexible work hours
Health and wellness programs
Collaborative work environment
Dog friendly office
Snacks and food trays!
Foosball and Ping-Pong tables
Staff gym and showers on site
Centrally located in downtown, close to restaurants and pubs, easily accessible by public transit

Halifax, NS$5,332 - $6,664 a monthApply By: 4/5/2019

Labour and Advanced Education

Manager Facilities and Safety, Permanent, HALIFAX

Competition # 18447


About Us
The Organizational Health and Professional Services division is responsible for four key areas of work – Facilities, Health and Safety, Information Management, and Organizational Health. This work impacts all employees in Labour and Advanced Education. The division is part of the Corporate Policy and Services Branch and our focus is on providing excellence in client service for all 20 of our departmental offices across the province.

About Our Opportunity
As the Manager of Facilities and Safety, you will be responsible for a leadership role in facilities management, health and safety and information management. Ensures departmental programs and offices are underpinned by smooth and seamless business operations and a healthy and safe support system. This includes managing the acquisition and maintenance of physical assets such as furniture and meeting room equipment; and through effective facility and space planning; leading in the evaluation, design, development and management of future space requirements; assessing and resolving space pressures and demands, consulting with senior staff to advise on space issues, problems and solutions. Manages all aspects of small and large scale moves and relocations through effective leadership and oversight of project planning to ensure minimal impact/disruption to program priorities, activities and operations. This includes all LAE facility issues, for example bi-annual inspections and flooding.

You will also serve as the primary lead on corporate administrative matters related to all business operations for our 20 facilities including, security and health and safety. You will be responsible for the timely, innovative and cost-effective delivery of a wide range of strategic and administrative services to the Department of Labour and Advanced Education offices across the province. Additionally, you will lead the departmental information management system into electronic records management (digitization).

You will be the lead contact for health and safety in the department, which includes working directly with senior leaders. You will be responsible for our departmental facilities strategy, building policies and procedures along with providing ongoing program development and support.

You will enhance the departmental emergency response plans to align with the departmental Business Continuity Plan, and corporate direction, including leading the four directives of the new Corporate Workplace Health and Safety Promotion policy.

You will be in a key position to build awareness and communication across the department in support of the health and safety management system. This includes working with manager colleagues, JOHS committee members as well as providing support and data to the executive leadership team to enhance health and safety promotion in departmental planning.

As the Manager of Facilities and Safety, you will report to the Director of Organizational Health and Professional Services.

About You
This position can be for you if you have a bachelor’s degree with 8 years of related experience or an equivalent combination of training and experience.

You are operationally focused and strategic in your thinking, confident in your ability to assess risk and solve problems.

You thrive working in a fast-paced environment and knowing each day will be different doesn’t faze you. Health and Safety is integral to how you think and conduct business.

You have a broad array of knowledge and experience, in a wide range of disciplines from construction standards, best practices in design, facilities, policy development and financial management to leading health and safety systems, business continuity

While not required, it is considered an asset if:
You have in-depth knowledge and experience in MS Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio. Competency in computer aided design (CAD) and project management.
Certification in Occupational Health and Safety and/or a professional designation, i.e. CRSP, CHCS etc.

Leadership competencies required at this level of work are:
Analytical Thinking, Action Management, Team, Leadership, Initiative, Effective, Interactive Communication, Partnering and Relationship Building, and Intercultural and Diversity Proficiency.

We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.

Other Considerations
Travel within the province is required.

Work outside of regular hours including evenings/weekends as required, i.e. you must be available to respond in a timely manner if a provincial office experiences facility issue(s).

Pay Grade: EC 11

Salary Range: $2,666.00 - $3,332.00 Bi-Weekly

$95,201 - $118,499 a yearCorrectional Service Canada - Information Management Services (IMS)

Abbotsford (British Columbia), Moncton (New Brunswick), Kingston (Ontario), Ottawa (Ontario), Laval (Québec), Saskatoon (Saskatchewan)

CS-04

$95,201 to $118,499
For further information on the organization, please visit Correctional Service Canada
Closing date: 5 July 2020 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request special accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Information on accommodation for persons with disabilities
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Although this advertisement is opened until June 2020, we invite you to apply as soon as possible as we intend on filling some positions very quickly. The first draw from the inventory will take place two weeks after the initial posting.

Various positions to staff
Stream 1: IM/IT Manager, General
Stream 2: Manager, IT Security
Stream 3: Manager, Enterprise Architecture
Stream 4: Manager, Infrastructure/Operations

You must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. Other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the persons identified for assessment or for an appointment. A volume management strategy may be used to select candidates from the inventory or at any stage during the assessment process.

Candidates must clearly demonstrate how they meet the essential education and experience factors listed by answering the screening questions. For each of the screening questions, provide clear and concrete examples and details of where, when and how you obtained the experience. For example, for each experience requirement, you must list where you gained the experience, your title at the time, a description of the tasks you performed relevant to the experience factor, and your accomplishments.

As a possible secondary source to validate your experience, provide an up-to-date résumé that clearly outlines your education and experience.

Failure to provide the above information may result in your application being rejected from the process.

Asset qualifications will be an important factor that will be considered for specific positions being staffed. Therefore, if you meet the asset education and experience, it is to your advantage to demonstrate this in your application as well.

Candidates who apply in this inventory and are later rejected or fail during the assessment process can re-apply 6 months after the date of their failure or rejection. Please note that results are not transferable from one round to another; candidates must be reassessed on all qualifications.
Work environment
Join the Government of Canada team

Explore career opportunities in the federal public service that suits your interest and experience. The pride of public service means working for your Country and the people in it. We offer great benefits and an amazing work environment which include work life balance, good salary, flexible hours, and wonderful people!
Intent of the process
A pool of partially assessed and fully assessed candidates will be established to staff CS-04 positions within the Information Management Services Branch with various linguistic profiles and tenures (permanent and temporary) that report to the National Capital Region. Based on operational needs, certain positions may be done virtually from one of the CSC Regional Administration offices across Canada. This process may also be used to staff similar positions.
Positions to be filled: 1

Toronto, ONPosition:

Data Analyst


Reports To:

Manager, Data Governance & Data Analytics


Tier:

Staff


Department:

Data Governance & Service Optimization


Company:

GS1 Canada


Location:
Toronto


Status:

Contract, (12 Months)


Job Number:

 1435



Company Profile:

We are a member organization of GS1, the world’s leading supply chain standards organization. As a neutral, not-for-profit organization, we enable our more than 20,000 subscribers – organizations of all sizes from over 20 sectors across Canada – to enhance their efficiency and cost effectiveness by adopting electronic supply chain best practices.


What We Do:
We develop standards that improve the way that business is conducted and allow Canadian businesses to compete on a global scale.
We deliver implementation services that enable businesses to implement standards to achieve supply chain efficiency.
We educate industry on how to incorporate collaborative commerce tools and processes into their businesses through seminars, conferences, and published guides and standards.
Watch our video: GS1 Canada Overview (https://youtu.be/3__lBt8SLvw)

Who We Represent:

As a user-driven and governed organization, our subscriber base includes organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries and sectors located across Canada and around the world.

Keys To The Role
The Data Analyst will support GS1 Canada’s industry exclusive Dashboard. This includes weekly data processing and validation of master data files, quality assurance testing and ongoing product development and process optimization.

The Data Analyst also plays an integral role in supporting Industry Managed Services (IMS) with subscriber and service level reporting and analysis. Working closely with other analysts, the candidate will extract, process and summarize subscriber data and be instrumental in ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process.

The Data Analyst will assist the Manager of Data Governance & Analysis to translate business requirements into technical and functional solutions that allow IMS to deliver value added services to existing subscribers and promote enrolment of new subscribers which support cost recovery in the not-for-profit model.

Duties and Responsibilities
Execute the refresh of GS1 Canada’s Dashboard – a portal used by retailers to evaluate vendor compliance to services essential for commerce.
Validate retail data against GS1 Canada registries for completeness and perform quality assurance prior to promotion to production
Transforming, validating and modeling data with the purpose of understanding and drawing conclusions.
Liaise with senior and executive level stakeholders to identify criteria for business reporting and execute the technical solution delivery.
Evaluate business requirements gathered from multiple sources and identify underlying business needs vs wants and work with Manager to prioritize development efforts.
Create reports that go beyond presenting the numbers, but tells a story about the data being evaluated.
Validate system integrity through report generation and analysis from various internal databases as required (i.e. CRM, ECCnet Registry and Item Centre).
Assist with conducting full lifecycle data analysis and evolving analysis and reporting capabilities.
Champions initiatives to enhance data quality by identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and efficiencies in reporting, analysis and/or product development
Establish a brand identity by standardizing report processes and generating output with consistent results, accurate information and quality fit and finish.
Engage with Data Governance to document and maintain procedures for data management and reporting standards;
Ensure ongoing understanding of relevant emerging technologies and services provided by GS1 Canada.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
University degree or college diploma in business or a related area of study, with a focus on problem solving, analytics/mathematics and critical thinking
A minimum of 2-3 year’s work experience, preferably in data management and reporting capacity
Background in business intelligence (BI) and familiarity with master data management highly preferred.
Ability to analyze, understand and effectively communicate/confirm business reporting requirements, technical design and implementation
Meticulous with high attention to detail
Proven ability to apply critical thinking. Able to read between the lines to extrapolate requirements not explicitly written or identified and anticipates next steps
Takes pride in their work and validates with vigour to ensure accuracy and correctness
Displays passion and optimism; inspires respect and trust; exhibits confidence in self and others
Demonstrated ability to interact in a professional and efficient manner
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with ability to positively influence others to promote engagement
Able to speak and present to stakeholders at all levels
Strong organizational focus, with demonstrated analytical, problem solving and planning skills
Demonstrated and proven high level of proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint) with preference given to those with advanced expertise in Excel and familiarity with MS Access or other relational database systems
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamic CRM would be an asset
Exposure in coding SQL and/or VBA is desired
Proven ability to work on multiple projects, multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Entrepreneurial spirit suited for fast-paced, results-based environment, requiring flexibility to ever-changing needs


GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

Toronto, ONPermanentWhat is the opportunity?

The Manager, AML FIU will lead by example, to deliver results through the combined efforts of the team and collaborative working with colleagues and external partners. You are the Subject Matter Expert (SME) on AML Investigations and works with the team members as a mentor; and a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on International Wealth Management, Securities, Broker Dealer – business experience. You will be responsible for implementation of the training into the Unit by mentoring staff and being the AML SME.

The Manager will conduct and complete risk based investigation into matters referred to the Unit, through the gathering, analysis and evaluation of relevant information in order to determine whether sufficient suspicion exists of money laundering, financing of terrorism or other criminal activities, to justify making a report to the Regulatory Authority for the purpose of complying with legislative/regulatory requirements, and mitigating risk to RBC in line with established organisational policy.

What will you do?
Act as SME to provide specialist advice, guidance and direction to team members on money laundering, financing of terrorism and related issues, seeking guidance and assistance when required from the Team Manager and other colleagues, to support the achievement of organisational objectives and regulatory requirements
Act as SME on reviews related to trading from an AML perspective
Collaborate with the Team Manager, the team of analysts to establish, develop and maintain links with internal/external stakeholders and other community contacts to support investigation requirements and the AML FIU
Assist the Team Manager with implementation of the training program into the team following training to ensure the understanding and processes are followed
Plan, conduct and complete risk based investigation into relevant matters referred to the Unit in line with approved processes,
Maintain accurate, contemporaneous records of all investigative actions and decisions taken, ensuring that all material and information obtained is treated in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements and RBC policy
Gather information/intelligence from all available sources, in order to determine whether sufficient suspicion of money laundering, financing of terrorism or other criminal activities exist, to justify making a report to the relevant Regulatory Authority for the purpose of complying with legislative/regulatory requirements, and mitigating risk to RBC in line with established organisational policy
Prepare relevant reports as required including documentation in support of any action proposed based on the results of investigations
Promote, support and adhere to RBC’s policies and guidelines on Code of Conduct, Personal and Professional Development, Equal Opportunities, Health and Safety, Data Protection and Information Security, in accordance with published Policy/Guidance documents and protocols
Work with the Global AML FIU Investigation Team and other FIU partners to ensure that investigations are conducted within defined timelines and are escalated in accordance with relevant policy

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
AML background in Canadian Banking
Strong leadership skills
Excellent communication skills, both oral & written, with good interpersonal skills in order to establish relationships across all levels of the enterprise
Undergraduate degree in Finance or equivalent
Ability to work well in a team setting

Nice-to-have:
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation
Canadian Securities Course (CSC)
Conducts and Practices Handbook (CPH)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

Mississauga, ONTemporaryJob Description

Title: Infrastructure Manager, Epic Implementations
Status: Temporary Full Time - Approx 18 months
Dept/Health System: Information Services
Posted: March 23, 2019
Internal Deadline: April 7, 2019
Trillium Health Partners (THP) is one of the largest community-based acute care facilities in Canada. Comprised of the Credit Valley Hospital, the Mississauga Hospital and the Queensway Health Centre, Trillium Health Partners serves the growing and diverse populations of Mississauga, West Toronto and surrounding communities and is a teaching hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto.
Our Mission: A New Kind of Health Care for a Healthier Community
When we set out to build our vision and future, we connected with our community - patients, families, visitors, physicians, staff and volunteers. The foundational goals of our new strategic plan - quality, access and sustainability - anchor everything we do. Our mission for a new kind of health care is built on an inter-connected system of care organized around patients - inside and outside the hospital.
At THP, we are relentless in providing high quality, compassionate care to our communities and take great pride in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment and we are all accountable for contributing to a healthy, safe and respectful environment for healing and promoting excellence in patient care though advancing patient and staff safety. If you are passionate about what you do, motivated to improve the health of the community, committed to excellence, quality and patient safety we would like you to join our Better Together team!
The Role

We are looking for an experienced leader with an extensive technology background to lead all technology infrastructure activities in THP’s HIS project. Reporting to the HIS Director of , Technology, the Manager will be part of the project leadership team and is accountable for ensuring all technology infrastructure requirements are fulfilled for the HIS project.

Technology subject matter scope includes: hardware (server, storage, network, data base ), operating systems and virtualization, application presentation and client devices, database administration, system hosting and disaster recovery and release management.
The manager will work with the HIS vendor, internal stakeholders and external vendors and contractors to develop the technology and project plan to fulfill the infrastructure requirements of the HIS project. The Manager will maintain scope, schedule and quality for the project plan while ensuring close alignment with Integrated HIS Project plan, working closely with the Project Control Officer, and will oversee an interdisciplinary project team of technology analysts who will execute all the activities identified in the implementation plan.
Responsibilities:
Developing the technology and project plan to fulfill the infrastructure requirements of the HIS project including their procurement, installation and configuration – as part of the overall Integrated HIS Project Plan.
Maintaining scope, schedule and quality for the project plan and oversee an interdisciplinary project team of integration analysts who will execute all the activities identified in the implementation plan.
Setting clear expectations for team members, including defining what they should do at each phase of the project.
Working closely with the Technology Project Director and Project Control Officer to coordinate activities.
Ensuring clinical and business stakeholders are engaged in the project.
Advising and coaching team members by providing guidance on project issues, key success factors of the project and lessons learned.
Organizing resources to complete project tasks on time and within budget.
Appropriately matching team member skills to team responsibilities.
Managing the project from an organizational perspective while attending to detailed tasks.
Identifying and troubleshooting issues as required.
Serving as a liaison between the HIS project team and Epic for all infrastructure activities.
Maintaining regular communication with Epic representatives including participating in project team meetings.
Reviewing the status of projects and issues on an ongoing basis with leadership and leads from other streams including Project Control Officer.
Holding weekly communications with team members to discuss the status of deliverables, shared issues, end-user concerns, budget and upcoming milestones.
Advising and coaching staff by providing guidance on project issues, key success factors of the project, and lessons learned.
Ensure the flow of information among staff regarding current priorities and project status.
Reinforcing the importance of the project together with the executives and the project executive and providing consistent communication to the project team.
Communicating with peers within the project and leaders in the hospitals.
Other duties as required.
Obtain training on the vendor application
Experience:
The successful candidate will have an extensive technology background and at least ten years of related information technology working experience and leading project teams. The candidate will have an expert understanding of hardware (server, storage, network), operating systems and virtualization, application presentation and client devices, database administration, system hosting and disaster recovery and release management tools and technologies.
You will have a proven track record for:

Leading infrastructure technology implementation projects.
Designing, building and implementing technology infrastructure solutions.
Managing and maintaining technical services.
Project management including building, maintaining and implementing project plans.

Key Criteria:

Ideal candidate should have completed a University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related degree or have equivalent work experience.
Technology certifications, for example MCSE, CISSP, ITIL, etc. are asset .
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with infrastructure hardware including server, storage systems and networking technologies is required.
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with Operating Systems (Windows and Linux), application virtualization presentation technologies (Citrix and VMWare) is required.
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with Operating Systems (Windows and Linux), Directory Services (MS Active Directory), application virtualization presentation technologies (Citrix and VMWare), and databases (MS SQL) is required.
Practical knowledge and experience with Information Technology Infrastructure Library standards, processes and techniques is required.
Possess knowledge of current electronic health record technology, health information systems and healthcare applications is an asset.
Demonstrated management with effective interpersonal and negotiations skills including written and verbal communications skills is required.
Demonstrated leadership skills with experience in building consensus are a must.
Demonstrated management in a complex environment with effective interpersonal and negotiations skills including outstanding written and verbal communications skills.
Able to work in a fast paced environment with quickly changing priorities to ensure superior customer satisfaction and business results.
Ability to travel to the United States is required
