About Project X
We work with clients to solve problems and gain insight through the use of data and analytics. Our clients give us their most challenging situations. No problem is too big or small for our team.
Every day at Project X is a call to address our clients challenges. That's the life of a team of trusted advisors creating data and analytics solutions for complex client problems. We do this through collaboration, creativity and an innate desire to solve tough data problems.
Data can be messy and problematic and our teams generally land somewhere in the middle of it. And that's where the passion comes in; to work at Project X you must share our obsession for the essence of data, to break through and make sense of it all, and of course add value at every stage of the process.
Data is our core DNA. What makes Project X unique is our custom methodology that delivers results rapidly and allows our teams creativity to solve the problems we're trusted to work on. This, paired with the fact that data runs deep in our veins and is what makes up who we are, individually and as a team, allows us to do the work we're passionate about. It is the foundation that translates into a common understanding, a way of being, that is apparent not just to us at Project X, but to our clients.
What we do
At Project X, we work side-by-side with our clients to create tailored solutions that meets their needs. From strategy through execution delivery, Project X works with it's clients to achieve results in a quick and cost-effective manner using our rapid results methodology. This approach defines our success and sets us apart.
Who we need
We need a Practice Manager who is well versed in the field of Data. Working with the organization, You will be instrumental in helping drive the strategy and execution of their practice. They will work with their team in implementing and carrying out innovative solutions as well as attaining the mission and the goals of Project X and their clients.
The Practice Manager also needs to be passionate about people, essentially a "champion of the people". They will be responsible for the development of an employee-oriented company culture that emphasizes on quality, continuous improvement, employee retention and development, and high performance.
As a Practice Manager, you will
Help team members with the successful delivery of their project by providing guidance and best practices that are available in the industry
Help project delivery team with planning and resourcing
Help the project team in de-escalations
Conduct regular monthly one-on-one meetings with individuals on your team and work with individuals on their professional development plan.
Establish performance expectations and address skill gaps and coach for performance improvements when required.
Address employees issues and concerns.
Empower employees to take responsibility for their jobs and goals
Maximize team performance through effective team building activities that increase productivity and job satisfaction.
Promote and exemplify the company's culture and our core values
Participate in resource forecasting and resource management with the management team for current and future engagements.
Assist in interviewing and selecting, onboarding, offboarding team members.
Participate in Trade specific activities for networking and Project X brand awareness
Be available for sales support as needed, review and approve approaches, proposal content and project plan as it relates to your practice and ensures contracts reflect your Practice's needs.
How do we Know its You:
You have a Degree/Diploma in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering, related topic or relevant work experience
You have 5-10 years of full project delivery of complex BI/DW projects as it relates to their specific practice and 1+ years of experience managing people.
You have excellent interpersonal relationship building and employee coaching and development skills
You have excellent organizational management as well as both written and verbal communication skills.
You have a broad knowledge and experience in functions, operation and mission of Data.
You have a proven ability to lead and develop personnel and practice and serve as a knowledgeable resource to direct reports and management team
You have general knowledge of employee relations basic economics, budgeting and accounting principles and practices
Experience in practising a high level of confidentiality
A consulting state-of-mind. You'll know if you have it. So will we. You coach our team on how to effectively work autonomously and away from headquarters for long periods of time. And still, find their way back "home" and into the comfortable, open and sharing mental and physical space of our office on a regular basis.
Specialized training in management and Sales support experience and Data specific certifications is an asset to have, not required.
Why join Project X?
Project X Ltd drives success by focusing on building teams of incredibly talented, fun, dedicated people.
At Project X, we work hard for our Clients but we also work hard to continue to be an employer of choice. We reward hard work and forward thinking with recognition, a fun company culture, opportunity to advance your career and a competitive salary.
We also offer other employment benefits like:
Health and dental benefits package
Gym membership discount
Casual dress code and working environment
Holiday parties and BBQs
Getting together for team socials and sporting events
While we often work onsite with our clients, we make sure we spend lots of time together to ensure everyone feels connected to the mission, company culture and is a valued member of the team.
If you believe in working collectively to raise the bar, we want to meet you. Express your interest here and follow us on Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn.
Project X welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Clinton, ONJob Type: Full-Time
Posting Date: February 14, 2019

Who We Are

Who We Are
Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley’s Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Why Work For Us

Gateway celebrates and empowers those employees who made it all possible. A career at Gateway means great people, a great atmosphere and career advancement opportunities across our locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs for all while working in an engaging and fun environment. Join us today!
The Position

Join our growing IT Team! The incumbent will be responsible for leading team(s) of technical specialists/analysts to provide support for all environments within the organization, including all facets of Data Center Operations, focusing on Data Centers, Servers, Backups and Networking components. The Manager will also be required to liaise with Ontario Lottery and Gaming (OLG), third-party vendor management and Disaster Recovery Planning (DRP)/ Business Continuity Planning (BCP). This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with multiple project/program stakeholders, including the Business Units, Project Managers, Solution Architects, Business Systems Analysts, Quality Assurance, IT infrastructure teams and third-party vendors.
Key Responsibilities

Architect, implement, and maintain network hardware and configurations
Deliver stable and responsive application, server, data storage, and backup services and software for the various datacenter environments
Take a lead role in ensuring the security and compliance requirements of networks and protected data
Lead Disaster Recovery initiative from an infrastructure perspective including documenting recovery procedures of all critical components
Collaborate with business leaders to design solutions that meet evolving company objectives
Evaluation of new technology and ongoing vendor management
Contribute significantly to capacity, scalability, and budget planning
Perform maintenance and upgrades during off-hours and provide 24 X 7 on-call network support
Drive the creation of an environment that fosters continuous improvement while following service management processes
Provide timely and expert advice on emerging trends and technologies impacting Network and Server Delivery and Support
Monitor, control and all Data Center, Server, and Network components; ensuring systems, methodologies and procedures are in place and followed
Champion Service and Support in projects and developing a strong understanding of projects impacting your service area and ensuring service impact is minimized and agreed to
Be accountable for the quality of Service and performance; ensuring future demand from growth and projects is understood and factored into capacity plans for all associated systems within the scope of this position
Act as the primary interface for Servers and Networking Services including:
Build and maintain relationships with business owners as well as IT leadership team members
Manage critical incidents – act as a lead member of the incident response team to gather key information from supporting sources on the call, effectively determine appropriate courses of action, and engage & escalate involvement of required resources (from Company, from the customer and/or from supporting vendors), to efficiently close the problem
Perform regular IT maintenance activities related to Data Centers, Servers and Networks.
Provide team feedback and develop action plans to remediate issues, identify processes and skills required for continuous improvements in knowledge
Manage projects and transitions when required
Support new initiatives, such as systems upgrades, refreshes and hardening changes
Ensure that the root causes of major incidents and problems related to the scope of responsibilities are being determined and report the status to Company management as well as the client counterparts
Identify potential areas for service improvement and present to IT Management Team
On-call may be required
What You’ll Require

Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Science or Engineering
Customer Service orientation with a strong bias toward action
5+ years’ experience in managing and leading a team of technical resources in support of networks and Data Centers
10+ years’ experience in a hands-on role supporting server class hardware and networks
Experience in DR runbook and execution in a mission-critical high availability environment
Experience in providing services to agreed SLAs and OLAs
Flexible in working outside of core business hours at short-notice
Good understanding of Microsoft and Linux technology stacks, including awareness of cloud computing architecture
Understanding of technical IT issues to enable discussions with internal and external technical specialists
Experience using Service/Incident Management Tools
Experience working with offshore teams
The ability to obtain a Category 1 registration with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
What Is Next
Love what you see so far? For the best chance to hear from us, apply within 7 days of the posting date.
Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!

Vancouver, BCMANAGER, ANALYTICS AND DATA SCIENCE

Our Business Intelligence and Analytics department integrates data and develops modern reporting solutions, provides advanced analytics and data science support to all business units across Aurora to generate insights and foster innovation.

As the Manager, Analytics and Data Science, you will work very closely with the business stakeholders such as Marketing, Sales, Operations, Finance, Research and Science etc. You possess well-blended interpersonal skills and technical skills. You have proven ability in leading the data scientist/analyst team whose members are in multiple cities to perform data mining, statistical and predictive analytics.

You will have excellent familiarity of advanced analytics process including identifying the business needs, gathering data from multiple sources, and deliver results. You will lead data science initiatives including machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will purposefully develop partnerships with vendors and universities. You will champion the best practice in data science and develop the center of excellence in analytics at Aurora. You will be a key contributor who enables Aurora to make strategic decisions with insights.

We are looking for a highly effective team leader who keeps the team focused and motivated to deliver on time. Apply if you love analytics, are flexible and self-driven, can work under pressure, and desire to develop a strong team in a new and fast-growing international business.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop, and maintain strong relationships and work closely with stakeholders to ensure business needs are addressed. Lead the team to identify business objectives, gather requirements from stakeholders, and translate requirements into user stories.
Lead the team to develop dashboards, reports. Extract and merge data from multiple data sources. Perform data cleansing, transformation, exploration, analysis and visualization.
Lead the team to support day-to-day requests for data analysis such as decision support and KPI’s. Use advanced techniques, conduct in-depth analytics for strategic initiatives as directed by the management.
Work side-by-side with the business stakeholders, iterate the analytical work in an agile fashion to deliver insights.
Develop the best practices for advanced analytics and data science.
Develop partnerships with vendors and universities to collaboratively working on data science initiatives.
Establish center of excellence in analytics at Aurora. Provide leadership to ensure consistency across all analyst teams.
Work closely with the Business Intelligence team in the Enterprise Data Warehouse development and enhancement.
Work closely with the Data Governance team in developing and rolling out the data management programs.
Lead the team to manage multiple project simultaneously while exhibiting professionalism to ensure an incredible stakeholder experience.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:
A university degree or diploma in Computing Science, Statistics, Mathematics or similar disciplines plus 8+ years of work experience in Analytics.
3+ years manager or team leader experience with people management skills.
Very strong experience in database systems including data warehouses and multi-dimensional analytic solutions. Very strong experience working with various data types.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft technologies including SQL Server, Power BI, Power Pivot and Azure environment. Excellent MS T-SQL skills to write complex queries.
Proficiency in Python or R.
Experience with Google Analytics, ArcGIS.
Strong Agile project experience with proven ability to prioritize and manage time.
Demonstrated success in people management and career progression.
Demonstrated success with strategic analytical projects, working with various stakeholders across the business areas.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure in fast-pace organizations.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Toronto, ONSenior Manager, Investment Data Warehouse
The opportunity
Do you want to be at the centre of what’s happening at Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan? The Data & Analytics group provides data services to all parts of the organization, and in this role you will be responsible for the management of our centralized data services, most notably our new Investment Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW). We are developing new approaches to deliver the ever growing needs for data, and the EDW is central to our strategy.
The operational health of systems is of upmost importance, and you will manage any outages to restore service, and implement approaches to provide improved services. Additionally, you will lead EDW change management for a diverse set of users do extend the service through the intake, triage and prioritization processes.
Who you'll work with
As a member of the Data & Analytics team, you will work with our partners for the daily delivery of data, as well as the implementation of changes. Our partners in business analysis, development, infrastructure, QA, and project management have dedicated resources to help us deliver data solutions to the valuations, risk, performance, compliance and investments groups.
What you'll do
Contribute to the development of the Data & Analytics’ strategy at Ontario Teachers’ in order to establish the program and deliver results.
Ensure that the EDW meets the needs of the Investment division’s applications.
Collaborate with data vendor management, data analysts, developers, and technology operations personnel to implement the strategies to improve content quality and support of the EDW.
Establish strong communication channels with our internal user groups that support the investment business operations and reporting, including the valuations, risk, performance, compliance and financial reporting groups.
Manage the intake, triage, and prioritization process to implement changes in the EDW.
Confer with internal service delivery partners and information technology partners to define the objectives, priorities, scope, milestones and resource requirements for improvements to the EDW.
Direct maintenance and improvement activities - striking a balance between enhancements and production support activities.
Manage service outage incidents for the EDW, gathering information from support groups during the service disruption, determining appropriate courses of action, engaging and escalating involvement of required resources.
Lead the investigation into issues raised through service disruptions, in order to determine lasting improvements of EDW.
Remain current as to business and technology developments and trends affecting enterprise data management in order to inform planning and facilitate the evaluation of solution benefits, costs and alternatives.
What you'll need
A minimum of 8 years’ experience in a financial service data management or information technology service delivery with firms that perform asset management, capital markets, or for technology vendors associated with these functions.
Deep understanding of solutions and technologies that enable the flow of capital markets data to support operations and decision-making.
Good understanding of technologies, techniques and tools relating to the analysis, design, development, testing, deployment and maintenance of technology solutions supporting enterprise data solutions.
University degree, Computer Science, BA, BSc, Business, or Economics.
Canadian Securities Course or demonstrated equivalent experience. Advance designations may be an asset, such as CFA, FRM.
Project management experience is an asset.
What we're offering
Pay for performance environment that offers competitive salary and incentives
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development
Comprehensive employer paid benefits coverage, including a Health Spending Account
Guaranteed retirement income through a defined benefit pension plan
Competitive time off
Discount programs including Edvantage and Perkopolis

Important messages
Although women make up 60 per cent of all graduates in Canada, they are still underrepresented in IT positions globally and seem to be declining – according to the Canadian Labour Force Survey, women represented almost 30 percent of the IT workforce in 2011, whereas they represented just slightly over 27 per cent in 2016.

The Government of Canada would like to help attract and develop women to grow their careers within the technology landscape, with jobs and opportunities for career advancement across a broad range of specializations, throughout Canada and internationally.
The Government of Canada offers meaningful and influential careers with opportunities to work on social, technological and economic topics that matter to Canadians. We also believe in continuous learning through onboarding, on-the-job training, coaching, mentoring, interdepartmental placements, and other opportunities. We offer a collaborative and horizontal work culture facilitated by the Government’s digital collaboration tools.

The technology industry needs more women – submit your application today!

Requisition ID: 54926
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Purpose:
The Senior Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining data management & governance framework, policy, standards, and procedures in order to effectively manage and govern data throughout data lifecycle. The scope of this role is across all business units and geographies. Through policy and standards, the Senior Manager will support the Director in driving delivery of full range of services required for data acquisition, storage, curation, consumption, and archival.
Effective communication and collaborative teamwork is a critical component of this role, especially with other stakeholders throughout the Bank, while not having established direct reporting relationships with them. E.g. the Senior Manager will work very closely with a variety of data system custodians, data operations leads, etc. The Senior Manager is responsible for clear communications regarding effective management and governance of data across data lifecycle, and will be responsible for assisting the Director in chairing and facilitating a Data Governance Working Group. In addition, when enterprise-wide decisions are required, the Senior Manager will support the Director to put forth recommended solutions to an Enterprise Data Council.
On a regular basis, the Senior Manager will ensure that maturity around data management and governance is measured and reported in a transparent manner in order to ensure all stakeholders are aware of gaps, priorities, and accountabilities for moving up the data maturity curve.
The Senior Manager’s knowledge of different aspects of data lifecycle, IT, and demonstrated strong communication skills will be key in influencing and ensuring standards for data are understood and enforced, both from a strategic and tactical focus. Proactive input will be required on CDO projects to ensure the planned approach meets governance standards and leads to accurate and consistent data. The Senior Manager will be required to maintain a strong network of data governance professionals both externally and internally to ensure data best practices are identified and implemented as much as possible thereby fostering a data-driven mindset in the organization.
Major Accountabilities:
Responsible for rolling out an enterprise-wide data management & governance framework, policy, standards, and procedures with a focus on effective management of data throughout its lifecycle, improvement of data quality, and the protection of sensitive data.
Responsible for data management & governance policy, standards, and procedures’ enforcement and compliance.
Define roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability. In addition, The Senior Manager will play a key role in guiding and influencing various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the enterprise-wide data management & governance framework.
Provide training and support regarding understanding and implementation of data governance & management policy, standards, and procedures.
Have oversight and ensure that standardized data governance “tools” covering data requirements documents, data lineage work flows, metadata forms, data models, etc. are used across the organization by all relevant stakeholders.
Roll out a data maturity model implementation along with metrics, methodology and reporting requirements. Create a roadmap and ensure progress along the data maturity curve.
Support ongoing and future Data Office projects by providing data governance subject matter expertise.
Education/Work Experience/Designations
This role requires an expert understanding of data governance leading practices. Any data governance or management certification would be an added advantage.
Demonstrated success in rolling out a data governance function in a data intensive front-line business unit.
Experience with some of the facets of data lifecycle including data governance, data architecture and modeling, data warehousing, metadata management, data quality, business intelligence, and analytics.
Experience in developing and implementing data standards, policies, practices, and procedures that leads to substantive improvements in data quality and security.
Proven ability to coordinate cross functional teams of IT professionals, business executives, and other key stakeholders towards common goals and objectives.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to identify, quantify, and effectively raise business risks associated with data.
The role requires an expertise in understanding the business uses of data and the linkage to the technical development, storage, and sourcing of the same data.
The role requires expert level influencing and inter-personal skills, and the ability to clearly communicate complex issues effectively to ensure key stakeholders understand all risks and priorities.
Experience in working with internal/external auditors and compliance professionals would be an added advantage.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

The design and delivery of our services and products reflect our deep understanding of commercial facilities, our focus on creating successful customers, and our respect for the environment.Position Summary: Reporting to the CFO, the role of the Master Data Manager is to be a subject matter expert in master data structure, design, governanace and use across the organization in order to help lead the growth and development of data strategy. job_title: EOP Manager, Transformation and Strategic Initiatives (Halifax)
job_description:
Halifax, NSPermanentWhat is the opportunity?

Enterprise Operations and Payments (EO&P) employs about 2,000 members across Canada, the US and around the world. This business is responsible for operating and expanding shared services related to Payments and Trade, Cash Processing, HR related services such as Payroll, Employee Benefits, Contract Workers administration and Finance shared services such as GL Reconciliations, Accounts Payable and report production. We are accountable for enhancing RBC’s industry leading position in processing vast array of cash management, payments and trade products for clients on a global basis.

As the EOP Manager, Transformation & Strategic Initiatives you will work on assigned strategic initiatives and transformational agenda as a key member in delivering RBC Enterprise Operations & Payments (EOP)’s strategy. With your expertise, you will contribute towards meeting the defined goals and objectives of assigned transformational initiatives, through the effective use of tools, techniques and methodologies. Along with your responsibilities, you will assist in the development of project plans and business partner deliverables on initiatives of varying size, complexity and type.

What will you do?

Manage the day-to-day execution in EOP’s multi-lever agile labs as assigned
Enhance EO&P's story telling ability to ultimately increase the visibility & profile organization wide while supporting the objectives of EOP’s 3 Year Transformation Roadmap
Engage in all elements of horizontal transformation and help utilize new strategies that promote efficiencies (ie Blockchain, Robotics, Machine Learning) – follow through to implementation
Provide portfolio oversight and program management of key strategic initiatives as assigned to accelerate operations and technology transformation
Support the enhanced EO&P Target Operating Model (TOM) aligned to our Technology & Operations (T&O) strategic priorities
Participate in research and implementation of industry and benchmarking best practices
Work with business partners & operations groups across RBC to leverage best practices, identify home of best fit, and expand EO&P shared services capabilities globally
Deliver ‘outside-in’ perspective, working within the complexities of day-to-day business functions to provide creative solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

2+ years’ experience applying leading practices in strategy development and execution
Education, Post secondary degree
Financial Institution knowledge & Project Management skills
Data Collection and Information Gathering
Business Communication and Influence
Financial Analysis / Preparing Business Cases

Nice-to-have:

Coaching and Peer Mentorship
Stakeholder and Relationship Management
Education – MBA
Accreditations: PMP, LSS

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Opportunities to build close internal relationships
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Learn more about RBC Tech Jobs

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.

Join our Talent Community
Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.
Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

Innisfil, ON$92,090 - $111,936 a yearAs part of our ‘One Town, One Team’ approach, InnServices Utilities Inc. is the exciting company created by the Town of Innisfil to deliver water and wastewater services to Innisfil and other municipalities.
A member of a collaborative and innovative team, you will work in an environment that focuses on service excellence and environmental stewardship. You will oversee the provincial regulatory obligations associated with Water and Wastewater, and be responsible for developing and tracking, organizing and monitoring the quality management data and compliance related matters. As well as the compliance of other Regulatory requirements as prescribed under the Conservation Authority Act, Drainage Act, Safe Drinking Water Act, Ontario Water Resources Act, Environment Act and the lake Simcoe Protection Act.
Responsible for performance metrics and benchmarking for Water and Wastewater, you will also assist with capital programs related to water efficiency and conservation measures, sanitary inflow and infiltration activities. In addition, you will develop, maintain and administer the Water Quality Management System and continuously improve upon a comprehensive quality and environmental management system to support and delivery of safe, reliable and cost-effective clean water services.
Job Requirements
We are seeking a dedicated and driven self-starter who thrives working in a collaborative environment, understand the merits of high safety standards, and has strong interpersonal skills. Your university degree in environmental engineering or certified engineering technologist with extensive direct experience in the water/wastewater environmental regulatory field, is accompanied by a minimum of five (5) years of related operational experience (water, wastewater, storm water, municipal drains) and two (2) – three (3) years managerial/supervisory experience in a unionized environment. The ideal candidate will hold or be capable of obtaining the Ministry of the Environment Certificate of Competency in Water Distribution and Supply, Class II and Wastewater Collection Class I and Wastewater Treatment Class II. A valid Class G driver’s licence is required, and ability to visit and access all water and wastewater facilities and equipment during inspections and audits. Closing date is April 7, 2019.

To apply to this position, submit your application online though our applicant tracking system at innisfil.ca. In the event you require an alternate method of submitting your application, please contact the Town’s People & Talent department by calling 705-436-3710.
We thank all applicants and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Personal information will be used to determine eligibility for potential employment and is pursuant to the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
Accommodations for persons with disabilities will be provided, on request, to support candidate participation in all aspects of the recruitment process. To request accommodation, please contact People & Talent.

MindGeek is the largest, privately held company in our industry developing unparalleled technologies for high traffic, high volume online properties. Our exceptional team consist of experts in every functional area of business and they are the key to our position as leaders in content delivery. We strive to innovate on a daily basis to ensure we continue to grow and create new revenue opportunities and cutting edge technology. If you are passionate about taking your career to the next level, then join the MindGeek team and be a part of something big.

The Product Manager – Data, Analytics and UX will work with business stakeholders to understand user behaviors, attitudes and experiences applying technical and analytical knowledge to transform these insights into actionable items that drive the business forward.

You are the ideal candidate if you are passionate improving user experience through a data-driven approach.

The role involves engaging with UX researchers, data scientists, product managers, sales teams and technology partners to leverage enterprise data and present clear, actionable recommendations/analyses.

Our team is fast-paced and focused, but we maintain a healthy work/life balance and have fun. We value integrity, flexibility, accountability, drive, and collaboration.

As the Data, Analytics and UX PM you will:

Work with product, UX and analytics teams to understand and identify user behaviors and the key metrics that will guide our product roadmaps.
Take ownership of internal testing and business intelligence tools and provide the vision for the roadmap for these tools
Build business cases to help drive portfolio decisions
Manage a team of analysts, researchers and data scientists
Seek to understand customer needs and market trends through experiments, customer interaction and other market research
Define, manage and monitor product and business KPIs, such as: revenue growth, cost savings, traffic growth, etc.
Work closely with team of analysts on delivering standard and advanced dashboards and reports

Proven track record of improving website performance and revenue based on data-driven strategy
Minimum 4 years' experience in product management or UX research
Highly motivated, self-starter, extremely curious about data and how it can help solve business problems
Experience working in JIRA
Strong experience with data extraction, manipulation and blending across different data sources (Google Analytics, MixPanel and proprietary tools).
Detail oriented with excellent organizational skills while managing multiple projects
Knowledge of the Internet landscape, including a comprehension of display advertising, consumer-facing websites, web traffic sources.
Experience working on large consumer-facing, ad-supported websites focused on audience engagement and growth.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.
Excellent Excel skills
Collaborates closely with all areas of the business (Product, Marketing, Sales and Editorial) to provide analysis, reporting and tool-building capabilities that inform our key stakeholders
Partners with product team to develop business cases to support new and existing product development, understands objectives and helps determine key performance indicators
Ensures data integrity across all performance-based metrics, tracking and reporting.
Previous involvement in the development of internal testing and analytics tools is an asset

Mississauga, ONClient Manager
Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference?
If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.
You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.
Want to be part of our team?
The Client Manager has account responsibility and their key focus is around analysing the client’s situation and business requirements through awareness, empathy and good questioning. They have the ability to influence clients to use Dimension Data’s solutions through articulating value in the client’s terms.
What you'll be doing
Primary Objectives
Take ownership of clients
They take ownership of a range of accounts within the domestic, mid-market or international market segments, by passionately advocating the client requirement, whilst keeping sight of the need to increase revenue and improve margins for Dimension Data. Ideally, Client Managers are vertically structured and their portfolio of accounts are in one or adjacent verticals.
Develop account strategy
These employees use their engagement skills to establish their account strategy with key stakeholders (focus of power, focus of receptivity, focus of dissatisfaction) in the specific account. They build enduring relationships and display an understanding of the client industry, business environment and strategy to identify current and future opportunities for Dimension Data.
Ensure client satisfaction
They drive passionately for client satisfaction throughout the entire lifecycle of the clients’ buying process, by taking ownership for the commercial agreement for each client. They aim to realise revenue and margin targets and exploit opportunities, whilst displaying notable client service orientation.
Generate demand from clients
They are able to generate demand by assisting clients to identify current needs (turning clients’ implied needs into explicit needs), and then effectively articulate how Dimension Data can add value through our services and solutions. They leverage their relationship skills and knowledge of the client environment to assist and influence the client at every stage of the buying cycle, and to position Dimension Data favourably compared to competitors. They have the ability to influence and work closely with vendors, partners and internal employees such as Project Managers and Service Delivery Mangers to achieve the required results.
Develop and grow profitability
The Client Manager approaches the management of his/her account in a systematic way by identifying and defining the strategy they will use to develop and grow the account profitably.
Vulnerability analysis
They do a vulnerability analysis of Dimension Data’s position in comparison to that of competitors and vendors, to ensure the client’s requirement is at the heart of our proposed solution. They understand the competitive environment and can effectively pursue and select specific deals that will have a profitable result for Dimension Data, by displaying knowledge of how the client’s opportunities aligns with Dimension Data’s strengths, the urgency drivers for the client and the client’s current relationship with Dimension Data.
Effective use of sales tools and methodologies
They use Dimension Data’s sales tools (e.g. Salesforce.com) and methodology to effectively manage their accounts, opportunities, pipelines and forecast.
Ensure governance
Client Managers develop and/or align governance and compliance policies in own practice area to identify and manage risk exposure liability. They assess, surface and mitigate buyer centric risks that could prove detrimental to the buyer’s credibility or could derail an initiative altogether.
Ensure financial compliance
These individuals monitor and control financial governance and compliance throughout an area of specialisation in order to manage financial cost. Client Managers identify who in Dimension Data holds budget authority and actively pursue opportunities to obtain access to the budget. They aim to realise revenue and margin targets and to maximise sales opportunities through connecting client needs with Dimension Data offerings and solutions.
Behavioural skills
As corporate citizens, Client Managers can work effectively in teams and manage their assigned work processes. They contribute ideas to the improvement of internal processes and continuously improve their own competence levels by displaying a learning orientation.
What would make you a good fit for this role?
Requirements: Education, Training and Experience
General Qualification in Sales (Degree / Advanced Diploma)
Experience
4 – 6 years’ work experience
At least 2 years’ work experience in a Sales environment
Personal Attributes and Skills Required
Skills and knowledge
Able to use Dimension Data’s sales tools and methodology to effectively manage accounts, opportunities, pipelines and forecast
Good client relationship building and engagement skills
Strong creative and innovative skills
Attributes
Able to work well in teams
Able to work independently
Display a learning orientation
Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today.

Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.

Marketing
Our Marketing Teams at Best Buy Canada are home to some of the most creative and strategic thinkers in the company. From graphic designers to writers, media analysts to the managers who bring it all together, Marketing is made up of diverse and talented people all committed to one goal: building lasting relationships with our customers. The Marketing Analytics team provides performance analysis, marketing insights & recommendations, data governance, subject-matter expertise, dashboards and reporting for Marketing stakeholders.
The Marketing Data Analytics Manager will help define strategy and manage budgets/resources within areas of responsibility to help achieve long-term organization objectives. This individual creates an environment of continuous improvement, accountability, and adaptability to meet changing business needs. The Marketing Data Analytics Manager is also passionate about data, tools, analytics and marketing and staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices.
As a Marketing Data Analytics Manager you will…
Help shape the marketing data and analytics vision and strategy while acting as the chief advocate and evangelist of data-based decision-making at all levels in Marketing
Partner with the Sr. Manager to define key customer KPIs used to measure customer value, retention and loyalty
Drive and execute Best Buy’s audience strategy for cross-channel marketing using customer databases, our data management platform (DMP) and other audience tools.
Partner with audience stakeholders to prioritize audience creation and optimization for personalization and loyalty initiatives
Liaise with IT/eComm on technology and data stack to support Marketing Analytics and work directly with our Data Engineering partners in Corporate IT, to represent Marketing’s needs as our enterprise data environment and analytic platforms evolve
Remain abreast of developments in technology, business and quantitative fields relevant to the company and helps drive business innovation through analytics
Lead an inclusive, high-performing, and fun team environment, which could include coaching and mentoring of marketing analysts while also participating in activities such as recruiting to build a rich pipeline of talent
We hope you are passionate about…
Collaboration – you partner well with both internal and external stakeholders and provide the best customer service in all scenarios
Logic and critical thinking – we’re largely a data driven company so consideration of all angles and viewpoints is vital
Developing others – you have a strong track record leading a team of high performance professionals
The experience we need…
7+ years of experience in Data & Analytics
7+ years of experience working in a fast-paced, results-oriented Agile environment along with familiarity with JIRA and Confluence
5+ years of experience working with Cloud technology, such as Azure and AWS
3+ years of experience in Management
Advanced proficiency with relational and non-relational databases
Equal familiarity with virtual machine/traditional database technologies such as Oracle and MySQL, as well as cloud-based technologies such as Azure and Google Cloud Platform
Strong programming skills in at least three scripting languages including but not limited to R, Python, and Scala to extract data from APIs, databases and RSS feeds
Experience completing (or working directly with analysts to complete) data-driven analyses to solve business problems and/or generate revenue within an organization
Business acumen which includes knowledge of Retail, Marketing, Analytics, Finance
Fundamental understanding of predictive modeling and statistical concepts to help with data science initiatives and the development of analytics and forecasting tools
University Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Bonus points…
Post-graduate degree in relevant field
We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology

Mississauga, ONHere’s what’s possible for H&M DEPARTMENT MANAGERS:

Department Managers are responsible for a lot of things here at H&M. From typical managerial things such as sales maximization, customer service and department profitability to coaching teams within a department. And they’re tasked to do it all according to H&M values, standards, policies and procedures. H&M culture, really. But most importantly, we ask our Department Managers to develop their teams. Think of this role as a manager-slash-mentor. Or mentor-slash-manager. Whichever you prefer. Just know that the only way we can become a better company is when we have talented people help unlock what’s possible for everyone around them.


Title: Department Manager

Function: Sales

Department: Store

Reports to: Store Manager

Direct Reports: Department Supervisor, Sales Advisor(s)

Overall Job Function: Responsible for sales, customer service and profitability of a department. Manages a team within a department according to H&M values, standards,policies and procedures and is responsible for all people evelopment functions.

Job Responsibility including but not limited to:

People:

Organize and distribute the work of his/her staff, set priorities and keep an overview of the tasks to be accomplished in accordance with the Store Manager

Manage, recruit, onboard, train, develop and provide succession planning for the staff in the store in partnership with the Store Manager

Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws including approving time-off requests, pay, location or title changes; corrective actions and making employment decisions

Assist the Store Manager in maintaining an overview of all Employee Relations responsibilities in the store to ensure a positive work environment

Commerciality:

Take action within department to maximize sales through joint operational and commercial focus to obtain highest level of profitability

Proactively ensure your team has knowledge on all product, campaign, promotion, display guidelines and merchandise information

Ensure garment presentation, garment level and visual standards within the department are presented according to H&M’s expectations

Plan and coordinate with the visual team on all activities concerning campaigns, promotions and sales activities in his/her department

Operations:

Effectively schedule the staff within the department according to the needs and restrictions of the business and adjust hours as necessary to reach store and SPH goals

Work with sales and cost plans, budgets and other available tools to make business decisions to ensure maximum profitability

Responsible for knowledge and completion of cash office operational functions

Follow and execute safety and security routines to prevent loss and guarantee employee and customer safety

May be assigned overall store responsibility in absence of Store Manager

Customer Service:

Maintain high-quality H&M direct and indirect customer service by providing the best shopping experience for each customer and role modeling the 5 basic demands on the selling floor, in the fitting room and at the cash point

Financial Accountability:

Assist Store Manager in establishing and overseeing sales and cost plans, budgets and variable costs for department; work with comparable sales from last year, sales to budget and future sales trends to maximize profitability

Accurately record sales and worked hour figures

Minimum Candidate Qualifications:

High School graduate or equivalent. Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree preferred

Preferably 2-3 years of retail management experience, including direct supervisory experience, or comparable management role experience

Ability to lift in excess of 20 pounds

Ability to stand for long periods of time; bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push; pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance

Ability to climb a ladder and use a stepstool

Competencies:

Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills

Proven organizational and analytical skills

Ability to be proactive to drive sales by creating selling opportunities

Strong merchandising skills with the ability to drive the business through creativity and extensive fashion knowledge

Ability to take own initiative and work under own direction

Ability to work strategically, tactically and operationally

Able to multi-task in a fast paced environment

Ability to establish effective routines for excellent communication with all members of the team to maximize productivity

Ability to provide feedback in a constructive and professional way

Ability to handle conflict and resolve problems constructively

Experience in administrating progressive discipline process and performance management

Basic computer skills, such as browser navigation, software interaction and data entry are needed

Open availability including evenings and weekends

Minimal travel required as necessary (i.e.Workshops)

Job Status: Non-Exempt, Hourly

Accommodation:

H&M will accommodate disabilities during the recruitment and selection process.

If a job applicant requests accommodation from H&M, H&M will consult with the job applicant and make adjustments that best suit their needs.

Successful job applicants of H&M will be notified of our policies for accommodating employees with disabilities

At AstraZeneca, we are united by a common purpose – to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. This purpose underpins everything we do; our work helps to make hearts healthier, to help people breathe easier, and to help more people survive cancer. Every single day, we make a difference by delivering potentially life-changing medicines to millions of people worldwide and by leading breakthrough science that promises to transform the treatment of disease.
Our purpose is bold and so is our approach. Becoming a more agile and innovative company means building a dynamic, inspiring culture where we celebrate entrepreneurial thinking and act with a sense of urgency. We are courageous, taking risks and learning from both success and failure. We are curious, creative, and open to new ideas and ways of working. Above all, we are passionate about science and driven to always put patients first. Join us and be part of a great place to work; an environment that energizes and empowers each of us to achieve our goal to develop and deliver medicines.
Position Title: Insights Manager
Position Type: Regular Full-Time
Location: Mississauga, Head Office
Career Level: D
At Astra Zeneca, our Insights Managers are driven by their curiosity and their ability to shape strategy. We have fostered a culture of trust and engagement. As the Insights Manager, you provide an unbiased voice of the customer as it pertains to brands, competitors, changing landscape and customers (patients, physicians, pharmacists, nurses and other HCP’s) needs and wants. Your outputs are critical for downstream commercial planning and help manage risk for the brand and the organization. You are the expert in brand competitive intelligence. You surprise and delight your internal customers by either figuring out answers to questions before they surface or finding new ways for insight generation. You are also critical partners in building the Market Insights function.
Responsibilities:
Extract and generate insights through primary and secondary research leading to: strategic planning, brand planning, life cycle management (pre NOC to LOE)
Develop and manage a strategic research plan to solve for current and future insight gaps.
Ensure a collaborative process between research partners and business partners.
Develop and report on, business drivers and KPI’s, assess/highlight risks and opportunities, perform monthly brand reports.
Collaborate with cross-functional clients to provide ongoing consultation and direction on complex issues.
Key tasks:
Work with suppliers to deliver excellence in market research
Ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget; must manage the budget assigned to each brand’s research plan.
Translate insights from primary and secondary data sources into meaningful business applications and implications on strategy and tactics
Conduct periodic situation analyses in preparation for strategic brand planning.
Publish monthly brand reports to track performance metrics (KPIs)
Conduct ad hoc analyses utilizing primary and secondary data; must be able to draw necessary information from internal data warehouse.
Set agenda for team meetings (rotating schedule)
Work collaboratively with the brand team to move forward the commercial agenda; utilize cross-functional experience and savviness
Minimum Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in business and/or science. Post graduate degree preferable.
Good understanding and prior experience with primary market research methodologies (qualitative & quantitative)
Naturally curious and self-starter; drive and passion for market research
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills
Ability to extract big picture from details
Excellent Microsoft office skills (Excel and PowerPoint)
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work and influence in an dynamic environment
Highly motivated with extreme attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple projects/requests at the same time
Bilingual and asset (French/English)
Only candidates meeting requirements will be interviewed
Next steps – Apply today
To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience – it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager will know that you feel well qualified for this position. If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this posting with them.

Toronto, ONTenzing Job Profile: Manager, Database Administration

Introduction

According to eMarketer, eCommerce is the only trillion-dollar industry experiencing double-digit year-over-year growth. In 2012, global eCommerce sales topped a trillion dollars for the first time ($1.1 trillion). If estimates are accurate by 2018 eCommerce will grow to $2.49 trillion. These figures alone are compelling, however coupled with the US Census Bureau’s estimate that only 7% of retail sales are currently done online leads us to believe that the eCommerce industry will be a dynamic, lucrative market for many years to come.

Tenzing Managed IT Services is a privately-held, managed hosting company founded in 1998. Tenzing specializes in hosting comprehensive enterprise-class eCommerce, software-as-a-service, and other enterprise Web applications. The Company’s key differentiators include its expertise and focus around managed services supporting leading eCommerce software platforms such as Oracle Commerce, Intershop, Hybris, Magento, and Websphere. Based on Tenzing’s experience hosting multiple eCommerce customers and in collaboration with SI partners, Tenzing has developed a set of reference architectures to standardize configurations which now also leverages asset-free deployments including Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Tenzing is capitalizing on two major market trends that are starting to intersect which is the growth in enterprise eCommerce/merchant applications and the growth in public cloud platform consumption. In the past 18 months Tenzing has been winning extensively with US merchants and 2015 represented a pivotal year smashing previous “new contract sales” records in the company with the majority of them on strategy. Tenzing has progressively moved away from generalist managed service offerings and this role will be challenged to help shape a scalable infrastructure organization to sustain the accelerated growth.

Position Summary

Tenzing’s IT team is searching for a DBA Manager who is highly motivated, collaborative with an entrepreneurial spirit. You will be a key member of our operational team, making important technical decisions that will shape the company's future and importantly, the service satisfaction of our customers. You will oversee all aspects of our on-prem and cloud-based infrastructure. You will join a skilled and motivated operational organization helping to build the future mode of operations for Tenzing.

Responsibilities Include:

Provide leadership to the DBA team in managing scope, issue resolution, project priorities, support & operations to the business
Facilitate agile teams’ delivery with high degree of focus on quality & timeliness
Coordinate the installation, upgrading and patching of Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) systems. Oversee database monitoring, tuning and optimization
Capacity planning for all database environments. Control user database access and data security
Work with application and system architects and subject matter experts to and design the corresponding physical database structure while and ensures standard control procedures are followed.
Manage overall delivery & support process across multiple initiatives to ensure sustainable DBA practice which includes automation, process documentation, production support, optimization & monitoring
Provide leadership in developing database standards and procedures. Establish benchmark criteria for evaluating alternate database products. Function as technical liaison for database-related project activities; provide on-call support
Assist in the implementation/upgrades/enhancements, testing, and installation of technology solutions.
Assist development teams in troubleshooting and stabilizing production issues
Ensures all recommended and implemented solutions are consistent with IT guidelines, procedures, Strategic Plan, goals, and objectives.
Ensure consistent database back-up/recovery; perform fault analysis and resolution; monitor and manage database backups, logs, and maintenance
Maintain data integrity and environmental security to improve information privacy, data protection, and compliance with regulations, audits, and business requirements
Develop and implement backup/recovery and purge/archive strategies

Candidate Profile

Qualifications/Skills:

Exceptional customer relationship skills and experience of managing vendors
Minimum five (5) years database administration experience with substantial RDBMS implementations required
3+ years’ experience in a leadership role required
Ability to plan, design & implement strategies for databases technologies
Knowledge of and experience with both SQL Server and Oracle.
Experience in managing AWS and other cloud database environments
Experience in security regulations as it pertains to DB configurations - PCI, GDPR etc
Excellent communication skills both oral and written; organizational skills and analytical skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced and demanding environment; multitask and prioritize
Ability to operate in a high transaction environment supporting 24/7 teams and customers
Ability to organize, prioritize, and coordinate multiple work activities and meet critical deadlines
Strong technical and leadership skills and ability to lead others in the development and adherence of best practices
Ability to interact with many projects and project reviews and gauge the level of interaction required
Excellent problem-solving skills with strong analytical ability and creative troubleshooting
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Must be a team player with strong attention to detail and able to work independently
Proven track record at delivering timely and accurate information in a fast-paced environment
Excellent critical thinking, problem solving and sound judgment
Working knowledge of Scrum/Lean and Agile, Scrum certifications desired
Other traits we look for :
A professionally adaptable attitude
A positive, people-oriented and energetic attitude
An analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
An interest in working hard/being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and having fun while doing it
Must like good beer

Search Committee
Michael Knox, Director, Service Delivery
Ira or Corinne

Toronto, ONLegalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

The mission of our digital team is to create the best digital cannabis properties in the world. And it all starts with content. The Manager, Content Strategy, will lead build content strategies across our recreational, medical, and CBD brands and manage a team of social and email specialists to execute with excellence.

This role is a member of the Digital Leadership Team within Canopy Growth. As a central service, it supports our core and partner brands across both the Recreational and Medical markets.

Responsibilities

Develop and optimize content strategies for our recreational, medical and CBD brands working in collaboration with cross-functional teams and partners
Manage a team of social and email specialists developing and producing high quality content at scale across a range of brands
Manage content operations, including developing new processes and workflows to increase efficiency and driving quality standards
Measure the effectiveness of all content across channels to develop actionable insights to inform our go-forward strategy
Develop and scope team projects that map to critical business goals
Scale best practices in content creation, including setting quality standards, implementing reviews and making process improvements
Make data-driven decisions to plan, optimize and manage our content generation. This includes blog posts, videos, podcasts, and more.
Track and grow our organic content reach, through optimization, outreach, community engagement marketing.
Oversee content budget, partner relationships and reporting
Other duties as assigned

Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field
5+ years’ experience in marketing, product marketing or related field
Demonstrated tactical proficiency in developing content strategies, including content direction, content scheduling, ongoing tracking and reporting on results.
Proven ability to lead a team and oversee multiple projects simultaneously.
Clear understanding of the content and social marketing landscape and best practices.
Able to perform well under pressure and be a team player.
Strong understanding of paid media planning, industry benchmarks and best-in-class strategies.
Keen interest in measuring ROI of social media programs relative to other media alternatives.
Excellent oral and written communications skills

Other Details

This is a full time position based out of either Kanata or Toronto.

We appreciate the interest from all candidates, and promise to review all applications, but we will only be contacting those who best fit the requirements. If you don’t hear from us, don’t fret; every resume we get is kept in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

One last note: the chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

Thank you so much for your interest in Canopy Growth.

job_title: Full-time opportunities for students & recent graduates: Sales
job_description:
CanadaWe live in a mobile-first, cloud-first world, and the transformation we are driving across our businesses enables our customers to thrive in the digital world. Our sales professionals are the essential link between the potential of what's possible and build trusted advisor relationships with customers and technology vendors.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job. Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available sales roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered as a student or recent graduate, you should be within 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 12 months.

Technology Solution Professional
Technology Solution Professional (TSPs) drive the technical motions within sales driving specific solution area revenue and market share. Based on the tremendous opportunity of digital transformation across every individual and organization, we focus our broad portfolio of assets and go-to-market efforts across four key solution areas: Modern Workplace, Business Applications, Apps & Infrastructure, and Data & AI.

Customer Success Manager
Customer Success Mangers (CSMs) focus on enabling our clients' vision for driving digital transformation within Microsoft solution areas. CSMs are our customer's success advocate as they deploy, use, adopt and consume our technology.
CSMs are core to our long-term strategic success and by driving usage of cloud services and increasing accounts while broadening the surface area of potential with our accounts.

Account Executive
As an Account executive, you are the main connection point between Microsoft and our customers., You provide strategic business leadership partnering with leaders in your customers' organizations to align their business transformation agenda with digital solutions that can help them better engage customers, optimize operations, transform products and shift their business models. Account Executive roles are an incredible opportunity to learn, experience and ultimately drive all aspects of the client relationship, sales pursuit, and customer success lifecycles

Account Technology Strategist
The Account Technology Strategist (ATSs) are our enterprise customer's chief architects. Acting as a chief architect offers a high profile, customer-facing role that is the primary technical face and orchestration point for enterprise customers. Successful ATS' have a strong, proven IT background and demonstrated knowledge with a broad range of Microsoft solutions and technologies.
As an ATS you must relish the opportunity to build and maintain trusted advisor relationships with technical leads at some of America's largest organizations including CIOs, CTOs, Enterprise Architects

Licensing Sales Specialist
As a Licensing Sales Specialist (LSS), you provide licensing solutions to your customers with a focus on Microsoft volume licensing programs. You work closely with multiple sales disciplines including Account Executives, Business Development, Buy and Legal service desks. Outside of Microsoft you will build and maintain relationships across customers' purchasing, business sponsors and technical lead to provide modern and robust licensing solutions.

Sales Operations Program Manager
You will be at the business center of excellence for cross-business execution performance, planning, and Subsidiary operations. The team helps scale execution, drives clear business & market insights that result in Microsoft achieving its business objectives.

Solution Sales Professional
As a Solutions Sales Professional (SSP), you will identify our customers’ pain points and solve them through the latest software and services solutions. You will be our customers’ trusted consultant, thoroughly evaluating the health of their IT platforms and development environments and diagnosing areas for improvement. Your solutions drive measurable value, helping customers run their businesses more cost-effectively and efficiently and giving them a competitive edge in their marketplace—be it business, government, or academics.
Responsibilities
Technology Solution Professional
As a TSP, you work alongside Business Development and Solutions Architect teams who source, generate and qualify opportunities within the sales lifecycle. TSPs enable, manage, and implement, cutting edge and legacy technologies in large enterprises.

Customer Success Manager
CSMs manage migration of America's largest enterprises to adopt, deploy and execute their business objectives using Microsoft technologies. Successful CSMs uncover the true essence of problems and come up with insightful solutions appreciative of the way a customer views both their business and processes

Account Executive
Day-to-day you'll build and maintain key account relationships while driving a two-side business plan with your customers across Technical and Business agendas, respectively. To drive your customers' digital transformation, you will need to become an expert on their respective industry and talk their language. Your customers will call on you to connect them to the full breadth of Microsoft's assets including supporting sales disciplines, consulting, support, product groups, and executives to advance their digital transformation agenda.

Account Technology Strategist
You will be responsible for developing the account technology vision and strategy to support the overall business objectives for Microsoft and customers. The ATS works closely with the Account Executive, Customer Support, Technical Sales, and Business Development sales disciplines to ensure all new sales are well scoped to achieve sustainable business results.
ATS' champion their customer success across varying Microsoft solutions, technologies, and channel partners often within multiple accounts. The role includes coordinating and guiding both the customer and Microsoft enterprise account teams on all technical domains.

Licensing Sales Specialist
Your role will include negotiating agreement terms and conditions, being the single point of contact for internal and external sales contracts and licensing issues, while supporting developing pricing scenarios and cost/benefit analyses. Successful LSS' deliver customer-centric licensing that ultimately reduce the complexity of doing business with Microsoft while fueling their ability to execute on their digital transformation agenda.

Sales Operations Program Manager
The Sales Operations Program Manager role will responsible for developing highly scaled and efficient operational services, driving standardized sales operations & processes, Building and executing standardized tools and reporting and accelerating the landing of Global Sales transformation efforts

Solution Sales Professional
You will build and maintain relationships with executive business and technical decision makers, be able to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft’s solutions, and develop a firm understanding of Microsoft’s strategies and product offerings relative to our major competitors.
Qualifications
A bachelor’s or master’s in in business, communications or related fields (within 12 months of graduation).
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and superior customer-service oriented skills desired.
Practical sales experience preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
