job_title: Senior Manager, Business Risk & Data Governance
job_description:
Toronto, ONPermanentWhat is the opportunity?
The Business Risk & Data Governance (BRDG) Senior Manager, will assist the VP of BRDG in managing WM Business Risk & Data Governance, Wealth Management, by providing strategic/operational support & partnering with other BRDG leaders. The incumbent will support with the execution as required for; Operational Risk, Supplier Risk & Business Reporting, IT Risk & Business Continuity Management teams and Data Governance under the BRDG operating model.

What will you do?

Provide risk management leadership; including expertise, advice and counsel to senior management and WM colleagues, enhancing the WM platform’s ability to anticipate and manage business risks effectively
Develop and drive solutions to platform challenges by way of sponsorship, leadership and execution of critical risk projects
Act as a risk translator and main point of contact for overall BRDG initiatives
Lead cross-team initiatives as requested by the VP of BRDG, support BRDG leaders in transformative initiatives & execution of action plans for critical risks.
Analyze control environment of Global WM businesses, processes and products to identify gaps and recommend control enhancements to improve the environment
Prepare Executive level presentations as required, review and ensure that presentations/reporting are consistent and aligned with strategy
Proactively support the strategic and tactical design of Business Risk and Governance programs executed in WM including event data collection, key risk indicators, risk reporting & risk control identification and assessment
Assist in the compilation of required audit and regulatory documentation, as appropriate
Maintain critical linkages with Centers of Governance, 2nd line of defense operational & enterprise Risk (GRM/TPR) as required.
Ensure BRDG compliance status is understood and in good order across Wealth Management business units

What do you need to succeed?
Must Have:
10+ years progressive business experience, risk mitigation experience, either operational or project-related
Excellent ability to “connect the dots”
Excellent corporate communication skills, with experience preparing Executive presentations and presenting to senior management
Proven track record in leading initiatives, adhoc projects and past performances
Strong self-awareness/interpersonal skills and networking capabilities with various internal audiences within the organization

Nice to Have:
Previous experience in the financial sector, particularly Wealth Management or Global Asset Management
Experience working with business and/or technology stakeholders in an Enterprise environment
Experience in mining and analysis of data and databases as well as the development/production of reports, including advanced MS Excel
Relationship Building; Building Partnerships with Stakeholders
Client-focused and process-driven, ability to build loyalty and trust by proactively anticipating needs/resolving issues

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. Greater Toronto Area, ON$60,000 - $100,000 a yearPartner Success Manager
GoFor is revolutionizing the construction industry. As a Partner Success Manager you will be responsible for building and managing our merchant partner network within your local market. You have a strong understanding of the retail and wholesale (trade) construction industry in your market and you know the value of reliable, cost effective movement of materials to and from the job site.

Due to our continued rapid expansion, we have a need for performance based Partner Success Managers in the GTA region. You will target, approach and on-board merchants to the GoFor marketplace and once a relationship is secured you will nurture the partnership with on-going training, promotion and merchandising efforts. The role is compensated through performance based commission for newly acquired partners and recurring revenue every time a newly acquired customer uses the GoFor marketplace to execute a delivery.

GoFor Partner Success Managers are responsible for:

Identifying new opportunities with guidance and assistance from our marketing team
Setting meetings with suppliers and distributors of building materials.
Setting meetings with construction companies, home builders, renovators,
Registering new customers on the GoFor online marketplace and demonstrating how to use it.
Train and manage all new partners to get them using the GoFor delivery service as well as increasing that frequency of use.
Enter all sales data into our CRM and keep it up to date on a daily basis.
To qualify you must:

Have 3 years relevant sales experience within the construction and/or logistics industry.
Live by the 10x philosophy and apply it to building your designated region business.
Be professional and represent the company in the best possible manner at all times.
Be articulate and proficient in the English language, both written and spoken.
Have your own laptop or tablet with ability to connect to the internet.
Own your vehicle
Having existing relationships with building suppliers, distributors and/or construction companies will be an advantage.

The right candidate will have the chance to become a full-time employee after a year of success as well as the ability to grow in one of North America's newest and highest potential startups. Stock options and bonuses will also be available to the right candidate.

Candidates must submit a cover letter detailing why they are ideal for this role. We will require a resume detailing your sales experience.

Job Types: Commission

Kingston, ON$100,000 - $115,000 a yearSalary: $100,000 to $115,000 per year
Benefits: Extended health and dental insurance package offered.
Position Summary

Reporting to the General Manager, the Production Manager directs and controls the plant’s production and packaging operations. During the commissioning of the new facility, the Production Manager will interact frequently with the equipment installation team as well as head office in Beijing.
The Manager is the Subject Matter Expert in all areas related to the production processes and associated equipment. They work cooperatively with Engineering, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain, Human Resources and EHS to accomplish the goals and objectives of the company. They will work closely with the Management team to ensure the successful launch of new product within the established timelines.
The Production Manager is dedicated to producing the highest quality product and creates an environment where employees take pride in their work. They emphasize food quality, safety and security, complying with all government legislation and the expectations of Canada Royal Milk’s customers.
An experienced leader, the Manager will be responsible for hiring and building an effective production team. With support and coordination from HR, the Manager will oversee the training and development of all plant production personnel, including coaching and mentoring.
Working Conditions
The standard office hours are Monday through Friday, 8:30 am to 5:30 pm. Most of the work occurs during regular week day office hours. However, as an international company with frequent interaction with head office, hours of work involved may vary to accommodate differences in time zones. Flexible hours are required and may include evening and week-end hours.
During the commissioning phase, the incumbent is required to work closely with the equipment installation and other trades on the construction site. This involves exposure to inclement weather, hazards associated with a construction site and frequent standing, walking and bending. Health and safety training are required, and Personal Protective Equipment is provided.
DutiesPlan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the operations of a manufacturing establishment or the operations or production department of a manufacturing establishmentPlan, organize, direct, control and evaluate plant production while continually striving for improvements to increase efficiencyDevelop and implement plans to efficiently use materials, labour and equipment to meet production targetsPlan and manage the establishment of departmental budgetHire, supervise and train or oversee training of employees in the use of new equipment or production techniquesParticipate in the oversight and inspection of manufacturing equipment installation and testing, ensuring safety and compliance at every stageAssist in the review and approval of contractor plans, including goals and objectives, work breakdown structure, detailed scope descriptions, detailed schedules, risk management approach, milestone descriptions, budgets and staffing requirementsPlan and manage the establishment of departmental budgetDevelop production schedules and maintain an inventory of raw materials and finished productsReview processing schedules or production orders to make decisions concerning inventory requirements, staffing requirements, work procedures, or duty assignments, considering budgetary limitations and time constraints.Review operations and confer with technical or administrative staff to resolve production or processing problems.Develop or implement production tracking or quality control systems, analyzing production, quality control, maintenance, or other operational reports, to detect production problems.Include staff in planning decision-making facilitating and process improvement.Makes oneself available to staff provides regular performance feedback develops subordinates' skills and encourages growthOther duties may be assigned.
Job Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s degree or above in a related field of study
Experience: 7-10 years progressively responsible experience in dairy product manufacturing and a minimum of seven (7) years supervisory experience in manufacturing.
Strong preference for candidates with experience manufacturing powdered milk products or powdered infant formula.
Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesSuperb interpersonal skills, a professional, collaborative attitude and sound judgmentIn depth understanding of production planning processUnderstanding of Infant Nutrition and manufacture of Infant FormulaKnowledge of applicable Canadian and Chinese legislationMastery of Good Manufacturing Practices including quality and food safety management systems, resource management, planning and production process, food defense, and measurements, analysis, improvements.Teamwork; member of multidisciplinary task forcesKnowledge of micro-computing and data management: Industrial control software; Data base user interface and query software; Enterprise resource planning ERP softwareUnderstanding of equipment operations with troubleshooting ability to assist maintenance, engineering and other technicians
Other Skills and AbilitiesProficient in Microsoft Office Suite applicationsExperience with implementing an ERP system an assetExperience manufacturing infant formula powder an asset

Job Description

As User Acquisition Manager, you will focus on marketing actions to drive customer acquisition for Gameloft games. You will be responsible for advertising on performance UA channels and optimizing to reach the target return on investment.
Job Description
You responsibilities include:
Plan, execute, and analyze user acquisition campaigns across performance UA channels
Optimize campaigns based on ROAS and LTV
Discuss with game teams about the results and planned actions
Communicate clearly to management the plans, status, challenges to meeting objectives

Qualifications

To qualify for this position, you must have:
Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science/ Bachelor of Commerce or equivalent
A first experience in managing marketing or UA campaigns, preferably in games or mobile
Passionate about gaming and media
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills required, conflict resolution skills a plus
Ability to work effectively and accurately under pressure
Detail-oriented, organized, and highly-motivated
Data analysis experience using Excel or similar tools
Additional Information

Why Join the World of Gameloft?Because you want to take part in the rise of a dynamic, stimulating, and captivating sector!Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience, within a company that is constantly growing!Because you want to work within a team made up of people motivated by, and passionate about, their field!Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!Because you love the idea of expanding your horizons within a cosmopolitan corporate culture and sharing your know-how with colleagues at the other end of the Earth!Because you want to work with renowned partners and clients such as Apple, Google, Nintendo, Disney, Marvel, and many others!Because you want to push technology to its limits – to succeed at creating console-quality games for mobile phones!Because you’re in search of great working conditions and benefits, all within a modern, friendly space!Or just because you’re looking for a great place to work!
We can’t wait to find our next great talent!
Only selected candidates will be contacted, and your CV will be saved in our files for 6 months.
Gameloft Toronto is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering diversity and inclusivity within our work environment. Gameloft Toronto welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Corporate Overview: Citron Hygiene is a leading provider of support services for commercial and industrial facilities. We provide washroom care, pest control, chemical, ware-washing and life safety services and products that help building owners and managers address their facility’s needs. Combining service excellence and innovation we help customers deliver award winning building environments to their employees, customers, and guests. The design and delivery of our services and products reflect our deep understanding of commercial facilities, our focus on creating successful customers, and our respect for the environment.Position Summary: Reporting to the CFO, the role of the Master Data Manager is to be a subject matter expert in master data structure, design, governanace and use across the organization in order to help lead the growth and development of data strategy. The Master Data Manager will work closely with teams across the business to support the creation and ongoing maintenance of high quality item data and ensure master data processes and guidelines are enforced. This role will also be responsible for the maintenance and formal processes for ensuring the integrity of our customer-related data. In addition, this role will help lead data migration of legacy master data from acquired companies.Duties and Responsibilities: Under the supervision of the CFO, the duties and responsibilities of the Master Data Manager include, but are not limited to, the following:Formalize the various processes to maintain Citron’s customer account details within SalesforceWork alongside Citron’s customer success team and other relevant teams to ensure accuracy and timely execution of all requests received for the creation and changes to customer accounts Understand and communicate master data updates (e.g., maintenance, introduction of new fields, modification in attribute definition etc.) that impact downstream systems / teamsProactively and consistently communicate with business areas to notify them of maintenance activities that may impact their areaTo support the maintenance of high-quality data, proactively monitor data accuracy and facilitate required data corrective actions with business ownersMaintain clear communication and positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholdersAd-hoc data cleansing as required (e.g., at the end of a season) to ensure data quality is upheld on an ongoing basisSupport and enforce established data standards and guidelines related to master dataServe as the subject matter expert and central resource to train business owners in master data creation/maintenance and/or the use of supporting tools.Lead the company’s data migration of legacy master data from acquired companies (M&A) into Citron’s systems.Other: Other duties as assigned.Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and business-related work experience totaling 8+ yearsExperience maintaining master data, OR, a process changeAbility to train on the appropriate use of master data systemsStrong analytical and systems thinking skillsjAbility to work independently and proactivelyMust be detail oriented and highly organizedAbility to work based upon specific timelines and dependenciesWorking Conditions: Work normal business hours but may be required to do some work in the evenings or outside normal Not particularly in that order, but if you’ve got these things, we want to talk with you. Our unique environment thrives on open communication, so we can work hard and play harder. In the past five years, we have grown tremendously by focusing on creative excellence for our clients. Hooplah’s innovative process leverages carefully designed marketing to drive targeted online traffic that supports brands with fresh strategies and leading-edge interactive solutions.

About You:
Are you a lover of all things digital, especially Social Media? Are you looking for a company that also lives and breathes everything online? At Hooplah, we dig digital and are anchored by 12 years experience coupled with early adopter obsession and a tireless thirst to stay ahead of the pixel pack. If your calling is to manage social communities of some world class clients, have we got a compelling read for you (by job posting standards at least).

About The Job:
We are on the hunt for a seasoned Community Manager to add to our close-knit team. Candidates should have 2-3 years of professional experience managing social communities for enterprise level clients. You will report to our V.P. Digital Strategy and work closely with our entire Digital Marketing team on the day-to-day management of your clients’ social media campaigns. We value strategic thinkers, motivated self-starters, positive attitudes, and strong work ethic.

Responsibilities:

Manage day-to-day social media and influencer related activities, including, but not limited to:

Daily maintenance of clients’ and Hooplah’s social media platforms (ie: Answering questions, comments, and driving overall customer engagement)
Constantly monitor and moderate user generated content within social media outlets to maintain positive environment for online communities
Provide comprehensive reports on community feedback, issues, concerns and trends to stakeholders in order to address the community's’ needs
Ad hoc Facebook/Instagram/Twitter post and copy creation
Source influencers to represent clients’ brand objectives and execute influencer marketing campaigns
Qualifications:

2-3 years of community management experience - candidates with previous customer service experience strongly preferred

Bachelor’s degree - marketing or related field preferred
Skilled with creating/maintaining spreadsheets and data in Excel and Google Sheets is a must, in order to perform content performance analysis
Possess an understanding of social media advertising and marketing, including trends and media types (owned, earned, paid)
Fluency in multiple social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
Media buying skills on social media platforms is strongly preferred
Comfortable creating branded content on our clients’ social channels with minimal oversight
Experience using social media management tools such as Hootsuite, Sysomos and Rival IQ is a bonus
Fast learner with a positive attitude and outgoing personality
Strong English written and verbal communication skills
Enthusiastic, highly organized, and detail-oriented
Strategic thinker seeking an opportunity that will allow you to showcase your diverse skill set to support a highly motivated, rapidly scaling team
What’s All The Hooplah About?

We offer the opportunity to become part of an incredible team of professionals
Great Benefits and Competitive Pay
Team events throughout the year to keep things FUN!
We dress for success (at least when the clients are around)
Work closely with our roster of great clients
Summer Hours – get some Canadian Sunshine while we have it!
Career Growth Opportunities

Clinical Research Assistant Manager
We are growing very rapidly and need someone who shares this vision and wants to grow with us! The Clinical Research Assistant Manager will diligently handle documents and materials, conduct research, and analyze data.
Toronto
What are we looking for?
We are growing very rapidly and need someone who shares this vision and wants to grow with us! The Clinical Research Assistant Manager will diligently handle documents and materials, conduct research, and analyze data.
What would you be doing?
Research current and new in vitro assays to test cosmetic products in house
Provide recommendations for performing experiments
Apply research findings to design, plan, and execute controlled experiments to test finished cosmetics products
Coordinate with other departments to ensure R&D goals are met
Source all the materials required for the experiment
Use analytical instruments to collect, analyze, and interpret experimental data
Follow SOP's and write new ones
Communicate results in a cross-functional team setting, prepare final reports suitable for regulatory fillings
Work with other labs to carry out tests that might not be feasible in house
Perform other related duties as assigned
What skills and qualifications do you need?
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Biomedical Science/Biotechnology, Pharmacology, or a related field
4+ years of research experience
Experience designing and conducting (preferably in vitro cosmetic tests)
Organized and good time management
Proactive in learning and applying research to further R&D goals
Good documentation practices
Adaptive and flexible
Work with minimal supervision
Able to multi-task and troubleshoot
Still interested?
Kindly send us your resume to hr@deciem.com. We really appreciate your effort in applying to this position. However, only those candidates will be contacted who have been shortlisted for interview.

company_name: The College of Midwives of Ontario
job_description:
Toronto, ON$86,700 - $92,820 a yearREPORTS TO: Director of Regulatory Affairs

POSITION SUMMARY

The College’s professional conduct team promotes and protects the public interest through enforcement of professional conduct and through the establishment of fair and transparent processes. Under direction from the Director of Regulatory Affairs (DRA), the Manager, Professional Conduct (MPC) takes full ownership of processes, resulting from complaints and reports and outcomes of the Inquiries, Complaints and Reports Committee (ICRC), in accordance with the provisions of the Regulated Health Professions Act, the Midwifery Act, College’s Professional Misconduct Regulation, College’s bylaws and professional conduct policies. The MPC manages the Professional Conduct team to achieve the mandate of the department and strategic direction. This position requires understanding the impact of the ICR, Discipline and FTP Committees’ and Panels’ work and partnering with the College leadership team to ensure that regulatory requirements and deliverables are timely and high quality.

ACCOUNTABILITY

Accountable for the successful delivery of the Professional Conduct program in accordance with the set direction, strategic priorities, Legislation, Regulations and Bylaws. Responsible for operational planning and implementation and ensures systems are efficient, effective, cost-effective and consistent. Monitors systems by collecting and analyzing data to ensure continuous improvement, and reports regularly to the Director using these systems. Conducts research, prepares reports and recommends the development and revision of policies, procedures and programs. Collaborates with relevant staff in policy development and communications drafting. Apprises the Director of issues and opportunities relating to policy, legislation and the performance of Committees and Panels. Ensures orientation and training for ICRC, FTP and Discipline Committee members. Manages and professional conduct staff using best practices in human resource management and assigns work effectively. Identifies risks and works with Director to mitigate them. Builds and maintains relevant stakeholder relationships and fosters engagement. Acts as the College contact for the professional conduct program and supports registrants in achieving compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, bylaws, policies and guidelines. Provides leadership for ICRC, Discipline and FTP Committees and Panels, ensuring decisions are well-informed, fair and consistent. Writes or oversees the writing of Committee and Panel decisions and assists with ensuring their defensibility. Liaises with consultants (i.e. investigators, assessors, court reporters, expert witnesses) and manages contracts and training. Ensures internal and external communications for all program and portfolio areas are appropriate, accurate and effective.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

The key responsibilities outlined below are interpreted as being descriptive in nature and are not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible job responsibilities, tasks, and duties.

Expertise


Acts as the College’s main resource on Discipline, Fitness to Practice, and Inquiries, Complaints and Reports matters

Provides expertise in the area of Professional Misconduct Regulation, policy and Bylaw revisions

Acts as the College’s main resource on inquiries and investigations into illegal practise

Manages and represents the professional conduct program achieve program and College goals and objectives


Program Oversight


Manages the professional conduct program design development and operations and monitors program and staff

Identifies objectives for the department and ensures timely implementation

Develops and refines procedures to ensure registrant compliance with decisions, remediation requirements and practice restrictions resulting from regulatory processes

Achieves annual department goals and maintains work plan

Lead the program in accordance with regulations, research evidence, and best practices with an understanding of how professional culture affects program implementation

Manages the evaluation of the complaints process with measurable deliverables

Delivers information and presentations on professional conduct matters of importance and interest to stakeholders and at forums

Manages the investigation process, ensures fairness, transparency, timeliness and accountability in the conduct of investigation of reports and complaints

Develops and expands relationships with other health regulatory colleges regarding matters of professional conduct

Monitors and takes appropriate action on activities related to each case file, updates and consults with DRA regularly

Evaluates and ensures the development of policies and procedures for case management

Develops and conducts briefings on recommended program and policy changes and oversees related implementation

Writes or oversees the writing of Committee and Panel decisions and assists with ensuring their defensibility

Effectively manages a complex, high-volume workload


Leadership


Manages the work and performance of Professional Conduct staff, consultants and professional resources in the delivery of file case management, committee support, and response to complaints and inquiries from members and the public

Participates in probationary, semi-annual and annual performance evaluations for team, and continually monitors staff performance

Undertakes regular meetings with team

Ensures tasks and assignments are fairly and effectively distributed amongst the team

Provides direction, support, training, mentoring and oversight to team members as appropriate

Promotes teamwork and shares appropriate information with team members in a timely manner

Works with colleagues to put into action the strategic plan of the College


Data and Financial Management


Ensures database and Public Register information is up to date and accurate in regards to Professional Conduct.

Manages the development and continual maintenance of the database and Member Portals in regards to Professional Conduct

Manages the development and maintenance of case files, both electronically and in paper format

Manages professional conduct program data management system, provides trending data, and plans system enhancements based on case volume projections, legislation, regulation and by-law changes

Ensures compliance with Records Retention policies and procedures

Ensures invoices are created for Professional Conduct receivables and tracks payables.

Monitors budget and costs as directed


Resource Development


Guides the development and implementation of an online complaints submission process

Guides the development of professional conduct information and resources

Develops, completes or manages ad hoc projects as directed by the Director of Regulatory Affairs, Registrar, ICRC, Fitness to Practise or Discipline committees


Committee Oversight


Builds quality relationships with ICR, Discipline and FTP Committee members to ensure timely completion and resolution of College’s requirements

Ensures committee members receive the necessary orientation, education and training to fulfill their duties

Ensures appropriate committee and panel support, including:

Development of agenda packages, background materials, minutes, committee and chair reports

Leads briefings, including preparing materials

Development and maintenance of committee documents and materials

Evaluation and improvement of processes, as needed, including investigation planning and establishing appropriate benchmarks

Ensuring adherence to directives

Liaising with College legal counsel as deemed appropriate


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

5 years of relevant work experience and demonstrated leadership required. Direct experience in professional conduct in health regulation strongly preferred.

A University Degree is required and legal training is an asset.

A valid criminal record check will be required by the successful candidate.

COMPENSATION

Salary with Benefits.

Salary Band ($86,700 - $105,060). Hiring Range ($86,700- 92,820).

START DATE: May 2019

Location:
1105 Fountain Street North, Cambridge, Ontario, N3E1A2

How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

job_title: VIP Back of House Manager - Cineplex Cinemas Markham & VIP
job_description:
Job Description

Right now Cineplex is looking for a dynamic:
Back of House (BOH) VIP Experience Manager
Reporting to the General Manager, the key responsibilities for this position are:
Leading, training, supporting, coaching, motivating and managing a dedicated team of BOH employees to ensure that each VIP Guest enjoys an exceptional food and beverage experience
Maintaining a positive, professional outlook while fostering good working relationships with BOH, FOH, and regional teams, colleagues and managers
Taking ownership of the Guest’s experience by ensuring consistency, quality and presentation of all food products through training, coaching and supervision of cooks, a deep attention to detail and a commitment to food excellence
Managing all food inventory and stock levels
Overseeing hiring and reviewing staffing levels for all kitchen staff positions
Working diligently with cooks to control food costs, and portion size, and ensuring every dish is prepared and presented according to Cineplex’s standards, including those related to food safety, food preparation, timing, cleanliness, and health and safety
Hosting regular staff meetings and workshops to inform, educate and coach team members, providing a forum for team to share their expertise
Managing stress in an fast-paced, high-pressured environment
Solving problems and resolving conflict proactively through analysis, critical thinking and flexibility in approach
Adapting to change and identifying opportunities to improve BOH execution

Qualifications

What you need to become a successful member of this Team?
A passion for hospitality in a fast-paced service environment.
Attention for detail and commitment to food service excellence.
Ability to initiate innovative and creative sales and food service activities.
Safe food handling and smart serve certification is preferential.
A flexible schedule that includes evenings, weekends and holidays.
Ideal candidates would possess a college or culinary degree.
A minimum of 2 years previous management experience in a bar, licensed restaurant, or similar environment is a requirement.
Personality Requirements:
Good Communication Skills - The BOH Manager is friendly, has strong communication skills, and can establish a strong working relationship with those that they are working with in order to achieve a common goal.
Outgoing Personality - The BOH Manager is an outgoing person who truly enjoys interacting with others.
Strong Organizational Skills – The BOH Manager will have the responsibility of ordering food for all food outlets, and will be required to keep this order organized on a weekly basis.
Computer Literacy – The ability to use a computer for various tasks on a daily basis is required.
BOH Operational Skills – Ability to properly count and weigh various stock, and determine order amounts for the building.
Business Acumen – The BOH Manager must have the ability to interpret financial and other data and communicate business results.
Additional Information

Interested applicants, please apply today.
While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Orangeville, ON$104,887 - $122,704 a yearManager of Information Technology (IT)
and Geographic Information Systems (GIS)

The County of Dufferin sits on the fringe of the Greater Toronto Area and is largely a rural county with
three urban settlement areas. The region is well known for its rivers, its rolling hills and its excellent
outdoor recreation opportunities. Home to over 61,000 residents the area boasts fabulous restaurants,
shopping and amenities.

Reporting to the Director of Corporate Services, the Manager of IT and GIS is responsible for setting the
strategic direction of IT infrastructure, applications and services, while ensuring alignment with corporate-
wide business objectives and priorities.

While leading a team of enthusiastic and talented individuals, this position oversees and manages the
implementation of GIS software for the Corporation and the eight area municipalities in Dufferin County
and provides IT services and support to participating area municipalities and non-profit groups.

What you bring:
 A highly developed knowledge of IT project management obtained through a degree in Computer
Science or equivalent;
 A minimum of eight (8) years’ experience in progressively responsible IT management positions.
 5 years’ experience as a Manager of IT or in a similar position where project management experience
was gained.
 Excellent leadership and supervisory skills with the ability to interpret and apply employment policies
and collective agreements;
 An understanding of current hardware and software trends, issues and initiatives and their
significance;
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical I.T.
processes as understandable customer solutions;
 A customer centric approach with a commitment to transparency and integrity in achieving results
 A valid Class “G” Driver’s License in good standing with access to a reliable vehicle to use on
corporate business.
What we offer:
 A competitive annual salary range of $104,887 - $122,704;
 A comprehensive health and dental benefits package paid for by the Employer;
 Enrollment in the Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System (OMERS) defined benefit pension
plan;
 Learning and development opportunities;
 Flexibility in order to meet work/life commitments.

To view a full job description, please visit our website: https://www.dufferincounty.ca/government/careers


Qualified applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and resume by Wednesday, April 10, 2019 at
4:30 pm to hr@dufferincounty.ca, quoting job number C20-19 in the subject line.

All applicants are thanked for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will receive a
response. Information collected will be used in accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information
and Protection of Privacy Act for the purpose of job selection and will not be used for any other reason.
The County is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available for all parts of the
recruitment process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.
POSITION DESCRIPTION
Title: Manager of Information Technology &
Geographic Information Systems
Reports to: Clerk/Director of Corporate Services

Department: Corporate Services

Positions Supervised: 6 + summer co-op student
Effective: March 2010
Revised: January 2018


BASIC FUNCTION:


Reporting to the Clerk/Director of Corporate Services, the Manager of Information Technology is responsible
for setting the strategic direction of IT infrastructure, applications and services, while ensuring alignment with
corporate-wide business objectives and priorities. Develop professional, technical and advisory IT services
along with appropriate policies to support secure and efficient access by stakeholders. Undertake budgeting,
procurement and management of staff resources in accordance with the policies of the County and applicable
legislation.

The position requires the ability to diagnose and resolve complex hardware and software problems.

Proficiency in the use of desktop productivity software and document management systems is essential, as is
a solid understanding of and fluency in technical jargon relevant to computing and software licensing. The
work also requires excellent problem solving skills, interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to
work both independently and as part of a team. A post-secondary degree in computer technology or
comparable experience in a technical support capacity is required. The incumbent should have a minimum of
eight years of experience implementing, supporting and maintaining critical systems in a multi-platform
environment in a mid-sized organization and possess current industry certifications in technologies relevant to
the County’s infrastructure. A valid Drivers Licence is also required.

Comfortable establishing a single vision that spans different businesses and can inspire enthusiasm in getting
others to embrace the digital vision. A customer centric approach and a commitment to transparency and
integrity in achieving results is essential.


Area Municipal Responsibilities
Responsible for strategic direction of IT infrastructure, applications and services, for the Town of Shelburne,
Township of Melancthon, Township of East Garafraxa and Township of Amaranth. Working with the area
municipal staff, elected officials on strategic direction, budgeting, and creating awareness of the
products/services available. Included in the County’s work order system and providing monthly invoices to the
municipalities. Services is based on an Memorandum of Understanding

GIS (Geographic Information Systems)
In addition, this position is responsible for the implementation of GIS software for the Corporation and also for
the eight area municipalities in Dufferin County. Oversees the production of corporate spatial data, responding
to department requests for special data, collection and processing of data using handheld GPS Devices,
maintenance and development of GIS applications. Works with the Department Heads and the area CAO’s
and IT staff to determine their GIS needs.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:


1. Provide strategic IT leadership to the organization through stakeholder governance structures to ensure
that IT enterprise architecture, portfolio prioritization and project management processes are established
and effectively utilized.
2. Oversee the implementation of the current Information Technology (I.T.) program, while creating the next
generation of system and process enhancements necessary to continue the organizational transformation.

3. Work directly with the CAO’s on highly sensitive, confidential matters that involve legal, HR matters such
as, Litigation, employee discipline, investigations, employee termination, policy compliance, etc.
4. Benchmark, and regularly analyse the overall hardware, software and services employed on a day-to-day
basis, to ensure that performance and availability metrics of systems are met, and that broader business-
level SLAs are achieved.

5. Head cross-functional work teams across the corporation and the area municipalities in dealing with
common interests, i.e. Open Data Committee, GIS Committee.

6. Complete voice and data network assessments on an annual basis to identify new business service
requirements, and to identify opportunities to improve services and reduce costs.

7. Establish corporate-wide policies and procedures that reflect IT industry best practices and ensure
consistent, effective and secure use of technology resources by all County staff and external users of
County resources.

8. Direct research on potential technology solutions in order to identify opportunities for cost effective
business transformation and service delivery improvement throughout the organization.
9. Review business cases for technology investments, make recommendations to senior management, and
initiate project planning, budget provisioning, resource allocation and associated procurement processes.

10. Ensure that all information Technology operations are maintained and supervised in the most efficient
manner possible and according to Provincial legislation, Municipal by-laws and policies.

11. Develop, implement and monitor the Information Technology budget ensuring expenditures are within
assigned authority and approved limits.

12. Authorize the purchase of equipment, materials and supplies according to needs, budget limitations and
purchasing policy within assigned authority.

13. Establish and ensure attainment of annual goals, objectives and standards.

14. Develop and maintain effective relationships with division managers, co-workers and external contacts as
required.

15. Provide leadership and supervision to Information Technology employees in a manner that motivates,
guides and directs employees to the realization of department goals and objectives. Maintain a work
environment that promotes staff participation, teamwork and positive labour relations.

16. Ensure the hiring, orientation and training of staff and oversee their day-to-day activities according to
County policies and guidelines.

17. Prepare and present written reports as required.

18. Participate in council and staff committees as required.

19. Monitor employee internet usage and report any unusual activity to the senior manager or the CAO as the
case may be.

20. Comply with provincial and County occupational health and safety legislation, regulations, policies and
procedures.

21. Maintain confidentiality in accordance with the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy
Act.
22. Perform other duties as assigned.

PROBLEM SOLVING RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Develop solutions for complex business problems that require ingenuity and innovation.
 Adept at strategic planning, tactical action and operational decision-making.
 Adept at managing risk and change, people and budgets.
 Develop creative IT solutions to meet the business needs of individual departments and the corporation
as a whole.
 Address the constantly growing and changing needs, concerns and expectations of a wide variety of
users and operations.
 Address change management issues with respect to the development and implementation of new
processes and applications.
 Allocate resources effectively to accommodate multiple and competing demands.

CONTACTS:
 Internal – staff at all levels, Chief Administrative Officer, County Council.
 External – tenants, Local Municipal staff in Dufferin County, Ministry staff, IT staff in other
municipalities, consultants, vendors.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
 Highly developed knowledge of I.T. project management obtained through a degree in Computer
Science or equivalent.
 Highly developed understanding of current hardware and software trends, issues and initiatives and
their significance.
 Excellent leadership and supervisory skills and ability to interpret and apply employment policies and
collective agreements.
 Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex
technical I.T. processes as understandable customer solutions.
 Highly developed planning and organizational skills.
 Highly developed time management and multi-tasking skills.
 Class G Driver’s License in good standing and reliable vehicle to use on corporate business.

EXPERIENCE:
 A minimum of eight (8) years’ experience in progressively responsible, I.T. management positions.
 A minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a Manager of I.T. or in a similar position where extensive
project management experience was gained.
 Experience in the leadership and supervision of staff and the administration of employment policies.
CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION:
 Knowledge of security codes and passwords
 Access to sensitive information at all levels
 Financial and personal database information
 Keys to Municipal Buildings
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:
 Facilitation, negotiation and interpersonal skills.
 In-depth knowledge of municipal services and processes.
 Well-developed leadership and administrative abilities combined with excellent presentation, writing
and problem solving skills.
 Ability to maintain accurate records and communicate effectively and tactfully with internal staff,
community agencies and the public.
 Able to supervise staff under a diverse environment.
 Strong organizational and communication skills with a proven background in both reactive and
proactive problem solving.
OTHER:
 Hours of work are as required to fulfil the obligations of the position. Core hours are from 8:30 a.m. to
4:30 p.m. Monday to Friday.
 Available to provide after-hours support and must have own transportation.
 Responsible, as an employee and supervisor, for good occupational health and safety practices and
ensures that these are observed.

Toronto, ONCreate awesome experiences for our customers.

Join our team

You will be part of the Device Programs team, a results-oriented team that puts customers at the forefront of our product strategy.

Our ability to develop a strategy and rally behind one another allows our team to challenge the status quo and accomplish exceptional things that propel TELUS forward. We are a dynamic, fun team of tech enthusiasts who love to learn, stay on top of global industry news and trends and consistently think two years ahead.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As Manager, Wireless Support Programs, you will directly lead a team of five product owners who manage and own the device support portfolio at TELUS. The team has end-to-end ownership of programs and products such as the TELUS DeviceCheckup app, online device support, TELUS Easy Repair, AppleCare+ and TELUS Device Care programs.

Through supporting the team, guiding their portfolios, and keeping an eye on the broader market, you will rally the broader TELUS organization to deliver on our key support deliverables and support the Future is Friendly promise at TELUS.

Here's how
Develop and support the strategy for wireless support programs

PermanentWhat is the opportunity?
The Manager, AML Data Management is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML/ATF Data Management Program that will govern data used within the AML Program to meet regulatory requirements / expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework. The incumbent will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML Program (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring). The Manager, AML Data Management will work with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to facilitate an effective / efficient AML Program.

What will you do?
Work with subject matter experts and stakeholders to develop knowledge and expertise of data sources and related banking systems
Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
Document identified data quality issues in designated issue management tools to ensure they are tracked for resolution
Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

What do you need to succeed?
Must have
Post-secondary education or equivalent
5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases and data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations. Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++ or other related experience desirable
Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems

Nice to have
Graduate degree (MBA or relevant subject matter area)
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications
Experience in using visualization software

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, and stock where applicable.Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.Opportunities to do challenging work.Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

Major Responsibilities:


Reporting to a Manager, Community Recreation, the Supervisor, Community Recreation, is responsible for providing recreation services and facility usage to residents and customers within a defined community or programming area. These services take place in a variety of City owned and Community based facilities.


The primary functions associated with this position include but are not limited to:

Supervises, motivates and trains assigned staff, ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning and encourages innovation in others.
Supports the Manager in effectively planning and delivery of recreation services and manage operations including City-Wide, and\or Provincial National Major/ special events and projects.
Provides leadership, manages branch priorities, develops and implements service standards, fiscal management strategies and effective operational plans, works collaboratively within the Branch and partner branches within the Parks Forestry and Recreation Division and other Divisions to ensure the delivery of quality service to efficiently and effectively meet customer service needs and requirements and achieve the Branch mission and goals.
Supervises the day to day operations of all assigned staff including the scheduling, assigning and reviewing of work. Authorizes and coordinates vacation and overtime requests. Monitors, evaluates and maintains records concerning and staff performance. Mentors and provides support to staff, approves salary increments, leads or participates in staff investigations, taking disciplinary and coaching actions when necessary. Supports the Divisional and corporate Labour Relations units in the grievance process, mediation, arbitration and terminations.
Responsible for analyzing Key Performance Indicators, measures and working to set targets and timelines
Provides input into creation of annual budget utilizing information on operational requirements, staffing requirements, known pressures and required adjustments; administers assigned budget and ensures appropriate action is taken to control expenditures within approved budget limitations by analyzing financial data. Prepares operating impacts of capital through Capital Request submissions.
Develops, reviews and implements detailed plans and recommends policies/procedures and guidelines regarding program specific requirements to ensure compliance with Council, corporate and divisional directives. Assesses current practices and make recommendations to improve operational efficiencies
Ensures compliance and a thorough understanding of the Collective Agreements, corporate and divisional policies, procedures and guidelines, and City by-laws.
Develops briefing notes and reports for the Branch Management Team, partners, prepares and submits correspondence to the Manager.
Provides project management support and leadership within the branch as a member of self-directed work team internally and externally including issues management
Responds to emergency and priority situations by anticipating problems, making decisions, deploying appropriate financial and human resources.
Cultivates effective working relations, represents the division and consults with Members of Council and their staff, internal and external stakeholders, other divisions and members of the public on community and project committees, programs, services.
Acts as a Supervisor under the definitions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act.
Follows the principles of healthy child development (High Five) in the planning and delivery of programs.
Ensures the quality of work and service meets corporate and divisional standards and employees are trained to perform work in compliance with all legislative regulations that apply, such as Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS), Fire Code, Electrical Code and the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), etc.
Represents the Division/Branch by providing leadership and technical expertise on projects and engages community groups to further the Branch Recreation Service Plan; apply equity lens from a community perspective ensuring the diverse needs of the community are represented
Recruits, creates interviews and written assessments, revises postings, creates evaluation criteria; conducts testing, marking and interviews for permanent, temporary full time and part time job competitions.
Performs other related duties as assigned.


Key Qualifications:

Post-secondary Education in a discipline pertinent to the job function, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Considerable experience in leading projects, programs and initiatives.
Considerable experience in a range of core functions of the recreation portfolio (which would include recreation programming, planning, administration functions, facility management, human resources, fiscal management and other specialized/centralized functions of the Branch such as involvement with Recreation Service Teams , Working Committees or Community Engagement).
Considerable experience supervising staff in day to day operations
Experience writing briefing notes and reports
Working knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and Regulations, the Collective Agreements and related Labour Legislation, Human Rights Code and Corporate and Divisional policies.
Proficient in the use of corporate computer software applications.
Must have access to a personal vehicle for business use and possess a valid current Ontario Class G Driver's License
Ability to work flexible hours which may include evenings and weekends.
Experience in unionised organization would be considered an asset.

$74,066 - $109,141 a yearPermanentWhat can I expect to do in this role?
The Ministry of Community Safety and Correctional Services, Ontario Provincial Police, and the Commander, Business Management Bureau is seeking a qualified individual to lead and direct a team responsible for the provision of advice, project support and strategic leadership in the area of information management; for implementing and monitoring delivery of an information management and information technology strategy while ensuring divisional requirements are met, and providing guidance to management and staff on information management standards, processes, regulations and policies.

How do I qualify?
Mandatory
Ability to pass an OPP background security investigation.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge and skill to apply human resources practices, policies, directives and collective agreements in relation to recruitment, training and development and labour relations to support an inclusive and engaged team; address employee issues and to support talent management.

Expertise in project management principles and methodologies to manage the delivery of program plans, initiatives and goals.

Knowledge and skill in data management principles, practices, concepts, systems, applications, and data transformation processes, and related technology, to articulate business needs for systems development; and to ensure the data maintenance of data holdings for the Ministry is in compliance with legislation, policies, data management technology and process requirements, and best practices.

Knowledge and skill in information/intellectual capital management and measurement principles, methodology and best practices, in order to evaluate and improve the accuracy, reliability, and timeliness of information; and to manage information resources as an asset with critical importance to the organization; to ensure data are properly stored, retrieved, and shared across organizations; and to develop and implement a comprehensive data maintenance plan in compliance with legislation, information management IM policies, and best practices.

Ability and skill in planning and managing access to and release of data for internal and external clients to ensure that access is appropriately controlled, and information is released in accordance with applicable legislation (e.g. privacy), standards, agreements, and controls.

Interpersonal, oral and written communication skills to manage team(s) by communicating values, strategies, expectations, and promoting an engaged and inclusive environment.

Skill in identifying and recommending staffing needs, conducting recruitment and selection activities, ability to manage orientation/training, developing remedial plans; addressing employee/labour relations/employee matters.

Political acuity to exercise independence of action in participating and providing program/service recommendations as a member of the management team. Ability to provide expert opinions/briefings, advice to senior management on identified and emerging issues impacting program or service goals, outcomes or efficiencies.

Ability to provide strategic advice to client management and staff on opportunities arising from emerging information technology trends and issues to provide IM expertise for planning, IM systems development and support, and directs IM projects in compliance with corporate I&IT policies, directions, and priorities.

Mississauga, ONThe Manager, Strategic Sourcing, is responsible for executing the Strategic Sourcing process for various indirect spend categories including but not limited to Logistics/Transportation, ISD, Ecommerce, Facilities, Operations, Shared Services, Marketing and other areas to be identified to leverage the scale of Walmart Canada’s spend. This position supports all team members including Associate Managers, SR Managers, Director and SR Director.

Position Responsibilities
Demonstrate persuasive leadership skills in influencing stakeholders and Business Units to follow Walmart Canada’s Strategic Sourcing policies in order to allow for competitive market tenders and cost containment, while ensuring that the initiatives are timely executed.
Collaborate with cross functional management teams to identify and develop the Road Map of key strategic initiatives over the next 3 years. Conduct category/sub-category analysis to develop opportunities from sourcing, demand management, and supplier collaboration efforts.
Monitor market place to provide insights on category spend and savings opportunities based on rigorous data analysis, industry benchmarks and experience. Work with other Strategic Sourcing teams and business unit leads to deliver committed capital and expense savings.
Implement the corporate Strategic Sourcing process: Project Identification, Baselines/Financial Target/Budget Adjustment, RFx Process, Quantitative / Qualitative Analysis, Total-Cost-of-Ownership Analysis, Negotiation, and Contract Support. Develop and maintain a process by which vendors are evaluated and selected in accordance with established guidelines and best practices (RFI/RFP, Cross Functional Evaluation Team, Scorecards, and Performance Metrics).
Conduct complex analyses in support of external supplier negotiations; create supporting materials for the team’s negotiation preparation (key messages, BATNA, fact based levers, market place trends, etc.). Research industry benchmarks in contract to existing practices to find opportunities for improvement (pricing, quality, product changes, service levels, and trends).
Support contract negotiations and facilitate creation of business terms and Service Level Agreements.
Complete ongoing performance tracking methods of strategic initiatives, measuring effectiveness against KPIs and compliance while providing regular reporting to team lead and stakeholders.
Canada Walmart DivisionAccounting and Finance
Qualifications
Minimum Bachelor’s degree required.
Minimum 8+ years of experience required
Experienced negotiator, ability to develop qualitative and quantitative analysis and develop strategic procurement processes to enable internal stakeholders to maximize Total Cost of Ownership.
AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

job_title: Data Analyst (internally known as Business Analyst)
job_description:
Toronto, ONTemporary$36.17 an hourMake a difference
Are you passionate about data analysis and looking for an opportunity to positively impact your community? If so, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) position at Toronto Community Housing may be for you!
The Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be part of the Data Governance team, reporting to the Data Governance Manager within the Information and Technology Services (ITS) department.
The main focus will be on supporting various initiatives under the Data Governance program, including, but not limited to, establishing best practices in Master Data Management and Data Quality areas. Initially, the Business Analyst (Data Analyst) will be focusing on understanding and modeling TCHC’s current state data in collaboration with the Data Governance and Data Management teams. Also, the Data Analyst will be one of the key resources as part of data conversion effort to consolidate TCHC data into the new business solution.
This role will be actively engaged with different business divisions as part of the Data Governance program to identify data requirements and to ensure that data governance will address various business data needs.
What you’ll do
Data Analysis
Identifies data requirements for enterprise data throughout whole data lifecycle
Performs research and analysis on a regular and ad hoc basis to support data governance activities
Ensures the integrity, quality and accuracy of data while collecting data from internal and external sources supporting data governance activities
Collects, interprets and analyzes data and provides ongoing reporting
Supports and enforces established data standards and guidelines
Manages master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
Proactively monitors data accuracy and facilitates required data corrective actions with business owners
Provides assistance and analytical support to ensure that decision-making processes are aligned with values, policies, and organization-wide business
Data Governance Strategy support
Assists with new initiatives and projects by understanding impacts on data flows, business constrains and requirements
Provides support to data owners/ data stewards in performing data validation
Participates in the creation of data standards, drafting of data and governance policies and management of related documentation
Partners in troubleshooting and resolving master data transactions, SLA impacts, or other operational challenges affected by master data issues
Develops and implements governance oversight and KPI metrics to successfully complete data governance objectives
Collaborates with division and other staff to interpret data, identify trends, communicate meaning and develop recommendations based on findings
Research
Maintains up to date knowledge of information technology products and methodologies as well as government and TCH data policies and standards
Contributes to ideas and actions towards continuous improvement of processes within master data and data quality
Participates in research projects with external and internal partners
 What you’ll need
University Degree in computer science, MIS or other relevant specialty/discipline
University degree in computer science, MIS is preferred
3 years - Previous experience in data analysis and data modeling, 3-5 years’ experience is preferred
Knowledge of data modeling tools
Working experience of SQL
Exposure to data architecture best practices
Previous experience in Data Governance, MDM and / or Data Quality initiatives
Has participated in data conversion activities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate architectural concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences
Excellent analytical skills, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
Nice to have:
Previous experience in data conversion initiatives
Ability to manage multiple demands within tight timelines
Demonstrate good problem-solving abilities, and have initiative and show sound judgment
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints are required
Ability to exhibit maturity, reliability and stability by adhering to commitments is critical in order to maintain business credibility
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision
What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please note: This temporary position may be extended or become permanent in order to meet business needs. If this occurs, the position may not be reposted.

job_title: Manager, Customer Strategy Insights and Integration
job_description:
PermanentHelp us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.

The Customer Insights Integration (CII) team is a new group within the broader Loyalty and Customer Insights Department with a bold mandate to socialize and embed a consolidated “voice of the customer” into insight-led strategy that elevates customer experience and drives sustainable growth. Our group has high visibility into enterprise-wide customer programs and our day-to-day work revolves around partnering with senior management across all Canadian Tire Corporation banners (CTR, SportChek, Mark’s, etc.) by extending strategic and analytical support.

We are a rapidly growing team and we are looking for candidates to take ownership of driving actions that will grow our share of wallet and improve our brand perception (Customer Net Promoter Score – NPS). This comprises of cross-banner shopping behaviour and integration of insights across CTC.

What you’ll do

1. Customer Experience Analytics and Program Design

Advance CTC’s customer experience by conceptualizing and operationalizing cross-functional and cross-banner customer experience insights, initiatives and operating models, with a focus on key capabilities across people, process, technology and information. (e.g. Canadian Tire Retail, SportChek, Mark’s, etc.)

Design customer journey maps and develop analytical frameworks for customer experience and Net Promoter Score (NPS) related insights including developing strategies to win at key moments of truth along the customer journey.

Aggregate disparate and broad data sources and synthesize insights into actionable recommendations by developing scorecards and executive presentations or communications that track prioritized improvement initiatives.

2. Strategic Insights Integration

Consult with key business stakeholders such as marketing, merchandising, and owned brands and lead the process of generating and embedding key insights into business unit strategies, plans and operations to optimize customer experience and drive future growth.

Champion and socialize key areas of opportunity across the organization.

Lead internal communication and organizational understanding of the customer including Customer NPS and key drivers, Jobs and Joys, customer segmentation, and performance measurement.

Partner with other areas of the organization as well as external vendors as required to facilitate the achievement of deliverables and identified objectives

Who you are

We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment

Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business

Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business

Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward

Inclusive leaders who build and develop teams that effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance

If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.

What you bring

5+ years’ experience in Marketing, consulting, retail or similar functions

10+ years overall related experience

Proven experience in managing a team

Track record building process from ground up

Strong experience in developing executive decks and communications

Collaborative team player who can with experience in building relationships across various groups and stakeholders

Strong problem solver with an ability to work through business problems and create solutions to meet objectives

Experience with consumer insights and an ability to synthesize data to make recommendations

Familiarity with research and analytical methodologies related to customer analytics and insights

About Canadian Tire Corporation

Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Top Employers.


LI-RD1

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.
