Contract“The Power of Together”
Join Northbridge, a growing dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide.
Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We’re 100% Canadian!
We offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands where we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence.
By continually striving to challenge the status quo, and by focusing on helping the customers we have the privilege of insuring achieve the possibilities of their business, we’ve been able to build our reputation as one of Canada’s largest commercial insurance providers.
To help us continue to build on this success, we’re committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people.
Be part of a team that’s passionate about making a difference every day, fuelled by our entrepreneurial spirit and where everyone owns a part of our success. Our company has had an amazing journey so far, and our future is full of new possibilities!
Located in the heart of Toronto’s Financial District, our head office is easily accessible by TTC and GO Transit, and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre, Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre, and CN Tower. As a national property and casualty commercial insurance provider, we also have offices across Canada.
Position Summary
Our reinsurance strategy and administration capabilities are important contributors in our capital management and Corporate Governance processes. The Reinsurance Manager, as part of the Corporate Risk group and working directly with the reinsurance buyer, is responsible for the management of the group’s Reinsurance administration and is a key part of our governance structure. This is a one year maternity leave contract.
What you will be doing:
Oversee reinsurance administration and treaty renewal process (including pricing, premium allocation data and risk transfer analyses for reinsurance contracts), providing technical leadership and direction on reinsurance treaties and practices.
Ensure accuracy and concurrency of reinsurance coverage through the review of contract wording during renewals. Research and advise management of significant changes / new clauses being suggested to the contracts and monitor the contract signing process
Contribute to the relationship management with the reinsurance broker(s) and reinsurers.
Analyze ceded reinsurance results.
Analyze reinsurer concentration risk, recoverable balances and credit reports.
Oversee the timely analysis, accuracy, preparation and distribution of reinsurance reports for various stakeholders including regulators, senior management, Board & Audit Committee, external auditors, shareholder, and affiliated companies.
Monitor all cash transactions for treaty reinsurers, including disbursements with respect to ceded premiums payable, and receipts with respect to ceded paid losses receivable, to ensure the proper and timely settlement of amounts owing to and recoverable from all treaty reinsurers.
Develop relationships with other departments to foster inter-departmental communication.
Lead and develop an effective team through communication, performance management, and development plans to cultivate an environment that supports the company’s vision and core values.
Assist with the commutation, novation, fronting, and facultative processes as required
Other duties and ad-hoc requests as directed.
What we are looking for:
Technical finance or business designation.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in analyzing and/or structuring (re)insurance contracts.
P&C insurance industry experience is an asset.
Minimum of 3-5years of experience in the financial services industry.
Some leadership experience would be an asset
P&C Commercial and Personal lines experience required
Working knowledge of (re)insurance together with a good understanding of the Underwriting, Claims, Finance and Catastrophe analysis operations.
Strong risk acumen, specifically related to reinsurance concepts, contracts, and practices.
Proficiency and resourcefulness in identifying and analyzing relevant data and defining critical issues and alternatives.
Excellent assessment and negotiation skills.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills with ability to interact with all levels of management, staff, and external business partners.
Demonstrated ability to plan, organize, and manage multiple demands and changing priorities, and deliver results.
Demonstrated commitment to high standards of performance and goals.
Strong interpersonal skills to foster collaboration among team members and functional areas.
What We Have to Offer:
Northbridge Cares program – volunteer day and donation matching
Generous paid time off, including personal days. Flexible work hours as well as early departure opportunities
Flexible Group Benefits Plan – medical, dental, insurances
Defined Contribution Pension Plan + Optional Group RRSP
Northbridge Employee Share Purchase Plan
Education Assistance Program
Employee Assistance plan
Staff Insurance - discount on home, automobile and pet insurance
Plus, the opportunity to contribute to the success of Northbridge through sharing your knowledge and experience while learning from others!

job_title: Intern opportunities for students: Data & Applied Sciences
job_description:
CanadaData Scientists at Microsoft help to improve the quality of experiences on our devices and services. We are looking for highly motivated and passionate Data Scientists to apply rigorous scientific methodology and algorithms to data in order to improve Microsoft’s devices, operating systems, and services. As a Data Scientist, you will provide unique insight into business and customer scenarios that cut across organizational boundaries and lead the growth of a data-driven culture within Microsoft.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference?
Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas?
Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment?
If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job.
Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Data & Applied Sciences intern roles including the ones described below, depending on education level and/or location. To be considered for an internship or college student position, you need to be enrolled full-time as a student majoring in an applicable field.

Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist, you will formulate approaches to solve problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources. You will incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data. Successful Data Scientists will interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.

You will engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers. As a Data Scientist, you will also engage in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.
Qualifications
Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Applied Sciences like Biostatistics, Physics, Chemistry, Computational Neurology and or other quant-focused field with at least one semester/quarter remaining after internship.
Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc.
Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#.
Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS.
Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems.
Some A/B Testing or experimentation (this can be from conducting real life science experiments, hypothesis testing in stats etc.) Not required but ideal.
Some experience or course work applying basic ML to a type of data and or used algorithms to conduct experiments on data. Machine Learning strongly encouraged.
Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain.
Ability to interact with peers and stakeholders to drive product and business impact.
Strong interpersonal and communications skills.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Organization: Real Food for Real Kids

Website: www.rfrk.com

Location: East End of Toronto, ON - 115 Saulter Street South (Lakeshore/Carlaw)

Seeking: Logistics Manager

Reports to: Director of Supply Chain & Logistics

Hours: Full Time, Monday to Friday, 8am - 4pm

Compensation:

$45-70k (dependent on experience, certifications and ability to create value on Day 1)

RRSP/TFSA matching

Benefits program including alternative and preventative health treatments

Application Deadline: ongoing

Anticipated Start Date: ASAP

About Real Food for Real Kids:

A multiple award-winning company recognized for excellence and innovation, Real Food for Real Kids (RFRK) is a leading healthy catering company for childcare centres, elementary schools, and camps. RFRK proudly serves delicious, nutritious meals and snacks to over 19,000 children throughout the Greater Toronto Area every day. RFRK’s mission is to enable and inspire a lifetime of healthy eating while having a great time doing it! Apply today to join a fast-growing company on a world-changing mission.

A glimpse at the role:

The Logistics Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the Logistics department, focusing on the successful delivery of all lunches and snacks to clients in a timely and efficient manner. Responsibilities also include managing a staff of 17-20 drivers, scheduling complete route coverage, route optimizing, and fleet maintenance. This position requires a high level of strategic and tactical ability.

Some of the things you’ll get paid to do:

Employee Management (35%)

Management of department's hiring, scheduling, training, performance and progressive discipline

Ensure all staff are following all Company Health & Safety practices and policies

Conduct verification of licensing, acquire initial and subsequent driver abstracts

Support labour tracking and manage labour utilization

Responsible for and directly manage all activities, processes, people and requirements within the Logistics department, ensuring that team is staffed with the appropriate number of competent and qualified personnel

Establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external customers

Build, develop and nurture a team of service-oriented logistics professionals, ensuring each direct report is provided with the resources they need to provide exceptional customer service. This includes proactive, ongoing performance management and customer centric training designed to ensure deliverables are aligned appropriately and integrated with company objectives.

Model and coach customer centric behaviours, engaging with customers to ensure service expectations are met and issues are resolved in a timely manner

Recommend customer service and logistics policies, standards and practices

Fleet (20%)

Scheduling and overseeing maintenance and repair of the vehicle fleet

Lead projects or provide support in the acquisition of vehicle materials and equipment through bidding strategy, bid analysis, and vendor negotiations

Manage and carry out vehicle maintenance supplier pre-qualifications, approvals, and evaluations and maintaining qualified supplier database

Confer with vendors to obtain vehicle service information, such as price, availability, and fixed-term scheduling

Deliveries (25%)

Modifying and creating delivery routes for both existing and new clients and services

Real-time monitoring of deliveries, resolving issues as they arise; ensuring timely delivery to all clients

Acting as an emergency driver backup on an ongoing basis

Risks Mitigation (10%)

Ensure contingency and fallback planning in regards to PM, 3rd party delivery program

Ensure dash cam checks and audits are conducted

Conduct verification of licensing, acquire initial and subsequent driver abstracts

Assume ownership of safety standards in all relevant work areas, including vehicles

Financial (10%)

Entering data as needed for specific departmental KPI’s, both helping to identify key metrics, and helping understand how to track these metrics

Establishing, implementing and executing overall strategy, and initiatives for the department

Define the metrics for analyzing the progress and continuous improvement of the department

Conduct saving/cost opportunity analysis; monitor budgets and provide recommendations for improvement

Some of the perks:

Put your professional and personal strengths to work in a fast-growing and dynamic company

Have a hand in reshaping the way children, families, and educators eat and perceive food

Help our community embrace real food and foster new healthy eating habits

Taste real food every day in our staff kitchen!

Required Education and Experience:

Post-secondary degree or college diploma

3 years+ of progressive logistics management

Experience in training and motivating a large team

Experience in a dispatch role

Professional certification in logistics (PLog or equivalent)

Completed criminal background check

G-Class Drivers Licence

Skills and Personal Attributes:

High degree of adaptability

Admirable discipline and work ethic

Able to drive meaningful relationships with front-line and executive staff

Strong analytical/numeracy/spreadsheet competency

Exceptional organizational skills

Adept negotiator

Physical Demands & Work Environment:

Combination of an office environment and production floor

Generally stationary in nature

May require standing and walking for up to 50% of the time

Work is generally performed in an office environment with standard office equipment and without hazardous or unpleasant conditions (caused by noise, temperature, lighting, etc.)

May be required that you work outside of your core work hours due to business need

Ability to lift 20-50 lbs

Nice-to-haves:

Previous delivery driver experience

Dispatch Experience

To apply, please upload your résumé and cover letter, including salary expectations, explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role!

About AstraZeneca:
At AstraZeneca, we are united by a common purpose – to push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines. This purpose underpins everything we do; our work helps to make hearts healthier, to help people breathe easier, and to help more people survive cancer. Every single day, we make a difference by delivering potentially life-changing medicines to millions of people worldwide and by leading breakthrough science that promises to transform the treatment of disease.
Our purpose is ambitious and so is our approach. Becoming a more agile and innovative company means building a dynamic, inspiring culture where we celebrate forward thinking and act with a sense of urgency. We are daring, taking smart risks and learning from both success and failure. We are curious, creative, and open to new ideas and ways of working. Above all, we are passionate about science and driven to always put patients first. Are you ready to move forward in your career? Join us and be part of an extraordinary place to work; an environment that energizes and empowers each of us to achieve our goal.
Position Title: Global Study Associate Manager
Position Type: Full-Time, Contract (1 Year)
Location: Mississauga, Ontario
Career Level: D
You are a member of the extended global study team supporting delivery of clinical studies to time, cost and quality from Clinical Study Protocol (CSP) development through to study archiving. The GSAM works cross-functionally with internal and external partners to deliver delegated aspects of the clinical study.
Responsibilities:
You will build partnerships functional authorities, internally and externally and provide oversight to ensure successful study delivery
You will maintain and facilitate interactions with internal functions including Data Management, Procurement, Regulatory, Patient Safety and Quality Assurance, and external functions including the CROs and other outside service providers to ensure an efficient study delivery.
You will lead and/or participate in the preparation of delegated study documents (e.g. Informed Consent Form, master Clinical Study Agreement etc) and external service provider related documents (e.g. specifications)
You will support the Global Study Leader (GSL) in project management as per agreed delegation
You ensure the supply of study materials and Investigational product by liaising with Clinical Supply Chain or external service providers
You help support the GSL with budget management, such as external service provider invoice reconciliation
You make sure studies are inspection-ready at all times according to ICH-GCP, AZ SOP and relevant policies/guidelines
You will ensure that all study documents in scope of GSAM’s responsibilities are completed and verified for quality in the Trial Master File
You will assist with the planning and conduct of internal and external meetings (e.g. Investigator/Monitors meeting)
You will monitor study conduct and progress, dedicatedly identifying and resolving risks and issues which may impact delivery of the study to the necessary quality, timeline or budget objectives with the Global Study Manager
You will contribute to ad hoc team productivity and efficiency by providing direction and facilitating positive team dynamics
You will have the opportunity to provide input into non-drug project work including training activities, and development of procedures as needed
Minimum Qualifications:
University degree (or equivalent), preferably in medical or biological sciences or discipline associated with clinical research
Significant experience from within the pharmaceutical industry or similar organization or academic experience, preferably of at least 3 years
Shown project management, organizational and analytical skills
Knowledge of clinical development / drug development process in various phases of development and therapy areas and relevant knowledge of international guidelines ICG-GCP
Computer proficiency
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English

For this role, you must know HTML, CSS, JavaScript and React, and you should be obsessed with creating engaging experiences, because experiences are our “products”! In this role, you’ll think about every single aspect of a student’s experience with workshops at HackerYou, from the moment they sign up to their experience post-workshop. You'll spend a lot of time on workshop curriculum design, making improvements to our existing workshops and also working with developers and other professionals in the tech industry to create the new workshops our community is asking for. In addition, you’ll be intensely focused on the collection of data and feedback so that you can appropriately prioritize changes (we want data to back up your “gut feelings”). We want to ensure that we are creating the most impactful, thoughtful, and enjoyable learning experiences in the whole world - and that’s why we need you!

Ultimately, you will be responsible for all aspects (curriculum, instructors as well as student experience) of all of our workshops (with the exception of the ones we run for free). We have huge plans for workshops at HackerYou for this year and beyond, and in this role there is the potential to directly impact over a thousand students a year. Though you'll only create and lead some of our workshops each year (many more will be led by others), you'll need to be very comfortable being at the front of the room because you'll also help instruct our Accelerated Web Development and JavaScript courses.

Reporting to our Director of Continuing Education, you will be an integral member of HackerYou’s 25-ish person team. We’re a close-knit and passionate team, and it’s important to us that everyone who joins us fits with our core values: 1) We are welcoming, 2) We care deeply about people, 3) We do what's right, 4) We are always improving, and 5) We have fun! If those values resonate with you, please...read on!

This role is ideal for a developer with two to three years of experience looking to make the switch into Product Management or build upon their developer skills by gaining some experience in a new area of technology. It’s also perfect for someone who has discovered a passion for teaching and mentoring, or for someone who wants to start their own business one day - this role will give you the chance to learn a whole bunch about startups, small businesses, technology and education while contributing to a team that really cares about what we do every day. Please note that we don’t care at all about things like degrees or diplomas. We care about finding great people to join our team, and then helping them to reach their full potential!

About us

Founded in 2012, HackerYou (also known as the HackerYou College of Technology, now that we’re a registered Private Career College) is a well-loved provider of hands-on, project-based training for people who want to learn to code or become professional developers! From our 12,000 square foot office in downtown Toronto, we run full-time and continuing education courses year-round. With thousands of alumni and 1000+ students a year, there’s a large community of people ready to welcome you to HackerYou!

Here's a sample of HackerYou's Product Manager (Workshops) responsibilities:

Maintaining and updating curriculum for our workshops using the latest best practices
Developing (or working with others to develop) new workshops based on the content our community is asking for
Creating brand new and highly creative exercises for our workshops (and working with our designers to ensure they’re remarkably beautiful!)
Creating methods for collecting indicators of workshop quality
Ensuring those who participate in our workshops are so passionate about their experiences that they want to leave reviews (and being comfortable asking them to!)
Instructing one evening or weekend Web Development or JavaScript program per calendar year (to ensure you’re always familiar with our offerings!)
Lead or co-lead Accelerated Web Development and Accelerated JavaScript courses throughout the year
Collaborating with the Head of Continuing Education, our CTO and the Bootcamp Team to ensure workshop curriculum is complementary to our other programs
Ensuring the HackerYou Instructor and Mentor Community is kept up-to-date about new workshops
Managing and marking Technical Challenges from students looking to join our workshops without completing prerequisites
Creating training documents and materials to ensure that every time we run a workshop, it’s at the highest level of quality
Contributing to the development and maintenance of HackerYou’s website and web applications
Your Qualifications

You are insanely creative and can come up with awesome ideas for making workshops, curriculum and even education in general way better than the status quo
You would be comfortable leading a group through lessons on HTML, CSS, JavaScript and React best practices
You have a track record of getting things done
You are comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets and Slides
You are not intimidated by numbers or light analysis in MS Excel
You can step in to make decisions and take ownership over a project
You can manage multiple projects, deadlines and priorities
You take pride in your ability to meet deadlines
You are driven to see projects and tasks through to completion
You have a ‘no job is too big or too small’ mentality
Most of all, you have a positive attitude and a desire to help others!
Please note that this is a full-time, permanent position beginning as soon as possible (but we’re flexible).

Perks & benefits

Please visit our Careers page at [hackeryou.com/careers](https://hackeryou.com/careers "HackerYou Careers") for a full list of perks & benefits.

How to apply

Please apply below! We’d love to see your resume, and anything else you’d like to provide us! All applications are appreciated, but we will only contact successful applicants to move on to the next stage.

job_title: Health Records Data Analyst - Health Data Resources REPOST
job_description:
TemporaryCompany Biography:
Across our three hospitals and eight satellite sites, Scarborough Health Network (SHN) is shaping the future of care. Our many programs and services are designed around the needs of one of Canada’s most vibrant and diverse communities. We are home to North America’s largest nephrology program, as well as the designated cardiac care and spine centre for Scarborough and surrounding communities to the east. We are proud to be a community-affiliated teaching site for the University of Toronto and partner with a number of other universities and colleges, helping to train the next generation of health care professionals. Learn more at shn.ca .

Position Overview:
As a Data Analyst, you will report to Manager of Health Records. The incumbent will be responsible for performing a variety of technical health information functions related to various databases within coding services. The Data Analyst is the liaison between the clinicians and the HIM professionals, ensuring data quality concerns are appropriately addressed as it relates to collection and optimization of clinical documentation. You may be scheduled at the General or Birchmount campus based on departmental needs.

Company Vacancy/Request for Transfer:
The completion of this online form serves as your application and will be used to determine if you meet the requirements of this position. Please ensure that you have provided all pertinent information necessary to be considered for this vacancy by the close date.

Requirements:

Possess a University degree or Diploma in Health Information Management
Current registration with Canadian Health Information Management Association (CHIMA)
Minimum 5 years acute care Inpatient(DAD) coding experience in a hospital setting
Knowledge of Canada’s Health Care System with thorough understanding of CIHI’s case mix grouping (CMG+) and Resource Intensity Weight (RIW) along with Ontario funding reform, HBAM Inpatient Grouper and HBAM Inpatient Weight (HIG)
Thorough knowledge and understanding of MIS guidelines
Experience working with WinRecs abstracting system and Meditech
Excellent skills and in depth knowledge of DAD and NACRS coding to perform chart audits for QA analysis
Must be proficient in scripting reports through Crystal report writer for data quality and reporting purposes
Responsible for pro-active and retrospective audits on coded data to ensure alignment with ICD-10/CCI standards and accuracy
Responsible for initiating analyses related to the quality of clinical documentation and the accuracy of its subsequent collection to ensure data quality standards
Develops, distributes and promotes materials with a focus on clinical documentation
The Data Analyst must have knowledge of providing data submission and correction files to CIHI, CCO and CCN
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Windows, Excel and Word)
Demonstrates values consistent with SHN’s Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization and develop and maintain respectful interpersonal relations
Excellent work performance, attention to detail and attendance and effective team work skills
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrates a commitment to customer service when dealing with patients, colleagues and volunteers and other members of the community and public
Demonstrates values consistent with SHN's Code of Conduct and is committed to fostering a healthy and positive work environment in accordance with Health & Safety policy and legislation.
Demonstrates an understanding of and commitment to SHN's comprehensive safety programs and practices including staff safety, patient safety, and environmental safety and participates in regular in-service education in this area.
Demonstrates excellent work performance and attendance record

Asset:

Ability to speak another language is an asset

Accommodation Statement:
Scarborough Health Network (SHN) embraces and celebrates our community’s unique multicultural heritage and diversity. SHN is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a culture of inclusiveness and diversity reflecting our diverse patients, staff and community alike. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Toronto, ONThe Digital Strategist has experience managing medium to large pay-per-click accounts. He or she has a strong analytical background and is proficient in account coordination. This position will be responsible for managing clients that use Trader’s advertising platform specifically paid media and social media optimization. The individual works with a wider team of analysts to help meet objectives around service, quality of work, customer metrics and productivity.

This position will participate in a small client-facing team for SEM, Display and Social Media. Specifically the role will focus on pay-per-click strategies for key VIP or Dealer Group Clients. Responsibilities will include analyzing data, management and tracking of KPIs, optimizing key accounts, providing weekly reports, and presenting strategic recommendations to clients.

Key Areas of Responsibility

Auditing, Optimization & Testing: Coordinate with analysts to ensure accounts are within acceptable KPI range. Perform weekly account analysis for key improvement areas and provide actionable insights. Develop testing/optimization process and schedule for account and dealer groups.
Reporting: Monitor, review, and update website traffic and web analytic reports. Gather and analyze data and prepare reports using our web optimization software, Monitor and report on monthly campaigns and statistical analysis, and present key KPI’s to be monitored monthly.
Stakeholder Management: Support VIP and Dealer Group Commercial Clients to optimize their SEM spend by offering intellectual marketing strategies and advice via: reviewing clients (who have purchased SEM solution) performance, in-depth knowledge of SEM optimization, leveraging reports produced by DSS software.
Providing Insight: Provide customer-specific insight to Customers and Trader staff on competitor and local markets. Provide market and industry context reporting. Make recommendations to clients and Trader Sales reps for potential up-sell products/services. Develop custom campaigns according to client objectives.

Self-motivated and results-driven with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced team environment.
Ability to provide executive level reporting on financial metrics and KPI’s for a team.
Passion for the power of content and web analytics.
Excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills; the ability to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization.

University degree or college diploma, preferably with a marketing major.
5 years of working experience in digital media, of which at least 3 focused on medium to large search engine marketing accounts.
Proven track record of results with pay-per-click accounts.
Working knowledge of SEM tools, optimization tactics, testing and web analytics.
Basic understanding of programmatic buying (social and display), SEO, website standards, usability testing, and website reporting tools.
Ability to use quantitative and qualitative metrics to communicate progress and identify meaningful trends.
High level of proficiency with the internet and MS Office (particularly Excel); demonstrated proficiency with Web-based applications; and knowledge of Web analytics software tools.
Experience in online media planning, media buying or campaign management would be an asset.
Knowledgeable about the latest trends in the search engine industry.
Google Adwords Certification and GAIQ is required.

We have an exciting opening for a Team Manager of Programming and Biostatistics team. In this role, the selected candidate will serve as a Lead on projects and guide and oversee the activities of Biometrics personnel.

Supervise, train and conduct performance reviews for staff

Highly motivated, self-driven, well-organized, team-oriented, versatile, and individuals focused on contributing to the long-term success the company

knowledge of clinical trial study design and electronic data submission

Background & Purpose of the Job
Are you a Procurement Manager with demonstrated experience handling million dollar spends? Do you love working with Global teams and sharing/adapting best practices? Is networking your strong suit? We are looking for you!
At Unilever, we act fast to anticipate consumer needs, fast to translate ideas into new products, and fast to make, distribute and market them. We build products that people enjoy, trust and use in their daily lives. Which is why, as part of Unilever, you could make an impact on a global and local scale.
A job at Unilever is a career made by you, with development opportunities, benefits and a working culture that supports diversity. You can craft your own career path as you work with the brands and people that drive our sustainable business growth.
In 2017, our total turnover reached € 53.7 Billion while North America (USA & Canada), as one of the biggest developed market represented 17.5% making us one of the largest Media buyers. North America Marketing and Business Services Procurement organization together handles over € 1 Billion spend including various of Marketing Bought In Services such as Agency, Ad Production and Market Research, various Marketing & Sales Promotions such as POSM, Premium, Field-force, Consumer Promotions and Shopper Marketing, various Business Services such as Employee Benefits, Facilities, Travel & Expenses, Contractors & Consultants Outsourced Services and last but not least company-wide IT services.
As a Procurement Market Manager, you will be an individual contributor based in Canada HQ while getting tremendous supports from our North America Hub team. With the level of engagements getting deeper, the team has the scope to expand to one or more employees, meaning you could manage a direct report.
Who You Are & What You’ll Do
You’re a born leader: Appreciative of the value and impact of outstanding execution – an eagle eye for detail. Acts as an entrepreneur, treats business as his/her own, sets trends and is willing to lead, follow or get out of the way. Has ability to handle ambiguity and to adapt leadership style to achieve high-performing motivated teams.
You’re a strategy guru: Excellent in idea generation, ideas that are forward thinking and that contribute to building sustained, competitive advantage.
You’re a dot connector: Have a deep understanding of the Market Research, IT/digital and organizational awareness, ability to see opportunities via aligning multiple groups to deliver higher levels of value for Unilever.
You’re a story teller: Strong at selling ideas to his/her business partners, internally and externally, translating those into effective proposals conveying our values and communicating it accordingly.
You’re an early adopter: Open-minded and have passion to learn and embrace new ideas.
Your areas of exploration include but are not limited to growing operational excellence to streamline MBS processes via early adoption of digital tools in market, incubator for new business model which could possibly roll out to North America and other markets. You are also expected to build strong connections with market and global portfolio teams on strategy alignment and timely best-practice sharing.
What You’ll Need To Succeed
At least a Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field of study
At least 5 years of relevant experience
A tenacious dedication to solving challenges in ambiguity
A strong command of the English language – both written and verbal– with the ability to convey often complex data to a variety of audiences
People management skills with emphasis on listening
Demonstrated Partner Management abilities
Thinker, challenger; somebody who would not accept status quo
Willing to travel to US Procurement Hub minimum once a quarter

Powered by state-of-the-art fibre optic and wireless networks, Eastlink delivers world-class video entertainment and communications services to residential, business and public sector customers across Canada. As one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 11 consecutive years, Eastlink provides high speed Internet, wireless, TV, telephone, security and automation, data communications and exclusive, locally-produced programming. Headquartered in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Eastlink is the largest privately owned telecommunications Company in Canada with an employee base of just over 1500 individuals.

Reporting to the Manager, Customer Insights & Analytic, and the Data Analyst is a key contributor to create data-driven solutions to deliver business insights and enable better decisions to drive growth.

This is a four month term position.

Responsibilities

Work with various teams to identify and integrate new data sources to address business needs.
Explore various sources of information to uncover business opportunities and customer insights.
Develop, test, and score predictive and prescriptive statistical models.
Present findings, conclusions and recommendations in a clear and understandable way.

Experience & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics or a relevant discipline;
Strong background in statistics and data analytics;
Proficiency in Python and/or R;
Proficiency in SQL;
Experience with data visualization tools. Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau;
Experience with Alteryx is considered an asset.

The successful candidate will have an inquisitive mindset with strong analytical and problem solving skills. They will have a drive to learn and master new technologies and have the ability to leverage information assets to support business goals and strategies.

Why Choose Eastlink?

Eastlink brings you technology in a way that people would want it. We work hard to provide the best products – Internet, TV, Wireless, Telephone, and Security and Automation – to keep our customers connected to the things and people that matter the most. By putting our customers and their needs at the centre of it all we can show them something special and provide a unique brand experience.

We are extremely proud of our employees and believe the best people make the best companies. As we continue to grow, our goal is to continue to attract the best people.

Dedicated to representing all of the customers we serve, we embrace diversity throughout all levels of the organization and encourage members of equity groups to self-identify during the application process.

Ready to explore an exciting career at Eastlink? Your journey begins here.

job_title: Manager - Admitting and Emergency Department Registration
job_description:
Milton, ONPermanentPosting #2019-838957
Non-Union
Position: Manager, Patient Registration and Admitting
Department: Patient Registration and Admitting
Status: Permanent Full-time
Hours: Mon - Fri, 7.5 hour day shifts (hours subject to change based on operational needs)
Site: Primarily Milton with travel to Georgetown site as required
This is what you'll be doing:
Responsible for the leadership, mentorship and direction regarding all aspects of ED and Admitting patient registration, cash handling, appointment booking and order entry. Oversees the registration and cashiering functionality, data quality and analysis of same, ensuring personnel performing such functions adhere to the organizational rules and standards. Responsible for the recruitment, training, supervision, discipline and work scheduling of clerical personnel. Ensure all mandatory data elements required by the Ministry of Health and Halton Healthcare are collected and accurate. Manages daily operations of the Milton and Georgetown Admitting and Emergency Registration Departments, by assessing work methods, developing and/or updating policies and procedures, directing and monitoring work practices, providing guidance and support in terms of customer service, finance and patient flow. Liaise with other Managers of personnel who perform registration/cashiering duties, providing support, guidance and documentation of performance, to assist them in their own supervisory responsibilities.
This is what you'll need to do it:
Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.
Minimum of 5 years of management experience in a related field, supported by a solid and thorough knowledge of related standards and legislation.
Working knowledge of the Canadian Council of Health Facilities Accreditation Guidelines and the Public Hospitals Act, as well as ERNI metric reporting requirements.
Minimum of five years’ previous relevant experience in an acute care hospital environment. Exceptional organization, mathematical and analytical abilities.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure.
Ability to communicate effectively in all mediums.
Experience developing and maintaining Meditech modules, related to admitting and registration functionality.
Ability to communicate with and relate to many diverse groups of people, including Management, Finance, Clinicians and Information Systems.
Exemplary attendance record.
Date Posted: March 19, 2019
Internal applications due by: March 26, 2019
If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we'd like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.
We thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.
All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products, We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

This position is primarily responsible for the development, operationalization and implementation of the School of Pharmacy’s Programmatic Assessment Plan, which includes establishing benchmarks and developing tools for assessing outcomes. The Programmatic Assessment Manager is also responsible for managing the Institutional Quality Assurance Process (IQAP) for Pharmacy programs at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. This involves managing the cyclical review of academic programs, proposals for new programs and reporting of program major modifications. Included in the Quality Assurance Process is managing the accreditation of the School’s PharmD program through the Canadian Council for the Accreditation of Pharmacy Programs (CCAPP).

The Programmatic Assessment Manager reports to the Administrative Officer and takes academic direction and is accountable to the Programmatic Assessment Officer. The position is supported by the Administrative Coordinator, Assessment.
Responsibilities
Oversee the Development, Operationalization and Implementation of the Programmatic Assessment Plan
Develop, enhance, finalize and maintain the Programmatic Assessment Plan that includes establishing benchmarks and tools to measure performance against internal and external (e.g. Accreditation) standards
Using assessment results as a guide, suggest modifications to the Plan that guide continuous improvement processes and ensure continuing compliance with accreditation standards. Excellence in programmatic assessment and ongoing maintenance of the Programmatic Assessment Plan is a requirement for accreditation of the undergraduate PharmD degree
Disseminate results that arise from program evaluation and assessment; this requires incumbent to establish and nurture strong partnerships and relationships with faculty and teaching staff in the School of Pharmacy given the sensitivity of the results
Develop Standard Operating Procedures for maintenance of all aspects of the Plan (e.g. SOP for the yearly evaluation of midpoint assessments)
Lead the development and implementation of a variety of formative and summative assessments (e.g. graduating student survey, alumni survey, employer survey, relevant focus groups, midpoint exam) including coordinating assessment tool use and analyzing and reporting results
Manage the continuous improvement cycle based on the results of programmatic assessment and Assessment Committee directives
Develop, maintain and update evaluation databases
Prepare periodic statistical and analytical reports on curricular outcome measures
Develop and implement global and curriculum evaluation plans to ensure defined educational and strategic outcomes are met
Manage the PharmD curricular mapping activities that relate to programmatic assessment and accreditation including ongoing relevant development of the database, reporting and mapping course objectives to NAPRA competencies and AFPC outcomes
Develop assessment tools and strategies
Write evaluation questions, select appropriate methods, apply appropriate analytic techniques
Liaise with individuals in similar positions in other units and institutions (e.g., AFPC’s Program Evaluation and Assessment Special Interest Groups)
Serve as a key member of the Assessment and Curriculum committees
Accreditation
Organize, plan and prepare documentation for cyclical reviews of the undergraduate and graduate programs
Coordinate site visits
Student and Teacher Evaluation
Establish processes for continuous assessment of teaching and learning
Develop an algorithm to identify those requiring both peer and student teaching evaluation
Develop and implement a comprehensive strategy for assessment of teaching
Oversee the student evaluation process
Qualifications
Graduate degree in education, psychology or a related field required; equivalent education and experience will be considered
PhD in Educational Measurement and Evaluation preferred
Minimum of three years’ experience in programmatic evaluation and assessment required; course and curriculum design experience preferred
Training and experience with program evaluation, collection and interpretation of qualitative data, the alignment of curriculum/instructional design with assessment methods, and learning theory required
Experience in research methods — quantitative, qualitative, and mixed approaches to facilitate the development of appropriate methods to generate the type of data needed to answer evaluation questions required
Experience in personnel management, including experience in developing and maintaining senior-level relationships required
Excellent interpersonal skills to engage and motivate faculty and teaching staff to participate in assessment activities together with experience building and working within collaborative environments required
Exceptional communication skills with demonstrated judgment, tact and diplomacy, including demonstrated ability to influence without authority
Exceptional time management and organization skills required
Ability to proactively anticipate challenges and show initiative in resolving issues
Advanced knowledge of database management and programming in Microsoft Access, with intermediate knowledge in other Microsoft products
Survey and focus group design/administration (Google forms, Qualtrics, Survey Monkey) and stats (R, SPSS, etc.) software experience preferred
Some evening or weekend responsibilities

Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP is currently seeking a Business Planning and Analytics Manager. Reporting to the Director, Business Planning & Analysis, and this position provides high quality financial support to Practice Groups and Business Services departments. This role will be closely aligned to Practice Group leaders to facilitate and analyze budget, revenue and resource processes and objectives to ensure a consistent approach across all practice groups. This position will assist with profitability and pricing analysis to help practices improve financial results and support decision making. This role also liaises with Global Business Information/BP and & A resources to ensure that Canada remains aligned with Global best practices and effectively utilizes our global platform.

The Role

Liaise with the Practice Heads and Business Services’ leaders on a monthly basis to review performance and drive decision making. Act as coordination point for Practice Group leaders for matters relating to other service areas
Leading budget and forecast preparation for Practice Groups and Business Services departments
Review, analyze and forecast monthly and yearly financial results and explain significant variances
Prepare profitability analysis (matters, files, clients, rates etc.)
Ad hoc financial analysis and reporting
Assist pricing managers in the preparation of RFPs and pricing analysis, where required
Contribute and support practice areas and services in business planning and project decisions
Provide financial training to partners, associates and Business Services leaders
The quality and accuracy of the financial and statistical reports as well as the analysis of practice groups and services are part of the manager's scope of work.
Participate in creating and implementing policies and procedures
Skills and Experience Required

Professional accounting or equivalent designation together with 7 years of experience (including supervisory experience), preferably in a professional service industry
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization
Experience manipulating large amounts of information to generate concise, strategic recommendations
Strong technical ability to utilize analytical systems and tools (BOBJ, Tableau, etc.)
Team player with strong leadership
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to manage deadlines and balance priorities
Flexibility to accommodate work demands
Establish effective working relationships with colleagues in other service areas and offices


Norton Rose Fulbright


Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. We have more than 3800 lawyers and other legal staff based in more than 50 cities across Europe, the United States, Canada, Latin America, Asia, Australia, Africa, the Middle East and Central Asia.

Recognized for our industry focus, we are strong across all the key industry sectors: financial institutions; energy; infrastructure, mining and commodities; transport; technology and innovation; and life sciences and healthcare.

Wherever we are, we operate in accordance with our global business principles of quality, unity and integrity. We aim to provide the highest possible standard of legal service in each of our offices and to maintain that level of quality at every point of contact.

Norton Rose Fulbright US LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright Australia, Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP and Norton Rose Fulbright South Africa Inc are separate legal entities and all of them are members of Norton Rose Fulbright Verein, a Swiss verein. Norton Rose Fulbright Verein helps coordinate the activities of the members but does not itself provide legal services to clients.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity is an important firm value. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and to providing a workplace which is free from discrimination and harassment. This means that all job applicants, employees and partners will receive equal treatment regardless of race, colour, ethnic or national origins, sex, marital status, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief.

To apply, please visit the Careers page of our website at www.nortonrosefulbright.com. We thank all candidates for their application, but will be contacting only those whom we select to invite for an interview.

Under the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. Lead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
Working within our Customer Care team, you will have accountability to develop and implement structural and replicable forecasting models to support long-term and short-term projections of volume, staffing requirements, average handle time and hold time, attrition for the Customer Care Team including new business, new programs (e.g. loyalty), and new technology impacts.
This position will provide comprehensive monthly volume forecasts for budget and capacity planning purposes and work with the Customer Care Director and other internal and external stakeholders to provide and access information for capacity and budgetary planning. This position will also liaise with vendors to ensure appropriate information flow and incorporation of forecast inputs. Other responsibilities will include the evaluation and analysis of daily operations results to assess risks/exposures to upcoming staff forecasts as well as provide formal, in-depth communication about forecasting plans, results, and future challenges.

What You'll Do:
Define, describe and implement strategic planning & forecasting, through collaboration with internal and external/vendor resources
Maintain and develop necessary loyalty and retail operational and performance reports
Assess and prioritize current and changing workload and reporting needs
Evaluate current utilization of resources and provide recommendations to generate efficiencies in staffing through data collection, analysis, and reporting to maximize operational productivity
Respond to business unit inquiries for reporting and analysis
Track and analyze historical volumes and patterns
Track and analyze agent performance metrics (schedule compliance, absenteeism, average handle time and general kpis)
Work with cross-functional teams within the business to improve customer service processes
Create long term and short-term forecasts , including financials
Identifies trends and averages on a daily, weekly, monthly and seasonal basis
Reviews forecast-to-actual workload variance and determines if adjustments to future forecasts are necessary
Adjusts workforce requirements based on changing / dynamic forecasts; reforecasts when necessary
Develops and maintains historical data (e.g. absenteeism, attrition, management investment, call volume, productivity, service level performance, and staffing adherence etc )
Filling adhoc reporting needs for business stakeholder through an open analytics environment
Stay on top of best practices in reporting and analytics
Present results in a in a concise, decisive format for various stakeholders
Ability to integrate various data streams into a coherent, accurate view of program activities
Provide data that supports weekly dashboard

What You'll Need:
Experience with data manipulation, analysis, and modeling
MS Excel – experience presenting data
Salesforce experience a definite asset
SQL and an understanding of relational databases
MS PowerPoint – the ability to consolidate complicated data in a concise, decisive format for senior stakeholders
Understanding of experimental design methodologies
Experience with web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics)
Strong attention to detail
A desire to proactively improve Customer Care processes
An understanding of call volume forecasting and the ability to analyze historical data to create accurate forecasting
Preferred: Background in Analytics, Mathematics, Econometrics/statistics (or related field)
Previous experitence in a Call Center
Minimum: Undergraduate degree - with related experience in quantitative analysis

*Integrated Marketing Analytics, Manager – Toronto*
Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's entertainment company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
What’s it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.
The Job:
A successful candidate would be able to analyze large qualities of data and be able to distill what’s important into dashboards accompanied by strong insights and recommendations that would help the marketing COE (center of excellence) team making decisions on marketing activities. This involves in-depth analysis of competitive brands, media activity performance, developing sales profiles, retailer segmentation and brand life cycles.
This role would also require the ability to utilize all data sources to develop an executive dashboard with clearly defined KPI’s that ladder up to business objectives allowing the Executive teams to make effective decisions.
What we can expect from you:
Identify actionable insights and provide recommendations for marketing optimization and budget allocation across marketing channels
Build basic attribution models for determining true drivers and impact of multi-channel/multi-touch marketing
Develop strategy for consistent metrics, reporting, testing, analysis, and forecasting to support marketing decision making and improve understanding of marketing performance for individual channels and across all channels
Partner with marketing agencies to gather and clean data, audit validity of data, develop naming conventions and manage automation of marketing reports
Present recommendations to senior-level executives and measure effectiveness of recommendations by monitoring their impact
Continuously evolve metrics used to measure the effectiveness and ROI of activity across all campaign types
Create and manage development of new data structures to capture data as needed
Job Requirements
Who’s a good fit for this team:
An individual with the ability to build and maintain relationships, both externally and internally
Self-directed, proactive and able to define and execute projects independently
High proficiency in Excel
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical people in an effective manner
Ability to present findings to senior management and display a comfort level in responding to any and all questions
You should apply if you have the following:
Bachelor Degree required (Business, Marketing, Statistics, Economics or similar), Master Degree preferred.
3 - 5 years of experience in a similar role (Marketing Intelligence, Analytics, Data Scientist etc.)
What you can expect from us:
Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values:
Integrity
Open Mindset
Innovation
Partnerships
Collaboration
Driving Results
Entrepreneurship
