With our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational
The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

The Team

Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP is currently seeking a Business Planning and Analytics Manager. Reporting to the Director, Business Planning & Analysis, and this position provides high quality financial support to Practice Groups and Business Services departments. This role will be closely aligned to Practice Group leaders to facilitate and analyze budget, revenue and resource processes and objectives to ensure a consistent approach across all practice groups. This position will assist with profitability and pricing analysis to help practices improve financial results and support decision making. This role also liaises with Global Business Information/BP and & A resources to ensure that Canada remains aligned with Global best practices and effectively utilizes our global platform.

The Role

Liaise with the Practice Heads and Business Services’ leaders on a monthly basis to review performance and drive decision making. Act as coordination point for Practice Group leaders for matters relating to other service areas
Leading budget and forecast preparation for Practice Groups and Business Services departments
Review, analyze and forecast monthly and yearly financial results and explain significant variances
Prepare profitability analysis (matters, files, clients, rates etc.)
Ad hoc financial analysis and reporting
Assist pricing managers in the preparation of RFPs and pricing analysis, where required
Contribute and support practice areas and services in business planning and project decisions
Provide financial training to partners, associates and Business Services leaders
The quality and accuracy of the financial and statistical reports as well as the analysis of practice groups and services are part of the manager's scope of work.
Participate in creating and implementing policies and procedures
Skills and Experience Required

Professional accounting or equivalent designation together with 7 years of experience (including supervisory experience), preferably in a professional service industry
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization
Experience manipulating large amounts of information to generate concise, strategic recommendations
Strong technical ability to utilize analytical systems and tools (BOBJ, Tableau, etc.)
Team player with strong leadership
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to manage deadlines and balance priorities
Flexibility to accommodate work demands
Establish effective working relationships with colleagues in other service areas and offices


Norton Rose Fulbright


Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. We have more than 3800 lawyers and other legal staff based in more than 50 cities across Europe, the United States, Canada, Latin America, Asia, Australia, Africa, the Middle East and Central Asia.

Recognized for our industry focus, we are strong across all the key industry sectors: financial institutions; energy; infrastructure, mining and commodities; transport; technology and innovation; and life sciences and healthcare.

Wherever we are, we operate in accordance with our global business principles of quality, unity and integrity. We aim to provide the highest possible standard of legal service in each of our offices and to maintain that level of quality at every point of contact.

Norton Rose Fulbright US LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright Australia, Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP and Norton Rose Fulbright South Africa Inc are separate legal entities and all of them are members of Norton Rose Fulbright Verein, a Swiss verein. Norton Rose Fulbright Verein helps coordinate the activities of the members but does not itself provide legal services to clients.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity is an important firm value. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and to providing a workplace which is free from discrimination and harassment. This means that all job applicants, employees and partners will receive equal treatment regardless of race, colour, ethnic or national origins, sex, marital status, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief.

To apply, please visit the Careers page of our website at www.nortonrosefulbright.com. We thank all candidates for their application, but will be contacting only those whom we select to invite for an interview.

Toronto, ONLead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

Closing date: 20 June 2019 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada and Canadian citizens residing abroad.
Apply online
Important messages
We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Assessment accommodation
When you apply to this selection process, you are not applying for a specific job, but to an inventory for future vacancies. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
Duties
What you will be doing:
The Life Insurance Group (LIG) is seeking motivated individuals to participate in the supervision, analysis and assessment of Canada’s federally regulated life insurance institutions using a risk-based approach. LIG is a division within the Insurance Supervision Sector, which includes three divisions: LIG, Property and Casualty Group and Actuarial Division. LIG is comprised of two sub-groups: Conglomerate Life Insurance Companies (LIG-C) and Non-Conglomerate Life Insurance Companies (LIG-NC). While the current position is in LIG-C, a pool of qualified candidates may be established to staff potential vacancies arising within either LIG-C or LIG-NC. The candidate’s accountabilities may include:
Interacting with Senior Management, Board of Directors and other key stakeholders at Federally Regulated Financial Institutions (FRFIs).Assessing the inherent risks and determining factors that drive the risk profile at FRFIs.Ongoing monitoring of FRFIs including analysing regulatory returns and other information, with an emphasis on capital strength and emerging risks.Leading assessments/reviews of significant activities or control functions at FRFIs.Working with OSFI’s Risk Support Sector, including specialists from the Actuarial Division, Credit Risk Division, Operational Risk Division, Model Risk Division, Risk Surveillance and Analytics Division, Culture and Conduct Risk Division, and Market and Liquidity Risk Division.Working with external supervisory partners (National and International).Identifying best practices and emerging trends.
Who you are:
You should possess the following attributes:
You are an individual with a broad financial industry and risk management perspective.You are keenly interested in contributing your expertise to promote a safer financial system.You have sound knowledge of the current and emerging risks in the financial services industry, including insurance.You know the techniques used in the measurement and management of current and emerging risks.You work well with others.Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision-making.
Work environment
Who we are:
The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) is an independent agency of the Government of Canada, established in 1987 to contribute to the safety and soundness of the Canadian financial system. OSFI supervises and regulates federally registered banks and insurers, trust and loan companies, as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight.

What OSFI offers:
OSFI is a separate agency that offers a competitive salary and eligibility for performance pay annually.
People are the foundation of our organisation. You will become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone has varied experience and fosters an environment where communication and teamwork amplify our effectiveness. Working at OSFI offers the following:
Mandate – the work you do at OSFI matters. Your efforts contribute to the safety and soundness of the Canadian Financial Sector. A strong financial sector promotes competition, and benefits all Canadians.Learning & Development – our organisation understands that ongoing learning and development is critical and necessary, and must evolve with developments in the Financial Sector. Learning and Development is a component of our Human Capital Strategy.Community & Culture – we strive to create a working environment that allows employees to work to their fullest potential. We strive to promote employee wellbeing, including a focus on balancing work and personal needs. Where available, we offer opportunities for flexible working arrangements.Benefits – As a Federal Government Agency, OSFI offers a number of competitive benefits to its employees, including a Defined Benefit Pension Plan, maternity and parental leave benefits and vacation (4 weeks), personal and family leave days.
Intent of the process
The intent of this process is to staff a Manager position within the Life Insurance Group.

This selection process may be used to establish a pool of qualified candidates, which could be used to staff similar or identical positions with various linguistic profiles and requirements, security profiles and various tenures.
Positions to be filled: 1

Your résumé.

A university degree specializing in accounting, actuarial science, business, commerce, economics, mathematics or other relevant field OR an acceptable combination of relevant experience, education and/or training.
Degree equivalency

Recent and significant experience working in the life insurance industry that includes involvement in various areas such as Risk Management, Compliance or Actuarial Oversight, Internal Audit, External Audit (includes experience in assessing risk and control effectiveness within the insurance sector), product development, analysis of profitability, strategic planning, mergers and acquisitions or consulting.Recent and significant experience in identifying key risk areas and assessing risk management and oversight practices in the life insurance industry.Recent and significant experience in analyzing financial results specific to the life insurance and/or reinsurance industry, including capital.Experience communicating and presenting complex issues to senior executives within the financial services sector and/or OSFI.

The Public Service of Canada is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that reflects the Canadians we serve. We promote employment equity and encourage you to indicate if you belong to one of the designated groups when you apply.
Information on employment equity
For this selection process, it is our intention to communicate with candidates via email. Candidates must include a valid email address in their application. It is the candidate’s responsibility to ensure accurate information is provided and updated as required. As a result you must update your personal information on your Public Service Resourcing System profile if it changes.

RESUMES:
Applicants must clearly demonstrate using sufficient details, how they meet the education and experience factors listed under the essential qualifications, as well as any of the asset qualifications that are applicable, including timelines of when this experience was gained (please indicate month and year). Lack of DETAILS may result in your application being rejected as the Assessment Board may have insufficient information to determine whether you meet the qualifications.

SCREENING QUESTIONS (if applicable):
It is the responsibility of the candidate to clearly outline that they meet each of the screening criteria (i.e. Education and Experience Qualifications, both Essential and Assets) by RESPONDING TO THE SCREENING QUESTIONS IN THE ONLINE APPLICATION. Please note that it is not sufficient to only state that the requirement is met or to provide a listing of current responsibilities, rather the candidate must provide concrete examples that illustrate how they meet the requirement. Your resume will be used to validate the answers provided; therefore, it should also contain sufficient details regarding your education and experience.

REFERENCE CHECKS/PERFORMANCE REVIEWS:
As part of the assessment, reference checks may be sought and candidates may be required to submit their performance reviews. For internal candidates of the Public Service, the Assessment Committee reserves the right to contact the internal candidates’ current manager(s).


Your application may be used to assess written communication.

Management may choose to invoke an asset(s) at any point of the process.

Internal indeterminate employees of OSFI at the same group and level or equivalent may be considered for deployment or assignment before considering applicants in the advertised appointment process.

An assignment/secondment or an acting appointment requires approval of your supervisor.

OSFI is a separate agency with its own classification and compensation system. OSFI's staffing is subject to the Public Service Employment Act (PSEA).

The client organization will accept applications on-line only. All job applications must therefore be submitted through the Public Service Resourcing System. To submit an application on-line, please select the button 'Apply online' below. Persons with disabilities preventing them from applying on-line are asked to contact 1-800-645-5605.

Applicants with disabilities: If you require special accommodation at any stage in the selection process, including technical aid to ensure an equitable assessment of your qualifications, please inform us by sending an e-mail to the following address Toronto.HR@osfi-bsif.gc.ca.

Please note that achieving the pass mark on any of the assessments used does not mean you will move forward in the selection process. Management may decide to use a score that is higher than the pass mark on any of the evaluations used throughout the selection process. Management may also decide to use top-down selection at any stage of the process.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans and to Canadian citizens, in that order, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.

Markham, ONJob Description:
XPERIGO IS AN EXCITING PLACE TO WORK. For 25 years,
Xperigo has provided products and services to the
automotive sector in Canada. Working with some of the
biggest and most prestigious automotive brands in the
world, Xperigo has developed industry-leading solutions
that have fueled rapid growth. With a keen focus on
innovation, Xperigo has expanded its suite of services
and solidified our place as a strategic partner to our
many clients. Xperigo is fast becoming a global force in
the automotive sector.
Proudly Canadian, Xperigo has provided B2B roadside
assistance services in Canada and recently expanded into
the U.S. market in 2017. We provide private label
roadside services to top automobile manufacturers,
rental car companies and other organizations with large
vehicle fleets. We are dedicated to providing best
in-class customer experiences to our clients and are
continually looking for new and innovative ways to
exceed our client's expectations.
Currently our Strategy & Innovation team is looking for
a full-time Analytics Manager to join the team. Key

responsibilities include:

Design and develop leading-edge predictive analytic

business solutions & proof of concepts to help
increase business efficiency & productivity

Work with field services, operations and IT teams to

understand and analyze data points generated

Gleam insights from time-based data as well as video

and image feed and provide them to customer in a
timely manner, through an intuitive product design

Utilize multidisciplinary approach to Data Analytic

problems to combine technical, analytics and
business knowledge

Partner closely with business stakeholders across

the larger CAA enterprise to create best technical
solutions to meet their needs

Explore various sources of information to uncover

new business opportunities at all levels (strategic
to operational)

Recommend improvements to streamline processes

regarding data gathering to improve data accuracy,
usability and value

Work with IT teams across various sister

organizations to ensure maximum productivity and
collaboration

To be successful in this role, you’ll need to be a

strong coder with a well-developed ability to
analyze the soundness of data

Become the SME for all things Predictive &

Prescriptive Analytics related at Xperigo

Over time, build a highly motivated, dynamic and

collaborative team working on gleaming insights and
analytics from operations.
Job Requirements

Ability to code and develop prototypes in languages

such as Python, C++, Java, Scala, SQL

Experience with Relational Databases, ETL/Data

Modelling/Star Schema design and development

Experience working with sourcing and feeding data

from REST/SOAP apis (e.g., Omniture, Salesforce,
SurveyMonkey, etc.) is nice to have

Hands-on experience with relational databases (e.g.

Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, etc.)
Preferred Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics,

or equivalent. Master's or PhD in these fields is a
plus.

Experience with big data processing for analytics

and/or AI

Experience with Azure or AWS cloud systems

Toronto, ONWith our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational

Toronto, ONAt Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

As the General Manager of JUMP Canada, you will have the opportunity to shape and lead one of JUMP’s landmark projects. You will play a vital role in all aspects of the program’s success, from diverse and intelligent hiring, to engaging and on-brand community outreach, navigating regulatory relationships, driving customer acquisition, motivating the operational team, and creative problem solving.

The role is centered on continual improvement and high quality. It requires a highly versatile and well rounded leader, someone who can create and drive strategy but also roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. It’s the intersection of leadership, analytics, creativeness, and problem solving that makes the JUMP GM an exciting and challenging job.
What You’ll Do
Define and implement JUMP’s operational, marketing, and policy strategy in your city
Recruit, build, and lead a team of Ops rockstars. You will be responsible for defining hiring needs in your city and bringing on top Ops talent to help execute on the day-to-day, while also setting the future strategy.
Leading by example and establishing a fun, inclusive, and safe work environment.
Oversee budgeting, P&L performance, and financial optimization to reach profitability targets
Growth of the business. Execution is key. You will be responsible for growing trips, ridership, and revenue in a highly competitive space.
Manage all aspects of operational activities, such as process creation, expansion plans, deployment of bicycles and charging stations - all with the goal of creating a highly efficient operations.
Initiate key marketing activities, communications, social media, partnerships, and events
Represent JUMP at in the community local events, in local media, and in communication with external stakeholders
Contribute and share best practices with JUMP HQ
What You’ll Need
7+ years proven success in a similar role - leading operations/logistics, leading diverse teams, developing procedures, optimizing systems, and achieving benchmark operational goals
Analytical Thinking. Data-driven mentality and strong business judgment. Able to roll up your sleeves and analyze the data and pull key insights for your team.
Strong interpersonal skills. Able to build and manage strong relationships with their team, cross-functional colleagues, and external partners
Experience with executing marketing campaigns and driving data-backed, creative marketing initiatives. Experience with CRM tools and A/B testing a plus.
Entrepreneurship mentality. Must be a self-starter and leader that assumes the risks and rewards of running an innovative sustainable operation.
Exceptional communication and organizational skills. Able to communicate and listen effectively; great written, verbal and presentation skills
Leadership by example. Able to motivate, inspire and create an inclusive and positive work environment for all.
A passion for bikeshare, JUMP, and growing and leading a team. Passionate about the overall goals of bike share and sustainable transportation
BA/BS with impressive academic record. Advanced degree a plus.
Bonus Points if...
French language skills
About the Team

JUMP Bikes is building the future of urban mobility: shared electric bikes that are the quickest, most enjoyable, and most empowering way to get around a city. Cheaper than most public transit and faster than cars in traffic, JUMP e-bikes are game-changers for local transportation. Founded in 2010, JUMP pioneered dockless bike share and has deployed more than 14,000 bikes in 6 countries. This year JUMP is launching the next generation of bike share in San Francisco, Washington DC, Chicago, and other top tier US markets. Our goal is to transform cities, making them more sustainable, equitable, and livable through electric mobility.
To make this vision a reality, we need to grow our team. We place tremendous value on our company’s roots and culture: a mix of ingenuity, controlled chaos, hard work, and sense of purpose. This is a great opportunity to join a rapidly growing team that is shaping the future of transportation.

Toronto, ON*Integrated Marketing Analytics, Manager – Toronto*
Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's entertainment company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
What’s it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.
The Job:
A successful candidate would be able to analyze large qualities of data and be able to distill what’s important into dashboards accompanied by strong insights and recommendations that would help the marketing COE (center of excellence) team making decisions on marketing activities. This involves in-depth analysis of competitive brands, media activity performance, developing sales profiles, retailer segmentation and brand life cycles.
This role would also require the ability to utilize all data sources to develop an executive dashboard with clearly defined KPI’s that ladder up to business objectives allowing the Executive teams to make effective decisions.
What we can expect from you:
Identify actionable insights and provide recommendations for marketing optimization and budget allocation across marketing channels
Build basic attribution models for determining true drivers and impact of multi-channel/multi-touch marketing
Develop strategy for consistent metrics, reporting, testing, analysis, and forecasting to support marketing decision making and improve understanding of marketing performance for individual channels and across all channels

The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

Under the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .

Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization

Norton Rose Fulbright


Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. Recognized for our industry focus, we are strong across all the key industry sectors: financial institutions; energy; infrastructure, mining and commodities; transport; technology and innovation; and life sciences and healthcare.

Toronto, ONProduct Manager, Analytics
Why work with us?
At LoyaltyOne, we are problem solvers who love the challenge of the riddle. We help find solutions without being asked. We have an ingrained streak of determination and don’t settle for good enough. We are passionate about shaping shopper behavior and we care deeply about giving back to the communities around us.

Are you always looking for opportunities to change things for the better and drive innovation? Do you bring an ‘owner’ mentality to everything that you do?
If you answered yes to all of the above, come join us! This is your chance to be part of an amazing team at LoyaltyOne and work for one of the “best companies in Canada”. As a Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to leverage our amazing knowledge about customer behaviour to build interactive tools to surface insights for clients.
What you’ll do…
Reporting to the AVP, Program Analytics, you’ll work with internal stakeholders, visualization experts, data scientists and data engineers to create powerful analytical products that help surface customer insights for our internal and external users.
Create roadmaps and become a strategic partner to the business.
Liaise with our data engineering center of excellence to understand our data, data processing and key components that can accelerate development.
Lead the vision, planning, development, and launch of new products and features; think in big picture terms but deliver on the details.
Understand and keep up-to-date with emerging technologies, trends and innovative solutions being implemented across the industry.
Prioritize and plan features based on customer priorities and business values, making educated, data-driven trade-offs and decisions as needed.
Review and refine user stories in addition to acting as a technical consultant to various teams
Partner with developers to ensure major milestones are being met and continuously identify process gaps and implement solutions accordingly.
Qualification:What you’ll need…
2 - 5 years’ experience in Product Management and/or Analytics
Experience working in agile environments
Knowledge of analytics, data, predictive modeling and/or data visualization
Excellent project management skills, including ability to translate business objectives into IT requirements and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to partner & build relationships easily/influence others
Excellent communication & storytelling skills
Strong comfort level with ambiguity
Ability to prioritize competing demands based on business value
Highly skilled at stakeholder communication and expectation management
About LoyaltyOne
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At LoyaltyOne, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions.
Across AIR MILES, BrandLoyalty, Precima and Global Solutions, our businesses help some of the world's leading retailers connect with consumers and deliver more value in every visit. Regardless of their role or geographic location, our people are always supported by one of the best teams around.
At LoyaltyOne, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities.
LoyaltyOne is an Alliance Data company. For more information, visit www.loyalty.com
About ADS
Alliance Data® (NYSE: ADS) is a leading global provider of data-driven marketing and loyalty solutions serving large, consumer-based industries. The Company creates and deploys customized solutions, enhancing the critical customer marketing experience; the result is measurably changing consumer behavior while driving business growth and profitability for some of today's most recognizable brands. Alliance Data helps its clients create and increase customer loyalty through solutions that engage millions of customers each day across multiple touch points using traditional, digital, mobile and emerging technologies. An S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company headquartered in Plano, Texas, Alliance Data consists of three businesses that together employ more than 16,000 associates at approximately 100 locations worldwide. www.alliancedata.com

Toronto, ONEver wonder what it’s like to work on products that touch one-third of Canadians every day? Welcome to Loblaw Digital, where we build some of Canada’s most loved products. From grocery, apparel, prestige-beauty, health & wellness and loyalty, we’re the digital engine of growth for Canada’s largest retailer.
We operate as a start-up and move twice as fast using lean and agile methodologies as we build the products that Canadians love including web and mobile apps for Loblaw Click & Collect (loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), Joe Fresh (joefresh.com) and PC Optimum (pcoptimum.ca).
In 2013, Loblaw acquired Shoppers Drug Mart and as a result our world is expanding into new spaces. The scale and impact of our products continues to grow at an exponential pace which means the data that we extract and learn from continues to grow. We’re looking for a Web Analytics Manager who can lead our team through best practices for web analytics and enable them to be self-sufficient in the tools and practices of web analytics. This is how we aim to scale!
Responsibilities:
• Design, implement and maintain web analytics solutions/products
• Oversee the delivery of web analytics implementation projects
• Support Developers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Merchandizers, Marketers, Operations specialists and Customer service through their reporting needs (ad hoc reports; insights; best practices)
• Help us in our mission to be a hypotheses-driven product development organization which means analytics are at the centre of everything we do
• Be an enabler by showing others how to master the analytics tools available to them, thereby empowering our team and getting us to scale
Requirements:
• 4+ years’ experience in the implementation of Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics 360
• 4+ years’ experience building dashboards and custom reports to derive business insights from raw data
• Solid understanding of HTML/JavaScript and Tag Management tools (Adobe DTM, Google Tag Manager, etc.)
• Knowledge of common web analytics best practices
• Bachelor degree in a quantitative field required (Engineering, CS, Math, Physics, etc.)
• Solid stakeholder management skills
• Bonus if you’ve coded before
• Ability to work independently and sift through ambiguity
• Strong attention to detail and project management skills
Loblaw Colleague Perks:
• 10% Colleague Discount Program on eligible products sold at Loblaw stores.
• Ongoing career development through in-house training programs, tuition assistance and support for professional designations.
• Sharing in the growth of Loblaw with our Employee Share Ownership Plan.
• Corporate rate fitness club memberships for colleagues as well as eligible family members.
• Helping you help others with our Volunteer Grant Program.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.
If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.
Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.
Apply today.

Full time

Regular

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing
In this role you will report to the Senior Director, Practice Management, Central Audit Services Team, and support various Internal Audit groups on all aspects of (a) managing regulatory examinations affecting IA, (b) providing help desk support and training to the department for deficiency/issue management using the eGRC (Enterprise Governance, Risk and Control application) application, (c) monthly, quarterly, annual and other ad hoc reporting to support Practice management activities, and (d) managing various Practice Management projects related to reporting, methodology enhancements, and quality assurance.

How You’ll Succeed
Managing regulatory examinations affecting IA – You will project manage regulatory examinations and interact with various audit portfolio teams and CIBC groups such as Global Regulatory Affairs. To facilitate a response to examination requests, you will gather required documentation from various systems and from audit portfolio groups and ensure that these documents are validated by the respective audit portfolio management prior to submission. In addition, you will maintain quality control over documentation collected for regulatory examinations and ensure that standards prescribed by the Global Regulatory Affairs group for packaging required documentation are maintained. At times, you will support the audit portfolio teams in preparing presentations requested by Regulators.
Supporting deficiency/issue management processes using eGRC– You will provide overall support for deficiency/issue management to audit portfolio groups. As part of this you will provide training on use of eGRC to new hires as well as periodical refresher training. Where required, you will update and maintain all eGRC guidance material as process changes occur. You will also liaison with the Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) group to identify deficiency/issue setup errors and exceptions and periodically perform deficiency/issue analysis when required by sourcing and collating data from multiple locations in the system.
Monitoring, Tracking, and Reporting – You will support with preparation of the monthly report to the Operating Committee, and Quarterly reports to various Board/Legal entity Committees (“external reports”) in accordance with Board and Senior Management Reporting standards. For this you will obtain appropriate data and information from internal systems to produce these reports. You will ensure that reports are accurate, contain appropriate information, and be issued within divisional deadlines. You will continuously look at opportunities for enhancing the content of external reports focused around analytics as well as formats and graphics. As such, experience with preparation of “placemats” and other forms of data visualization and other tech-enabled techniques to drive efficiencies and increase effectiveness of messaging is considered a strong asset. In addition, you will support Practice Management activities including internal reporting on key Internal Audit metrics, producing Teammate (audit software tool) reports and various dashboards including Audit Report Tracker. You will also assist in reporting and coordinating reports to the Bank Regulators.
Managing various Practice Management projects related to reporting, methodology enhancements, and quality assurance – You will manage projects related to audit methodology and practices based on QA results, analysis of professional standards, regulatory expectations or reviews, industry best practices and results of internal or external assessments of IA. As part of this, you will ensure that projects are implemented thoughtfully and fully recognizing all aspects of change management and managing these to minimize impact on employees and other stakeholders.


Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in communicating information effectively, both internally and externally, using effective messaging, presentation toolsets and designing new formats for reporting. Knowledge of producing placemats, use of data visualization tools such as Tableau are considered a strong asset. In addition, experience in dealing with or supporting regulatory examinations and providing support to end users with any eGRC applications will be a strong asset.
You have well developed skills related to presentations, editing and communication, both written and verbal, (including well developed writing skills to a level required to prepare senior level reporting with limited supervision). Reporting will involve detailed descriptions and explanations requiring the accurate use of specialized terminology to effectively communicate information
You have an undergraduate degree
You embrace and champion change. You will continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best and more importantly get the best out of your colleagues and internal partners.
You're passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You will become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities and individual development planning
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
This is a regular full-time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
There will be times when additional hours are required to meet deadlines.
Occasional travel outside of Canada may be required as this position supports our offices in select cities in the United States.

Job Description:

The Manager, Digital Analytics & Optimization will provide real-time, actionable insights and recommendations, using data analytics, across all Spinrite’s digital platforms and consumer touchpoints. This position requires extensive experience with budgeting and forecasting, ability to analyze UX and consumer journeys, and a deep understanding of the eCommerce and digital marketing sales funnel.

The overall objectives of the Manager, Digital Analytics & Optimization are to deliver consumer insights and trends in digital behavior and to recommend modifications in order to optimize the digital consumer experience – from inspiration through to purchase. This person will work closely with the team to assist in connecting with consumers during all stages of their digital buying journey.

This position is tasked with the selection and implementation of best-in-class analytical tools to provide the data and insights to achieve the objectives outlined below. As a part of this job, you will:

Serve as the company’s digital data & analytics leader, developing the strategy with which data-driven insights and recommendations will be used to support business growth.
Keep abreast of latest PPC and SEO products, services, information and trends. Stay up-to-date on algorithms, features and trends related to search analytics. Proactively inform leadership of new developments and provide recommendations.
Lead Financial initiatives within the Digital Team such as SGA reviews, margin/financial scenarios calculations, and digital forecasting.
Identify metrics and provide analysis on a variety of online campaigns, including paid, owned and earned media.
Contribute to goal-setting and KPI definition for the e-commerce team, based upon industry standards, competitive intelligence and benchmarks.
Analyze transactions data to uncover consumer pain points and optimize the buying process on Yarnspirations.com.
Utilize competitive intelligence tools to develop category benchmarks and provide insights into competitor activity.
Assist in promotional planning through the analysis of historical performance and data-driven hypotheses of new promo opportunities.
Analyze e-commerce data from multiple online channels; direct-to-consumer, marketplaces, retail.com and e-tail (primarily Amazon) to provide cross-channel recommendations.
Integrate multiple data sources in your analysis; including shopping behavior, web analytics, household, mobile, weather, social media, and competitive data.


Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in analytics related fields such as statistics, business, economics or equivalent experience.
5+ years of experience analyzing/reporting on web analytics and providing actionable insights to business decision makers.
Extensive experience using Google Analytics; you can set events, goals and generate insightful reports in your sleep
Strong understanding of a variety of web, e-commerce, CRM, social and competitive analytical tools (Rival IQ, SEM Rush, Similar Web, Social Analytics platforms or equivalent)
Proficient knowledge of BI platforms, relational databases, and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Highly proficient with Excel
Experience with SQL querying/data extraction/data modeling for analysis and reporting.
Understanding of the basic concepts of UX design and the impact it can have on the online shopping process.
Strong knowledge of search engine marketing and paid advertising programs, internally or with external agencies
Strong knowledge of organic search and optimization, with an understanding of how to optimize a site to drive organic traffic growth and measuring the results of such improvements
Demonstrated measurable e-commerce sales & web traffic growth and conversion rate improvement through actionable, data-driven recommendations.
Great communication and presentation skills, with a knack for presenting complex data in a simple and easy-to-understand manner.

job_title: Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada
job_description:
Mondelez International, Inc. empowers people to snack right in over 160 countries around the world. We’re leading the future of snacking with iconic brands such as Oreo, belVita and LU biscuits; Cadbury Dairy Milk, Milka and Toblerone chocolate; Sour Patch Kids candy and Trident gum. Our 90,000+ colleagues around the world are key to the success of our business. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are.
Join us on our mission to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.
Strategy, Insights & Analytics

Strategy is where you’ll help us develop plans to shape an exciting future for Mondelēz International. Working with our excellent team of strategy professionals, you’ll diagnose key business growth drivers, set strategic direction for the future, prioritize our growth initiatives, and partner with our business teams to implement our growth plans.
Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada
The Senior Associate Analytics Manager, Confections Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis.
The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.
Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.
Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.

Responsibilities:
Statistical Modelling & Data Mining:
Develop a variety of forecasting models - marketing mix models, inventory management models, consumption and share forecasts.
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.
Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.
Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.
Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.
Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Corporate Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.
Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.
Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.
Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.

Analytic Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, statistical analysis, analytic research, business performance) into one report.
Strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

Toronto, ON$55,000 - $65,000 a yearJob SummaryGoldmoney is seeking a talented and driven individual to join our dynamic and growing Compliance team. Reporting to the Director of Compliance and the Chief Operating Officer, the incumbent will play an important risk management role to ensure the company is operating in compliance with applicable legal requirements and best practices.
