Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people.

Position Summary:
The Product Manager (PM), Data & Analytics, is an analytical product [BP1] leader responsible for several assigned domains, including usage and utilization, data value[BP2] , data standards and integrations. This role requires a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset who thrives in working both at the strategic and tactical level. The successful candidate will be able to work across a variety of domains and influence levels to achieve extraordinary outcomes, often without direct authority. This role will involve significant research to drive strategies / recommendations to drive organizational buy-in and change. This is a role for a tech-savvy enterprise application product professional, as opposed to a technical product manager.

At a high level, the PM for Data & Analytics is responsible for: Working closely with PointClickCare senior leadership to identify and prioritize customer analytical needs and standards[BP3] Drive development of multi-domain business intelligence applications Spearhead the development of an application usage and utilization analytics strategy across PointClickCare applications Contributing to the overall data access strategy for PointClickCare Coordinating analytical and functional product roadmaps Driving value propositions for analytical applications and associated services Defining production milestones, success metrics and go-to-market efforts Ensuring customer satisfaction and adoption

Key Responsibilities: Envisioning viable new concepts/ideas, with a focus on addressing key customer business problems Defining the minimally valuable product/service experience (MVP) by conducting needs/impact assessments, creating workflows [BP4] by persona and high-level user requirements Contributing to system [BP5] requirements and technical assessments, and reviewing UX prototypes Working with product development to establish schedule / budget estimates, and communicating the MVP and appropriate project phasing definition Iteratively testing concepts with customers to inform decisions Overseeing approved product development projects through the planning, definition, development, testing, and pre-launch phases, in conjunction with Product Engineering and Product Owners and collaborating cross-functionally Developing multi-year business plan and forecasts for analytical applications Providing specific input for sales-team training regarding analytics and associated services Driving results through effective communication by building rapport, anticipating and preparing for questions, communicating calmly under pressure and being a good listener Maintaining performance standards if working remotely (where applicable) Representing PointClickCare with a high degree of knowledge, integrity and professionalism

Required Experience:
Minimum Experience:
 Significant experience with EHR applications and product management experience, including: Bachelors Degree in informatics, business, computer science, finance, information technology, or healthcare-related related field of study; or additional years of analytical experience in the EHR segment. Experience building BI and/or analytical applications Working knowledge of building enterprise scale applications Prior experience managing software products through the entire software development lifecycle. Proven ability leading cross-functional teams (without formal authority) to solve problems. Strong skills communicating effectively with internal and external stake holders, both orally and in writing.

Strong product management experience, including: Previous experience participating in marketing or sales activities. Expertise in working with the pragmatic marketing framework. Experience working in an Agile software development process, preferably Scrum.

We make a difference to the world and you can too.

Analytics Developers at Kinaxis create algorithms to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

Coach your teams on software engineering practices, agile delivery, and customer focus

State of the art in-memory analytics technology
Visual Studio, JIRA, Confluence, Git
Sophisticated internal testing tools to validate correctness and performance
Virtual and cloud infrastructure for development, support and testing

A love of data and algorithms, and the desire to apply them in the real world
5+ years’ experience in a software development management position
Experience delivering enterprise software to large customers
Ability to manage and maintain existing products as well as introduce new features via continuous delivery
Background in agile methodologies—not just training but real world experience
Solid background in object oriented programming in Java, C#, or C++
The commitment to help every member of your team perform better

Things that would definitely help
Having written production quality code in C++
Experience in:

Background in, or understanding of, supply chain management

Legalization has opened up the recreational cannabis market in Canada, and the global demand for medical cannabis continues to expand. In this exciting new environment, Canopy Growth’s mission is to be the No. 1 cannabis company in the world. We’re looking for incredible people to join us on the journey.

The Company

With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production and operations spanning five continents, Canopy Growth Corporation (“Canopy Growth”) is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world. It is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC), and is part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries — including its flagship, Tweed, and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand — are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls, Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of its success, and takes pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration, and diversity. Our employees come from a wide range of backgrounds, each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue and increase our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Tokyo Smoke became a household name in cannabis long before the first legal gram was ever sold. Through our award-winning concept of combining craft coffee with cannabis accessories and lifestyle goods, Tokyo Smoke has been revolutionizing cannabis retail well before 10/17. In addition to our Tokyo Smoke coffee shops, we now operate a growing network of beloved cannabis dispensaries. A proud part of the Canopy Growth family, we are now better positioned than ever to write cannabis history.

We are looking for a creative thinker and flawless executor to join our dynamic marketing team with the ability to develop a deep understanding of our market and products, then translate that into meaningful content for our consumers and insights for our business.

Support the brand leads for the Hiku brand portfolio, which may include Tokyo Smoke, Van der Pop and DOJA, on the development of best-in-class campaigns. Lead and execute all future innovation/renovation/commercialization projects. Work alongside external partners and internal cross-functional teams to drive these complex projects forward, managing all timelines and deliverables.
Own business analytics and reporting, leveraging insights to help shape the overall strategy and brand plan.
Partner with internal and external stakeholders to support the launch and sell-in efforts, product/packaging changes, and format extensions.
Lead ongoing competitive analysis and market place trend reports through market place research and store insights.

Experience & Background

Bachelor’s Degree is required;
Minimum of 4 years of work experience;
Ability to thrive in and handle ambiguity in a fast paced, ever-changing environment;
Ability to build and deliver against strict timelines;
Ability to work with a cross functional team.
Project management guru, able to expertly navigate complicated timelines and corral large scale teams towards a mutual target.
Thrive in a fast paced, ever-changing environment.
Harness a unique combination of strategic thinking and flawless tactical execution in order to get the job done.
Flexible, with a willingness to shift gears quickly with changing priorities to drive projects forward.

Under the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_title: Senior Manager, Analytics and BI, Digital Factory
job_description:
Toronto, ONRequisition ID: 56857
At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.
We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.
If you’d like to learn more about the Digital Factory workspace, our Digital Banking career opportunities, Communities of Practice, and open source projects, check out our microsite: https://digitalfactory.scotiabank.com/
As the Senior Manager, Analytics, you will be leading a high performing team of Data Analysts and Data Scientists who are responsible for delivering data and analytics projects at a global scale.
Is this role right for you?
Lead, coach and mentor a team of data analysts and scientists who are responsible for delivering on global initiatives across 4 major business streams; business intelligence, performance marketing enablement and, engineering
Work closely with cross-functional teams such as Product and Marketing, as well as our Analytics partners in Latin America and the Caribbean.
Identify and support business development initiatives; participate in and lead all aspects of the proposal development process.
Maintain an understanding of advancements in technology and innovations which are happening across digital and analytics.
Lead project management delivery and related software/systems development using various methodologies such as Agile and DataOps.
Traveling to our Latin American counterparts in Mexico, Chile, Colombia and, Peru about 20% of the time
Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?
You have at least 5 years of consulting experience managing relevant BI or analytics projects
You have proven success in leading high performing teams
You hold a Bachelor’s degree in the Analytics discipline
You’re experienced with Agile project methodologies
You have experience implementing large projects
It would be preferred if you are bilingual in Spanish
What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create beautiful customer experiences
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
Dress codes don't apply here, being comfortable does
Free shuttle service to and from Union station
Onsite cafeteria with a chef!
Onsite fitness center
This isn't your typical "corporate" job. We work hard and we have fun!
We offer a competitive total rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), 4 weeks of vacation, personal & sick days, personal development funding, maternity leave top-up, parental leave and much more.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Toronto, ONLocation:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
Take ownership and find more ways to care about our local store owners in a career at Shoppers Drug Mart Central Office / Store Support. Provide great service, specific expertise and actionable advice to support Associate-Owners and their staff in delivering the best health, beauty and convenience services to Canadians.


Why this role is important?
The incumbent will take a lead role in supporting pharmacy continuous improvement through measurement, analysis, and optimization of the dispensing workflow. As part of the Enterprise Operations Development and Systems organization, your impact will help drive operational excellence across the Shoppers Drug Mart and Loblaw pharmacy network. Reporting to the Director, Pharmacy Workflow Design & Optimization, your combination of strong technical expertise with business acumen will guide the ongoing development of value-adding analytical capabilities and tools. The successful candidate will play a major role in enhancing the data-driven culture in pharmacy, demonstrating strengths in both planning and execution (process analytics, data modeling, and business intelligence reporting) to help meet enterprise objectives.
What you will do:
Build deep understanding of digital and physical dispensing workflow through process analysis, engagement with subject matter experts, and conducting in-store work studies
Provide analytical input to support defining project requirements and workflow design principles
Consult with project and product leads within Pharmacy and Healthcare to understand business challenges, define success metrics, and quantify business case opportunities
Uncover process improvement opportunities, working from problem identification through data collection, analysis, results, and evaluation
Enhance scope, quality, and timeliness of internal analytics and KPI measurement tools, building upon existing data platforms and providing input to develop future reporting capabilities
Guide technical teams to ensure reporting and dashboard systems meet desired outcomes and quality
Promote use of data-driven decision making by presenting key analytical findings and maximizing stakeholder engagement
Provide input to the design and development of pharmacy labour model and other resource scheduling tools
Lead team members and developers in statistical & data modeling and reporting best practices
What you will need:
5+ years in data and analytical modeling, preferably in an operational improvement or industrial engineering role
University degree (Bachelors or Masters) in engineering, math, computer science, or similar discipline
Robust analytical skills to deep-dive and work hands on with various data sources
Takes initiative and employs a problem-solving mindset to plan ahead and anticipate issues
Verbal and visual communication skills to effectively articulate findings to non-technical audiences
Fluent in multiple small to large-scale data analysis and reporting platforms (our tools include SQL, Teradata, R, VBA, Python, MicroStrategy)
Adept at Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
Able to accommodate occasional travel within Canada
Why work at Shoppers Drug Mart?
Acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the Associate-Owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through SDMU.
Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. , we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Toronto, ONOur purpose at Molson Coors is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re TalentBrewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.

The Headline

In the role of Customer Solutions and Analytics Manager working in Toronto, Ontario you will be part of the Revenue Management Team The Revenue Management Team drives topline growth and profit maximization across the business unit through fact based price, promotion, trade terms and assortment management by channel. Revenue management is a powerful strategic lever that supports the business unit in its competitive efforts in the Canadian Market.

This position reports to Sr Manager Customer Solutions and works closely with sales teams, finance, channel marketing and category solutions to drive holistic recommendations.

The Responsibilities
Lead strategic decisions and recommendations to drive Net Sales Revenue. 80% looking forward while using history as a guidance
Identify opportunities within the Business Unit Portfolio to improve Net Revenue via price levers (ED pricing, Promo Pricing, Promo Freq/Depth, Discount Curves, Mix Shift)
Develops and leverages new and existing analytical tools to support development of category, portfolio and brand pricing, promotion, mix and customer strategies
Support pricing related elements of the Annual Operating Process including channel or customer assortment, everyday price, promotional price and merchandising. Own accurate updates to price elements of materials for Revenue Management teams and assist with pricing related customer sell-in stories when needed
Development and management of Price/Promo Strategies for brands, price tiers, skus, customer and regions.
Providing strategic insights to the teams to leverage in pricing discussion with customer negotiations.
Providing statistical modeling expertise and training required to build and apply econometric modeling techniques to better understand Pricing/Demand relationships and trade offs within the portfolio and with competitors / substitutes
Key point of contact for Non Alch, Beyond Beer and Heineken database recommendations and back up assistance
The Other Qualifications
You love a challenge. You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities
You are confident and competent. You are diplomatic, professional and exercise great judgment in developing and maintaining excellent business relationships within the business
You are deadly serious about results, and take pride in a proven track record in delivering.
You are renown for your communication/ presentation skills.
You have 3-5 years of experience with demonstrated success in unearthing insights and turning them into actionable recommendations in the areas of price/promo and mix analytics.
You have a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics or another analytical discipline
As part of the recruitment process, the candidates will be required to provide consent to complete a criminal background check (if locally applicable).

Work Perks that You Need to Know About:
We’re one of Canada's Most Attractive Employers
As the world’s family brewer we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe
We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.
Flexible work programs like working from home, no meetings after 1pm on Fridays, year-long summer hours and flexible start and end times
You can become a Certified Beer Enthusiast through in-house training that includes everything from brewing techniques to beer tasting and food pairings
Access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events, beer allotment, an Employee Assistance Program and discount plans
Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefits
Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences
At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

Lead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

Toronto, ON*Integrated Marketing Analytics, Manager – Toronto*
Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's entertainment company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
What’s it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.
The Job:
A successful candidate would be able to analyze large qualities of data and be able to distill what’s important into dashboards accompanied by strong insights and recommendations that would help the marketing COE (center of excellence) team making decisions on marketing activities. This involves in-depth analysis of competitive brands, media activity performance, developing sales profiles, retailer segmentation and brand life cycles.
This role would also require the ability to utilize all data sources to develop an executive dashboard with clearly defined KPI’s that ladder up to business objectives allowing the Executive teams to make effective decisions.
What we can expect from you:
Identify actionable insights and provide recommendations for marketing optimization and budget allocation across marketing channels
Build basic attribution models for determining true drivers and impact of multi-channel/multi-touch marketing
Develop strategy for consistent metrics, reporting, testing, analysis, and forecasting to support marketing decision making and improve understanding of marketing performance for individual channels and across all channels
Partner with marketing agencies to gather and clean data, audit validity of data, develop naming conventions and manage automation of marketing reports
Present recommendations to senior-level executives and measure effectiveness of recommendations by monitoring their impact
Continuously evolve metrics used to measure the effectiveness and ROI of activity across all campaign types

Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. Wherever we are, we operate in accordance with our global business principles of quality, unity and integrity. We aim to provide the highest possible standard of legal service in each of our offices and to maintain that level of quality at every point of contact.

Under the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. Lead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

Calgary, ABPermanentHelping Albertans achieve their dreams by turning the complex world of banking into brilliantly simple solutions. That’s ATB. Is that you?
Manager, Data Science and Analytics
Banking generates data. Analytics can transform banking by capturing the data, studying it and telling its story in order to provide focused assurance and valuable insight. Under the leadership of the Director, Data Science and Analytics & Professional Practices, this position is responsible for applying data analytics tools and techniques to create value for the Internal Audit department.
The primary purpose of this position is to perform data gathering, wrangling, automation, analysis, visualization and reporting to support operational audits, continuous monitoring and investigations performed by the audit department. In addition, the Manager supports the value-focused service offering of the analytics team to make data science and analytics a competitive advantage for the department.
You will find success based on your ability to:
Develop a deep and broad understanding of data points, systems, structures and flows within SAP and other ATB information infrastructure and data sources.
Apply data collection methods and strategies to support the audit and investigation processes, optimize departmental efficiency and support organizational data quality.
Support the development of automated solutions for Internal Audit team members to apply data analytics and analyze complex data to improve efficiency and effectiveness of departmental engagements.
Contribute to the design of methods to extract and analyze large amounts of data and synthesize it into information, reporting, supporting documentation and insights for users and stakeholders.
Explain complex analytics concepts in business and audit terms, coupled with the ability to extrapolate moderately complex business processes into technical concepts.
Perform data analytics processes (monthly, quarterly, etc.) and ad hoc initiatives as required to achieve the Data Science and Analytics strategic plan.
Work effectively with a variety of internal and external stakeholders and other ATB analytics teams, building a network of relationships and strengthening the data science and analytics objectives of the organization.
Understand audit activities and support tests of automated controls as required, documenting results in accordance with professional and industry standards as requested.
Support the conduct of automated audit techniques to facilitate audit sampling, exception reporting, trend analysis and continuous monitoring opportunities.
Provide on-going support for Internal Audit’s in-house applications and related data/IT environment.
Remain up to date with leading edge data science developments, procedures, tools and analytics techniques.
Work in a high-pace agile-driven environment. Gain proficiency in JIRA and agile project management operations to enable the team-driven approaches to work.
Strong team-player - no “superstar” syndrome - required.
Job Requirements
As the ideal candidate you possess:
A minimum of 5 years of technology experience (e.g. systems development/support).
A minimum of 3 years of relevant data management and analytics experience in a highly complex environment.
Skilled proficiency with data analytics techniques, including data extraction, transformation, loading, automation, analysis and visualization.
Skilled proficiency with data analytical tools, such as ACL, SQL (or equivalencies such BigQuery, GCP). Experience with SAP, Tableau, Python, BigQuery, GCP, SAS, R is highly preferred.
Inquisitive mindset and keen curiosity to understand the operations, procedures and policies of Internal Audit and ATB business units related to analytics, audit, continuous monitoring and investigation engagements.
Natural collaborator with communication skills to effectively communicate data outputs and analytics concepts to various business partners, information users and stakeholders.
Designations/Training Required/Prerequisites:
University degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent programming - related training.
Master’s or higher degree level preferred.
Attributes:
Connector: Builds relationships naturally, and brings people of mutual interest together.
Customer service: Delivers exceptional service by going beyond expectations.
Problem solver: Challenges established thinking, processes and issues with mutual success in mind. Skilled at identifying business needs and taking initiative to create solutions.
Optimism: “Think Yes First” and see problems as opportunities, not obstacles. View problems and changes as a chance to learn something new, to grow and succeed.
Hungry: Naturally motivated and driven with a high level of GSD

Brampton, ONWho We Are:

HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment

What This Position Is All About:

The Senior Manager, Merchandise Analytics is responsible for meeting or exceeding sales and profit objectives for the banner working in partnership with Divisional Planning Managers, Divisional Merchandise Managers, and Planners. The responsibility includes establishing seasonal planning targets and by door plans. The Senior Manager, Merchandise Analytics will also manage multiple ad hoc projects related to overall banner planning strategies. This role requires strong partnerships with our Corporate Finance, Strategy, Digital, Tech, and Hudson’s Bay Store teams.

Who You Are:
A natural problem-solver, who is also analytical and creative
You understand the value of being proactive and solution-oriented
You have a can-do attitude
You also have:
Post-Secondary education or commensurate retail experience
Minimum 5 years in buying, planning or allocation capacity, retail experience preferred
Strong business and financial analysis skills
Strong cost math acumen, including elements of markup, margin planning, open to buy, inventory productivity measures (WOS, T/O, GMROI), master's understanding of budget frames
Strong communication and presentation skills; extensive exposure to senior management
Advanced computer skills including MS Word and Excel
Demonstrated managerial and leadership skills

As the Senior Manager, Merchandise Analytics will assist:

Financial Planning
Build, update and maintain the daily corporate sales, gross profit and inventory forecast in partnership with merchandising, planning, marketing and ecommerce.
Review daily sales, gross profit and inventory forecast update submissions with finance weekly & monthly.
Build, update and maintain company roll up documents on sales, gross profit and inventory plans by channel to support merchandising and planning groups on strategy builds that align to corporate strategy.
Work with store teams to identify business opportunities and coordinate information back to the merchandising/planning teams.
Participate in store level analysis to help identify sales, gross profit and inventory opportunities specifically in our top doors.
Work with stores, planning and finance on overall store sales and gross margin store plans that feed into the individual store P&L
Create and participate in actions and communications that ensure adherence to the company's planning calendar and other key planning initiatives
Provide ongoing analysis to support seasonal planning decisions and directions, inventory aging, full priced and markdown selling and gross margin, transfers, new and closed stores and sku productivity.
Participates in AD HOC analysis to support the planning team including analysis and data pulls that assist planning in various audit requests and strategic data reviews that help drive various strategic initiatives.
Inventory, Allocation and Replenishment
Help develop and maintain unit target setting/tracking by store and/or merchandise area to align to corporate inventory targets
Track allocation accuracy and work with the planning team to provide the appropriate adjustments/improvements
Work as a liaison with Planning and the replenishment team and the corporate inventory management team to ensure corporate strategies are implemented within DCM (replenishment tool) and how we as a banner manage our aged merchandise.
Work closely with Planning teams to identify opportunities that drive business strategy as outlined in the banner strategy.
Store visits & communications
Visit stores as feasible and shares notes/observations/opportunities with the planning team to action.
Participates in conversations around store plans
Open-to-Buy Monitoring
Participates in the monthly OTB by building/maintaining trend forecast reporting as well as managing notes and follow up discussions around key takeaways discussed in the meeting.
Reviews actual to planned receipt performance.
Reviews vendor allowance projections and coordinates summaries against targets set.
Manages the process including meeting schedules, reporting,analysis, and final reviews with the VP’s of Planning and the Chief Merchant.
Merchandising
Review key conclusions on style productivity and assortment breadth and depth resulting from performing assortment analytics around AUR and SKU productivity.
Forecast and track the success of newly implemented projects/initiatives, opportunity areas and potential liabilities as they align to corporate banner strategies (i.e. store renovation plans, Proof of Concept store tracking, Key brand/vendor tracking etc.)
Support Planning Projects through the development of action focused solutions based analysis. Present findings and proposed actions to cross functional team members and business leaders.
Your Life and Career at HBC:

Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.
A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance
Benefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).
An amazing employee discount
