job_title: Service Manager, Security Monitoring and Analytics
job_description:
We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

CIBC’s Enterprise Security & Risk Services (ESRS) team protects Our Bank, Our Employees, and Our Clients by leveraging innovative solutions to mature the information & cyber security landscape within CIBC. As a Service Manager, you’ll join the Security Monitoring and Analytics group to manage and lead all activities pertaining to Threat Detection and Response services and capabilities. Your key accountabilities include enhancement and management of an enterprise wide cyber security threat detection and response program aligned to strategic business objectives. As a people leader, you will coach, motivate, and guide a team of senior information security professionals.

How You’ll Succeed
Cyber Security Threat Detection and Response Management Program – Maintain and enhance the program specifically focusing on security service capabilities via development of roadmaps in collaboration with key stakeholders across the bank. Facilitate input across the organization to ensure everyone’s opinion is considered when solutioning for projects on behalf of the enterprise. As a business lead, execute on cyber security projects, provide governance and oversight including managing total cost of operations.
Continuous Improvement – Drive and support continuous improvement of the threat detection and response capabilities related to information and cyber security by leading a working group comprised of subject matter experts across the bank. Manage centralized reporting of key processes to ensure their effectiveness, efficiency and compliance with management objectives. Communicate results within Information Security and CIBC on the analysis, interpretation, strategy and execution of projects while also providing solutions for existing and future risks and vulnerabilities in order to assess the security posture of CIBC.
Relationship building – Build and maintain strong relationships with important internal stakeholders, especially leaders of technology groups whose work is critical to the success of cyber security at CIBC, and business groups that are impacted by cyber security controls. Gain and maintain executive support for the threat detection and response program through creation of business cases, delivery of presentations to senior management, etc.
Consulting – Take on a consultative approach when checking for Information Security control use and work with internal/external stakeholders to monitor threat environment and contribute to adjustments of security service plans. Analyze trends in information security and perform benchmarking against external organizations through participation in external thought forums.

Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in Information and Cyber security management with a key focus on Centralized Log Management, SIEM, UEBA, EDR, SOAR, CASB, Threat Intelligence, and additional established and emerging Threat Detection and Response technologies and domains. You have practical hands-on experience with cyber-attack methodologies and tactics and can protect against those, strong understanding of cyber security and insider threat mitigation, and strong analytical storytelling skills. It’s an asset if you have a CISSP, GCIH, GMON, or similar certification, as well as a minimum of 5 years of experience in information security.
You can demonstrate knowledge in security-oriented, solution delivery mindset, previous threat modeling experience, excellent understanding of technology and exposure to incident response in small or large SOC environments.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.
You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible and what can be improved.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need To Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
Prior to starting in this role, security checks, including a criminal record check must be successfully completed to the satisfaction of CIBC. An annual criminal record check may also be required.

Medical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Recreational cannabis is on the horizon. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

The Company

Hi.

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

The Opportunity

Tokyo Smoke became a household name in cannabis long before the first legal gram was ever sold. Through our award-winning concept of combining craft coffee with cannabis accessories and lifestyle goods, Tokyo Smoke has been revolutionizing cannabis retail well before 10/17. In addition to our Tokyo Smoke coffee shops, we now operate a growing network of beloved cannabis dispensaries. A proud part of the Canopy Growth family, we are now better positioned than ever to write cannabis history.

Reporting to the Head of Digital Marketing, the Digital Marketing Analytics & Insights Manager will be responsible for overseeing the analysis of our digital marketing initiatives across a multitude of channels, campaigns, platforms and segments within the Tokyo Smoke Brands portfolio.

The ideal candidate will be eager to work with the latest digital tools to analyze data, optimize performance, and provide actionable insights to execute a unique and impactful strategy. You’ll have the opportunity to work in collaboration with subject matter experts in digital marketing, eCommerce, content creation, experiential marketing, creative design, and brand marketing. If you truly thrive in collaborative, challenging and action-packed environments, and have what it takes to implement strategies to develop our analytics & measurement framework, this role is for you.

Responsibilities

Manage the weekly/monthly reporting to analyze digital marketing results across channels, campaigns, platforms and segments, with a keen focus on automation
Identify trends and provide recommendations for improving ROI and optimizing the marketing mix, utilizing cross-channel and offline-attribution methodologies
Utilize customer data to better understand behavior in order to drive both engagement and sales
Build and maintain dashboards that integrate paid and owned channels, while continuously diving deep into the data to extract and share insights with cross-functional teams
Offer perspective and guidance on development and selection of target audiences to support paid, earned and owned channels
Drive digital marketing-tagging strategy and implementation for campaigns and other efforts
Drive integration across marketing and data platforms to ensure sound testing, targeting, and personalization strategies
Continuously improve campaign design and delivery while managing the project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and consider the business impact of decisions on diverse groups; influence others to achieve project goals

Background & Experience

3-5 years related experience in analytical roles, preferably in alcohol, CPG or retail
Prior experience working with multi-channel marketing programs, including but not limited to display, search, E-mail, social, organic and owned channels
Deep understanding of analytics and data mining, with a specific focus on Online and Digital Marketing measurement
Experience working on testing, targeting and personalization projects with both targeting and optimization tools and Data Management Platforms (DMP)
Experience with the Adobe Marketing Stack, Marketing Automation Platforms and data visual tools
Bachelors/Masters degree in Business, Engineering or other quantitative discipline
Excellent communication, presentation and data visualization skills
Proven leadership skills with ability to lead, motivate, challenge and influence cross functional teams to deliver superior results

Other Details

This is a full-time position based out of Toronto.

Note: The chosen applicant will be required to successfully complete background and reference checks.

We appreciate the interest by all candidates however we will be contacting those that best fit the requirements. All resumes will be maintained in our database for six months for consideration in future searches for talent.

Canopy Growth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

job_title: Consumer, Category, and Shopper Insights Manager, Canada
job_description:
Job Address:
1425 The Queensway, Etobicoke, Ontario, M8Z 1T3
Weston Foods is a leading North American bakery company with a specialized focus across all key bakery categories, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, alternatives breads, and others. We bake our products in more than 50 facilities across Canada and the USA, conducting our business with integrity, contributing to our communities, and fostering a respectful culture. We are building a culture of success here, and it depends on our people striving for greatness and having the courage and commitment to getting better every day.
Are you insatiably curious and thrive in a fast-paced environment? Does it energize you to know that you will see the efforts of your work hit the market in months, then this role is for you!
Our Insights team is committed to uncovering and articulating meaningful insights that inspire breakthrough innovation, impactful creative and strategic category planning. We are dedicated to exploring new and innovative ways of working to get closer to consumers pain points and how we can solve them. And above all else, we are passionate about bakery – understanding everything there is to know about our products, how they are consumed, both in and out of home.
The Sweet Goods Consumer & Category Insights Manager at Weston Foods is a business leader and a proactive entrepreneur. This position will be accountable for assessing the organization’s knowledge requests and developing an effective and efficient research plan to address those needs. The Insights Manager will have strong business advisory skills and insights expertise, turning insights to actionable business recommendations. A successful candidate for this role is inherently curious about business patterns and proactively investigates and recommends opportunities for strategic growth.
Core Responsibilities:
Leverage insights and analytics to identify growth opportunities for the business
Be consistently “externally focused”, consistently engaged with customers and consumers.
Drive the development of thought-provoking insights that challenge organizational norms and thinking to inspire break-through product innovation
Lead the development of consumer, shopper and category research initiatives from design to execution
Able to synthesize syndicated/analytics learnings with primary research learnings to tell a complete story, driving to implications and recommendations.
Manage research supplier relationships and appropriately challenge suppliers to ensure highest quality and best thinking is applied
Work cross-functionally with category, marketing, innovation, sales strategy and the food service teams to ensure that research and insights are leveraged throughout the organization
Liaison to the Weston Foods community with new trends, retail and food service landscape understanding, which is key to developing foresight for the business
Build strong relationships, positively influence others and collaborate in ways that creates alignment and inspires others to take action
About You:
Minimum 5 years of experience in consumer insights
Analytical thinker, able to work cross-functionally to proactively recommend solutions with a complete work plan
Solid communication skills
Ability to prioritize numerous, simultaneous projects
Ability to influence others across the organization and effectively coordinate resources
Thrives in working in an fast-paced, entrepreneurial matrix environment
Solid understanding of the Canadian retail landscape
Strong expertise in both qualitative and quantitative research techniques
Nielsen experience is an asset
Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Weston s'engage à promouvoir un environnement de travail avec des valeurs fortes qui favorisent la diversité à travers divers politiques, programmes et activités qui encouragent la sensibilité et les accommodements. Weston offre du travail sans égard à l’ethnie, la couleur de la peau, le sexe, l’origine, la religion, l’âge, le handicap ou l’orientation sexuelle. La diversité est une partie intégrante de notre succès en tant qu’entreprise et nous allons utiliser la diversité comme modèle pour aider à identifier et à développer les meilleurs talents, pour créer des équipes efficaces et pour atteindre une excellence globale. En outre, nous croyons que la conformité aux lois consiste à faire ce qu'il faut. Le respect de la loi fait partie de notre Code de conduite; il renforce ce que nos clients et nos parties prenantes attendent de nous.

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize her dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

You are an experienced Digital Analytics Developer who has experience aligning data structure across multiple reporting suites (online, mobile web, mobile app, wearables, etc). In this role, you will be responsible to support a team with our analytics stack of tools such as Adobe Marketing Cloud (Adobe Launch, Dynamic Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, Target, and Audience Manager), DOMO and ClickTale.

Communicate findings and recommendations in a professional, clear, and actionable manner, articulating next steps and recommendations to various audiences including executive level.Manage quality assurance of all Adobe Analytics implementations and provide recommendations to provide insightful, best-in-class digital channels reports and dashboards, and adherence to service level agreements with lines of business, partners and the overall Digital Channels team.
You're the missing piece of the puzzleUniversity degree in Computer Science (preferred) or any technical fieldAt least 5-7 years of experience in implementing analytics on high traffic websitesUnderstanding of database structures, tables & basic SQL statementsWeb development experience including knowledge of JavaScript (or any of its flavours)Ability to work independently as well as a contributing member of the tea

Great-to-havesExperience with agile, iterative, lean product life cyclesAt least 2-3 years of experience in implementing and using Adobe Launch or DTM to ingest data into Adobe Analytics

Location:
243 Consumers Road, Toronto, Ontario, M2J 4W8
The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
The Retail Financial Analytics team is focused on providing impactful reporting and analyses to the business to manage and drive a reduction in Total Loss which includes, Inventory Shrink, Vendor Claim Adjustments and Inventory Damages totaling over $100M of annual expense.
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Finance, Retail Financial Analytics the Manager, Finance, Retail Financial Analytics will be responsible for supporting the team to generate insights on retail performance that influence business decisions and improve future profitability. This position has three direct reports.
Key Responsibilities:
Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
Support the periodic forecast requirements by building on historical performance, normalizing for one-time events and incorporating known financial impacts with commentary for all assumptions
Lead the annual planning process by managing the key individual Total Loss accounts and ensure plan assumptions and initiatives are included for all Retail Stores
Build and improve processes and tools as required to assist the team in preparing the annual plan
Prepare and communicate financial analysis for each Total Loss account by providing standard analytics, volume/mix and rate analysis, variance commentary, and management reporting
Identify and communicate risks and opportunities
Business Partnering & Insight Generation
Partner with cross functional teams (e.g. National Operations, Loss Prevention, Internal Audit, Category Management, Finance, etc.) to understand and support business decisions through insights and recommendations
Synthesize large amounts of data to drive insights and improved business performance
Develop and prepare performance reporting to support Total Loss Initiatives highlighting performance through key performance indicators (KPI)
Financial Period End Close
Support period end close requirements for each Total Loss account
Store Reporting & Analysis
Maintain and enhance existing weekly and periodic reporting & insights sent to stores and senior management
Collaborate closely with internal and external data experts to build and extract appropriate and accurate data sets to support performance reporting
Investigate and make recommendations for process improvement in addition to supporting continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies
Team Management
Coach, mentor and develop direct reports in an open and collaborative environment
Other Responsibilities
Support adhoc projects and initiatives as required
Skills and Experience:
CPA designation; Minimum 5 years of experience in a related Finance role
Drive for continuous improvement and an ability to challenge existing processes
Exceptional analytical abilities, quality driven, and detail oriented
Project management skills with the ability to leverage resources (people, processes, departments, tools) to complete objectives effectively and efficiently
Strong problem-solving skills and possess the tenacity to find solutions
Strong communication & presentation skills, both verbal and written with the ability to effectively interact with all levels of the organization
Strong leader and team player with the ability to collaborate, drive team effectiveness and develop talent
Advanced Excel skills; Experience with macros would be an asset
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Toronto, ONAs the Manager of the Ad Operations group, you will be responsible for overseeing a high-paced, advanced team of operational and technical advertising specialists. The Ad Operations team is primarily responsible for architecting the platform operations and related workflow, and on boarding new activations from initial sale to launching live.


Beyond managing the team and direct responsibilities, the position will work with the Director of TRFFK Operations to provide weekly and monthly reports, quarterly business reviews and annual budget planning.

This position will also liaison with key external technology and media partners to ensure continuity in workflow, support requirements are adequate and operations are consistent.


Key Areas of Responsibility
Ad Operations Platform Management

Operate the TRFFK platform complete with strategy, hiring, annual budget planning
Track revenue expectations of new team, report weekly & monthly on achievements, mitigation plans and actions to improve
Monitors analytics across all stages of on boarding to ensure timely and accurate launches across search, display and social platforms.
Ad Operations Team Management

Manage day to day activities of the Ad Operations team on all related workflow, managing intake of sales submissions, new campaign launches and on boarding new activations
Control quality standards of campaign setups through testing for quality assurance and completing documentation following launches to ensure a closed-loop process communication
Maintaining operational excellence through updating Trello tracking system, maintaining systems documentation and addressing support inquiries
Uses own drive/passion to mentor & inspire team members & cross functional teams to deliver 1st class solutions
TRFFK Business Operations

Works with multiple teams (Creative, Product, Strategy) to ensure all campaign elements are operating efficiently for campaign launches.
Design processes & templates to deliver work on spec, on time & on budget
Partner and Industry Coordination

Stay up to date on emerging technologies/products
Driven to constantly update & acquire new skills and information on competitive situations or new business opportunities. Maintains current knowledge and is an advocate of future skill development for the team to be on par with any external Digital agency
People leadership & people management: developing processes, teaching skills, best practices design, documentation, implementation & review

People management : inspiring & collaborative, mentorship
Experience building business plans & ownership of the execution of the resulting deliverables
Excellent communication to direct supervisor, peers, team & clients
Driven personality – desire to win
Strong organizational & time management skills

Bachelors or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Minimum 5 years of digital marketing and management experience, including the following:
Experience with analytics platforms, including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and call tracking technologies
Experience with advertising platforms - Doubleclick Bid Manager / Campaign Manager / Studio, Kenshoo, Facebook, Bing and Google AdWords
Strong planning, communication, and organizational skills
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks effectively with a high-degree of accuracy
Effective problem solving and analytical skills
Self-motivated with the ability to operate independently
Ability to work within a fast-paced, demanding, results-driven environment
Google AdWords, Bing, Facebook and Google Analytics Certification preferred

$67,304 - $112,168 a yearReporting to the Associate Director, Infrastructure Trades Projects & Operations, the Manager, Maintenance Planning is responsible for the management and oversight of the Maintenance Planning Group within Operations and Maintenance which are comprised of a multi-disciplinary group of specialists that develop and implement the maintenance planning program for Operations and Maintenance. The group is comprised of the Maintenance Planners, Asset Management, Maintenance Desk, and Infrastructure Work Coordination. Together, the group is responsible for the planning, coordination, execution, and analysis of maintenance and project activities done within the Operations and Maintenance portfolio which includes, but is not limited to: the Infrastructure Maintenance Program, Preventive Maintenance Program, and projects undertaken by internal Trades groups. The activities will span from developing maintenance programs for Trades resources to the strategic 15-year Asset Management Plan.

Duties

 Leadership and Management

Provide leadership and day to day management of a team of planning, reporting, and analytical specialists.
The group of direct reports will consist of the Maintenance Planners, Maintenance Desk, Asset Management, and Infrastructure Work Coordinators.
Create an environment that rewards initiative and enthusiasm that empowers their staff to do their best work, think critically, and to develop creative solutions for complex problems.
Through teamwork and effective collaboration, be a change champion and lead efforts of continuous improvement within Operations and Maintenance, and the broader Facilities and Operations unit.
Manage and develop professional development for their staff to encourage succession planning, opportunities for special assignments and personal growth, as well as cross training for maximum team agility, flexibility, and resiliency.
Facilitate the change management process for teams within their area of responsibility as business processes are updated and improved.
Strategic Planning and Analysis

Contribute to the strategic planning of the 4 year Infrastructure Maintenance Program rolling plan and how it informs the 15 year Asset Management Plan. Specifically, work closely with the Associate Director, as well as the Infrastructure Analytics team to manage the intake of deferred maintenance and facility condition assessment information to inform the greater Asset Management Plan.
Manage the requirements, design, planning, and implementation of the Preventive Maintenance Program. Specifically, work closely with the Associate Director, and Trades Supervisors and Foremen to design, implement, monitor, and manage the Preventive Maintenance Program for Facilities & Operations.
Manage the coordination and planning of all internal F&O Multi-Trades Projects with the Estimates Shop and Trades Supervisors.
Analytics and Performance Measurement

Champion the push to O&M initiative for evidence-based decision making processes and policy by working with the Infrastructure Analytics team to develop work order cost analysis and project control.
Oversee the creation and distribution of asset reporting for F&O including deferred maintenance reporting, asset condition and facility condition reports. The Manager will also have oversight to ensure that all reports are up to the standard and specifications set out by industry standard and are in compliance with Government guidelines where applicable.
Provide reporting and feedback on service request and cycle time metrics to ensure that service requests are being done to the standard set in the Asset Management Plan, and make recommendations as required when deficiencies are noted.
Stakeholder Collaboration and Engagement

Collaborate and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to deliver enhanced maintenance and infrastructure renewal outcomes in an integrated delivery portfolio. Stakeholders include the Project Management Office (PMO), Internal Trades, Space Management, Office of the University Architect (OUA), Utilities, Energy Management, consultants, etc.
Facilitate cross-portfolio input and prioritization efforts that impact the IMP Rolling Plan and the Asset Management Plan.
Manage the process of intake for maintenance requests, infrastructure renewal priorities and requirements as they pertain to the University as a whole.
Qualifications

10+ years of directly relevant experience in building design, construction, operations and maintenance.
P.Eng. or C.E.T. designation required.
Demonstrated knowledge of mechanical, electrical, architectural and structural building systems, as well as knowledge of applicable maintenance standards and building codes and standards.
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Data analytics skills and knowledge of business intelligence tools would be an asset.
Proven collaborator, excellent communicator and a team player who is able to work with all levels of the organization.
Must be highly motivated, self-starter, and results oriented with the ability to excel in a fast paced and challenging environment.
Strong work ethic, detail oriented, willing and able to learn new skills and embrace change.
In accordance with the Administrative and Professional Officer Agreement, this full-time continuing positions offer a comprehensive benefits package found at Faculty and Staff Benefits and offers an annual salary range of $67,304 to $112,168.

Along with your resume, please submit a cover letter outlining your qualifications. The review of applications will start on March 29, 2019; however, the competition will remain open until filled.

*Integrated Marketing Analytics, Manager – Toronto*
Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's entertainment company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
What’s it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.
The Job:
A successful candidate would be able to analyze large qualities of data and be able to distill what’s important into dashboards accompanied by strong insights and recommendations that would help the marketing COE (center of excellence) team making decisions on marketing activities. This involves in-depth analysis of competitive brands, media activity performance, developing sales profiles, retailer segmentation and brand life cycles.
This role would also require the ability to utilize all data sources to develop an executive dashboard with clearly defined KPI’s that ladder up to business objectives allowing the Executive teams to make effective decisions.
What we can expect from you:
Identify actionable insights and provide recommendations for marketing optimization and budget allocation across marketing channels
Build basic attribution models for determining true drivers and impact of multi-channel/multi-touch marketing
Develop strategy for consistent metrics, reporting, testing, analysis, and forecasting to support marketing decision making and improve understanding of marketing performance for individual channels and across all channels
Partner with marketing agencies to gather and clean data, audit validity of data, develop naming conventions and manage automation of marketing reports
Present recommendations to senior-level executives and measure effectiveness of recommendations by monitoring their impact
Continuously evolve metrics used to measure the effectiveness and ROI of activity across all campaign types
Create and manage development of new data structures to capture data as needed
Job Requirements
Who’s a good fit for this team:
An individual with the ability to build and maintain relationships, both externally and internally
Self-directed, proactive and able to define and execute projects independently
High proficiency in Excel
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical people in an effective manner
Ability to present findings to senior management and display a comfort level in responding to any and all questions
You should apply if you have the following:
Bachelor Degree required (Business, Marketing, Statistics, Economics or similar), Master Degree preferred.
3 - 5 years of experience in a similar role (Marketing Intelligence, Analytics, Data Scientist etc.)
What you can expect from us:
Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values:
Integrity
Open Mindset
Innovation
Partnerships
Collaboration
Driving Results
Entrepreneurship

Toronto, ONWith our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.

The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

$55,000 - $65,000 a yearJob SummaryGoldmoney is seeking a talented and driven individual to join our dynamic and growing Compliance team. Reporting to the Director of Compliance and the Chief Operating Officer, the incumbent will play an important risk management role to ensure the company is operating in compliance with applicable legal requirements and best practices. Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

Company Profile:
MAXIMUS is an industry leader in the provisioning of products and services to support the delivery of government services in North America and internationally. With operations across Canada and around the Globe, MAXIMUS is a world-leader in providing innovative, practical and meaningful solutions to help government programs and services function more effectively and efficiently.
In Canada, MAXIMUS is responsible for the administration of two of the Province of British Columbia’s most important healthcare programs: Medical Services Plan and Fair PharmaCare. Further, in British Columbia we administer the Service BC contact centre and the Work BC catchments in Mission, Abbotsford and the South Okanagan. We also administer the Ontario Drug Benefit Program on behalf of the Ontario Ministry of Health and Long-term Care. In Charlottetown, PEI we develop and support our flagship medical and drugs claims-management software – MedigentÒ. In British Columbia., through our Themis division, we also operate the Family Maintenance Enforcement Program that is responsible for tracking and collecting child and spousal support.
We are constantly looking at new technology, processes and methods of delivering services to the citizens of Canada. Because of this, and given our expertise in program information management, claims processing, contact centre services, document processing and information technology, we are positioned for significant growth.
Join us here in beautiful Victoria, British Columbia to experience the best in West Coast lifestyle. You will work in an environment that will challenge you and reward your achievements. Your down time can be spent exploring the natural beauty of the West Coast – from culinary experiences to cultural events, and to outdoor challenges. We have it all! Located in beautiful Victoria, BC, in the heart of downtown, our location offers easy access to every amenity.
MAXIMUS offers competitive market-based salaries, incentive pay opportunity, comprehensive employer-paid benefits and a defined-benefit pension plan or a Group RSP with employer-matching contributions, for eligible employees. Our people also get some great perks too, such as a heavily subsidized fitness-membership program, an annual gala year-end celebration event along with a supportive results-oriented work environment.
MAXIMUS welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Position Description:
As an Operations Manager, you will provide strategic leadership to serve our employee, client and customer needs, in balance with achieving MAXIMUS’s business goals and profitability. This balance is achieved by collaborating with the Director of Operations to lead and direct the operations within the Service BC Contact Centre.
A major focus of this role is to engage employees to achieve peak work performance, so that financial forecasts and service level requirements are met. A major driver is to reduce costs by creating process efficiencies while ensuring that MAXIMUS continues to be an employer of choice.
SBC managers are future focused; always looking at the larger business landscape for opportunities while actively planning for the immediate future by creating a business strategy and engaging their teams in the process of setting and achieving goals and objectives.
Primary Accountabilities:
1. Set clear expectations, provide performance feedback, and develop direct reports through coaching, performance plans and reviews.
2. Deliver against Service Standards and key performance indicators: TSF, Schedule Adherence, Conformance, Average Handle Time, CSAT, Transfers.
3. Identify and research service level risks for problem resolution and management notification. Oversee escalation plan when service levels are negatively impacted.
4. Forecasts and accounts for growth due to seasonal variations, special events, and other cyclical patterns affecting clients (such as marketing campaigns).
5. Strong knowledge of Call Centre platform
6. Calibration of Quality document with the Quality program lead.
7. Engagement and supporting contact center culture and reward and recognition initiatives.
8. Use specific workforce analytics, with sound and appropriate data inputs, to identify and define forecasting and reporting needs of the business.
9. Produce and develop accurate reporting to measure and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
10. Work with stakeholders to fulfill reporting requests and gathering of data inputs to support decision making for the business.
11. Must have availability to work various shifts influenced by current business needs.
12. Continuously demonstrate a high sense of urgency
13. Enthusiastic and energetic
14. Strong negotiation and objection handling skills
15. Possess a high level of Professionalism
16. Must have a keen sense of attention to detail, taking the initiative
17. Evaluation of new technology and ongoing vendor management
18. ESAT – employee morale
19. CSAT through Operational and Site performance
20. Develop and implement operational practices that establish positive employer-employee-client relationships and promote high levels of employee morale
21. Ensure all Company policies and procedures are followed within the site
22. Ensure Compliance with all Internal and Client Operational Procedures and Requirements
23. Collaborate with business leaders to design solutions that meet evolving company objectives
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 2+ years leading in a Contact Centre environment
Previous technical experience with CISCO, Omni Channel Platforms, Verint, Telestrat, Knowledge Management Systems.
Demonstrated success leading or influencing a variety of stakeholders to achieve mutually desirable outcomes.
Proven ability to deliver feedback to others in a way that results in positive outcomes.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and evolving environment which includes ongoing learning and training opportunities

Toronto, ONOneClass is looking for someone who lives and breath A/B testing and it doesn't matter if it's within a web application, paid acquisition channels or drip emails going out to our users. Increasing conversion is something that you get super excited about, and you continue to think about new ways to improve on it, and never stop. You have strong analytics skills and is extremely data driven. You’ll be the first member in our Online Growth Team and you’ll have the freedom, resources, and support to develop and manage top-performing marketing campaigns.

Responsibilities
Manage day-to-day account activities, from bidding strategies and creative testing to keyword research and expansion
Ensure tests get up and running, and willing and able to help product and marketing team interpret results and present them to management
Own OneClass’s paid search strategy, execution, and budget with the object of exceeding monthly KPI goals
Utilize internal or external analytic tools to measure the overall success and repeat
Ideal Candidate
1-3 years of online user acquisition experience with both paid and organic channels
Self-starter who is comfortable in a fast-paced environment and can switch from implementing and analyzing paid ad campaigns to building landing pages and setting up drip campaigns with ease
Extensive knowledge in implementing A/B test scenarios throughout the web and email on a regular basis and tracking them with internal tools.
Obsession with learning about customer behaviour through both numbers and qualitative data
Basic understanding of statistics and decent Excel skills
Willingness to learn what you don’t already know
About
OneClass is an educational platform that allows university students to collaborate and share study resources from self-created lecture notes to study guides. At the same time, we have subject experts creating high quality video tutorials for common university subjects ranging from concepts within a textbook, to step-by-step solutions to past exams. Today, we have helped over 2.2 million+ students spanning across 1.3 million different courses.


Our mission is to not only become the largest library of education resources for university and college students, but to also provide the necessary tools for students to successfully graduate and land their very first job. That’s how we define a true success! If helping millions of students succeed excites you, give us a shout!

Why OneClass
At OneClass, we believe that our company is only as strong as our employees, so it is a priority for us to make sure our team members know how much we appreciate them! From a kitchen full of delicious snacks, to insanely fun quarterly team events, to monthly catered lunches – OneClass believes in supporting an awesome team environment where we work hard together, and play hard together. We don’t just talk about employee development, we practice it. Your success is our success.

Toronto, ONEY delivers unparalleled service in digital transformation, big data, data science, and digital analytics built on a blend of custom-developed methods related to customer analytics, data visualization, and optimization. We leverage best practices and a high degree of business acumen that has been compiled over years of experience to ensure the highest level of execution and satisfaction for our clients. At EY, our methods are not tied to any specific platforms but rather arrived at by analyzing business needs and making sure that the solutions delivered meet all client goals.


We help our clients transform. Together we are changing the way they interact with their Customers, Employees and Partners alike. We are modernizing their applications, creating new ones and driving business efficiency across their ever-changing platform and channel infrastructures. Everything we do centers around this simple story.


The opportunity


 As a member of the Facilitation team at EY Wavespace (EY’s innovation center), you will have the opportunity to work with global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex performance challenges, and ultimately improve and drive sustainable business results. We enable organizations to identify and address their most critical issues, ranging from strategic direction and alignment, digital disruption and organizations responses to the pace of change whether technological, political or societal in nature. Whilst the nature of our work focuses on the design and facilitation of collaborative events, the competencies required is a diverse and challenging blend of logical problem solving, Innovative thinking, political astuteness. Exemplar communication skills, psychology, an open and inquisitive mind and a fundamental desire to enable the capabilities of others to reach resolutions. In terms of skills facilitation is grounded in a number of methodologies of which Design thinking is core but equally critical are project and program management, change management and a depth of understanding across the entire consulting value chain. While not critical across all sectors a current and relevant level of experience and knowledge of client and industry issues is crucial.


It is anticipated that facilitators will need to engage and in over unfamiliar groups who are operating under high pressure and create the environment and framework that empowers them to rapidly understand challenges, identify options for potential resolution and to steer them towards an appropriate set of action oriented outcomes.

Your key responsibilities


As a facilitator, you will be a key resource on designing and facilitating large scale facilitated workshops for our client’s business transformation projects. In this role, you should be able to deliver quality client service, analyse complex problems and deliver insightful solutions. You will also be expected to have excellent communication skills, integrate into new teams and rapidly establish relationships. More specifically, the successful candidate should:

Bring a unique specialty to bear on the challenges facing our clients (industry trends, critical issues and concerns of board level executives, an understanding of the challenges faced within at least one of our target sectors, the ability to translate complex issues ranging from strategic, digital, customer, compliance, into coherent problem statements and the ability to design processes to enable organizations to resolve complex issues..
Demonstrate technical competence in our capabilities (Organisational Change Management, Organisational Design, Digital transformation, customer experience, large scale transformation, technology enablement, process efficiency) and take a practical/business driven approach to solving complex client challenges within those focus areas
Be up to date with key technical and functional skills, and industry trends
Be able to influence and persuade clients and stakeholders to gain support for any major change initiatives and/or decisions
Take a practical approach to solving issues and gaining client agreement
Encourage and facilitate collaboration amongst team members, and promote an inclusive working environment
Be able to identify and help manage any potential issues and risks during a client engagement
Contribute to business development and client pursuit activities, by preparing proposals, presentations for potential clients and thought leadership brochures
Identify and flag any follow-on engagement opportunities
Support and lead certain engagement activities from planning through to implementation
Develop the capabilities of the broader organization to encompass leading practices and innovative ways of working
Skills and attributes for success

Understanding the clients challenge (and on many occasions supporting the client in specifying their challenge)
Development of a design session to support the client in
better understanding their challenge through a broadening of their exposure to aligned market trends, case studies, examples and leading practices
supporting the client in bringing to bear an awareness of options that will drive significant change in relation to the challenge
Creating tactical and practical steps for resolution
Supporting the alignment of groups through collaborative activity in co-developing solutions
Generating momentum and a sense of engagement and excitement around the proposed solutions
Managing the delivery of sessions ranging from 1-2 through to 150-200 participants, ensuring a high quality seamless experience for all participants, an inclusive process that engages all, an action oriented event that maintains pace and a focus on outcomes that are both practical and short term.
Continuously focusing on process improvement, innovation and quality of events and the experience of customers
A depth of understanding and inquisitiveness to support the digital enablement of the collaborative experience and development of a truly connected collaboration offering
The ability to plan and manage multiple complex and critical projects across multiple locations under scrutiny of executive level internal and external customers
To qualify for the role you must have

Organisational Change Management (communications, training)
Project Management
Design thinking
Large scale meeting management and facilitation skills
Organizational Operating & Delivery Modelling and implementation
Process Efficiency (definition, implementation and measurement)
Customer Experience mapping/journey mapping
Digital Design
Cultural/political awareness
Deep personal EQ strength
Ideally, you’ll also have

MBA degree preferred.
What we look for


Aside from the world-class messaging we deliver to leading companies, what makes us unique is our fun, transparent, highly entrepreneurial and collaborative culture. We work hard, play hard and love what we do together. Day in and day out, we know we can count on one another. If you think everything we’ve said so far sounds great, then we look forward to hearing from you!


What working at EY offers


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 15 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY


 As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.


If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.


Join us in building a better working world.
Apply now.

Management

Toronto, ONJoin our team and experience Workday!
It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.
Job Description
Our mission is to partner with our amazing prospects to help them tell their stories, to quantify what life with Workday will mean for them, and to work side-by-side to craft their business case for change. We focus on relationships, analytics, and business strategy. We get the privilege of advising leaders from the C-Suite of the world’s biggest companies, to the ﬁrst Recruiter or Finance Analyst hired at small startups. We are workmates, teammates, and coaches. We are Value Managers.
As a member of the Operations team, you’ll also work to support the tools, techniques and processes that Value Managers use in the field on a regular basis. You’ll help train the teams, giving them the resources they need to do their jobs better and faster, and help push our practice into its next iteration.
If this sounds like who you’d like to be, then you should consider a career as a Value Manager at Workday.
As a Value Manager, you will:
Develop relationships as a consultant and business advisor to a team of Workday Account Executives – working alongside them and the industry’s best pre-sales teams to engage, excite, and educate Workday prospects on their transformation
Command a strong understanding of Workday’s technology to deliver compelling and relevant messages around Workday’s unique and differentiated value
Drive engaging discovery interviews with HR, Finance, and IT stakeholders to help uncover pain points and to understand business processes within their organizations
Help support the field facing teams by developing internal projects to help to empower the team with analytics, dashboards, new go-to-market techniques, business case modeling tools and many other activities
Combine a technical background with consulting abilities to enable our team, the sales force and Workday
Other requirements:
Relevant Financials work experience, ideally in consulting, professional services, corporate strategy, project management, pre-sales, value engineering, sales, or other applicable roles. Financial modeling abilities are a plus.
Excellent collaboration, executive presence, and storytelling skills
Deeply curious about business, highly motivated to have an impact on prospects/customers, and broadly interested in leveraging technology to solve business problems
Understanding of software deal dynamics and ability to think strategically about driving software opportunities forward
Understanding of software deal dynamics and ability to think strategically
Deep technical background with knowledge of scripting languages (i.e. Python) and analytics tools (like Tableau) are required
Bachelor’s degree required; MBA encouraged
Bilingual (English and Business French) is a requirement
Travel 10-20%, typically in region (mostly day trips or one overnight)

This position will assist with profitability and pricing analysis to help practices improve financial results and support decision making. This role also liaises with Global Business Information/BP and & A resources to ensure that Canada remains aligned with Global best practices and effectively utilizes our global platform.

The Role

Liaise with the Practice Heads and Business Services’ leaders on a monthly basis to review performance and drive decision making. Act as coordination point for Practice Group leaders for matters relating to other service areas
Leading budget and forecast preparation for Practice Groups and Business Services departments
Review, analyze and forecast monthly and yearly financial results and explain significant variances
Prepare profitability analysis (matters, files, clients, rates etc.)
Ad hoc financial analysis and reporting
Assist pricing managers in the preparation of RFPs and pricing analysis, where required
Contribute and support practice areas and services in business planning and project decisions
Provide financial training to partners, associates and Business Services leaders
The quality and accuracy of the financial and statistical reports as well as the analysis of practice groups and services are part of the manager's scope of work.
Participate in creating and implementing policies and procedures
Skills and Experience Required

Professional accounting or equivalent designation together with 7 years of experience (including supervisory experience), preferably in a professional service industry
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization
Experience manipulating large amounts of information to generate concise, strategic recommendations
Strong technical ability to utilize analytical systems and tools (BOBJ, Tableau, etc.)
Team player with strong leadership
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to manage deadlines and balance priorities
Flexibility to accommodate work demands
Establish effective working relationships with colleagues in other service areas and offices

They will be responsible for strategic and commercial plan development, pricing, trade and spend stewardship. They collect and analyze data on potential and established strategic customers, brands, prices, and sales of Fontem Canada and of competitor products. They build and maintain budgets and rolling forecasts for identified channels and strategic retail customers under their responsibility. They are also responsible for interpreting data findings, and proactively advising senior leadership on the meaning of those findings, as well as providing recommendations and contingency plans. The decision to join a company is a big one. We have opportunities for hard working, energetic and reliable people just like you.
Why is this role important?
The Manager, Global Sourcing reports to the Sr. Manager of Global Sourcing and plays a key role in sourcing and negotiating indirect goods. The Manager is responsible for categories with multi-million dollars in spend and providing new ideas and leadership to secure the best market value through process improvement, demand management and sourcing initiatives. In this role the Manager will prepare and analyze moderate to complex category sourcing projects, provide recommendations, lead negotiations and implementation for the award of business to vendors.
Accountabilities :
Lead cross-functional teams in the execution of strategic sourcing projects and designated departmental spend reduction and process improvement initiatives
Manage and optimize supplier performance, contract compliance, continuous improvement, innovation, and reduction in total cost of ownership
Maintain collaborative relationships with our vendor(s) while effectively resolving vendor performance/capability issues to ensure alignment with Loblaw Companies expectations
Work with Sr. Manager to develop opportunity assessments and strategies based on changing market conditions for assigned categories and application of advance sourcing methodology in negotiation planning and contract development
Keep informed of technology offerings and global market trends that facilitate the purchasing of indirect goods globally to reduce the total cost of ownership
Continually seek process or asset improvements to maximize cost savings
Role Requirements:
A university degree, preferably in Business, or a related quantitative field
Three years of experience in negotiating offshore buying.
Knowledge of Commodity Markets in a Retail environment is an advantage
External procurement certification preferred
Previous experience within Category Management or Strategic Sourcing in a Retail environment preferred
Previous experience with SAP, Ariba, or e-sourcing tools would be an added advantage
Proficient with MS Office (specifically Excel & Powerpoint)
Fluent in English (both written & verbal)
Fluency in Mandarin would be an asset
Skills and Capabilities:
This position requires an advanced level of initiative and judgment to organize and prioritize tasks, workload and projects. Courtesy, tact and diplomacy are required in dealing with colleagues in every day working relationships.
Advanced communication skills and capabilities in negotiating and leading a cross functional team approach to spend reduction
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing with all levels of the workforce including senior leadership and executive management
Ability to think innovatively and apply innovations to practical business problems
Adaptable and able to work with diverse personalities and styles
Strong business acumen along with a strong understanding of quality standards relative to procurement and contract administration.
Significant development of a wide range of sourcing and supplier performance management related skills and knowledge, including a solid understanding of, and the ability to deploy strategic sourcing methodologies
Capable of successfully managing significant sourcing projects with limited management involvement
Competencies and knowledge of contract development
Prior Strategic Procurement experience and excellent problem solving and risk management skills
Behavior:
Strong analytical and negotiation skills
Demonstrated ability to effectively work with disparate teams
Creative and driven by high quality results
Strong work ethic and problem-solving skills
High degree of ingenuity, creativity and innovation
Highly organized and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Technical Skills:
Strong in analytics
Strong Leadership qualities
Strong problem-solving skills and work ethic
Strong attention to detail and organization skills
Category specific background would be an added advantage
Communication Skills
Strong organizational, verbal communication and writing skills
Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language
Fluent in English (written and spoken). Fluent in Mandarin would be an asset.
Ability to summarize complex data into key insights
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
