job_title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence Predictive Analytics
job_description:
Markham, ONJob Field:
Business Support
Job Type:
Full time
Length of Assignment:
Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

Further information is available at www.bgis.com


Why Choose BGIS?

Whether you’re a seasoned professional or a recent graduate, we hire the best and brightest to inspire change for a sustainable future and drive innovation through best practices and technology within our communities and the real estate management services industry.

At BGIS, you will be part of a diverse, team-oriented workplace, with opportunities to drive your career development forward. Our goal is to ensure that our workforce is a reflection of the diversity that exists within the community in which we operate and serve. We offer a competitive and value-driven compensation and benefits package, great employee programs, a healthy work life balance, and more. Join our team and become part of a leading global corporate real estate company today!


SUMMARY

BGIS is the Canadian industry leader in FM management for enterprise level outsourcing contracts. Through our processes, technology and IoT strategies BGIS gathers hundreds of thousands of data points from our wide portfolio of clients; data that includes energy consumption, space utilization, customer satisfaction, costs, age and types of assets which include all major building categories. As we expand our building automation strategies, space utilization monitoring methods and engage in social media platforms the data we have access to will provide insight into everything from running times of assets to creating integrated workplace strategies to developing an understanding of client satisfaction not possible with yesterday's methods.

The Business Intelligence group will turn this data into strategic solutions which we can deploy to our clients. Our industry faces mounting cost pressure for energy, continued pressure to cut cost and elevate occupant experience. As a society, we face the challenge of preserving the environment and helping our clients adapt to new ways that people want to work.

BGIS is charting this course by investing in an analytical program where teams made up of data analysts and business experts partner to turn the significant volume of data our operations generate every day into business models to identify opportunities to enhance customer value, create financial models to be used in business transformation business cases, and create insightful operational reporting.

Senior Manager, BI & Predictive Analytics will partner with data analysts and business experts partner to turn the significant volume of data our operations generate every day into business models to identify opportunities to enhance customer value, create financial models to be used in business transformation business cases, and create insightful operational reporting.


KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

People Leadership

Demonstrates strong, competent leadership for team members to guide them in reaching their full potential and meeting their objectives, which supports achievement of our corporate goals. Specifically these responsibilities include but not limited to:

Full involvement with recruiting talent
Provides mentoring, coaching and guidance to all team members
Objectively recommends compensation adjustments
Manages all aspects of performance
Manage small internal team of data scientists to develop their business knowledge of BGIS and their client portfolio.
Coach them to develop relationships with account teams and clients to further develop their business acumen.
Predictive Analytics

Work closely with Director of Business Analytics to build predictive/prescriptive models and insightful data visualizations which deliver value for BGIs clients, and advanced dashboards.
Manage team that models data in preparation for use with data visualization tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik or others as they are adopted by either CGIS corporate or specific accounts.
Work closely with all members of Corporate Business Analytics teams to define requirements for ad hoc descriptive and predictive analytics
Work with internal constituents and the Corporate Analytics team to:
Define use cases,
Develop requirements to progress from an analytical study, to assessing the value generated from that study,
Upon successful study result, scale into a steady state application
Data Management

Partner with web/app developers, internal business intelligence team, and data governance teams to ensure all product and customer data is thoroughly and accurately captured, cleaned, and made available on timely basis to internal databases.
Client Presentations

Prepare and deliver presentations to clients detailing the conclusions reached from both regular analytics and special one-time studies.
Work closely with business leads to ensure that conclusions presented are clearly understood by the client and lead to pragmatic solutions by the account team.
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Master’s degree in Business Analytics and 5 - 10 years of relevant working experience
Experience in driving data governance practices at a medium sized company
Experience creating use cases for analytical studies
Expert level knowledge of advanced data mining and statistical modeling: Predictive modeling techniques (e.g., binomial and multiple regressions); Classification techniques (e.g., Clustering, Principal Component Analysis, factor analysis); Decision Tree techniques
Proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge data analytical tools, e.g. Mathematica, R, Python
Proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Birst, MS BI Stack - Power View, Power Pivot, Power Maps
Programming and querying skills: MS SQL, VB, Visual Studio.NET, HTML/DHTML, XML, XSL, CSS
Hands on experience on processing extremely large data sets. Hands on data base administration experience a plus
Good business acumen with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven quantitative methodologies.
Strong project management skills with experience in managing and delivering large, complex analytic projects
Team oriented, energetic, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style, with the ability to tailor data driven results to various audience levels
Excellent communication, facilitation and negotiation skills.
Ability to communicate complex comprehensive topics at all levels.
Effective persuasion and interpersonal skills
Self-motivated / self-starter, strong work ethic
Solid organizational and prioritization skills
Bilingual in English and French (an asset)
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None required

ABOUT US

Sid Lee is a leading creative agency with 600 professionals working globally out of offices in Montreal, Toronto, New York, Paris, and LA. Our multidisciplinary teams leverage the power of radical collaboration to build brands for the modern age, activating communication platforms to engage with today's consumers across all possible touchpoints. Rooted in strategic thinking, our work ranges from advertising to branded content, digital solutions, design & branding, architecture & retail design, social media, experiential platforms & activations, and analytics. By breaking boundaries to create what matters, our company has earned a global reputation as a top-tier brand builder for some of the most progressive clients in the industry. Sid Lee is also at the origin of C2 Montréal, one of the largest innovation events in the world, and is part of kyu, a new collective of creative companies established by Hakuhodo DY Holdings, the second-largest agency network in Asia.

Unfortunately (or fortunately), talent isn't the only thing we're looking for. We also like to surround ourselves with the bold, caring, progressive, and persevering types. You know, the curious ones who take on impossible challenges and see their ideas through to fruition, and the entrepreneurs-at-heart who aren't afraid of failure. They're the artisans who make our collective kinder, stronger, and more purposeful.

ROLE

The Community Manager will be based in Toronto and will be responsible for managing and engaging social communities across channels such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, SnapChat and Tumblr. They will work closely with the extended client team and internal creative teams. The Community Manager will also function as a creative writer on day-to-day community engagement and will be partnered with a content creator for proactive, reactive and trending social media opportunities. Through research, a good understanding of each platform's native analytics tools and moderation of user generated content, the Community Manager will evaluate the pertinence of new posts and create original content that will be integrated into the brand's social media pages. The Community Manager will be in charge of developing and executing creative social media tactics, in partnership with the client and with Sid Lee's strategy and creative teams.

You spend your life online – you are a social native – but you are also a huge fan of culture across a range of subjects and in touch with what's happening offline and how that can impact the social space. You know how and when to start conversations, as well as when to participate and when to just listen.

You speak through pictures, animated GIFs, emojis, short videos, memes, and capture content with everything you do. But you also understand how to speak from the perspective of a brand's voice, not your own – and in fact can switch between brands seamlessly.

TASKS


Monitor conversation on channels such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, and Snapchat — monitoring both people explicitly tagging the brand and people talking about them without tagging.
Engage with fans, influencers, and publications multiple times a day. Not just answering questions, but creating moments that will garner press and extend brand love with faves, RTs, shares, etc.
Identify daily, quick-turnaround reactive opportunities — throw lots of ideas at the wall each day with the agency & client teams and see what sticks
Identify & track larger ideas that are not necessarily reactive, but based on observations in the community, as well as contribute to a running list of brand-centric behaviors
Be an integral part of brainstorming for larger campaigns, bringing the audience perspective to all ideas
Create excitement and proactively participate on our client's social media platform
Develop, organize, prioritize, schedule and manage content with the client and internal team across all platforms
Announce new content on the brand channel, as well as remind people of the great experience they have had with the brand
Capture & publish content (copy, photos, videos, etc) as required
Manage pages and platforms (comments and direct messages)
Attend and cover key events to create content for the platforms
Foster relationships with influencers
Work closely with creative teams to identify opportunities for innovation and drive press coverage
Route customer service enquiries to the right channels and flag opportunities to surprise and delight members
Monitor client's social listening tools and native platform analytics for top-line insights on what is working/not working on platforms
Staying current on digital and social media trends and platform innovations and changes (such as algorithm changes)
Strong knowledge of social best practices in terms of formats to use, how to optimize formats across channels and experience boosting and targeting content

PROFESSIONAL SKILLS


Excellent creative writing skills – you're a writer at heart
An eye for good creative & design
Ability to produce video & photography using your iPhone or Android phone for a variety of social pages
A hands-on ability to do what it takes to get the job done

Excellent social media knowledge and a capacity to adapt to user trends

Working knowledge of social media management tools/platforms (Percolate, Hootsuite, etc)
Sense of humour, good insight for jokes, obsessed with culture. The kind of person who can create a fake profile for a character and fully make that funny, intuitive about being funny for fans without offending
While this is mostly a creative job, a good head for analytics and organization is necessary to drive actionable insights from social listening reports
Ability to work in an agile manner
Ability to create content/editorial calendars for content planning purposes

REQUIREMENTS


3-5 years of experience as a Community Manager
Educational background in: new media, advertising or journalism preferred
Relevant agency, media or independent blogging experience is considered an asset
An impressive understanding of social media. You don't need to have 50K Twitter or Instagram followers, but – you are connected, cultured & curious of the social space.
You know who's who and can offer a POV on who best to engage with.
Writing samples required
Knowledge of local market

CanadaJoin the TELUS Mobility team and help shape the future of telecommunications in Canada!
Join our team
We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our Mobility Solutions team works across Marketing and Sales to serve Canadian consumers and small businesses across TELUS, Koodo, and Public Mobile.
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Our performance in the market relies on our strategic problem solving, our innovation, and our flawless execution, so we are looking for well-rounded individuals who like to wear multiple hats, like to think big, but are equally happy to roll up their sleeves. No job is too big or too small.
Our industry is competitive and it moves quickly so sense of urgency is an important trait to have to be successful. We are looking for people who can drive the business but also know when to slow down and focus on the details.
We thrive on diversity and are proud to have a culture that celebrates spirited teamwork. It’s important to us to hire people who will add to this culture and who will celebrate their peers and also help them grow.
Here’s how
Solve complex business challenges with a team of business owners to develop and execute creative solutions
Build strong cross functional relationships to enable and unlock the strength and skills of the team
Be an advocate for our customers by seeking to understand them and bring to life experiences that give them control over their wireless spend
Consistently look inside and outside the industry for ideas, innovation, and inspiration that empowers you and the entire team to think bigger and bolder
Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
You have strong problem identification skills and outstanding ability to use analytics to distill insights that allow you to make thoughtful, strategic recommendations
You have solid business acumen and an understanding of Profit & Loss levers and key performance measures
You have a strong business-owner mentality and can manage projects effectively from beginning to end, including funding and timelines
You have excellent interpersonal skills; ability to work with diverse groups and empower cross-functional partners to feel ownership of the business and to reach their highest potential
You have a keen ability to influence without authority and to drive action through ambiguity and change
You are curious and possess the ability to probe, ask, and dig to better understand our customers and business partners
You are an effective communicator and can tell a compelling story in verbal and written form, including presentations
You are resilient, flexible and adaptable; you appreciate that failure and setbacks are a natural way to learn and grow
You have 2-4 years of experience in product management
What WE Give Back to YOU
Opportunity to show your stuff and be recognized and rewarded for excelling
Highly-engaged, dynamic and collaborative environment
Opportunities for personal development through training, networking and career development
Organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
Competitive compensation and benefits
Place that embraces our core values: spirited Teamwork, courage to Innovate, embrace Change and initiate Opportunity, and a passion for Growth

Summary
Posted: Sep 29, 2018
Weekly Hours: 37.5
Role Number: 114342165
The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts.
By joining Apple, one of the most influential technology leaders and brands in the industry, you will be able to make a positive impact on a company that is known for its impressive lineup of products. At Apple, you’ll share in a dedication to excellence by partnering with extraordinary managers, all with one unified vision of crafting innovative products that delight our customers. Finance is about “Fuelling Innovation.” We do this by hiring unusual individuals with integrity, accountability, collaboration, excellence, and enthusiastic thinking.
Canada Sales Finance is seeking a passionate, self-driven leader for the Demand Forecasting and Analysis (DF&A) team. Partnering with Sales, Operations, and other Finance teams, you will lead the performance of Apple’s products and provide direction on how to optimize outcomes. You are a highly reciprocal and process driven leader with not only the expertise to analyze and distill complex data, but also to present recommendations concisely and persuasively at the executive level.
Key Qualifications
Minimum 8 years of dynamic finance, forecasting, or analytics experience
At least 3 years experience leading a team of analysts, including successfully developing people to have career growth agility
Validated ability to problem solve through ambiguous situations using complex, non-linear, and occasionally incomplete data, with a knack for providing new perspectives and challenging status quo thinking
Extraordinarily strong verbal, written, and presentation skills
Impeccable organization skills with expertise leading multiple and going for priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Razor sharp attention to detail, possessing the highest standards of accuracy, while still having the aptitude to deliver big picture conclusions succinctly
Strong team collaborator, with the capacity for developing relationships and quickly becoming a trusted business partner who can influence effectively
Track record for proactively identifying and executing improvements in execution
Expert level knowledge of Excel; proficiency with Keynote, Business Objects, Demantra, Essbase, and Tableau an asset
Description
Business Partnering and Communications:
- Build strong partnerships and influence with cross-functional teams including Sales, Sales Operations, Reseller Operations, Supply Demand Management, Marketing, and Worldwide (WW) Finance
- Lead the Canadian Weekly Business Review (WBR) with Sales, Finance, and Operations, including agenda setting to focus on priorities, curating meeting materials, and moderating the discussion to drive actions against forecast risks and opportunities (R&O)
- Establish subject matter expertise on the product categories covered by Apple’s portfolio, keeping up to date on market dynamics including share, pricing, and high-reaching impacts
- Present forecast outlook/assumptions and write executive e-mail reports to senior Sales and Finance leaders, up to the WW VP of Sales
- Proactively recommend to Operations teams where to prioritize and allocate supply to maximize revenue and consumer experience
STRATEGIC PLANNING & ANALYSIS:
- Deeply understand the pan-geo Canadian business and strategy and the effects of seasonality, historical performance, sales initiatives, channel interaction, and macro-economic conditions on financial outcomes
- Own the units/revenue outlook for Annual Plan and present recommendations to senior management
- Actively participate in and give insights to Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR)
- Provide innovative analyses and strategic consultation on product outlook and market dynamics for ad-hoc and special projects
- Support the ongoing development of Apple tools and business support systems, including participation in future projects
LEADERSHIP:
- Lead an elite DF&A team through cultivating, coaching, and challenging a team of up to 3 senior analysts
- Lead DF&A deliverables, imparting thoughtful feedback on analysts’ recommendations
- Steward professional development for the team, paving the way for future career opportunities
- Serve as the primary geo contact with WW Finance, leading the weekly WW WBR prep call
- Directly backfill for any out of office DF&A analysts
FORECASTING:
- Review weekly and quarterly forecasts for sell through, sell in and channel inventory by analyzing performance to date and evaluating potential R&O
- Drive cross-functional consensus on forecast revisions by explaining drivers that are impacting previous guidance and enthusiastically identify levers to run R&O
- Assess the uplifts for promotional and sales initiatives, working with Route-to-Market Finance teams to evaluate business cases
- Directly manage the forecast for a subset of Apple’s product portfolio, providing a view down to the sub-product and major account level
Education & Experience
Business or Science undergraduate degree. MBA or other relevant advanced business degree strongly preferred.

Bounteous Canada is dedicated to being the best customer experience, eCommerce, and strategic partner for clients across North America.
Our team, located in the bustling downtown Toronto core, is growing rapidly! If you like a fast-paced work environment that is fun, creative, and collaborative, with phenomenal projects, then Bounteous may be the ideal fit for you.
The Opportunity
The team is looking for a Google Analytics Consultant who understands the digital analytics space and has the ability to build and customize web analytics and tag manager implementations. The ideal candidate can track sites and mobile applications for our clients and work to become a top-100 web analytics implementation expert in the world!
Responsibilities:
Develop domain expertise in client’s business space to drive results.
Demonstrate a grasp of the fundamental importance of clean data to empower successful digital marketing initiatives, in support of larger business objectives.
Identify gaps throughout the customer experience and recommend solutions.
Ensure client expectations are met and results are delivered.
Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both in speech and writing.
Cultivate and manager relationships at the company and among the team.
Collaborate with the team lead and do so in a manner consistent with our culture and values.
Adapt to a fast-paced work environment and have the ability to overcome technical and business challenges.
Demonstrate high intellectual bandwidth, as well an ability to prioritize and work on the right things at the right time.
Requirements
College degree (required) plus at least 2 years of relevant work experience in marketing, consulting, and/or media.
Experienced with Google Analytics and has implemented, configured, and customized the tool.
Deployed Google Analytics through Google Tag Manager.
Has focused in one or more of the following areas: digital analytics, optimization, statistical modeling, consumer insights, and/or marketing analytics.
Understand how to read and interpret reports.
R knowledge or can speak to big data.
Experience with BigQuery or have used data visualization tools like Tableau is a plus!
Benefits
Competitive salary.
Training opportunities for professional development.
Health benefits, including medical, dental and vision coverage.
Flexible PTO (Paid time off) policy.
Extensive health and wellness programs, and initiatives.
Creative, fun, pet-friendly work environment.
Monthly team events: Bonfire, Jay’s game, Axe-throwing and more.
Internal office activities, including Yoga classes, Game nights & more!
Corporate gym discounts.
Weekly catered Lunch.
Bounteous offers competitive compensation, benefits, training opportunities, and a killer downtown Toronto office. Did we mention we like beer and pizza? If this sounds like something you’re interested in, send us an application with all the particulars (resume, portfolio, Dribble accounts, etc.).
**Must be legally eligible to work in Canada.
**Please note only successful candidates will be contacted.

job_title: Manager, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Finance Applications
job_description:
Toronto, ONWho We Are:
HBC is a diversified global retailer, focused on driving the performance of high quality stores and their all-channel offerings, growing through acquisitions, and unlocking the value of real estate holdings.

Founded in 1670, HBC is the oldest company in North America. Our portfolio today includes formats ranging from luxury to premium department stores to off price fashion shopping destinations, with more than 480 stores and over 66,000 employees around the world.

Our leading banners across North America and Europe include Hudson’s Bay, Lord & Taylor, Saks Fifth Avenue, Saks OFF 5TH, Galeria Kaufhof, the largest department store group in Germany, and Belgium’s only department store group Galeria INNO.

We have significant investments in real estate joint ventures. HBC has partnered with Simon Property Group Inc. in the HBC Global Properties Joint Venture, which owns properties in the United States and Germany. In Canada, HBC has partnered with RioCan Real Estate Investment Trust in the RioCan-HBC Joint Venture.

A truly global corporate citizen, HBC is committed to responsible business practices to bring about positive change, and we work hard to shape a sustainable future for people and the planet. Our philanthropic initiatives help create healthy families, strong communities, and sport excellence in the cities and countries in which we operate around the world, while striving to create innovative programs and resources that provide flexibility for work-life balance in order to maintain a positive working environment

What This Position Is All About:
The Manager, BI & Analytics will be responsible for identifying the varied existing sources of data, accessing that information and delivering meaningful analytics, business intelligence through a creation of reports in a consumerable format to drive improved decision making is in increasingly high demand within HBC. This leadership role in the Finance Applications COE is responsible for ensuring we can leverage our investments in new applications to deliver significant improvements and advances in automated, accurate and accessible reporting and analytics across Finance This leadership role will also be a key Finance point person in projects and initiatives beyond Finance to align data models, analytics strategies broadly, understand downstream impacts and be proactive in the design and delivery of new/improved insight to the business.

The successful candidate must have a proven ability to build strong business relationships beyond the Finance team as well as the ability to effectively manage the needs of multiple stakeholder groups. He/she should have the ability to turn concepts into action. He/she should embody a culture of taking smart risks and innovating to win, with a willingness to initiate change as the company grows in order to streamline processes, improve efficiency and facilitate the growth of the company. They’ll have the ability to provide strong customer service and accurate, concise and up to date information in a timely manner when needed.



As the Manager, BI & Analytics, You Will:
Work closely with key stakeholders across Finance to understand needs, manage expectations/timing and exceed expectations in creation and maintenance of reporting, analytics and BI requirements to drive the business;Support development of and own the execution of the plan for BI/Analytics across Finance, including implementation and enhancements of applications for core Finance suite (Oracle Fusion, Hyperion, Oracle ERP) and legacy applications;Provide cross-team support on development/maintenance of key reporting for operational Finance teams;Engage with and support teams across the Finance Applications and Projects COE on Security, Governance and overall Fusion management (e.g. upgrades, testing, etc.);Develop and understanding of where data resides, data architecture and ensure reporting and BI strategies, applications and methods meet the needs of business in a cost-effective manner and in-line with maturity models.Maintain critical stakeholder relationships to remain close to all relevant issues/needs/concerns.Work closely with IT, other areas of the business and third-party vendors to develop and align an overarching approach to analytics and BI.

You Also Have:8+ years of diverse accounting, finance and information systems experience required;Demonstrated strong technical skills/knowledge of Oracle BI suite, including BI Publisher, OTBI, Oracle Analytics suite, Essbase, SmartView, etc.Demonstrated experience with Oracle Cloud Security, Fusion Interfaces and Oracle Web Services strongly preferred;Demonstrated experience in working with Finance stakeholders to understanding reporting and BI requirements, evaluating available data and creating reports (automated, manual, other) to deliver on desired business outcomes;Demonstrated leadership roles with expertise in Oracle ERP/Fusion Cloud;Strong Microsoft skills, including PowerPoint, Excel and Project.Experience with Hyperion (HFM, Hyperion Planning) is strongly preferred.Bachelor’s degree in either information systems or accounting/finance is required and an additional degree or qualification in the other is strongly preferred.

How Often You May Travel:

None

Your Life and Career at HBC:
Be part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balanceBenefits package for all eligible full-time employees (including medical, vision and dental).An amazing employee discount

Thank you for your interest with HBC. We look forward to reviewing your application.

HBC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, HBC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

HBC welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

Service: Financial Advisory
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
External Posting Description
The Financial Crime landscape is continually evolving and becoming increasingly complex for our clients to manage. Rapidly emerging fraud vectors, cyber-attack typologies, and increasing money laundering risks and regulatory pressures leave our clients struggling to respond in a nimble and effective manner, as they battle siloed systems and organizational structures.

Deloitte helps our clients to protect their brand and reputation by proactively advising on their exposure to fraud, corruption, and other financial crime issues. Drawing on our global network of seasoned investigators, intelligence analysts, technologists and advanced analytics, we can quickly and efficiently gain an understanding of our clients’ various Financial Crime exposures. We provide expert advice and solutions to address our clients Financial Crime Management needs across the organization:

A career in Financial Advisory will offer you the opportunity to:
Work in a fast growing and challenging environment with like-minded people who are eminent in their respective technical fieldDevelop solutions through collaborative discussions, in our teams and with clientsContinue your professional development to reinforce and expand your chosen career pathWork with high profile clients on a variety of Canadian and international engagements

As a Manager you will be involved in three distinct areas:

Technical Delivery
Design and architect analytics solutions for analyzing large datasets, developing models and analytics tests, and visualizing dataLead technical teams, providing support and guidance as requiredWork in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and participate in client presentations

Practice Development & Go-to-Market
Contribute to practice growth and development, including client engagements and business initiativesDevelop a specialization in the Forensic group and act as a business or technical advisor in the area of expertiseDevelop relationships with clients and support the scoping, design and development of engagementsCoach and mentor team members to their highest potential

Project Management
Manage the complete lifecycle of Analytics projectsEmploy a structured approach to project management to ensure complete client satisfaction and project profitabilityEnsure risks are monitored and controlled appropriately
External Posting Qualifications
Completed a Bachelor's Degree or Master Degree in the preferred concentration in a quantitative discipline such as: Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance or other quantitative discipline.5+ years of relevant work experienceLead file engagements of at least 5-6 team members and supported junior resources throughout an Analytics lifecycleLead business initiatives and prepared Go-to-Market materials that aligns to the business’s strategy and visionProject management experience including budgeting, activity tracking and stakeholder communicationProven analytical skills and systematic problem solving abilitiesProven experience in design and development of Analytics packages solutionsRelevant work experience in financial crimes programs in analytics or technology is preferred.Canadian travel required, with the potential for occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments

Technical Skills
Deloitte Financial Crime Analytics practice uses a broad stack of analytic and data technologies. As a manager, you will be leading client engagements that require creation of financial crime analytic insights leveraging the following (not limited to):
Analytics – SQL, Python, Angoss, SPSS, and RData preparation and modeling – SSIS, T-SQL, AlteryxVisualization – Tableau, IBM i2 Analyst Notebook and Power BIData management system – SQL Server, Oracle, DB2 and Hadoop HivePrograming – JavaScript, C# and Java


Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Toronto, ONRequisition ID: 54422
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose:
The Agile Project Manager, Advanced Analytics will support key projects, in an agile rapid lab environment, aimed at accelerating benefits for customers and the bank, leveraging agile principles and cadences. She/he will work with global partners including the business lines, digital banking, IT and other advanced analytics teams to deploy global use-cases to implement end-to-end solutions. The candidate will identify and prioritize opportunities to deliver effective planning, execution and communication for analytical blueprints roll-out across a respective business line/function.
The Agile Project Manager role requires rigorous coordination, time management, anticipation, flexibility, process documentation as well as great teamwork abilities. The candidate will be at the intersection of data engineering, data science, and business and technical teams, taking a leading role in data science labs to help drive innovation and advanced analytics throughout the Bank.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Opportunity to make an impact in the digital transformation of Scotiabank
Exposure to global teams and business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
Hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
A compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs
Key Accountabilities:
Support analytics Agile labs:
Work in an Agile environment to deploy new solutions within 90-120 days
Co-ordinate with cross-functional teams to align with project scope and timelines
Organize and facilitate project planning, daily stand-up meetings, reviews, retrospectives, sprint and release planning, demos and other Scrum related meetings
Track and communicate team velocity and sprint/release progress
Collaborate with key stakeholders and partners to define project management and technical training best-practices
Lead Global deployment Process:
Lead global teams in making appropriate commitments through scope selection, task definition
Participate proactively in developing and maintaining team standards, tools and best practices
Maintain process documentation and ensure the development teams are practicing the core agile principles of collaboration, prioritization, team accountability, and visibility
Empower the team to self-organize, facilitate discussion and conflict resolution
Ability to deal with multiple projects deadlines, and assist with backlog maintenance and with prioritization and resolution of defects/bugs
Travel to the US, Latin America and the Caribbean may be required
Functional Competencies:
Working knowledge of Agile principles, cadences and processes
Experience with collaboration tools (i.e. Jira, Confluence) to connect multiple stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills with ability to translate technical knowledge into business value
Effective communication skills with ability to present to executives
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to understand and navigate team dynamics
Experience/Education:
University degree in relevant Business, Science or Engineering discipline
PMP Certification (or equivalent) with hands-on experience end-to-end project management
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

With our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational
The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

Under the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects

Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.

Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios

Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products

Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation

With our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational
The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

Toronto, ONLead the product reporting and analytics for Trader’s marketplace products. Ensure that internal stakeholders such as sales, executives and product managers are provided with consistent, accurate and insightful reporting & analysis on the drivers of product performance.

Key Areas of Responsibility:

ANALYSIS: Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for quantitative analysis on the drivers of performance of Trader’s online marketplaces products. Work closely with the rest of the business to understand their business needs and tell stories with data. Support senior product managers to deep dive the root causes of business and product trends and make recommendations to improve product performance and engagement with products. Work in tandem with the internal reporting team as well as external teams such as UX and Engineering and lead all product related A/B tests.

REPORTING: Develop, document and maintain Key Performance Indicators tracking for new and existing products. Provide updates to management on performance to objectives and make corrective recommendations as necessary. Ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of all reporting data. Be proactive in providing context and insight into trends by incorporating marketplace, competitive and macroeconomic factors into analyses.

SUPPORT: Support internal stakeholders with analysis and reporting on specific issues or opportunities as required. Identify and execute opportunities to leverage data and analytics to expand Trader’s relationship with clients as an authority on the used car market in Canada.

PEOPLE MANAGEMENT: Coach and mentor a small team of analysts to further enhance Trader’s product analytics practice.

High degree of autonomy – ability to work with product teams to identify requirements and communicate them effectively
Strong business perspective – ability to understand medium-term (9-12m) implications of business decisions and react accordingly
Strong communication skills – ability to work in both technical and business environments
Highly numerate with advanced analytical skills
Ability to gather, analyze and synthesize data from various sources and present written assessment and recommendations
Ability to interact professionally with all levels within and external to the organization
Strong leadership and customer focus

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Quantitative Studies or Marketing or similar business-related discipline. Graduate degree in a quantitative field is an asset
Minimum 5 years of conducting reporting & analysis in a fast-paced business environment
Demonstrated proficiency using SQL, Python, R, Google Analytics, PowerBI and/or Tableau

Toronto, ONRequisition ID: 50616
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose
The Manager, Competitive Intelligence & Analytics, will be responsible for providing ongoing industry information, competitive intelligence and business intelligence to support the Product Team; this includes quantitative research and insightful analysis on all mutual fund products and competitors. The incumbant will be expected to create a robust and innovative framework to deliver timely reports, dashboards and key industry insights.
The incumbent will be a key member of the Product Analytics & Competitive Intelligence team that supports a high demand for accurate and timely business insights and reporting across Asset Management. This position will require a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and deep understanding of product and industry developments to quickly draw insights from the data and produce content to support Product strategies.
Key AccountabilitiesChampions the collection, analysis and distribution of relevant industry research covering retail and institutional business linesDesign and implement product concepts and investment solution research that can be both qualitative and quantitativeResponsible for the consolidation and reporting of retail industry gross and net flow information for mutual funds and ETFsCompetitive benchmarking and reporting on core Canadian competitive set including banks, independents, private client investment counsel firms and institutional asset managersIndustry analysis on key trends including product manufacturing, asset classes, pricing, series, bundling and investment dealer shelf managementResponsible for development, maintenance and distribution framework of reports and dashboards focused on key performance measures and internal business line function controls for Scotia Securities Inc. branch distribution channelsStay current on industry developments and the impact on Scotiabank
Functional CompetenciesExperience with research systems such as Morningstar Direct, Bloomberg, IFIC, Strategic Insights, Investor Economics, and SimFundStrong understanding of the mutual fund/investment manager sales process and industry’s competitive landscape, as well as the different investment products availableKnowledge of the Bank's products and servicesProficient in Microsoft Office suite with emphasis on MS Excel; confident with intermediate functions, modelling and dashboard creation.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills; detail-oriented, self-starter and forward thinkingExcellent written, verbal and Executive level communication skills to effectively present complex, multi-faceted issues and initiatives
Educational / Work ExperienceUniversity education, with a specialization in Commerce, Economics, Finance or Statistics

Toronto, ONAt Loblaw Companies Limited, our purpose – Live Life Well – supports the needs and well-being of Canadians who make one billion visits each year to our stores.
Ambitious, right?
We excel at challenging convention and pushing beyond the limits of what’s comfortable. Our goal is a relentless customer-first commitment. We analyze. We challenge. We connect. We are innovators. And what we are achieving is revolutionizing the retail and digital advertising industry. By transforming data into knowledge, we provide our partners a deeper understanding about their customers — who they are and what they are about.
Loblaw Media offers a new way to plan and deliver meaningful digital advertising to help consumer brands more effectively reach customers who will love their products. We use transaction-based insights from our online and bricks and mortar stores to target and measure campaign effectiveness.
Bringing our mission to life requires amazing people and the right workplace. We have a diverse team of experts who want to take ownership and make an impact. People who are energized by collaboration and passionate about solving complex problems. People hungry to venture well beyond their corner of the business to discover new products and new ways of doing things. We have gathered this cross-functional team in a unique and open loft-style space in downtown Toronto.
What You'll Do:
Design, implement and maintain Analytics solutions and products to measure the effectiveness of digital Marketing activities.
Build dashboards and reports to enable various functional teams make better, more informed decisions and be able to evaluate their performance.
Oversee the delivery of digital analytics implementation projects, from KPI definition to data analysis and insights presentation to business stakeholders.
Support Marketers, Product Managers, Product Designers, Operation Managers through their reporting needs (ad hoc reports, insights, best practices)
Help us in our mission to be a data-driven organization which means analytics are at the center of everything we do.
Be an enabler by showing others how to master the analytics tools available to them, thereby empowering our team and getting us to scale.
What You'll Need:
3+ years’ experience building dashboards and custom reports to derive business insights from raw data.
3+ years’ experience implementing tracking solutions in Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
Solid knowledge of digital media strategies and bid management tools (Search, Social, Programatic, etc.).
Knowledge of HTML/JavaScript and Tag Management tools such as Google Tag Manager (Bonus if you’ve coded before).
Knowledge of common digital analytics best practices and data visualization techniques.
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Excellent reporting, analysis and storytelling skills.
Bonus if you have a Bachelor degree in a quantitative field (Analytics, Data Marketing, Engineering, CS, etc.).
Ability to work independently and sift through ambiguity.
Strong attention to detail and project management skills.
How You’ll Succeed:
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.
We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce.
If you have big ideas, undeniable enthusiasm, and thrive in a collaborative, creative, and diverse group, we’ll get along just fine.
Looking for a challenge? Good. Love an innovative work environment? Even better.
Apply today.

Full time

Regular

job_title: Collaborative Planning, Forecasting and Replenishment (CPFR) Manager
job_description:
Overview
LG Electronics is looking for a candidate to fill a position in our supply chain division. The sucessful candidate is accountable for demand forecasting and inventory management tactics designed to meet and exceed the customer’s goals for productive inventory and service levels for the entire LG product portfolio. The role will insure that the consensus plans for continuous product supply to meet the Canadian market place requirements for a product or group of products.

The incumbent in the role provides significant experience in forecasting volume, revenue, product movement and procuring supply. The skill set brings to the business a well versed background using enterprise systems and modern methods in sales and operations planning.

This position requires;
Facilitating the collaboration process between LG and major retailers in Canada and their cross functional team including buyer and replenishmentCommunication and proper execution in-line with the demand-forecast consensus and demand based supply chain / logistics capacity requirements.Accountability for the effective implementation of sustainable, cost effective, supply chain processes.Detailed customer level planning at the national, DC, and store levels, creating inventory and demand analysis for solutions, using both LG and customer’s systems and analytic tools.
Responsibilities
Area of Responsibility:

Collaborative Planning:Customer level planning at the national, DC, and store levels, creating inventory and demand analysis for solutions on a weekly basisAnalyzes sell-in and sell-out forecasting trends and aligns future demand to meet the trends and current market conditions.Develop forecasts, track and recap promotional events.Reviews current inventory levels and adjusts supply plans to align with target levels of channel inventoryCollaborates with Sales team to insure New Product Introductions are planned for execution in the marketplace.Maintain Channel service level and inventory management goals.Collaborates with logistics to insure operations are transparent and supply lines are performing,Monitor and report on performance scorecards (weekly/monthly/quarterly)

CPFR Process Improvement:Execute value-added services to drive competitive advantage and improved effectivenessExecute flexible, low cost supply chain options that lowers cost-to-serveTroubleshoots coverage plans and supply disruptions on an on-going basis.Reviews the forecasting, sales capability, Inventory KPI’s for alignment and meeting business requirementsWorks well within planning organization. Provide progress and improvement in the installed processes to deliver scalable and sustainable efficiencies.
Qualifications
Education level and/or relevant experience(s)
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Industrial Engineering.3+ Years of experience in a product level forecasting.3+ Years of experience in CPFR planning.

Knowledge and skills (general and technical)
Able to develop strategic business solutions to aid in inventory control, supply chain efficiencies and cost reduction.Ability to problem solve, adapt to changing Customer demands and sense of urgency.Strong analytical skillsGood verbal/written communication and delivery skills.Highly developed Microsoft Excel skills, Familiarity with Microsoft Access and a willingness to increase these skills. Excel skills highly critical to success in this role.

Other requirements (licenses, certifications, specialized training, physical or mental abilities required)
Demonstrated experience in global sourcing organization required.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

LG Electronics Canada Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and the Ontario Human Rights Code, LG Electronics Canada Inc., will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform LG’s Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

*Integrated Marketing Analytics, Manager – Toronto*
Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's entertainment company?
At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!
What’s it like to work here?
Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.
The Job:
A successful candidate would be able to analyze large qualities of data and be able to distill what’s important into dashboards accompanied by strong insights and recommendations that would help the marketing COE (center of excellence) team making decisions on marketing activities. This involves in-depth analysis of competitive brands, media activity performance, developing sales profiles, retailer segmentation and brand life cycles.
This role would also require the ability to utilize all data sources to develop an executive dashboard with clearly defined KPI’s that ladder up to business objectives allowing the Executive teams to make effective decisions.
What we can expect from you:
Identify actionable insights and provide recommendations for marketing optimization and budget allocation across marketing channels
Build basic attribution models for determining true drivers and impact of multi-channel/multi-touch marketing
Develop strategy for consistent metrics, reporting, testing, analysis, and forecasting to support marketing decision making and improve understanding of marketing performance for individual channels and across all channels
Partner with marketing agencies to gather and clean data, audit validity of data, develop naming conventions and manage automation of marketing reports
Present recommendations to senior-level executives and measure effectiveness of recommendations by monitoring their impact
Continuously evolve metrics used to measure the effectiveness and ROI of activity across all campaign types
Create and manage development of new data structures to capture data as needed
Job Requirements
Who’s a good fit for this team:
An individual with the ability to build and maintain relationships, both externally and internally
Self-directed, proactive and able to define and execute projects independently
High proficiency in Excel
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical people in an effective manner
Ability to present findings to senior management and display a comfort level in responding to any and all questions
You should apply if you have the following:
Bachelor Degree required (Business, Marketing, Statistics, Economics or similar), Master Degree preferred.
3 - 5 years of experience in a similar role (Marketing Intelligence, Analytics, Data Scientist etc.)
What you can expect from us:
Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun. From top leadership to new and veteran team members alike, everyone at Spin Master embodies our Core Values:
Integrity
Open Mindset
Innovation
Partnerships
Collaboration
Driving Results
Entrepreneurship

eg: Application for ‘ Job Title & SOURCE: (where you heard about this job) in the subject line.
We do appreciate all interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

The Team

Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP is currently seeking a Business Planning and Analytics Manager. Reporting to the Director, Business Planning & Analysis, and this position provides high quality financial support to Practice Groups and Business Services departments. This role will be closely aligned to Practice Group leaders to facilitate and analyze budget, revenue and resource processes and objectives to ensure a consistent approach across all practice groups. This position will assist with profitability and pricing analysis to help practices improve financial results and support decision making. This role also liaises with Global Business Information/BP and & A resources to ensure that Canada remains aligned with Global best practices and effectively utilizes our global platform.

The Role

Liaise with the Practice Heads and Business Services’ leaders on a monthly basis to review performance and drive decision making. Act as coordination point for Practice Group leaders for matters relating to other service areas
Leading budget and forecast preparation for Practice Groups and Business Services departments
Review, analyze and forecast monthly and yearly financial results and explain significant variances
Prepare profitability analysis (matters, files, clients, rates etc.)
Ad hoc financial analysis and reporting
Assist pricing managers in the preparation of RFPs and pricing analysis, where required
Contribute and support practice areas and services in business planning and project decisions
Provide financial training to partners, associates and Business Services leaders
The quality and accuracy of the financial and statistical reports as well as the analysis of practice groups and services are part of the manager's scope of work.
Participate in creating and implementing policies and procedures
Skills and Experience Required

Professional accounting or equivalent designation together with 7 years of experience (including supervisory experience), preferably in a professional service industry
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization
Experience manipulating large amounts of information to generate concise, strategic recommendations
Strong technical ability to utilize analytical systems and tools (BOBJ, Tableau, etc.)
Team player with strong leadership
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to manage deadlines and balance priorities
Flexibility to accommodate work demands
Establish effective working relationships with colleagues in other service areas and offices


Norton Rose Fulbright


Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. We have more than 3800 lawyers and other legal staff based in more than 50 cities across Europe, the United States, Canada, Latin America, Asia, Australia, Africa, the Middle East and Central Asia.

Recognized for our industry focus, we are strong across all the key industry sectors: financial institutions; energy; infrastructure, mining and commodities; transport; technology and innovation; and life sciences and healthcare.

Wherever we are, we operate in accordance with our global business principles of quality, unity and integrity. We aim to provide the highest possible standard of legal service in each of our offices and to maintain that level of quality at every point of contact.

Norton Rose Fulbright US LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright Australia, Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP and Norton Rose Fulbright South Africa Inc are separate legal entities and all of them are members of Norton Rose Fulbright Verein, a Swiss verein. Norton Rose Fulbright Verein helps coordinate the activities of the members but does not itself provide legal services to clients.

Diversity and Inclusion
