Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Toronto, ONAbout Project X
We work with clients to solve problems and gain insight through the use of data and analytics. Our clients give us their most challenging situations. No problem is too big or small for our team.
Every day at Project X is a call to address our clients challenges. That's the life of a team of trusted advisors creating data and analytics solutions for complex client problems. We do this through collaboration, creativity and an innate desire to solve tough data problems.
Data can be messy and problematic and our teams generally land somewhere in the middle of it. And that's where the passion comes in; to work at Project X you must share our obsession for the essence of data, to break through and make sense of it all, and of course add value at every stage of the process.
Data is our core DNA. What makes Project X unique is our custom methodology that delivers results rapidly and allows our teams creativity to solve the problems we're trusted to work on. This, paired with the fact that data runs deep in our veins and is what makes up who we are, individually and as a team, allows us to do the work we're passionate about. It is the foundation that translates into a common understanding, a way of being, that is apparent not just to us at Project X, but to our clients.
What we do
At Project X, we work side-by-side with our clients to create tailored solutions that meets their needs. From strategy through execution delivery, Project X works with it's clients to achieve results in a quick and cost-effective manner using our rapid results methodology. This approach defines our success and sets us apart.
Who we need
As a trusted advisor, the engagement manager ensures the success of the customer, making the most of their environment by tailoring delivery plans and driving business value. You will be responsible for the delivery quality of our services throughout projects, executing within agreed budget and to customer satisfaction.
You are involved in structuring SOW, managing the delivery from inception to completion and follow up of engagements. You are responsible for developing long-term strategic customer relationships and growing of the services.
As an Engagement Manager you will:
Act as the customer's primary Point of Contact for Services and Support
Address any customer satisfaction issues across the customer's organization and follow up with speed and efficiency
Manage all customer situations including conflict resolution and high-profile Escalations
Lead technical support ticket review ensuring appropriate responses from the delivery team
Perform regular risk assessments
Ensure the correct setup of services and provide training on process, tools and procedures to assure the customer experience.
Create and support account plans including clearly aligned operational procedures for critical incidents.
Deliver service reviews and track agreed corrective actions.
Foster positive relationships with our customer as their trusted partner, firm acting voice of the client and Project X.
Present and promote the value of Project X services to the client.
Assist customers with using our services throughout projects.
Track service delivery to ensure Project X meets or exceeds optional KPI's to maximize customer satisfaction and ensure service renewals
Attend regular meetings with assigned customers to assure their level of understanding in services purchased and being delivered.
 Ensure that contract terms and conditions are met; respond to questions and queries in relation to service
Manage invoices and bills for assigned customers
Identify upselling and cross-selling opportunities; work with sales to generate new business
Build teams to facilitate communications with the delivery, customer, sales and any other internal or external contacts
 How do we know its You?
You come with 5+ Years of experience as a Manager having specialised training in sales and Customer Service.
You have a Degree/Diploma in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering or related topic or relevant experience
You have above average skills in communication and the ability to present to all levels of an organization up to C-Suite.
Excellent skills in negotiation and crisis management and the ability to effectively analyze situations, break down problems and identify key issues.
Demonstrated ability to build solid and lasting relationships with the clients which exceed building rapport (I.e knowing quarterly business results to help them realign their strategy).
Experience in project management, collaboration and promoting collaboration among teams
A consulting state-of-mind. It's a thing. You'll know if you have it. So will we. You coach our team on how to effectively work autonomously and away from headquarters for long periods of time. And still, find their way back "home" and into the comfortable, open and sharing mental and physical space of our office on a regular basis.
Operational excellence qualification (ITIL) or related, preferred but not required
Why join Project X?
Project X Ltd drives success by focusing on building teams of incredibly talented, fun, dedicated people.
At Project X, we work hard for our Clients but we also work hard to continue to be an employer of choice. We reward hard work and forward thinking with recognition, a fun company culture, opportunity to advance your career and a competitive salary.
We also offer other employment benefits like:
Health and dental benefits package
Gym membership discount
Casual dress code and working environment
Holiday parties and BBQs
Getting together for team socials and sporting events
While we often work onsite with our clients, we make sure we spend lots of time together to ensure everyone feels connected to the mission, company culture and is a valued member of the team.
If you believe in working collectively to raise the bar, we want to meet you. Express your interest here and follow us on Twitter, Facebook or LinkedIn.
Project X welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Familiarity with retail growth tactics and technologies related to personalization and promotion effectiveness.

Toronto, ONeSight is an organization with a simple but profound belief: that people who can see the world, can change the world.
This belief has driven us to invent a truly novel technology - breakthrough, electronic glasses that let the legally blind actually see. This solution dramatically transforms the lives of the legally blind, with thousands of stories online (http://esighteyewear.com/moments) that are likely to leave you with a lump in your throat or a tear in your eye.
We are a well-funded, cutting-edge organization that in growth mode transitioning from Start-up to Scale-up. We are looking for a Communications Manager responsible for corporate communications, media relations and PR events to further support the buildup.
What you'll be working on:
Develop communications strategies and reconcile related budgets.
Work collaboratively with agency partners in delivering fully integrated PR & communication campaigns.
Manage media relations, secure and evaluate press opportunities.
Manage PR & partnership events, interviews, and KOL engagements that drive both brand and business results.
Manage the production of MARCOM content, including videos, brand collaterals, promotional messages, and content shoots.
Provide support to the development of the product communication plans as part of the go-to-market planning.
Partner with HR to implement effective corporate communications strategies.
Create copy for MARCOM initiatives, including press releases, press kits, newsletters, and related materials.
Manage social media accounts, evaluate social media data and analytics to formulate insights that will inform creative development and optimization.
Prepare media activity reports and semi-annual media agency performance reviews.
Work closely with the Sr. Director to bring forward recommendations to optimize process and overall performance.
Who you are:
A minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role.
Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, public relations or relevant field.
Demonstrated ability to leverage social media and use social media channels effectively to deliver marketing content.
Proven experience creating targeted content that generates measurable ROI is advantageous.
What we are offering:
Meaningful work that changes people's lives – you can be proud of what you do!
Competitive base salary.
Comprehensive benefits.
A fully stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages.
A collaborative team environment with comfy sofas and Muskoka chairs.
Monthly after work socials to recharge your batteries.
Get in early at a growing (private) company with stock options.
At eSight we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require any accommodation during the application or interview process, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please contact us at 613 800 5544 x538.

Saskatoon, SKOperations Manager - Saskatoon
As an Operations Manager for ParcelPal, you will be directly responsible for the growth, development, and ongoing maintenance of our new markets. You will be involved in multiple aspects of the business, being directly responsible for finding the right people on your team, managing and improving operations, overseeing local marketing and sales campaigns. The right person for this role should not shy away from unforeseen (and seen!) challenges, have a natural aptitude for people management and the operational grit to get it done. If you're the type of person that demands more out of themselves, read on!
What will keep you busy?
Marketing:
You will be coordinating with the marketing team on initiatives for your region as well as regional expansion. You will also liaise with HQ to ensure brand consistency is maintained and messaging is suitable to your regional market.
HR:
As the leader of your city's team, you will develop and maintain day-to-day HR procedures, manage employee/driver schedules, interview potential staff for multiple roles, develop employee programs designed to empower and drive high performance.
Support:
As a customer-centric company, you will work with HQ on any customer support inquiries and follow up when necessary for both merchants and consumers. You will facilitate support, training, and customer service to our merchant partners.
Operations:
Getting things to where they need to be and on time should become your goal.

You will work to improve and execute on the functional aspects of each department: the logistics of marketing, sales coordination, process engineering, and optimizing dispatch and routing to drive strategic goals and initiatives. You will oversee all operations within your region to ensure efficient and supreme customer service. You will be working with marketing to increase order volumes but also use your analytical aptitude to identify opportunities to lower costs. You will ensure that your team is working to strengthen our service, streamline processes and ultimately improve the way we do things.
Nice to have:
Hiring, Developing and managing salesforce for Partner businesses
You are a true self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit. You can work in a fast-paced and (sometimes) chaotic environment.
A customer-centric person that will go the extra mile to ensure our customers are happy.
You are a natural leader who is constantly curious to learn, grow and teach others.
Competitive, driven and hungry.
Confident, friendly 'people person' who can establish and maintain solid relationships
Need to have:
2 - 4 years of experience in consulting, strategy, business development, operations, technology, banking, analytics or related experience
high-growth or early-stage start-up experience is a huge asset
Proven track record of leading initiatives, hitting goals and succeeding in a team environment
Experience building and managing a team of 4-8 people
Excellent Excel skills
Must like to travel.
Must understand that working for ParcelPal is not a 9-5 Job, it's a lifestyle.

You will be a key member of our team
What we can offer:
Competitive salary
Free delivery….of course
The ability to work independently without management breathing down your neck

CaseWare International is a leading global software provider for accounting firms, corporations, and governments. We build auditing software solutions that push the technological boundaries in the industry. With 30 years of proven success, our solutions are used daily by hundreds of thousands of users in 130 countries and in 16 spoken languages.
At the heart of CaseWare Canada, is our unique culture, which lays the foundation for who we are, what we do, and where we are going. As an organization, we strive for a dynamic culture by exercising three core values - community, excellence, and continuous innovation.
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who is passionate about building products that customers love. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.

What’s in it for you:
Have fun creating great products, solutions and an exceptional customer experience
Take ownership of your business process by recommending and implementing improvements
Working with an established market segment as a market leader but with a “scale up” feel
Celebrate achievements and corporate goals with social events
We encourage candor, collaboration and possibility thinking
We develop cutting-edge software solutions that change the future of audit, financial reporting and data analytics.

You Are:
Passionate about success and efficiency of financial reporting, and the unwavering belief that this can lie in systems. It is important that the successful incumbent is confident, and able to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a way that keeps all teams aligned to the vision and road-map of the product.
Exceptional technical and data-analysis skills, with a demonstrated passion for technology
Confident, enthusiastic, and highly resourceful
Empowered and committed
Visionary and doer. You should possess a big-picture vision and the drive to make it a reality

We Need You To:

As the Product Manager for the Financial Reporting Solutions team, you will have end-to-end responsibility for the work undertaken by your squad within the team, focused on creating cloud based solutions. Working closely with your squad of developers, designers and QA, your goal is to keep the squad focused on building innovative solutions that exceed client expectations.

You will work closely with the users and stakeholders to understand pain points and create relevant products and features that meet user needs.
Maintain and communicate the vision and direction of the financial reporting product suite
Set goals and objectives for product releases
Understand and communicate market and client needs and prioritize product development accordingly
Set delivery dates and drive the overall delivery of product to market.
Keep customers and key stakeholders highly engaged.
Communicate with key stakeholders.
Represent the customer interface and engage the customer – using your personal knowledge (subject matter expert) as well as consulting with platform providers, implementation teams and clients. Maintain a thorough understanding of the customer needs to ensure we continuously deliver value. Work closely with sales to understand and improve win rates.
Build a strong partnership with the product owner/s. Work closely with the Product Owner/s to develop appropriately detailed specifications for product features so that they are clearly understood by the development teams. Express what value-added is from a customer perspective and focus the development efforts toward providing that value.
Ensure product success. Communicate status externally. Ensure profitability (ROI). Ensure delivery of the roadmap. Validate value proposition through customer engagement, such as beta testing Integrate cross functional teams required to deliver products to markets.
Collaborate closely with the product development team. Participate in team activities like planning, product demos and reviews. Provide day-to-day JIT tactical decisions to system level questions and prioritization. Closely collaborate with the team on an ongoing basis to guide and direct the product development team.
Facilitate various meetings with customers and other stakeholders to communicate product strategy, direction, product functionality etc.
Work closely with external content providers to ensure our products are compliant
The Product Manager – Financial Reporting will not manage direct reports, but will collaborate and work closely with cross-functional teams.
Requirements
Good working knowledge and interest in Cloud-based software.
Ideally, previous experience in the development and / or customization of financial reporting software.
At least 5 – 8 years in financial reporting leadership and subject matter expert roles.
Have a solid understanding of and passion for how financial reporting software creates significant efficiency and value
Detailed understanding of and exposure to Canadian accounting, tax and financial reporting principles, and legislation.
Understanding and exposure to our financial reporting product suite is beneficial.
Ability to maintain and enthusiastically communicate the vision. Must also get your hands dirty and do the work that needs to be done to support the vision (requirements elaboration, collaborating with the team, steering the project, etc.).
Leader and team player. Ensure guidance and direction are maintained and the tough decisions are made. Respects the team and the process, but maintains a clear, blunt voice.
Communicator and negotiator. Need to have strong listening skills to fully understand what clients need, not what they ask for. Must be able to keep everyone informed and drive transparency. Must be able to facilitate negotiation of project deliverables. Ability to communicate with and align different parties (customers, users, development, engineering, marketing, sales, service, operations, and management)
Must be empowered to do their job by the highest levels of the organization. Must be committed to the success of the project.
Intimate understanding of the customer and the market. Ability to manage a budget and guide a development project. Comfortable working with a self-managed, self-organizing cross-functional team.
Benefits
In this digital age, driving innovation involves transforming the way people think and act. With this in mind, Caseware is committed to three core values—community, excellence, and innovation. These values support our vision, informs our culture, our behaviour and enables us to provide our clients with greater efficiency, quality, and value.

Toronto, ONProduct Manager / Associate Product Manager

Nomis is searching for a Product Manager / Associate Product Manager to join our growing Product team. As part of the team, you will collaborate on product strategy, understand the market opportunity and customer needs deeply and own the prioritization, design and launch of key features that power the Nomis Platform.

Who We Are & What We Build

Nomis is a venture-backed Enterprise FinTech with the vision to transform the $150 Trillion retail financial services market for the better. And play table tennis along the way.

Our mission is to help banks and lenders understand their customers deeply, so that they can deliver products, pricing and offers that align with customers' needs, driving benefits for customers, employees and shareholders. And we are doing so by building and scaling the market's most intelligent platform for Customer-centric Insights, Pricing & Offers in Financial Services. On this mission, you will collaborate with a world-class team of Banking Experts, Data Scientists and Engineers and partner with a growing, marquee list of Global 500 banks.

Who You Are

You love building awesome products (even if you are just getting started!) - intelligent solutions that users love and gain tremendous value from. You have a passion for using data, analytics, design and technology to solve big, hairy problems. You can both brainstorm the big picture but also roll up your sleeves and sweat the details. You thrive in being the critical connection between the market and development teams, ensuring we know what we have to build to be successful, and that the market understands the value our products deliver.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with customers and internal stakeholders to discover key needs and validate requirements, priorities, and business objectives
Serve as a Scrum Product Owner in an agile development process, with a UX feather in your hat, by delivering User Stories and mock-ups that ensure developers know what to build
Perform key functions such as performing bug triage, communicating the status of features and hotfixes, and making tactical prioritization and scoping decisions - sometimes under aggressive timelines
Drive and communicate the internal and external roadmap for your components of the platform

Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or equivalent
1-3 years in product management or engineering for a SaaS product, preferably in financial technology or data analytics
Ability to work as a leader in a fast-paced, cross-functional team
A passion for building data driven products and working with big data
Familiarity with financial and statistical models
Ability to switch between strategic to tactical conversations multiple times a day
Exceptional attention to detail organizational and project management skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to clearly explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience
PLUS: Experience with JIRA, reporting, logging, and prototyping tools

At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

The Uber Eats Operations Manager role is a unique opportunity to build and scale Uber Eats across Canada. This is a critical role sitting at the heart of the Uber Eats business, seeking to keep the needs of restaurants, delivery partners and eaters in balance in order to maintain reliable and fast deliveries. This analytics-driven role calls for a combination of creative problem solving, curiosity about numbers and data, and interpersonal ability to nurture and guide all the actors in the marketplace toward mutually beneficial outcomes.
What You’ll Do

Scale new and existing processes to allow the business to efficiently operate and grow
Optimize delivery times and courier earnings by making couriers as efficient and effective as possible
Recommend and execute actions to take as you demonstrate tradeoffs the business faces as it develops measures to absorb the stresses rapid scaling places on the marketplace
Choose the strategic projects the team should prioritize, and set a timeline to reach goals quickly
Proactively search for new product features which could improve the scaling of our operations
Take ownership of Uber Eats' growth across Canada and do everything you can to enhance the quality of our services
Be an advocate for delivery partners and enhance their experience delivering on the Uber Eats platform
Develop strategies to grow the base of delivery partners in new and existing markets

What You’ll Need

Proficient in Excel
Knowledge of SQL or other programming languages
Data-driven decision making mentality, sound business judgment, and the ability to back your analysis up with meaningful analytical thinking
A willingness to be "on the ground" building empathy with actors from all sides of the marketplace
Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment
Experience creating and optimizing processes
Excellent understanding of a variety of business models (we're still proving ours)

About the Team

Uber Eats was first launched in Canada and continues to be a major global hub for the business. We are scaling aggressively across the country and you will play a key part in solving the business challenges posed alongside other Operations Managers sitting in Toronto and Montreal. This is an awesome opportunity be at the ground level of a rapidly growing product and be able to help further drive its growth.

BioMedica has experienced significant change and growth in recent years as it works towards consolidating its US and Canadian operations at one facility in Windsor, Nova Scotia. We are seeking someone with an IT background who is interested in leading the business analytics function. With our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational
The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

Calgary, ABThe Team

Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP is currently seeking a Business Planning and Analytics Manager. Reporting to the Director, Business Planning & Analysis, and this position provides high quality financial support to Practice Groups and Business Services departments. This role will be closely aligned to Practice Group leaders to facilitate and analyze budget, revenue and resource processes and objectives to ensure a consistent approach across all practice groups. This position will assist with profitability and pricing analysis to help practices improve financial results and support decision making. This role also liaises with Global Business Information/BP and & A resources to ensure that Canada remains aligned with Global best practices and effectively utilizes our global platform.

The Role

Liaise with the Practice Heads and Business Services’ leaders on a monthly basis to review performance and drive decision making. Act as coordination point for Practice Group leaders for matters relating to other service areas
Leading budget and forecast preparation for Practice Groups and Business Services departments
Review, analyze and forecast monthly and yearly financial results and explain significant variances
Prepare profitability analysis (matters, files, clients, rates etc.)
Ad hoc financial analysis and reporting
Assist pricing managers in the preparation of RFPs and pricing analysis, where required
Contribute and support practice areas and services in business planning and project decisions
Provide financial training to partners, associates and Business Services leaders
The quality and accuracy of the financial and statistical reports as well as the analysis of practice groups and services are part of the manager's scope of work.
Participate in creating and implementing policies and procedures
Skills and Experience Required

Professional accounting or equivalent designation together with 7 years of experience (including supervisory experience), preferably in a professional service industry
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills necessary to interact with individuals throughout all levels of the organization
Experience manipulating large amounts of information to generate concise, strategic recommendations
Strong technical ability to utilize analytical systems and tools (BOBJ, Tableau, etc.)
Team player with strong leadership
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to manage deadlines and balance priorities
Flexibility to accommodate work demands
Establish effective working relationships with colleagues in other service areas and offices


Norton Rose Fulbright


Norton Rose Fulbright is a global legal firm. We provide the world’s pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. We have more than 3800 lawyers and other legal staff based in more than 50 cities across Europe, the United States, Canada, Latin America, Asia, Australia, Africa, the Middle East and Central Asia.

Recognized for our industry focus, we are strong across all the key industry sectors: financial institutions; energy; infrastructure, mining and commodities; transport; technology and innovation; and life sciences and healthcare.

Wherever we are, we operate in accordance with our global business principles of quality, unity and integrity. We aim to provide the highest possible standard of legal service in each of our offices and to maintain that level of quality at every point of contact.

Norton Rose Fulbright US LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright LLP, Norton Rose Fulbright Australia, Norton Rose Fulbright Canada LLP and Norton Rose Fulbright South Africa Inc are separate legal entities and all of them are members of Norton Rose Fulbright Verein, a Swiss verein. Norton Rose Fulbright Verein helps coordinate the activities of the members but does not itself provide legal services to clients.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity is an important firm value. We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment and to providing a workplace which is free from discrimination and harassment. This means that all job applicants, employees and partners will receive equal treatment regardless of race, colour, ethnic or national origins, sex, marital status, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief.

To apply, please visit the Careers page of our website at www.nortonrosefulbright.com. We thank all candidates for their application, but will be contacting only those whom we select to invite for an interview.

Reporting to the Director of Talent Acquisition, this role is responsible for leading a team of recruiters to develop and implement talent acquisition strategies, programs and processes, ensuring Moneris is attracting and hiring the best talent with the required capabilities and values alignment to meet organizational strategic objectives.
You will be responsible to:
Lead a team of Talent Acquisition Partners (TAPs) responsible for sourcing, screening, and presenting hiring managers with pre-screened qualified candidates (both internal and external) to meet the organization’s talent short and longer term needs
Personally participate in the identification and selection of Director level and above vacancies, including knowledge of internal talent, their career goals and succession plans
Track all requisition and applicant activity and notes in the applicant tracking system and ensure direct reports comply with the required tracking and accuracy; utilize metrics and analytics collected weekly to adjust recruitment tactics and escalate to remove any bottlenecks in the process; analyze and probe to understand why roles take longer to fill and take action to move those forward more quickly; use a predictive analytics approach to strategically select advertising mediums to maximize the best return of qualified candidates at the optimal cost
Regularly analyze and recommend changes or improvements to existing recruitment processes to improve candidate experience, hiring manager satisfaction, and recruiter efficiency & effectiveness; identify, research, recommend and implement new recruitment related tools, technologies, and services aligned with the overall HR technology roadmap leading to a fully digital end to end candidate experience
Manage recruitment vendor relationships, and contracts, ensuring the list of pre selected vendors covers`1 all candidate segments including niche skills and executive recruiting
Stay informed of what’s going on in the labour market and within the recruitment industry, share and make recommendations for programs and practices to ensure quality hiring standards are continuously upheld at Moneris
Your experience includes:
Post secondary degree in a related field (Human Resources or Business) or equivalent experience, CHRP designation completed or in the process of completion would be an asset
5-7 years of full cycle recruitment experience in a comparable sized organization, ideally in the technology, finance, or fintech industry; 3-5 years in a people management role
Strong interpersonal and communication (verbal, written, presentation) skills
Strong team player, who demonstrates a high level of initiative and positivity
Demonstrated ability to improve efficiency and quality while maintaining/reducing costs
Must be technology and social media savvy and have previous experience utilizing an applicant tracking system (Jobvite preferred), comfortable with reporting on, analyzing and drawing insights from recruitment data to support decisions

Toronto, ONUnder the direction of t he Senior Manager, Risk Methodology, Analytics & Reporting, this role is accountable for specialized credit risk analysis, risk rating systems and introducing new methodologies and statistical techniques to support credit risk management activities. The Manager provides advanced analytical expertise to support the development, validation, monitoring, reporting and documentation of Basel risk rating systems, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies. The role is also accountable for mentoring and teaching new techniques to all analysts within the group.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Credit Risk Management
Responsible for improvements to the production, organization, analysis and accuracy of BMO and/or U.S. portfolio monitoring reports and ad hoc reports, including both consumer and commercial portfolios
Responsible for improvements to the monitoring, analysis and reporting of credit portfolios including probability of default, loss given default, exposure at default, economic loss, delinquency rates, write-off rates, automated decisions, approval rates, and override rates
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for the development, monitoring and enhancement of Stress Testing and IFRS-9 models for BMO Canada and/or U.S. portfolios
Responsible for developing new analyses and making recommendations to improve risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards, stress testing and IFRS-9 models and credit decision trees
Responsible for detailed documentation corresponding to statistical analysis and results
Responsible for change management activities including the creation and management of change logs
Responsible for the development, timely delivery and monitoring of Capital at Risk plan information
Responsible for the production and development of reports in a more supervisory role, in most cases
Responsible for specialized analysis and developing creative statistical solutions to support Basel Accord deliverables, Stress Testing models, IFRS-9 models and sales/marketing initiatives on lending products
2. Specialized Model Development
Responsible for specialized support for the development, implementation and testing of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and decision trees for BMO Canada and U.S. credit portfolios.
Responsible for specialized support for the development of predictive models and decision trees to predict PD, LGD and EAD for AIRB, Stress testing and IFRS-9 models.
Responsible for providing expertise to others involved in the development, documentation, and validation of models to support risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical initiatives
Responsible for defining how risk rating systems, scorecard and decision tree performance will be monitored and analyzed
Responsible for the development, documentation and validation of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and other analytical models to support regulatory requirements, credit risk strategies, provisioning and loss estimation
3. Project Management and Mentoring
Responsible for providing analytical expertise on larger scale projects with the biggest strategic implications
Responsible for mentoring senior analysts, analysts and interns in order to deliver on projects
Responsible for leading larger scale and strategic projects
Responsible for designing, creating and managing detailed documentation and change logs for regulatory purposes
AUTHORITIES:
To deliver on these accountabilities, the incumbent must have the following authorities:
This role has the authority to access legacy system data on the mainframe and credit risk data in the Basel datamarts.
This role has the authority to access, read, manipulate and create datasets from third party files, which are loaded to the Basel datamarts
This role has the authority to access details of risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit decision trees and strategies.
This role has the authority to provide information and make recommendations on proposed risk rating systems, credit risk scorecards and credit risk strategies.
This role has the authority to coordinate work and arrange meetings to discuss or resolve issues.
This role has the authority to assign work to analysts and interns within a project team.
This role has the authority to make recommendations on statistical techniques used by other analysts within the team.
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
This role requires the incumbent to interact with the following processes and/or groups:
Other members of the Risk department (BMO or Harris) for the purposes of providing information, reviewing strategies and making recommendations
The Financing Products department for the purposes of providing product knowledge, and making recommendations about credit strategies
Model Validation for the purposes of providing model documentation for validation and to comply with policies and standards
Cardholder Services for the purposes of providing information and reviewing credit strategies
Various capital teams for the purposes of providing and receiving information on capital impact of Basel parameters
Third party suppliers (e.g. FLinxs, Accepta, Equifax, etc.) for the purposes of receiving and understanding data
Third party suppliers (e.g. SAS, Angoss, etc.) for the purposes of using critical software for the role
Information Management department for the purposes of understanding data in the marts and being able to create and run reports
Risk Governance and Operations department for the purposes of supplying regulatory data
Customer Insights, Line of Business departments for the purposes of understanding various data
Qualifications
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Knowledge:
Graduate University Degree in Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Operations Research or Business , or Undergraduate degree with comparable work experience
At least five years previous work experience in an analytical role using SAS or any other statistical/data mining software
Very strong analytical and technical skills required including quantitative analysis, programming and statistical model development
Strong mainframe, UNIX and PC skills
Experience with statistical software packages, including SAS and KnowledgeStudio
Experience with manipulating data using Excel and SQL
Excellent knowledge of bank products and credit lending services
Knowledge of the Basel Capital Accord
Knowledge if IFRS-9 and Stress testing requirements
Skills:
Excellent interpersonal, relationship building and communication skills
Excellent analytical and technical skills
Excellent writing skills
Excellent time management, planning and organizing skills to manage multiple priorities and deliver quickly under pressure
Strong leadership and mentoring skills
Strong project management and change management skills
We’re here to help
At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. With our portfolio of global Power Brands such as Oreo and belVita biscuits, Cadbury Dairy Milk and Milka chocolate and Trident gum, we’re the world’s #1 in biscuits and candy, and #2 in chocolate and gum. We’re Mondelēz International, a snacking powerhouse with operations in more than 80 countries, with approximately 90,000 employees globally and our brands are marketed in around 165 countries.
Our purpose and vision is to create more MOMENTS OF JOY by building the BEST SNACKING COMPANY IN THE WORLD.
Even if you’re not familiar with our name, you’ve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the world’s favorite snacks, we’re passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world. Working at Mondelēz International is all about the power of big - and small.
Why big? Because we’re the world’s leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. We’re ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. What’s more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries.
Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyone’s point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. It’s this combination of big and small that drives everything we do.
For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational
The Corporate Analytics Manager, Mondelez Canada is a key business partner to the Mondelez Marketing team across Biscuit & Confections as well as the extended cross-functional team, responsible for providing analytical leadership. This role is ideal for candidates who love drawing insights from data and sharing out findings and recommendations from their analysis. The role begins with data and facts but is so much more than that. It requires candidates to build a strong partnership with internal and external stakeholders to build analyses and recommendations to drive business growth. This role is about providing integrated business intelligence and consultative advice to key senior leaders, Brand and Customer teams within Mondelez.
This role involves:
Business Intelligence & Insight Generation: Leveraging the field of Marketing Analytics to identify and articulate key business issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of setting marketing objectives, strategies and plans.Client Engagement: Work consultatively with key stakeholders across the Canadian organization to deliver analysis, gain alignment and drive decision making.Team Leadership: Position provides opportunities to coach, train and mentor across the Canadian organization.
Responsibilities:
Reporting:
Work with multiple teams to assess and enhance marketing and sales effectiveness through the proactive monitoring of business performance leveraging Nielsen data and recommending changes in direction as required.Improve the quality of reporting by creating easy to follow weekly or monthly reports that key stakeholders will utilize on a regular basis to make informed business decisions.Utilize Nielsen, Excel, Tableau and other analytic tools to pull data into custom charts and tables.Improve the speed of reporting by creating automated processes to more efficiently consolidate data from various data sources.
Data Mining:
Provide guidance to the brand & customer teams by identifying key brand and retail issues, identifying gaps and uncovering opportunities in support of marketing strategies and plans.Identify key issues relative to price/ price gaps, marketing support/ tactics, merchandising objectives and volume forecasts.Works with cross functional team to develop specific recommendations to minimize risks to plans.Counsels the brand team on the results of advanced data analysis (source of volume, price & promotion modelling, etc.) providing a robust understanding of business drivers.Monitor changes in the customer & competitive environment and communicates findings and business implications to the brand & customer teams.
Storytelling:
Ability to analyze and integrate various research inputs (industry reports, internal consumer research, analytic research, business performance) into one report.And strong communication skills to translate integrated research reports into compelling narratives that deliver actionable insights and business recommendations.

TELUS Business Solutions is looking for a Senior Strategy Manager to join our National Integrated Product Strategy team.


The Integrated Product Strategy team is responsible for helping TELUS Business Solutions decide on the optimal product portfolio to meet the evolving ICT needs of our business customers. The team develops the roadmap and marketing strategies to accelerate select cross product portfolio. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to collaborate on various projects identified by the leadership team including the annual strategic planning process for TELUS Business, market and competitive review and business case evaluation. The team is at the center of various product level decision making activities for TELUS Business and you will play a vital role in providing the strategic thinking as well as the responsibility to execute on plan.


The Senior Strategy manager will drive the following (and not limited to):

Build and implement a comprehensive product marketing plan. Which includes accelerating select products, ideation or new product opportunities, profitability improvement and analysis for deselecting redundant products groups
Eyes on the customer and on evolving market trends. Constantly monitor and analyze key market and competitive activity and provide insights on the impact on our business and opportunities for us to grow
Support the development of building an integrated product strategy. Interview internal product development teams, sales teams and external industry experts to get information and perspective on product development and emergent opportunities. Develop business cases and make recommendations to the leadership team for optimal capital allocation
Performance measurement and update on progress. Establish a performance management framework that aligns metrics/KPIs to our broader medium to long term strategy. Update the leadership team on product team performance, roadblocks, and suggestive improvements
Tactical analysis. In our fast changing business, you will be required to deep dive into a new area, learn its complexities, present your analysis and insight to the leadership team and execute on plan – all within tight timelines
Qualifications

What are we looking for:
A curious and tenacious nature. You are a self-starter motivated by learning something new every day but also not afraid to call out what does not add up or question status quo
Eye for detail and a grasp of evolving market dynamics. You are able to look at a problem from 20,000 feet and see its macro impact and at the same time be able to dig into a large pile of data to develop your understanding at a micro level
Outstanding communication and collaboration. The team is constantly in conversation with key stakeholders and leaders in the organization, you are expected to have strong presentation skills, confidence in your analysis and open minded approach to influence decision making
A passion for market research, networking and strategic thinking. You enjoy digging deep into research, reaching out to industry experts, getting the voice of the customer and suggesting a better way of doing business
Great-to-haves
University degree
7-10 years of equivalent experience in marketing and/or strategy
Broad knowledge of IT and telecommunication industry
Demonstrate very strong knowledge of business analytics
Consulting skills and reporting/presentation
Influence and negotiation skills
Project Management skills

Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario and our goal is to create a transportation network that enhances the prosperity, sustainability and quality of life for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area. This includes building light transit, bus rapid transit and Regional Express Rail, as well as operating GO Transit, UP Express and PRESTO.


Mandate


The Senior Advisor, Analytics contributes towards identifying customer insight and analysis that will support the customer experience and marketing function to increase customer acquisition, retention and loyalty.


Key Responsibilities


Leads customer behaviour analysis, designs test and learning strategies, builds customer profiles and dashboards, and leverages data that will support business decision-making
Develops the customer analytics related business requirements for the I&IT Enterprise Analytics program and provides understanding of customer behaviours and transit service use cases
Drives Customer insight and analysis to assist and create customer acquisition, retention and loyalty plans
Supports brand and marketing planning and tactical execution in the areas of ridership and revenue through analytics
Assists the Manager, Customer Analytics in presenting key findings (e.g., customer segmentation information) to Customer Experience and the broader Customer Experience & Marketing (CE&M) for business decision-making
Experience and knowledge in the application of R, Python & SQL to derive insights from data is an asset
Applies sound business logic when applying learning back to the business objectives, which can include behavioural economics, specifically around pricing sensitivity
Works with Brand & Marketing, Business Development & Strategic Partnerships, Customer Service Delivery, I&IT, and other key stakeholders to evaluate business needs, propose analytical solutions and agree upon the business metrics required for a single view of the customer experience
Assists the Research & Consumer Insights group in data analytics, as required
Provides data to Brand & Marketing and Finance, so as to facilitate compilation of information required for the P&L statement and ROI reports
Supports the Customer Analytics Manager with ad-hoc analytics requests
Ensures that data is presented in a format that is easily digested and data visualization is based on target audience
Assists the Manager, Customer Analytics in identifying best practices and recommendations from marketing assessment findings to help client address key business and marketing challenges
Guides the Customer Analytics Advisor to facilitate accurate customer analytics and data reporting
Coordinates projects within the customer analytics team


Location: 10 Bay Street, Toronto

Minimum six (6) years of progressive experience in data mining, modelling and analytics
Experience within the transportation industry is an asset
Experience in analyzing customer and market data within a marketing environment
Background in applied statistical analysis, specifically in modeling and target marketing applications
Experience in building analytical frameworks and modelling to embed a customer centric approach in business plans, including the analysis of customer behaviour analytics
Knowledge of concepts such as customer segmentation and profiling, clustering, associate, and basket analysis
Strong quantitative skills, attention to detail, high aptitude for problem solving, and a natural interest in understanding customer behaviors

Title: Information Systems & Analytics Specialist

Oxfam Canada is an affiliate of the international Oxfam Confederation networked in over 90 countries as part of a global movement for change. Our mission is to build lasting solutions to poverty and injustice with a focus on improving the lives and promoting the rights of women and girls. We work directly with communities, partners and women's rights organizations to challenge the systems that perpetuate inequality and keep people poor. Together we seek to influence those in power to ensure that women trapped in poverty have a say in the critical decisions that affect them, their families and entire communities. That’s why we believe that ending global poverty begins with women’s rights.
Oxfam Canada offers a generous compensation and benefits program, but more than that, we offer the opportunity to be a part of our global movement for change. If you advocate for gender equality, are passionate about women’s rights, and share our values of Empowerment, Accountability, Inclusiveness – we want you on our team!

SCOPE OF POSITION:

Oxfam Canada’s operations are based on a suite of information management systems built on the Salesforce platform and integrated with a variety of supporting technologies. These systems support the functions of the whole organizations. As part of Oxfam Canada’s core mission, we strive to make decisions based on face and use technology to problem solve.
This key leadership position, reporting to the Manager, IT/IS and working closely with the Directors of Fund Development and Communications is responsible for the overall operation and continuous improvement/development of Salesforce and all information systems while supervising the Data & Information Administrator. This is a role that services staff in all departments.
She/he will work with the Communications and Fund Development Team to build a sustainable foundation for integrated marketing and information sharing that will drive scalable fundraising, donor stewardship and engagement initiatives, including the optimization of the donor journey with the use of the marketing cloud. The incumbent will lead data mining projects, as well as provide detailed analytics on constituent data to support Oxfam Canada’s overall strategies.
The Information Systems & Analytics Specialist will keep informed and stay abreast of relevant technologies, making recommendations for further investments and implementation of new systems as necessary, in order to help achieve organizational goals.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES: (This is not an exhaustive list of duties to be performed)
As systems administrator, manages and leads ongoing development and continuous improvement of Salesforce (system architecture) and related information systems with the goal to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
 Manages relationships with third-party systems providers as they relate to information management, integration with other systems, and use by various staff/groups within Oxfam.
Champions the effective use of the Salesforce system throughout Oxfam Canada and provides support and guidance for all database users, including the development and implementation of a regular training program across the organization.
Ensures existing systems are being utilized effectively by all departments, making recommendations/modifications when necessary, and to identify new requirements to ensure that Oxfam technologies keep pace with new innovations.
Performs the required quality control procedures on all data-entered ensuring the highest of standards.
Analyzes datasets and drives data modeling projects based on Oxfam goals as part of the public engagement work to build, advocate, and donor “pipelines”, predict behavior and measure success.
Manages staff ensuring that appropriate KPI’s are established, monitored and achieved.
Works with Oxfam’s internal and external stakeholders on data requests to provide actionable and meaningful information in support of organizational activities.
Builds reports in Salesforce and other integrated systems to inform and support organizational priorities and programs.
When appropriate, works with and manages external experts to research, recommend and implement new systems/solutions that integrate with our existing systems.
Assists with and preforms data pulls, creates reports and develops dashboards.
Develops, tests, and introduces audit reports to strategically identify and lead data opportunities and review tracking coding within Salesforce to ensure appropriateness and usefulness to Oxfam.
Oversees database integrity, security, including profiles, user permission levels, offline back-ups, licensing and data mapping.
Communicates analytics in a meaningful way.
Oversees the budget and expenses related to the improvement and maintenance of Salesforce and information systems.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & COMPETENCIES:

Minimum seven (7) years related experience, with a minimum of three (3) years direct administration experience with object/relational databases, preferable Salesforce and/or Microsoft SQL Server.
University degree in Computer Science, Informational Systems, Statistical Sciences or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Salesforce Certification is an asset.
Demonstrated experience writing Requests for Proposals (RFP), negotiating the terms and conditions of complex agreements for products and services.
Experience in a leadership role; managing and/or coordinating work of others, including working with external suppliers and contractors and technical and non-technical staff.
Demonstrated track record of completing high quality IT/IS projects on time and within budget.
Competent in writing and maintaining system documentation and data/system mapping.
Experience managing complex databases, including hands on understanding of database development, programming and data analytic software.
Experience developing technical and training guides for all user levels and delivering training to end-users.
Demonstrated success in integrating multiple systems to drive and support business operations.
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality of information.
Demonstrated experience performing detailed data analysis and presenting results, insights and conclusions effectively to internal and external audiences.
Able to effectively communicate complex issues in a concise, professional and easily understood manner.
Excellent project management skills are required for this positon which includes prioritizing, work planning etc.
Detail oriented and able to prioritize work flow.
Experience in gathering user requirements, documenting process ad work-flows, and designing systems and solutions to meet organizational needs.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Curious, enthusiastic and willing to innovate and adapt.
Willingness to sign and abide by the Oxfam Code of Conduct.


** MUST be eligible to work in Canada **
We thank all those who apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Oxfam Canada is committed to diversity and equity around the globe and in our workplace. All our work is led by three core values: Empowerment, Accountability, Inclusiveness. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, persons of minority sexual orientation or gender identity, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification and share our values. If you are invited to continue the selection process, please notify us as soon as possible of any particular adaptive measures you might require.

Important Note: All offers of employment are conditional upon signing our strict code of conduct, subject to satisfactory references and may be subject to appropriate screening checks. We place a high priority on ensuring that only those who share and demonstrate our values are recruited to work for Oxfam Canada.

For additional career opportunities within Oxfam Canada, please visit https://www.oxfam.ca/who-we-are/our-people/careers/. Please note that we are not able to offer internships or overseas volunteer placements.

job_title: Lead, Partnerships, Events and Scorecard Analytics
job_description:
BMO intends to keep its lead in the women’s space despite the competition increasing. Our target customer segments are affluent/HNW women and women business owners. The program requires an individual to lead the BMO for Women’s experiential marketing events, act as the lead on our partnership portfolio and drive the assessment of ROI on all activities including ongoing improvements to the LOB women customer growth scorecards. This role will be expected to collaborate with the Senior Manager, Strategic Initiatives, Events-Based Marketing Team, Data Analytics Team(s) and the Corporate Community Sponsorships Team leading the Celebrating Women program.
In collaboration with team’s Senior Manager and Director, the individual will create, develop and execute strategies for key strategic partnerships, act as the BMO for Women business owner of events and develop new, and improve existing, scorecards to demonstrate ROI back to the businesses.
This position requires skills in the areas of communication, creative thinking, decision-making acumen, negotiation and problem solving while demonstrating personal integrity.
Manage the day-to-day execution of BMO for Women Partnerships
BMO for Women prides itself on choosing partnerships that allow us to engage our employees in the communities in which we serve. The incumbent will need to understand the partner organizations, their needs and why BMO has partnered with them to support the acquisition of women as customers through these partnerships.
Involve BMO sales teams, across multiple LOBs, to engage them in strategic partnerships, based on the needs of the partner organization.
Writes communications and develops materials, with input from Program leadership, front-line staff and marketing managers, aligned with brand and visual standards
Involve partner organizations to execute needs around specific conferences, events and initiatives.
Manage allocation, communications, distribution and tracking of tickets provided by organizations to ensure appropriate BMO representation at partner events.
Work with Marketing Manager and BMO for Women leadership to ensure alignment and cooperation on marketing activities.
Understand our business, marketing materials available and business jargon, the unique point of difference and our products / services to communicate to partner organizations.
Manage the execution and collaboration of BMO for Women events & Celebrating Women Program
Collaborate with Senior Manager, Strategic Initiatives to receive direction on meaningful events for the women’s segment, as determined by strategy they are driving with the businesses
Act as business lead, involving Events-Based marketing team to execute events based on program needs
Handle budget for event programs, working with events team to execute on budget
Coordinate the shipping/distribution of materials as necessary for events, sponsorships, client events, etc as requested by the field or as needed by program.
Collaborate with Corporate Community Sponsorships team to successfully execute the Celebrating Women Program.
Engage front-line teams in regions where events are held to ensure completions of nominations, attendance at events, etc.
Act as BMO for Women team lead on needs identified by BMO for Women and Corporate Sponsorships leadership
Collaborate with Marketing Manager to implement appropriate support for Celebrating Women program
Scorecard Analytics
Develop quarterly reporting on BMO for Women events and partnerships
Collaborate with Marketing Analytics team to understand new reporting process on events and partnerships to ensure BMO for Women program compliance with new process
Collaborate with Business Analytics teams to ensure appropriate reporting on new customer acquisition/increased SOW after key events (ie. Celebrating Women program events; BMO for Women events)
Collaborate with Senior Manager, Strategic Initiatives and Business Analytics teams to improve existing LOB scorecards to reflect success, as defined by the individual LOBs.
Qualifications
Knowledge & Skills
Develop and maintain relationships with internal and external partners, with minimal oversight from managers
Able to manage multiple projects with changing priorities
Able to communicate with senior-level internal partners and provide recommendations
Interest in advancing and supporting women – our target customer segment
Computer literate. Comfortable with technology and the use of office programs and networks.
Client service orientation. Driven to meet or exceed client expectations.
Strong communicator
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Demonstrated writing and editing skills
Ability to work with people at all levels across the organization
Ability to deal with ambiguity, flexibility, with ability handle multiple projects simultaneously and resolve conflicts
Ability to work independently, but with judgment to know when to get manager involved
Team player, motivated and committed, self starter and quick learner, confident and self-assured, assertive, tactful, strong interpersonal skills
Trustworthy, discreet, ability to work with ambiguity and maintain composure even in stressful situations
Experience and Education:
Bachelors Degree in Marketing or Business
Proven experience in developing means of assessing ROI on initiatives – incumbent should have exceptionally strong proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
3-5 years of experience in a related position with 2-3 years business-to-business experience preferred
Experience in events-based marketing

At BMO we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs.
