Mississauga, ONThe Category Manager designs, develops, and executes category and assortment strategies for medium-complexity categories, as determined by established sales, qualitative, and quantitative criteria, in partnership with cross-functional specialist teams that achieve profit and loss deliverables and sell the products customers want at unbeatable prices.
#LI-FY1
Position Responsibilities
1. Sales/Profit: Accountable for all aspects of profit and loss management and category financial results relating to specific categories including short and long-term planning. Proactive & reactive management to ensure forecasts, sales, gross profit, inventory and market share growth targets are met or exceeded, as well as communicating/reporting results to appropriate cross functional partners. Conduct post-buy financial analysis & Post Mortem/ROR with cross functional partners.
2. Strategy: Develop category, merchandising and marketing strategies that align with the merchant framework and portfolio strategies/financials through the use and review of multiple data sources. Conduct item level assortment analysis and determine assortment including coverage of needs analysis for priority sub-categories, vendor optimization, SKU optimization, private label strategy, visiting stores (both Walmart and competitors) to build category strategy and price ladders. Proactively communicate those strategies to leadership and their respective cross functional teams in order to allow for appropriate planning and execution for all teams.
3. Negotiations: Initiate, negotiate (e.g. Cost Analytics, Pay for Scan, etc.), and manage vendor agreements, costs, vendor allowances/terms, quality, and delivery terms in order to drive supplier performance. Develop and maintain vendor relationships both domestic and overseas.
4. Marketing: Responsible for all aspects of Marketing for the category. Tab space planning based on historical analysis of results. Working with vendors as well as internal partners responsible for Item level planning, selection, placement forecasting and execution for tabs, and all other media. Responsible for proofing of final tabs for accuracy as well as exit strategies for any tab residue.
5. Flow: Accountable for, in collaboration with Replenishment and Financial Planning, new item and promotional forecasts, identify item deletes, manage and communicate markdowns/markups/ price adjustments and develop exit strategies. Develop and/or recommend product flow plans to maximize availability at the lowest possible inventory levels.
6. Execution of Strategy: Prepare and lead all line reviews to ensure store ready modulars and seasonal sets are available on time. Colloborate with cross functional partners to make timely, quality, informed decisions, and actions. Conduct modular walk throughs with senior management from cross functional areas to receive sign off. Create store communication to ensure flawless execution at store level.
7. Innovate: Attend trade shows and buying trips in order to identify new vendors, enhance innovation and product categories that will influence item assortment, new item creation, pricing, while aligning to corporate strategy.
8. Lead: Provide coaching, and direction to Category Team Analyst and/or Associate Category Managers and/or Category Advisors (vendor). Mentor other merchants as required.
Canada Walmart DivisionCorporate
Qualifications
5-8 years minimum experience required
Bachelor’s Degree
Licensing & Other Qualifications
Proven ability to deliver results including demonstrated P & L management skills
Broad retail experience including working knowledge of cross functional areas/processes and their inter-relationships.
Strong Customer Orientation
Results driven, strategic thinking and ability to influence others
Strong analytical, business and financial acumen

AccessibilityWalmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.

Create processes for packaging and/or shipping independent of Goodfood’s dinner operations
Monitor and analyze the costs and operational performance of the Western Canadian business unit
Liaise between East and West Business Units on new program launches and operations

Ready to be a trailblazer in Procurement

The TELUS Procurement team is on a mission to ensure we spend our money smartly! Within TELUS we spend significant amounts on goods and services from stationary to strategic outsourcing. Through understanding business needs and building strong partnerships with our stakeholders and suppliers, we are helping those who spend money on behalf of TELUS get the best value, achieve the best results, and bring the best innovation from third parties.

Within our Tail Spend Procurement team, we are responsible for sourcing products and services across all categories. Nowhere else can you find a Procurement role that will give you such variety. Every week there will be an opportunity to become a subject matter expert with a new product or service supporting a different area of the organization. The work we do every day has a huge tangible impact for our stakeholders and customers. Together, we can make sure TELUS optimises spend, and reinvests as much as possible to build a friendly future for Canadians.

If you’re a trailblazer who can forge strong relationships while championing innovation and sustainability, you will have the opportunity to work alongside the best minds in the industry to support our journey to becoming best in class.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Vendor Manager, you will have accountability for the strategic procurement of products and services across all categories of spend. You will also be responsible for building relationships within new areas of the organization, and the opportunity to develop the strategy and manage various categories of spend.

You will use your market knowledge and Procurement expertise to develop and deploy world-class approaches to spend management while utilizing e-procurement tools to deliver optimal value. You will also be responsible for negotiating, drafting, administering and managing commercial contracts associated with hardware, software and SaaS suppliers.

Here’s how
Partnering with stakeholders across the organisation as a subject matter expert and trusted advisor
Driving best in class strategic sourcing related to category expertise, that will underpin TELUS' continued profitable growth, whilst offering an unsurpassed client experience
Influencing key strategic decisions through impactful thought leadership and consultative approach
Leveraging expert skills in data analytics, market research, sourcing, relationship and contract management
Leading major contract negotiations, strategic sourcing activities, cross functional projects, risk and relationship management, and savings initiatives
Optimising our transformational delivery model to maximise impact for TELUS

Toronto, ONmīhī is on a mission to build canada's most customer centric cannabis retailer. our purpose is to help customers discover their journey to a life of newer, richer, deeper experiences.
we’re looking for a product manager to oversee the heart and soul of mīhī
job mission:
like our customers, mīhī is a group of open-minded people who are passionate about the potential cannabis has for each of us. our goal is to make cannabis a normal and accepted part of life. that’s why we’re seeking an experienced product manager for our retail store—someone who’s excited about making a difference as we build a new industry.
as product manager, you’ll be responsible for the heart and soul of mīhī. you’ll define and deliver a carefully curated selection of cannabis products, accessories and lifestyle products supporting a personalized, needs-based customer experience. our product experience is what will set us apart, and it needs to play a key role in our retail strategy, driving category growth by managing the margin and profit and loss (p&l) of each product line.
job functions:
a full-time member of our team, you’ll be our product expert who’s committed to the mīhī customer experience and dedicated to driving profitable growth while delivering core customer needs.
like our in-store staff, you’re nimble and curious, passionate yet humble and most importantly, focused on delivering our customer-first values. able to work both independently and as part of a small, dynamic team, you’ll deliver a strong product offering that will elevate the mīhī experience and deliver a robust p&l.
the most essential part of the job? you have to be energized by the retail opportunities that our product offers and the lifestyle benefits it creates for our customers. you must be passionate about managing the product of canada’s most customer-centric retail cannabis experience.
Requirements
principal duties:
lead our product strategy across all segments: cannabis, accessories and lifestyle
maintain a brand-leading stock reflective of the craft producers and entrepreneurs within our local communities
develop strong partnerships with local producers, artisans and entrepreneurs to increase brand differentiation and a unique customer experience
maintain p&l accountability (including pricing) and track product results to achieve the best product shelf by store
deliver portfolio optimization with recommendation of best product mix
deliver business reviews to management via strong analytics and reporting while providing strong business recommendations
forecast volume
support stores with product marketing materials and communication

education & experience:
5+ years of product and category management experience
understanding of the cannabis industry and cannabis culture
demonstrated ability to manage p&l via pricing, assortment mix, volume forecasting and margin management initiatives
excellent project management skills with ability to multi-task, set measurable objectives, manage defined timelines and budgets for each campaign
experience operating in cross-functional work environments
experience marketing and selling products in a highly regulated environment

Our Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. Were crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; thats why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Burnaby, BCLite Link Technologies Inc. (LLT), is a Burnaby based technology company driving to be a disruptive force cross-industry by focusing on innovation and delivery of technical solutions that attack real world problems.
Our initial flagship product is 1SHIFT Logistics. 1SHIFT is a logistics platform to connect shippers, trucking companies, truckers, and 3PL (third party logistics companies) via web applications for logistics and dispatch office workers and a mobile application for truckers. After our initial release, we have a roadmap to evolve functionality in our base platform, integrate other third-party solutions, and develop capabilities to meet industry variations and anchor client requirements.

Opportunity to join our team:
We are currently looking to add a high caliber UI Designer to our team building our 1SHIFT Logistics SaaS product following agile delivery methodology. Our base build is well underway with closed beta trials starting in April and broader roll out by summer.

What you will be doing:
The UI Designer will combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
Design web and mobile apps.
Use responsive design and grid principles.
Use strong typography, layout and visual design skills while executing a design task.
Develop standard UI components and style guides for company-wide use.
Use UI kits when required.
Oversee the development and delivery of effective user interfaces.
Work with digital analytics team to assess the impact of all UI design and usability changes.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

What you bring to the table:
3-4 years of Proven UI experience.
Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio
Expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques.
Experience in creating wireframes(high & low fidelity), storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps
Working knowledge of industry tools: Photoshop, Adobe XD, Illustrator, InDesign, Balsamiq, Omnigraffle, InVision, and Sketch.
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies

OPTIONAL, but would be a great benefit:
Working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Experience creating rapid prototypes.
Balsamiq
Lookback.io
Zeplin

More about us:
LLT is a publicly traded Canadian company (CNSX: LLT) with two products in development about to launch closed beta trials. For entrepreneurial driven candidates wanting to share in the success of a tech startup, this is an excellent opportunity to join us at the beginning of our journey with many of the initial startup challenges behind us.
Our strategic objective is to be an innovation hub to incubate new software products and solutions incorporating leading edge technology like AI and blockchain with web and mobile applications that are simple and deliver differentiated customer experiences. Our solutions will all target disrupting industries or markets to redefine how we think of targeted businesses today.
Valuing creativity, strong work ethic and fervent collaboration, working at Lite Link will be a fast paced, goal driven environment that promotes radical passion for innovation and laser dedication to making a difference. Our team is quickly growing – starting with Accenture heritage in our leadership team with proven delivery experience and extended with thoughtful recruiting to assemble our delivery team in Vancouver with the right tech startup culture and team that makes us excited to come to work each day.
We are located at 3480 Gilmore Way in Burnaby in a newly built out 5,500 square foot office that will co-locate our Sales, Marketing, Product and Operations teams for execution efficiency.

We offer the following total compensation package to foster a happy and productive team.
Competitive base compensation
Stock options to share in success of company
Medical and dental benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Awesome office in Burnaby
Stellar and committed team environment

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
You will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.


About Myplanet


We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.


A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Want to work on some of the biggest franchises in gaming? Certain Affinity, the largest independent video game developer in Austin, Texas, is opening a second location in Toronto, Canada — and we’re looking for exceptionally talented people to collaborate with our Austin studio. Together we’ll be co-developing AAA FPS games and creating our own compelling new IP.

Certain Affinity is seeking a Systems Designer with extensive experience designing and implementing gameplay systems for both single and multiplayer games. This is a rare opportunity to join a world-class independent developer with one of the strongest multiplayer design teams in the industry. Help us reach new heights by increasing our strength in designing fun and accessible gameplay systems for players to enjoy for many years to come.
Responsibilities
Work closely with the Creative Director and Lead Designer to design, prototype, and foster core gameplay systems, including player mechanics, game mechanics, game modes, inventory systems, etc.
Must be able to design, implement, and iterate gameplay elements including but not limited to combat mechanics, player and NPC abilities, collectibles, and player progression
Create design documentation that clearly and concisely communicates the requirements and the vision of the system for clients, internal developers, marketing and external developers
Analyze data and player feedback to continually optimize and improve the existing game experience
Requirements
3+ years of game design experience, including 2+ with systems design experience and at least one full development cycle as a systems designer.
Strong experience scripting systems using Unreal Blueprints in a networked game. You must be willing to get your hands dirty implementing and balancing your designs!
Proven ability to create innovative gameplay systems and to enhance existing ones
Great collaborator with an uncanny knack for seeing the issues underlying any criticism or complaint
Passion for playing games and understanding the systems that drive them, especially AAA shooters (1st and 3rd person)
Proficient with various scripting languages (Java, Lua, Python, Perl, Blueprint, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the documentation of technical designs
Excellent ability to multi-task and to adapt easily to change
Highly self-motivated and able to self-manage
Extra Credit
Experience designing player character classes or enemy and/or NPC AI.
Experience with other facets of design (level design, encounter scripting, UX/UI, etc.)
Experience developing on multiple console, PC, and/or mobile platforms
Data analytics experience
Strong programming background
Bachelor’s (BA) degree from accredited four-year college or university or equivalent experience

PermanentBuild amazing experiences in Halo Infinite, connect players across platforms in Minecraft, or unleash your creativity on original IP. Skybox Labs is a game development studio that works on some of the world’s most iconic games. We are a co-developer on Halo Infinite, work on projects in the Minecraft universe, and also make original cinematic platformer, Stela. As one of Vancouver’s fastest growing game studios, since our inception in 2011, Skybox Labs has evolved from a group of 8 people developing independent projects to a team of over 140 engineers, artists, designers, producers, and more.

SkyBox Labs is looking for a Combat AI Designer to join us in building compelling combat with a focus on AI-controlled enemies and vehicles for work on Halo Infinite. The ideal candidate possesses a strong understanding of current AI design, a proven record of collaborating and communicating cross-discipline, and has experience building great AI combatants for diverse combat encounters.
Responsibilities
Work closely with other AI designers to create compelling AI combatants
Work closely with engineers to build new gameplay features for use in AI systems and on new characters
Take characters from prototype, through production, final tuning and shipping
Gather feedback from playtests to inform tuning and iteration
Prototype systems and new characters quickly with script and proxy assets to prove out new gameplay
Balance the needs of multiple stakeholders to cohesively drive development towards the vision
Document and communicate design updates for both internal & external development teams
Requirements
At least one shipped console or PC title
Familiarity with game engines/tools (Unreal, Frostbite, Unity, etc.)
Ability to communicate and collaborate cross discipline on a daily basis
Familiarity with balancing gameplay values
Strong documentation skills

Nice-to-haves:

3+ years of game development experience
Scripting experience (Lua is a plus)
Experience pitching ideas, strategic initiatives and game concepts to peers & leads
Ability to demonstrate analysis of combat AI in at least one Halo game and discuss strengths & weaknesses
A Culture of Empowerment, Collaboration and Personal Growth

Our studio’s success can be attributed to our culture of empowerment, collaboration and personal growth. We employ a flat structure where all team members are heard, respected and trusted. We encourage knowledge sharing and personal growth through our many Lunch & Learns and frequent feedback. This culture is underscored by our strong commitment to work-life balance.
One major thing that we’re proud of is that we’ve been able to grow a 140+ person studio while cultivating an inclusive grassroots culture. We value our team members’ various backgrounds, hobbies, skills, and interests and this is demonstrated through our broad spectrum of social clubs: Join our soccer team, fitness group, potluck club, or one of our many D&D groups - you can even start your own!

Skybox Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

Learn more about us at http://skyboxlabs.com/

Although we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are looking for a great AI Conversation Designer, to join Wysdom.AI – a fast-growing company providing the world's most advanced AI-based virtual assistants.
Wysdom is a mature full-stack virtual assistant platform that uses machine intelligence for cognitive customer care management over social, web chat, and voice. We give businesses a powerful new way to connect to customers, answer questions, and transact any time, using natural language.
Wysdom provides the framework, the tools, and a massive AI training data corpus to enterprises needing to quickly implement cognitive care. Our experienced team of AI experts continuously trains the system, ensuring businesses provide the best customer experience in whatever channel their customers choose.
We are growing and expanding our team — please join us as an AI Conversation Designer based in our Richmond Hill Headquarters.
What is a Wysdom.AI AI Conversation Designer?
Behind every amazing AI-based solution is a team of really smart people, with a passion for helping our clients deliver an amazing customer experience. Your core role will be to train the Wysdom.AI solutions and drive the success of our client's virtual assistant deployment.
Our clients are some of the top brands in the world. You will get a chance to be a part of how these companies are transforming their customer care operations into world-class digital experiences.
But what will I actually be doing?
Your day-to-day responsibilities will include building conversational flows for Wysdom.AI's Virtual Assistant, as well as building prototypes for future projects. You will be reviewing customer interactions within our Virtual Assistants and make them even better. In addition, you will continuously enhance the performance of our solution by updating content, improving conversational flows, and building technical solutions.
Typical day-to-day responsibilities may include:
Create, maintain, troubleshoot world-class conversational flows for the Wysdom Virtual Assistant
Train the Wysdom.AI's AI solution to be smarter everyday
Create, review, and edit conversations and content to enhance customer experience
Proactively identify issues, recommend solutions, and provide tailored technical solutions
Maintain the quality and style of communications from Wysdom.AI across all clients
Write training and support materials
Beyond these day-to-day responsibilities, your sense of curiosity and analytical mind will challenge you to dig deeper into the ways in which we can continually improve our solution, our success rate and the customer experience.
About You
University degree (English, Journalism with coding experience preferred).
Strong writing and communication skills
Bilingualism (English and French) is a requirement
Experience with JavaScript, R, or Python
“All hands-on deck” mentality
Passion for delivering amazing results
Attention to detail
Above-average Excel / Sheets skills
About Wysdom.AI
Wysdom.AI is a VC-funded start-up, and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices, full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what it's like to work at Wysdom (https://wysdom.ai/careers/).

job_title: Solution Designer, SAP HANA, Omnia AI
job_description:
Montréal, QCJob Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada
All Available Locations: Montreal
Job Description
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.

Our Canadian Delivery Centre (CDC) team is based out of Montreal and helps multiple clients replace, upgrade or maintain their information systems. We deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems. Our Omnia team delivers Analytics and Big Data services on the SAP HANA platform.

Your Role at Deloitte
As a Solution Designer in the CDC, you will be part of a team that delivers new technology solutions and enhancements to our clients. We count on you to help clients define their requirements, design, develop or configure solutions, leveraging SAP HANA platform and SAP HANA Data Services.
In our view, the best Solution Designers are passionate about new and leading technology solutions, and are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. They possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are comfortable working remotely with colleagues and clients, and have an understanding of software development and/or configuration principles.

We have:
Leading methods and tools
Top professionals to coach and develop you
An open mind for new ideas
Opportunities to work with leading Canadian and global companies
Top-tier partnerships with SAP
A dynamic and energetic workplace
Qualifications
You have:
A Bachelor degree or a college degree in an IT related field (Computer science, Software Engineering)
A data management and analytics background with a focus on data modeling

The ability to work fluently in English

Experience with data integration, ETL tools and other database platforms (Oracle, SQL)

Experience with front-end development technologies: UI5, HTML5, CSS3, javascript, and javascript frameworks (AngularJS, jQuery)
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Visio, Project
Ability to work fluently in French

Vancouver, BCPermanentJob Description
At Avigilon we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Founded in 2004 in Vancouver, Avigilon has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. At Avigilon, you will find a culture of thought-leaders who are passionate about creating exciting new solutions for security and surveillance. We seek problem-solvers who are eager to rise to the challenges of a continuously evolving technological industry, and those who want to make an impact of the safety of people and businesses globally.

Position Overview:
The systems engineering (NVR Servers) team at Avigilon is responsible for selecting, qualifying and optimizing OEM server platforms that are used to deploy our world-class Avigilon Control Center software product. From enterprise scale out rackmount servers, storage enclosures and precision workstations to purpose-built embedded systems, our systems engineers have the opportunity to design, test and fine-tune our industry leading product offerings.
What kind of impact can you have? How about influencing the technology roadmap of two of the top three PC vendors worldwide, or helping Avigilon capture new market segments with customers who need to work with petabytes of storage - all while working with the latest, most bleeding edge technology. We work on challenges like finding ways to squeeze 25% faster performance than OEM vendors can offer and architecting an end-to-end product solution that are streamlined for manufacturing and our customers love to deploy.

Responsibilities Include:
Designing and qualifying hardware appliances for our industry leading, end-to-end security monitoring solutions.
Scaling our diverse product portfolio including rackmount NVR and AI servers and workstations.
Working closely with product management to analyze product requirements.
Building and maintaining the OS image through the lifecycle of the product
Hardening our product through security updates to our OS image after the initial release of our product
Collaborating with manufacturing engineering team to ensure a smooth transition from product development to product launch
Build relationships with internal software teams, technical support, product management, sourcing, manufacturing, and others including third party vendors.
Participate in the RFP process for OEM vendor and solution selection.
Qualifications:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical discipline
Minimum of 5 years’ experience successfully deploying Windows based servers
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Self-motivated and proactive with a desire to innovate
Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience:
Expertise in maintaining and or administrating scalable Windows platforms in enterprise environments.
Proven experience with Windows ADK and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT).
Experience in designing end-to-end petabyte scale solutions comprised of SAN, NAS, rackmount servers, hypervisors and L2/L3 switches.
Experience in Windows platform development work (C#) on embedded devices.
Experience with bash, Powershell, Python, C# for automating builds and processes.
Excellent communication and facilitation skills working with various stakeholder groups.
Manage relationships with third party system integrators and vendors assisting with delivery and support for enterprise systems and associated services.
Perks and Benefits:

As a full-time employee at Avigilon, you are eligible to receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes MSP, extended health, dental, and medical insurance while travelling. You will also receive a health spending account to cover additional healthcare costs, such as vision care, RMT and chiropractor visits.

We believe that diversity spawns innovation – the more diverse our employees are, the more ideas and talents we have to excel as a leader in the technology sector. If you would like to be part of a dynamic team of people who are ambitious, focused, and hardworking then we look forward to meeting you!

Working at ICF
Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.
Product Designer, Emerging Strategies
Toronto, ON (preferred)
We are ICF, a strategic consultancy that imagines and builds transformative experiences across the world. Our breadth of verticals and clients are a reflection of the diversity that drives us. Technology and how people engage with the world around them is in constant change, and we’re here to help our clients build sustainable ideas inside this medium.
The Team
In Emerging Strategies, you will be joining a team that leverages diversity and powerful processes, as we look to accelerate the design of products and services into the market. Our focus is on energy, environmental and transportation challenges, and our goal is to unlock emerging strategies for our clients into real-world projects and innovations today. You will join a team of facilitators and Program Managers, who organize and execute these solutions through our innovation program called ICF Spark Labs.
The Role
As a Product Designer, you will be an expert in crafting customer experiences across multiple touchpoints, developing digital and physical prototypes that solve for the user and business strategy. You will be instrumental in visualizing the narrative created inside Spark Labs.
Built exclusively on design sprints, Spark Labs is one of ICF’s fastest growing client services, where we rapidly prototype remarkable new ideas for clients in fast, iterative sprints. In your role, you will lead the development of the prototype and the user testing. Supported by a fantastic cast of Program Managers and your lead Facilitator – each design sprint is an opportunity to explore game changing ideas.
Our projects and programs are as diverse as our capabilities, from creating remarkable new UIs for airports, through to reimagining how environmental policies are communicated to constituents. The rich diversity of prototyping will flex every aspect of your creativity, from passenger flow maps in airports through to brand strategies and interactive chat bots.
As Spark Labs is a mix of teams from all over the world, you will have complete flexibility in managing a remote work culture for yourself, and your team. It is expected that there will be 35% travel involved in this position, to Europe, USA, and Canada.
Activities
Here’s what you’ll do day to day:
Rapidly develop prototypes to get real world feedback within weeks, to help validate an idea before it becomes a big project.
Conduct market research to fuel your design approach to a workshop or design sprint and create engaging ways to share that knowledge
Stellar illustration and crafting skills, to rapidly develop storyboards, sketches, and compositions.
Support workshops and design sprints that foster problem solving and idea generation.
Support strategic discovery by meeting with experts and clients, helping them breakdown their problem and developing an approach the Emerging Strategy team can undertake.
 Continuously improve process design by developing guides and finding creative ways to optimize our capabilities.
Your Experience:
Here’s an idea of the type of background we’re looking for. It’s not an exhaustive list by any means, and we’re open to hearing your story and where you want to go.
4+ years of evolving work experience in technology, design, strategy, consulting or engineering.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Design, Technology, Engineering or similar.
Comfortable in agile development and/or Google Design Sprint methodologies
Strong skillset with digital prototyping tools of your choice (InVision, Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, etc.)
Extensive work in developing products or services, from the customer journey through to the visual design or customer experience strategy.
Experienced in leading qualitative and quantitative research that includes knowledge of digital analytics and customer interviews.
Familiar with the technology architectures required to support the implementation of products and services, from data design and AI, through to system design & APIs.
ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce.

To request an accommodation please email icfcareercenter@icf.com and we will be happy to assist. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. Toronto, Canada (CD80)

Montréal, QCJob Description

Ubisoft Montreal is looking for you, AI Programmers!

At Ubisoft Montreal, a preeminent developer of video games located in Montreal’s dynamic Mile-End neighbourhood since 1997, we offer a work environment unique in the industry for allowing you to build and cultivate games that are part of critically acclaimed, iconic AAA franchises of international repute.

When you join Ubi Montreal, you enter a community of passionate, extraordinary developers connected by their need to innovate, to be creative and to work with the latest technology. You’ll discover a world where employees enjoy constant career advancement, a supportive learning environment, and competitive compensation packages.

On being an AI programmer at Ubi Montreal

When you’re an AI Programmer at Ubi Montreal, you care about keeping our players immersed in the game world. Using our most advanced tools, you make the unexpected come to life; in many ways, you are responsible for creating the exciting, suspenseful and downright fun interactions within a game's universe. One of your biggest thrills is witnessing players engage with your work in surprising new ways.

You understand that game development is an iterative process and you work with mission designers to improve each new version. As a dependable and collaborative member in an interdependent team of programmers, animators, designers and dev testers, you provide the remarkable AI knowledge that will create the most compelling and interesting AI experience possible for our players.

More than anything, at Ubi Montreal, you will regularly ship a variety of big, quality titles – Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Rainbow Six, Watch_Dogs, and… well we can’t disclose all our secrets just yet… – and work with some of the most talented people in the industry.

The daily life of an AI Programmer at Ubi Montreal

When you get in in the morning, you sync up to the latest code and data, and check your email.
Then it's off to your morning scrum, where the team discusses issues that have arisen. You present avenues for AI improvement, and what you will be working on for the day – which is programming AI for non-playable characters' (NPCs) behaviours, navigation, decisional systems and traffic systems, for instance, and fixing AI-related bugs.
In collaboration with designers, you ensure that the game's AI systems are coherent and maintain high standards of quality.

Qualifications

What it takes to make it
An undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent;
A minimum of 5 years' experience in AI programming, ideally in the video games;
Proficiency in C++ language;
Experience developing on video-game consoles;
Experience as part of a team that has shipped a video game is an asset;
That rare mix of attention to detail and flexibility in your work organization;
A proficiency to communicate with all disciplines and to support and elevate the team in terms of quality and vision of the game;
You are creative and thirsty for innovation.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.
Additional Information

Job Description
Deloitte Omnia, Deloitte's Artificial Intelligence practice is comprised of specialized experts with hands-on experience, and cutting-edge information assets that facilitate successful Artificial Intelligence (AI) transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.

Our Canadian Delivery Centre (CDC) team is based out of Montreal and helps multiple clients replace, upgrade or maintain their information systems. We deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems. Our teams deliver “Big Data”, Robotic Processing Automation, Digital Content, Data Integration, and Analytical Solutions. Each one of these solutions leverages a different mix of new technologies to achieve a business outcome.

As a Senior Solution Designer based in our Montreal Delivery Centre, you will be part of a dedicated technical team that delivers new solutions to our clients. You will play an active role throughout the entire implementation cycle while working with both OpenSource and proprietary technology.

In our view, the best Solution Designers are passionate about data and technology solutions, and are driven to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. They possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills, are comfortable working remotely with colleagues and clients, and have an understanding of software development and/or configuration principles.

We have:
Leading methods and tools
Top professionals to coach and develop you
An open mind for new ideas
Opportunities to work with leading Canadian and global companies
Partnerships with top software providers
A dynamic and energetic workplace

Create various custom applications that tailor towards different clients by working with multiple teams and understanding the business needs of both the clients and the internal teams
Work closely with product management, design, and analytic teams to define application requirements/user stories
Design and develop front-end interfaces, backend systems with multiple programming languages and frameworks
Consistently write effective code that is stable, secure, scalable and efficient
Accurately define effort requirements and manage personal workflow to ensure the deliverables are created on time and in budget

Qualifications
7+ years’ experience building software solutions in a corporate or start up engineering environment using JavaScript, PHP, Ruby, Python, C++ and/or Java / C#, etc
4+ years’ experience developing web applications
4+ years’ of front end technologies ranging from HTML, CSS, React / Ember / Angular, etc
4+ years’ of experience developing Data Transformation Processes (ETL) and/or databases development (Traditional or Big Data)
Experience in developing technical solutions to business opportunities (i.e. improving client’s sales efforts)

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
You will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.

As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.

About You

Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:


50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.

What this Role is NOT


A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.

Is the role a fit for you?

The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you…


Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.

Qualifications


A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).

Performance & Growth Expectations


Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.

Benefits & Perks


Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.

Compensation

This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.

About Myplanet

We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.

A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace

We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

York, ONWHY JOIN ROOTS?
Roots is not only a brand, it’s a culture and lifestyle. We look for dynamic individuals who are not only interested in retail and fashion, but who enjoy challenges and share our vision for a safer, cleaner, healthier planet. In addition to our customers, an intrinsic part of our success has always been the people who work here. Roots is a company in which you can grow and benefit from the great opportunities often available. All members of our team are encouraged to ‘spread their roots’. Never before have had brands had the ability to research the products they are interested in whenever and wherever they are. This information enables commerce both in-store and online.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR?
Reporting to the Director, Omni-Channel Commerce, the candidate would ensure every item available for purchase though the digital channel is listed online accurately, is allocated to the correct categories and has a complete set of data associated with it, essentially merchandised to the best of our ability.

To be successful, you’ll need to possess:

Understanding of Merch Analytics, Epicor and Momentis.
Solid understanding of apparel characteristics.
Experience in an apparel retail or ecommerce position is preferred.
Excellent understanding of eCommerce environments and Product Information Management systems.
High attention to detail.
Understanding of AI technology is a benefit

THE IMPACT YOU'LL HAVE

This is an opportunity to shape our company’s future by:Collaborates with:

Marketing & PR – working with the marketing and PR teams to ensure product release dates coincide with promotions, events and other projects.
Visual Team – Assist with the coordination of sample merchandise across departments.
Leather Factory – Ensure samples received are consistent with the actual inventory received.
Outside Vendors - Ensure that services are working as expected and all systems are processing as expected. Provide guidance and feedback to new enhancements and fixes.

Areas of Responsibility:1. Key Functions:

Develop product data profiles for each item including UPC, style, color, price, product description, etc. that is fed into roots.com product database.
Continuously test and maintain all catalog data for merchandise on website to ensure accurate and up to date product pricing, images, promotions and availability.
Support buyer/planner for the online division.
Manage the product listing process, including assigning product categories and departments.
Code all product images to style and colour conventions.
Monitor returns at the warehouses and recall inventory back to Roots DC on a regular basis.
Communicate website product needs to allocations and other relevant departments.
Place orders with vendors to meet needs of backorders.
Collect product samples with designers, buyers, warehouse, stores and other contacts for product photo shoots.
Write and collect data from designers, buyers and roots.com to develop accurate product information for display on website.
Collect any additional product or style trend information that could support call centre associates.
Analyze returns to find ways to minimize.
Work with others on ecommerce team, marketing team and merchandising team to find new ways to highlight product features and benefits to lift conversion online
Provide merchandising suggestions that will best present product and encourage higher items per transaction.
Feature appropriate product as it relates to current and future inventory levels.
Plan for product and category launches and evaluate / improve launches.
Work with data to adjust AI/dynamic and static merchandising rules and functions to increase sales.
Contribute to managing reviews, SEO and other product related data on roots.com.
A/B test merchandising rules and settings to help with strategies.
Find new methods to promote products to support sales in-store and online including pre-promoting items before they are available for purchase online.

2. General Tasks

Communicate regularly with the allocations department to ensure a sufficient quantity of new styles.
Coordinate with photographer necessary photo shoots.
Prepare a list of items that need to be shot.
Ensure items are labeled correctly for product shoot.
Ensure products are returned and damages are recorded.
Entering “Upsell” items into website administrator interface.
Participate in research of competitors to find most appealing way to present product and merchandise.
Assist in other areas whenever necessary.

Some of the ways success in this role will be measured are:

Accuracy of product information on website.
Sell through of merchandise.

Our Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. Were crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; thats why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

The work we do at Autodesk touches nearly every person on the planet. By building tools for designing buildings, developing machines and even the latest movies, we influence and empower some of the most creative people in the world to solve problems that matter. We love that often, these are solutions to some of the most pressing issues the world faces, such as housing more people, reducing impact on our environment, and dramatically reducing illness and death in developing parts of the world.

In serving these customers, we tap into and find insights in these rich streams of data, such as real-time sensor data from cars or 3D scans of buildings as they are being constructed or restored. In other cases, it’s about learning the language of 3D modeling from watching designers create, and then training intelligent design tools to make design more accessible. Or, it’s about automating and refining how things are physically made in the world, through advanced robotics, controlling 3D printers or sophisticated milling machines.

We have an opening for an executive role in the Autodesk AI Lab! Reporting into the head of AI & Robotics at Autodesk, you will be part of a rapidly growing team of over 20 researchers and engineers heading up Autodesk’s work in AI, Computational Science, and Robotics. The teams are based in San Francisco, Toronto, and the UK.

You will lead our AI Research team in Toronto, working on the future technologies our customers will use to create a better world.

Our AI Labs focus on research in deep learning, control systems, simulation, and knowledge representation applied to diverse areas such as geometry, robotics, advanced sensing, design exploration, and sustainable engineering or construction practices. The labs also host product engineers resulting in early productization of our research, so you can see your work in action.

A sampling of AI Lab projects:
BrickBot
Auto Sketching and Vectorization
Topology Optimization for Specific Manufacturing Processes

Responsibilities
As a Director of AI Research in the Autodesk AI Lab you will have a range of responsibilities including:
Strategic thought leadership with other research executives
Guiding and leading teams of researchers working on the above-mentioned AI problems
Connecting with academics and institutions to build relationships and collaborations
Planning and designing research projects: specifying the problem, guiding the project scope and methods for tracking progress
Mentoring researchers and engineers
Exploring and developing new Machine Learning models and AI techniques
Constantly reviewing relevant Machine Learning literature to identify emerging methods or technologies and current best practices
Exploring new data sources and discovering techniques for best leveraging data
Publishing and talking at conferences
Working closely with product engineering teams to design, develop, and incorporate AI solutions into new products
Connecting with Autodesk customers (with whom we do collaborative research)
Publishing and speaking at conferences

Minimum Qualifications
An MS or Ph.D. in a field related to AI and Machine Learning such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Physics
Significant doctoral or post-doctoral research experience, or 5 or more years of work experience in AI research projects
Experience leading teams, running projects, and mentoring staff
Good communication skills and an awareness of how to communicate data and results effectively
Comfortable working in newly forming ambiguous areas where learning and adaptability are key skills
Experience working with large data-lakes/data-sets
Solid background in statistical methods for Machine Learning, e.g. Bayesian methods, HMMs, Graphical Models, dimensional reduction, clustering, classification, regression techniques, etc.
Strong familiarity with Deep Learning techniques, e.g. network architectures, regularization techniques, learning techniques, loss-functions, optimization strategies, etc.

Preferred Qualifications
Reinforcement Learning and other areas of Control Theory
Distributed Systems and High-Performance Computing methods
Geometric Shape Analysis
Advanced simulation methods such as: FEA, CFD, Shape and Design Optimization, Photo-Realistic Rendering, etc.
Knowledge Representation (semantic models, graph databases, etc.)
Familiarity with modern ML frameworks and tools, e.g. TensorFlow, Caffe, MxNet, Spark, Ray, Chainer, etc.
Strong coding abilities in Python and C/C++
Experience training and debugging networks
Background in the design, manufacturing, or construction industries

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Own end-to-end visual design projects consisting of several product features and touchpoints
Analyze feedback from various channels and build user-centric product features that solve user's biggest pain points
Create a design system and manage a component library to achieve UI and UX consistency across WatrHub’s platforms
Develop site maps, user flows, wireframes, mockups, and specs and high-fidelity prototypes
Instill the benefits of quantitative and qualitative approaches to user research to the greater team
Deliver design deliverables compliant with UX standards and latest design patterns
Demonstrate high quality design practices for WatrHub. This includes participation in all aspects of UX: research, ideation, strategy, interaction design, information architecture, and visual execution.
Design clean, intuitive, and functional user interfaces across multiple devices and platforms
Collaborate and work across multi-functional teams to formulate and fine tune design ideas and guidelines
Comfortable discussing ideas and sharing recommendations with senior team members
Skills and Requirements

Minimum 2 years’ of professional experience in UI/UX design, graphic design, visual design, product design, or equivalent
Bachelors or diploma in computer science, HCI, graphic or visual design, business analytics, digital marketing or similar
Previous experience working in a fast paced start up environment is an asset
Experience in interaction design and information architecture
Experience implementing brand through visual/graphic design
Strong user-centric problem-solving skills with high attention to detail
Great organizational and interpersonal skills with proven success building relationships across all levels
Self-driven and motivated
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Able to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment
Comfortable working in a dynamic environment, with a small team and a lot of responsibility
Benefits
Why WatrHub?
This is a rare opportunity to lead the product designing process at WatrHub, where you can influence positive change within one of the biggest societal challenges of our generation (water)
You get to sell a disruptive solution with a compelling value proposition into an industry that is eager to hear from you and in a market with no direct competition.
We live at the cross section of water, startup and data science. There is no other team like us in Toronto.
There is no corporate bureaucracy here. You will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large, entrenched technology company.
Perks include company-paid public transportation, health & fitness benefits, a training budget and work-from-wherever days in addition to your competitive salary and incentive plan.
You get direct exposure to Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Tech Entrepreneurship and Water Infrastructure Markets from our in-house subject matter experts and industry titans.
We work hard. We win together. We are on a mission to solve water. We enjoy happy-hour patios, team lunches exploring the food scene around our office, and rock-climbing together. We believe our that our team's diversity makes us great.
Application Deadline is January 30, 2019, but candidates will be selected for interviews on a rolling basis.
