Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?
As a key member of Ciena's fast paced NPI Host-Modem Test Engineering team, the successful candidate will develop, enhance, and monitor the test automation process (S/W & H/W) for the System, EST, & Config portion of the Test Process.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate will define the test specification jointly with our Design team, and will define test equipment requirements for the SYS/EST/CFG Test environment. Candidate will also develop the S/W for the automation, the system provisioning for adequate system configuration and document everything for life cycle support with real-time Confluence documentation tools.
General Activities
Participate in product evolution by providing innovative SYS/EST/CFG solutions.
Follow the NPI Gating process steps by providing analysis and feedback inputs to the development team for each steps : (Functional Agreement, Component Placement Agreement, Physical Agreement)
Participate in defining the test strategy (including test steps, equipment requirements, captives, custom test tools, Log monitoring points, Environmental Test strategy, etc...)
Develop out-of-box smart and clever Test S/W automation in C#, Python, & Linux scripts.
Must enjoy working in a Lab environment with hands-on product testing as he will need to team-up with R&D to develop the working recipe to test and debug the first Alpha and Beta Prototypes.
Develop fault isolation troubleshooting tools and document them in online guides via Confluence.
Investigate faults, alarms, or heat dissipation on key components during EST temperature cycles.
Frequently visit to our Local NPI Contract Manufacturer to monitor prototypes production and help investigate issues.
Provide product training and knowledge sharing to CM engineers & technicians team to improve their technical Trouble shooting skills on defective cards.
Perform Data analysis of Test yield to early identify design related hardware, software, performance or even test automation robustness issues.
Provide reports & drive resolution by pulling key players within each team.
As part of constant improvement, The candidate will refine test processes to gain the highest test coverage, fully automated Test process and highly efficient test routine to handle high volume throughput at less cost.
From a teamwork requirement, good interpersonal skills are required, good relations with others and flexibility to help others or request help if needed to meet the project commit date.
Collaboration with stakeholders
This role implies a strong teamwork with Ottawa and CM Test Engineers team. This role requires to be located in Ottawa for a very close working relation within the H/W & S/W Designers and support of our Gateway NPI manufacturer.
Areas of impact
The candidate will be providing the optimal test coverage tools & solution to assure highest quality of prototypes delivery to R&D to shorten their validation process and accelerate the overall Time to Market introduction for eventual revenue shipments.
Experience
Strong technical skills with hands on experience in test & debugging of high tech telecom and data-center product
Strong Hands-on experience on S/W development (C#, Python, Linux scripts).
Excellent knowledge of electronic components (Optical, Digital and analog devices )
Ability to develop clear and structured test document real-time in Confluence
Team Player to effectively collaborate with cross functional teams around the world.
Self-motivated, well-organized with a willingness to learn.
Able to manage multiple tasks with flexibility to refocus as priority changes.
Ability to work under pressure and perform both strategic and sustaining tasks.
Open to site visits at factories around the world!
Willing to accept flexible work schedule for completing critical project as per committed target.
Assertiveness to drive our contract manufacturer engineers / technicians
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Speaking & writing: Fluent English
Bachelor Degree in Electronics/ Electrical / Optical Engineering / SW development
Masters in above fields or 0-3 years in High Tech electronic industry as Intern, Co-op, Design, Test, and/or Manufacturing
LI-CN
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
What you can expect from us
You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Full Time
Toronto, Canada
Our high-growth educational technology company is seeking a Software Developer to implement, test and maintain interaction systems that support student learning in class and at home.

Requirements
Solid experience with Angular JS and at least one object-oriented language
Proven ability to bring design concepts to life with a keen sense for intuitive interactions
Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to other technical staff members.
Superior time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal supervision.
High level of critical and logical thinking, analysis, and/or reasoning to identify underlying principles, reasons, or facts.

Job Duties
Create code, and test major features in collaboration with Instructional Designers, Data Engineers, and other members of the development and technical team to deliver projects.
Use existing code components to implement into new projects
Maintain and modify existing applications.
Debug, test, and deploy software implementations.
Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.
Provide recommendations for improvements in the overall development process.
Ensure work progress to schedule and keep (internal) customers informed of project the progress.
Stay current with relevant research, techniques, technology and other factors impacting the job.

Git
TypeScript, ES6, WebPack, HTML5 Canvas

Event streams

ABOUT VRETTA
Vretta is a global education technology company that creatively utilizes cutting-edge technologies to design and develop interactive learning and testing resources that are transforming the way students learn mathematics. Our vision is a world where everyone enjoys math.

We collaborate with schools, colleges, universities, and ministries around the world to re-imagine what really matters for students in the 21st century to ensure that every student acquires meaningful quantitative skills that will serve them in their lives and professions. Our resources are being used by the majority of academic institutions in Canada, while rising strongly as an effective tool for Math education in North America and Europe. We believe that students will live smarter if they have a strong foundation in mathematics and we strive, every day, to build educational solutions that make math meaningful and exciting for every learner.

To learn more about Vretta, we encourage you to visit: www.vretta.com.

Excellent oral and written English communication skills

An exciting company that uses Artificial Intelligence and Data Science to help re-define the sales process is looking for a Product Manager for their Montreal office!

Title: Product Manager
Location: Montreal, QC
Position status: Full time permanent
Salary: Highly competitive + Benefits + Vacation

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to: adam.hassoulas@groomassocies.com

With their head office in New York and with locations across the globe, our client is heading north and expanding to Montreal. The product team is growing and this is an exciting time to join. They have two flavors of their core product: one for their enterprise customers and one for individuals. For product team members, this offers a variety of systems and environments to make an imprint, from the more test-driven, consumer-facing application, to the more analytics, big-data backend infrastructure that needs to meet the scale, reliability and security of enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

Develop and own product vision and strategy for once or more product components for the product platform. Proactively communicate this vision/strategy to the executive team and all internal/external stakeholders
Gather business and functional requirements, propose features and develop tests, prototypes and MVPs to validate product theses
Own your part of the roadmap and work closely with engineers, designers and architects to execute against it
Own and drive backlog grooming and management, prioritize user stories, create acceptance criteria and drive testing and delivery
Drive sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, stories and create necessary documentation to ensure features and benefits are widely socialized
Conduct user interviews as part of researching which features should be prioritized for development.
Lead and listen; continually seek input but have ownership mentality and stand behind product tradeoffs

Preferred background:

5+ years of product management experience, preferably in social network, CRM or SaaS industries. Tech-startup experiences a big plus
A doer, with an ability to always be moving the ball forward and doing them well
Strong business acumen and the ability to think both strategically and tactically
Experience and a track record of success partnering with engineering, marketing, sales, services, and other internal teams
Experience in a test-driven, agile development environment preferred
Integrity, dedication and a collaborative nature that has an overwhelming desire to exceed expectations
Extraordinary written and oral communication skills
Exceptional organizational and analytical abilities
MBA, technical background, or, a working knowledge of CS fundamentals strongly preferred

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
Ciena Corporation, the network specialist, offers leading network infrastructure solutions, intelligent software and a comprehensive services practice. Our portfolio of software-centric optical and Ethernet platforms combines network element programmability, operating system commonality and management unification, and Carrier Ethernet-based transformation to enable our customers to change the way they compete. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated service provider, enterprise, government, and research and education networks across the globe.


This is an entry level position.


JOB DESCRIPTION & RESPONSIBILITIES

We are looking for an enthusiastic and innovative CAD PCB designer to join our hardware development team.


The Optical Transport R&D hardware team is seeking a PCB layout designer to develop high-speed, high complexity, multilayer circuit packs for communication products. The PCB Layout Designer will use Cadence Allegro layout toolset to extract the netlist from schematic capture, and perform printed circuit board artwork design and deliver a complete design package for production.

• Work under supervision to deliver a complete PCB documentation package that meets the quality system requirements.

• Perform component placement to meet electrical, mechanical and thermal constraints

• Develop detailed routing strategy and perform PCB routing to meet electrical specifications

• Participate in design reviews and work with various teams (hardware, mechanical, component, operations, test, product integrity, thermal) to resolve issues

• Complete layout verification with Valor to ensure compliance to Design For Manufacturability requirements


REQUIRED SKILLS

• Familiar with Cadence Allegro and Valor tools essential.

• Manual routing and controlled auto-routing.

• Forward / backward schematic annotation.

• Have good knowledge of PCB technologies, and familiar with mix analog and hi-speed digital circuits.

• Understanding of the PCB design process, and knowledge of the PCB manufacturability and assembly process an asset.

• Familiarity with high-speed hardware design and photonic interfaces a plus.

• Ability to adapt to change and manage multiple assignments simultaneously.

• Self-motivated, strong work ethic, and well organized

• Strong analytical and problem solving skills

• Detailed oriented and strives for perfection

• Team player, works effectively with others in a multi-disciplinary team


REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

• Recent college graduate with Electrical/Electronic technology Diploma program or Associate Drafting/CAD Diploma"
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
What you can expect from us
You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Are you passionate about research and development in computer and information science? Does design excite you? Join us at Autodesk Research as part of a dynamic, global team working on applied research projects. Autodesk Research explores a range of possible and desirable futures and creates the science and the stories to bring them to life. We are looking for a Research Engineer to join our team and work collaboratively across design and engineering on innovative projects.

The Design Futures group within Autodesk Research is seeking a machine learning research engineer to join our team in Toronto, in association with our AI Labs in Toronto and San Francisco. We are focused on advancing the state-of-the-art in design tools to allow architects, designers and engineers to Make Anything. As a machine learning engineer at Autodesk, you will have access to and incredibly rich world of data from the built environment. You will also have the opportunity to work closely with peers in machine learning and other experts in geometric modeling, simulation systems, robotics, knowledge representation, sensing and computer vision, industrial manufacturing and construction techniques.

This position is specifically focused on exploring and implementing novel machine learning algorithms into components and prototypes for design and engineering tools. The applications of the research include geometry generation, simulation, optimization, knowledge representation and learning.

Learn more about the team:
Research that has come out of our team
We created the prototype that was used to design the Lander
Our research embedded into the Fusion project

Responsibilities
Research and implement experimental machine learning algorithms and systems, including CNNs, RNNs, GANs, Graph Neural Networks, and Reinforcement Learning for geometry and knowledge representation
Document and communicate the intent and the results of projects in clear terms to both technical and non-technical team members
Explore alternative solutions and validate the results
Architect and develop software components and prototypes with a multi-disciplinary team
Keep current with latest trends and technologies to accelerate research and anticipate future development needs
Collaborate closely with the AI Labs in Autodesk Research and across multiple locations to deliver outstanding engineering solutions

Minimum Qualifications
Hands-on experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence and data science techniques and their frameworks
MS/Ph.D. in Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other relevant disciplines
Development experience in Python and C++
Excellent knowledge of linear algebra and calculus
Ability to collaborate effectively with a multicultural, global team of scientists and engineers
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to new situations
Team player yet responsible for owning specific deliverables

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with HPC, GPU computing, cloud computing and parallel programming
Knowledge of 2D and 3D computer graphics and visualization techniques
Knowledge of geometry and topology concepts, representations and data structures (such as NURBS, splines, level sets, surface and volumetric meshes, point clouds, analytical surfaces/solids, functional representations, subdivision surfaces, T-splines, etc.)
Experience with OpenGL, OpenMP, OpenCL (or alternatives), STL
Familiar with collaborative development environments and version control

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

#LI-DNP

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
To all recruitment agencies: Autodesk does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Autodesk will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Autodesk, Inc.

Toronto, ONEfficient receipt management is critical to the health of any business. Since 2013, Sensibill has been committed to building an AI-powered tool that makes capturing, organizing, and retrieving receipts as magical as possible. We work with banks to offer our receipt solution through their mobile banking apps. Banking customers use the service to keep track of important receipts for returns, exchanges, expenses, accounting, and taxes. Our mission? We want to give time back to freelancers and small business owners so that they can focus on the things they love. To find out more, visit www.getsensibill.com.
As the Pre-sales engineer in Toronto, you will support Sensibill’s revenue growth by working directly with the Sales and Delivery teams. The Pre-sales engineer will support sales cycles through direct participation with technical leads at some of the largest financial institutions in North America. You will manage and prepare demonstrations for client presentations, tailor demo assets and create scenarios that map to client needs in sales presentations, and respond to client technical questions related to Sensibill’s services.

You will support functional Proof of Product (POP) and short Proof of Concept (POC) to support in the signing of licenses for Sensibill’s services. Support and conduct enablement sessions to cross train local client technical specialists on technical details. Assist in the creation, management, and maintenance of wikis for Sensibill. Participate in RFP responses. Articulate product functional features to meet customer requirements.

What does the job entail?

Collaborate closely with external clients and internally with our project team to ensure delivery of a well-designed, effectively architected business solution.

Design and develop innovative solutions that bring value to our clients.
Be a key member of our growth team, designing prototype solutions for quick-development.

Support technical responses to RFPs.

Ensure customer requirements are added to our product roadmap.

Liaise with third party system integrators that are building software for our customers.

Handle technical due diligence requests such as security and performance reviews.

You will be based out of our office in Toronto but may need to travel when required to cities across North America.

 What you bring to the table:

3+ years as a technical consultant or solution architect, working side-by-side with clients, developers and designers alike. You can lead a team, implement processes, and exceed expectations for deliverables. You are super-organized, a presentation superstar, and you strive for excellence in all things.

3+ years experience in software development, or software architecture in a services-focused company, ideally building user-facing custom applications.

A range of collaborative methodologies and processes.

Skills to break down intricate flows and algorithms into simple to follow diagrams and descriptions.

Experience with mobile technology, RESTful web services, security, machine learning and SaaS solutions.

An itch to leave enterprise and work with a fast-paced start-up. We need a charismatic technical superstar to liaise with our financial services clients to define and develop solutions that incorporate Sensibill’s receipt management solution into the banking experience.

What’s in it for you?

We love #pie. Our culture is like that perfect piece of pie; humble and delivers exactly what you expect. Why #pie? That’s our acronym. We are a team of people that work to #getshitdone, all while ensuring Passion, Integrity, and Excellence.

Joining a startup in the early days is pretty much the greatest adventure you can embark on in your career. You have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions; to make an impact. We are lean, we are smart, and we live for balance – there are no mandatory 60-hour work weeks here.

This is not a top-down culture. We want everyone’s input during critical decisions. If you have ideas, we want to hear them. Together, we can build out your role, build our product, and our company. We want new team members who want to invest in us the way we invest in them. We want your ideas, your energy, your skills, your dedication, and if you have any, we’ll take your #receipts too.

What if you have questions before you apply?

No worries at all! If you have additional questions prior to submitting your application, please feel free to reach out to Kazi Hossain, Talent Acquisition Specialist. He accepts all real-human connection requests on LinkedIn and does his best to reply to all messages within 24 hours.

What does the interview process look like?

The first step is a conversation with someone from the Talent & Culture team. They’ll focus on the culture side of things and answer any questions you may have. If we feel that you'll fit into the Sensibill family like you were born here, we give you an assignment that will allow you to showcase your skills, and also give you some insight to the type of problems and experiences you'll face in your role with us. The last step of our process is a panel style of interview where you will meet the team, see our space, and present your assignment.

We know that, while we’re interviewing you, you're interviewing us as well. So, while you dress to impress, we ready the coffee press, in order to have meaningful conversations to make sure we are both a good fit for each other!

Should you require accommodation in any aspect of our selection process, please don't hesitate to contact Kazi Hossain at kazi@getsensibill.com

Are you a sharp thinker and keen writer interested in how technology shapes and enables business?

We’re seeking a multi-talented individual to join our team of business software researchers and writers. Technology Evaluation Centers (TEC) is an enterprise software consulting firm. We pride ourselves on providing impartial expertise to organizations seeking best-fit software solutions. We cover the spectrum of business software, including the key areas of ERP, CRM, HR, BI, and SCM.

Montréal, QC$80,000 - $95,000 a year*** Please note that we can only consider applicants who already have the right to work in Canada, e.g. PR or Citizen ***
We are looking for a capable team-player (f/m) to join our highly-motivated start-up environment - with ample opportunities for ownership, to take a lead, and to put her/his technical expertise into the products we build.

CONCURED's Montreal office is an 10-strong diverse team of developers, researchers and designers - representing 6 nationalities, and with a better gender balance than Google or Facebook.

Our finances are unusually secure for a young company, having brought our first product to market within months, serving paying customers, and backed by private investors. Unlike many startups, we are not only dreamers but DOers!

Lite Link Technologies Inc. (LLT), is a Burnaby based technology company driving to be a disruptive force cross-industry by focusing on innovation and delivery of technical solutions that attack real world problems.
Our initial flagship product is 1SHIFT Logistics. 1SHIFT is a logistics platform to connect shippers, trucking companies, truckers, and 3PL (third party logistics companies) via web applications for logistics and dispatch office workers and a mobile application for truckers. After our initial release, we have a roadmap to evolve functionality in our base platform, integrate other third-party solutions, and develop capabilities to meet industry variations and anchor client requirements.

Opportunity to join our team:
We are currently looking to add a high caliber UI Designer to our team building our 1SHIFT Logistics SaaS product following agile delivery methodology. Our base build is well underway with closed beta trials starting in April and broader roll out by summer.

What you will be doing:
The UI Designer will combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
Design web and mobile apps.
Use responsive design and grid principles.
Use strong typography, layout and visual design skills while executing a design task.
Develop standard UI components and style guides for company-wide use.
Use UI kits when required.
Oversee the development and delivery of effective user interfaces.
Work with digital analytics team to assess the impact of all UI design and usability changes.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

What you bring to the table:
3-4 years of Proven UI experience.
Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio
Expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques.
Experience in creating wireframes(high & low fidelity), storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps
Working knowledge of industry tools: Photoshop, Adobe XD, Illustrator, InDesign, Balsamiq, Omnigraffle, InVision, and Sketch.
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies

OPTIONAL, but would be a great benefit:
Working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Experience creating rapid prototypes.
Balsamiq
Lookback.io
Zeplin

More about us:
LLT is a publicly traded Canadian company (CNSX: LLT) with two products in development about to launch closed beta trials. For entrepreneurial driven candidates wanting to share in the success of a tech startup, this is an excellent opportunity to join us at the beginning of our journey with many of the initial startup challenges behind us.
Our strategic objective is to be an innovation hub to incubate new software products and solutions incorporating leading edge technology like AI and blockchain with web and mobile applications that are simple and deliver differentiated customer experiences. Our solutions will all target disrupting industries or markets to redefine how we think of targeted businesses today.
Valuing creativity, strong work ethic and fervent collaboration, working at Lite Link will be a fast paced, goal driven environment that promotes radical passion for innovation and laser dedication to making a difference. Our team is quickly growing – starting with Accenture heritage in our leadership team with proven delivery experience and extended with thoughtful recruiting to assemble our delivery team in Vancouver with the right tech startup culture and team that makes us excited to come to work each day.
We are located at 3480 Gilmore Way in Burnaby in a newly built out 5,500 square foot office that will co-locate our Sales, Marketing, Product and Operations teams for execution efficiency.

We offer the following total compensation package to foster a happy and productive team.
Competitive base compensation
Stock options to share in success of company
Medical and dental benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Awesome office in Burnaby
Stellar and committed team environment

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
Toronto, ONYou will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.


About Myplanet


We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.


A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Toronto, ONResponsibilities

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
Toronto, ONYou will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.


About Myplanet


We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.


A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Please review the job details below.
The MDA facility in Brampton, Ontario has 30+ years experience in designing and operating space robotics systems such as Canadarm on the Space Shuttle, and Canadarm2 and Dextre on the International Space Station. In addition, this site develops rover technology for Mars missions, sensors for Asteroid exploration missions, as well as a multitude of terrestrial spin-offs for medical robotics and nuclear power plant operations. MDA is currently exploring future opportunities in areas such as AI-based robotics for Lunar Gateway (the next international space station, which will orbit the moon), on-orbit satellite servicing, and next-generation space missions. The site is currently seeking a Manager of Mechanical Engineering.


The Manager, Mechanical Engineering is a member of the engineering leadership team and reports directly to the Director, Engineering. The Manager is responsible for a team of over 50 engineers in the design, implementation and testing of all aspects of mechanical engineering and design office. Mechanical engineering responsibility includes mechanism design and analysis, materials engineering, structural engineering, thermal engineering, and design office activities from initial concept design through to manufacture, qualification, delivery, and support of mission operations.


The Manager will support the Director, Engineering in business strategy and technology roadmap development, and continuously align, improve, and modernize engineering practices to improve business performance, employee engagement, and customer satisfaction.


The Manager will oversee recruitment, retention, development, and succession planning of a diverse multi-disciplinary team. The Manager will advocate and manage the adoption of next-generation engineering tools, techniques, and procedures to increase competitiveness in their discipline area.
Engineering Process and Tools. Establish and modernize the engineering process and tools that are used by the team to optimize engineering performance in the context of business needs.
Bid Solution Validation.
Validates and assesses technical merit, scope sufficiency, risk management, cost-effectiveness, and resource availability for costed solutions in proposals to customers as part of the engineering management organization. Confers with project management, production, business development, and bids & proposal staff to establish appropriate project specifications and procedures.
Independent Review Team.
Independently audits and assesses risk on planned program work and program work-in-progress through its life cycle, assists Engineering Review Teams in identifying mitigation responses or workarounds and leading Mechanical Engineering review.
Engineering Resource Management.
Recruits employees, assigns, directs, and evaluates their work; develops staff to support the deployment and operation of human spaceflight and commercial robotic systems. Oversees engineering facilities, processes, and tools required to support deployment and operation of both current and future flight systems. Creates regular training and mentoring plans for the department. Establishes and updates succession plans regularly for key skills to avoid single point failures and bottlenecks in resource allocation.
Engineering Resource Facilitation.
Provides Mechanical Engineering leadership and staffing expertise to support the demand of MDA Programs, R&D, and Business Development. Ensures that staffing supports the demand of current and future MDA programs.
Continuous Improvement Advocacy and Management.
Identifies, supports, and promotes innovation and continuing process improvements within the Mechanical Engineering department and across the business. Ensures the usage and procurement and of up-to-date tools within the department. Plans and directs the installation, testing, operation, maintenance, and repair of operations and test facilities/ equipment.
Budget Management.
 Plans, provides rationale, and administers department operating budgets
The ideal candidate will possess a degree in Mechanical Engineering, with experience in Mechanical Design, including design for manufacture and assembly principles and planning for the development of safety- and mission-critical mechanisms, structures, and tools
8+ years of broad-based engineering experience in all phases of a program working closely with a variety of commercial and government customers
2+ years managing or supervising engineering teams
Deep understanding of mechanical design and analysis principles for mechanisms, materials, thermal, and structures engineering.
Experience in analyzing and interpreting mechanical technical drawings, ability to generate high quality technical reports, test plans/ procedures, investigation/analysis reports.
A strong understanding of manufacturing and fabrications processes to assess, troubleshoot and work collaboratively with designers.
Demonstrated leadership ability that includes effective communication, interpersonal, and negotiating skills to operate effectively with all with all organizational work experience
Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and as a member of a highly performing technical team
Ability to collaborate broadly with peers and stakeholders, internally within MDA, and with commercial/government partners and customers
Excellent oral and written communication skills
High motivation with a proven ability to adapt quickly in dynamic environments
Demonstrated strong technical contribution across a wide range of engineering challenges and across multiple developments
Ability to build and maintain professional relationships both within and outside of the engineering disciplines
Strong project and technical management skills
 Excellent verbal, written communication skills are essential to this position . All candi-
 dates must be able to obtain CGP and ITAR clearance .
 MacDonald, Dettwiler and Associates Inc. is an equal opportunity employer
 committed to promoting diversity in the workplace.
 MDA is proud to provide accommodations during the recruitment and selection
 process. If you require accessible formats, communication supports or any other
 form of accommodation, please notify MDA if you are contacted for an interview.
Competitive Compensation and Benefits Package
MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at its many locations. As a member of the MDA team, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection for employees and their families through health care plans, disability income protection, life insurance, and other employee benefits. The Company's retirement plans encourage employees to save for their future with a Company matching contribution in many locations.

Edmonton, ABPermanentOur Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. We’re crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; that’s why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?
As a key member of Ciena's fast paced NPI Host-Modem Test Engineering team, the successful candidate will develop, enhance, and monitor the test automation process (S/W & H/W) for the System, EST, & Config portion of the Test Process.
Responsibilities
The successful candidate will define the test specification jointly with our Design team, and will define test equipment requirements for the SYS/EST/CFG Test environment. Candidate will also develop the S/W for the automation, the system provisioning for adequate system configuration and document everything for life cycle support with real-time Confluence documentation tools.
General Activities
Participate in product evolution by providing innovative SYS/EST/CFG solutions.
Follow the NPI Gating process steps by providing analysis and feedback inputs to the development team for each steps : (Functional Agreement, Component Placement Agreement, Physical Agreement)
Participate in defining the test strategy (including test steps, equipment requirements, captives, custom test tools, Log monitoring points, Environmental Test strategy, etc...)
Develop out-of-box smart and clever Test S/W automation in C#, Python, & Linux scripts.
Must enjoy working in a Lab environment with hands-on product testing as he will need to team-up with R&D to develop the working recipe to test and debug the first Alpha and Beta Prototypes.
Develop fault isolation troubleshooting tools and document them in online guides via Confluence.
Investigate faults, alarms, or heat dissipation on key components during EST temperature cycles.
Frequently visit to our Local NPI Contract Manufacturer to monitor prototypes production and help investigate issues.
Provide product training and knowledge sharing to CM engineers & technicians team to improve their technical Trouble shooting skills on defective cards.
Perform Data analysis of Test yield to early identify design related hardware, software, performance or even test automation robustness issues.
Provide reports & drive resolution by pulling key players within each team.
As part of constant improvement, The candidate will refine test processes to gain the highest test coverage, fully automated Test process and highly efficient test routine to handle high volume throughput at less cost.
From a teamwork requirement, good interpersonal skills are required, good relations with others and flexibility to help others or request help if needed to meet the project commit date.
Collaboration with stakeholders
This role implies a strong teamwork with Ottawa and CM Test Engineers team. This role requires to be located in Ottawa for a very close working relation within the H/W & S/W Designers and support of our Gateway NPI manufacturer.
Areas of impact
The candidate will be providing the optimal test coverage tools & solution to assure highest quality of prototypes delivery to R&D to shorten their validation process and accelerate the overall Time to Market introduction for eventual revenue shipments.
Experience
Strong technical skills with hands on experience in test & debugging of high tech telecom and data-center product
Strong Hands-on experience on S/W development (C#, Python, Linux scripts).
Excellent knowledge of electronic components (Optical, Digital and analog devices )
Ability to develop clear and structured test document real-time in Confluence
Team Player to effectively collaborate with cross functional teams around the world.
Self-motivated, well-organized with a willingness to learn.
Able to manage multiple tasks with flexibility to refocus as priority changes.
Ability to work under pressure and perform both strategic and sustaining tasks.
Open to site visits at factories around the world!
Willing to accept flexible work schedule for completing critical project as per committed target.
Assertiveness to drive our contract manufacturer engineers / technicians
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Speaking & writing: Fluent English
Bachelor Degree in Electronics/ Electrical / Optical Engineering / SW development
Masters in above fields or 3-5 years in High Tech electronic industry as Full-time, Intern, Co-op, Design, Test, and/or Manufacturing
LI-CN
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.

You will receive notification of your successful application

Montréal, QCSenior Systems Engineer, Broadcasting (MTIS) - MON05189


Job Family Broadcast Engineering
Primary Location Montreal
Position Language Requirement Bilingual (English / French)
Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) B B B
Status of Employment Permanent
Work schedule(s) Full-time


Description

Behind the scenes, but ahead of the curve: help us develop the next-generation public broadcaster.

To learn more about the people who lead, build out, support and make up the teams at MTIS, please visit our website here.

Created in 2015 to align, lighten and modernize infrastructure, the Media Technology and Infrastructure (MTIS) team is the backbone and the future forward arm of CBC/Radio-Canada. We are the people that make stuff work. We make connections; between media content, systems, people and places. We are the space in between.

A place with purpose. CBC/Radio-Canada has always been a highly-regarded pioneer of media technology. Not just in Canada, but around the world. Today, we’re transforming ourselves from a conventional radio and television broadcaster into a modern digital media company. Technology is the driving force. MTIS is the team making it happen.

The opportunity

CBC/Radio-Canada is looking for a Senior Systems Engineer, Broadcasting to work on various aspects of design and implementation for TV, Radio and Digital production and distribution systems. As part of our Engineering team, this is an exciting opportunity to learn, deploy and use the latest technologies for broadcast and media production. It’s a chance to collaborate across multiple teams which may include other engineers, designers and members of CBC / Radio-Canada operations and support.

Who you are and where are you now?

You are an experienced Systems Engineer with hands-on experience overseeing the deployment of new technologies across an organization. With formal or informal Project Management experience, you are a mentor who can guide the work of their team; a presenter who can work across any level of an organization; and an Engineer with a toolbox of processes and plans.
You want to be part of a continuously changing environment with leading-edge technology. A place where you can both apply your expertise and develop marketable skills and knowledge. You want to learn more about general broadcast and media production processes; audio/video technology, standards and best practices. You want to expand your design and deployment skills to include audio video production, processing and broadcasting systems based on IT Technologies.

What’s in it for you

Challenges. We spend our days solving problems on an unbelievable scale. Media files are highly nuanced and incredibly complicated; updating, installing and supporting technologies that are organization-wide and that impact broadcasting content is a time-sensitive, complex technical feat. And that’s just the beginning. You will manage the end-to-end project implementation from proposal and procurement to design, implementation, testing and handover.
Be part of the change. Right now we are looking for people who can execute our strategy. Innovators who want to push future-forward thinking. Builders who want to be hands-on, building the next generation of media technology for CBC/Radio-Canada employees. We want to hear the ideas, see the designs and implement the innovations brought to us by our teams. You want to be part of a team actively transforming the workspace for every individual at CBC/Radio-Canada. Our priority is to proactively and in-the-moment solve problems and ensure the users can engage with new functionalities, new tools and conduct their day-to-day work seamlessly.
Cutting-edge tech. Data management. Cloud migration. IP for broadcast. AI. Security and reliability. The road ahead changes every day. By joining us now, you will become both pioneer and expert with a highly specialized, in-demand skill-set as you help us take steps towards the next frontier of media. While we will want you to stay, we know you will be able to go anywhere after this. As the official providers of technology to CBC/Radio-Canada, you will be joining the team that touches the latest technologies. You will have a chance to influence the choice and use of newer technologies and introduce changes to the processes.

As our new Senior Systems Engineer, Broadcasting you will:

Design innovative, practical solutions to complex problems, particularly where new technologies are to be integrated into existing facilities.
Create and track the schedules and budgets for capital projects; monitoring progress to ensure compliance with scope and objectives.
Prepare functional, schematic, layout drawings and detailed installation instructions for wiring crews.
Oversee the procurement from writing and requesting quotes and proposals to evaluating tender responses and making recommendations.
Verify system performance against design criteria, ensuring identified deficiencies are corrected and providing documentation for ongoing operation and maintenance of facilities.
Participate in strategic planning, providing expert advice on cost, timeframe and feasibility of capital requirements.
Create concept designs for review with our business partners.
Conceptualize alternative solutions which satisfy defined objectives.
Why join us?

At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with an excellent benefits package; we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office.

We are a dynamic, in-flux team less than 3 years old, brimming with potential. There’s a lot of exciting work ahead of us and while we aren’t there yet, we have a plan. Our focus is fulfilling our mandate to exceed audience expectations. We weigh our options, research, explore and evaluate. When we make a decision, we follow through with purpose. We don’t have one static future ahead of us, but a fluid set of options. This means a chance to be part of that change whether you are an idea generator or an executor.

Qualifications

What you bring
The education. You have either a Bachelor degree in Engineering or a diploma in Applied Science and Technology. You are eligible for membership in the Ordre des ingénieurs du Quebec. Alternatively, you have an undergraduate degree from a program that is accredited by the Canadian Information Processing Society (CIPS) such as a Bachelor of Computing Science or a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.
The experience. You have several years of system design or engineering experience and deploying new technologies across an organization. You have hands-on expertise with web, virtualization, storage, IT security and networking technologies.
The communication and relationship building skills. You can nurture strong two-way relationships with peers, partners, clients, staff, senior managers and external technological vendors. You can effectively translate technical requirements to non technical business needs and you can communicate with individuals in a diverse group. You have excellent technical writing skills and you can conduct presentations. You are comfortable negotiating contracts with suppliers.
The Agile Project Management approach. You thrive in a team-focused environment. You can guide and lead the work of cross-functional teams. You are focused on taking a hands-on role wherever and whenever needed.
The analytical skills and the creativity. You can think through complex issues and design innovative solutions. You are proactive and creative in your approach. You can adapt diverse technologies to suit project concepts and to translate abstract concepts to physical reality.
The drive. You have a strong sense of urgency and can quickly resolve unforeseen technical problems onsite through cost effective solutions. You can efficiently work on a number of projects at different stages with multiple priorities, never losing sight of the details.
The bridging capability. You work on the cutting edge of technology and pick up new tools quickly. You are aware of modern, best practices and you thrive in an Agile environment. You understand how to dig into issues, remove the roadblocks and present solutions both immediate and long term.
The flexibility. You are able to travel between Toronto and Montreal once a month and occasionally, across Canada for short-periods of time.
To apply:

Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC/Radio-Canada we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet 70% of the requirements we are seeking and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here: https://bit.ly/2Sq0Ycg

As a leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air.
