Canada and the United States have an aging water infrastructure. It will cost $1 Trillion over the next 20 years to replace pipes, pumps, valves, treatment equipment and the software to run them all.
WatrHub is the only source of predictive market information on how, when, and why these water infrastructure investments will be made. Our AI-enabled search engine transforms millions of public documents into actionable sales leads and market insights. Technology Vendors and Engineering Firms subscribe to WatrHub to secure their next water utility clients and bring their advanced, efficient technologies to our aging water infrastructure.
We sell disruptive products to one of the world's largest and most critical industries that has been set in its way for decades. The majority of large players in our industry rely on WatrHub for AI-powered Market Intelligence. Our data infrastructure uses sophisticated Machine Learning to digest data from millions of public documents into actionable market insights, which requires unique scaling challenges as the dataset grows exponentially.
We operate using a leading edge microservice architecture built using Node.js & Python. Our microservices are powered by various backend systems including: Cloud SQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, and RabbitMQ. Our systems are hosted on GCP (Google Cloud) using Kubernetes and Google Cloud Instances. We focus on automation and monitoring to ensure efficient operations at scale. We are consistently iterating and improving our systems and workflows with our minds set on delivering the best data possible to our users.

We are looking for Full Stack Engineer with strong design and development skills building both frontends and backends, with exposure to building large-scale cloud web services. Reporting to our Software Team Lead and working closely with Product Managers and developer peers, you will be presented with unique challenges where you can apply your ideas and explore new technologies. We are looking for someone brings a “do what needs to be done” attitude who has a sense of ownership and accountability. We expect you to be collaborative and a key contributor to our Sprint Planning and Backlog prioritization.
The ideal candidate has been through several end-to-end product development cycles with an aptitude for big data & scalable software.
This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to take the next step in their career and learn how to build, maintain, evolve, and improve a system in a small startup environment. The buck stops with you. It’s a great chance to shine.

The position will be based out of our Toronto Headquarters.

Requirements
What You Will Accomplish
Design, implement, build and maintain our large and distributed, high availability microservices, internal tools, user interfaces, and deployment systems
Create automated test and deployment strategies for our CI/CD pipeline
Work closely with a cross-functional team including product managers, designers, client success managers, and research analysts to understand user needs requirements from our data infrastructure and develop solutions to improve product delivery and end-user experience.
Live Outside The Box: You are empowered by Team Leaders to seek out and adapt the latest software technologies to develop the functionality that will improve our data infrastructure performance and product delivery quality.
Skills and Requirements
Experience in several of the technologies we are using and the Linux stack (bash, git, package management, cloud, containers, etc.). You don’t need to be an expert in all of them. We are looking for someone who is already comfortable across various layers of the tech stack and eager to learn additional technologies as needed.
You’re evidence-driven and data-driven. You make decisions because they have shown to be effective and they cater to the people you’re developing for.
Be comfortable in a quickly changing environment, with a small team and a lot of responsibility.
A passion for quality, an obsession with automation and a love for writing clean, effective code + docs
Experience with Software Development Methodologies (e.g. unit testing, code reviews, design documentation) and Design Patterns
You are a well-rounded programmer, with one or more areas of expertise and depth, and a passion for working throughout the tech stack
You have a strong knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals including software design, algorithms, etc.
You believe in keeping your tech stack current with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and trends in cloud technologies and Machine Learning advancements
Degree in a Computer Science / Software Engineering field or equivalent practical experience.
Ability to represent data in various forms to provide unique insights.
Benefits
Why WatrHub?
This is a great opportunity to write code that can influence positive change within one of the largest societal challenges of our generation (water)
We live at the cross section of water, startup and data science. There is no other team like it in Toronto.
There is no corporate bureaucracy here. You will accomplish more here in a few months than what you would in a few years at a large, entrenched technology company.
You get company-paid transportation, health & fitness benefits, a training budget and work-from-wherever days in addition to your competitive salary and incentive plan
You get to direct exposure to Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Tech Entrepreneurship and Water Infrastructure Markets from our in-house subject matter experts and industry titans
We are on a mission to solve water. We enjoy happy-hour patios, team lunches exploring the food scene around our Liberty Village office, and rock-climbing together. We believe in diversity of culture, thought and approach and that makes us the best we can be!
Application Deadline is January 30, 2019, but candidates will be selected for interviews on a rolling basis.

Toronto, ONKira Systems is a powerful machine learning software that identifies, extracts, and analyzes text in your contracts and other documents. Our software is intuitive and easy-to-use to uncover relevant information for some of the largest law firms, professional services and corporate companies in the world.

As the Digital Marketing & Web Operations Lead you will be instrumental in achieving our vision in the overall content and communication strategy of Kira. This role will impact an increase in lead revenue(s) achieved by increasing our brand visibility in the media, increasing user numbers visiting the site via SEO tactics, and increasing conversion rates via optimizing website and blog content. This role will also help us move the needle on our brand awareness measurement by developing an array of innovative digital content types. You will work closely with our marketing team, business managers and leadership.

Responsibilities


Build and drive demand for Kira's AI solutions through digital and web channels
Manage the Content Marketing and Digital Web Operations team. You will train, develop your teams, hiring when required
Champion SEO and instill best practice amongst the content and business unit teams. You will create processes for keyword analysis & come up with integrated communications & content plans for improving search engine ranking positioning and traffic. You will help increase the efficacy of growing content based links with external partners
Execute paid media strategy and campaigns to drive higher website traffic and conversion rates and increase repeat website visitors
Achieve best in class content marketing to support the commercial objectives of the business unit teams

Requirements


8-10+ years of experience in SEO & content marketing management
Web Optimization and Conversion Experience leading A/B Testing and UX Design practices
In-depth knowledge of paid search and social media channels and how to leverage them to drive increase website traffic and demand generation
Experience in web design and with web developers creating engaging online experiences
Deep understanding of web analytics, A/B testing, SEO, conversion optimization, marketing analytics/attribution, paid media ROAS, and ecommerce/lead generation.
Analytical and competent in understanding a variety of data
Knowledge of SEO analytics platforms (e.g. SEM rush), web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Omniture); data reporting & visualization software (e.g.mTableau, Looker) an asset
Experience in working with CMS and social platforms is a plus
Managing organic traffic growth for kirasystems.com, leading all on-page and off-page SEO tactics (technical SEO, content writing, link building & link equity management, keyword research, reporting), in addition to net new enterprise content marketing programs
Conceptualize and execute on a radical approach to SEO and content marketing within the B2B software space, leveraging a diverse team of SEO specialists, content strategists, journalists, designers, and UX practitioners.
Steering enterprise SEO strategy and partner with Product Management to relay website visitor insights, and develop further automation of customer acquisition journey.

Why Join Kira Systems?


Team. Our team is filled with smart, curious, independent, self-motivated, and nice people. Together, we have a happy and fun team culture
It's early stage. So there are lots to still discover and develop - which makes for a great learning environment where you can build experiences and lots of opportunities for you to dig in.
Personal Development. We work on challenging problems. It's hard, in a good way.
Technology and Design. Machine learning is driving a new industrial revolution, and it's terrific to work closely with this impactful technology. Moreover, we care about great design and a great customer experience.
Lots of benefits and perks - you can read about them here: www.kirasystems.com/careers

Some notes:
While experience and skills are valuable - growth potential, values and attitudes are equally important to be a successful Kiran. If you're prepared to grow and aren't above doing anything (we're pretty low ego over here - we just do what needs to get done!), consider applying. We understand that the most creative solutions require diversity in thought and life experiences.

Kira Systems believes that at the foundation of our success are the people who work here. We are an equal opportunity employer and believe our diversity is a driver of success at our company. Any race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation or identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status are welcome here. Accommodations are available on request for all aspects of the selection process.

Please be aware that due to the nature of our business all successful candidates must clear a background check before beginning employment.

job_title: Software Designer - DevOps and BigData Applications
job_description:
Job title: Software Designer - DevOps and BigData Applications
Division/function: Research & Development (DF0007)
Business unit / department: Transport Protocol BigData HW Platform&OS (BU0063)
Country: Canada
State: Quebec
City(ies): Montreal
EXFO develops smarter network test, monitoring and analytics solutions for the world’s leading telecommunications service providers, network equipment manufacturers and webscale companies—and we love what we do! With nearly 1,900 employees in more than 25 countries, EXFO is no. 1 worldwide in fiber optic test solutions and has the largest active assurance deployment. Our broad portfolio of intelligent hardware and software solutions enable our customer’s network transformations related to fiber, 5G, virtualization and big data analytics. We’re always looking for top talent to help us lead the way in a thriving industry with boundless opportunities.
This position is located in our Montreal Office
Job summary
As a junior-intermediate developer on the Nova Big Data Framework you will be responsible for the continued growth and evolution of the framework as it supports multiple big data applications in the telecom space, such as: mobility network trouble-shooting, visualization and optimization; multi-dimensional analytics and advanced analytics using machine learning.
What you’ll do
You will work primarily with a team in Montreal, but also with teams in Rennes(Fr) and Valencia(Sp), to grow and evolve the Nova Big Data Framework.
You will be an integral part of the agile development team. You will work closely with the Technical Lead, fellow developers and verification specialists to develop framework capabilities, define and maintain strong public interfaces and continuously improve system scalability and performance.
What we're looking for
Technical skills:
Exposure, experience and understanding in a mix of the following areas:
Big Data ingestion and ETL pipelines: Java programming, Kafka message bus, Avro data representation
Big Data storage technologies: HDFS, Hive, HBASE, Elastic Search, Druid
Deployment, Monitoring and Control of big data clusters, using tools such as Ambari and Yarn
Building real-time and/or batch processing pipelines using Spark stream processing and Oozie
Accessing large data sets in real-time for visualization and troubleshooting applications
Multi-Dimensional analytics: using data cubes, dashboards and Business Intelligence tools
Advanced/predictive analytics: using machine learning and AI applications
Following technical skills and experiences are considerable assets:
Some exposure to, and experience with, multi-tiered web applications and database intensive applications
Some exposure to, and experience with, big data systems (HADOOP based or other)
Experience with the following technologies: Python, Ansible, Docker, Bash
Experience in cloud-based environments (OpenStack, Azure, AWS)
Experience designing or interfacing with RESTful APIs
Required aptitudes:
Comfortable working in a team environment using agile methods
Flexible mindset; ability to consider different approaches to meet technical and project objectives
Enthusiastic, motivated and likes to learn new technologies
Must have
Pertinent experience:
2+ years developing software applications in Java, C# or C++
Experience developing software in the Linux environment
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Science or Engineering;
Language requirements:
Must be able to work in a French environment
Must be able to read and write in English (technical material)
Must be able to converse in English at more than a beginner level
Other: Must be authorized to work in Canada.
Any other combination of experience/studies will be considered.
EXFO is an equal opportunity employer.
Thanks for your interest in EXFO.
If you have questions, please write us at careers@EXFO.com
We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Ottawa, ONCiena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?
The Ciena Network Planning Software development team in Ottawa are looking to hire exceptional software designers/engineers who will complement the existing development team. The designers should have a solid basis in object-oriented software development methodology. Teamwork and collaboration are critical.
Responsibilities
Contribute in all areas of software development – design, documentation, implementation and test, as well as, troubleshooting and support
Work in a cross-functional environment to deliver a complete solution
Provide estimates for technical efforts
Collaboration with stakeholders
You will work with development leads in the implementation of software applications using Agile development methodologies.
Experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong Object-Oriented design skills
Strong design and programming experience with one or more of the following (Microsoft .NET, C++, C, Java, Python, Go)
Web Services (REST, JSON, XML, SOAP)
Micro-Service architecture
Experience developing high-performance, scalable applications
Strong debugging and trouble shooting skills
Must be able and willing to work in a high energy, dynamic and fast paced development environment
Self-motivated and willing to learn new skills or technologies as needed
Experienced with iterative agile approaches to development
Nuget/Git/Stash
Experience with multi-threaded programming paradigms
Cloud deployment technologies (Amazon AWS)
Linux Operating System
Windows Operating Systems
Working knowledge of telecommunication networks (Layers 0-2)
LI-CN
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.
A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.
Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
What you can expect from us
You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Montréal, QCBack-End Developer (Senior)
About BEEM – Connected Experience
You are passionate about data, cars and IoT, and you strive to build never seen before innovative products in a fast growing Montreal based Startup? We are looking for smart engineers, with an entrepreneurial spirit, independent thinking and ready to hit the ground running. We`re fun, hard-working, and share a passion for using technology to make a massive positive impact in the automotive industry. We are a team of smart and fun engineers, software developers and designers, with a mission to make a difference.
BEEM offers innovative data analytics and automation solutions to the automotive industry with a focus on Data and IoT technologies, with a mission to improve the customer experience and help our clients increase their operational efficiency.
The BEEM team is passionate about the automotive industry and is driven to make difference. The goal is to make work fun, work hard as a team and enjoy great times together as this is the reason why we have got where we are today! Our working environment is paramount to us and we wish to offer that to our employees and team which is why we are conveniently located in the heart of downtown Montreal, only minutes away from a metro station and surrounded by great lifestyle amenities like restaurants and coffee shops. Assets
Experience in working in a fast paced and quickly evolving StartUp environment

Passionate about the auto industry and new technologies

job_title: Ingénieur Conception Électronique - Electronic Design Engineer
job_description:
Quebec City, QCCiena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?
En tant qu’ingénieur de conception électronique, vous serez impliqué dans la conception de composantes optoélectroniques à large bande utilisant diverses plates-formes technologiques telles que silicium et phosphure d’indium. Vous serez également impliqué dans la conception de solutions d’encapsulation et de circuits de test. Faisant partie d’une équipe pluridisciplinaire, vous devrez collaborer avec des chercheurs, ingénieurs et technologues sur une base régulière. Cette position requiert de l’autonomie, une capacité d’adaptation aux situations changeantes, un désir pour l’innovation et la capacité de solutionner des problèmes complexes.
Principales tâches et responsabilités
Conception et simulation de filtres passifs et circuits de protection ESD en utilisant différentes technologies de fabrication (PCB, hybride, circuits intégrés)
Concevoir, tester et documenter des solutions de test sur mesure
Appliquer les techniques de conception RF aux PCB de test et systèmes de test
Concevoir des circuits de polarisation pour dispositifs actifs tels que des photodiodes rapides et des amplificateurs
Faire des analyses d’intégrité de signal
Caractériser les performances électriques, élaborer des méthodes et des plans de tests et produire des rapports
Qualifications requises
Minimum d’un baccalauréat en ingénierie avec études spécifiques en conception électronique ou une expérience de travail significative en conception électronique
3 à 8 années d’expérience de travail dans un champ de pratique pertinent
Expérience pratique en conception, simulation, fabrication et test de PCB
Connaissance de logiciel d’entré de schéma électrique comme Cadence un atout
Connaissance des outils de simulation tels que Ansys Designer et LTSpice un atout
Connaissance de MatLab est requis
Connaissance de base des composantes optoélectroniques haute-vitesse telles que modulateurs et photo-détecteurs
Expérience directe avec des équipements de mesure tels que l’analyseur de réseaux, l’analyseur de Spectre et l’oscilloscope haute-vitesse
Aptitude au travail d’équipe et à la communication
Maitrise des langues française et anglaise à l’écrit et à l’oral
Localisation

Type de position
Temps complet/régulier
-
Acting as an electronic design engineer, you will be involved in the design of broadband electro-optic components using technology platforms such as silicon and/or indium-phosphide. You will also be involved in the design of packaging solutions, test circuits and systems. Part of a multi-disciplinary team, you will have to collaborate with scientists and other disciplines of engineering on a regular basis. This position requires autonomy, adaptability and a strong desire for innovation and problem solving skills.
Responsibilities
Design and Simulation of passive filtering circuits and ESD protection circuits using various technologies PCB, hybrid and integrated circuits
Design, test and documentation of custom test systems
Apply RF design techniques to test PCB and test systems
Design bias circuits for active devices such as high-speed photo-diodes and amplifiers
Perform signal integrity analysis
Characterize electrical performance, elaborate test methods and publish characterization reports
Required qualifications
Minimum of engineering degree with specific studies in electronic design or engineering degree with significant work experience in analog electronic design
3 to 8 years work experience in a relevant field
Practical experience in the design, simulation, fabrication and test of PCB
Knowledge of schematic entry tool like Cadence is a plus;
Knowledge of circuit simulators like Ansys Designer and LTSpice is a plus;
Knowledge of Matlab is mandatory
Basic knowledge of high speed opto-electronic devices such as modulators and photo-detectors are a plus
Hands-on experience with RF test instruments such as Vector Network Analyser Spectrum Analyser and High-speed Oscilloscope strongly desired
Excellent team work and communication skills
Excellent mastery of French and/or English both written and oral

Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.

Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Balsamiq

LLT is a publicly traded Canadian company (CNSX: LLT) with two products in development about to launch closed beta trials. Our strategic objective is to be an innovation hub to incubate new software products and solutions incorporating leading edge technology like AI and blockchain with web and mobile applications that are simple and deliver differentiated customer experiences. Montréal, QCAn exciting company that uses Artificial Intelligence and Data Science to help re-define the sales process is looking for a Product Manager for their Montreal office!

Title: Product Manager
Location: Montreal, QC
Position status: Full time permanent
Salary: Highly competitive + Benefits + Vacation

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to: adam.hassoulas@groomassocies.com

With their head office in New York and with locations across the globe, our client is heading north and expanding to Montreal. The product team is growing and this is an exciting time to join. They have two flavors of their core product: one for their enterprise customers and one for individuals. For product team members, this offers a variety of systems and environments to make an imprint, from the more test-driven, consumer-facing application, to the more analytics, big-data backend infrastructure that needs to meet the scale, reliability and security of enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

Develop and own product vision and strategy for once or more product components for the product platform. Proactively communicate this vision/strategy to the executive team and all internal/external stakeholders
Gather business and functional requirements, propose features and develop tests, prototypes and MVPs to validate product theses
Own your part of the roadmap and work closely with engineers, designers and architects to execute against it
Own and drive backlog grooming and management, prioritize user stories, create acceptance criteria and drive testing and delivery
Drive sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, stories and create necessary documentation to ensure features and benefits are widely socialized
Conduct user interviews as part of researching which features should be prioritized for development.
Lead and listen; continually seek input but have ownership mentality and stand behind product tradeoffs

Preferred background:

5+ years of product management experience, preferably in social network, CRM or SaaS industries. Tech-startup experiences a big plus
A doer, with an ability to always be moving the ball forward and doing them well
Strong business acumen and the ability to think both strategically and tactically
Experience and a track record of success partnering with engineering, marketing, sales, services, and other internal teams
Experience in a test-driven, agile development environment preferred
Integrity, dedication and a collaborative nature that has an overwhelming desire to exceed expectations
Extraordinary written and oral communication skills
Exceptional organizational and analytical abilities
MBA, technical background, or, a working knowledge of CS fundamentals strongly preferred

Our Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. Were crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; thats why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
Toronto, ONYou will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.


About Myplanet


We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.


A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Are you a seasoned gameplay programmer with a desire to make an impact?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Do you believe that creating games is bigger than what one person can do alone?
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If so, our Senior Gameplay Programmer opportunity might be the perfect fit for you!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Relic Entertainment, a wholly owned studio of SEGA, is the award winning RTS developer of Homeworld, Dawn of War and Company of Heroes, and we're on the hunt for a Senior Gameplay Programmer to work in our Vancouver studio. As a studio, our role is to create a workplace where people are energized and empowered to not only do their best work but to continually surpass their best. We'll push you out of your comfort zone to become the best version of you by giving you the ownership and creative freedom to solve our most challenging problems.

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of building gameplay features on an exceptional strategy game. You'll collaborate across disciplines, while acting as a technical expert for the gameplay features that you own.

As our Senior Gameplay Programmer you will…
--------------------------------------------------


Collaborating with game designers to develop and implement their vision of gameplay features
Architecting gameplay systems from scope definition to testing stages
Identifying and solving performance issues
Providing regular updates on technology risks and obstacles to designers and leads
Supporting our Principal Programmers in mentoring more junior programmers on best practices

We're looking for someone who has…
-----------------------------------------------


A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or the equivalent in experience
5+ years' professional game industry experience
Shipped 1+ successful AAA title(s) on PC or console
Fluent in C++
Expertise within object oriented analysis and design, AI, and physics
Experience working with other people's code
A commitment to collaboration, teamwork and getting the job done
Passion, creativity and a desire to make a significant impact

It's a bonus if you have…
--------------------------------------


Enjoy playing and creating strategy games
Have experience with proprietary game engines
Have a website or Github account with samples of your code

What's in it for you?
---------------------------------

You will become part of the SEGA family (in addition to Relic, it includes Creative Assembly ( http://www.creative-assembly.com/ ), Sports Interactive ( http://www.sigames.com/ ), Hardlight Studio ( http://www.hardlightstudio.com/ ), and Amplitude Studios ( http://www.amplitude-studios.com/ )) which means you'll have an opportunity to work on AAA games and learn a ton. We also offer top-notch benefits and perks, including an extensive extended health benefits plan, retirement savings plan, and support for any required relocation or immigration efforts. On top of that, we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games so we offer competitive total compensation packages.

Interested?
-----------------

Please apply through this portal - you'll find the application below! Make sure to tell us a bit about yourself and let us know why YOU would be a great fit for our team!

Next Steps?
-----------------

Regrettably, we are unable to interview all applicants. Please be patient while we review every application. We will get in touch with the applicants that best fit what we're looking for, so please make sure you tell us about yourself and how you would like to contribute to our team.

Have you heard? We're making Age of Empires IV!
-----------------------------------------------

Check out the trailer here ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RYwZ6GZXWhA ) and follow along on social:

Facebook ( http://fb.com/relicentertainment ) | Twitter ( http://twitter.com/relicgames ) | Instagram ( http://instagram.com/relicentertainment )

job_title: Machine learning developer, Low Level CPU / GPU (Labs) / Développeur d'apprentissage machine, processeur / GPU bas niveau (Labs)
job_description:
In this role, you will use your machine learning and natural language processing skills to contribute to the creation of new "smart" workflows in Unity. You will be joining the Unity Labs team, comprised of talented folks in search of new cutting edge methods to author content and help storytellers.

Machine-learning based approaches to content creation are poised to redefine how artists work, and how stories are told. By applying these groundbreaking methods to Unity workflows, you will be part of the next revolution in digital content creation.

In this role, you will be asked to come up with novel ways of interacting with virtual worlds, including natural-language understanding, knowledge engineering and representation, search, and AI-driven content creation. Unity's award-winning 3D engine, and its huge reach into many industries, it is the perfect place to influence and contribute to the future.

Responsibilities
----------------


Use machine-learning approaches to build and use a knowledge system
Write various software APIs to interface with knowledge systems
Contribute to the Unity Editor by writing UI components with the help of our designers
Write, train and integrate neural-nets, including variational auto-encoders and generative adversarial networks

Requirements
------------


Experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch required
Ability to write and train successful models
Experience with any of the following languages: C++, C#, Python

Bonus points
------------


Unity or game development experience is a bonus
Experience with natural language processing techniques, Neo4J graph databases and / or generative adversarial networks
Inquisitive minds with an appetite for discovering things: definite bonus

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#LI-NS1 #SEN

Dans ce poste, vous aurez à utiliser vos compétences en apprentissage machine et en traitement automatique du langage naturel pour contribuer à la création de nouveaux flux de travail « intelligents » au sein de Unity. Vous vous joindrez à l'équipe des laboratoires Unity, une équipe formée de talentueuses personnes à la recherche de nouvelles méthodes de pointe de création de contenu et d'aide à la narration.

Les approches fondées sur l'apprentissage machine sont en voie de redéfinir le travail des artistes et la manière dont les histoires sont vendues. En appliquant ces méthodes avant-gardistes aux flux de travail Unity, vous prendrez part à la prochaine révolution en matière de création de contenu numérique.

Vous aurez dans vos fonctions à trouver des manières inédites d'interagir avec les mondes virtuels, notamment par la compréhension du langage naturel, l'ingénierie et la représentation des connaissances, la recherche, et la création de contenu guidée par l'intelligence artificielle. Le moteur 3D primé de Unity, grâce notamment à son énorme portée dans plusieurs secteurs, est le meilleur endroit pour influencer l'avenir et contribuer aux technologies du futur.

Responsabilités
----------------------


Utiliser les approches d'apprentissage machine pour bâtir et utiliser un système de connaissances
Écrire des API logicielles servant d'interface avec les systèmes de connaissances
Contribuer à l'Éditeur Unity en écrivant des composantes de l'interface utilisateur qui aideront nos concepteurs
Écrire, former et intégrer des réseaux neuronaux, y compris des auto-encodeurs de variations et des réseaux antagonistes génératifs

Compétences
------------------


Expérience avec TensorFlow ou PyTorch requise
Capacité d'écrire et de former des modèles réussis
Expérience avec l'un des langages suivants : C++, C#, Python

Atouts
------


Une expérience en conception de jeux vidéo ou avec Unity est un atout
Expérience avec les techniques de traitement automatique du langage naturel, avec les bases de données orientées graphe Neo4J ou avec les réseaux antagonistes génératifs
Avoir un esprit curieux qui aime découvrir des choses : c'est un atout considérable

Qui sommes-nous

Nous sommes une entreprise orientée vers le produit, nous sommes curieux et créatifs. Afin de permettre à Unity d'évoluer avec les progrès, d'être plus conviviale et d'élargir ses marchés, nous réinvestissons continuellement dans le développement. Avec plus d'un milliard d'installations par mois, Unity rejoint autant les joueurs que les amateurs. En plus de nos jeux vidéo, nos logiciels sont utilisés dans des secteurs aussi variés que la médecine, la visualisation et le commerce. Ces logiciels contribuent à démocratiser le développement des jeux, permettent de résoudre des problèmes et favorisent la réussite d'un grand nombre de développeurs à l'échelle mondiale.

Aujourd'hui, Unity compte plus de 15 succursales dans le monde et ses employés sont répartis dans 23 pays. Les employés de Unity Technologies sont passionnés et dynamiques, il ne suffit plus de savoir faire le travail, nous sommes à la recherche de candidats qui souhaitent se dépasser, surmonter des obstacles et qui ont de grands rêves!

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. #LI-NS1 #SEN

The Search Infrastructure team at Etsy builds and maintains the core search platform that help Etsy buyers and sellers discover and celebrate handmade goods from all over the world. We own and operate all system components powering Etsy’s search and AI tools and aim to utilize aggressive automation to ensure our infrastructure scales independently of the size of the team.

The technical staff at Etsy believes that code is craft, and that the work we do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make Etsy such a unique marketplace. We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of our pioneering continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning. Learn more about our engineering philosophies, tools, and some of the challenges we’ve been solving on our Engineering blog: http://codeascraft.com/

Location: Brooklyn, NY / San Francisco, CA / Toronto, Canada
About the Role
Design, build and support the core infrastructure of our search platform, including on-call duties.
Work cross-functionally with various platform teams, ML teams and product partners to build next generation of high availability search platform in the cloud.
Build and maintain internal tooling for logging, monitoring, testing, alerting and reporting needs for our search stack.
Practice continuous learning and agile delivery model to stay informed and focused on our deliverables.
About You
You have solid engineering and coding skills, data structures knowledge and ability to write high performance production quality code.
You have experience working with languages like Java, Scala, Python, Go or other equivalent languages.
You are a strong collaborator and communicator and you make the engineers around you grow and learn.
Experience with search technologies such as Lucene/Solr or Elasticsearch is a plus
Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and Google Cloud is a plus
Experience with Unix/Linux operating systems and networking stack (e.g., TCP/IP, routing, network topologies and hardware, SDN) is a plus.
Experience with full stack development is a plus.
What’s Next

Interested in working with us? Send us a cover letter and your CV or resume explaining why you’d be great for the job. We value your unique talents and point of view, so feel free to tell us what you are all about. And if you write, draw, craft, or contribute to something you’re proud of, we’d love to hear about it.
At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We welcome people from all backgrounds, ethnicities, cultures, and experiences. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Project Lead, Senior System Engineer - MON05339


Job Family Broadcast Engineering
Primary Location Montreal
Position Language Requirement Bilingual (English / French)
Language Skill Levels (Reading / Writing / Speaking) B B B
Status of Employment Contract
Work schedule(s) Full-time


Description

To learn more about the people who lead, build out, support and make up the teams at MTIS, please visit our website here.

Created in 2015 to align, lighten and modernize infrastructure, the Media Technology and Infrastructure (MTIS) team is the backbone and the future forward arm of CBC/Radio-Canada. We are the people that make stuff work. We make connections; between media content, systems, people and places. We are the space in between.

A place with purpose. CBC/Radio-Canada has always been a highly-regarded pioneer of media technology. Not just in Canada, but around the world. Today, we’re transforming ourselves from conventional radio and television broadcaster into a modern digital media company. Technology is the driving force. MTIS is the team making it happen.

The opportunity

CBC/Radio-Canada is seeking a Project Lead, Senior System Designer to join us for a 12-month contract (with renewal) within our Engineering Department. This is a Montreal-based role working primarily on local projects with the possibility of travel to Toronto. CBC/Radio-Canada has one of the largest technological infrastructures and private networks in the world that uniquely deploys our content and services from coast-to-coast-to-coast. In this role, you will play a critical role in the design, optimization and delivery of projects including updating, installing, configuring, and testing equipment, software and systems. You will ensure that the designs and system implementations you oversee are in accordance with CBC/Radio-Canada, accepted industry practices and applicable Federal and Provincial regulations.

Who you are and where are you now?

You are a Project Lead, Senior System Designer with a passion for designing and optimizing complex storage systems. You have hands-on experience designing and overseeing the delivery of infrastructure systems in telecommunication, banking or another industry. You have outstanding leadership skills including the ability to guide the work of a team and a logical, structured mindset that demands you approach problems and issues in an organized, well-thought-out manner. You may have experience working in both French and English.

What’s in it for you?

Challenges. We spend our days solving problems on an unbelievable scale. Media files are highly nuanced and incredibly complicated; moving our broadcasting content from on-prem servers to the cloud is a complex technical feat. And that’s just the beginning. This one-of-a-kind wide network infrastructure is always in transformation, growing and evolving, with new technologies based on new business and industry realities. Your project work will range from:

Strategic planning and reporting.
Providing expert advice on cost, timeframe and feasibility of capital requirements.
Controlling and tracking the schedules and budgets for capital projects as well as monitoring progress to ensure compliance with scope and objectives.
Design.
Innovating practical solutions to complex problems, particularly where new technologies are to be integrated into existing facilities. This will include virtualizing media infrastructure to allow more flexibility for the corporation.
Creating concept designs for review with our business partners as well as conceptualizing and formulating alternative solutions which satisfy defined objectives.
Preparing functional, schematic, layout drawings and associated documentation, and detailed installation instructions for wiring crews.
Implementation and procurement.
Coordinating with groups to manage the project implementation as per the approved business case.
Overseeing procurement, from preparing Supply Requirements to Request for Quotations/Proposals when necessary and evaluating responses.
Handover and acceptance,
Verifying system performance against design criteria, providing test documentation.
Identifying project deficiencies and assigns resources to correct them.
Preparing documentation for ongoing operation and maintenance of facilities.
Be part of the change. Right now we are looking for people who can execute our strategy. Innovators who want to push future-forward thinking. Builders who want to be hands-on, building the next generation of media technology for CBC/Radio-Canada employees. We want to hear the ideas, see the designs and implement the innovations brought to us by our teams. You want to be part of a team actively transforming the workspace for every individual at CBC/Radio-Canada. Our priority is to proactively and in-the-moment solve problems and ensure the users and media components can engage with new functionalities, new tools and conduct their day-to-day work seamlessly.
Cutting-edge tech. Data management. Cloud migration. IP for broadcast. AI. Security and reliability. The road ahead changes every day. By joining us now, you will become both pioneer and expert with a highly specialized, in-demand skill-set as you help us take steps towards the next frontier of media. While we will want you to stay, we know you will be able to go anywhere after this. As the official providers of technology to CBC/Radio-Canada, you will be joining the team that touches the latest technologies. You will have a chance to influence the choice and use of newer technologies and introduce changes to the processes.

Why join us?

At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance. We offer a rare-in-tech work-life balance with an excellent benefits package and a pension plan noted as one of the best in the country; we want to ensure you are happy in and out of the office.
We are a dynamic, in-flux team less than 3 years old, brimming with potential. There’s a lot of exciting work ahead of us and while we aren’t there yet, we have a plan. Our focus is fulfilling our mandate to exceed audience expectations. We weigh our options, research, explore and evaluate. When we make a decision, we follow through with purpose. We don’t have one static future ahead of us, but a fluid set of options. This means a chance to be part of that change whether you are an idea generator or an executor.

Qualifications

What you bring

The education. You have a degree in Engineering and you are eligible for membership in the Association of Professional Engineers of Ontario. You have networking certification.
The experience. You have expertise in designing, planning and overseeing the implementation of infrastructure for network, advanced IP routing, IP telephony, unified communications, virtualization and storage technologies. You have hands-on experience with Hyperconverged solutions and platforms; deploying large scale software and of critical IT security and networking concepts. You work on the cutting edge of technology and pick up new tools quickly. You are aware of modern, best practices and you thrive in an Agile environment.
The project management expertise. You can navigate business and financial decisions; negotiate contracts and conflicts; and drive the deliverables of major projects on time. You understand how to work within the processes and use the significant budget as well as existing resources, tools and personnel to your advantage. You are a strategic thinker with the motivation to think through complex issues, remove the roadblocks and innovate multiple solutions.
The communication skills. You can nurture strong two-way relationships with peers, partners, clients, staff, senior managers and external technological vendors. You are skilled at presenting ideas, documenting processes and workflows and designing systems. You can relay your opinions with sensitivity. Fluency in both French and English would be a great asset, further enabling you to collaborate with and support the teams and end-users across the country.
To apply:
Think this job is meant for you but worried you don’t have it all? At CBC/Radio-Canada we know that not everyone takes the same path when it comes to building their skills. Hands-on experience, intelligence, innovation, a passion for learning and a team-focused approach can combine to form the best set of qualifications. If you feel you meet 70% of the requirements we are seeking and you are excited by the possibility of growing our company, take a chance and express your interest here:https://bit.ly/2HF9eAW

As a leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and permeate all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.

Title: Senior Android Camera System Developer

Immervision enables intelligent vision in any device. We design wide-angle lenses with augmented resolution to see more, and AI-ready image processing to see smarter. This technology is for smart professional applications, consumer devices, automotive, robotics, medical, and other industries. We believe that vision is key to understanding and securing the environment and to entertaining and informing the world, so we constantly adapt our technology, and license it to state of the art component manufacturers, OEMs and ODMs in the imaging eco-system.

As a Senior Android Camera System Developer, you will work with a group of talented and experienced developers, designers, and marketing specialists to deliver solutions to top-tier global brands and SOC partners.

You will help and support the engineering team on a continuous basis, to quickly deliver various projects while furthering our aim to revolutionize the way we communicate with each other.

In this role, you will work with some of the best-known consumer electronic brands in the world. You’ll contribute in developing cutting edge technology and help to the successful launch of major consumer devices. You will lead brainstorming sessions, write and publish articles in leading worldwide scientific magazines and associations and collaborate in patent writing. You’ll be part of a team spirited company pursuing continuous innovation.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Software Development (specification, implementation, tests, and maintenance)
Customer/partner support and pre-sale activities (International travel might be required)
Documentation (Reporting, Technology presentation, White paper and Software and code documentation)
Timely submission of expenses reports, project status reports, etc.
Timely submission of all project documentation in the document repository of record
 STUDIES AND EXPERIENCE

University degree in computer science, engineering or equivalent

More than 5 years of experience

Language:
REQUIRED: English
ASSET: Korean, Mandarin or Japanese
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Proven ability to work as a team member and to meet critical customer deadlines
Strong background in Android development

REQUIRED: Experience in Android Camera HAL, Android camera software stack, Framework, ISP

ASSET: Knowledge in image processing (ISP tuning) or 3D driver (e.g. OpenCL, GPU programming or CUDA)
OUR OFFER

Dynamic work atmosphere within a high technology company working within the global imaging ecosystem
Full time
Four (4) weeks vacation
Downtown Montréal location
Company in expansion

About Us

Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.

The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure's technology literally in the driver's seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheethere ( http://www.purestorage.com/content/dam/purestorage/pdf/PureStorage_FactSheet.pdf. ).

The Pure1 Team

Pure1 is the unifying manageability and intelligence layer on top of all Pure products - Flasharray, Flashblade, ObjectEngine, and more to come. It is the nexus of our promise of a simple customer experience, providing insights and tools to help make our customers' lives better. The team works on everything from:


On device RESTful APIs, CLI's, and user interfaces that interact with complex underlying protocols yet help customers easily use our products
Web infrastructure and Data processing pipelines that manage petabytes of data being sent home to our cloud hosted systems in real-time
An industry-leading SaaS cloud platform, Pure1 Manage, which allows customers to manage their array from any browser or from the Pure1 Mobile App. We build tools to manage large fleets of devices and help customers identify and quickly diagnose issues across the stack
Machine learning models allowing for predictive analytics to help resolve potential issues and optimize customer workloads

We build our frontend with Angular and Typescript and our backend services in Java, Python, and Go.

What You Will Be Doing


Collaborate with Product managers, Designers and Engineers to iterate on the design and implementation of our product
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications
Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability

What You Bring To The Team


3+ years of JavaScript / Typescript experience including concepts like asynchronous programming, packaging (webpack, gulp)
3+ years experience with JavaScript testing frameworks (Jasmine, Mocha) and HTML templating (Angular, React, Mustache, Handlebars, etc.)
3+ years of HTML/CSS/Saas/LESS experience, including concepts like layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility
Experience developing web applications that work across multiple devices and screen sizes
Knowledge of Angular is a plus
Knowledge of Python, and SQL is a plus

No Storage? No Problem.

We look for talent and culture first, specific backgrounds second, so once you decide Pure is the right place for you, we will match you with the right project to start with. Plus, we like people to have the ability to do different things and be constantly learning, so we support our employees in moving around to different teams and projects across the company.

Pure creates opportunities for individual development and career growth.

At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We're here to change the world and we hope you join us!

Popular Perks

Pure offers an unlimited vacation policy, free lunches, meditation rooms, free yoga classes and employee resource groups to encourage all of our employees to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back not only to the Bay Area, but across the globe.

Pure is Committed to Equality

Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. job_title: Machine Learning Developer / Développeur, Machine Learning
job_description:
Montréal, QCIn this role, you will use your machine learning and natural language processing skills to contribute to the creation of new "smart" workflows in Unity. You will be joining the Unity Labs team, comprised of talented folks in search of new cutting edge methods to author content and help storytellers.

Machine-learning based approaches to content creation are poised to redefine how artists work, and how stories are told. By applying these groundbreaking methods to Unity workflows, you will be part of the next revolution in digital content creation.

In this role, you will be asked to come up with novel ways of interacting with virtual worlds, including natural-language understanding, knowledge engineering and representation, search, and AI-driven content creation. Unity's award-winning 3D engine, and its huge reach into many industries, it is the perfect place to be to influence and contribute to the future.

Responsibilities
----------------


Use machine-learning approaches to build and use a knowledge system
Write various software APIs to interface with knowledge systems
Contribute to the Unity Editor by writing UI components with the help of our designers
Write, train and integrate neural-nets, including variational auto-encoders and generative adversarial networks

Requirements
------------


Experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch required
Ability to write and train successful models
Experience with any of the following languages: C++, C#, Python

Bonus points
------------


Unity or game development experience is a bonus
Experience with natural language processing techniques, Neo4J graph databases and / or generative adversarial networks
Inquisitive minds with an appetite for discovering things: definite bonus

Who we are
----------

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Guelph, ONIntermediate / Senior Web Developer
This is an on-site position in Guelph, ON
Who we are
Concourse Media is a leading North American online desktop and mobile publishing company located in the South end of Guelph, Ontario. We are passionate about changing the way consumers interact and engage with content online. Our Company attracts over 30 million readers worldwide per month across a growing portfolio of web properties covering Food, Lifestyle, Health, Entertainment, Travel and Sports.
We are a young and vibrant group of writers, designers, developers, and advertising specialists who use interactivity, functionality, and engagement to drive the creative process. We infuse our sites and online videos with a new style of web publishing that brings unique and original content to the forefront for coveted consumer demographics.
Why we need you
Concourse Media is looking for Intermediate / Senior Web Developers to join our growing and talented tech and design team to help us build scalable custom tools and extensions for other departments as well as our web properties. We’re also having a hard time getting past the 4th level on Donkey Kong and could use some support.
What we offer you
Concourse Media is a growing and exciting Canadian publishing company. Our compensation packages include flexible work hours, work from home availability, health benefits, dental benefits and more. We have an arcade cabinet that needs love and a Friday afternoon Happy Hour that needs more fun seekers!
Who you are
You love to code! You get satisfaction from building an idea into a great product. You continually improve your craft by learning from others and you love to share what you’ve learned with your peers. You will own and run multiple projects within the company and be accountable for their successful delivery.
You’re an expert Pac Man, Street Fighter II, or other old school arcade master. If you don’t fit into this category, your meme game better be on point.
What To Expect:
As Intermediate / Senior Web Developer, you will report to the CTO and be required to:
Collaborate with other teams and developers to design, develop, test and deploy new tools and extensions in PHP, javascript and multiple other languages.
Identify and provide technical solutions to business problems.
Work with management to improve productivity through automation and AI.
Learn about and become an expert in Concourse Media.
Be a flexible, fast and enthusiastic developer who is committed to delivering high quality results
Qualifications:
3+ years expert experience implementing responsive front-ends using web development technologies such as Javascript, HTML and CSS.
3+ years expert experience with server-side web development technologies on the LEMP stack (Linux, NGINX, MySQL and PHP).
Fundamental understanding of Object Oriented PHP development.
Solid understanding of DOM manipulation and JavaScript coding concepts.
Experience and proficiency with MySQL databases.
Experience with agile development methodologies.
Experience with source control software such as Git repositories.
Internally motivated and able to work both independently and effectively within a team.
Strong communication skills both internally within the tech and design team and externally with non technical staff.
Encouraging, passionate, inspiring in all things.
Desired:
3+ years’ experience as a Software Developer.
College or University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
Strong initiative to find ways to improve solutions, systems, and processes.
Knowledge and experience using DocBlock.
A positive individual wishing to contribute to a growing company.
Preferred:
Experience using the Symfony framework.
Experience in small business IT.
Experience with Varnish cache.
Past experience with Linux operating systems, such as Ubuntu.
Experience with web server software NGINX and PHP-FPM..
Experience with Facebook, DFP, Google Analytics and associated APIs.
Experience using Doctrine.
Experience using Composer.

Objective:

Reporting to the Engineering Manager, this position is responsible for developing, delivering and implementing data-driven cloud-based applications. The Backend Software Developer provides the best approaches to realize a software solution/system using their intensive backend and full stack development skills. The Backend Software Developer must have a strong knowledge of Azure and AWS cloud services.

Responsibilities:

Working closely with project stakeholders and related architects to define/verify the use cases and requirements for new software products using systems engineering methods
Designing cloud base software components and extracting the details using provided high level architectures and following best known methodologies such as UML
