PermanentJob Description
At Avigilon we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Founded in 2004 in Vancouver, Avigilon has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. At Avigilon, you will find a culture of thought-leaders who are passionate about creating exciting new solutions for security and surveillance. We seek problem-solvers who are eager to rise to the challenges of a continuously evolving technological industry, and those who want to make an impact of the safety of people and businesses globally.

Responsibilities include:
Design and implement sophisticated scalable multi-threaded Object Oriented Software in C++ for solving challenging problems involving imaging, high speed data processing and networking
Design advanced software modules that follow modern C++ design patterns
Develop and debug Linux device drivers
Apply problem solving skills to identify and improve low-level system performance issues
Apply engineering principles to design algorithms for controlling image acquisition parameters, as well as environmental conditions (Temperature, Power, Fog, Frost, etc.)
Create design documents on software architecture and algorithms
Collaborate with Hardware designers on board bring-up and debug
Maintain and improve Firmware build system using Make, CMake, Python and Docker
Peer review code for adherence best practices, design guidelines and coding standards
Estimate and track time and effort necessary for completing implementation tasks
Review Marketing and Product Requirements Document during feasibility and development
Collaborate with Quality Assurance team on identifying test cases for new features and areas for regression tests
Follow the established development process for all design and implementation tasks
Provide mentorship and coaching to junior developers
Qualifications:
7-10+ years embedded development experience
Strong C++ design and programming skills for embedded applications
Firm grasp of operating system concepts including processes, threads, mutexes, interrupt handling, and exception handling
Experience with C++ compilation and debugging tools
Experience with scripting languages, build systems, and version control systems
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical discipline
Understanding of embedded design considerations including C++ memory management, microprocessor architectures, instruction efficiency, and I/O timing
Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience:
Knowledge of digital imaging/photography and audio/video coding
Experience with development in a Linux environment for ARM target processors
Perks and Benefits:

As a full-time employee at Avigilon, you are eligible to receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes MSP, extended health, dental, and medical insurance while travelling. You will also receive a health spending account to cover additional healthcare costs, such as vision care, RMT and chiropractor visits.

Back-End Engineer Wanted

We’re a team of strategists, designers, and technologists, driven by a shared passion for creating digital platforms, products, and services that span web, mobile, and connected spaces. Based in Vancouver and New York City, we’re focused on changing how organizations connect with users in an increasingly digital world. If you’re up for that challenge, you should join us.

The Role

We believe that small, collaborative, and cross-functional teams are best equipped to achieve the most optimal project outcomes. Within these teams, members of our Technology group play a critical role in helping to define solutions to our clients’ business challenges.

As a Senior Back-End Engineer, you’ll lead the planning and implementation of web and mobile platforms and products built on current and emerging technologies. In addition to helping define the project roadmap and approach, you’ll lead teams across the full lifecycle, optimizing for performance, and testing for stability. Your experience in navigating the full technology stack of tools, frameworks, and APIs will ensure we’re always focused on finding an approach that is optimal over obvious.

Ideal candidates will have experience working in an agency or startup environment, utilizing agile, kanban, and iterative process. You should have an expert level knowledge of Laravel, PHP, Database Architecture, and Unix, a strong portfolio of work in product and platform for web and mobile, and a proven ability to collaborate, lead, manage, and mentor.

Responsibilities

Lead the way on project architecture and database structure while utilizing best practices in performance, stability, scalability and security
Maintain proficiency in a wide range of back-end web development technologies and help identify the most effective solutions to the projects you lead
Setup and manage services on AWS and other platforms. Our front-end developers will lean on you to design API services, set up deployment servers, and more
Participate in workshops, roadmapping, scoping, and estimation
Own technical requirements gathering through stakeholder engagement and research and lead the documentation of technical architecture
Collaborate with engineers, designers, strategists, and QA analysts, both internal and external (client-side and partners)
Test, refactor, and optimize code to achieve the best performance, and make quality assurance a top priority
Follow industry best practices and coding standards developed by the agency
Understand our clients’ business, their needs, and the technical opportunities and challenges that exist within their categories
Required Skills & Experience

5+ years experience in back-end web and mobile development with a focus on custom applications, Linux/Unix and open source including Laravel, PHP, Node, Ruby, shell scripting, database architecture, and Unix operating systems
Thorough understanding and working experience with CS fundamentals including automation, algorithmic processes, data modeling, and design patterns
Experience with database design, solution architecture, and development with MySQL, MongoDB, Postgres, and cloud hosting with AWS, Azure, and Heroku
Experience integrating with web services APIs via JSON and REST
Experience planning, prototyping, developing, and testing for web, mobile/tablet, IoT devices, VUI, and other digital platforms
Extensive experience working with open source and enterprise CMS (WordPress, Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal, and Custom CMS)
Able to implement ecommerce platforms (Shopify/Plus, Magento, BigCommerce), payment gateways (Stripe, PayPal, Authorize.net), and merchant account providers
Experience in behavioral and test-driven development, continuous integration and delivery, agile, and working with Git code repositories
Familiarity with secure web application practices (authentication, authorization, encryption), SSL, web application firewall, web service proxy, and multi protocol gateways
Ability to code HTML, CSS, and JavaScript as needed
Familiarity with native mobile development and mobile app frameworks
An interest and general understanding of machine learning and AI
Digital agency or startup team experience preferred but not required
Degree in Web Development or Computer Science preferred but not required
Candidates should be residents of Vancouver or willing to relocate and able to travel
Benefits

In addition to an exceptional company culture, we offer the following benefits to all employees:

A welcome kit, a MacBook Pro, and all the tools you need on day one
Personal learning budget for classes, events, and conferences, and access to General Assembly, Treehouse, Udemy, and One Month to help you expand your skills
Winter holiday break in addition to 3 weeks vacation time to start
Office snacks, coffee, tea, beer, and monthly birthday celebrations
Holiday parties, happy hours, and team building activities
Health and dental coverage
Offices in two of the best cities in the world – Vancouver and New York City
An incredible global client list including some of the most recognized brands
Focused yet casual work environment in Mount Pleasant and close to public transit
How to Apply

If this sounds like a fit, please apply through our online application form. Only candidates with an online portfolio or work samples may be shortlisted and contacted. Please clearly state your personal contribution to each project submitted. If you have a Github profile, blog, or other online projects, please send those URLs along too. Extra attention will be given to creative candidates who are active online.

No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.

Visit us at www.enginedigital.com

We build simple, easy-to-use conversational AI platforms exclusively for banks so their customers can manage their money and improve their financial well-being. With customers across four continents, our conversational AI platform is changing the financial lives of people around the world.

Headquartered in beautiful Vancouver BC, Canada - we are growing rapidly with people based in Toronto, New York, and Florida. Our culture is open and we work collaboratively to achieve our goals. Perform end to end engineering of assigned feature and product area from design, develop, test, release, deploy, upgrade and production

Actively participate in architecture design and decisions, communicate Significance/Impact of a Solution with Management

Finn AI is an award-winning, AI-powered virtual assistant built for personal banking and finance. We put a personal banker in every bank customer’s pocket, helping them to manage their money wherever they are, whatever they need - via a simple, natural conversation.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics - Toronto, ON
job_description:
Requisition ID: 50384
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose:
The Data Scientist role in the Corporate Functions Analytics team is designed for individuals with a curiosity for deriving insights out of data and applying them to address business opportunities, in partnership with global teams and business lines driving innovation and advanced analytics across the Bank.
The Sr. Data Scientist will lead key projects, in an agile rapid lab environment, aimed at accelerating benefits for customers and the bank, leveraging enterprise-level data management tools and advanced analytics. She/he will work closely with Global teams, business lines, Digital Banking and technology to apply advanced analytics techniques and tools, as well as explore ideas to enhance business opportunities utilizing advanced analytics and artificial intelligence.
The Sr. Data Scientist role requires rigorous logical thinking, curiosity, flexibility and great teamwork abilities, with a strong aptitude for understanding complex business problems and translating their deep technical knowledge into practical, implementable solutions that will drive high impact business value. Individuals should be able to consider end-to-end solutions and have the ability to work on all technical elements in an Analytics project from system architecture, through modeling of advanced artificial intelligence models, to the front end user interface and design.
The candidate will be at the intersection of math/stats, computer science, communication, the business line and the customer. She/he will take a leading role in agile rapid labs and strategy development to drive innovation and digital transformation throughout the Bank and Corporate Functions.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Opportunity to make an impact in the digital transformation of Scotiabank
Exposure to global teams and business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
Hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
A compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs
Key Accountabilities:
Work in an Agile environment to deploy new credit solutions within 90-120 days
Coach a team of data scientist for analytics. This includes providing them guidance on how to work in agile environment, infuse analytics in building solutions and transforming the Bank’s digital capabilities, determine the analytics tools and technology that should be applied in each solution and coaching the team as they work with colleagues from across the organization.
Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging Data Science
Work collaboratively with data engineers, UX designers, digital marketing team and agile coaches to define analytics requirements for every scrum and map out an end-to-end solution
Help find solution on what and how to ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model transform and store it in variety of data stores
Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop) for analysis, data mining and modeling
Collaborate with Data engineering to deploy models and algorithms in production, across business lines and geographies
Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of models and make ongoing changes
Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
Lead Research & Development work focused on the effective application of design thinking and scalable advanced techniques to drive ideation and innovation
Collaborate with other Advanced Analytics teams and partners to define data engineering, visualization and machine learning best-practices
Be an integral part of the Advanced Analytics community for incubating ideas and use case acceleration in rapid labs across key markets through advisory, training and scalable solutions
Support analytical use-case delivery, as well as customer/financial benefits tracking and communication
Competencies and Experience:
Hands-on experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g. Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Kafka) and experience with NoSQL databases (e.g., Hbase, Cassandra, Druid)
Production experience with experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling (e.g. cross-sell, upsell, attrition, acquisition and lookalike models)
Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image)
Working experience with machine learning and other AI techniques for strategy design
Experience with UNIX tools and shell scripting
Solid SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
Experience using and implementing visualization tools like D3, Tableau or Qlikview
Working experience of strategy optimization leveraging operations research principles would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills with ability to translate technical knowledge into business value
Effective communication skills with ability to prepare project documentation and presentations
Education:
University degree in relevant STEM discipline (Computer Sciences, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering and Mathematics)
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

Kitchener, ONJob Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Kitchener, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Kitchener
External Posting Description
We are seeking a qualified Technical Lead, Software Development to join our growing team of established corporate entrepreneurs and technologists at the Emerging Technology Hub in the newly opened Deloitte Waterloo Region Office.
The Emerging Technology Hub (ET Hub) is part of Deloitte’s Technology group and will serve clients across Canada and globally. We build innovative large-scale technical solutions for our clients in industries like Banking, Healthcare and Insurance. We also create solutions for clients using emerging technologies like Blockchain, AI/ ML, and IoT.
We are located in Kitchener-Waterloo Region right next to Communitech, one of Canada’s most productive and exciting technology and innovation hubs. You will be working alongside some of the brightest entrepreneurs and innovators in Canada and inside one of the region’s most exciting work environments. The team will consist of product managers, software architects, full stack developers, front-end designers and subject matter experts.
As a Technical Lead, Software Development, you are responsible for the big picture, guiding the development team to build or adapt existing products or prototypes that are differential and that inspire our customers. You will have mentorship responsibilities, working with the team of developers, designers and product managers to build technologically innovative solutions. You will work on enterprise products like Amazon AWS, redhat technologies, openshift, and dockers. With that, you will have the option to work on full technology stack like angular, nodejs, python, APIs development, RESTful services and micro services.
Your day to day responsibilities include agile scrum master. You will work with Product Owners and Product Managers to groom and execute a backlog of software development activities that are prioritized using lean startup principles. You will participate in design thinking lab sessions with Product Owners, startups, and clients.
You will have the opportunity to research and train on emerging technologies and some of the most crucial technology platforms in the market today, sharing back your findings with innovation center teams as a subject matter expert and providing input for future projects. You will also support the presentation of products or platforms developed in client engagements and make contributions to Deloitte’s global technology knowledge base.
You are an entrepreneurially-minded software developer who works collaboratively with stakeholders to create digital solutions that are engaging, inspiring, and differential. You are nimble-minded and naturally curious. You are comfortable juggling responsibilities and pivoting a team based on feedback. You are passionate about your work and the accomplishments of your team. If this sounds like you, read on!
External Posting Qualifications
To qualify for this position, you have:

5-7 years software development experience, ideally full stack, and software architecture experience in building PaaS and SaaS based products.
Demonstrated experience in documentation of technical solution designs.
A passion for mentoring and leading a team of software developers and students. The desire to manage young professionals and students in an agile-scrum environment.
Experience working on teams that incubated or created new products.
Confidence to work on problems that may not be well defined from the beginning, leading a team through the discovery process.
A degree in computer science, engineering, or math program (or equivalent programming academic experience or through work experience).
Interpersonal skills and a team-player attitude.
An open mind and a desire to learn from client or stakeholder feedback.

Let us know if you have any of these optional qualifications:

Experience in healthcare or insurance industries.
Have agile-scrum training and experience.
Design thinking, rapid prototyping, or entrepreneurial experience.
Dev-ops experience.
QA experience.
Data science, machine learning, deep learning, or NLP application experience.
Blockchain programming experience.
IoT system design or deployment experience.
A business degree or experience.
Cloud development and deployment experience.

Highlight your experience in the following technical areas. If we missed something, tell us what we need to know!

Python, Java, or any OOP programming language
HTML5, CSS, JavaScript
Web related frameworks (Angular, ReactJS, jQuery, Bootstrap, Foundation, Node.js)
API Creation and RESTful services
Redhat technologies, OpenShift and Dockers
Data processing (OpenRefine, Excel, Pandas) and visualization (Highcharts, Google Charts)
Database systems (SQL, NoSQL)
Algorithm design
Mobile platforms
Cloud environments (AWS, Google)
Knowledge of version control systems
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make a greater impact than you ever thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and drive our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, and lead.
At Deloitte, we understand that everyone, and their career goals, are different. As a firm, we help create the conditions and opportunities that will enable our people to thrive – both professionally and personally. We do this by making three commitments to our people:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to work how you want, and we have innovative spaces and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.
Apply now and let us show you how to push your career to the next level at Deloitte. The One Firm. For You.
Deloitte is an inclusive employer dedicated to building a diverse workforce. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective provincial human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Please advise the Recruiter to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted
36030

CTO.ai enables development teams to easily adopt automation into their workflows to streamline processes and increase repeatability. Our tool allows any developer to create and implement workflow automations, what we call Ops, across their entire team via a CLI. This means any developer can contribute towards DevOps through a mix of custom built and community contributed workflow automations, regardless of their prior DevOps experience
We’re growing faster than ever and are looking for accomplished Senior Software Engineers with a solid understanding of how all parts of the system work in order to build first-rate product and technology.
About the Platform Team:
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Platform team, you will work with a highly-motivated team of engineers, designers, and product leaders to build a new platform and its features. We’re a small close-knit team with an environment for you to learn quickly. On the Platform team, you will have the opportunity to make a big impact on the new product launches and technology choices.
Requirements
Multiple years of experience designing and building scalable applications Experience building robust RESTful APIs in one of the following: Golang (preferred), JavaScript (Node.js/Express.js), Ruby, or Python.
In-depth knowledge of SQL (PostgreSQL preferred)
Experience with Docker
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Pluses: Experience with NoSQL databases such as Redis and Elasticsearch
Benefits
What We Offer:
A supportive and inclusive environment with ambitious and high-performing peers to work alongside on challenging new projects
Exposure to a variety of technologies on a diverse range of projects
Tons of autonomy and the opportunity to make a big impact on our business
We are a thriving tech startup which gives us the freedom to do what is best for the benefit of the company and our employees
Why we love working here:
In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an employer-paid comprehensive benefits plan including an Extended Health Care with Dental/Vision Care, Life Insurance, and AD&D
We provide a flexible work schedule and environment
We have a generous vacation policy - We foster a healthy work/life balance and pride ourselves on being flexible
We provide regularly catered lunches and healthy snacks
We have a great location in Gastown – Enjoy the water views!
We do frequent team events and outings - Join the fun!
I’m In!
If this role sounds interesting, please send us your resume and feel free to include links like your GitHub or non-public code that will help us understand your background. Thanks!

Montréal, QC$80,000 - $95,000 a year*** Please note that we can only consider applicants who already have the right to work in Canada, e.g. PR or Citizen ***
We are looking for a capable team-player (f/m) to join our highly-motivated start-up environment - with ample opportunities for ownership, to take a lead, and to put her/his technical expertise into the products we build.
Who are we?
CONCURED's Montreal office is an 10-strong diverse team of developers, researchers and designers - representing 6 nationalities, and with a better gender balance than Google or Facebook.
We are leveraging recent advances in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning to serve the global community of Content Marketers. Our product is a SaaS platform that saves Marketers time researching content ideas, and provides recommendations for content topics that will resonate with their target audiences.
Our finances are unusually secure for a young company, having brought our first product to market within months, serving paying customers, and backed by private investors. Unlike many startups, we are not only dreamers but DOers!
Must have skills:
3+ years' on-the-job experience developing new features with Python
Passionate in solving complex issues from system level
Back-end experience in a production environment
Strong knowledge in understanding docker and CI/CD working flow
Version control systems
Database experience (MongoDB preferred)
Good experience with Agile and DevOps concepts - Developing the monitoring architecture and implementing monitoring agents, dashboards, escalations and alerts
More specifically, to:
Plan technical architectures that minimize or eliminates performance problems, complexity, or solution fragility
Work closely with data scientists, AI engineers & Front-end devs
Mentor and lead junior developers to fulfill technical activities, including code reviews
Identify and resolve complex bugs and problems
Help define coding practices and guidelines
Develop Micro-services & APIs
Perks & Benefits
Fast-growing company -> potential for rapid promotion
Dynamic and motivated team; friendly and approachable culture
Flexible working hours
Free tea, coffee & beer
Monthly catered team lunches
Attractive WeWork offices and common areas
Opportunity to benefit from company success via Share Options
Awesome Downtown location, close to orange & green metro lines, Gare Central and major bus routes

Lite Link Technologies Inc. (LLT), is a Burnaby based technology company driving to be a disruptive force cross-industry by focusing on innovation and delivery of technical solutions that attack real world problems.
Our initial flagship product is 1SHIFT Logistics. 1SHIFT is a logistics platform to connect shippers, trucking companies, truckers, and 3PL (third party logistics companies) via web applications for logistics and dispatch office workers and a mobile application for truckers. After our initial release, we have a roadmap to evolve functionality in our base platform, integrate other third-party solutions, and develop capabilities to meet industry variations and anchor client requirements.

Opportunity to join our team:
We are currently looking to add a high caliber UI Designer to our team building our 1SHIFT Logistics SaaS product following agile delivery methodology. Our base build is well underway with closed beta trials starting in April and broader roll out by summer.

What you will be doing:
The UI Designer will combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
Design web and mobile apps.
Use responsive design and grid principles.
Use strong typography, layout and visual design skills while executing a design task.
Develop standard UI components and style guides for company-wide use.
Use UI kits when required.
Oversee the development and delivery of effective user interfaces.
Work with digital analytics team to assess the impact of all UI design and usability changes.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

What you bring to the table:
3-4 years of Proven UI experience.
Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio
Expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques.
Experience in creating wireframes(high & low fidelity), storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps
Working knowledge of industry tools: Photoshop, Adobe XD, Illustrator, InDesign, Balsamiq, Omnigraffle, InVision, and Sketch.
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies

OPTIONAL, but would be a great benefit:
Working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Experience creating rapid prototypes.
Balsamiq
Lookback.io
Zeplin

More about us:
LLT is a publicly traded Canadian company (CNSX: LLT) with two products in development about to launch closed beta trials. For entrepreneurial driven candidates wanting to share in the success of a tech startup, this is an excellent opportunity to join us at the beginning of our journey with many of the initial startup challenges behind us.
Our strategic objective is to be an innovation hub to incubate new software products and solutions incorporating leading edge technology like AI and blockchain with web and mobile applications that are simple and deliver differentiated customer experiences. Our solutions will all target disrupting industries or markets to redefine how we think of targeted businesses today.
Valuing creativity, strong work ethic and fervent collaboration, working at Lite Link will be a fast paced, goal driven environment that promotes radical passion for innovation and laser dedication to making a difference. Our team is quickly growing – starting with Accenture heritage in our leadership team with proven delivery experience and extended with thoughtful recruiting to assemble our delivery team in Vancouver with the right tech startup culture and team that makes us excited to come to work each day.
We are located at 3480 Gilmore Way in Burnaby in a newly built out 5,500 square foot office that will co-locate our Sales, Marketing, Product and Operations teams for execution efficiency.

We offer the following total compensation package to foster a happy and productive team.
Competitive base compensation
Stock options to share in success of company
Medical and dental benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Awesome office in Burnaby
Stellar and committed team environment

An exciting company that uses Artificial Intelligence and Data Science to help re-define the sales process is looking for a Product Manager for their Montreal office!

Title: Product Manager
Location: Montreal, QC
Position status: Full time permanent
Salary: Highly competitive + Benefits + Vacation

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to: adam.hassoulas@groomassocies.com

With their head office in New York and with locations across the globe, our client is heading north and expanding to Montreal. The product team is growing and this is an exciting time to join. They have two flavors of their core product: one for their enterprise customers and one for individuals. For product team members, this offers a variety of systems and environments to make an imprint, from the more test-driven, consumer-facing application, to the more analytics, big-data backend infrastructure that needs to meet the scale, reliability and security of enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

Develop and own product vision and strategy for once or more product components for the product platform. Proactively communicate this vision/strategy to the executive team and all internal/external stakeholders
Gather business and functional requirements, propose features and develop tests, prototypes and MVPs to validate product theses
Own your part of the roadmap and work closely with engineers, designers and architects to execute against it
Own and drive backlog grooming and management, prioritize user stories, create acceptance criteria and drive testing and delivery
Drive sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, stories and create necessary documentation to ensure features and benefits are widely socialized
Conduct user interviews as part of researching which features should be prioritized for development.
Lead and listen; continually seek input but have ownership mentality and stand behind product tradeoffs

Preferred background:

5+ years of product management experience, preferably in social network, CRM or SaaS industries. Tech-startup experiences a big plus
A doer, with an ability to always be moving the ball forward and doing them well
Strong business acumen and the ability to think both strategically and tactically
Experience and a track record of success partnering with engineering, marketing, sales, services, and other internal teams
Experience in a test-driven, agile development environment preferred
Integrity, dedication and a collaborative nature that has an overwhelming desire to exceed expectations
Extraordinary written and oral communication skills
Exceptional organizational and analytical abilities
MBA, technical background, or, a working knowledge of CS fundamentals strongly preferred

Our Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. Were crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; thats why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

WHY WORK AT ROSS VIDEO?

We have a great group of people working together to create and deliver cutting edge products that look amazing and are easy to use. We go all out so that our customers can have the best possible experience and achieve quality results. With a product focus, continual learning, results driven processes, and creative thinking, we constantly strive to improve our solutions and to deliver results.

If you've ever watched live television, news, sports, or entertainment, you've seen our products in use. All of the major Hollywood award shows, most professional sports teams, and many of the largest broadcasters in the world use Ross Video technology. Get behind the scenes and learn about what it takes to make live events possible.

If that resonates, and you're someone with integrity, commitment, and a strong drive to deliver great products, we'd love to hear from you.

THE ROLE

We’re looking for a Senior Software Designer, working on the Embedded & Application level to help build out a new suite of exciting products. In this position, you’ll be designing, simulating and testing leading edge software solutions for a variety of customers in the commercial & military video markets.

You’ll work with a team of Hardware & Software developers to design requirements, support aggressive project scheduling, while verifying the functionality of both the embedded and application software solutions that you create. This means you’ll also be responsible for generating specification & design documentation to support cross functional elements of the new production integration (NPI) process.

As a senior member of the team, you’ll also provide support and guidance on the Hardware requirements which drive schematic development and other hardware components specifically related to the embedded control solutions. In order to ensure maximum quality, you’ll thoroughly self-test all of your designs, and will support DevTest & PV, which means reviewing test plans to align focus, validating feedback and debugging/fixing problems when needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

To be considered, you will have a minimum of 10 years of Embedded Software development experience, or equivalent. You will also possess Senior level Application Software design knowledge and experience in the development of complex IP-based video and audio systems in an embedded Linux environment utilizing C, JavaScript, HTML, USB protocols and network sockets. Experience with embedded Linux development and embedded microcontroller software design & OS/RTOS environments will also be required, as will familiarity with common development tools & IDE’s such as GCC, Make, Eclipse, etc., as well as version control solutions such as Subversion, Git, CVS, etc.

We operate utilizing agile development methods (specifically Scrum) so experience within this setting is required, as well as a demonstrated ability to provide accurate estimates for task & project durations, as well as the ability to use those estimates to drive towards completion. Strong debugging skills & proficiency with typical lab equipment (scopes, multimeters, etc.) and strong computer skills, with proficiency in Excel, Powerpoint & Word are also required within this role.

NICE TO HAVE

While not necessarily must haves, experience with the following would be beneficial:

Experience with USB Host and Gadget device development
Experience with Xilinx FPGA, Xilinx PetaLinux, Yocto development environments and JTAG pods
Experience with 10G/25G fiber networking, SFP+, and high-performance network switchers
Experience with network protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, SNMP, etc.), wireshark and network analyzers
Experience with HTML GUI design and deployment (LAMP, DOM, jQuery, Dojo, etc.)
Familiarity with professional broadcast markets, and associated digital audio and video standards
Familiarity with general circuit principles, uP design, and related PCB level troubleshooting
Experience with C#, .NET, Java, JSON, XML and Databases
Experience with Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning and AI-based hardware acceleration
B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or Engineering

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

If the description of the role above sounds interesting to you, and if you feel you meet the qualifications described, we’d love to chat. In addition to the technical knowledge & skills, we’re looking for somebody with strong interpersonal skills, as well as the desire and ability to work both as part of a team, but also independently as required. Keen observational skills and problem solving intuition will also be useful traits for you to possess, in order to manage both the pace & complexity of some of the issues you’ll be tasked with. To this end, you’ll also be organized and a detail oriented self starter, who is able to self manage in order to meet aggressive deadlines.

We’re not looking for someone whose knowledge is set in stone – we want you to be able to learn new concepts quickly, and ultimately work towards finding creative solutions to challenging issues. You’ll be equally comfortable contributing as a day to day member of the team as you are in championing an idea to upper management.

IN A NUTSHELL

Do you have integrity, commitment, and a drive to get results? Then Ross is the place for you, and we'd like to hear from you.

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
Toronto, ONYou will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.


About Myplanet


We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. We make smarter interfaces for the world's most influential companies by implementing leading software platforms from Acquia, IBM, and Salesforce to empower your employees and engage your customers. Headquartered in Toronto, with studio presence in Vancouver, San Jose, and Chicago, we're a team of over 100 designers, developers, product managers & enablers hell-bent on making the workplace better.


A Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment as we work to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live, including those with disabilities. We are dedicated to providing accommodations in all parts of the hiring process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Lite Link Technologies Inc. (LLT), is a Burnaby based technology company driving to be a disruptive force cross-industry by focusing on innovation and delivery of technical solutions that attack real world problems.
Our initial flagship product is 1SHIFT Logistics. 1SHIFT is a logistics platform to connect shippers, trucking companies, truckers, and 3PL (third party logistics companies) via web applications for logistics and dispatch office workers and a mobile application for truckers. After our initial release, we have a roadmap to evolve functionality in our base platform, integrate other third-party solutions, and develop capabilities to meet industry variations and anchor client requirements.

Opportunity to join our team:
We are currently looking to add a high caliber UI Designer to our team building our 1SHIFT Logistics SaaS product following agile delivery methodology. Our base build is well underway with closed beta trials starting in April and broader roll out by summer.

What you will be doing:
The UI Designer will combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
Design web and mobile apps.
Use responsive design and grid principles.
Use strong typography, layout and visual design skills while executing a design task.
Develop standard UI components and style guides for company-wide use.
Use UI kits when required.
Oversee the development and delivery of effective user interfaces.
Work with digital analytics team to assess the impact of all UI design and usability changes.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

What you bring to the table:
3-4 years of Proven UI experience.
Demonstrable UI design skills with a strong portfolio
Expert knowledge of UI design principles and techniques.
Experience in creating wireframes(high & low fidelity), storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps
Working knowledge of industry tools: Photoshop, Adobe XD, Illustrator, InDesign, Balsamiq, Omnigraffle, InVision, and Sketch.
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders.
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies

OPTIONAL, but would be a great benefit:
Working knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
Experience creating rapid prototypes.
Balsamiq
Lookback.io
Zeplin

More about us:
LLT is a publicly traded Canadian company (CNSX: LLT) with two products in development about to launch closed beta trials. For entrepreneurial driven candidates wanting to share in the success of a tech startup, this is an excellent opportunity to join us at the beginning of our journey with many of the initial startup challenges behind us.
Our strategic objective is to be an innovation hub to incubate new software products and solutions incorporating leading edge technology like AI and blockchain with web and mobile applications that are simple and deliver differentiated customer experiences. Our solutions will all target disrupting industries or markets to redefine how we think of targeted businesses today.
Valuing creativity, strong work ethic and fervent collaboration, working at Lite Link will be a fast paced, goal driven environment that promotes radical passion for innovation and laser dedication to making a difference. Our team is quickly growing – starting with Accenture heritage in our leadership team with proven delivery experience and extended with thoughtful recruiting to assemble our delivery team in Vancouver with the right tech startup culture and team that makes us excited to come to work each day.
We are located at 3480 Gilmore Way in Burnaby in a newly built out 5,500 square foot office that will co-locate our Sales, Marketing, Product and Operations teams for execution efficiency.

We offer the following total compensation package to foster a happy and productive team.
Competitive base compensation
Stock options to share in success of company
Medical and dental benefits
3 weeks paid vacation
Awesome office in Burnaby
Stellar and committed team environment

$80,000 - $95,000 a year*** Please note that we can only consider applicants who already have the right to work in Canada, e.g. PR or Citizen ***
We are looking for a capable team-player (f/m) to join our highly-motivated start-up environment - with ample opportunities for ownership, to take a lead, and to put her/his technical expertise into the products we build.
Who are we?
CONCURED's Montreal office is an 10-strong diverse team of developers, researchers and designers - representing 6 nationalities, and with a better gender balance than Google or Facebook.
We are leveraging recent advances in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning to serve the global community of Content Marketers. Our product is a SaaS platform that saves Marketers time researching content ideas, and provides recommendations for content topics that will resonate with their target audiences.
Our finances are unusually secure for a young company, having brought our first product to market within months, serving paying customers, and backed by private investors. Unlike many startups, we are not only dreamers but DOers!
Must have skills:
3+ years' on-the-job experience developing new features with Python
Passionate in solving complex issues from system level
Back-end experience in a production environment
Strong knowledge in understanding docker and CI/CD working flow
Version control systems
Database experience (MongoDB preferred)
Good experience with Agile and DevOps concepts - Developing the monitoring architecture and implementing monitoring agents, dashboards, escalations and alerts
More specifically, to:
Plan technical architectures that minimize or eliminates performance problems, complexity, or solution fragility
Work closely with data scientists, AI engineers & Front-end devs
Mentor and lead junior developers to fulfill technical activities, including code reviews
Identify and resolve complex bugs and problems
Help define coding practices and guidelines
Develop Micro-services & APIs
Perks & Benefits
Fast-growing company -> potential for rapid promotion
Dynamic and motivated team; friendly and approachable culture
Flexible working hours
Free tea, coffee & beer
Monthly catered team lunches
Attractive WeWork offices and common areas
Opportunity to benefit from company success via Share Options
Awesome Downtown location, close to orange & green metro lines, Gare Central and major bus routes

Vancouver, BCPermanentJob Description
At Avigilon we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Founded in 2004 in Vancouver, Avigilon has been a driving force behind the security industry’s AI evolution and has continuously been a company that stands for innovation and growth. At Avigilon, you will find a culture of thought-leaders who are passionate about creating exciting new solutions for security and surveillance. We seek problem-solvers who are eager to rise to the challenges of a continuously evolving technological industry, and those who want to make an impact of the safety of people and businesses globally.

What will you be doing?

Designing and implementing features for our industry leading, end-to-end security monitoring solutions.
Working on scrum team with dedicated software engineers, UX designers and QA engineers to bring new features to life.
Working closely with product management, system architects, and subject matter experts to ensure that we build the best possible product.
Researching and identifying new directions for our technical architecture, user experience, and process improvements.
Having fun.
Qualifications:

Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical discipline
Expert knowledge in .Net and C#
Strong knowledge of design patterns
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Self-motivated and proactive with a desire to innovate
Preference will be given to candidates with the following skills and experience:

A demonstrated pragmatic approach to problem solving
Experience designing and developing RESTful APIs
Experience with SQL and NoSQL data stores
Experience with Web UI development, specifically ReactJS
Experience with Node.js development
Experience with Azure
Exposure to Agile software development practices
Experience with unit testing and Test Driven Development
Experience with modern source control management systems such as Git or Mercurial
Experience with memory profiling and debugging
Perks and Benefits:

As a full-time employee at Avigilon, you are eligible to receive a comprehensive benefits package which includes MSP, extended health, dental, and medical insurance while travelling. You will also receive a health spending account to cover additional healthcare costs, such as vision care, RMT and chiropractor visits.

We believe that diversity spawns innovation – the more diverse our employees are, the more ideas and talents we have to excel as a leader in the technology sector. If you would like to be part of a dynamic team of people who are ambitious, focused, and hardworking then we look forward to meeting you!

job_title: Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services
job_description:
You will be a critical part of Myplanet's achievement of our vision. We are searching for an Associate Director of Voice and AI Professional Services to lead our teams working with Google, Amazon, IBM and other emerging Voice and Artificial Intelligence partners. Together, we can define the future of technology-augmented workplace and customer experiences.


As an Associate Director at Myplanet, you'll mentor, critique, and foster growth for a group of 10 - 15 developers embedded on several multidisciplinary teams within a 50-person unit. You'll coach others to deliver amazing work, build relationships with customers, and foster a strong technology culture. You'll work as a member of our Extended Leadership Team to grow accounts and win new business. You'll wear various hats and let your entrepreneurial spirit fly (or run, or swim, or teleport...) It's a tall, incredibly rewarding order.


About You


Alongside our Client Services and Design leaders, here is how you'll spend your time:
50% - Build strategic relationships with new customers, help define customer technology strategy and vision, and scope & pitch our work together, contributing directly toward our quarterly bookings objectives. Define business strategy as a tech thinker: continuously examine and assess Myplanet's technology services, explore new competitive offerings, and build capabilities.
25% - Support our delivery teams: provide technical guidance, critique, and mentorship to help your team deliver the best possible work for our customers. Be ready to roll up your sleeves where necessary to provide hands-on support.
15% - Grow and engage our talent: engage and grow your team by providing regular coaching and feedback on operational performance, functional expertise, and career development. Drive internal activities that promote tech culture. Foster relationships with talent in the industry to bring new expertise on board.
10% - Plan & communicate: Provide insight into the health of your team and projects, and plan effective assignments that match the interests and expertise of your staff.
What this Role is NOT
A traditional 'approve everything' engineering manager role.
A management role which is fully unbilled; i.e. you'll still have some time allocated to direct involvement in a few projects as a technology leader.
Is the role a fit for you?


The Associate Director, Voice and AI Professional Services role emphasizes team collaboration, technology strategy and business acumen, as well as functional leadership in your area of expertise. We value leaders with a maker's attitude, collaborative energy, and entrepreneurial spirit. You'll find fulfillment in the role if you
Delight in making things. You thrill at the concept of helping teams deliver a concrete product, not merely a strategy or concept. You have an eye for detail and know how to get the highest performance out of technologists. You've got a solid handle on building enterprise web and mobile applications.
Find passion in learning new things. You relish every opportunity to move things forward with your can-do attitude and you eagerly share your entrepreneurial spark. You like depth, but if you only have time to skim the surface, you can get up to speed quickly and think critically about what you've learned.
Thoroughly enjoy collaborative work and servant leadership. You enjoy knowledge sharing in all directions and you geek out at the chance to improve skills across disciplines for you and your teammates. You genuinely care about what makes people tick, and you're committed to helping others succeed by putting the team's needs first.
You have an interest in making the business work. You're an entrepreneur at heart. You see technology as a tool that can solve business challenges. You're willing to wear different hats to move the business forward.
Qualifications
A college or university degree in a related discipline preferable.
Demonstrated ability to scope, pitch and close business with enterprise customers.
Minimum 7 - 10 years industry experience in enterprise web and mobile development with a minimum of 3 years in a leadership role.
Demonstrated background with voice interfaces (frameworks such as Alexa Skills Kit, Google Dialogflow or MS Bot Framework) or creation of custom Conversational AI
Ideally experience managing teams using a modern technology stack, including cloud infrastructure, full-stack JavaScript and using agile project delivery methodologies.
Ability to travel to meet customers, partners and our community (10-25%).
Performance & Growth Expectations
Your work as a technology team leader will be measured using our 360-degree system (a combination of peer and supervisor feedback) and through evaluation of responsibility fulfilment.
Your growth path in your functional domain will be primarily your own responsibility to define, based on what you hope to achieve and how you choose to access the resources available to you.
Your work will also be measured on the basis of a semi-annual KPI set cooperatively with our leadership team.
Benefits & Perks
Explore ongoing opportunities for professional development: training, conferences, certifications, and in-house peer mentorship.
Experiment with new techniques, wear multiple hats, and learn about new disciplines. Our environment is not your average, hierarchical software studio: we emphasize accountability for outcomes, but autonomy in activities.
Pursue independent projects, explore new ideas, and challenge yourself to become a thought leader in your field with 5 days of dedicated "Awesome time" (self-directed professional development) annually.
Enjoy a flexible schedule of full-time hours, health/dental benefits and private US coverage.
Work from a modern, ergonomic space complete with standing/sitting desks and an open-concept social atmosphere.
Compensation


This role features a competitive base salary; benefits; and a commission-based booking incentive, tied to your book of business; as well as participation in our Employee Stock Option Plan.

We're a software studio with an integrated team of designers and developers. An exciting company that uses Artificial Intelligence and Data Science to help re-define the sales process is looking for a Product Manager for their Montreal office!

Title: Product Manager
Location: Montreal, QC
Position status: Full time permanent
Salary: Highly competitive + Benefits + Vacation

TO APPLY: Please send your resume to: adam.hassoulas@groomassocies.com

With their head office in New York and with locations across the globe, our client is heading north and expanding to Montreal. The product team is growing and this is an exciting time to join. They have two flavors of their core product: one for their enterprise customers and one for individuals. For product team members, this offers a variety of systems and environments to make an imprint, from the more test-driven, consumer-facing application, to the more analytics, big-data backend infrastructure that needs to meet the scale, reliability and security of enterprise clients.

Responsibilities:

Develop and own product vision and strategy for once or more product components for the product platform. Proactively communicate this vision/strategy to the executive team and all internal/external stakeholders
Gather business and functional requirements, propose features and develop tests, prototypes and MVPs to validate product theses
Own your part of the roadmap and work closely with engineers, designers and architects to execute against it
Own and drive backlog grooming and management, prioritize user stories, create acceptance criteria and drive testing and delivery
Drive sprint planning meetings, retrospectives, stories and create necessary documentation to ensure features and benefits are widely socialized
Conduct user interviews as part of researching which features should be prioritized for development.
Lead and listen; continually seek input but have ownership mentality and stand behind product tradeoffs

Preferred background:

5+ years of product management experience, preferably in social network, CRM or SaaS industries. Tech-startup experiences a big plus
A doer, with an ability to always be moving the ball forward and doing them well
Strong business acumen and the ability to think both strategically and tactically
Experience and a track record of success partnering with engineering, marketing, sales, services, and other internal teams
Experience in a test-driven, agile development environment preferred
Integrity, dedication and a collaborative nature that has an overwhelming desire to exceed expectations
Extraordinary written and oral communication skills
Exceptional organizational and analytical abilities
MBA, technical background, or, a working knowledge of CS fundamentals strongly preferred

Edmonton, ABOur Purpose

Improbable is dedicated to building powerful technology designed to help solve previously impossible problems and enable the creation of new realities. In gaming and entertainment, Improbable unlocks truly next-generation gameplay through virtual worlds of unprecedented scale, persistence and richness. In other industries, we hope to help answer critical questions through simulations that could lead to a better functioning world.

Our platform, SpatialOS, lets developers transcend the limits of regular computation, allowing swarms of servers running in the cloud to cooperate in order to simulate worlds far larger and more complex than any single server could.

We are a British technology company proudly building a diverse workforce, driven by a shared desire to improve and achieve extraordinary things. Were crafting technology for the future and fostering a problem-solving culture that embraces innovation through iteration and experimentation.

Your Mission

With the successful launch of SpatialOS to the gaming world, the popularity of our platform is growing. Our goal is to strongly demonstrate the potential of the platform, by producing a variety of playable demos, and technical showcases.

As a Game Programmer at Improbable, you understand the core concepts of SpatialOS and use this knowledge to build a wide variety of implementations on top of the platform. You design and implement critical gameplay systems that will be technically robust for large-scale, complex games. You also help to drive the requirements of the platform by giving structured feedback on the process of using the technology and the challenges faced.
Competencies:
Knowledge of implementing gameplay or elements of gameplay (e.g. combat mechanics, AI behaviours, pathfinding).
Knowledge of game architectures and game development paradigms (e.g. entity component systems).
Knowledge and working experience of game engines (e.g. Unity, Unreal, Frostbite, or CryEngine).
Excellent communication and team skills
Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. producers, artists, designers).
Ability to establish technical requirements from creative or design-led pitches.
Ability to define and understand elements of game design documents and technical design documents.
Experience breaking down the development of a system into a number of manageable tasks.

Experience with any of the following would be advantageous:
Previous experience with shipping 2+ titles.
Previous experience developing titles for desktop or console.
Previous experience with implementing features for multiplayer games.
A portfolio of projects/side projects.

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; thats why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
